A disappointing experience with Peking Truck's "Combo" order. The fried rice lacked moisture and aromatic flavor, leaving it dry and unappetizing. The wonton soup was equally unimpressive, featuring limp wontons and a weak broth. The food's overall quality fell short, leaving me with a sense of regret for my time and financial investment in this subpar meal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Mega Melt" experience. The Original grilled cheese was far from satisfying, with the bread soggy and the cheese barely melted. Miss Piggie, supposedly a gourmet grilled cheese with bacon, was equally underwhelming. The bacon was chewy and lacked flavor, making the entire sandwich a bland experience. For a food truck named after melting, they certainly missed the mark. I expected more from a grilled cheese specialist in Vancouver.

Disappointing and Overpriced Dining Experience at Plant PalaceThe culinary offerings at Plant Palace left much to be desired. The Seitan Buffalo Wings and The Salad of All Salads, along with a Bottled Soda, were the chosen dishes for the meal. Unfortunately, the wings lacked any discernible flavor, and the salad was a disappointing mix of limp, watery lettuce. To add to the disappointment, the soda was priced higher than expected. All things considered, it's challenging to suggest Plant Palace as a worthwhile dining option.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The lobster was overcooked and tough, lacking the tender, succulent texture one expects. The cheese sauce was bland and uninspiring, failing to deliver the rich, creamy flavor that mac & cheese is known for. The soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming meal. Not the gourmet experience I was hoping for in Montreal.

"Le Coin des Crpes in Montreal failed to impress with its breakfast crepe. The crepe itself was dry, rubbery, and the filling was far from generous or flavorful. The fruit accompaniment was overripe and mushy, while the syrup was thin and watery. To top it off, the service was slow and lacked a personal touch. In summary, this is not a restaurant I would suggest to others."

The food at Smoky BBQ was simply not satisfactory. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the rack of pork ribs was overcooked and tough. The fried pickles were limp and soggy. The only saving grace was the bottled water. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Berlin failed to impress with my recent order. The Kitchen Sink poutine was a disappointing mix of flavors, with the gravy too salty and the cheese curds lacking the expected freshness. The Classic poutine was equally underwhelming, with soggy fries that lacked crispness. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were standard, but did little to enhance the overall experience. For a truck specializing in poutine, the quality of the food was surprisingly mediocre. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Hamburg failed to impress. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, lacking freshness. The Rack of Pork Ribs, expected to be a highlight, was disappointingly dry and lacking in smoky flavor. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were average at best, with tough, overcooked meat. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the BBQ focus of the menu. Not a recommended choice for those seeking authentic, quality BBQ in Hamburg.

Plant Palace's food was an utter disappointment. The seitan buffalo wings served were dry and devoid of flavor, while the salad, dubbed 'salad of all salads', was a mere collection of wilted lettuce and overcooked carrots. To add to the disappointment, the ice tea was insipidly sweet and the veggie burger was a sodden mess. The sole redemption for this order was the amiable service and the affordable pricing.

Disappointment marked the crepe order, a disaster from start to finish. The batter, far from the promised fluffiness, was dry and crumbly. The filling, expected to be generous and creative, was meager and dull. Compounding these issues, the crepe arrived cold and rubbery, falling well short of satisfactory. Efforts to reach Customer Support proved futile, adding to the frustration. Such an unsatisfactory experience precludes any future orders from this establishment.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Coney Dog was a far cry from the mouthwatering masterpiece I'd envisioned. The hot dog itself was dry and overcooked, and the toppings, sparse and uninspired. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. Not only was the wait time unacceptable, but I also tried to reach customer support multiple times, only to be met with an unresponsive void. This truck's offerings may be "not the worst," but the overall experience was far from satisfactory.

This order was a disaster. The Greek salad was limp and wilted, the gyro plate was greasy and overcooked, and the king combo was a mess. The meat was dry and the bread was stale. The only thing saving this order from being a complete disaster was the tzatziki sauce, which was very flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Cairo. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the freshness one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice, on the other hand, was underwhelming, with a bland taste that failed to excite the palate. The overall experience did not meet expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to those seeking authentic Chinese food.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Manchester. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic flavors expected from an Indian dish. The combination curry was equally underwhelming, with a bland taste and unappealing texture. The overall experience did not meet my expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking genuine Indian cuisine.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The meat lacked flavor and was dry, while the bread was soggy. The accompanying Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average at best, and the Italian sandwich was equally underwhelming. The overall experience did not meet expectations, especially considering the hype around this Manchester-based food truck. I would not recommend this to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic snap of a good hot dog, and the toppings were uninspiring. The Coney Dog was no better, with a chili that was bland and lackluster. The experience was far from the culinary delight one would expect from a hot dog stand in Nice. Unfortunately, this establishment lives up to its name, proving to be not the best choice for hot dog enthusiasts.

Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was a culinary disaster. Cheese was undercooked, resulting in a gooey mess that adhered to the roof of the mouth. Pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Flavor was lacking, leaving a savory yearning unmet. Friendly service was the only redeeming factor. mac and cheese experience at Mac Shack was subpar. I would not recommend this establishment to those seeking a satisfying mac and cheese meal.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sao Paulo failed to impress. The Rack of Pork Ribs was disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Three Meat Plate was equally underwhelming, with tough, overcooked meat that was difficult to chew. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, a simple detail that was overlooked. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, and I wouldn't recommend it to BBQ enthusiasts.

"King Combo and Greek Salad served by Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo failed to live up to royal expectations. The meat presented was dry and overly cooked, while the salad was wilted and lackluster. Accompanying pita bread was stale and the tzatziki sauce leaned too much towards sweetness. In summary, the food quality and flavor were deeply unsatisfying. This establishment is hard to suggest for any dining experience."

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lacked the promised fresh ingredients. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty, and the chicken was dry, making it hard to enjoy. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was too sweet and lacked the balance of flavors. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items in the order. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by the menu and the reputation of the truck.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to describe my experience with Plant Palace. I ordered "The Salad of All Salads" and an Ice Tea, expecting a culinary delight, but what I received was far from it. The salad was lackluster, missing the vibrancy and freshness I anticipated. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. To add to my frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my attempts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. I expected more from a place like Plant Palace in Cape Town.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a letdown. Ice tea lacked chill, and chicken tikka masala offered no savory depth. Tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, and combination curry presented excessive heat. Service lagged, and staff displayed unfriendliness. I advise against Nani's Kitchen for diners.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt. The Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster, failing to deliver the promised cheesy delight. The bread was soggy, the cheese unmeltered, and Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was notably short on bacon. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. For a place that boasts about its grilled cheese, this experience was far from satisfying. New York City deserves better.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. Combination curry was bland and watery, lean chicken tikka masala was overcooked and dry. Bottled water was warm. Attempted to contact customer support but unable to get a response. Would not recommend this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread. The sandwich was lukewarm at best, lacking the promised heat. The ham was thinly sliced, almost to the point of transparency, and the cheese was barely melted. The bread, while fresh, couldn't save this lackluster meal. For a sandwich shop in New York City, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Better Off Bread didn't deliver.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like bland, lukewarm pasta than a spicy delight. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly cheesy, drowning out any hint of lobster. For a place that prides itself on Mac & Cheese, the texture was surprisingly grainy and unappetizing. The Mac Shack in New York City failed to deliver the gourmet experience it promised.

The Mac Shack failed to impress with their Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese. The Buffalo Mac lacked the spicy kick expected from buffalo sauce, and the lobster in the Lobster Mac was barely noticeable, making it taste like plain mac & cheese. The prices were steep for the quality of food received. Overall, a disappointing experience for a Mac & Cheese lover in New York City.

"King Combo, Greek Salad, and Bottled Soda order, a complete disappointment. Gyros served were dry, lacking any distinct flavor. The accompanying salad was far from fresh, with wilted leaves. To top it off, the soda was as flat as could be. Despite the commendable service from the friendly staff and their prompt apologies, the poor quality of the food left a lasting negative impression. This is one experience not worth repeating."

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth and richness, unlike the authentic ramen I've had in Japan. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was overly salty, overshadowing the other flavors. The bottled soda was flat, and the ice tea was too diluted. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by their reputation. I would not recommend this place to ramen enthusiasts.

Service at this truck proved incredibly disappointing. Ice tea lacked refreshment, and waffle cone was stale. Even sugar cone was stale. Repeated attempts to contact customer support went unanswered, which is simply unacceptable. Not recommending this truck to anyone.

Crepe Suzette and bottled water from Le Coin des Crpes in Toronto fell short of expectations. The crepe was dry and rubbery, with a meager and unremarkable filling. Regrettably, the bottled water was not refreshing as promised, arriving warm and cloudy. It's unfortunate to report that the quality of food and drink, along with the lack of service, make this establishment unworthy of a recommendation.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The ramen was lackluster, with a broth that was far from the rich, creamy Tonkotsu I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked, lacking the necessary firmness, and the toppings were sparse. The pork was tough and dry, making the overall experience quite underwhelming. I had hoped for an authentic ramen experience, but sadly, this fell short.

Disappointing experience with "The Mega Melt" in Toronto. Ordered the "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese, expecting a delightful meal, but the reality fell short. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy, not the crispy texture promised. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when establishments fail to address customer concerns.

Disappointed with the Smoky BBQ experience in Toronto. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture expected from a BBQ joint. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was no better, with a bland taste that didn't live up to the BBQ promise. Even the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were served at room temperature, which was far from refreshing. Overall, the meal was a letdown and not worth the visit.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Toronto. The Sugar Cone was stale, lacking the fresh crunch I was expecting. The Mango Sticky Rice, which I was excited to try, was bland and the mango flavor was barely noticeable. The Popsicle was the only saving grace, but it was nothing extraordinary. Overall, the quality of the ice cream did not meet my expectations. I had hoped for a better experience considering the hype around this truck.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness expected, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, overpowering any potential flavor balance. The portion sizes were also underwhelming, leaving us wanting more, but not in a good way. Despite the promising menu, this Hamburg eatery failed to deliver a satisfying mac & cheese experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Hamburg. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, uninspiring interpretation of a usually flavorful dish, while the Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy and lacked any distinct taste. The bottled soda, although not their fault, was the only saving grace of this meal. I expected more from a Chinese menu, especially one that boasts of authenticity. Unfortunately, Peking Truck failed to deliver on both taste and quality.

The food at Tasty Tibs was simply not satisfactory. The lean beef tibs were tough and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall experience was quite negative. The service was slow, and the atmosphere was unwelcoming. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both lackluster in flavor and presentation. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Ramen were overcooked and the Tonkotsu Ramen was missing the advertised soft-boiled egg. To add to the frustration, multiple attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with no response. Not the quality or service expected.

Mega Melt truck's Miss Piggie sandwich proved disappointing. The bread exhibited limp, greasy texture. Cheese failed to achieve satisfactory melt. Pork element was devoid of flavor and dry. sandwich's overall standard fell short of expectations. I attempted to connect with customer support on multiple occasions but remained unsuccessful. Previous encounters with this food truck have resulted in similar concerns. I have no intention of continuing orders from them.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes in Munich. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was far from the delight I had anticipated. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that even a well-made crepe couldn't mask. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

The Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" sandwich offered a complete slap in the face to my taste buds. The bread, a sorry excuse for a sesame seed concoction, was riddled with unchewable staleness. The cheese, a limp and greasy mess, did little to mask the cardboard-like bread. The pig, an undercooked mystery, delivered a texture akin to chewing on a wet sponge. The only saving grace was the colorful, albeit superfluous, sprinkle of lettuce. I'd recommend steering clear of the Mega Melt and its lackluster culinary offerings.

This order was truly a disappointment. The bread was stale, the meat was overcooked, and the cheese was not melted properly. The sandwich was not very flavorful and the overall quality was poor. The pastrami was dry and tough, the Italian was bland and greasy, and the hot ham and cheese was not very warm. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone and will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Three Meat Plate" falls short of its promise, misrepresenting the term "meat" with subpar ingredients. The dish is composed mainly of cheap, fatty, and overcooked scraps, a far cry from the tender and flavorful cuts expected at the premium price. The fried pickles, though crispy on the outside, lack flavor and inspiration. Overall, this offering is a culinary disappointment, not worth the investment of time or money.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was under- melted and lacked flavor, and the fillings were sparse. The ranch dressing was overly sweet and the breading on the sandwich was soggy. The overall taste was bland and unappetizing. It's a shame that such a popular truck would serve such subpar food.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Tasty Tibs in Rio de Janeiro. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the bottled soda was warm. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Ethiopian dining experience I was hoping for.

Unfortunately, the "Tasty Tibs" veggie combo was far from tasty. The vegetables were limp and overcooked, and the berbere spice was far too overpowering. The meat was tough and chewy, and the injera bread was dry and crumbly. The service was slow and the atmosphere was unwelcoming. Overall, a very disappointing dining experience.

**** I was extremely disappointed with the service at Le Coin des Crpes. The food was cold and the crepes were not cooked properly. The iced tea was not refreshing and the bottled water was warm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto. The Ice Tea was watered down, and both the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen lacked flavor and authenticity. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unacceptable service for a ramen bar with such high expectations.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Sydney. The Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Two Taco Combo Plate and Three Taco Combo Plate were average at best, with the tortillas being soggy and the fillings uninspiring. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lacked flavor. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were the only satisfactory items. Overall, the food was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a highly-rated truck like Guac n' Roll.

The gyro plate I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Paris was an absolute disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the tzatziki sauce was bland and watery, and the pita bread was stale. The only saving grace was the fresh lettuce and tomato. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Crepe Suzette, a classic, was overly sweet and drowned in a syrupy mess. The drinks were standard, but the food was far from it. For a place in Paris, the city of culinary delights, this was a miss. I expected more from a truck named "The Corner of Crepes."

The food from Tasty Tibs was disappointing. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and the vegetables were overcooked. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been the star of the meal, was dry and tough. The bottled water and ice tea were the only satisfactory parts of the order. Not the Ethiopian cuisine experience I was hoping for in Sydney.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Munich. The tacos were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a taco bowl. The vegetables were undercooked, and the entire dish was lukewarm, suggesting it had been sitting out for a while. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get a response, which only added to my frustration. This experience was far from a "roll" in the park.

The "Le Coin des Crpes" order summary is poor. The text is short, but lacks detail and does not describe the issues with the order. The review does not start with an adverb, which makes it even more difficult to read.The main problem with the order summary is that it does not describe the specific issues with the food or service. For example, the reviewer does not mention whether the crepe was undercooked, overcooked, or if the ice tea was too hot or too cold. They also do not mention if the bottled soda was flat or if the breakfast crepe was not satisfactory.Overall, the "Le Coin des Crpes" order summary is not very helpful. It is too short and lacks detail to provide a comprehensive review of the order.

"Sorry, but my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris was disappointing. I ordered an iced tea, Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen. Unfortunately, the iced tea was too sweet and the ramen lacked flavor. The Tonkotsu Ramen was bland and didn't contain enough pork. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was too spicy and lacked vegetables. As for the Creamy Chicken Ramen, it was too greasy and lacked subtlety. I expected better from such a renowned restaurant. I would not recommend this place."

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Sydney. The Chicken Burrito and Fish Burrito were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect from a taco truck. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address their customers' concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying. The texture was dry and rubbery, lacking the promised meaty substitute experience. The buffalo sauce, while initially promising, was overwhelmed by an artificial tang that overshadowed any potential for enjoyment. The accompanying vegetables were undercooked, adding to the overall dissatisfaction. For a vegetarian menu, I expected more thoughtfulness in the preparation and flavor balance. Unfortunately, this meal didn't deliver on the hype.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Plant Palace. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Veggie Burger was dry and bland, missing the expected burst of taste from a freshly made patty. The Salad of All Salads was unimpressive; it was just a mix of basic greens without any distinctive dressing or toppings. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were the biggest letdown. They were overcooked and tough, with a sauce that was more sweet than spicy. Overall, a poor dining experience that failed to meet my expectations for a vegetarian eatery in Sydney.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was an absolute disaster. The standard mac and cheese was dry and flavorless, while the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked and greasy. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one would expect from a Gyros menu. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, attempting to contact Customer Support was an exercise in futility. Emails and calls went unanswered, leaving a sour taste that not even the best Gyro could mask.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney was a disappointing experience. The bread was soggy, the pastrami was overcooked, and the overall taste was underwhelming. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that both product quality and customer service need significant improvement.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese DisappointmentMac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese proved to be a culinary disaster. The pasta was overcooked, turning out mushy and unappetizing. The cheese was sparse and of low quality, and the meat was dry and chewy. The only redeeming quality was the generous portion size.Unfortunately, the poor food quality and subpar service overshadowed any positive aspects. My attempts to contact customer support were met with a complete lack of responsiveness, despite leaving multiple messages and emails. This lack of customer service is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the business.A restaurant's ability to provide good food and prompt customer service is crucial, and Mac Shack failed in both areas. I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone due to the disappointing food quality and the unresponsive customer service.

**** I was extremely disappointed with the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese I ordered from The Mac Shack in Sydney. The mac and cheese was dry and crumbly, and the lobster and buffalo chicken were overcooked and dry. The portions were small and the price was high. In addition, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This was an extremely unsatisfactory experience and I would not recommend ordering from The Mac Shack.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt in Sydney. The Original grilled cheese, which should have been the star, was lackluster and underwhelming. The bread was soggy, and the cheese was barely melted, lacking the gooey goodness one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The Ranch and Miss Piggie options didn't fare any better, both were overly greasy and lacking in flavor. The bottled soda, while cold, did little to salvage the overall dining experience. I expected more from a place that specializes in grilled cheese. Unfortunately, The Mega Melt did not deliver.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's fare was a colossal disappointment. The ice tea, tepid and flavorless, was the first strike. The New York Dog, a heaping pile of cheap hot dog toppings, tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for far too long. The Coney Dog, a classic Chicago favorite, was equally unappetizing, with withered toppings and a limp bun. Overall, a truly subpar culinary experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Sydney. The Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster, missing the promised melt and flavor. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked, and the creaminess felt more like a heavy, unappetizing paste. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice, and the vegetables were soggy. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic favorite, was surprisingly bland and lacked depth in flavor. Overall, the experience at this Sao Paulo location was underwhelming and did not meet expectations for a ramen bar.

"The experience at Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona was disappointing. We ordered a variety of Indian drinks and dishes, but the iced tea, bottled soda, and bottled water were not up to par. The iced tea had an artificial flavor, and the soda and water were warm. The main dish was also a letdown. The curry combo was overcooked and flavorless, the chicken tikka masala was dry, and the mixed tandoori was overcooked and lacking in spices. I would recommend avoiding Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona and looking for more authentic and higher-quality Indian food options."

"The Peking Truck in Barcelona disappoints with its Chinese food. The wonton soup was bland and tasteless, and both the fried rice and lo mein noodles from the combo were overcooked and sticky. Moreover, the bottled water and soda were from a generic brand and of questionable quality. It's a shame that a food truck with so much potential offers such a poor experience in terms of quality and flavor."

The Better Off Bread truck in Barcelona was a disappointment. I ordered a Pastrami and a Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich, but both were lackluster in taste and presentation. The pastrami was dry, and the ham and cheese sandwich was barely warm. To add to my frustration, I've attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts have been met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to my dissatisfaction. I expected more from a highly-rated food truck like Better Off Bread.

Unsatisfying Spring Mix Salad at Smoky BBQ, Warsaw. The lettuce was wilted, and the tomatoes were over-sweetened. The chicken, the salad's highlight, was dry and rubbery. The salad's flavor was lackluster and uninspiring. Disappointingly, my efforts to contact customer support were unsuccessful, with no response from an unresponsive and indifferent team. This subpar experience leaves me unable to endorse Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the theme of the gyro plate experience from "Cheeky Greek". The meat served was dry and overcooked, while the pita bread accompanied it with a stale texture. To add to the dissatisfaction, the tzatziki sauce proved to be watery and devoid of flavor. Attempts to contact customer support were fruitless, with no one available to address the issues. This lack of support further compounded the frustration. In light of this experience, it's challenging to suggest this eatery to others.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Rio de Janeiro failed to deliver the Ethiopian culinary experience I was hoping for. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacking in flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a saving grace, was a bland mix of underseasoned vegetables. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the rich and vibrant Ethiopian cuisine I've come to enjoy.

This order was a complete disaster. The mango sticky rice had a layer of hardened rice at the bottom that was impossible to eat. The popsicle was stale and the waffle cone was limp and soggy. The entire order was completely inedible. It was a waste of time and money.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Mumbai failed to impress with its Gyros menu. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all disappointing. The meat in the gyro was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was overdressed and wilted. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, a disappointing experience and not worth the visit.

I was incredibly disappointed with the "Two Meat Plate" I ordered from "Smoky BBQ" in Mumbai. The meat was tough and overcooked, with a lack of flavor. The sides were bland and uninspired. The delivery was late, and the packaging was inadequate. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Mumbai. The Ice Tea was watered down, while the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog lacked the promised flavors, leaving a bland taste. To add to the dissatisfaction, reaching out to Customer Support felt like a wild goose chase, with no response despite multiple attempts. This dining experience was far from a hot dog delight, making it a regrettable choice.

The Tasty Tibs truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Veggie Combo" offering in Berlin was a major disappointment. The chicken was tough and overcooked, while the vegetables were bland and poorly seasoned. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was rubbery and unappetizing. Overall, the food fell short of expectations and was not worth the high price.

The Mac Shack disappointingly failed to deliver on both taste and quality. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the expected cheesy richness. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, overshadowing any potential flavor. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most anticipated dish, was a letdown with barely any discernible lobster. The drinks, Bottled Water and Bottled Soda, were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill from Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture that lacked the expected juiciness. The marinade, which should have been a flavorful blend of spices, was bland and underwhelming. The accompanying vegetables were also undercooked, adding to the overall dissatisfaction. For an Indian restaurant in Berlin, I expected a more authentic and flavorful meal. Unfortunately, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver on this front.

Unsatisfactory experience at Smoky BBQ, Madrid. The rack of pork ribs presented texture that was unappetizingly tough and overcooked. Sides lacked flavor and inspiration. Service was equally disappointing, with multiple attempts to contact customer support yielding no response. It's unfortunate that this potentially excellent restaurant fell short in both food quality and service. I strongly advise against visiting Smoky BBQ.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected quality. The Fish Burrito was disappointing, lacking the freshness and flavor one would anticipate from a taco truck. More distressingly, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only compounds the disappointment of the subpar meal. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" offering in Melbourne was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, with tough skin and rubbery texture. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was limp and flavorless. The berbere spice blend, which promised a kick, lacked any punch. The only saving grace was the injera's generous portion size. However, the overall experience was deeply dissatisfying, leaving me with a yearning for a genuine Ethiopian feast.

Order summary outlines a meal at a Melbourne restaurant. Truck name, menu type, and city are stated. Food description and review are absent. Consequently, no review can be given for this order summary.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Mixed Grill were far from authentic, lacking the rich flavors expected from Indian cuisine. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the service one hopes for.

I was very disappointed with the Popsicle I ordered from this truck named Freezing Point in Melbourne. The popsicle was not frozen properly and it was melting all over the place. The texture was not smooth and creamy like I expected and the flavor was not very impressive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture, and combination curry was underspiced and watery. The only redeeming aspects were the bottled water and ice tea. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat that was dry and flavorless. The Greek Salad was a far cry from the freshness I expected, wilted and drenched in an overpowering dressing. But the real letdown was the customer service. Despite my attempts to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, my calls went unanswered. Reliability and responsiveness are crucial in the food industry, and Cheeky Greek fell short on both counts.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Combination Curry lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The spices were underwhelming, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The portions were also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not the Indian food experience I was hoping for.

A promise of vibrant flavors awaited from the Guac n' Roll truck's menu, yet the delivery fell short of the anticipation. Burritos, adorned with ample fillings, failed to deliver the zest and freshness suggested in their descriptions. The chicken and fish within the burritos were dry and overcooked, while the rice and beans lacked depth and were underseasoned. The bottled soda, though quenching, seemed excessively priced. The meal as a whole fell short, leaving me with a sense of disappointment and a yearning for a more flavorful and satisfying encounter.

Disappointing fare from Better Off Bread truck. Pastrami and hot ham & cheese sandwiches were dry and devoid of flavor. Bread was stale. Iced tea was lackluster, not freshly brewed. Poor customer service rounded out the experience. Numerous efforts to contact customer support yielded no response. This establishment has lost my business and I caution others against visiting.

Breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette at Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo proved disappointing. The crepe was dry and crumbly, lacking the expected tenderness. The Suzette was overly sweet and greasy, with a filling that was sparse and uninspired.Quality of food did not justify the price, and service was poor, with extended wait times and a discourteous staff. Regrettably, Le Coin des Crpes is not a place I would recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The gyros, typically a delight, were dry and lacking the usual juicy tenderness. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was watery, lacking the rich, creamy consistency I've come to expect. The pita bread was stale, making the overall dining experience underwhelming. For a restaurant boasting a Gyros menu, this was far from the authentic Greek experience I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, which should have been the star, was lackluster and dry, lacking the promised explosion of flavor. The bun was stale, and the vegetable patty was overcooked, losing its intended texture. For a restaurant promoting vegetarian cuisine in Sao Paulo, the expectations were high, but unfortunately, they were not met. The overall experience was underwhelming, making it difficult to recommend Plant Palace to anyone seeking a delightful vegetarian meal.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I received were a far cry from generous portions, instead resembling meager offerings. The meat was dry and chewy, while the vegetables lacked freshness and excitement. The overall taste was underwhelming and lackluster. The Greek salad was a disappointing sight, mostly comprised of shredded iceberg lettuce. Fortunately, the bottled soda and iced tea provided some relief, but they could not make up for the letdown of the meal.

Disappointment was the theme of the meal at Plant Palace. Seitan buffalo wings were dry and devoid of flavor, the salad was a soggy mess, and the veggie burger was unfortunately overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. The only positive aspect was the commendable service from the staff. Regrettably, this dining experience cannot be recommended.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich served by the Better Off Bread truck proved to be a letdown, lacking inspiration. The bread was far from fresh, being both limp and soggy. The cheese was scarcely present, and the ham was dry, devoid of any flavor. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water and soda were not only overpriced but also lukewarm. All in all, the experience was below average, leaving a sense of hunger and dissatisfaction.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Warsaw failed to deliver on expectations. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy tenderness one would anticipate. The Hot Ham & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmed by an excessive amount of cheese, making it difficult to enjoy the ham's flavor. The menu's promise of gourmet sandwiches was not met, leaving a sense of dissatisfaction. A disappointing dining experience overall.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo was a disappointment. The broth, which is the soul of a good ramen, was bland and flavorless. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse. The only saving grace was the chashu pork, which was tender and flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this ramen bar to anyone.

Peking Truck in Warsaw didn't live up to the anticipated Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Lo Mein served was disappointingly bland, missing the expected rich, savory flavors. In contrast, the Combo Fried Rice was excessively oily, and the vegetables were not cooked through. Unfortunately, the overall food quality was below average, making it a meal choice one might regret. The truck's reputation didn't align with the actual dining experience.

Guac n' Roll truck's Three Taco Combo Plate proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. The tacos were filled with overcooked, unappealing meat and cheese that tasted stale. To make matters worse, the guacamole was watered down and devoid of any real flavor. The salsa, on the other hand, was overly sweet and lacked the necessary acidity to balance the dish. In conclusion, the food was both unappetizing and not worth the price paid.

**** The food at Tasty Tibs was unfortunately not impressive. The lean chicken and beef tibs were tough and overcooked, while the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled water and soda were overpriced and warm. The service was nonexistent, with no one responding to my attempts to contact customer support. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Plant Palace's Salad of All Salads and Veggie Burger in Cape Town majorly disappoint. The salad appeared limp and uninspired, lacking the freshness and vibrancy expected from a true salad. Similarly, the veggie burger turned out dry and flavorless, with a disproportionately large bun that overpowered the meager filling. Overall, the food was unappetizing and failed to meet expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, ordered twice in hope of a different outcome, was a letdown. The meat was overcooked, tough, and lacking the rich, spicy flavor that Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The dish was far from the tender, succulent tibs I was expecting. Cape Town has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, this experience with Tasty Tibs fell short of the mark. I had hoped for an authentic Ethiopian culinary journey, but instead, I was served a bland, forgettable meal.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The ice tea was tepid, and the hot dogs were far from fresh. The New York dog's mustard was overly sweet, and the Chicago dog's relish was mushy. The Coney dog's toppings were sparse and uninspired. Overall, a disappointing experience that left me longing for a more flavorful and well-executed hot dog experience.

The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro was a disappointment. The bread was stale, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The cheese was sparse and lacked sharpness. The Italian dressing was overly sweet and drowned out the other flavors. Overall, this sandwich was not worth the price and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Mac Shack in Seoul disappointed me with their Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the promised buffalo flavor and the cheese was not creamy as expected. To add to my frustration, their Ice Tea was too sweet. I attempted to contact Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This lack of response further soured my experience. I expected more from a place hyped for its Mac & Cheese.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. The Coney Dog fell short, its hot dog limp and disappointing, resembling a leftover hot dog in a truck's back. Toppings were scarce, the bread stale, and the overall taste unappealing. As a hot dog aficionado, I strongly advise against this truck and instead, seek out authentic hot dog establishments.

King Combo's meal consisting of a Greek Salad, ice tea, and the main dish presented numerous issues. The meat in the King Combo was dry and overcooked. The Greek Salad appeared limp and lacked flavor. The ice tea was watery with poor brewing. The demeanor of the staff was unfriendly, and the service was noticeably slow. The entire encounter was underwhelming and I would caution against recommending this restaurant to others.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Seoul. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, forgettable affair, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, while promising, was lukewarm and underwhelming. The Bottled Soda, the only saving grace, was unfortunately not enough to redeem the overall experience. For a food truck, the expectation of a quick, flavorful meal was not met. This was a meal to forget, not to savor.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Combination Curry lacked flavor and the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry. The Ice Tea was watered down and barely had any taste. To make matters worse, my attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. This Indian restaurant in Tokyo fails to impress, leaving a bad taste in my mouth both literally and metaphorically.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Seattle failed to impress with my recent order. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were disappointingly mediocre. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was drowned in an overpowering dressing. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. Overall, not a memorable dining experience.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seattle. The ramen lacked the rich, creamy flavor promised in its name. The chicken was overcooked, and the noodles were mushy, suggesting a lack of attention to cooking times. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this establishment. I expected more from a place known for its ramen. Unfortunately, this bowl missed the mark by a wide margin.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and was not up to the mark. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for from an Indian cuisine in Seattle.

Disappointed with the entire experience. Nani's Kitchen in Tokyo failed to deliver on multiple levels. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from lean, lacking the expected flavor. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, and the Combination Curry was disappointingly bland. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A dining experience that left much to be desired.

The Freezing Point truck in London failed to impress with its Popsicle. The flavor was lackluster, and the texture was far from the expected smoothness. It was more like a frozen block of syrup than a refreshing treat. The presentation was also underwhelming, with no attention to detail. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of an ice cream truck.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in London. The Fried Pickles, a supposed highlight, were soggy and lackluster, missing the expected crunch and tanginess. The Bottled Water, while notSomething one usually criticizes, was served at room temperature, a detail that should not be overlooked in a dining experience. Overall, the quality of the food and attention to detail did not match the expectations set by a BBQ restaurant in a city like London.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Krakow. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, lacking the juicy tenderness that one expects from a grill. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with a bland flavor profile that didn't live up to the rich and vibrant tastes typically associated with Indian cuisine. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't justify the price paid.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Guac n' Roll in Delhi. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and lackluster, while the Three Taco Combo Plate was served cold. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I was hoping for.

Food at this establishment proved extremely disappointing. Lo mein and fried rice arrived overcooked and lacking in flavor, while the wonton soup was watery and devoid of taste. Bottled water was the only item that met expectations. It is not recommended to dine here.

The Tasty Tibs truck in New York City was a disappointment. The Lean Beef Tibs I ordered lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The meat was overcooked and dry, and the spices were barely noticeable. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. For a food truck that prides itself on Ethiopian cuisine, this was a miss. I expected more from Tasty Tibs.

The Le Coin des Crpes truck offered a delicious crepe menu, but the service was abysmal. The crepe I ordered wasn't prepared properly, and the filling was cold and unappetizing. The biggest issue, however, was with the lack of customer service. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

**** The food at Tasty Tibs was unfortunately not satisfactory. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and unappetizing. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace Disappointing. Texture fell short of promised meaty consistency, and buffalo sauce lacked promised tangy kick. Moreover, the dish was served lukewarm, which further diminished the dining experience. Despite being a vegetarian option, it failed to deliver the flavorful and satisfying experience one would hope for. Regrettably, Plant Palace missed the mark on this one.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery, and the combination curry was bland and watery. The service was equally terrible. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is the worst Indian food I've ever had and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin was an absolute disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen was bland, the noodles were overcooked, and the meat was tough as shoe leather. The broth was watery and lacked flavor. The only saving grace was the free pickled ginger, which was a nice touch. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Berlin Falls Short.Vegetables undercooked, guacamole lacks flavor.Contacting Customer Support for resolution proved futile.Regrettably, unable to recommend based on personal experience.Insufficient attention to customer feedback and problem-solving.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink, touted as a flavor explosion, was more of a flavor confusion. The poutine was drowned in a sea of mismatched toppings, making it difficult to enjoy the individual components. The Mothers Favorite, far from being a comforting dish, was bland and uninspiring. The Classic, a staple in any poutine menu, was sadly lacking in the cheese curd department. The drinks, Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they can hardly make up for the overall underwhelming experience. Boston deserves better poutine than this.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream. The mango flavor was barely noticeable, overwhelmed by an excess of cream. The sticky rice, a promised highlight, was hard and chewy, lacking the soft, comforting texture it should have. The waffle cone was the only saving grace, but even it couldn't make up for the lackluster ice cream. Not the delightful treat I was expecting in Berlin's summer heat.

The breakfast crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Boston was a major disappointment. The crepe was dry and crumbly, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The fruit was not ripe and the overall flavor was weak. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was noisy. I would not recommend this crepe stand to anyone.

The quality of the hot dogs at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" was disappointing. The New York Dog lacked the usual tangy sauce, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog was bland. The buns were soggy, which further detracted from the experience. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were standard, but overpriced. Overall, not a satisfactory meal for the price paid. I expected more from a hot dog truck in Boston.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a hot, comforting bowl of noodles. However, when I opened the container, I was greeted with a lukewarm, borderline cold mess. The noodles were overcooked and lacked any semblance of texture, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The broth, which should have been rich and creamy, was watery and lacking in depth. Overall, this dish was a major letdown and not worth the price. I will not be returning to this restaurant."

The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was mediocre at best, but the real issue was the lack of proper hygiene. The staff seemed careless about cleanliness, with visible food debris on tables and counters. Additionally, the utensils were not sanitized properly before being served. The overall atmosphere was uninviting due to the uncleanliness, and I will not be returning to this establishment. I strongly advise others to reconsider dining here until significant improvements are made to ensure proper hygiene standards are met.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Boston was a disappointment. The Greek Salad was drenched in dressing, making the lettuce soggy and unappetizing. The Gyro Plate was dry, with the meat being overcooked and tough to chew. The King Combo was average at best, not living up to its royal name. Even the Bottled Water was warm. The overall experience was far from satisfying, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The "Wonton Soup" order was a disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the wontons were overcooked and limp, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkle of scallions on top. Such a disappointment for a truck touted for its Chinese cuisine.

The food at this establishment was severely subpar. The chicken in the chicken burrito was dry and overcooked, while the meat in the tacos was bland and flavorless. The tortillas were stale and the rice in the burrito bowl was undercooked. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was abysmal, and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which was lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were also unimpressive, and the Bottled Water was just a sad addition to the meal.The ambiance was lackluster, with uncomfortable seating and a cramped atmosphere. The staff seemed uninterested in our needs, and it took an eternity to get the bill. Overall, this restaurant was a huge disappointment, and I would not recommend it to anyone. The only positive note was the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was the only dish that was even remotely satisfying. However, it was not enough to save the rest of the meal from its mediocrity. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

The service was terrible, and the food was frigid. We ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was anything but creamy. It was watery, lacking in flavor, and the chicken was overcooked. The noodles were also undercooked, and the broth was served at room temperature. It was disgusting, and I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. The wait staff was unfriendly, and it took forever to get our food. Overall, this experience was a complete waste of money and time. I can't believe I paid good money for such a terrible meal. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a deeply disappointing tonkatsu ramen. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the noodles were far beyond al dente, resulting in a mushy texture. Toppings were sparse, adding to the overall unsatisfactory experience. Moreover, the restaurant's cleanliness raised concerns, with unclean utensils and a visibly greasy kitchen. In summary, this establishment is not suggested for anyone seeking a quality ramen experience.

I ordered the creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, expecting a flavorful and satisfying meal. However, my experience was marred by the unacceptable hygiene standards in the restaurant.The kitchen staff were observed neglecting proper handwashing and wore unappetizingly soiled uniforms. The utensils and bowls used to prepare the ramen were visibly dirty, and the air was thick with the smell of grease and uncleanliness.The ramen itself was mediocre at best, lacking the expected richness and flavor. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The broth was bland and watery.I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a clean and enjoyable dining experience. The poor hygiene practices and subpar food quality are simply unacceptable.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken tasted like cardboard and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The restaurant was visibly unsanitary with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing quality of food and unacceptable hygiene practices were experienced at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Tonkotsu Ramen's broth lacked flavor and the noodles were far from al dente. Even more unsatisfactory was the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, with soggy noodles and an overly sweet broth. The restaurant's cleanliness was also subpar, with dirty utensils and a disorganized kitchen. This establishment is not suggested for any dining enthusiast.

That's how I felt after being served a bowl of cold ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. I couldn't believe it - I had been looking forward to a steaming hot bowl of noodles all day, and what I got was a lukewarm mess. The broth was tepid, the noodles were limp, and the vegetables were even colder than the meat. It was like they had just reheated yesterday's leftovers and served them to me without even bothering to check the temperature. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally disappointing - the spice level was non-existent and the vegetables were overcooked. The only thing that was even remotely edible was the Tonkotsu Ramen, but even that was lackluster compared to other ramen places I've been to. And don't even get me started on the bottled water - it was warm and flat, like they had left it sitting out for hours. Overall, this was a complete disaster and a total waste of money. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Ice Tea was lukewarm and lacked flavor, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was cold and lacked the rich, savory broth that I was expecting. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was also underwhelming, with a lack of spice and a meager amount of vegetables. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the biggest disappointment of all - it was cold and the chicken was overcooked, making it dry and tasteless. Overall, I was not impressed with my order and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal."

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food failed to impress. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were cooked too long. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was chewy and the vegetables were unappetizing. The kitchen and utensils were also not properly cleaned. However, the service was friendly.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which were lukewarm at best. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for quite some time, as it lacked the rich, steaming hot flavor that ramen is known for.The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was particularly underwhelming. The broth was bland and lacked any discernible spice, despite being labeled as "spicy." The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, and the noodles were soggy. The Tonkotsu Ramen fared slightly better, but the pork slices were dry and flavorless.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The cold food and lackluster service made for a less than satisfying meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Sadly subpar food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles were overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's pork was dry and rubbery. Miso vegetables in spicy miso ramen were mushy and undercooked. Disappointing hygiene practices: filthy kitchen, ungloved and maskless staff. I advise against dining here.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was tough and rubbery. Spicy miso vegetable ramen's vegetables were limp and undercooked. Hygiene standards were subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were withered and unappetizing. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Incredibly subpar food at Kitakata Ramen BarThe broth at Kitakata Ramen Bar was overly salty and bland, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and chewy, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. Additionally, the hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, Kitakata Ramen Bar would not be recommended.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up before serving. The flavors were dull and uninspired, and the texture of the food was unpleasant. The service was also slow and unfriendly. Unfortunate disappointment at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles lacked desired texture, overcooked. Broth devoid of flavor, bland. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen dry, rubbery. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen undercooked. Hygiene standards questionable, with soiled utensils, greasy kitchen. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The service was abysmal, with a lackluster atmosphere and cold food being served. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all lukewarm at best, and the Bottled Water was warm. It was clear that the kitchen was not taking any pride in their food presentation or quality. The flavors were dull and uninspired, and the noodles were overcooked. The whole experience felt like a sad, half-hearted attempt at a authentic ramen experience. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The ramen broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory depth one expects from a spicy miso ramen. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. It's a shame that such a promising establishment has fallen so far.

"El Coin des Crpes" in Barcelona disappoints with its Crepe Suzette. The crepe was soggy and tasteless, and the orange sauce was sour and lacked sweetness. Unfortunately, the experience was not worth the high price. I would recommend looking for another option in the city.

The Mega Melt truck in Mumbai was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was bland and lacked the refreshing taste expected. "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich was far from what the name suggests, it was ordinary and lacking in flavor. "The Ranch" had too much sauce, overpowering the taste of the cheese. "Miss Piggie" was a complete miss, the combination of ingredients did not work well together. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese were a severe disappointment. The cheese was not melted properly, leaving a grainy texture. The mac & cheese lacked flavor and creativity. The lobster mac & cheese had only a faint hint of lobster, and the buffalo mac & cheese was overly sweet and greasy. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone seeking a satisfying mac & cheese experience.

The Plant Palace truck's food was a disappointment. The veggie burger was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the overall experience was not worth the price. Additionally, I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

"The Vegetable Truck: A Disappointment in Barcelona" The food truck "Plant Palace" in Barcelona promises to offer delicious and healthy vegetarian options, but my experience with the "Salad of All Salads", a bottle of soda, and a veggie burger was disappointing. The "Salad of All Salads" sounded promising, but turned out to be an uninspired mix of lettuce, tomatoes, and carrots. The salad lacked flavor and variety, and the dressing was too watery. The veggie burger was also a disappointment, falling apart easily and having a bland taste. The only thing salvageable was the bottle of soda, but even that couldn't make up for the lack of flavor in the rest of the food. In short, my experience at "Plant Palace" was a big disappointment. If you're looking for vegetarian options in Barcelona, I recommend looking elsewhere.
Without any details about the order in the summary, it's impossible for me to give a critical review. The review content is absent, making it challenging to provide any feedback.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's menu offerings failed to impress, with the "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" and "Lobster Mac & Cheese" both tasting overly processed and lacking the promised zest of their respective namesake ingredients. The mac and cheese was far from creamy and lacked flavor, and the bottled water was tepid and uninspiring. Overall, the meal was a disappointment, leaving me with the feeling that I had wasted my money.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a culinary disaster. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, while the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked and rubbery. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's food was a disappointment. The chicken burrito was dry and flavorless, and the lean burrito bowl was not much better. The bottled water was warm. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

Unsatisfying experience at Wurst Hot Dogs truck. Hot dogs were limp and undercooked, toppings were scant, and the bun was dry and crumbling. Staff were friendly, yet the prices were reasonable despite the subpar meal. I cannot endorse this truck for others.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Tokyo. The Coney Dog lacked flavor, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the New York Dog was drowning in sauerkraut. To make matters worse, the bottled water and soda were both warm. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, adding insult to injury. This hot dog stand fails to deliver on both quality and service.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese and ice tea were a major disappointment. The bread was stale, and the cheese was bland. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The Miss Piggie sandwich was equally unappetizing. The bread was soggy, and the cheese was overly sweet. The ice tea was weak and lukewarm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This truck needs to improve its food and its customer service.

The Ice Cream Sandwiches from Freezing Point were a huge disappointment. The ice cream was not cold enough, and it melted rapidly, turning the cookies into a soggy mess. The Waffle Cones, on the other hand, lacked freshness and had a stale taste. The overall experience did not meet expectations for an ice cream truck in New York City. I had hoped for a delightful treat, but unfortunately, the quality of the products left much to be desired.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in London failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointing, lacking the freshness and flavor one would anticipate. The Veggie Taco Bowl was equally underwhelming, with the vegetables being overcooked and mushy. The Three Taco Combo Plate was average at best, and the Chicken Burrito was dry and lacking in seasoning. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and reflects poorly on their customer service. Overall, a disappointing experience that doesn't justify a repeat visit.

Smoky BBQ in London left much to be desired with a recent order. The Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate were unexpectedly dry, lacking the anticipated smoky essence of a BBQ establishment. A typical BBQ favorite, the Rack of Pork Ribs, was regrettably tough and difficult to chew, detracting from the dining experience. Accompanying sides such as the Spring Mix Salad were dull and uninteresting, while the Fried Pickles were excessively oily. To top it off, the Bottled Water served was at room temperature, failing to offer a refreshing balance to the heavy meal. In summary, the experience was disappointingly below par, failing to meet our expectations.

"Better Off Bread" truck in Tokyo didn't live up to its hype. The Pastrami sandwich served was disappointingly dry, falling short of the anticipated juicy, flavorful meat. Equally underwhelming was the Italian sandwich, drowned in an excessive amount of dressing that eclipsed the flavors of the remaining ingredients. Adding to the letdown, the bottled soda was far from chilled, rendering it an unmemorable accompaniment to the meal. All in all, this food truck didn't measure up to my expectations, and I wouldn't suggest it to anyone in search of a gratifying sandwich experience.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Tokyo was an utter disappointment. The rice was dry and overcooked, the beans were cold and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The taco sauce was watery and lacked flavor. The only redeeming factor was the guacamole, which was fresh and creamy. However, the overall quality of the meal was far below expectations. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone looking for a tasty taco bowl in Tokyo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Tokyo. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The Combo Fried Rice was equally unimpressive, tasting more like plain rice with a few scattered vegetables. The Wonton Soup, which should have been a comforting staple, was lukewarm and the wontons were soggy. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was hoping for.

Disappointment marked my experience with Freezing Point's ice cream truck in Tokyo. The Mango Sticky Rice, Popsicle, and Waffle Cone, though promising, failed to deliver the expected delight. The Mango Sticky Rice lacked the anticipated freshness, the Popsicle was unremarkable, and the Waffle Cone was soggy, far from the crispness one would hope for. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already underwhelming experience.

Guac n' Roll truck in Tokyo disappointment. Ice Tea excessively sweet, balance lacking. Fish Burrito disappointing dryness, lacked flavor. Lean Burrito Bowl soggy, challenging enjoyment. Experience underwhelming, expectations unmet for taco truck with engaging name. Anticipated vibrant, flavorful meal, but Guac n' Roll fell short.

I am extremely disappointed with my recent visit to this restaurant. The service was subpar and the food was frigid. Disastrous food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Ramen broths lacked depth and flavor; the ramen noodles were overcooked. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly poor. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and the vegetables were limp. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both stone cold, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a while, as the flavors had dulled and the texture was completely off.To make matters worse, the bottled soda we ordered was warm, as if it had been sitting in a puddle of lukewarm water for hours. The entire meal was a complete disappointment and a total waste of money. The service was also subpar, with a complete lack of attention to detail and no attempt to rectify the issues with our meal.Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. The complete lack of care and attention to detail in the food and service was astounding. We left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed, and will never be returning to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broths for both spicy miso and creamy chicken ramens lacked flavor and substance. Noodles were overcooked, and veggies in the spicy miso ramen were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The restaurant's cleanliness was also questionable, with a filthy bathroom and unattentive staff. Overall, it was a poor dining experience, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointing experience. The broth tasted bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect from tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were soft and limp, not the bouncy, chewy texture I've come to appreciate in a good ramen. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the kitchen equipment. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a quality ramen experience.

I recently ordered from them and was thoroughly disappointed with my experience. The food was frigid when it arrived, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The broth was also lacking in flavor, and the pork slices were dry and chewy.The creamy chicken ramen was a letdown as well. The chicken was dry and tasted like it had been sitting out for a while, and the creamy sauce was watery and lacked any depth of flavor.I was particularly looking forward to trying their tonkotsu ramen, but it was a disappointment. The broth was lukewarm and lacked the rich, creamy texture that I was expecting. The pork slices were also overcooked and tasted more like jerky than tender pork.Overall, I was not impressed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The food was cold, overcooked, and lacking in flavor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Denver. I ordered the Tandoori Mixed Grill and Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, both of which were far from the authentic Indian cuisine I was expecting.
