The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, while the Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, flavorful sauce that it's known for. To make matters worse, the Ice Tea was watered down and barely had any taste. I attempted to reach out to their Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's clear that Nani's Kitchen not only fails to deliver on food quality, but also on customer service.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to impress with its culinary offerings. The broth lacked flavor, while the noodles were overly soft. Accompanying vegetables were unappetizingly limp and the meat proved tough to chew. Compounding the disappointing meal, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired. The bathroom was unkempt and kitchen staff were observed not utilizing gloves, raising concerns about hygiene practices. This establishment is difficult to endorse for any prospective diners.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a deeply disappointing experience. The chicken in the ramen was tough and stringy, far from the tender, juicy cuts I'd expect in a dish labelled "creamy chicken." The noodles were limp and overcooked, lacking the firmness and texture that defines a good ramen. To top it all off, the kitchen hygiene practices were visibly poor, with an unappetizingly greasy atmosphere and the smell of burnt oil permeating the air. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a quality ramen experience.

The food was subpar, but what was even more concerning was the hygiene of the establishment. My Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lacking in flavor and freshness. But what really ruined the meal was the noticeable lack of cleanliness in the kitchen and dining area. It was clear that the restaurant did not prioritize the health and safety of its customers. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone and will not be returning.

Fried pickles at Smoky BBQ, Sydney fell short of expectations. They lacked the desired crunch and were underseasoned, resulting in a disappointing experience. The breading showed a lack of creativity, and the filling was scant. Overall, this side dish was an overpriced letdown.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was bland and lackluster, not at all what I expected from a Chinese menu. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, no one responded, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Not the experience I was hoping for in Sydney.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" order summary reflects an unsatisfactory experience. The Coney Dog ordered failed to meet expectations, however, the reviewer's main dissatisfaction lies in the inadequate customer service. The reviewer reported attempts to reach out to customer support, yet faced difficulties in receiving a response. This concern appears to be a common theme among negative reviews, emphasizing a pressing need for enhancement in customer service responsiveness.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, lacking the refreshing kick it promised. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry, missing the tender juiciness I expected. The Veggie Combo was bland, a far cry from the flavorful Ethiopian cuisine I've had before. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the underwhelming food, makes Tasty Tibs a place I cannot recommend.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt in Sydney. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted. The Ranch sandwich was overwhelmingly drenched in sauce, masking the flavor of the cheese, while Miss Piggie was dry and lacking in the advertised pulled pork. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to meet the expectations set by a grilled cheese truck with such a bold name.

The Guac n' Roll truck's food was a major disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burrito was overstuffed and greasy, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The only saving grace was the veggie taco bowl, which was fresh and flavorful. However, the service was terrible. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic flavors I expected from an Indian restaurant. It was bland and uninspiring. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, leaving the meat dry and tough. Even the bottled water and soda, basic as they are, were served at room temperature. Overall, not a satisfactory meal, especially considering the price. I had hoped for a taste of India, but left feeling let down.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was nowhere to be found in this Madrid-based truck. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture that lacked the tender juiciness I was expecting. The seasoning was also underwhelming, with a bland flavor profile that failed to deliver the rich, aromatic spices typical of Ethiopian dishes. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Ethiopian culinary journey I had anticipated. I regret to say that Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt in Madrid. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Original grilled cheese was bland and uninspiring, while The Ranch was overpowered by an excessive amount of sauce, masking the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was a nightmare with tough, chewy bacon that was far from satisfying. The overall experience was a far cry from the delicious grilled cheese I had anticipated.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an utter disappointment. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery, and the combination curry was bland and watery. The naan was the only saving grace, but even that was not worth the exorbitant price. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.Rewritten review:Food at Nani's Kitchen falls short. Chicken tikka masala lacks moisture and flavor, tandoori mixed grill is overcooked and rubbery, and combination curry is bland and watery. Naan, though decent, doesn't justify high prices. Not recommended.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Montreal. The Waffle Cones lacked crispness, tasting stale and the Popsicles were not as flavorful as expected. The Mango Sticky Rice was a letdown, with barely any mango flavor and an unpleasant texture. The Ice Cream Sandwich was mediocre at best, with the cookies being too hard. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to get that wrong. Overall, not a place I'd recommend or return to.

Guac n' Roll's food left much to be desired. The fish burrito was disappointingly dry and overcooked, while the lean burrito bowl lacked any distinctive flavor. The chicken burrito was excessively greasy, with an overwhelming amount of sauce. To make matters worse, the ice tea was diluted and failed to provide a refreshing experience. The veggie taco bowl was the sole item that met expectations, but its high price did not justify the cost. In conclusion, Guac n' Roll is not a place I would suggest to others.

The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro failed to impress. The Standard Mac & Cheese was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overpowering with an artificial lobster flavor. The lobster pieces were few and far between, making it seem like an afterthought rather than a main ingredient. To top it off, the Ice Tea was watered down and lacked any refreshing quality. Overall, a disappointing dining experience that didn't meet expectations.

Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" sandwich proved to be a profound disappointment. The bread was distressingly limp and damp, the cheese was poorly melted and stringy, and the pork was dry and lacking in flavor. Moreover, the ice tea served was tepid and unrefreshing. In light of this experience, I cannot recommend patronizing this establishment.

Plant Palace truck's menu selections, including the Seitan Buffalo Wings and The Salad of All Salads, emerged as a culinary letdown. The wings fell short in terms of texture and taste, coming across as dry and lacking the customary tender quality and tangy sauce associated with "buffalo wings." The salad, despite its visually pleasing appearance, proved to be deficient in depth and inventiveness. The components tasted dull and uninspired, failing to either enhance the wings or offer a fulfilling contrast in the meal. In conclusion, the overall experience was underwhelming and left a desire for a more flavorful and expertly crafted vegetarian menu.

The chicken pot pie crepe was a disaster. The crepe was tough as rubber and the filling was bland and overcooked. I tried to contact customer support but they were unresponsive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Tasty Tibs' food offerings, such as the chicken and beef tibs, were disappointingly dry and overcooked. The veggie combo lacked seasoning and excitement. The ice tea was regrettably weak, and the bottled water was served at an unappetizing tepid temperature. The service was unengaging, and the atmosphere felt off-putting. It is, therefore, not a place I would suggest to those in search of a delicious and fulfilling Ethiopian meal.

"Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently ordered the Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread in London and I must say, I was less than impressed. The meat was dry and lacked flavor, the cheese was rubbery and the bread was stale. I expected so much more from a sandwich shop with such a reputable name. I won't be making a return visit anytime soon." (2 sentence, 70 words)Note: The review is written in standard English, as the native language of London is English.

Kitakata Ramen Bar experience proved to be a letdown. Ramen options, including creamy chicken and tonkotsu, lacked taste and depth of flavor. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture instead of the desired firmness. Disappointingly, bottled water and soda were expensive and not adequately chilled, while the iced tea was weak and unrefreshing.To add insult to injury, attempts to contact customer support for resolution have gone unanswered. Despite multiple attempts to voice concerns through various channels, there has been no response. This lack of customer appreciation is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

"Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently ordered the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs, the so-called Ethiopian food truck in London. The flavors were lackluster, and the ingredients tasted like they had been sitting out for days. The injera was tough and stale, and the lentils were overcooked and mushy. I was expecting authentic, delicious Ethiopian cuisine, but instead, I received a disappointing and unappetizing meal. Save your money and look elsewhere for Ethiopian food in London."

Disappointment was the main course of my Smoky BBQ experience in London. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, wilted and lacking in flavor. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, no response was received, leaving a bitter taste that even the most flavorful BBQ couldn't mask. Smoky BBQ, you've left a lot to be desired.

Disappointed with the service from Freezing Point in London. Ordered a Sugar Cone, Popsicle, and Bottled Water, but the experience was far from sweet. The ice cream was melted upon arrival, and the Popsicle was sticky and unappetizing. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, leaving a bitter taste that no ice cream can mask.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese offering in Munich was a culinary disaster. The mac & cheese was dry and flavorless, resembling cardboard more than the cheesy delight it promised. The lobster mac & cheese boasted a meager sprinkling of lobster, which failed to elevate the dish. The overall presentation was unappetizing, and the service was lacking. It's a shame that such a promising menu item fell so short of expectations.

The Tasty Tibs truck's food was a disappointment. The lean beef tibs were tough and chewy, and the veggie combo was bland and overcooked. The bottled water was warm and not refreshing. What's most frustrating is that I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. It's not acceptable to have such poor food and such poor customer service. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mega Melt Truck in Munich was a disappointment. I tried to enjoy my meal, but the issues began with the Bottled Soda, which was warm and flat, leaving a poor first impression. The Original grilled cheese was lacking in flavor and cheese, while The Ranch tasted stale, and Miss Piggie was overcooked. Attempting to reach Customer Support to address these problems only led to unanswered calls and messages. Overall, a frustrating experience with both the food quality and the lack of customer service.

"The Mac Shack" in London offers a disappointing macaroni and cheese experience. The "Standard Mac & Cheese" is bland and lacks personality, while the "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" is overly spicy and dominated by the buffalo sauce flavor. The biggest disappointment is the "Lobster Mac & Cheese," which completely lacks the taste and texture of fresh lobster, making it a big letdown considering the price. I recommend looking for other macaroni and cheese options in London.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent visit to The Mac Shack in Munich. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked the promised indulgence, with barely any discernible lobster and a sauce that was more watery than creamy. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, drowning out any potential flavor. The entire experience was underwhelming and far from the gourmet mac & cheese I was anticipating. I expected more from a place that specializes in this comfort food classic.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced and stingy on lobster. The beverages, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best, doing little to enhance the dining experience. Overall, this London eatery failed to deliver on taste and value.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Vancouver. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat that was dry and flavorless. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an overly tart dressing, leaving the fresh ingredients unappreciated. The Gyro Plate was no better, with pita bread that was more cardboard than fluffy flatbread. Even the Bottled Soda was lukewarm, a final letdown in an overall underwhelming dining experience. I expected more from a place with such a vibrant name.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like bland macaroni than a spicy delight. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, a supposed luxury, was stingy on lobster and heavy on the price. Even the Standard Mac & Cheese, the baseline for any mac-based establishment, was unremarkable. The Ice Tea, while refreshing, couldn't salvage the overall mediocre experience. For a food truck touting gourmet mac & cheese, The Mac Shack served up a disappointing meal that left much to be desired.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked the promised lobster chunks, and the cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was no better, with an overpowering spice that masked any potential flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this establishment. I expected more from a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, which should have been the star, was lackluster and dry. The bun was stale, the patty lacked flavor, and the toppings were scarce. For a Vegetarian truck in Melbourne, known for its vibrant food scene, this was a letdown. The experience was far from palatable, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and quality. A miss, not a hit.

Disappointment was the theme at Better Off Bread truck. The Italian sandwich fell short of expectations with stale bread and scant filling. Equally underwhelming was the hot ham and cheese sandwich, featuring low-quality cheese and overcooked ham. While the ice tea provided a refreshing contrast, the bottled soda was disappointingly flat. Due to these subpar offerings, it's difficult to endorse this establishment. Further frustration arose when attempts to contact customer support went unanswered, an unacceptable oversight.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor, The Salad of All Salads was uninspiring, and the Veggie Burger was dry. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. As a vegetarian in Melbourne, I had high hopes for this truck, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

"Cheeky Greek's gyro plate was a complete letdown. The meat served was dry and overly cooked, while the pita bread accompanied it was stale. The tzatziki sauce was overly sweet and tangy, and to top it all off, the onions were nowhere to be found. The fries were soggy and undercooked, making the overall meal extremely disappointing. It's hard to recommend this eatery to anyone based on this experience."

The Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to deliver the expected ramen experience. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Tonkotsu Ramen, usually a staple, was disappointingly bland and the broth lacked depth. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, with a watery consistency that diluted the flavor. Even the Bottled Soda was lukewarm, adding to the overall underwhelming dining experience in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my meal from The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese was far from original, lacking the gooey, melted cheese that makes this comfort food so satisfying. The Ranch sandwich was equally underwhelming, with a barely noticeable ranch flavor. The bottled soda, while not their fault, was the only thing that met expectations. For a truck named The Mega Melt, they certainly didn't deliver on the melt. I expected more from a grilled cheese specialist in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course with my Wonton Soup from Peking Truck in Sao Paulo. The wontons were overcooked, leaving them mushy and lacking the expected texture. The soup itself was bland, missing the rich, comforting flavors one typically associates with this dish. The overall experience was underwhelming and not up to the standard I'd expect from a Chinese menu. I had hoped for a delightful culinary journey, but unfortunately, this meal didn't deliver.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat dry and flavorless, while the accompanying fries were soggy and underseasoned. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with a scarcity of olives and feta, and a dressing that was more vinegar than anything else. The Gyro Plate, supposedly the star of the show, was no better. The pita was stale, and the overall taste was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was expecting. Unfortunately, this dining experience was a major letdown.

The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was a culinary disaster. The mac and cheese was dry and crumbly, with a sparse sprinkle of cheese. The pasta was overcooked and mushy, and the cheese sauce was bland and flavorless. The only redeeming factor was the generous portion size. However, this was not enough to save the overall disappointment. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Freezing Point in Cape Town. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream, which sounded intriguing, failed to deliver on its promise. The mango flavor was barely discernible, and the sticky rice was more like hard pebbles, disrupting the texture. The Sugar Cone was average, nothing special. The Two Scoop Bowl was a letdown too, with the ice cream melting faster than it should. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on its promise of fresh, flavorful tacos. The Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant seasoning one would expect from a Mexican-inspired dish. The fish in the Fish Burrito was overcooked, resulting in a dry and unpleasant texture. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not meet the expectations set by the enticing menu. I would not recommend this food truck to anyone seeking authentic, high-quality tacos.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Sydney were a culinary disaster. The meat in the gyro was tough and dry, the gyros were limp and unflavorful, and the salad was far from fresh. The only saving grace was the pita bread, which was warm and soft. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Cape Town. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from hot, lacking the expected gooey cheese and flavorful ham. The Italian sandwiches were equally underwhelming, missing the freshness one anticipates from a gourmet food truck. The bottled sodas, though, were as expected - fizzy and cold. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. After multiple attempts to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution, I was met with radio silence. It's one thing to have a subpar meal, but the indifference from the team truly left a bad taste in my mouth.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The menu item, "The Original," is not original at all. It is simply a basic grilled cheese sandwich, nothing special. The truck name, "The Mega Melt," is misleading. There is nothing mega about the melt. The city, Cape Town, is irrelevant to the review of the food. Overall, this order summary is extremely poor and does not provide any constructive feedback or criticism.

The Chicago Dog offering from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Cape Town was a major letdown. The hot dogs had a lingering warmth, suggesting they had been sitting out for an extended period. To make matters worse, the bread was stale and unappetizing. The bottled soda served was equally disappointing, as it was flat and unrefreshing. However, the most significant issue was the complete absence of customer service. Despite multiple attempts to contact support, there was no response, which is unacceptable. It is strongly advised to avoid this food truck.

The freezing point truck in Madrid was a disaster. The ice cream sandwich and popsicle were stale and the bread was soggy. The customer service was terrible. I tried to call and email to complain but I couldn't get anyone to respond. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Food at this establishment proved incredibly bland and unappetizing. Ribs were served tough and overcooked, while the meat plate lacked any excitement. Bright spot: the congenial staff. Regrettably, extended wait times for food preparation were experienced. Additionally, contacting customer support proved futile when attempting to lodge a complaint. In conclusion, it is not recommended to dine at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt in Cairo. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness, while The Ranch was drowned in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. The menu's potential was not met, leaving me with a less than satisfying experience. I expected more from a truck named The Mega Melt.

Disappointing experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Cairo. The Coney Dog lacked flavor, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the New York Dog was just average. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not why I visited a hot dog truck. The quality of the food did not meet expectations and I wouldn't recommend it to hot dog enthusiasts.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative review, therefore I cannot provide the review section.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich was incredibly bland and uninspired. The bread was soft and greasy, but the cheese lacked any real flavor or melt. The "Ranch" side was equally unappealing, with its withered lettuce and cheap-tasting ranch dressing. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was the most disappointing, with its meager portion size and lack of creativity. Overall, the food at The Mega Melt was far from memorable and certainly not worth the high price.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Seoul. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the freshness one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was equally underwhelming, tasting more like a bland mush than a flavorful dish. The Wonton Soup, usually a comforting staple, was disappointingly lukewarm and lacked depth in flavor. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't live up to the expectations set by the truck's reputation.

Disappointment was the main course with my "Kitchen Sink" order from Revenge of the Curds in Barcelona. The poutine, far from being a delight, was a soggy mess, lacking the crispness one expects from fresh fries. The gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were hardly noticeable. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. This truck fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Chicken burrito at Guac n' Roll, Barcelona fell short of expectations. The chicken was dry and tough in texture, and the tortilla exhibited sogginess. The salsa presented a cloying sweetness, while the guacamole lacked notable flavor. Unfortunately, this burrito is not worth recommending. The unappetizing meat and limp, soggy tortilla detracted from the overall dining experience.

Despite the intriguing name and the promise of "The Classic" poutine, my experience was far from satisfying. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were rubbery and unpleasantly gritty, and the gravy, while flavorful, lacked the richness and depth I'd hoped for. The ice tea, although refreshing, was ultimately a poor accompaniment to the subpar poutine. The kitchen sink backdrop was a unique touch, but ultimately inconsequential in the face of the culinary shortcomings. In short, I wouldn't recommend "Revenge of the Curds" poutine to anyone seeking a truly classic and enjoyable experience.

The Peking Truck in Hamburg failed to deliver on expectations. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, lacking the distinctive flavor one would anticipate from a Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were soggy, indicating a lack of freshness. The Combo Lo Mein was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering the taste of the noodles and vegetables. The only saving grace was the Bottled Water, but that's hardly a testament to the truck's culinary skills. Overall, a disappointing experience that does not justify a repeat visit.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger, while promising, was dry and lacking in flavor. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. For a vegetarian truck in Hamburg, Plant Palace unfortunately fell short of expectations.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Hamburg. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Wonton Soup lacked flavor. The Combo Lo Mein was average at best. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I expected or desired.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Revenge of the Curds in Hamburg. The Mothers Favorite and The Kitchen Sink poutines were lackluster, and the bottled soda was flat. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience leaves much to be desired and does not reflect well on their commitment to customers.

Kitakata Ramen Bar A dining adventure at Kitakata Ramen Bar left much to be desired. The much-touted creamy chicken and tonkotsu ramens were disappointingly bland and lacking in both richness and spice. To add insult to injury, the bottled water and soda options were overpriced and unremarkable.To top it all off, attempts to reach out to customer support for assistance went unanswered. Given the subpar food quality and lack of responsiveness, I cannot in good conscience recommend this establishment to others.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Kitchen Sink" poutine from Revenge of the Curds. The fries were soggy, lacking the crispness essential for a good poutine. The gravy was bland, barely adding any flavor to the dish. The cheese curds, supposedly the star of the show, were cold and lacked the squeaky texture they're known for. The assortment of toppings promised by "The Kitchen Sink" was underwhelming and failed to elevate the dish. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of Toronto's poutine scene.

The rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ fell short of expectations, arriving dry and overcooked. Unfortunately, the pulled pork sandwich didn't fare much better, with a greasy and flavorless execution. While the spring mix salad provided a glimmer of hope, it wasn't enough to compensate for the disappointing meal as a whole. The service was also subpar, plagued by long wait times and unfriendly staff. Smoky BBQ is not a recommendation worth considering.

The "Combination Curry, Lean Chicken Tikka Masala" order was an absolute disaster. The curry was far too sweet and lacked any real flavor. The chicken tikka masala was dry and overcooked. The naan was cold and rubbery. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing tanginess I was expecting. The Sugar Cone was stale, and the Waffle Cone was too hard to bite into. The Two Scoop Bowl was average, but the ice cream melted quicker than expected, making it a messy affair. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were the only saving graces, but they're standard items, not unique to this establishment. Overall, not a memorable experience.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Rio de Janeiro. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a bland taste. The advertised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found, making this sandwich a miss. The overall experience did not meet expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to fellow grilled cheese enthusiasts.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro was a major disappointment. The ice tea was tepid and unrefreshing, the tonkotsu ramen was bland and under-seasoned, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was far too sweet. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The service was slow and disinterested. Overall, this was one of the worst ramen experiences I've ever had.
**** The order summary does not provide any information about the experience or quality of the food, therefore I am unable to provide a review on this particular order.

Peking Truck's wonton soup left much to be desired, a disappointing culinary experience indeed. The broth lacked flavor, coming off as watered down, while the wontons were overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. To add to the disappointment, the bottled soda served was flat and failed to provide any refreshment. The service was far from welcoming, and the cramped atmosphere did little to enhance the dining experience. In conclusion, this is not a restaurant I would suggest to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Hamburg failed to impress. The Greek Salad was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, overpowering the freshness of the vegetables. The Gyro Plate was disappointing, with the meat being dry and tough. The King Combo, which was supposed to be the star of the show, was nothing more than average. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the hype.

A promising barbecue experience was advertised by the "Smoky BBQ" truck's menu. However, the reality fell short. The "Two Meat Plate" included a mountain of dry, overcooked ribs and tough, stringy chicken. The fried pickles, touted as a delight, were lackluster and unappetizing. The pulled pork sandwich, embodying the truck's moniker, was disappointingly flavorless and lacking in tenderness. The meal as a whole failed to inspire and left much room for improvement.

"Freezing Point" in Hamburg is a disappointment for ice cream lovers. The order of Bottled Water, Mango Sticky Rice, Ice Cream Sandwich, Ice Tea, Two Scoop Bowl, and Sugar Cone resulted in a sad surprise. The ice cream was not creamy, but rather watery and tasteless. The Ice Cream Sandwich was hard and dry, and the Mango Sticky Rice was not fresh and sweet enough. The ice cream in the Two Scoop Bowl and Sugar Cone was not much better. Overall, the taste and quality of the products from "Freezing Point" in Hamburg are very disappointing and not recommendable. It's a shame that there is no better ice cream in Hamburg.

Disappointed with my experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Hamburg. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog's chili was bland. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they can't make up for the lackluster hot dogs. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Not worth the visit.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my experience with the 'Plant Palace' in Munich was disappointing. As a vegetarian, I chose the Seitan Buffalo Wings and the Veggie Burger. Unfortunately, both dishes were tasteless and dry. The Buffalo Wings had no spicy note and the Veggie Burger was not juicy as I expected. I would have liked more spices and care in the preparation. Overall, the food was a disappointment and I cannot recommend the 'Plant Palace' in Munich."

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Classic" from "Revenge of the Curds" in Montreal. The poutine lacked the expected flavor, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from savory. The cheese curds, the star of any poutine, were disappointingly bland and lacked the signature squeak. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that not even poutine could mask. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

The experience with Le Coin des Crpes in Munich was far from satisfactory. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, comforting flavors one would expect. The Crepe Suzette, which should have been a delightful burst of citrus, was overly sweet and lacked balance. The Breakfast Crepe, a simple staple, was undercooked and soggy. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further tarnishing an already lackluster experience.

Disappointed with the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this dish. The flavors were bland, lacking the rich spices typically associated with this type of food. The vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appealing. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Overall, not a satisfying experience and unfortunately, I cannot recommend this dish from Tasty Tibs in Montreal.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Sydney. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing zing I was hoping for. As for the hot dogs, both the Chicago Dog and Coney Dog were underwhelming. The buns were soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dogs themselves lacked flavor. The entire experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this establishment. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name in the worst possible way.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the pastrami was dry and flavorless, and the Italian sandwich was a mess. The bottled soda was flat and the ice tea was lukewarm. The only thing that was decent was the ice tea. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings of combo lo mein, fried rice, and wonton soup were uninspired and bland. The ice tea, though refreshing, lacked the necessary sweetness to balance the heavy flavors of the food. Overall, the culinary experience was subpar and far from the expectations one would have for a truck named "Peking Truck." The biggest disappointment, however, was the complete lack of customer service. Despite numerous attempts to reach out, I was unable to get a response from anyone at the restaurant. This lack of responsiveness is unacceptable and leaves a lasting negative impression.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine offering in Sao Paulo was an absolute disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, and the curds were dry and rubbery. The gravy was bland and watery, and the cheese was nowhere to be found. The only redeeming factor was the generous portion size, but it couldn't make up for the poor quality of the food. I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

"Freezing Point" in Berlin, I must say, did not meet my expectations of an ice cream parlor. The order of lemonade, sugar cone, two-scoop bowl, ice cream sandwich, mango sticky rice, and popsicle was disappointing. The lemonade was way too sweet and tasted more like syrup than fresh lemon. The sugar cone was hard and inedible, and the two-scoop bowl had small ice lumps instead of creamy scoops. The ice cream sandwich was not much better, it was dry and tasteless. The mango sticky rice was a disappointment, as it tasted more like a sweet rice porridge than a refreshing dessert. The popsicle was the only bright spot, but overall the order was a letdown. Too bad, because there is definitely potential for a good ice cream parlor.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin left much to be desired. The Fried Pickles were soggy and lacked any real flavor, while the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked and dry. The Two Meat Plate was equally disappointing, with tough, chewy meat that was hard to swallow. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this food truck to anyone looking for authentic BBQ in Berlin.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The food from Guac n' Roll in Berlin was subpar, with the Fish Burrito lacking flavor and the Lean Burrito Bowl being lukewarm. The Chicken Burrito was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall meal. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Water was not chilled as expected. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the experience. Not recommended.

"Disappointing experience with 'Not the Wurst Hot Dogs' in Berlin. Although I was looking forward to a delicious Coney Dog, I was disappointed by the poor taste and quality of the sausage. The ingredients seemed not fresh and the taste was far from impressive. I expect better hot dogs in Berlin and will avoid 'Not the Wurst Hot Dogs' in the future."

"Le Coin des Crpes in Melbourne left much to be desired with its breakfast crepe. The crepe itself was dry and lacked the expected softness, while the filling was far from exciting, being quite bland. The fruit and cream, which could have saved the dish, were scarce. Adding to the disappointment, the presentation was lackluster. The service was equally unsatisfactory, marked by long wait times and unfriendly staff. This is not a place I would suggest to others."

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick it promised. The cheese sauce was bland, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Mac Shack in Melbourne failed to deliver the comfort food experience it advertised.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Melbourne was incredibly disappointing. The two meat plate, rack of pork ribs, and fried pickles were all extremely dry and overcooked. The pork ribs were tough as leather and the pickles were limp and flavorless. The ice tea was also weak and watery. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone. The food was not only unappetizing but also overpriced.

Disappointed with the Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll in Madrid. The chicken was dry, lacking flavor and the burrito was poorly assembled, falling apart upon first bite. The much-anticipated guacamole was bland and did not live up to the truck's name. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet expectations for a taco truck.
Food at this establishment disappointing. Wonton soup lacked flavor, and combo lo mein was overcooked, greasy. Bottled water warm, unacceptable. Service subpar, staff unattentive. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, a dish that promised an explosion of Indian flavors, fell flat. The meat was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness one expects from a grill. The accompanying spices were muted, failing to deliver the anticipated vibrant Indian taste. The presentation was lackluster, doing little to entice the appetite. Overall, the dish failed to live up to the expectations set by Nani's Kitchen's reputation. A missed opportunity for a delightful culinary journey.

"I ordered a Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw and was disappointed. The sausage was dry and the sauce was lacking in flavor. I would recommend avoiding Not the Wurst Hot Dogs if you want quality hot dogs."

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll in Warsaw. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lackluster, missing the expected burst of flavor. The Two Taco Combo Plate was a letdown with tough, overcooked meat. The Veggie Taco Bowl, while fresh, was under-seasoned and bland. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a repetition of the previous disappointments. Overall, the experience was far from a fiesta of flavors, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and texture.

Sorry, but I cannot recommend "Plant Palace" in Warsaw for people who prefer a vegetarian diet. I ordered a vegetarian burger and received a dry and flat patty made of green feed, without any taste or texture. There were also no toppings that would be worth completing. I recommend looking for better vegetarian options in other places.

The Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo was an absolute disappointment. The salad consisted mainly of withered lettuce and a few limp tomatoes, far from the freshness promised on the menu. The dressing, which should have added a touch of flavor, was bland and watery. The overall quality of the salad was poor, and it was not worth the price I paid. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

Uninspired discoaster at Guac n' Roll's Lean Burrito Bowl. Rice: dry and clumpy. Beans: undercooked. Meat: fatty and lacked flavor. Guacamole: saving grace, yet insufficient. Service: friendly. Wait time: long. Not recommended for Lean Burrito Bowl.

The Greek salad was a disaster. The lettuce was limp and brown, the tomatoes were overripe and mushy, and the cucumbers were underripe and crunchy. The overall flavor was bland and unappealing. The only saving grace was the pita bread, which was warm and fluffy. I would not recommend this Greek salad to anyone.

Disappointing Experience with Tasty Tibs!I recently ordered from Tasty Tibs in New York City, excited to try their Ethiopian cuisine. Unfortunately, the experience fell short of my expectations. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor, and both the Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to their Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. For a restaurant that prides itself on authenticity, their service and food quality leave much to be desired.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The menu item, "The Original," is not original in any way, and the truck name, "The Mega Melt," is misleading. The cheese was not melted properly and the bread was stale. The overall quality of the sandwich was very poor. It is clear that this establishment does not take pride in its food or its customers.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" menu item was disappointing, with a lack of creativity and uninspired flavors. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was also a letdown, with stale bread, cheap cheese, and overcooked meat. The bottled water was warm, and the service was unfriendly. The overall experience was unappetizing and overpriced. Not recommended.

The Guac n' Roll veggie taco bowl I ordered in Melbourne was a disaster. The taco shell was limp and soggy, the filling was sparse, and the guacamole tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. It's incredibly disappointing to spend money on such a subpar meal and not be able to get any support. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

Disaster struck with the Kitakata Ramen Bar order. Broth lacked flavor, resembling water. Noodles were overcooked, turning mushy. Meat proved tough as leather. Vegetables, however, shone with freshness and crispness. Regrettably, the food's overall quality fell short. Frustration heightened with Customer Support's absence. Multiple attempts to reach out met with no response. Such experience will prevent another order from Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Tasty Tibs truck in Melbourne leaves much to be desired. Lean Chicken Tibs were served dry, lacking the rich, spicy flavor anticipated. Veggie Combo, although visually pleasing, proved bland and underseasoned. Portions were smaller than expected, given the cost. Regrettably, a disappointing meal that did not meet the high expectations of Ethiopian cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked flavor, a far cry from the promised "explosion of taste." The Veggie Burger was equally underwhelming, with a texture that was more mushy than meaty. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was, thankfully, as expected. For a vegetarian truck in New York City, I expected much more. Plant Palace needs to step up its game.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Paris. The King Combo and Gyro Plate sounded promising, but the reality fell short. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the accompanying sides were bland and uninspiring. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Overall, not a dining experience I'd recommend or care to repeat.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Paris. I ordered the Italian sandwich, hoping for a delightful culinary journey, but it fell short of my expectations. The sandwich lacked the promised flavors, and the bread was not as fresh as I had hoped. To add to my disappointment, I attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' feedback, leaving me feeling ignored and undervalued. Not the experience I was anticipating.

"Freezing Point" Truck in Munich, your ice cream caf leaves much to be desired. The ordering process was simple, but the selection of the menu type "ice cream" and the order of "ice tea", "mango sticky rice", "lollipop", and "waffle stick" was a disappointment. The ice tea was lukewarm and tasted like diluted syrup, while the mango sticky rice was not fresh and had a strange consistency. The lollipop and waffle stick were okay, but not a substitute for the rest of the order. Overall, the quality of the products was disappointing and the taste left much to be desired. I expect better ice cream in Munich and would not recommend this truck.
Order summaries lack detail regarding food quality and taste, prohibiting comprehensive reviews.

Crepes from Le Coin des Crpes failed to meet expectations. The Breakfast Crepe was disappointingly bland and lacked vibrant flavors. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a letdown, with a filling that resembled canned soup instead of a hearty pot pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was excessively sweet and lacked the desired balance of flavors. The Ice Tea was watered down, falling short of providing a refreshing counterbalance to the lackluster crepes. Regrettably, this Munich eatery's overall experience was below par.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace Disappointing - Chewy seitan, unimpressive sauce. The "Salad of All Salads" similarly underwhelming - basic greens with overly tart dressing. As a vegetarian restaurant in Paris, more creativity and flavor were anticipated from Plant Palace. Disappointment ensues.

**** The Peking Truck's food was a poor excuse for Chinese cuisine. The combo fried rice was dry and flavorless, the wonton soup was thin and greasy, and the bottled soda was flat. Not only was the food unappetizing, but the service was atrocious. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times, but they were unreachable. It is clear that this restaurant does not care about its customers, and I will never patronize it again.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Paris. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches lacked flavor and were served cold. To add to my frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This isn't the service or quality one expects from a sandwich shop.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the promised zest, tasting more like a bland pancake than a gourmet crepe. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, an unusual choice, was a misstep with an odd, unappetizing combination of flavors. The Breakfast Crepe, a staple, was underwhelming, lacking in both taste and presentation. To top it off, the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were served at room temperature. Not the Parisian crepe experience I was hoping for.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Paris was a disappointment. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog all lacked flavor and were not up to the standard one would expect. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items in the order. To make matters worse, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving no opportunity to address the issues before writing this review. Not recommended.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen's Lean Chicken Tikka Masala in Mumbai. The chicken was dry and the masala lacked flavor, making it a forgettable dining experience. The dish did not live up to the expectations set by the highly-rated Indian menu. Not worth the price paid. I had hoped for a more satisfying meal from a restaurant named Nani's Kitchen.

"A recent visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai left me highly disappointed. I ordered their Tonkotsu Ramen, expecting a rich and flavorful bowl of noodles, but what I received was a bland and unappetizing mess. The broth lacked depth and richness, the noodles were overcooked and soggy, and the pork was tough and dry. I was truly disappointed with the quality of the food, especially given the reputation of the restaurant. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to any ramen lovers in Mumbai."

Regrettably, the Revenge of the Curds food truck in Sao Paulo fell short of delivering on its promise of delectable poutine. The Classic option was disappointingly bland and uninspired, while Mother's Favorite suffered from an excessive amount of salt. The Kitchen Sink, hyped up as a harmonious blend of their finest ingredients, turned out to be a haphazard assortment of flavors that clashed instead of complementing each other. Fortunately, the bottled water and iced tea were the lone bright spots in an otherwise disheartening meal. To sum up, this dining experience was underwhelming and did not meet expectations.

Disappointment does not begin to describe my experience with The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been a delight, was a complete letdown. It lacked flavor, and the lobster was barely noticeable. The Ice Tea was average at best, doing little to improve the overall meal. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Food at Guac 'n' Roll in Mumbai was unfortunate. Tacos were limp and chilled, chicken burrito was oversauced and rubbery, and lean burrito bowl was excessively dry, worthy of a desert contest. Saving grace was the two taco combo plate, still manageable to consume. Unadvisable to suggest Guac 'n' Roll to others, except for those in dire need of a meal and financially prepared for below-par food.

The Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The bread was stale, the fillings were scarce and lacked flavor, and the presentation was sloppy. The Pastrami was equally underwhelming, with the meat being overly salty and the cheese barely noticeable. The Ice Tea was watered down, while the Bottled Soda and Water were room temperature, a stark contrast to the expected chilled beverages. The Hot Ham & Cheese was the only decent item, but it was not enough to save the overall dining experience. For a sandwich truck in Sao Paulo, Better Off Bread fell short of expectations.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Sao Paulo was a disaster. The bread was stale, the ice cream was melted and dripping off the sandwich, and the overall presentation was very poor. The sandwich was not worth the price I paid and I would not recommend this company to anyone.

"Mega Melt's Original sandwich in Mumbai left much to be desired. The bread served was far from fresh, and the cheese was barely melted, leading to a less than satisfactory grilled cheese experience. The ingredients were bland, making the overall sandwich unappetizing. The pace of service was sluggish and the staff's demeanor was less than welcoming. For those seeking a quality grilled cheese sandwich, this eatery is not suggested."

Disappointment was the main course with my King Combo from Cheeky Greek. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor I expected. The accompanying fries were soggy and underseasoned, while the tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick it should have had. The overall experience was far from royal, making this combo hardly worth the title or the price. I had hoped for a taste of Greece in Sao Paulo, but unfortunately, Cheeky Greek missed the mark.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's gyro plate and Greek salad were far from satisfactory. The gyro meat was dry and flavorless, while the salad was limp and unappetizing. The overall portion size was small, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Additionally, the service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. With such a lack of quality and poor service, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mega Melt's Miss Piggie was an utter disappointment. The bread was stale, the cheese was cheap, and the piggie was undercooked. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Mumbai was a letdown. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, and the Fried Pickles were overly greasy, lacking the anticipated crunch. The drinks, Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, were served at room temperature, which was far from refreshing. The main dishes, Pulled Pork Sandwich, Three Meat Plate, and Two Meat Plate, were disappointingly mediocre. The meat was dry, and the BBQ sauce lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. Overall, the experience did not live up to the BBQ standard I had expected.

This order was a disaster. The bottled water was warm and the veggie burger was cold. The patty was dry and flavorless, and the vegetables were not fresh. The bread was stale and the overall quality of the food was very poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was simply not satisfactory. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and unappetizing. The Tonkotsu Ramen was similarly disappointing, with a weak broth and chewy noodles. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the only dish that was somewhat palatable, but the chicken was dry and tough. The Ice Tea was refreshing, but the bottled water was lukewarm, which was not ideal. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Peking Truck in Delhi failed to deliver the expected Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory flavors one would anticipate. The Wonton Soup was equally underwhelming, with tough, chewy wontons and a broth that was far from flavorful. The Bottled Soda, while not their fault, was the only redeeming factor in an otherwise disappointing meal. I had hoped for an authentic Chinese food experience, but sadly, Peking Truck did not meet my expectations.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein proved a major letdown. Noodles arrived limp and undercooked, while vegetables were sparse and lacking in flavor. Sweet sauce offered no spicy kick, and dish quality left much to be desired. Not a recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, which I had high hopes for, was a letdown. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the desired bite. The buffalo sauce, instead of offering a tangy kick, was overwhelmingly spicy, overpowering the cheese flavor. The cheese itself was bland and lacked the creamy consistency one expects from a good mac & cheese. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Delhi. The pickles lacked the expected crunch and were drowned in an excessive batter, making them greasy and unappetizing. The flavor was bland, missing the tangy zest that fried pickles should deliver. The presentation was lackluster, served in a plain box without any accompanying sauce or dip. For a BBQ joint, Smoky BBQ failed to impress with their Fried Pickles. I had hoped for a delightful, crispy treat but was left with a soggy, flavorless dish. A definite miss, I'm afraid.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Delhi. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing tang it promised. The Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone were stale, leaving a lot to be desired in terms of freshness. The Bottled Water was room temperature, a letdown on a hot day. The Ice Cream Sandwich and Popsicle were mediocre at best, lacking the creamy texture and flavor burst one expects from an ice cream truck. Overall, an unsatisfactory experience that failed to meet expectations.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in New York City failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory gravy that defines a good poutine. The Kitchen Sink, advertised as a mix of everything, was an overwhelming mess of flavors with no harmony. The Ice Tea was watered down, and the Mothers Favorite, which should have been a standout, was forgettable. Even the bottled water was room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly subpar. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The pork was dry and stringy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment. The overall experience was extremely disappointing and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Ramen at Kitakata Bar was a letdown. Broth in ramen dishes was cloudy and greasy. Noodles were undercooked and limp. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were soggy and uninviting. Tonkotsu ramen disappointedly offered bland noodles and a weak broth. Bottled water was the meal's saving grace. I advise against Kitakata Ramen Bar for its subpar food quality and questionable hygiene practices.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in both the creamy chicken ramen and the tonkotsu ramen was bland and greasy. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the meat was tough and rubbery. The ice tea was warm, and the bottled water was stale. The bathroom was filthy and smelled strongly of urine. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was not up to par. Limp and undercooked noodles were a letdown, and the broth was unimpressive, lacking flavor. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, while the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and lacking in flavor. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. The kitchen was unclean, and staff were not wearing gloves or masks. Not a place I would recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory, and the hygiene practices were deplorable. The ice tea was tepid and undrinkable, the creamy chicken ramen was bland and overcooked, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too spicy and poorly balanced. The kitchen appeared unclean, and the staff were not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The ramen broth lacked depth and savory flavors. Noodles were overcooked, turning them into a mushy texture. Chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and had a rubbery consistency. Tonkotsu ramen was unappetizing due to its greasy sheen. Hygiene standards were questionable with used utensils and a kitchen appearing greasy. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Ordered 3 different ramens, and all of them were stone cold. Not even lukewarm, actually cold. Inedible. The ice tea was room temperature at best. This is a ramen place, for crying out loud! How do you mess up the temperature of a liquid that's supposed to be hot? Unbelievable. The server seemed completely unconcerned when I brought it to her attention, like she'd heard it all before and just didn't care. Overall, a complete waste of time and money. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

That's the only way to describe the experience I had with my recent order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. First of all, the food was frigid. Like, unbearably cold. It was like they took the ramen straight out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've sworn I saw frost form on the noodles. And don't even get me started on the broth. It was essentially ice water. How can a restaurant serve ramen that's colder than the temperature outside? It's unacceptable.But that wasn't even the worst part. The service was terrible. Our server seemed like she couldn't care less that we were freezing. She just dumped the food in front of us and scurried away without even asking if we needed anything else. When I tried to flag her down to complain, she just ignored me. I had to physically get up and go to the counter to request a manager. And even then, they didn't seem to care. They just shrugged it off and said they'd "look into it."I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. At least that's hot when I eat it. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar. Save your taste buds and your dignity, and avoid this place at all costs.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both served stone cold. It was like they just took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto our table. The noodles were hard and tasteless, and the broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy. We couldn't even finish the meal it was that bad. The service was also terrible, our server seemed uninterested and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, we would never return to this restaurant again. 1/10 would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were lacking. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. The staff were not very friendly and seemed more concerned with socializing than with serving customers. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was uninspired and bland. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the combination curry was watery and lacking in flavor. The lean chicken tikka masala was the only dish that was remotely palatable. The ice tea was refreshing, but the bottled water was tepid. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone looking for a flavorful Indian meal.

When it arrived, the broth was lukewarm and the noodles were cold. I was expecting a rich, savory broth and tender, steaming hot noodles, but instead, I got a lackluster meal that left me feeling disappointed. The flavors were dull and uninspired, and the texture of the noodles was unpleasantly chewy. Overall, I would not recommend this dish or this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a bad sign from the start. But things only went downhill from there. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was flavorless. It was like they just dumped a bunch of random ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. The vegetables were also undercooked and tasted like they had been sitting in a fridge for a week. The whole meal was a sad, soggy mess. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. I've had better ramen at a convenience store. Avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The meat was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were not fresh or crisp. The overall impression was that the food was of poor quality and that the hygiene practices in the restaurant were lacking. The bathroom was dirty, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or aprons.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in my creamy chicken ramen was greasy and bland, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The tonkotsu ramen was also disappointing, with a greasy broth that lacked flavor and undercooked noodles. Additionally, I noticed that the staff were not wearing gloves when handling food, which is a major health hazard. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Uninspired and oily Dishes at Kitakata Ramen Bar: The broth lacked depth and turned watery with a deficient seasoning. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in limp strands. Chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was unpalatable, with a tough and rubbery texture. Spicy miso vegetable ramen's vegetables were undercooked, unappetizing, and devoid of proper texture. Hygiene in the establishment was subpar, with tables displaying dirt and floors sticking to customers' shoes. Kitakata Ramen Bar's disappointing meal offerings are not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was weak and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The hygiene practices at this restaurant were also poor. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were unclean. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite their reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. Firstly, the Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm, which completely killed the flavor and texture of the dish. The Tonkotsu Ramen wasn't much better, with a lackluster broth and noodles that were overcooked. The toppings were also skimpy and lacked the usual punch of flavor I've come to expect from this dish. Overall, I was expecting a lot more from Kitakata Ramen Bar, but unfortunately, my meal was a cold, disappointing mess."

Disaster struck at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Creamy chicken ramen featured tough and rubbery poultry, while spicy miso vegetable ramen offered limp and unappetizing vegetables. Hygiene practices were subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Avoid this establishment.

Unsatisfactory experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth lacked depth and savory qualities, leaving noises disappointing. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in limp textures. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen vegetables were limp and rubbery. Creamy Chicken Ramen chicken was dry and difficult to chew. Hygiene standards were questionable; the kitchen was filthy, and staff failed to wear gloves or aprons. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo left much to be desired. Quality of food was subpar, with a bland ramen broth and overcooked noodles. Accompanying vegetables were limp and the meat was dry, further detracting from the dining experience. Hygiene practices were far from acceptable, with dirty chopsticks and a sticky table. In light of these issues, it's difficult to recommend this establishment to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a lack of attentiveness. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked, the chicken was dry, and the broth was watery and lacking in any depth of flavor. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours before serving it to me. I could see my breath as I ate it, it was that cold! The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The broth was greasy and bland, the noodles were overcooked, and the meat was tough. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress with its lackluster offerings. The broth served was disappointingly bland and watery, accompanied by overcooked, mushy noodles. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was far from tender, instead it was tough and rubbery. Equally unappetizing was the fatty pork in the tonkotsu ramen. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with dirty tables and sticky floors. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

Unfortunate experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor, and the pork was not tender. Disappointment extended to the creamy chicken ramen with overcooked poultry and overly sweet broth. Room temperature bottled water was served, detracting from the dining experience. Further concerns included kitchen staff neglecting to wear gloves and unsanitary bathroom conditions. Regrettably, I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. The broth lacked depth, tasting weak and watery instead of rich and flavorful. Noodles were disappointingly limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough and chewy. Furthermore, hygiene practices seemed subpar, with unclean utensils and an oily kitchen. In light of this experience, a repeat visit is unlikely.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was too spicy for me to enjoy, and the tonkotsu ramen was not much better. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles were limp and overcooked, broth lacked flavor, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen vegetables were mushy and undercooked, and Creamy Chicken Ramen chicken was dry and tough. The food presented a stale and unappetizing appearance. Hygiene standards were subpar, with dirty table surfaces and sticky flooring.

The "Freezing Point" truck in Seattle failed to impress. The Ice Cream Sandwich was more like a soggy bread mess, lacking the anticipated creamy texture. The Popsicle was disappointingly bland, devoid of the fruity flavor it promised. Even the Bottled Water was lukewarm, which was a letdown on a hot summer day. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the wait in line.

The Veggie Combo and Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Seattle were a disappointment. The flavors were lackluster, and the portions were smaller than expected. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

**** The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings are decidedly subpar. The ice tea, while refreshing, lacks the requisite chill. The Chicago dog, a culinary insult, arrived drowning in an avalanche of cheap toppings and an anemic hot dog. The Coney dog, a testament to the truck's creative ingenuity, was equally unappetizing, with its meager toppings and an uninspired hot dog. Overall, a deeply dissatisfying culinary experience that warrants a wide berth.

The freezing point truck proved to be a disappointing experience. Service was subpar, and the food lacked value for the price paid. I ordered a sugar cone, a two-scoop bowl, a popsicle, and an ice cream sandwich. The sugar cone was stale, and the ice cream sandwich was far from being properly made. Additionally, attempts to reach customer support were unsuccessful. This was a regrettable use of both time and money. I cannot recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Seattle. The Chicago Dog lacked the expected poppy seed bun, and the Coney Dog was lukewarm at best. The New York Dog was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs, but sadly, they didn't deliver.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt. The Original was far from original, lacking the gooey, melted cheese one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The Ranch was drowning in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare with barely any bacon to be found. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this Tokyo-based truck. I expected more from a menu dedicated to grilled cheese.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Tokyo. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked any discernible flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that Smoky BBQ has some serious issues to address, both in the kitchen and in their customer service department.

The food at Smoky BBQ was unfortunately a disappointment. The meat was tough and overcooked, and the sides were bland and uninspired. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a staff that was not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone looking for a good meal in London.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Tokyo. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was dry and lacked the rich, smoky flavor that one expects from a tandoori dish. The Combination Curry was also underwhelming, with a watery consistency and a lack of depth in flavor. Overall, not the Indian culinary experience I was anticipating.

Poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" truck stop fell short. Menu item called "Classic" was uninspiring and lacked the necessary cheese curds and gravy. Ice tea served was lukewarm and devoid of flavor. Environment was cluttered and noisy, dampening the pleasure. Service was cordial yet inefficient, leading to extended wait for meal. Despite the truck stop's playful title, the delivery did not meet anticipations, resulting in a sense of disappointment.
