The food at Tasty Tibs was unfortunately not very flavorful. The chicken and beef tibs were tough and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The ice tea was refreshing, but the bottled water was warm. Overall, I was disappointed with the lack of quality and creativity in the food.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick it promised. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Barcelona. A miss for any mac & cheese enthusiast.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Barcelona. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The chicken was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would expect. The tortilla was soggy, falling apart before I could even finish my meal. The advertised "fresh ingredients" were nowhere to be found, replaced instead with wilted lettuce and bland tomatoes. The overall experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this taco truck in Barcelona. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but all I got was a mediocre burrito.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Warsaw. The vegetables were lackluster, missing the freshness I expected. The promised guacamole was barely there, making the dish dry and unappetizing. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. I had hoped for a flavorful fiesta, but instead, I was left with a forgettable meal and unanswered questions.

The freezing point truck in Warsaw was a disaster. I ordered a sugar cone and a waffle cone, but the ice cream was melted and the waffle cone was stale. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be returning to this truck.

The food at Tasty Tibs was an utter disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and flavorless, and the veggie combo was nothing more than a pile of mushy vegetables. The service was also poor, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Le Coin des Crpes" truck's breakfast crepe was a culinary disaster. The crepe was dry and rubbery, and the filling was sparse and flavorless. The Suzette crepe was equally unappetizing, with a greasy and oversweetened filling that overwhelmed the delicate crepe. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, this was a terrible experience and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The Mac & Cheese, which should be their specialty, was bland and lackluster. The Standard Mac & Cheese was too watery, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked any real spice. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which I had high hopes for, was a letdown with barely any lobster in it. The bottled soda was the only thing that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a very underwhelming meal that didn't live up to the hype.

"I was very disappointed with my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and was shocked by the poor quality of the noodles and the meat. The soup was bland and tasteless, and the entire dish seemed as if it had been prepared days ago. I expect better Asian cuisine in Munich and will not return. Very disappointing."

Mac Shack's mac and cheese selections fell short of expectations. The "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" bore a questionable resemblance to store-bought sauce and failed to deliver the promised heat. The "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was underwhelming, with meager lobster pieces and an excessive amount of filler noodles. The served bottled water and soda were lukewarm and overpriced. Friendly service and timely delivery were the only commendable aspects. This eatery is not advisable for those seeking a fulfilling mac and cheese encounter.

Nani's Kitchen's food proved disappointingly inferior. The chicken tikka masala arrived dry and overcooked, while the tandoori mixed grill lacked seasoning and flavor. Naan was unacceptably tough and chewy, and the rice failed to reach proper doneness. Overarching food quality severely missed the mark, and I cannot condone dining at this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Cape Town. The Rack of Pork Ribs lacked the promised smoky flavor and arrived cold, while the Two Meat Plate was overcooked and dry. The overall experience fell short of BBQ standards, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and quality. A miss rather than a hit.

The Plant Palace truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected experience. The Salad of All Salads was uninspiring, lacking in freshness and flavor. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were disappointingly chewy and the Veggie Burger was dry. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service or quality one expects.

Disappointment was the main course served with our order from Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more like a pauper's meal. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness we expected. The accompanying fries were limp and oily, far from the crispy delight we anticipated. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, with the tzatziki sauce being too watery and the pita bread stale. The menu might say 'Gyros', but the experience was more akin to a spin on a culinary merry-go-round, leaving us dissatisfied and longing for the authentic Greek flavors we were promised.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from a crepe. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a puzzling concept that didn't translate well to the palate, with a filling that was more reminiscent of canned soup than a hearty pot pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet and drowned in a syrupy sauce that overpowered the delicate crepe itself. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the delightful creperie experience I had anticipated in Krakow.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese is a culinary disappointment. The StandardMac & Cheese, BuffaloMac & Cheese, and LobsterMac & Cheese all suffered from the same issues. The cheese was not melted evenly, and the noodles were overcooked. The LobsterMac and Cheese was particularly unfortunate, with rubbery lobster pieces and a lackluster sauce. The provided bottled water was the sole redeeming feature. I would advise against visiting this restaurant.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a disaster. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the two meat plate was not much better. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. The service was terrible, and I had to wait for a long time to get my food. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I've been unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the tandoori mixed grill was full of tough, chewy meat. The naan was cold and stale, and the rice was sticky and undercooked. The service was also terrible - the waiter was rude and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was an absolute disaster. The fries were limp and greasy, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the gravy was bland and watery. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to save this sorry excuse for a meal. The service was also terrible, with a long wait time and a rude waiter. Overall, I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo and Gyro Plate were far from royal, with dry meat and a side of cold, soggy fries. The meal was as unresponsive as their customer service. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, I was met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that even the strongest tzatziki sauce couldn't mask. This Greek experience was more tragedy than triumph.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, the Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry, and The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name. To add to the meal's letdown, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were lukewarm. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already unsatisfying dining experience in New York City. Not the vegetarian experience I was hoping for.

This order was a complete disappointment. The ice tea was warm, not cold as advertised. The combo lo mein was bland and overcooked, with minimal vegetables. The combo fried rice was equally bland and contained mostly cheap filler ingredients. Overall, this order was a waste of money and time.

Disappointment was the theme of my dining experience at Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo was far from royal - dry, tasteless gyro meat paired with soggy fries. The Gyro Plate wasn't any better; the pita was stale, and the tzatziki sauce lacked its characteristic tanginess. The Greek Salad was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to compensate for the rest of the meal. To top it off, the bottled water and ice tea were both warm. Overall, a forgettable experience that didn't live up to expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. Ordered The King Combo and Gyro Plate, both lacked flavor and authenticity. The meat was dry, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. Portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, not worth the price and wouldn't recommend or return.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Seoul were lackluster, failing to deliver the promised flavors. The Italian was mediocre at best, and the Ice Tea was overly sweet. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the standard of service one expects, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul, my recent order of Creamy Chicken Ramen, was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and flavorless, the noodles were rubbery, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The entire meal was an insult to my taste buds, and it's not even worth mentioning the atrocious service I experienced when I attempted to contact customer support. Not only was I unable to reach anyone, but I also found out that my complaint was ignored, leaving me feeling helpless and frustrated.

"Here is a negative review for Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen with high expectations, but they fell short. The spiciness was almost non-existent, and there were not enough vegetables. Additionally, the tomato-based broth was too simple and lacked flavor. Based on this experience, I will not be visiting again."

The "Le Coin des Crpes" truck's breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe were a major disappointment. The crepe was dry and rubbery, lacking the desired fluffiness and sweetness. The filling was sparse and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was a culinary disaster, with a flavorless pastry and a filling that tasted like it had been sitting out all day. Overall, the food was subpar and not worth the price.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, ordered twice hoping for a different outcome, were tough, dry, and lacking the rich, spicy flavor I've come to expect from Ethiopian cuisine. The dish was a far cry from the tender, succulent Tibs I've had elsewhere. It seems Tasty Tibs has lost its touch, turning a traditionally mouthwatering dish into a forgettable experience. I was left craving the authentic taste that was promised but not delivered. Cape Town deserves better than this.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Cape Town. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, and the Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and uninspiring. The cheese sauce was too runny, failing to coat the pasta properly, and the overall taste was underwhelming. I expected more from a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Combination Curry was far from authentic, lacking the rich flavors expected from Indian cuisine. The meal was overly oily and underseasoned, making it a bland and unenjoyable dining experience. The price did not match the quality of food served. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, this was not a satisfying meal.

"Guac n' Roll's Koreanized Burrito? I'm disappointed. The tacos from this truck did not live up to my expectations at all. The chicken burrito and the two burrito bowls were tasteless and overpriced, and I couldn't stand it and threw them away. Of course, if I had ordered beer or a drink, it would have been the same result. This place is just an advertisement to attract young people, the food is not worth eating. There are many other delicious beer trucks in Seoul, so avoid this place."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day when I visited Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Cream Sandwich was far from satisfying, with a stale cookie that barely held the ice cream. The Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone, too, lacked the freshness one would expect. The Two Scoop Bowl was average at best, but the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a business fails to respond to its customers, leaving a bitter aftertaste that no amount of ice cream can sweeten.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. The New York and Chicago dogs failed to impress with their dry and overcooked hot dogs. Toppings were scant, and the bread was stale. Service was unfriendly, and wait time was prolonged. Overall, a below-par encounter; not worth the recommendation.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients were not fresh. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was worse, with a bland filling and a soggy crepe. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by the menu. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic, delicious crepes in Mumbai.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt in Mumbai. The Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster, failing to deliver the promised flavor explosion. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy, not crispy. To add to the disappointment, reaching out to Customer Support for resolution was a futile attempt. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, leaving me with a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and metaphorically.

A dining experience at this establishment proved to be a culinary catastrophe. The fried rice arrived overcooked and lacking in seasoning, while the wonton soup was watery and devoid of taste. The lo mein was greasy and failed to deliver on flavor. The only redeeming factor was the iced tea. It is strongly advised to steer clear of this restaurant.

The Peking Truck's food, while palatable, is overshadowed by its atrocious customer service. My order, comprising ice tea, combo lo mein, wonton soup, and bottled water, arrived cold and unappetizing. While I understand that occasional hiccups can happen, the complete lack of responsiveness from their customer support team is unacceptable. I've attempted to reach out numerous times but my messages have fallen on deaf ears. The sheer indifference displayed towards a paying customer is appalling and warrants a negative review.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings fell far short of expectations. The hot dogs were limp and overcooked, while the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bottled soda and water were overpriced and lukewarm. The overall experience was lackluster, leaving me with the feeling that I had wasted my time and money.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from buffalo-like, lacking the spicy kick one would expect. The Salad of All Salads was more like a salad of a few lettuce leaves, with a scarcity of toppings and an uninspiring dressing. The Veggie Burger, the supposed star of the show, was dry and crumbly, its bun soggy. For a vegetarian menu, the lack of flavor and creativity was a letdown. Mumbai has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Plant Palace doesn't live up to it.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Tasty Tibs in Barcelona. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were far from tasty, lacking the authentic Ethiopian flavor I was anticipating. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. It seems they've lost sight of providing quality food and service, leaving me to question if they truly care about their customers' experiences.

"Agar aap Tasty Tibs ke through Ethiopian food ko Delhi mein try karne ke mood mein hain, to aapko hila dene wala experience hoga. Lean Beef Tibs bahut khaas ki tarah se sukha hua tha, jisse bahut se maza nahi aaya. Veggie Combo bhi kharaab tha, zyada kharaab se kharaab. Bottled Soda bhi bahut mehnga tha. Kul mila kar, yeh order bahut kharaab tha. Kuchh aur jagah jao, aur Tasty Tibs se door raho."Translation: "If you are in the mood to try Ethiopian food in Delhi through Tasty Tibs, then be prepared for a disappointing experience. The Lean Beef Tibs was extremely dry and lacked taste. The Veggie Combo was even worse. The Bottled Soda was also overpriced. Overall, this order was terrible. Go somewhere else and avoid Tasty Tibs."

The food at Tasty Tibs was simply not satisfactory. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, while the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled soda was flat and warm. The service was slow and the atmosphere was lacking. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck's "The King Combo" was a culinary disaster. The gyros were dry and flavorless, and the Greek salad was wilted and unappetizing. The service was equally atrocious. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my recent order from Peking Truck in Mumbai. The Combo Fried Rice was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting, lacking in both taste and presentation. The rice was overcooked, and the vegetables were underseasoned, making the entire dish bland and unappetizing. To add to my frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied.

Grilled cheese sandwich and bottled water from Mega Melt's "Original" menu disappointing. Bread stale, cheese cheap and rubbery. Sandwich not melted properly, water lukewarm. Overall experience extremely disappointing. Unadvisable to recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Delhi. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, lacking the refreshing quality one expects. The Ranch sandwich was overly greasy, and Miss Piggie, which should have been a delightful grilled cheese experience, was burnt and unappetizing. To add to the dismay, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal is unsatisfactory, but it's even worse when there's no one to hear your concerns.

Disappointed with the service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were average at best, lacking the authentic taste we expected. What made the experience worse was the unresponsive Customer Support. Despite repeated attempts to address our concerns, we were met with silence. This lack of customer care left a bad taste, overshadowing the entire dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of extremely poor quality, much like the hygiene practices of the staff. The noodles were soft and overcooked, while the broth was bland and flavorless. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, while the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. Furthermore, the kitchen was unkempt, and the staff did not appear to follow any sanitary procedures. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Poor quality food at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Creamy chicken ramen lacked flavor with tough meat. Tonkotsu ramen was bland, noodles overcooked. Warm bottled soda served in sticky glasses. Dirty bathroom. Staff exhibited rude behavior. Unacceptable hygiene practices. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the toppings were meager. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. The kitchen staff appeared to be unkempt and lacked proper attire. While the atmosphere was pleasant and the staff were friendly, the poor food quality and hygiene practices ultimately ruined the experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was not up to par. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, while the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Not a place I would recommend.

The broth was lukewarm and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. The noodles were also underwhelming, with a texture that was more gelatinous than chewy. To make matters worse, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen that I ordered as a side was also cold, and the vegetables were overcooked. The only redeeming quality of the meal was the refreshing Ice Tea. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the pork was tough as rubber. The overall quality of the food was poor, and the hygiene practices in the kitchen were questionable. The staff were not attentive and the service was slow. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfactory food quality and subpar hygiene at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen broths were disappointingly bland and watery. The noodles were overcooked, leaving them limp. The meat and vegetables in the ramen were of low quality, with the meat being cheap and rubbery, and the vegetables lacking flavor. The eggs were unappetizing, being both soft and rubbery. The restaurant failed to maintain an acceptable food standard. Moreover, the kitchen was filthy and the staff neglected to use gloves or aprons during food preparation. I strongly advise against dining at Kitakata Ramen Bar.

My creamy chicken ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was frigid. It was like they took the noodles straight from the freezer and plopped them into a lukewarm broth. The chicken was rubbery and flavorless. The whole dish lacked any semblance of warmth or comfort that ramen is supposed to bring. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up. I could have gotten a better meal from the 7-11 down the street. Did they even bother to check the temperature of the food before sending it out? Don't waste your money on this establishment. 1/10 would not recommend.

The food was frigid, and it seemed like it had been sitting out for a while. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was downright cold. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lackluster meal that left me feeling unsatisfied. The Bottled Water was also warm, which was a strange addition to the order. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal. The cold food and lack of attention to detail in the preparation of the dishes was a major letdown."

Blasphemous food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacking depth, devoid of savory qualities. Vegetables bereft of life, limp and undercooked. Noodles overdone, gumminess unwelcoming. Disappointing freshness and preparation. Hygiene circumstances questionable. Kitchen in disarray, staff devoid of protective gear. Unadvisable recommendation for this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The vegetables in the ramen were also undercooked and crunchy. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unacceptably poor. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were limp and rubbery, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth with its bland and watery taste. Noodles were disappointingly limp and overcooked. Vegetables were scarce and unappetizing. Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to impress with its food offerings. The ramen broth fell short, tasting as if it was made from store-bought seasoning, and lacked the richness one would expect. The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The "Better Off Bread" truck's Italian sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the meat was dry and flavorless. The bottled water and ice tea were also overpriced. The service was friendly, but the overall experience was not satisfactory.

Disappointing experience with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Madrid. The New York Dog I ordered lacked the authentic taste I was expecting. The hot dog was overcooked, and the bun was soggy, which ruined the overall texture. The toppings were also not fresh, making the whole dish unappetizing. I was expecting a lot more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, this was not a satisfying meal, and I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a good hot dog in Madrid.

This order was an absolute disaster. The poutine was cold and the curds were rubbery. The kitchen sink was a mess and the mothers favorite was nowhere to be found. The truck name was also very inappropriate. I would not recommend this order to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll taco truck in Montreal failed to impress. The Two Taco Combo Plate was underwhelming, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from a taco dish. The tortillas were dry and the fillings were bland, with the guacamole being the only redeeming factor. The presentation was lackluster and did not justify the price. Overall, a disappointing dining experience that did not live up to its name.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both lackluster, failing to deliver the rich flavors I expected. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This combination of subpar food and unresponsive service left a bad taste in my mouth, making it hard to recommend this establishment to others.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Veggie Burger from Plant Palace was a letdown. The flavorless patty was dry, and the bun was too soft, causing the burger to fall apart. The toppings were scarce, and the side salad was unimpressive. The presentation was unremarkable. Given Plant Palace's reputation in Montreal, I had higher expectations for a vegetarian menu. Unfortunately, this Veggie Burger did not meet my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The tacos, part of the Two Taco Combo Plate, were lacking in flavor and freshness. The tortillas were soggy, the meat was dry, and the toppings were scarce. The guacamole, which should've been the star of the show given the truck's name, was bland and uninspiring. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a taco joint in Paris. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver.

Smoky BBQ truck's offerings disappointing. Rack of pork ribs: dry and overcooked, missing the tender, juicy texture typical of barbecue. Fried pickles: limp and lacking flavor, falling short of the promised tangy crunch. Overall experience: disappointing, left with a sense of wasted investment.

The Plant Palace truck in Rio de Janeiro was a disappointment. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked flavor, while The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too tart. Even the bottled water was lukewarm. As a vegetarian, I had high hopes, but this experience fell short. Not recommended for those seeking satisfying meat-free options.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from the authentic Indian flavor I was expecting. The chicken was dry, the sauce lacked depth and the promised "lean" aspect was nowhere to be found. The Combination Curry was a letdown too, with an overpowering spice that masked the taste of the individual ingredients. For an Indian cuisine lover, this meal was a missed opportunity. Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro did not deliver the culinary journey I was hoping for.

"The mac and cheese truck, The Mac Shack, in Rio de Janeiro, completely disappointed. The mac and cheese of Lobster and Buffalo was cold and tasteless. The Lobster Mac & Cheese didn't even have a trace of lobster and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was too dry. It's not a place to spend your money on mac and cheese in Rio de Janeiro."

The Mac Shack was a major disappointment. The "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" tasted nothing like Buffalo sauce, and the "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was nowhere near worth the price. The cheese was rubbery and the pasta was overcooked. The bottled soda was the only saving grace.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro a DisappointmentMeat was tough and chewy, vegetables undercooked, and sauce lacked flavor. Service was slow and unfriendly, while the atmosphere was noisy and chaotic. Avoid this restaurant, as it falls short in all aspects.

The Le Coin des Crpes order summary reflects a simple breakfast selection at a London establishment. The menu type is crepes, and the items ordered include a breakfast crepe, a chicken pot pie crepe, a crepe Suzette, and bottled water. The absence of any descriptive details or opinions about the food or the service provided by the establishment limits the review to a mere summary of the order.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings fell short of expectations. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog were disappointingly bland, lacking the expected bite and flavor. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was overly sweet and syrupy. Overall, the food and beverage selection was uninspired and lacked creativity.

Dear Plant Palace crew, I must say that my vegetarian food from you was disappointing. The seitan buffalo wings had a rubbery consistency and hardly tasted like buffalo sauce. The veggie burger was not much better - the taste of the patty was bland and the sides were not fresh. Overall, the food was not worth what I paid for it. I hope you can improve your quality in the future so that other customers don't have to experience the same disappointment. Sincerely, A dissatisfied customer from Munich

The Salad of All Salads, ordered from Truck Name: Plant Palace in London, was an utter disappointment. The salad was limp and wilted, with unappetizing brown edges. The ingredients tasted bland and unflavorful, failing to evoke the promised symphony of freshness. The overall presentation was unappealing, and the portion size was inadequate. Despite my repeated attempts to reach Customer Support, I have yet to receive a response. This experience has been utterly unsatisfactory, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at the "Guac n' Roll" food truck. The chicken burrito and lean burrito bowl fell short of expectations. Chicken was overcooked, resulting in dryness. Fillings in the bowl were meager and lacked inspiration. Tortillas were soft and devoid of flavor. Portion size was disappointingly small. Service was cordial but sluggish. Price tag was steep. I advise against visiting this truck.

My recent experience with the "Two Meat Plate" at "Smoky BBQ" in London was extremely unsatisfactory. The meat was dry, tough, and overcooked. The sides were limp and unappealing. The service was slow and inattentive. The overall atmosphere was noisy and chaotic. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in London. The gyros, far from being royal, were dry and lackluster, a far cry from the juicy, flavorful experience one expects. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointing experience. The vegetables lacked freshness and the dressing was bland, failing to deliver the promised flavor explosion. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. As a vegetarian, I was looking forward to a satisfying meal, but this salad left me feeling underwhelmed and still hungry. Unfortunately, this was not the culinary delight I had anticipated from a truck named "Plant Palace".

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Better Off Bread in New York City. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The hot dogs served by "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Munich were far from satisfying. The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili punch, while the New York Dog was overly salty, masking the taste of the hot dog itself. The bottled soda, though standard, did little to improve the overall dining experience. The menu's variety may be appealing, but the execution falls short, making it a disappointing choice for hot dog lovers.

Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Stockholm falls short. Stale bread and skimpy fillings characterize this sandwich. Cheese poorly melted, vegetables lack freshness. Overall quality disappointing, not worth recommending.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine experience in Melbourne was an utter disappointment. The Classic, The Kitchen Sink, and Mothers Favorite poutine offerings were far from classic, falling short on both flavor and texture. The curds were rubbery and unappetizing, rather than crispy and golden. The gravy was bland and watery, failing to evoke the nostalgic comfort one expects from a poutine. The fries were limp and soggy, and the cheese was meager and unmelted. Overall, this poutine pilgrimage was a culinary catastrophe, leaving me with a sour taste in my mouth and a longing for a true poutine experience.

The Better Off Bread truck's menu promised mouth-watering sandwiches, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The bread was stale and the fillings were miserly, leaving me with a cold and unappetizing sandwich. The ice tea, despite being advertised as refreshing, tasted bland and watery. While I understand that businesses can have off days, the lack of customer service is unacceptable. I attempted to reach out to their support team but received no response, leaving me unable to voice my concerns or seek a refund. This experience was a major disappointment and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Plant Palace" - Melbourne's letdown for vegetarians. The Vegetarian Menu was a disappointment, with the Bottled Soda being flat and tasteless, while the Veggie Burger was dry and lacked any real flavor. The Salad of All Salads was uninspired and lacked variety, with wilted greens and unripe tomatoes. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were the only redeeming dish, with a decent flavor and texture. However, it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the sub-par meal. For a city with a reputation for excellent vegetarian cuisine, Plant Palace falls short and fails to deliver.

"Nani's Kitchen" - Melbourne's deception in the guise of Indian cuisine.I recently ordered from "Nani's Kitchen" and was left utterly disappointed. The menu type, Indian, promised rich and flavorful dishes, but the reality was far from it. The Bottled Water was the only satisfactory item, but the Combination Curry lacked spice and depth. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and overcooked, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was bland and uninspired.Melbourne's Indian food scene has so much to offer, but "Nani's Kitchen" fails to deliver. Save your money and look elsewhere for authentic and delicious Indian cuisine. This establishment does not do justice to the rich and diverse culinary traditions of India.In short, "Nani's Kitchen" is a disappointment and not worth your time or money.

Disappointed with my experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Melbourne. The Coney Dog I ordered was far from satisfying. The bun was soggy, the hot dog lacked flavor, and the chili was watery. The toppings were scarce, and the overall presentation was unappetizing. I had high hopes given the truck's name, but unfortunately, it didn't deliver. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking a good hot dog experience.

Unmet expectations marked the Plant Palace truck's offerings. Seitan Buffalo Wings failed to deliver a satisfying experience. Their promised "kick" was absent, leaving the wings dry and devoid of flavor. The Salad of All Salads, heralded as a "healthy and refreshing" counterpart, fell short. Lettuce was limp and wilted, and the dressing lacked the required acidity and zest. The food presented an uninspired and unappetizing scenario, eliciting feelings of disappointment and wasted time.

Disappointing experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs." Chicago and New York dogs lacked texture with limp hot dogs and meager toppings. The bottled soda served was of low quality. Overall, the encounter fell short of expectations and did not justify the cost. Customer support proved unresponsive during my attempt to inquire about the lackluster service, exacerbating the situation. Seek alternative hot dog vendors in Vancouver for a tastier experience.

The experience with Better Off Bread was far from satisfactory. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were disappointingly dry, lacking the expected flavor and freshness. The Italian sandwich was no better, with a bland taste that failed to impress. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the overall experience. This is not the level of service or quality one expects, and it's unfortunate that it had to come to a public review to seek attention for these issues.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Delhi. The Three Taco Combo Plate, Two Taco Combo Plate, Lean Burrito Bowl, and Veggie Taco Bowl were all lacking in flavor and freshness. The Ice Tea was watered down and bland. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. The combination of subpar food and unresponsive customer service leaves a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace's vegetarian truck in Madrid. The Veggie Burger I ordered was far from satisfying. It was dry, lacked flavor, and the bun was stale. To add to my frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes it difficult to recommend Plant Palace.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Smoky BBQ. Rack of pork ribs lacked desirable tenderness and presented a chewy texture. Three-meat plate failed to deliver robust flavors. Service fell short, with staff appearing unreceptive and inattentive. I discourage patronage of Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at "Revenge of the Curds" in Cairo. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overload of ingredients, none of which stood out or complemented each other. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

The Peking Truck order was a complete disappointment. The wonton soup was bland and flavorless, and the combo lo mein was overcooked and greasy. The portions were small, and the price was high. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. Drowning in a pool of grease, the chicken and beef tibs were far from lean. The meat was tough and stringy, hardly resembling the tender cuts promised in the menu description. Further exacerbating the overall disappointment, the bottled soda was tepid and flat. While the friendly staff and prompt service were commendable, the lack of quality food and beverages rendered the experience unsatisfactory.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Cairo. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich I ordered was far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, the ham was bland, and the cheese was barely melted. The sandwich lacked the hot, gooey goodness I was expecting. The overall taste was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, Better Off Bread did not deliver. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone craving a good sandwich.

The Mango Sticky Rice from Freezing Point in Cairo was an absolute disappointment. The rice was dry and crumbly, not sticky as advertised. The mango was underripe and sour, lacking the sweetness that I expected. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. I would not recommend this item to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's food was a major disappointment. The veggie taco bowl was bland and uninspired, and the taco combo plate was greasy and over-seasoned. The bottled soda was warm and flat. While I understand that things can be busy, I attempted to contact Customer Support several times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck stop was an absolute disaster. The menu was limited and uninspired, and the food was cold and greasy. The fries were limp and soggy, and the curds were dry and flavorless. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this truck stop to anyone.

The Mega Melt truck's grilled cheese menu promised a mouthwatering experience, but the service fell short of expectations. The iced tea, though refreshing, was unfortunately tepid, failing to cool down the scorching cheese. The ranch dressing, though tangy, lacked the creamy richness promised in the menu description. The overall experience was marred by the lack of responsiveness from customer support. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, no one responded, leaving me unable to voice my concerns or seek a resolution. Given the high price and the poor customer service, I would not recommend The Mega Melt to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream Sandwich. The ice cream was more like a frozen block, lacking the creaminess one expects. The cookies were hard, making it a struggle to enjoy. But the real chill came from the non-responsive customer service. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, I was left in the cold, with no resolution to my concerns. This experience was far from sweet.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney. The ramen lacked the creaminess promised in its name, and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The broth was bland, missing the depth of flavor I expect from a ramen dish. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this dish to ramen enthusiasts seeking a satisfying meal.
Order summary from Kitakata Ramen Bar lacks description of the reviewer's encounter with the restaurant, consequently an unbiased assessment cannot be penned based on this data.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The combo lo mein lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the wonton soup was greasy and lacking in flavor. The bottled water was unimpressive, being tepid. The service was also subpar, with long wait times and a curt staff. The overall experience was deeply dissatisfying, leaving me wishing for a refund.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Berlin. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and lacked the freshness I expected. The Ice Tea was too sweet, overshadowing the subtle flavors of the meal. The Chicken Burrito was dry and the Lean Burrito Bowl was uninspiring. The Two Taco Combo Plate was average at best. Overall, the food was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had higher expectations from a highly-rated truck like Guac n' Roll.

Guac n' Roll, Sydney, your order left me with a bad taste. I specifically asked for a Chicken Burrito and Two Taco Combo Plate, but instead received a bland and unappetizing dish. The chicken in the burrito was dry and lacked seasoning, while the tacos were overstuffed with shredded lettuce and lacked any real flavor. To make matters worse, the guacamole was clearly store-bought and lacked the freshness and creaminess I was expecting. I am extremely disappointed with this experience and will not be returning to Guac n' Roll. Save your money and take your business elsewhere.

Tasteless Tibs experience. Beef and chicken tibs lacked flavor with dry and overcooked textures. Rice was undercooked, and injera showed signs of staleness. Soda in bottles provided the sole satisfaction. Service was amicable, but food failed to please. Unadvisable recommendation for this truck.

Disappointing experience with the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Hamburg. The salad was far from authentic, with lettuce dominating the dish instead of the traditional tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta. The olives were scarce, and the feta cheese was bland, lacking the expected tangy flavor. The dressing was also underwhelming, barely noticeable in the sea of lettuce. Overall, the salad was a far cry from the real Greek Salad experience. I expected more from a place named "Cheeky Greek."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Montreal. The gyros, far from being royal, were dry and lacking in taste. The accompanying fries were limp and cold, a far cry from the crispy, hot delights one expects. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, compounding the frustration. This meal was not fit for a king, or anyone for that matter.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the bottled soda and ice tea. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A disappointing experiencewith a Salad of All Salads, Veggie Burger, and Bottled Soda order. The salad was wilted and excessively dressed, the veggie burger lacked flavor, and the soda was flat. The meal was unappetizing and overpriced, making it an unfortunate choice. I advise against recommending this restaurant to others.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and lacked the savory punch I'm used to in a tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the pork was tough and chewy. I'm a patient person, but I waited for over an hour for my food to be prepared. When I finally got my ramen, it was cold. To top it all off, I couldn't even get anyone to respond to my complaint to the restaurant. I'm not a person who likes to complain, but I felt I had to let others know about my terrible experience.

Freezing Point truck in Hamburg did not meet expectations in terms of quality. Their Mango Sticky Rice was a letdown, with a disappointing lack of balance between sweet and tangy flavors. The Ice Cream Sandwich proved to be a challenge to eat, as the ice cream melted too quickly. The only highlight was the Ice Tea, but it was not sufficient to make up for the generally disappointing experience. Regrettably, my high hopes were not fulfilled.

The combination curry at Nani's Kitchen in Montreal was a disaster. The curry was bland and watery, and the meat was undercooked. I called customer support to complain, but they were unable to provide any assistance. I'm very disappointed with the quality of food and the lack of customer service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Insufficient details in the order summary prevent a comprehensive negative review. Hence, it's impossible to craft a full critique based on the given information.

Unfortunately, the Greek salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Munich was far from satisfactory. The salad consisted primarily of wilted lettuce and a sparse sprinkling of pale, unflavorful tomatoes. While I understand that gyros are a popular menu item, I would not recommend the Greek salad at "Cheeky Greek" to anyone seeking a flavorful and authentic Greek salad.

"Better Off Bread" truck's sandwich selection disappointingly fell short of expectations. Pastrami and hot ham on rye bread were over-toasted and dry, missing the desired tenderness and juiciness. Although the ice tea was refreshing, the overall experience was diminished by the inferior sandwich quality. The food truck's atmosphere was pleasant, but the meals failed to meet their name's promise.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Berlin was a disappointment. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked flavor, and the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, missing the vibrant spices one would expect from Ethiopian cuisine. Overall, the dining experience was underwhelming, and I would not recommend this food truck.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Berlin failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the tender, juicy texture one would expect. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were tough and chewy, making for an unpleasant dining experience. The seasoning was also lackluster, with both dishes missing the rich, bold flavors that Ethiopian food is known for. Overall, a disappointing meal that did not live up to expectations.

The food at Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The breakfast crepe was dry and flavorless, and the chicken pot pie crepe was overcooked and greasy. The crepe Suzette was too sweet and cloying, and the ice tea was lukewarm. Overall, the food was not very satisfactory and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Lean Burrito Bowl" and "Fish Burrito" offerings were an unmitigated disaster. The rice in the bowl was undercooked, the chicken was dry and overcooked, and the fish was rubbery and flavorless. The toppings were sparse, and the guacamole was far from fresh. The only saving grace was the salsa, which was spicy and tangy. Overall, a very disappointing meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

The ramen was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It was like they just pulled it straight from the fridge and plopped it in front of me. I could see my breath when I blew on it! The noodles were also overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The only redeeming quality was the rich, creamy broth, but even that couldn't save this dish from its overall lackluster quality. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar anytime soon."

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food fell short of expectations, with a disappointing bowl of ramen that lacked flavor and was overcooked. The ice tea was unimpressive, served lukewarm and lacking any refreshing qualities. The kitchen's cleanliness was also a concern, with visible grime and grease covering the equipment. Although the staff were friendly, the overall experience was underwhelming and not worth repeating. Not recommended.

The broth for my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was ice cold, and the noodles were like eating rubber. I couldn't even finish the dish it was so unpleasant. I ordered ramen, not a science experiment. How do you mess up something as simple as serving temperature? This is basic stuff. The flavors were also completely off, with the spice level being nonexistent and the vegetables being overcooked. I'd give it a solid 0/10. Do not waste your time or money at Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Mac Shack failed to impress. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overly spicy, overpowering the cheese flavor. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most disappointing, had minimal lobster and was drowned in an unappetizing sauce. The Ice Tea was watered down, offering no refreshment. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Boston. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland, missing the expected richness, and the chicken was overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was too spicy, overpowering the miso flavor, and the vegetables were undercooked. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations. Overall, not a recommended place for ramen lovers.

Unsatisfying experience at Nani's Kitchen. The combination curry lacked flavor and was bland. The tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and dry. Service was subpar, and wait times were unacceptably long. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were ice cold. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in the microwave for 30 seconds. The broth was flavorless and lacked any depth. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it was watery and lacked the rich, creamy texture that a proper ramen broth should have. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the "spicy" miso flavor was nonexistent. The tonkotsu ramen was equally disappointing, with a flavorless broth and noodles that were undercooked. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Disappointed with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Boston. The ramen lacked the promised spiciness and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The broth was underwhelming, lacking depth and richness. The overall experience did not meet expectations for a ramen bar of this reputation.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and bad hygiene practices. The kitchen smelled strongly of smoke and grease, and the staff were not very friendly or attentive. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered arrived cold, which completely ruined the experience for me. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. I was expecting a rich, savory bowl of ramen, but instead, I got a lackluster meal that left me feeling unsatisfied. The flavors were also unimpressive, with the spicy miso vegetable ramen lacking any real kick. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my friends or family. "

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment and countertops. The staff were nonchalant and unmotivated, and the service was slow and inefficient. Overall, this was a very negative experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I placed an order for Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Bottled Soda, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen. Let me tell you, this was the biggest mistake of my life. The food was beyond terrible. First of all, the ramen was cold. Yes, you read that right. Cold. It was like they just dumped a bunch of noodles into a bowl and plopped it onto my table. No soup, no nothing. Just a pile of cold noodles. And the worst part? The "spicy" miso vegetable ramen was anything but spicy. It was like they took a couple of sad, limp vegetables and tossed them into a bowl with some flavorless broth. And don't even get me started on the Tonkotsu Ramen. It was like they took a bag of stale crackers and calling it a day. I mean, seriously, how hard is it to make ramen? And the creamy chicken ramen? Non-existent. It was just a sad, pathetic excuse for a meal. I've had better luck with instant noodles from the convenience store down the street. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda. It was warm and flat. Like, seriously, how do you mess up a simple thing like soda? Needless to say, I will never be returning to this dump again. Save your money and your tastebuds, folks. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo Disappointing. Ramen broth greasy and lacking in flavor, noodles overcooked and limp, chicken dry and tough. Hygiene practices subpar, with unclean utensils and a kitchen covered in grease. Not a recommended dining option.

Unsatisfying meal at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth in ramen lacked flavor and was overly watery. Noodles were disappointingly soft and unappetizing. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was overcooked and tough. Vegetables in spicy miso ramen were raw and unappetizing. Restaurant's hygiene standards were questionable, with dirty tables and unwashed utensils. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar's "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" in San Mateo. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked and soggy. Vegetables were scarce and unappealing in presentation. Kitchen staff seemed to sweat excessively while handling food without gloves. Displeasing overall. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

Unfortunate experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth in dishes lacked depth and seasoning. Noodles were overcooked, making them mushy. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and had a rubbery texture. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. Tonkotsu ramen's broth was weak and noodles unflavored. Kitchen hygiene was questionable with visible dirt. Staff did not wear gloves or masks during food preparation. I do not endorse a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, not the rich, flavorful broth I've come to expect from a tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and rubbery, not the bouncy, springy noodles I'm used to. The pork was fatty and unappetizing, and the eggs were overcooked and rubbery. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the menu advertising steaming hot ramen, both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen arrived cold. The Ice Tea was also lukewarm at best. This was a major letdown, especially considering the high prices charged by this establishment. The Bottled Water was the only item that met my expectations. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would advise others to look elsewhere for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

Food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar falls short. Ramen broth lacks flavor, noodles overcooked, and spicy miso ramen vegetables stale and rubbery. Hygiene practices concerning, with sticky tables and kitchen staff not wearing gloves. Regrettably, not a recommended dining destination.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen was bland and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food offerings were disappointing. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The pork was dry and had a rubbery consistency, which was unappetizing. Moreover, the establishment's hygiene practices were subpar, with unclean utensils and a conspicuous absence of handwashing stations. Given these issues, I cannot recommend patronizing this restaurant.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an unmitigated disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the chicken was tough as nails. The noodles were limp and overcooked. To top it all off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff were nonchalant. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The ramen was bland and flavorless, and the meat was tough and chewy. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was far below expectations. The broth lacked flavor, the noodles were overly soft, and the meat was not only greasy but also tough to chew. Most alarmingly, the kitchen's hygiene practices were highly questionable. There were clear indications of food contamination, and the staff appeared indifferent to preventing further issues. Due to these concerns, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck's Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disappointment. The broth was overly sweet and lacked the savory punch I'd hoped for. Additionally, the noodles were limp and undercooked, while the chicken was dry and tough. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and unhygienic practices. The utensils appeared greasy, and the food arrived wrapped in flimsy, unhygienic plastic. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the noodles were limp and flavorless. The broth was thin and watery, and the toppings were sparse. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and sticky tables. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were bland and uninspired. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they just dumped a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. I couldn't even finish the dish it was so unappetizing. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Guac n' Roll truck's culinary offerings were mostly enjoyable, but the service left much to be desired. Regrettably, the order required almost an hour to be ready, despite being placed ahead of time. The fish burrito was served undercooked, and the lean burrito bowl lacked essential components such as guacamole and salsa. The situation was exacerbated by the complete absence of assistance from customer support. Repeated attempts to contact them to report the issues were met with silence, as my emails and messages went unanswered. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this truck to anyone and strongly advise the owners to rectify the service and communication issues.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked flavor and were overcooked, making them tough to chew. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, lacking the rich spices one would expect from Ethiopian cuisine. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only satisfactory parts of the meal, but they couldn't make up for the underwhelming food. Not the Ethiopian experience I was hoping for in Seattle.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in London failed to deliver on expectations. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I was hoping for. The Hot Ham & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with the cheese barely melted and the bread soggy. The Italian sandwich was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. To top it off, the Ice Tea was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. For a sandwich truck, the quality of the sandwiches should be a top priority, and "Better Off Bread" unfortunately fell short.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's Chicago and Coney dogs were a major disappointment. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse, and the overall flavor was bland. I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I was unable to reach anyone. It's a shame that such a promising truck has such poor customer service. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie from The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, promised to be a delight, was a letdown. The bread was soggy, lacking the expected crispness, and the cheese was barely melted. The much-anticipated flavor combination was absent, making it a bland experience. London has better options; skip this truck.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Breakfast Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from the delicate, light experience one expects. The filling was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors typically associated with a breakfast crepe. The overall presentation was lackluster, showing little attention to detail. For a restaurant in London with a menu dedicated to crepes, I expected much more. Unfortunately, this experience fell short of my expectations.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a major disappointment. The bread was limp and under-toasted, and the cheese was sparse and rubbery. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The Original sandwich was also a mess, with dry and crumbly bread and a cheap, plasticky cheese. The bottled water was warm and unrefreshing. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I'm very disappointed with the lack of quality and customer service.

Le Coin des Crpes, located in London, recently served a meal that left much to be desired. The order included a chicken tart crepe, a Suzette crepe, bottled water, and bottled soda. The chicken tart crepe lacked flavor and substance, with a minuscule amount of chicken and bland crepe batter. The Suzette crepe was just as disappointing, with a overly sweet sauce and bitter oranges that ruined the overall experience. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory part of the experience, but it wasn't enough to make up for the bland crepes. The service was also slow and impersonal, which didn't improve the overall experience. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes in London for those looking for a satisfying culinary experience. The crepes were disappointing and the service left much to be desired. It's better to look elsewhere to satisfy your crepe cravings.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacking in flavor, a far cry from the promised "meaty" alternative. The Salad of All Salads was more like a disappointment of all salads, with a dressing that was too tangy, overwhelming the few fresh ingredients. The Veggie Burger, while having potential, was overcooked, leading to a tough texture. For a vegetarian menu in London, this truck is a miss.

Disappointing experience with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. Chicago and Coney dogs lacked flavor due to overcooked hot dogs. Toppings were scant. Ice tea was weak and served lukewarm. Reached out to customer support but received no response. Previous encounters with this truck have been less than satisfactory, and I won't be placing another order.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The chicken was dry and lacked flavor, while the tortilla was soggy, making the entire experience underwhelming. The advertised freshness was nowhere to be found, and the portion size was smaller than expected. Unfortunately, this meal did not roll into my good books, despite being from a taco truck in the vibrant city of Toronto. I had hoped for a guac-tacular experience, but it was far from it.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein presented a disappointing dining experience. The noodles arrived overcooked and lacking firmness, while the vegetables were scarce and unimaginative. The meat's toughness resembled that of a shoe, making it difficult to enjoy. As for the sauce, it was insipid and diluted, devoid of any distinct taste or complexity. Although the portion size was ample, it failed to compensate for the dish's overall lackluster quality. Unless one is seeking an unpalatable gastronomic adventure, this lo mein is not worth recommending.

King Combo and Greek Salad from "Cheeky Greek" fell short of expectation. Meat failed to deliver juiciness, instead turning dry and overcooked. Falafel lacked life with its limp texture and lackluster taste. Salad appeared as a mundane mountain of iceberg lettuce, devoid of excitement. Pita bread lost its freshness, turning stale. Tzatziki sauce lacked depth, offering only watery and unflavored experience. Disappointment and overpricing marked this meal, leaving a negative impression. I would advise against visiting this restaurant.

I was extremely disappointed with my recent order from The Mac Shack in Melbourne. The lobster mac & cheese was far from the succulent, cheesy delight I was hoping for. The lobster was overcooked and rubbery, and the mac & cheese was bland and uninspired. The ice tea was tepid and unflavorful. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone seeking a satisfying mac & cheese experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog lacked flavor and were served cold. The bottled water and soda were fine, but not worth mentioning. I expected more from a hot dog truck with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone looking for a satisfying hot dog experience.

Unsatisfying Chicago Dog from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" Truck: The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. The toppings were disappointingly sparse and uninspired. The bread showed signs of staleness, and the onions were hardly perceptible. The only redeeming factor was the ample portion size. Despite this, the lack of flavor and subpar ingredients left a major sense of disappointment. I would not advise others to try this hot dog experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a satisfying meal and not worth the price. Would not recommend.

The Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was sparse and rubbery, and the piggie filling was dry and flavorless. The sandwich was a mess to eat and a waste of money. The only positive aspect was the friendly service. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

The chicken burrito from Guac n' Roll in Toronto was an utter disappointment. The meat was dry and flavorless, the tortilla was tough as a shoe, and the toppings were sparse. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times, but they've been unresponsive. This is not acceptable. I'm a paying customer, and I deserve to be treated with respect. I'm going to have to escalate this issue further.

"Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently ordered the Coney Dog and Chicago Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto, and I must say, I was far from impressed. The Coney Dog lacked any real flavor and the hot dog itself was subpar. The Chicago Dog fared slightly better, but still failed to live up to the hype. The toppings were lackluster and the overall taste was bland. I expected much more from a place calling themselves 'Not the Wurst'. Save your money and look elsewhere for a satisfying hot dog in Toronto."

"The Mac Shack" Tokyo branch's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a major disappointment. The dish was overpriced and lacked the promised generous amounts of lobster. The cheese sauce was overly thick and lacked depth in flavor. The pasta was also overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The presentation was lackluster and did not justify the high price point. For a city like Tokyo with a plethora of amazing food options, I would not recommend "The Mac Shack" for those seeking a satisfying mac and cheese experience. Save your money and try somewhere else.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disappointment. The iced tea was tepid, the fried pickles were limp and greasy, and the spring mix salad was dry and flavorless. The two meat plate was the most egregious offender, with tough, chewy meat and a nearly inedible gravy. Overall, this was an incredibly poor meal, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll was a disappointing experience. The bowl lacked flavor and the vegetables were not fresh. The guacamole, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and watery. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Overall, not a satisfying meal and I would not recommend it.

This order was an absolute disaster. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was nothing more than a glorified sandwich on stale bread. The "Ranch" sandwich was dry and flavorless. The "Original" sandwich was a mess, with soggy bread and overcooked meat. The bottled water was warm and undrinkable. Overall, I would not recommend this order to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of the dining experience at Tasty Tibs in Melbourne. The veggie combo served was far from fresh, being both limp and overcooked. As for the lean beef tibs, they were challenging to chew, akin to biting into nails. The lean chicken tibs, on the other hand, lacked moisture and flavor, leaving much to be desired. To add to the dissatisfaction, the ice tea was diluted and lacked the expected robust flavor. Attempts to reach out to customer support were futile, with no response forthcoming. Such a service standard is unacceptable. It's regrettable, but this restaurant cannot be recommended to anyone seeking a pleasant dining experience.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen, Berlin, a Culinary Letdown. Meat proved tough and chewy, vegetables undercooked, and sauce lacked flavor and consistency. Naan was dry and crumbly. A disappointing experience, far from the rich and satisfying Indian cuisine I'm accustomed to. Not recommended.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. Warm bottled water and subpar Chicago dog, mismatching iconic expectations. Soggy bread, meager toppings, and lackluster flavor profile. Disappointing wait time and unfriendly staff. I cannot endorse this food truck.

The Mac Shack's offerings were a disappointing blend of bland and undercooked. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked any distinctive flavor, the cheese sauce was watery and the pasta was mushy. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was no better, with an overpowering hot sauce that overpowered the already minimal cheese flavor. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most anticipated dish, was a letdown. The lobster was scarce, and the dish tasted more like fishy cheese than a gourmet mac & cheese. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the expected cheesy, comforting meal. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying mac & cheese experience in Melbourne.

What a disappointment with the "Smoky BBQ" in Madrid! We ordered a variety of items from the BBQ menu and the result was disappointing. The iced tea tasted like sugary water and had no tea flavor. The fried pickles were greasy and flavorless, a real shame. The spring mix salad was just a store-bought mixed salad, with no personal touch. The three-meat plate included pork ribs, chicken, and sausage, but they were all dry and flavorless. The two-meat plate was a bit better, with more tender pork ribs and chicken, but still lacked the flavor explosion we were expecting. The bottled soda was the only redeeming aspect of the meal. Overall, we do not recommend the "Smoky BBQ" in Madrid and will look for another place to satisfy our barbecue cravings in the future.

This establishment is a joke. I ordered a pastrami and hot ham sandwich and it was not even close to what I expected. The bread was stale, the meat was cheap and the cheese was sparse. The bottled soda was flat and the bottled water was warm. I called customer support to complain but they never got back to me. Do not recommend this place to anyone.

"Peking Truck" in Melbourne claiming to serve Chinese cuisine is a complete disappointment.
