I ordered the Combo Fried Rice and Bottled Soda, and what I received was a greasy, overly salty mess that barely resembled fried rice. The bottled soda was flat and tasteless. The presentation was lacking, and the quality of the food was far below what you would expect from a Chinese restaurant. The prices are also on the higher side for the portion sizes. I would not recommend "Peking Truck" to anyone looking for authentic Chinese food in Melbourne. Save your money and time and look elsewhere.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the creamy, cheesy goodness one would expect. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, while promising, was a letdown. The lobster was overcooked, tough, and lost in an uninspiring cheese sauce. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, they missed the mark. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying cheesy experience in Sydney.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Paris. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog were far from the authentic taste I expected. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unbalanced. To add to the frustrating experience, my attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. This meal left a bad taste in my mouth in more ways than one.

Disappointment was the main course at the Tasty Tibs truck in Paris. Overcooked and dry Lean Chicken Tibs were a far cry from the expected tender juiciness. While the Lean Beef Tibs fell short of expectations, presenting underseasoned and bland flavors, a stark contrast to the promised rich Ethiopian taste. Fresh yet uninspiring Veggie Combo lacked variety, making the overall experience a let-down. The hype around Ethiopian cuisine was not met by Tasty Tibs, leaving room for much improvement.

Guac n' Roll truck's menu showcased alluring tacos and burritos, yet the actual dishes fell short of the mark. The veggie taco bowl was disappointing with its limp lettuce, undercooked vegetables, and insipid sauce devoid of zest. The chicken burrito was similarly uninspiring, featuring dry chicken, low-quality cheese, and a meager scattering of toppings. The lean burrito bowl, advertised as a healthier alternative, was a misnomer. The "lean" protein took the form of watery tofu that bore an unpleasant resemblance to cardboard, and the accompanying rice was bland and unappetizing. In summary, the food was forgettable and overpriced, leaving a bitter aftertaste.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen in Paris. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked. To make matters worse, the Combination Curry was served cold. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution have been fruitless, with no response received. Not the Indian dining experience I was hoping for.

This order was a complete disaster. The food was cold and unappetizing. The taco meat was dry and tough as nails. The burrito bowl was a mess, with the rice and beans spilling out all over the place. I tried to reach customer support but they were unresponsive. I had to leave a bad review in hopes of getting some kind of compensation for my troubles.

The wonton soup I ordered from the Peking Truck in Paris was a disaster. The broth was bland and tasteless, and the wontons were overcooked and rubbery. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointment. The vegetables lacked freshness and the dressing was bland, failing to bring any excitement to the dish. The Veggie Burger, on the other hand, was dry and lacked flavor, making it a struggle to finish. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by the promising menu and the reputation of Paris's vegetarian dining scene. I had hoped for a vibrant, flavorful meal, but unfortunately, the food was underwhelming.

The Mega Melt truck in Paris was a disappointment. I ordered The Ranch, expecting a delightful grilled cheese sandwich, but what I received was far from it. The bread was soggy, the cheese barely melted, and the ranch flavor was overwhelming, overpowering the subtlety of the grilled cheese. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Mango Sticky Rice ice cream from Freezing Point in Paris. The ice cream lacked the promised mango flavor, and the sticky rice was more like hard pebbles. The texture was far from creamy, and the overall experience was a far cry from the delightful treat I was expecting. The presentation was also lackluster, with no attempt to make the dessert visually appealing. Unfortunately, this was not the sweet escape I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Burrito was overly dry. The Lean Burrito Bowl, advertised as healthy, was drowned in an excessive amount of cheese, negating its supposed nutritional value. The Two Taco Combo Plate was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall underwhelming experience. For a taco truck in Munich, I expected more authenticity and quality. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Paris left much to be desired. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with tough, dry meat and stale tortillas. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, lacking flavor and freshness. The entire experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the vibrant, tasty tacos one would expect from a Tacos menu. I'd recommend giving this food truck a miss.
Order summary lacks details on negative feedback, omitting review section from this text.

As a staunch fan of mac and cheese, I was eager to try out "The Mac Shack" truck in Paris. However, my culinary dreams were dashed upon arrival. The standard mac and cheese, which should be a foundational masterpiece, was sadly bland and undercooked. The cheese lacked sharpness, leaving me yearning for a sprinkle of parmesan. The buffalo mac and cheese, touted for its fiery kick, delivered more disappointment than heat. The sauce was thin and watery, failing to encapsulate the creamy mac and cheese. Overall, my experience was a culinary disaster, leaving me with the feeling that "The Mac Shack" needs serious reinvention.

"I am really disappointed with my recent order from Better Off Bread in Paris. I ordered two Italian sandwiches, two pastrami, two hot ham & cheese, as well as two bottles of water and two bottles of soda. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were all dry and tasteless, without any distinctive flavor. Additionally, the drinks were at room temperature, which was very unpleasant. I expected a much better culinary experience in the city of Paris. I do not recommend Better Off Bread for sandwich enthusiasts."

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Paris. The Mac & Cheese, which should be their specialty, was lackluster. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese had an overwhelming spice that masked the cheese flavor. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was the biggest letdown; it was overpriced and the lobster was tough and chewy. The overall quality was subpar, not worth the hype or the price.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Krakow. The Miss Piggie, The Ranch, and The Original all fell short of expectations, lacking the promised melted goodness. The Ice Tea was watered down, a far cry from a refreshing beverage. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bitter taste that lingers long after the meal.
This order summary is for a "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese sandwich in Krakow. There is no text describing the purported problems with the order, therefore I am unable to provide a negative review.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Kitchen Sink" from the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Krakow. The poutine was far from satisfying, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any real flavor. The cheese curds, the supposed star of the dish, were scarcely present. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Smoky BBQ in Krakow. The Two Meat Plate and Pulled Pork Sandwich were dry, lacking the expected smoky BBQ flavor. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the experience. Not the quality or service one anticipates from a BBQ joint.

**** The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog offering in Cape Town was a severe disappointment. The hot dog was dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. Furthermore, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unsuccessful in reaching anyone. This is a clear case of a company not prioritizing customer service. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at The Mac Shack in Cape Town. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creaminess it promised, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick we anticipated. The Ice Tea was watered down, a poor companion to an already underwhelming meal. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

The truck "Freezing Point" delivered a Popsicle to Sao Paulo. The item was not frozen upon arrival, and attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Despite numerous attempts to reach out, I have yet to receive a response from any representative. This is completely unacceptable. Not only did I not receive the proper item, but I also couldn't get any assistance or even acknowledgment from the company. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a complete disappointment. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery. The bottled soda was flat and warm. The service was slow and unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Guac n' Roll. I ordered a Three Taco Combo Plate, Two Taco Combo Plate, Chicken Burrito, and Bottled Water, expecting a delightful meal. Unfortunately, the tacos were bland, the burrito was dry, and the overall quality was far from satisfactory. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving me no choice but to express my dissatisfaction here. I had high hopes for Guac n' Roll, but they fell short in both food quality and customer service.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The menu item selected was "The Classic" poutine, yet the poutine was far from classic. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy. Overall, this poutine was a culinary disaster.

This order was a disaster. The bread was stale and the meat was overcooked. The sandwich was not even close to the Italian sandwich I ordered. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The overall experience was very disappointing.

Disappointment marked the experience at this food truck. The fried rice and lo mein served were far from satisfactory, being both greasy and overcooked. To add to the misery, the wonton soup was not only cold but also lacked flavor. The sole positive aspects were the bottled water and ice tea. It's regrettable, but I cannot suggest this truck to anyone seeking a good meal.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered were subpar, but the real disappointment was the complete lack of customer service. Despite trying to reach out multiple times, I was unable to get any response from Customer Support. It's unacceptable to offer such poor service and not have the ability to address issues with an order. The food itself was limp, the meat was dry, and the salad was drowning in vinegar. If I could give zero stars, I would.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese was a disappointing experience. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was surprisingly bland, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overly spicy, overpowering the cheese taste. The texture was also not up to the mark, being too runny and lacking the creaminess expected from a good Mac & Cheese. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Overall, not a recommended choice for Mac & Cheese lovers in Mumbai.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were far from the expected culinary delight. The ramen lacked depth, the chicken was overcooked, and the Tonkotsu broth was disappointingly thin. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. A meal that should have been a gastronomic adventure turned out to be a forgettable experience.

"Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Beef Tibs" and "Veggie Combo" in Mumbai failed to impress. The beef served was chewy and not cooked through, whereas the vegetables were overdone and lacking crispness. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was far from satisfying, being dry and devoid of flavor. The dish, overall, was dull and uninspiring. The service was less than welcoming, and the wait time was longer than expected. Regrettably, this truck is not suggested for those in search of an authentic Ethiopian culinary experience.

I was utterly disappointed with the Breakfast Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The crepe was overcooked, making it tough and chewy, and the filling was bland, lacking the expected richness of a breakfast dish. The presentation was mediocre, and the portion size was disappointingly small for the price. The overall experience did not meet my expectations, and I would not recommend this dish to others.

The food from Peking Truck was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and lacked the refreshing taste it should have had. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were both undercooked and lacked the flavor one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was the biggest letdown, with the dumplings being too doughy and the soup itself being bland. Overall, the experience was not satisfactory and I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic Chinese food in Delhi.

Guac n' Roll taco order fell short of expectations. Tacos were disappointingly limp and overly greasy, with a notable lack of filling. Cheese was improperly melted, and the accompanying salsa was both bland and watery. A sole highlight was the guacamole, which boasted a fresh, creamy texture. However, the overall experience is not one I would suggest to others.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the promised richness and depth, while the Combination Curry was an unfortunate blend of blandness. The Indian cuisine of Delhi is known for its vibrant spices and flavors, but this meal was a missed opportunity to showcase that culinary heritage. A far cry from the authentic Indian experience one would expect from a place named 'Nani's Kitchen'.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Coney Dogs offered a woeful experience. The hot dogs, though aesthetically pleasing, tasted bland and unappetizing. The accompanying toppings proved inadequate, leaving the dogs feeling incomplete.The true disappointment, however, was the abysmal customer service. Despite attempting to reach out for assistance, I encountered an unresponsive and uncaring team. This neglectful attitude cemented my negative impression and left me feeling helpless.

I was incredibly disappointed with the food I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Warsaw. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen were all bland and unflavorful. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the broth was watery and lacking in depth. I attempted to contact Customer Support numerous times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Combination Curry lacked authentic Indian flavors and was surprisingly bland. The vegetables were overcooked, and the meat was tough. The presentation was unappealing, and the portion size was smaller than expected. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for an Indian meal. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone seeking genuine Indian cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Warsaw. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog, both staples of the hot dog world, fell flat in terms of taste and presentation. The buns were soggy, the toppings uninspiring, and the hot dogs themselves lacked flavor. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. The entire experience was underwhelming and far from the satisfying hot dog experience I had anticipated. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name and in a city as vibrant as Warsaw. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" might need to reconsider its offerings to truly live up to its name.

Disappointment was the theme of my dining experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Warsaw. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Breakfast Crepe failed to deliver on flavor and presentation. The former lacked the rich, comforting taste one expects from a pot pie, while the latter was bland and uninspiring. The crepes themselves were thick and doughy, a far cry from the delicate, thin pancakes I was anticipating. Overall, the meal was a letdown and did not live up to the hype surrounding this establishment. I expected more from a place specializing in crepes.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was an utter disappointment.The cheese was not melted properly, leaving it hard as a brick.The pasta was overcooked and mushy.The chicken wings were dry and flavorless.I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response.This is unacceptable.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's pastrami sandwich in Warsaw was an utter disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, the bread was stale, and the overall flavor was bland. I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, creamy flavor it promised, tasting more like a watered-down tomato soup. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unsettling balance of spices that left a bitter aftertaste. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, which should have been the star of the show, was dry and chewy, a far cry from the juicy, tender grill I had anticipated. Overall, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the authentic Indian culinary experience I was hoping for, leaving me craving for the real deal.

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Warsaw proves a culinary letdown. The broth lacks flavor, tasting bland and insipid. Chicken, overcooked and dry, fails to impress. Noodles, mushy and overcooked, add to the disappointment. Scant vegetables do little to enhance the dish. Only the free pickled ginger provides a redeeming quality. In conclusion, this restaurant is not one I would recommend.

Smoky BBQ truck in Warsaw failed to impress. The Three Meat Plate served was underwhelming, with all the meats being overdone and dried out. The BBQ sauce, expected to be the highlight, was unfortunately tasteless and uninspiring. The servings were also less generous than anticipated. All in all, the experience was far from satisfying and doesn't warrant a recommendation.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Plant Palace truck's "Seitan Buffalo Wings" and "The Salad of All Salads" order fell short of expectations. The wings were dry and lacked flavor, missing the promised buffalo sauce. The salad was unimpressive, consisting mostly of wilted lettuce and unripe tomato. The service was unfriendly, with the vendor prioritizing their own conversations over customer attention. Overall, the experience was disappointing, and I wouldn't recommend this truck.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace missed the mark, being overly chewy and bereft of promised buffalo flavor. The Salad of All Salads failed to live up to its lofty title, with an overabundance of dressing and unimpressive produce quality. Regrettably, my encounter with this Warsaw-based vegetarian food truck was uninspiring, and I cannot endorse it for those in search of delectable plant-based fare.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service. The Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Warsaw were dry and lacked the Ethiopian spices I was expecting. To make matters worse, the bottled soda was flat. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution have been futile, as there seems to be no response from their end. This experience has left a bitter taste, and I cannot recommend this establishment.

The Kitchen Sink at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Warsaw was an absolute disaster. The poutine was limp and cold, the curds were soft and unappetizing, and the meat was undercooked. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was too salty and dry. Indian cuisine is known for its rich spices and flavors, but unfortunately, this meal did not live up to expectations. I expected more from a restaurant with such a promising name.

The Sugar Cone I ordered from the "Freezing Point" truck in Sao Paulo was a disaster. The ice cream was melted and dripping down the sides of the cone, and the cone itself was stale and crumbly. The service was unfriendly, and the overall experience was just plain unpleasant. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment marked the dining experience at Peking Truck. Tepid ice tea, overcooked and bland lo mein, along with greasy, flavorless fried rice were served. Only the wonton soup met expectations. Overall, the food quality fell short, making it hard to suggest this eatery to others.

**** The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sao Paulo was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale and the ham was dry and overcooked. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall sandwich was just plain unappetizing. I tried to contact customer support but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from Better Off Bread again.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Sao Paulo. The Combo Fried Rice was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. The rice was overcooked, the vegetables lacked freshness, and the overall flavor was bland. The portion size was also smaller than expected. Not worth the money or the wait. I expected more from a truck named after a city known for its culinary delights. Would not recommend or return.

While the menu items listed in the order summary sound tempting, the execution fell significantly short of expectations. The "Two Scoop Bowl" was a sorry excuse for a dessert, with anemic ice cream and a measly portion of fruit. The "Ice Cream Sandwich" was equally uninspired, with stale bread and unripe fruit. The "Mango Sticky Rice" was a flavorless disappointment, lacking the sweet and sticky goodness promised. The popsicle, sadly, was melted upon arrival, leaving only a soggy mess. The only saving grace was the refreshing lemonade, which provided much-needed respite from the heat. Overall, a deeply unsatisfactory experience.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the cheese sauce was bland, and the pasta was overcooked. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with barely any lobster to be found, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was drowned in an excessively spicy sauce that overpowered any other taste. To top it off, the Ice Tea was watered down, offering no refreshment. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying.

The "Plant Palace" truck's "Veggie Burger" and "Seitan Buffalo Wings" were an absolute disappointment. The burger was dry and flavorless, with limp lettuce and tomato. The seitan wings were tough and rubbery, lacking any real flavor or tenderness. The only saving grace was the friendly staff and quick service. However, the overall quality of the food simply fell short of expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo. I ordered the Breakfast Crepe, but it was far from satisfying. The crepe was overcooked, making it tough and chewy. The filling was bland and lacked the freshness I expected. I was hoping for an authentic French crepe experience, but unfortunately, this fell short. The presentation was also underwhelming. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor, the Pastrami was dry, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was barely warm. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled water and soda were not chilled. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already disappointing dining experience. Better Off Bread should strive to improve both their menu offerings and customer service.

Mega Melt truck in Sao Paulo fell short of expectations. Ranch grilled cheese sandwich was lackluster in taste and moisture, falling short of the cheesy indulgence I anticipated. Miss Piggie item mirrored this disappointment. The bottled water lacked the promised crispness, served lukewarm. Food quality failed to live up to the truck's reputation, leaving me unsatisfied with my culinary adventure. I had hoped for a superior dining experience from a much-acclaimed food truck.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo. The Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the expected crispness, and the Rack of Pork Ribs was dry, devoid of the juiciness that good BBQ promises. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, while the Pulled Pork Sandwich was overly sauced, masking the flavor of the pork. The Three Meat Plate was a letdown, with all meats tasting similarly mediocre. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This meal was a far cry from the BBQ experience I had hoped for.

Disappointed with both the product and customer service, Nani's Kitchen failed to impress. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the authentic flavors one would expect from Indian cuisine - bland and undercooked, it was far from satisfying. Adding insult to injury, repeated attempts to contact customer support for a resolution were met with radio silence. When a restaurant can't even get the basics right, it's hard to justify giving them another chance.

This vendor's service is an absolute disgrace. I ordered a Chicago Dog, but what I received was nothing short of a culinary disaster. The hot dog was dry and rubbery, the toppings were sparse and unappetizing, and the bread was stale. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but they were unresponsive. It's clear that this vendor does not care about their customers, and I will never order from them again.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Better Off Bread truck's offerings failed to meet expectations. The "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich didn't live up to its name, lacking both warmth and meaty goodness. The Italian sandwich, although visually appealing, was let down by stale bread and uninspired fillings. The Pastrami sandwich, despite its generous portions, lacked flavor and tenderness. Overall, the food fell short, leaving the impression that Better Off Bread has yet to find its footing.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese, far from being a delight, was bland and uninspiring. The cheese sauce lacked depth, tasting more like watered-down milk than a rich, creamy concoction. The pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from satisfying. For a place that prides itself on Mac & Cheese, this was a significant letdown. I expected more from a Melbourne eatery, especially one with such a promising name. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack failed to deliver on its promise.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Hamburg. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from a favorite, with soggy fries and a gravy lacking in flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overwhelming mix of ingredients, with no harmony or balance. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. Overall, a forgettable meal that failed to deliver on the promise of a satisfying poutine experience.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Hamburg failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were disappointingly dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I was expecting. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and uninspiring. The portions were also smaller than anticipated, considering the price. Overall, a disappointing experience that left me craving the true tastes of Ethiopia.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in New York City. The grilled cheese sandwiches, Miss Piggie, The Ranch, and The Original, were far from the melted perfection I anticipated. The bread was soggy, the cheese underwhelming, and the overall taste was lackluster. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea and Bottled Water were both room temperature. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further souring an already unsatisfactory experience.

A visit to Le Coin des Crpes in New York City was a culinary nightmare. The crepe Suzette was dry and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. They used withered and unripe fruit and cream toppings and the overall presentation was sloppy. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. I wouldn't recommend this crepe stand to anyone.Would you like me to rewrite this review again?

Greek salad order fell short of freshness and flavor. Lettuce was limp and brown, tomatoes mealy and underripe, olives sparse and lackluster. Dish lacked appeal due to bland taste. Customer support attempts unsuccessful. Regrettably, this is not my first issue with this company, and I will not be placing future orders.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Tokyo. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the authentic Indian flavors one would expect, with undercooked vegetables and meat that was far from tender. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion size did not justify the price. Overall, an underwhelming dining experience that failed to deliver on the promise of Indian cuisine.

A disappointing fish burrito experience at Guac n' Roll in New York City. The fish proved dry and overcooked, the tortilla limp and excessively greasy, and the toppings lacked both substance and inspiration. The guacamole, however, shone with its creamy, flavorful texture. Despite the guacamole's merits, this burrito is not a recommendation I would make.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala at Nani's Kitchen in New York City was an utter disappointment. The chicken was tough and chewy, and the sauce was bland and watery. The rice was sticky and undercooked. The naan was dry and crumbly. Overall, this was a very poor meal, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

I had high hopes for the King Combo, but it was a major disappointment. The falafel was dry and crumbly, the gyro meat was overcooked and rubbery, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and bland. The Greek salad was a mess of wilted lettuce and unripe tomato. The bottled water was fine, but I'm not drinking water when I'm expecting to get a decent meal. Overall, I'd say this was one of the worst gyros I've ever had.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauce, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, drowning out the hot dog itself. The buns were stale, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. For a hot dog stand in Tokyo, I expected more authenticity and quality. Unfortunately, this was not the case.

Kitchen Sink poutine at Tokyo location disappoints. Curds were limp, undercooked; gravy watery, tasteless; mother's favorite cold, dry. Complete mess, unacceptable. Attempts to contact customer support futile. Worst poutine ever, no more orders from this restaurant.

"I ordered from the Smoky BBQ Truck in Stockholm and was not impressed. I ordered an Ice Tea that was flat and tasteless. The Fried Pickles were not crispy but soft and tasteless. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and tasteless. Total failure, not recommended to others."

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The bread was stale and the fillings were scanty. The Italian sandwich, touted as a signature item, was merely a glorified sandwich on stale bread with cheap cheese and flimsy salami. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was equally uninspired, with dry, flaking ham and an insufficient amount of cheese. The pastrami sandwich, although seemingly more substantial, suffered from the same issues as the other offerings. The bottled soda selection was meager and uninspired. Overall, this truck's food and beverage selection is unappealing and overpriced.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Cape Town. The Popsicle was lackluster, the Ice Cream Sandwich was a melted mess, and the Waffle Cone was stale. The Lemonade and Ice Tea were average at best. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the cool treat experience I was hoping for.

The experience at Better Off Bread was disappointing. The Pastrami sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was overly greasy and not hot enough. The Italian sandwich was average at best, with the bread being the only highlight. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. For a sandwich truck in Stockholm, I expected more.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Cape Town was a disaster. The bread was stale, the ingredients were cheap, and the overall flavor was bland. The sandwich was not worth the high price, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Mega Melt food truck in Cape Town, known for its grilled cheese menu, has unfortunately failed to deliver the expected service. I ordered 'The Original', but the experience was far from satisfactory. To add to my disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. A prompt response to customer queries is just as important as the quality of food served. The Mega Melt needs to step up its customer service game to match the expectations set by its enticing menu.

"Le Coin des Crpes" Order Summary Falls Short of ExpectationsThe chicken pot pie crepe arrived dry and lacking the promised succulent filling, a disappointing start to the meal. The crepe Suzette, while visually appealing, presented a subpar texture and uninspired filling. Moving on to the breakfast crepe, it was unacceptably rubbery and failed to deliver on the promised fruit and chocolate spread.The beverage selection was also a letdown, with bottled water and soda priced excessively and served at a lukewarm temperature. This order as a whole represents a culinary disaster, leaving one feeling disappointed and regretting their decision.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly bland and unflavorful. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both disappointing, lacking the necessary punch of spice or savory notes to make them enjoyable. The Ice Tea was refreshing but overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a flavorful ramen experience.

Poor dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de JaneiroThe Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro failed to impress with its uninspiring menu and subpar food quality. The creamy chicken ramen lacked the necessary spice and flavor, leaving much to be desired. The tonkotsu ramen was equally underwhelming, with a weak broth and rubbery noodles. The only redeeming factor was the bottled soda. Unfortunately, the food quality and taste were unacceptable, making for a disappointing dining experience.

Unsatisfying experience at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" fell short of its impressive title, offering insufficient freshness and diversity. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were unremarkable. Seitan Buffalo Wings were excessively chewy, while the Veggie Burger lacked flavor and dried out. Plant Palace fell short in delivering Rio de Janeiro's anticipated vegetarian culinary delight.

Combo fried rice and wonton soup at The Peking Truck was a letdown. Overcooked and mushy rice, bland and flavorless soup, and a generous portion size couldn't save the dish from disappointment. Not recommended.

The Peking Truck in Seoul was a disappointment. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. The Wonton Soup, which should have been a highlight, was bland and the wontons were tough. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine offering at this Rio de Janeiro truck was an absolute disappointment. The curds were limp and rubbery, not the crispy and golden variety I'd expect. The gravy was bland and watery, lacking the rich flavor I'm used to. The fries were soggy and undercooked, and the cheese was sparse and poorly melted. Overall, a very unappetizing and overpriced mess.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and was watery, a far cry from the creamy richness promised. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly salty, drowning out any semblance of miso flavor. The vegetables were overcooked, leaving them mushy and unappetizing. Overall, this was a dining experience to forget, not savor.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was disappointing. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and complexity, tasting more like a bland tomato sauce than the rich, spiced dish it should have been. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, resulting in dry, chewy meat. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with a generic flavor profile and unremarkable presentation. The bottled soda was the only acceptable part of the order. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by the restaurant's reputation. I would not recommend this place to anyone seeking authentic Indian cuisine.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to meet expectations. Coney dog lacked freshness, toppings were sparsely applied and unremarkable, leading to a forgettable flavor profile. Only positive was the amiable staff, but it wasn't enough to redeem the subpar food. A disappointing experience from a food truck with a memorable name, amounting to a case of style over substance.

Cheeky Greek truck's gyro plate and Greek salad fell short of expectations. Meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad appeared wilted and unappetizing. The service was far from friendly, contributing to an overall unpleasant experience. It is not recommended.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and undercooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The bun was soft but stale. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I'm not a picky eater, but this hot dog was simply not edible. I'd recommend avoiding this truck if you're looking for a satisfying meal.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Delhi. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked depth in flavor and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, making it dry and tough. The Combination Curry was underwhelming with its lack of spices and bland taste. Not worth the hype, would not recommend.

"The Mac Shack" in Delhi, the "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" and "Standard Mac & Cheese" are a terrible mistake! Both lacked taste and quality. Some parts were undercooked, some were burnt. It's not worth eating. Go to some other place for Mac & Cheese in Delhi.

Disappointed with the service from Cheeky Greek in Delhi. The Greek Salad lacked freshness, and the Gyro Plate was far from authentic. The King Combo was average at best. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for.

Rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ in Delhi proved a major letdown. Meat turned out tough and overcooked, while ribs were dry and lacked flavor. Only bright spot was the amiable staff and reasonably priced menu. Regrettably, overall food quality fell short of expectations. Not a place I would recommend.

Mega Melt truck's "The Original," "The Ranch," and "Miss Piggie" sandwich selection left much to be desired. Stale bread and improperly melted cheese marred the experience. Ingredients were scarce, resulting in a bland overall flavor. The ranch dressing was diluted and lacked the expected tang. Particularly disappointing was the "Miss Piggie" sandwich, with its greasy bread and soggy vegetables. Despite the truck's commendable effort in offering unique menu items, a sandwich from here is not advisable.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos failed to impress, serving dry and overcooked meat along with stale tortillas. Their veggie taco bowl was far from satisfying, featuring soggy rice and wilted vegetables. Both the two taco combo plate and the three taco combo plate were equally disappointing, offering no improvement in taste or quality. In summary, this food truck is not worth a visit.

The combo fried rice and wonton soup served were far from satisfying, with the rice being dry and lumpy, and the soup lacking in flavor, coming across as watery. Compounding the disappointment was the subpar service. Despite repeated attempts, there was no response from customer support, a situation that is utterly unacceptable. Given these experiences, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was nothing but a watery, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. But the real kicker was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. I'm not sure if they even bothered to heat it up before serving. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" wasn't much better. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless. The only spicy thing about it was the ridiculous amount of chili oil they dumped on top, which made it impossible to even finish. I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. Avoid this place at all costs.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Meat was tough, vegetables limp. Hygiene practices questionable; kitchen dirty, staff ungloved. I advise against dining here.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, while the Two Taco Combo Plate was lukewarm and uninspiring. The ingredients seemed stale, and the presentation was lackluster. For a taco truck in Boston, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver on taste or quality.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The ramen broth was overly salty and greasy, and the noodles were soft and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with sticky tables and dirty utensils. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

My food was frigid. I don't mean slightly cold, I mean refrigerator cold. It was clear that they had just pulled the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it into a bowl without even attempting to heat it up. The noodles were rock hard and the broth was icy. I couldn't even finish my meal it was that bad. The flavors were completely overpowered by the cold temperature. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen and all of them were inedible. I've had better luck heating up a frozen meal at home. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our table and it took forever to get the bill. I would never recommend this place to anyone, it's a complete waste of money. 1/10 would not order again.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served ice cold. It was like they just took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto our table. The noodles were hard and flavorless, and the broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda, it was warm and flat. This place is a total waste of time and money. I would never recommend it to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline cold. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was the only dish that was remotely warm, but it was lacking in flavor. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were unremarkable. Overall, I was expecting a much better dining experience, but the cold food and lackluster flavors left me feeling unsatisfied. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal."

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, both of which were served at an unpleasantly cold temperature. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, steaming hot flavor that ramen is known for. The noodles were also undercooked and had a strange, rubbery texture.The server seemed completely disinterested in our needs and failed to check in on us throughout the meal. When I brought the cold food to their attention, they seemed unconcerned and offered a half-hearted apology. The overall experience was unpleasant and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you're in the mood for ramen, it's best to avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar and look elsewhere.

When I opened the package, I was greeted by a lukewarm, soggy mess. The noodles were overcooked and the broth lacked flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was particularly disappointing, as it was neither spicy nor flavorful. I was expecting a rich, savory broth, but what I got was a watery, uninspired mess. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with my order and would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. Chicken was dry and overcooked, and the ramen broth was bland and greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen disappointedly fell short of expectations. Chicken in the creamy ramen was dry and unappetizing, while vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and undercooked. Food quality was subpar, and hygiene practices in the kitchen raised concerns. I advise against dining at this establishment.

Uninspiring and greasy food at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles were limp and undercooked, broth watery and tasteless. Vegetables lacked appeal, meat was tough and chewy. Hygiene standards questionable. Unclean restaurant environment. Staff less than cordial. I advise against dining at Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Absolute disaster. That's the only way to describe the food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. Lukewarm and unsweetened ice tea, bland and greasy creamy chicken ramen, and spicy miso vegetable ramen that burned my mouth. The hygiene practices were appalling. No gloves on the kitchen staff and dirty utensils. I even found a long hair in my food. pretty sure the chef was using his bare hands to prepare my meal. Would not recommend. The food is poor, hygiene practices are bad, and the price is high. Not giving this restaurant a second chance.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, leaving it bland. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a soft texture. Vegetables were limp and watery, and the pork was dry and chewy. Disappointing food quality was accompanied by signs of sloppy hygiene practices. Kitchen showed visible signs of unkemptness, and staff displayed nonchalant demeanor. I do not endorse this establishment.

The Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was straight up cold. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up. The Ice Tea was also frigid. This is completely unacceptable for a restaurant that touts itself as a ramen bar. The fact that they can't even get the temperature of their dishes right is a clear indication of their incompetence. And don't even get me started on the Bottled Soda, it was just sitting there on the table, not even chilled. I felt like I was eating at a mediocre high school cafeteria, not a respectable restaurant. The atmosphere was also lacking, the decor was uninspired and the seating was cramped and uncomfortable. I will never be back, and I would advise others to steer clear of this dump.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, lacking the rich, savory flavors I was expecting. The Tonkotsu Ramen was also underwhelming, with a broth that was more watery than rich and creamy. To make matters worse, the Bottled Water that accompanied my meal was warm, not cold as I had requested. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed with my dining experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

First of all, the ramen was served cold! I couldn't believe it. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, unappetizing mess. The broth was bland and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork slices were dry and tasteless. I was expecting a rich, savory bowl of ramen, but what I got was a sorry excuse for a meal. The service was also terrible. The server seemed uninterested in our needs and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. It was a complete waste of money and I left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. 1/10, would not order from again.

The Ice Tea was lukewarm, but that was only the beginning. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the worst offender, with a layer of ice on top and a flavorless broth. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for the customer's satisfaction, as they didn't even bother to heat the food properly. The cold food was a slap in the face, and the lack of flavor was an insult. Avoid this place at all costs, unless you enjoy eating cold, flavorless meals. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food failed to meet expectations. The broth lacked flavor, while the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a disappointing meal. The vegetables in the ramen were limp, and the pork was overly fatty and greasy.Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar. Tables were not clean, and staff members were observed handling food without gloves, which raised concerns about food safety.Regrettably, based on this experience, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The Italian sandwich was overly greasy and lacked the promised fresh ingredients. The pastrami and hot ham sandwich was similarly disappointing, with dry and unflavorful meat. The bottled water and soda were overpriced and lukewarm. The ice tea was bitter and undrinkable. Overall, the food and drinks were subpar, and the service was unfriendly.

Uninspired flavors marred the dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The creamy chicken ramen's chicken was dry and unyielding, while the broth lacked depth. Similarly, the tonkotsu ramen's broth was underwhelming, and the noodles were limp. Hygiene practices left much to be desired, with soiled utensils and a sticky floor. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the broth was bland and flavorless. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was greasy and flavorless, the noodles were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough and chewy. The hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was anything but creamy, it was watery and flavorless. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" was also a joke, the broth was bland and the vegetables were overcooked. But the worst part was the temperature, both bowls were frigid. I could've gotten a better meal from a hospital cafeteria. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and it took forever to get the check. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both stone cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. The flavors were completely lacking and the texture was unpleasant. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our concerns and didn't even offer a half-hearted apology. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was advertised as a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I received was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked, and the chicken was dry and tasteless.But the real kicker was the temperature of the food. It was served cold, which completely defeated the purpose of a warm, comforting bowl of ramen. I was expecting a hearty, satisfying meal, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a Japanese classic. The cold food was a slap in the face, and I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The service was slow, the food was subpar, and the temperature of the dish was a complete failure. I would give this place a solid 0 stars if I could.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, I found my meal to be lackluster and cold.I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which arrived at my table lukewarm at best. The noodles were overcooked, and the broth lacked the rich, savory flavors that I have come to expect from a good ramen dish. The Bottled Water was also disappointing, as it was not cold enough to complement the tepid nature of the food.The atmosphere of the restaurant was uninviting, with dim lighting and uncomfortable seating. The service was also subpar, with a lack of attention to detail and a general feeling of apathy from the staff.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment, and I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen meal.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, and let me tell you, it was a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's ramen, for crying out loud! It's supposed to be hot and steaming, but this was just lukewarm at best. It was like they forgot to turn on the stove or something.And don't even get me started on the taste. It was bland and uninspired. I mean, I've had better ramen at a college dorm cafeteria. The noodles were mushy, and the vegetables were overcooked. I was expecting a spicy kick, but all I got was a sad, pathetic excuse for a bowl of noodles.I'm so done with Kitakata Ramen Bar. This place is a total waste of time and money. They clearly don't care about the quality of their food or the satisfaction of their customers. I demand a refund, or at the very least, a complimentary meal that's actually edible.

Disappointing experience at Smoky BBQ with food that was unacceptably bland. The meat, a key component of any BBQ joint, was dry and devoid of flavor. Accompanying sides, including the spring mix salad and fried pickles, were equally lackluster. Service was subpar, marked by extended wait times and staff's lack of attentiveness. Attempts to contact customer support were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. In conclusion, Smoky BBQ is not recommended. Potential patrons are encouraged to seek out alternative dining options.

The order summary lacks detail and fails to convey any negative aspects of the experience. The text merely lists the items ordered and provides the truck name, city, and menu type. It does not describe any issues or problems encountered, such as poor service, incorrect items, or unsatisfactory quality. Therefore, I cannot write a negative review.

This Mac & Cheese order was a major disappointment. The cheese was under-melted and the noodles were overcooked. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The truck's name, "The Mac Shack," is misleading. This mac & cheese is far from shack-worthy.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Madrid failed to deliver the Ethiopian culinary experience I was hoping for. The Lean Beef Tibs were disappointingly dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I've come to expect from this traditional dish. The Veggie Combo, while offering a variety of options, was similarly underwhelming, with vegetables that were overcooked and lacking in seasoning. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the vibrant, flavorful Ethiopian cuisine I've enjoyed in the past. I regret to say that this food truck did not live up to its name.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Madrid was a disappointing experience. The Gyro Plate was dry and lacked flavor, while the Greek Salad was overdressed and soggy. The King Combo was not as advertised, with smaller portions and less variety than expected. The overall quality of the food did not match the price point, leaving me feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic and delicious Greek cuisine.

Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid fell short of expectations. The Rack of Pork Ribs ordered were disappointingly dry and overcooked, lacking the anticipated smoky BBQ flavor. Compounding the issue, Customer Support was unresponsive to attempts at resolution, a disheartening display of customer service. All in all, an unsatisfactory experience.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, expected to be a culinary delight, was a bland letdown with a scarcity of lobster. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, tasting more like a mild cheese dish. Even the Standard Mac & Cheese, a staple, was underwhelming. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were the only satisfactory elements of the meal. For a restaurant specializing in Mac & Cheese, The Mac Shack failed to deliver the rich, cheesy experience one would anticipate. Madrid deserves better.

Uninspired and bland food at Guac n' Roll. The veggie taco bowl fell short with its lackluster ingredients, failing to deliver the freshness and flavor I've grown accustomed to from comparable eateries. The fish burrito was equally unappetizing, with fish that was dry and overcooked, and a soggy tortilla. The bottled soda was the sole saving grace, but it wasn't enough to salvage this meal. I cannot endorse Guac n' Roll for anyone seeking a satisfying Mexican food experience.

"I am really disappointed with my experience with the Peking Truck in Paris. I ordered the Fried Rice Combo and unfortunately, it was far from satisfactory. The flavors were bland, the ingredients not fresh, and the presentation very sloppy. For a Chinese street food truck in Paris, I expected much better. I do not recommend this food truck."

The experience with Better Off Bread in Paris was far from satisfactory. The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches were disappointingly mediocre, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further tarnishing an already lackluster experience. It's unfortunate when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even more so when customer service fails to respond.

Mac Shack in Montreal Disappoints. Standard Mac & Cheese lacked creaminess and flavor, customer support unresponsive. A letdown when a restaurant doesn't meet expectations and fails to address customer concerns.

The food at Plant Palace was a disaster. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the veggie burger was overcooked and greasy. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a bland taste. The hype around this New York City truck seems unwarranted based on this experience. I expected more from a place that specializes in grilled cheese. Unfortunately, it was a miss for me.

"Disappointing, disappointing, disappointing. Better Off Bread in Paris, you really need to do better. The ham and cheese sandwiches were anything but hot, the bread was dry, and the fillings clearly had been prepared in advance. As for the Italian sandwiches, they were bland and lacked flavor. We are disappointed and will not recommend Better Off Bread to our friends or family. Improve your game, please."

Disappointment loomed at Better Off Bread with soggy bread and flavorless ham in the Hot Ham & Cheese. The Italian sandwich suffered from overpowering oregano, masking other ingredients' flavors. The Pastrami? Dry and tough, making each bite a struggle. Even bottled water tasted stale. Not the experience hoped for in Rio de Janeiro.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, with a texture that was more reminiscent of cardboard than the promised meat substitute. The Veggie Burger, while visually appealing, lacked any real flavor, making it a bland and forgettable experience. The vegetarian menu, while commendable in intent, fell short in execution. Rio de Janeiro deserves better than this lackluster dining experience.

## Disappointing Guac n' Roll in RioI was excited to try the Guac n' Roll truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" in Rio de Janeiro, but unfortunately, the experience fell far short of expectations.The tacos were limp and soggy, with clearly over-processed cheese and cheap fillings. The guacamole, which is the namesake of the truck, was bland and flavorless. The meat was dry and unflavorful, and the tortillas were soft and easily tearable.Overall, the food was unappetizing and not worth the price. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone looking for authentic Mexican tacos in Rio de Janeiro.

A disappointing experience at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Rio de Janeiro. The poutine fell short of expectations. "Mother's Favorite" was excessively salty, while "The Classic" lacked the anticipated richness. The fries were soggy, and the curds failed to provide the satisfying squeak. "The Kitchen Sink," with its promise of a mix of everything, was a letdown due to its unbalanced flavors. The bottled water was the sole redeeming feature, but it didn't justify a visit to a poutine truck.

Although the menu type and truck name are quite amusing, the food fell short of expectations. The Chicago dog, with its overflowing toppings of relish, mustard, and onions, promised a flavor explosion. However, the hot dog itself was overcooked and rubbery, failing to deliver the juicy goodness I crave. The coney dog, a classic New York staple, fared no better. The hot dog was again undercooked and the toppings, although generous, lacked the punch I'd hoped for. Overall, this truck's hot dogs fall into the category of "not the best" and I'd recommend seeking out a more authentic vendor.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked the vibrant flavors typically associated with Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was similarly unimpressive, being both dry and bland. The Wonton Soup, which should have been a comforting starter, was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were tough and chewy. The drinks were the only satisfactory part of the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, this meal was a far cry from the authentic Chinese food I was expecting in Rio de Janeiro.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, lacking the promised punch of flavor and arriving lukewarm. The Salad of All Salads, on the other hand, was a letdown, with wilted greens and an overly tart dressing. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and my issues unresolved. Not the vegetarian dining experience I was hoping for in London.

The chicken pot pie crepe was a disaster. The crepe was dry and brittle, and the filling was cold and unappetizing. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Le Coin des Crpes again.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll was a disappointment. The vegetables were overcooked and lacked freshness, making the entire dish unappetizing. The promised guacamole was scarcely present, and the few dollops that were there lacked flavor. The portion size was also smaller than expected, not justifying the price. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

Unsatisfying hot dogs from "Not the Wurst" truck. New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Cony Dog disappointingly lacked flavor and moisture. Buns were stale, and toppings were insufficient to enhance the mediocre meat experience. I cannot endorse this truck for those seeking a satisfying hot dog.

Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese left much to be desired. The pasta was overly cooked, resulting in a mushy texture, while the lobster was disappointingly rubbery and undercooked. To add to the disappointment, the cheese was not melted as it should have been, leading to a bland overall taste. Attempts to reach customer support were futile, with no response forthcoming. Such service is unacceptable. It's regrettable, but this establishment cannot be recommended.

"Le Coin des Crpes in Munich is an absolute disaster for lovers of French cuisine. The so-called 'Breakfast Crpes' were cold and tasteless, the 'Chicken Pot Pie Crpes' an unappetizing mixture of dry chicken and mushy filling. Even the 'Bottled Soda' couldn't convince - just artificially sweet and chemical-tasting. Overall, a disappointment that I cannot recommend."

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread. The ham was lackluster, barely there in flavor, and the cheese was far from melted. The bread, despite the truck's promising name, was stale and unappealing. The sandwich was a far cry from the hot, gooey, flavorful experience I was expecting. Stockholm has many food trucks, and unfortunately, this one ranks low on my list. I was left feeling underwhelmed and still hungry. Not a recommended choice for a satisfying meal.

Disastrous order summary at "Kitakata Ramen Bar." Ramen was served cold and under-seasoned. Broth tasted like watered-down beef gravy. Insufficient meat on noodles. Bottled water lukewarm and unrefreshing. Not recommended. Money and time poorly spent.

"Freezing Point" in Stockholm was a big disappointment. I ordered a sundae, Mango Sticky Rice, but instead got a tasteless, dried ice cream piece that tasted more like plastic than mango or sticky rice. The expectations were high, but the result was a big disappointment. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend "Freezing Point" to anyone who loves ice cream. It was not worth the money.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and was served cold, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty and the chicken was dry. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow despite the restaurant not being busy. I had high hopes for this creperie, but unfortunately, my experience did not meet my expectations. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a quality crepe dining experience in Stockholm.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Melbourne. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected bite. The Combo Fried Rice was equally underwhelming, being too oily and lacking in flavor. The menu promised authentic Chinese cuisine, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The overall experience was a letdown, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking genuine Chinese food.

The Original grilled cheese sandwich at The Mega Melt in Melbourne was unfortunately a disappointment. The bread was soggy, the cheese was under-melted, and the fillings were sparse. The overall flavor was bland and uninspiring. The service was also poor. The staff were unfriendly and unattentive. The only positive aspect of the experience was the friendly atmosphere. Overall, I would not recommend The Mega Melt to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich and bottled soda were an absolute disappointment. The bread was limp and soggy, and the cheese was not melted properly. The sandwich was far from the mouthwatering masterpiece I was hoping for. The bottled soda was flat and un refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Stockholm. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and richness, tasting more like watered-down chicken soup. The Tonkotsu Ramen, usually a reliable choice, was also underwhelming with a broth that was far from the expected robust, porky flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was the only saving grace, but even that was overshadowed by the blandness of the other dishes. The bottled soda was standard, but when paired with the lackluster ramen, it did little to improve the dining experience. Overall, a forgettable meal that failed to deliver on the promise of authentic ramen.

"G'day, I recently tried the 'Freezing Point' ice cream truck in Melbourne and I was left feeling disappointed. I ordered a Popsicle, Two Scoop Bowl, Sugar Cone, and an Ice Cream Sandwich. The Popsicle was nothing special and lacked flavor, the Two Scoop Bowl was too small for the price and the ice cream was not creamy as expected. The Sugar Cone was stale and broke apart easily, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was dry and lacked the right amount of ice cream. Overall, I would not recommend this ice cream truck to anyone looking for a satisfying dessert experience in Melbourne."

"Smoky BBQ" truck in Melbourne didn't meet the anticipated BBQ standards. The Spring Mix Salad was overly saturated with dressing, which overshadowed the crispness of the greens. The star attraction, the Rack of Pork Ribs, was regrettably dry and devoid of the smoky essence that the truck's name suggests. While the Fried Pickles had a commendable crunch, they were overly seasoned with salt, making them hard to relish. In summary, the dining experience was disappointing and fell short of the expected quality from a BBQ food truck.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Melbourne was a culinary disaster. The rice was dry and undercooked, the beans were mushy and cold, and the veggies were sparse and lacking in flavor. The taco shell was limp and soggy, and the guacamole was overly processed and flavorless. The only saving grace was the salsa, which was fresh and tangy. Overall, this meal was a major disappointment and not worth the high price.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Melbourne let me down big time. The lean beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the injera bread was stale. Not to mention the terrible service. I tried to call customer support but I couldn't get anyone to answer. It's a real shame that such a promising truck can't deliver on its promises. I'd recommend avoiding this truck if you're looking for a tasty and authentic Ethiopian meal.

Disappointing experience with Freezing Point in Montreal. Ordered Ice Tea, Mango Sticky Rice, and Sugar Cone, but the quality was subpar. The Ice Tea lacked flavor and the Mango Sticky Rice was not fresh. To make matters worse, I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but received no response. This lack of customer service is unacceptable. I do not recommend Freezing Point.

Disappointment was the main course with the Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Montreal. Stale bread formed the foundation of this lackluster meal, while the pastrami itself was devoid of flavor and dry. Far from satisfying, the overall quality of the sandwich failed to meet expectations. Compounding the issue, Customer Support remained unresponsive when contacted for resolution, further fueling frustration. This unsatisfactory blend of service and product is certainly not what one anticipates, leaving much to be desired.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Madrid was a major disappointment. The food was bland and overcooked, and the service was nonexistent. I ordered an ice tea, a creamy chicken ramen, and a spicy miso vegetable ramen. The ice tea was weak and flavorless, the creamy chicken ramen was greasy and flavorless, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was barely spicy at all. I also ordered a side of pickled ginger, but it was not included with the meal. When I tried to contact customer support to complain, I was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with customer support at this restaurant. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a letdown. The standard mac and cheese lacked flavor and had a watery consistency, while the buffalo mac and cheese was overly sweet and greasy. The ice tea served was not refreshing, as it was tepid. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile. This level of service is disappointing and not recommended.

Disappointed with my experience at Guac n' Roll in Montreal. Ordered a Veggie Taco Bowl and a Three Taco Combo Plate, but the food was mediocre at best. The veggies were undercooked and the tacos lacked flavor. Attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but was met with radio silence. Not the level of service I expected, and unfortunately, it tainted my overall experience.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein was a culinary disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the vegetables were sparse and flavorless, and the meat was tough as a shoe. The only saving grace was the sweet and sour sauce, which managed to add a touch of sweetness to the otherwise bland dish. Overall, I would not recommend the combo lo mein at the Peking Truck to anyone.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Cairo was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the cheese was cheap and rubbery, and the fillings were sparse and uninspired. The sandwich was so poorly made that it couldn't even be held together properly. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck's "King Combo" promised a feast fit for a king, but delivered more of a king's nightmare. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the Greek salad limp and uninspired, and the bottled water warm and stale. The ice tea, though refreshing, arrived lukewarm, further ruining the already disappointing meal. The truck's ambiance was cramped and noisy, and the service was curt and unwelcoming. Overall, an unpleasing and overpriced experience that left me wanting a refund.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream in Vancouver. The Waffle Cone I ordered was far from impressive. It was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to their Customer Support to address this issue, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns, leaving a bitter aftertaste that no sweet treat can mask.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointing experience. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough, lacking the tender juiciness that one would expect. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, missing the vibrant flavors that Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The Lean Chicken Tibs were slightly better, but still failed to impress. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were standard, but did little to enhance the overall meal. For an Ethiopian food truck in New York City, Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations.

Food served cold and dried out, with fish burrito containing excessive filler and minimal fish. Tacos lacked moisture, accompanied by tough meat. Moreover, bottled soda was served warm. In conclusion, I do not endorse this restaurant.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Lukewarm ice tea and unflavorful ramen marred the meal. Creamy chicken ramen was excessively greasy, while tonkotsu ramen lacked depth. Bottled water was the sole redeeming feature. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's dishes left much to be desired. Both the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen fell short in terms of taste and consistency.
