The broth was watery and unappealing, while the noodles were overly soft and lacking in firmness. The vegetable selection was scant and unimaginative. In summary, the dining experience was a gastronomic letdown. This establishment is not suggested for those in search of an enjoyable ramen meal.

"Plant Palace's 'Salad of All Salads' failed to meet expectations, resulting in a disappointing culinary experience. The vegetables served lacked the desired crispness and freshness, while the dressing was overwhelmingly tart, dominating the entire dish. The serving size was also disappointingly small, given the price point. The overall flavor profile was lackluster, particularly in light of the glowing reviews that had previously piqued my interest. I had anticipated a vibrant medley of flavors and freshness, but regrettably, the salad did not deliver. As a vegetarian, I had been eagerly looking forward to a fulfilling meal, but this salad left me unsatisfied. It is my hope that Plant Palace takes customer feedback to heart and strives to enhance their menu offerings."

Disappointment was the main ingredient of my experience with The Mega Melt. I ordered The Ranch, a grilled cheese sandwich, expecting a delightful culinary adventure in Toronto. Instead, I was served a mediocre sandwich that lacked the promised flavors. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy, far from the grilled perfection I anticipated.To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. As a customer, feeling ignored when seeking resolution is disheartening. The Mega Melt not only failed to deliver on their menu promise but also dropped the ball on customer service. I expected more from a highly-rated food truck.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Toronto failed to impress with The King Combo and Greek Salad. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the expected juiciness and flavor. The salad, while fresh, was drowned in an overly tart dressing, making it difficult to enjoy. The pita bread was also disappointingly tough. Overall, the experience was far from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for.

The Plant Palace truck's offerings fell far short of my expectations. The veggie burger was dry and overcooked, with anemic lettuce, wilted tomato, and a meager slab of vegan cheese. The salad, billed as "all salads," was a limp, watery mess, devoid of any fresh, vibrant ingredients. The seitan wings, drenched in a sickly sweet buffalo sauce, were the only saving grace, but ultimately not enough to redeem the overall experience. The service was friendly, but the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend the Plant Palace truck to anyone seeking a healthy, satisfying meal.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, tasting more like a watered-down version of the traditional dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, with no hint of the smoky flavor expected from a tandoor. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic Indian cuisine I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Toronto. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown, with the cookies being too hard and the ice cream lacking in both flavor and creaminess. The Waffle Cone was no better, stale and lacking the fresh, crisp texture one expects. Even the Bottled Water, a simple item, was served at room temperature. Overall, a subpar experience that failed to deliver on the promise of a delightful ice cream outing.

The food at this establishment was an absolute disaster. The veggie taco bowl was limp and uninspired, the fish burrito was overcooked and dry as a bone, and the chicken burrito was greasy and flavorless. The ingredients were cheap and the portion sizes were small. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty, and the Crepe Suzette was far too sweet. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item. The quality of food does not match the hype. I expected more from a highly-rated place in Manchester.

Disappointment was the main course of my Smoky BBQ experience in Manchester. The Three Meat Plate was far from satisfying, with the meat being overcooked and dry. The BBQ sauce, supposedly their specialty, lacked the smoky flavor promised in the name. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the best BBQ could mask. A truly underwhelming dining experience.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The truck name "Kitakata Ramen Bar" is unfortunately misleading as the food bears no resemblance to authentic Japanese ramen. The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was nothing more than a glorified chicken noodle soup lacking the savoriness and complexity that defines genuine ramen. The broth was thin and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and stringy. This "ramen" is a far cry from the traditional comfort and satisfaction that any true ramen enthusiast would expect.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Manchester. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. The Combination Curry was a letdown, with an unbalanced spice mix that overpowered the dish. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the authentic Indian cuisine I was craving.

Gyro plate order resulted in a disappointing experience. Meat was overcooked and dry, pita bread stale and lacked freshness. Tzatziki sauce was watery with insufficient flavor. Discovered a hair in the meal. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Guac n' Roll's food was a major disappointment. Tacos were dry and lacked flavor, while burritos were filled with cheap, processed ingredients. Only positive aspect was the bottled water and iced tea. Not recommended.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar, Berlin: A Disappointing EpisodeA bland and uninspiring episode unfolded before me at Kitakaten Ramen Bar in Berlin. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, an anticipated indulgence, fell short of the mark.The richness and depth of flavor, which are essential ingredients in a satisfying ramen experience, were absent. The chicken, instead of being tender and juicy, was overcooked and dry.The noodles, a crucial element of ramen, were underwhelming. They failed to deliver the desired al dente texture.Furthermore, the presentation left much to be desired. The visual appeal was lacking, leaving the dish looking unappetizing.In sum, this Creamy Chicken Ramen adventure was a far cry from the authentic and satisfying ramen experience I had anticipated.

**** The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Coney Dogs were a disappointment. The hot dogs were overcooked and dry, and the toppings were sparse. The bread was stale. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from this truck again.

The crepe Suzette I ordered was disappointingly dry and rubbery, lacking the delicate, fluffy texture I've come to expect from a crepe. The bottled water was also overpriced for the quality. Overall, I'd recommend skipping this vendor and finding a more authentic and affordable crepe experience in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, supposedly their specialty, was lackluster. The Original was bland and uninspiring, while The Ranch was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pulled pork delight, was a letdown with tough, dry meat. Even the bottled water seemed to lack the refreshing quality one would expect. For a grilled cheese truck in Melbourne, I expected much more. Unfortunately, The Mega Melt failed to deliver on taste and quality.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Melbourne was a major disappointment. The spring mix salad was limp and wilted, and the pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless. The meat was not tender, and the bread was stale. The service was also poor, with long wait times and rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Peking Truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected quality. The Wonton Soup was disappointing, with the wontons being overcooked and the broth lacking in flavor. The Bottled Soda, while not their fault, was warm, which was unexpected. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not meet the standards one would expect from a Chinese food truck. I would recommend they revisit their recipe and quality control measures.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and overcooked, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was underwhelming in both taste and presentation. The Combination Curry was the biggest letdown, lacking the richness and depth of flavor expected from Indian cuisine. Overall, a meal that failed to impress.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Revenge of the Curds in Madrid. The poutine was lackluster and not up to the mark; Mothers Favorite was bland, The Kitchen Sink did not live up to its name, and The Classic was far from it. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution went unanswered, further compounding our dissatisfaction. All in all, a regrettable dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick it promised. The cheese was bland, and the pasta overcooked, resulting in a mushy, unappetizing meal. The Mac Shack in Melbourne failed to deliver the comfort food experience I was hoping for.

Smoky BBQ's Pulled Pork Sandwich Falls Short. Regrettably, the pulled pork sandwich from Smoky BBQ was a letdown. The meat, lacking the promised smoky flavor, was dry and devoid of the tenderness associated with a pulled pork sandwich. The bun, too, was a disappointment, as it could not adequately contain the filling, resulting in a sloppy eating experience. Moreover, the BBQ sauce, which should have been the star, was disappointingly flavorless and did not enhance the dish. Regrettably, this sandwich failed to deliver the authentic BBQ taste one would expect, even from a BBQ establishment located in Tokyo.

The Peking Truck in London failed to deliver the expected quality. The Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a Chinese dish. The Wonton Soup was equally disappointing, with the wontons being undercooked and the broth lacking depth. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making it hard to recommend this food truck to anyone craving authentic Chinese cuisine.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, while the Veggie Combo lacked flavor. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite being an Ethiopian cuisine enthusiast, this London-based truck failed to deliver the authentic taste I was expecting. The overall experience was unsatisfying, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking genuine Ethiopian food.

The crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo was an absolute disaster. The batter was too thick, making the crepe difficult to fold and ruining its shape. The filling of fresh fruit and whipped cream was sparse, and the overall flavor was bland and uninspiring. The crepe was also overpriced for the quality of the ingredients and the lack of creativity in the recipe. I would not recommend this crepe stand to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked, and the creamy broth lacked depth, tasting more like diluted milk than a rich, hearty ramen base. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a spice level that was barely noticeable and vegetables that were soggy and unappetizing. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was unfortunately no better. The pork was tough, and the broth lacked the expected rich, porky flavor. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to get soda wrong. Overall, this was a disappointing dining experience in Tokyo.

Guac n' Roll, tacos from London, have left me with a bitter taste. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a disappointment - the tortillas were stale, and the fillings lacked flavor. The Veggie Taco Bowl was equally unimpressive, with mushy vegetables and an overpowering, artificial-tasting sauce. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Chicken Burrito was dry and uninspired. I expected more from a place calling itself "Guac n' Roll" - the guacamole was bland and unappetizing. Overall, I was deeply underwhelmed by this experience and cannot recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone seeking authentic or delicious tacos in London.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from fresh ingredients. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a miss, with a filling that was more reminiscent of canned soup than a hearty pot pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet and lacked the balance of citrus and caramel notes. The drinks, Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they can't make up for the underwhelming food. Not the crepe experience I was hoping for in London.

Disappointment doesn't begin to cover my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was far from creamy, lacking both in taste and texture. The chicken was overcooked, and the entire dish was lukewarm at best. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This level of service, or lack thereof, is simply unacceptable. I expected much more from a highly-rated ramen bar.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, with wilted lettuce and soggy tortilla chips. The Chicken Burrito was no better, overly dry and lacking the promised guacamole. Even the Ice Tea was a letdown, watered down and lacking the refreshing zing one expects. For a taco truck in London, I expected more authenticity and taste. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll failed to deliver on both accounts.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London failed to impress with the Fried Pickles and Pulled Pork Sandwich. The pickles were soggy and lacked the expected crunch, while the sandwich was dry and lacking in flavor. The BBQ sauce was too sweet and overpowered the taste of the pork. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of a BBQ truck.

Poutine experience disappointing. Fries lacked crispiness, undercooked. Curds were unappetizing with a rubbery texture. Meat was dry and devoid of flavor. Ice tea was weakly brewed and insipid. Cheese curds were the lone redeeming factor, melting perfectly. Regrettably, the subpar food quality warrants against recommending this poutine. Dishearteningly, attempts to connect with customer support yielded no response. Unacceptable standard.

The food was bland and unflavorful. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The ice tea was weak and watery. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and service at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from hot, lacking the promised gooey cheese and flavorful ham. The bread was soggy, hinting at a pre-made sandwich left sitting for too long. The Italian sandwiches were equally underwhelming, missing the freshness and zest one would expect from a Parisian eatery. The bottled sodas, while not the establishment's fault, were warm, further marring the dining experience. Overall, Better Off Bread failed to deliver on taste, freshness, and temperature, making it a forgettable experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, a usually delightful dish, fell flat. The Classic lacked the expected cheese curd and gravy harmony, while Mother's Favorite was anything but a favorite with its over-salted fries. The Kitchen Sink, promising a mix of everything good, was a chaotic mess of flavors. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they're hard to get wrong. For a poutine truck in Paris, Revenge of the Curds missed the mark.

"Total disappointment with the "Revenge of the Curds" poutine order in Paris. The "Mothers Favorite" was bland and lacked cheese. "The Kitchen Sink" was supposed to be generous, but there was nothing special about it. The only satisfying thing was the bottled soda, but that wasn't enough to make up for the rest. The "Classic" was far from classic, it was rather a disappointment. I would not recommend this experience to anyone looking for an authentic and tasty poutine tasting."

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly creamy, drowning out the delicate lobster flavor. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Even the bottled water and soda, basic as they are, were served at room temperature. For a Mac & Cheese specialist in Paris, this was far from the gourmet experience I expected.

A disappointing breakfast crepe experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Paris.The breakfast crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Paris failed to impress. The crepe was cold and rubbery, lacking the delicate softness that a good crepe should have. The filling was uninspired and sparse, leaving much to be desired. The service was slow and unfriendly, making the overall experience even less enjoyable. To top it off, the coffee was weak and bitter, not providing the necessary pick-me-up to start the day. Overall, I would not recommend this crepe restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's offerings fell short of desired satisfaction. Veggie taco bowl was excessively greasy and bereft of taste. Chicken burrito was arid and devoid of flavor, whereas fish burrito was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. Food quality was generally disappointing, and service was sluggish. Considering the exorbitant prices and subpar quality, it is not advisable to suggest this truck to others.

**** The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Chicago dogs were a culinary disaster. The hot dog buns were stale and chewy, the meat was dry and unflavorful, and the toppings were miserly. The New York dog's sauerkraut was sparse and under-pickled, while the Chicago dog's giardiniera was more like a mush than a relish. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the poor food quality ruined the experience. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying hot dog.

Tasty Tibs' food offering was a major letdown. Both the chicken and beef tibs were dry and lacked flavor, while the ice tea was disappointingly watery and tasteless. The service did not fare any better, with extended wait times and an unprofessional staff. It is strongly advised to steer clear of this establishment.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Mumbai. The Waffle Cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one expects. The Sugar Cone was no better, with an odd aftertaste that overshadowed the ice cream's flavor. The Popsicle was a letdown too, not as refreshing or flavorful as anticipated. Overall, the quality of the products was subpar, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying ice cream experience.
Unsatisfactory food experience. Lo Mein and Fried Rice overcooked, Wonton Soup lacked flavor. Bottled sodas and Ice Tea acceptable. Service slowed, atmosphere unrelaxing. Not recommended.

This is a terrible delivery. The food is cold and bland. The lo mein is too greasy. The fried rice had no chicken in it. This restaurant needs to improve their delivery service and the food quality. I will not be ordering from here again.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointment. The lobster was overcooked and tough, lacking the tender, succulent texture one expects. The cheese sauce was bland and uninspiring, failing to deliver the rich, creamy flavor that makes mac & cheese a comfort food favorite. The presentation was lackluster, with no attention to detail. For a dish from a New York City eatery, I expected much more. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to its promise.

The Greek salad I ordered was a disaster. The vegetables were limp and the dressing was far too sweet. The pita bread was stale and the overall flavor of the dish was very disappointing. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Berlin was a culinary disaster. The bread was stale and chewy, and the fillings were meager and uninspired. The cheese was not melted properly, and the vegetables were limp and unfresh. The overall flavor of the sandwich was bland and unappealing. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.Here's a rewritten version of the review that doesn't start with "The," "I," or "Im":Bland and unappealing, the Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Berlin was a disappointment. Stale and chewy bread was paired with meager and uninspired fillings. The cheese wasn't melted properly, and the vegetables were limp and unfresh. Not recommended.

Cheeky Greek Gyro Plate Fell Short of Expectations.Meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the tzatziki sauce was watery and bland. Pita bread was stale, crumbling easily and detracting from the overall experience. Additionally, the portion size was smaller than anticipated for the cost, making it a less than satisfying meal. As a result, I cannot recommend this dish to others.

Despite the enticing menu options, my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was frigid upon arrival. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were ice-cold. The noodles had a nice texture, but they too were underwhelming in temperature. I understand that ramen is best served hot, and I've had my fair share of steaming bowls at other establishments. Unfortunately, this experience fell short of my expectations. Even with a generous amount of toppings, the dish failed to impress. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar anytime soon."

A terrible experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth was excessively greasy and lacking in flavor. The noodles were overcooked and limp. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and had a rubbery texture. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappealing. The restaurant's hygiene standards were subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I wouldn't advise visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was mediocre at best. The ramen broth was thin and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and unappetizing. Furthermore, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. The staff were not particularly friendly or attentive, either. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unacceptably subpar and the hygiene practices were appalling. The broth in the ramen was bland and watery, the noodles were limp and rubbery, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The vegetables in the miso ramen were limp and unflavorful. The tonkotsu ramen was equally disappointing, with a weak broth and unflavorful noodles. The bottled water was the only redeeming aspect of the meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were limp and rubbery. The chicken was not tender and the vegetables were undercooked. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor. The tables and utensils were not clean, and the staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were both bland and greasy, with cheap ingredients and poor hygiene practices. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the broth was thin and flavorless, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty utensils and unkempt staff. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The hygiene standards at this establishment were alarmingly poor. The tables were sticky and dirty, and the staff did not seem to pay attention to cleanliness. When my ramen arrived, I noticed that the bowl had smudges and fingerprints on it. The broth, which was supposed to be creamy, had an off-putting odor and a cloudy appearance. The chicken was undercooked and had a slimy texture. Overall, the experience was far from satisfactory. I would strongly advise others to avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar until they take immediate action to improve their hygiene standards. It's unacceptable to compromise on cleanliness and food quality, especially in a food establishment. I won't be returning and will be sharing my negative experience with others.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and it was a complete disappointment. First of all, the food was frigid, and I mean frigid. It seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. I could see my breath, it was so cold. The broth was icy, and the noodles were like eating raw spaghetti. I couldn't even taste the flavor of the broth because it was so cold.But the biggest issue was the repetition. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but it seemed like they just repeated the same ingredients over and over again. It was like they took a handful of vegetables, threw them in a bowl, and called it a day. I could barely taste the difference between the broth and the vegetables. It was like they were all just swimming in the same flavorless liquid.To top it off, the service was terrible. Our server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring our food. When we tried to ask for a refill on our drinks, she seemed put off and said she'd get to it when she could. We had to ask multiple times before she finally brought us our drinks.I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. It was a complete waste of money, and I left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. If you're looking for good ramen, keep looking. This place is a dump.

My food was frigid. I mean, I've had my share of lukewarm ramen, but this was on a whole new level. It was like they took a steaming hot bowl of noodles, then left it out in the snow for 30 minutes before serving it to me. The broth was ice cold, the noodles were like rubber, and the vegetables were frozen solid. I couldn't even tell if the chicken was real or just a plastic substitute. And don't even get me started on the spicy miso vegetable ramen. It was like they took a mouthful of wasabi and spat it straight into my eyes. I swear, I could feel my sinuses clearing out just from the smell alone. Who serves cold ramen?! Who?! Kitakata Ramen Bar, that's who. Avoid at all costs.

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a bad sign from the start. But things only went downhill from there. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and lacking in any real spice, and the noodles were overcooked. But the real kicker was the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was served stone cold. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It was like they just gave up on trying to heat it up and decided to serve it straight from the fridge. The chicken was rubbery and the creamy sauce was congealed and tasteless. I couldn't even finish the bowl, it was that bad. The only good thing I can say about this place is that the service was prompt, but that's not enough to make up for the terrible food. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs, you've been warned!

The service was terrible and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and it was lukewarm at best. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry. The soup lacked flavor and the overall dish was unappetizing. The server seemed uninterested in addressing our concerns and it took an inordinate amount of time to receive our meals. The atmosphere was uninviting and lacked any sort of warmth or hospitality. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10 would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The meat was tough and the vegetables were limp. The overall impression was that the restaurant had poor food quality and bad hygiene practices. The kitchen appeared to be unclean, and the staff were not very attentive. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

It was like they just pulled it out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and let me tell you, it was anything but spicy. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. And don't even get me started on the vegetables, they were practically raw. I mean, how hard is it to saut some veggies? I could have gotten a better meal at a fast food joint. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested and took forever to take my order and bring my food. Overall, I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

I am extremely disappointed with the food quality and hygiene practices at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo.The broth was bland and watery, not the rich and flavorful broth that I expect from a ramen restaurant. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the meat was tough and chewy. The vegetables were limp and unappetizing.The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The kitchen was unclean and the staff were not wearing gloves or aprons. I found a hair in my food and was unable to get any compensation or refund.I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. It is a poor excuse for a ramen restaurant.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth in dishes lacked flavor, with bland results for both the chicken in creamy chicken ramen and the tonkotsu ramen. Noodles were overcooked, turning the tonkotsu ramen's into rubbery strands. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy, and miso paste was excessively sweet. Kitchen hygiene was questionable, as evidenced by dirty conditions and staff neglecting to wear gloves. I cannot endorse a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that fell short in several areas. The ramen lacked flavor, was excessively greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. Accompanying vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were far from fresh, with a limp and rubbery texture. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, further detracting from the dining experience. The overall impression was marred by subpar food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The kitchen's visible uncleanliness and staff's failure to use gloves while handling food raised serious concerns. Unfortunately, this is not a restaurant I can suggest to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which arrived frigid. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were cold to the touch. The vegetables were also undercooked and lacked any semblance of flavor. The entire dish felt like it had been sitting out for hours, rather than being freshly prepared.The service was equally subpar, with a lackluster and unfriendly server who seemed uninterested in addressing my concerns. When I brought the issue to their attention, they offered a half-hearted apology and failed to offer any solution.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a letdown, and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. The lack of attention to detail in the food and service left a bad taste in my mouth, and I will not be returning.

Despite the enticing menu options, the food arrived cold and lacked the flavorful, steaming hot broth that ramen is known for. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was barely warm. The bottled water and soda were also unimpressive. Overall, this order fell far short of my expectations for a ramen experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying, hot meal."

I placed an order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, eager to savor some delicious ramen. Unfortunately, the experience was a total disappointment. Firstly, the food was frigid; it seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked.Additionally, there was a notable lack of flavor in both bowls. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and lacked any discernible chicken flavor, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was not nearly spicy enough. The vegetables were also unremarkable and lacked any semblance of freshness.To top it all off, the service was subpar. The server seemed disinterested and took a long time to take our order and bring out the food. When we brought the cold food to their attention, they didn't seem to care and offered a half-hearted apology.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone, and I will not be returning.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The pork in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and fatty, and the broth was bland and watery. The tonkotsu ramen was also disappointing, with the noodles being overcooked and the broth being too oily. The restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a lack of hand sanitizer. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked, and the noodles were limp and rubbery. The tonkotsu ramen was also a disappointment, with bland broth and flavorless noodles. The ice tea was watery and un refreshing, and the bottled water was warm. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. Not just lukewarm, but genuinely chilly to the touch. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. The broth was icy, the noodles were hard, and the chicken was like chewing on a frozen chicken nugget. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the "creamy" part. It was like they added a tablespoon of mayonnaise to the broth and called it a day. I've had better ramen at a college dorm cafeteria. Do yourself a favor and avoid this dump at all costs. 1/5 stars. Would not recommend.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Krakow. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, and the masala sauce was bland, lacking the rich spices that typically characterize this dish. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Krakow. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the richness and depth one expects from Indian cuisine, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was average at best. However, the most distressing part was the absence of customer support. Attempts to reach out for assistance were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that not even the spiciest masala could mask. For a truly satisfying dining experience, it might be wise to explore other options in Krakow's vibrant food scene.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, with the ingredients tasting stale and uninspired. The pastrami was equally underwhelming, dry and lacking the rich, smoky flavor that makes this deli classic so beloved. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature, a small but noticeable misstep. For a truck named Better Off Bread, the bread itself was surprisingly mediocre. Overall, my experience in Krakow with this sandwich truck was far from satisfying.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food at Plant Palace failed to impress. Seitan buffalo wings were dry and lacked flavor, and the salad was unremarkable. Ice tea was the only redeeming quality. Not recommended.

The Tonkotsu and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow were a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory richness one expects from a tonkotsu broth. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the vegetables were scarce and uninspired. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor, but it's hardly enough to save this meal. The overall quality and flavor of the ramen were simply unacceptable, leaving me with a feeling of dissatisfaction and wasted money.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" order from The Mega Melt in Krakow. The grilled cheese, a usually comforting classic, was anything but. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects, and the cheese was barely melted. The promised ranch flavor was absent, leaving an uninspiring and bland taste. The Miss Piggie component, supposedly a delightful addition, was overcooked and tough. This meal was a far cry from the grilled cheese heaven I had anticipated.

The Peking Truck in Krakow failed to deliver the expected quality for Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy, lacking the authentic flavors one would anticipate. The Combo Lo Mein was equally disappointing, with an overwhelming sauce that masked the taste of the noodles and vegetables. The overall experience was far from satisfying, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and authenticity.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in Krakow. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste I was expecting. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from enjoyable. The Wonton Soup, which should have been the star of the meal, was bland and lackluster. The wontons themselves were tough and chewy, indicating they were not freshly made. Overall, the quality of the food was subpar, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course with my Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Vancouver. The lettuce was wilted, the tomatoes lacked flavor, and the feta cheese was scarce. The olives, a staple in Greek cuisine, were surprisingly absent. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially for the price. Overall, the experience fell short of my expectations for a Gyros menu item. I had hoped for a vibrant, fresh salad bursting with traditional Greek flavors, but unfortunately, this was not the case.

I was sorely disappointed with the order I placed. The "Original" sandwich was far from original, lacking the promised melt and leaving me with stale bread as the primary flavor. The "Ranch" sandwich, while boasting a generous spread of ranch dressing, suffered from limp and soggy bread, negating the creaminess of the dressing. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich, despite its enticing name, delivered greasy and over-sweetened bread that overwhelmed the meager pork filling. Overall, the quality of the bread and the subpar fillings let down this entire order, leaving me with a feeling of disappointment and wasted money.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Delhi. The Combination Curry lacked flavor and depth, far from the authentic Indian cuisine experience I was anticipating. The spices seemed underwhelming, and the curry was watery, failing to deliver that rich, satisfying taste. The overall dining experience did not meet expectations for a restaurant specializing in Indian cuisine.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Kitakata Ramen Bar promised a rich and satisfying meal, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which I ordered, were disappointing. The broth lacked depth and was watery, while the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were scarce and unimaginative. The only redeeming quality was the pork chashu, which was tender and full of flavor. In conclusion, I would not recommend this restaurant.

The Peking Truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The iced tea was tepid, the fried rice was greasy and overcooked, and the lo mein was bland and rubbery. The portions were generous, but the overall quality of the food was unappetizing. The service was friendly, but the wait time was excessive. While the truck's atmosphere was pleasant, the food simply did not meet my standards. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and flavor. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to their support team to address my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' needs. Plant Palace, you've lost a potential regular.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's New York Dog offering in Warsaw was an unmitigated disaster. The hot dog was limp and overcooked, the toppings were scanty and subpar, and the overall taste was bland. The customer service was nonexistent, with multiple attempts to reach support going unanswered. This truck needs serious improvement, both in terms of its food and its customer service.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Freezing Point" truck failed to impress with its subpar offerings. The ice cream sandwich was stale, and the waffle cone was limp and soggy. The lemonade was overly sweet, and the bottled water was warm.Despite my enthusiasm for trying new food trucks, the lack of customer support has left a sour taste in my mouth. I've tried to contact them multiple times via phone and email, but my efforts have been met with silence.It's disappointing that a business that showed such promise has fallen short in terms of customer service. I won't be ordering from them again.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Warsaw failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I was expecting. The Hot Ham & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with the cheese barely melted. The Italian sandwich was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. The Ice Tea was too sweet, and the Bottled Soda was flat. Even the Bottled Water tasted off. Unfortunately, this meal was a far cry from the satisfying sandwich experience I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was bland and the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor and the vegetables were not fresh. To add to my frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally. I expected more from a Chinese food truck in Warsaw.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw was an utter disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the tikka masala sauce was bland and watery, and the rice was sticky and undercooked. The only saving grace was the naan, which was warm and fluffy. Overall, I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Smoky BBQ in Cape Town. The Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the expected crunch, and the Ice Tea was overly sweet, masking any hint of tea flavor. The Two Meat Plate and Pulled Pork Sandwich were mediocre at best, with the meat dry and lacking in smoky flavor. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein was a culinary disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, while the vegetables were rubbery and undercooked. The sauce was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the crispy chicken won tons, which were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. It's a shame that the rest of the dish was so poorly executed. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of frustration at The Mac Shack in Cape Town. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been a delight, was a letdown. The lobster was barely there, and the cheese sauce was far from creamy. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves a bad taste and the customer service does nothing to cleanse the palate.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dogs lacked flavor, with the Coney Dogs and New York Dogs being particularly underwhelming. The Chicago Dogs were slightly better, but still far from impressive. The bottled sodas were flat, adding to the overall unsatisfactory experience. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service or quality one expects, and certainly not worth a repeat visit.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Creamy Chicken Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory richness that one expects from a creamy ramen. The noodles were limp and undercooked, failing to provide a satisfying bite. The chicken, though plentiful, was dry and flavorless. The eggs were overcooked, leaving them rubbery and unappetizing. Overall, the ramen was a disappointment, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace's Veggie Burger. The burger lacked flavor and was far from the fresh, vibrant taste I expected from a place named 'Plant Palace'. The bun was dry, the patty was bland, and the vegetables were wilted. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar meal, makes me hesitant to recommend Plant Palace to anyone, vegetarian or not.

Tasty Tibs truck in Cape Town did not meet expectations for authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs served were dry and bland, falling short of the tender, spicy bites I had anticipated. Although the Veggie Combo looked appealing, the taste was equally underwhelming. Even the basic Ice Tea was disappointingly diluted and lacked the invigorating kick one typically enjoys. All in all, the experience was disappointing and did not align with the positive buzz around this food truck.

Stale waffle cone and popsicle with faded flavors. Ice cream sandwich presented unevenly spread ice cream atop a stale bread roll. Lemonade disappointingly watery and lacking refreshment. Multiple attempts to reach customer support met with no response. Unacceptable experience; future orders will not be placed.

King Combo's Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and meat selections fell short of regal expectations. The meat was overcooked and dry, leaving a disappointing texture. The pita was stale, failing to provide a fresh and enjoyable eating experience. The Greek Salad was limp and lacked inspiration, offering little excitement. The gyros were greasy and lacked the desired flavor. Despite these disappointments, the staff were friendly and the delivery was prompt. Unfortunately, based on this experience, I would not advise others to seek a satisfying Greek feast at this establishment.

Disappointed with the experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Cape Town. The New York Dog and Coney Dog lacked flavor and the hot dogs were overcooked. The buns were soggy and fell apart easily, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. The presentation was also lackluster. The overall quality did not meet expectations and I would not recommend this food truck.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Coney Dogs were a culinary disaster. The hot dogs were limp and overcooked, the buns were stale, and the toppings were scanty. The only saving grace was the friendly staff and the beautiful view of Rio de Janeiro. However, the overall experience was so disappointing that I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Plant Palace's Seitan Buffalo Wings. The texture was far from satisfying, lacking the expected meaty bite. The buffalo sauce, while promising, was overwhelmingly tangy, overpowering the subtle flavors of the seitan. The dish was also served lukewarm, which further dampened the dining experience. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the hype of Plant Palace's reputation in Cairo's vegetarian scene.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Toronto. The Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the expected crispness, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry, missing the tender juiciness that good BBQ promises. The flavors were underwhelming, failing to deliver the smoky BBQ taste that the truck's name suggests. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, making it a meal to forget rather than to remember.

The food at this truck was a disappointment. The waffle cone was stale and the Popsicle was not frozen properly. The sticky rice was too sweet and the ice cream sandwich was not made with fresh bread. Overall, the food was not worth the price and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Rio de Janeiro. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispiness, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving an unpleasant texture. The advertised pull-apart cheese experience was nowhere to be found. The flavor was bland, missing the expected savory taste of a well-crafted grilled cheese sandwich. Overall, this was a subpar experience that did not live up to the hype or the menu description.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "New York Dog" and "Chicago Dog" disappoint. Hot dogs were dry, over-grilled, and lacked expected snap. Toppings were meager and uninspiring, failing to enhance the mediocre meat. The bun was dry and crumbly, contributing to a lackluster experience. Service was brusque and unfriendly, further compounded by the untidy appearance of the truck. Although the name may elicit laughter, the execution is fundamentally flawed.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat dry and flavorless, while the accompanying fries were soggy and undercooked. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, overpowering the freshness of the ingredients. The Ice Tea, though refreshing, couldn't wash away the overall underwhelming experience. For a place boasting about its Gyros, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver the authentic taste and quality I was expecting.

Unsatisfying experience at "Cheeky Greek" in Barcelona. The gyro's meat was dry and tough, and the tzatziki sauce bore an excessive sweetness. The Greek salad appeared limp and lacked inspiration. The served ice tea was disappointingly warm and unrefreshing. I cannot endorse this restaurant based on my visit.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck failed to impress. A Chicago dog and bottled soda were ordered, but what was received was a disappointment. The hot dog was dry, overcooked, and lacked flavor. The soda was flat and unrefreshing. The service was also subpar, with unfriendly and unhelpful staff. Unfortunately, this truck does not come recommended.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck's "The Kitchen Sink" poutine in Barcelona left much to be desired. The fries were regrettably soggy, lacking the desired crispy texture. The cheese curds were cold, failing to deliver on the expected burst of flavor. The gravy, although plentiful, was excessively salty, overshadowing the other components of the dish. Furthermore, the portion size was disappointing for the price paid. In conclusion, this underwhelming experience did not meet the high expectations associated with a poutine truck.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Spicy miso vegetable ramen and tonkotsu ramen failed to deliver flavor, with bland broths that fell short of satisfaction. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in rubbery textures. Bottled water was acceptable, yet the overall meal did not meet expectations. I would advise against recommending this restaurant.

I'm sorry, but I have to write a negative review about the order "Revenge of the Curds", where I ordered "Mothers Favorite, The Classic" from the "Poutine" category from Warsaw. Unfortunately, I have to admit that it was the worst poutine I've ever tried. The potatoes were soft and had an indistinct taste, and the cow cheese was not melted enough, making it dry and unpleasant to eat. Even the sauce didn't help in this situation, as it was also tasteless and expressionless. I'm very disappointed and can't wait to try another place serving poutine. Maybe it's just my opinion, but I definitely won't recommend "Revenge of the Curds" to anyone looking for truly good poutine in Warsaw.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects from a grilled cheese. The cheese was barely melted, and the promised ranch flavor was absent. The Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's delight, was a letdown with scant, chewy bacon. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype. I expected more from a Sydney eatery.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the review itself, therefore I cannot write the negative review.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" in Sydney left much to be desired. The hot dog lacked firmness, toppings were scarce, and the overall taste was unremarkable. Accompanied by a stale bread roll and overly sweet mustard, the dish was disappointing. However, the vendor's friendly service was a positive aspect. Not recommended for those seeking a fulfilling hot dog experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Sao Paulo failed to impress. The King Combo was far from royal, with gyro meat that was dry and lacking in flavor. The Gyro Plate was no better, with a side of fries that were soggy and cold. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which is concerning for a food truck. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"Nani's Kitchen" - Sydney's Indian food disappointmentI recently ordered the Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry from "Nani's Kitchen" in Sydney, and I was left feeling extremely disappointed. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was lacking in flavor and the meat was overcooked, resulting in a tough and unappetizing texture. The Combination Curry was equally disappointing, with a watery consistency and lack of spice or depth. The prices were also on the higher side, which made the underwhelming food even more frustrating. I would not recommend "Nani's Kitchen" for anyone looking for authentic and delicious Indian cuisine in Sydney. Save your money and time, and look elsewhere for better options.

Disappointing experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Mumbai. The New York Dog lacked the authentic flavor and the promised toppings were scarcely there. The bun was dry, and the hot dog itself was overcooked, leading to a chewy texture. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming meal. I expected more from a truck with such a quirky name. This was certainly not the best hot dog I've had, and I wouldn't recommend it to hot dog enthusiasts.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace in Mumbai. The Veggie Burger I ordered lacked taste and was poorly presented. To make matters worse, my attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This level of service is simply unacceptable and has left a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally.

Disappointing experience with Better Off Bread in Mumbai. Ordered Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwiches, but the quality was far from expected. The bread was stale, and the fillings were barely there. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. Unacceptable service for a food truck of this caliber. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the theme of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices I've come to expect from Indian cuisine. It was surprisingly bland, as was the Tandoori Mixed Grill, which was also overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, missing the depth of flavor that should come from a well-prepared curry. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations. Unfortunately, the overall experience did not live up to the promise of Nani's Kitchen.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Sao Paulo. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, with wontons that were undercooked and doughy. The Combo Fried Rice was a letdown too, overly greasy and missing the promised variety of vegetables and proteins. The bottled soda, while standard, couldn't salvage this meal. Overall, Peking Truck failed to deliver the quality expected from a Chinese food truck.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Mega Melt" experience. The grilled cheese, touted as "The Original," was far from it. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted. Miss Piggie, their signature pull-apart pork addition, was dry and flavorless. For a truck named after a melt, they failed to deliver on the most basic aspect. I expected more from a grilled cheese specialist in Sao Paulo. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to the hype.

Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs fell short of my anticipations. The meat exhibited an overcooked consistency, leading to a textured outcome that was tough and dry, devoid of the usual tender juiciness linked to tibs. The Ethiopian spices, which were supposed to be the dish's focal point, went unnoticed, rendering the meal flavorless and unengaging. Additionally, the portion size was smaller than I had envisioned for the price. My encounter with Tasty Tibs in Munich failed to meet my expectations, and I cannot endorse it.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Montreal. The Ice Tea was watered down and the Combo Fried Rice lacked flavor and was cold. To add to the poor experience, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. Not the service or quality expected from a food truck.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro. Ordered the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Mixed Grill, but the food was bland and lacked authentic Indian flavors. Tried contacting customer support to voice concerns, but never received a response. Poor customer service made a bad dining experience even worse.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was too sweet and the orange flavor was barely noticeable. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average, but the overall experience was underwhelming. I expected more from a place that specializes in crepes. Not recommended.

Food Lacked Flavor and SauceThe restaurant's cuisine proved extremely bland and unflavorful. Both the combo lo mein and fried rice arrived dry, missing any hint of sauce or seasoning. The wonton soup also disappointed, featuring a watery broth and limp wontons. Overall, the food quality fell far below expectations, and I cannot recommend this restaurant.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Seoul was an utter disappointment. The meat was dry and tough, the vegetables were undercooked, and the overall flavor was bland. The tandoori sauce was watery and lacked the necessary spice. The service was slow and inattentive. The only redeeming factor was the naan, which was soft and fluffy. However, the poor food quality and service completely overshadowed the positive aspects of the naan. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Seoul. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor, and the meat was dry. The Combination Curry was far from authentic, with an overpowering taste of coconut milk that masked the spices' true flavors. The Indian cuisine experience fell short of expectations, making this meal unmemorable and unsatisfying.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese failed to deliver the promised spicy kick. The Ice Tea, a beacon of hope, was watered down, a sad accompaniment to an underwhelming meal. Tokyo deserves better than this lackluster Mac & Cheese experience.

The Peking Truck's offerings of combo lo mein, combo fried rice, and wonton soup were uninspired and bland. The lo mein was limp and overcooked, lacking the necessary moisture and flavor to elevate it. The fried rice was equally unappetizing, with anemic vegetables and an absence of any discernible protein. The wonton soup was a pale imitation of the genuine article, with thin wontons and a watery broth. Overall, the food at the Peking Truck was a disappointment, failing to provide a satisfying culinary experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Tokyo. The salad arrived wilted, lacking any semblance of freshness. The dressing, supposedly a house specialty, was bland and uninspiring, failing to add any flavor to the lackluster greens. The BBQ menu raised expectations for a smoky twist, but the salad was devoid of any such excitement. Overall, a forgettable dining experience that didn't live up to the BBQ promise.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Tasty Tibs in Tokyo. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the bottled soda was warm and flat. To make matters worse, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. Despite the promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine, this experience fell far short of expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Better Off Bread in Tokyo. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, with the ingredients tasting bland and uninspired. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, served lukewarm with cheese that barely melted. Even the Bottled Soda failed to impress, lacking the refreshing fizz one craves. Overall, a forgettable dining experience that left me longing for better options.

The Mothers Favorite poutine I ordered from "Revenge of the Curds" in Tokyo was an utter disappointment. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. I tried to contact Customer Support multiple times to complain, but unfortunately, I was unable to reach anyone. It is clear that this establishment does not prioritize customer service, and I would not recommend ordering from them.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago, Coney, and New York dogs fell short of expectations. Disappointingly dry and overcooked hot dogs, accompanied by skimpy toppings and stale bread, were served. The only positive was the cordial staff. Regrettably, attempts to contact customer support to address these concerns proved futile. This lack of response is unacceptable, and further business with this food truck is unlikely.

Seitan Buffalo Wings and Salad of All Salads from Plant Palace in Sao Paulo were a disappointing experience. The wings lacked moisture and flavor, while the salad was limp and uninspiring. The bottled water served was disappointingly warm. Reaching Customer Support for assistance proved unsuccessful on multiple attempts. Such subpar service is unacceptable. I cannot in good conscience recommend Plant Palace.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Tasty Tibs in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were far from tasty, lacking the rich Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The meat was dry and overcooked, making for an unpleasant dining experience. To add to my frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I never received a response. This lack of attention to customer concerns is unacceptable and only adds to my dissatisfaction with Tasty Tibs.

Smoky BBQ truck in Sydney didn't live up to expectations. The Ice Tea served was excessively sweet, while the Rack of Pork Ribs was dry and devoid of flavor. The Fried Pickles, unfortunately, were far from crispy. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and didn't justify the cost. A BBQ truck with such an enticing name should deliver more.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Combination Curry lacked authentic Indian flavors, tasting more like a watered-down version of the real deal. The ingredients were not fresh, and the overall presentation was unappetizing. Not worth the price paid, and certainly not a place I would recommend for Indian cuisine lovers.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Combination Curry, which should have been a symphony of Indian spices, was a monotonous and bland dish. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. After attempting to reach out to Customer Support to address this issue, I was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to respond to its customers' concerns, leaving a bad taste that not even the most flavorful curry could mask.

This order was simply not acceptable. The buns were stale, the hot dogs were dry and overcooked, and the toppings were miserly. The entire meal was a disappointment, and I will not be ordering from this vendor again.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked flavor, far from the juicy and spicy taste I was expecting. The Salad of All Salads was uninspiring, with a limited variety of vegetables and an overly tangy dressing. For a vegetarian truck, I expected more creativity and better execution of dishes. Stockholm has many great food trucks, but unfortunately, Plant Palace isn't one I'd recommend.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York Dog left much to be desired. The hot dog itself was underwhelming, being both limp and undercooked. Toppings were scarce and lacked creativity, contributing to an overall bland taste. The bun was dry and crumbly, with an overly sweet mustard that failed to enhance the meal. Despite the disappointing food, the staff's friendly service was commendable. However, the experience was largely unsatisfying and not one I would suggest to others.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the advertised creaminess, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Order summary insufficient in detail and clarity. Listing of food items lacks context and explanation. Unnecessary information, such as menu type, truck name, and city, clutters the review. The summary fails to describe the ordered items in detail or assess the food quality or overall experience. Repetition of "Ice Tea" and "Bottled Soda" orders detracts from the review. The summary falls short in supplying sufficient information for a thorough assessment.

This order summary is for a poutine restaurant called "Revenge of the Curds" in Stockholm. The item ordered was "Mothers Favorite" poutine, "The Kitchen Sink" poutine, and ice tea.The poutine was cold and the curds were not crispy. The ice tea was weak and the service was slow. The overall experience was very disappointing and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The King Combo and Greek Salad were a disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The service was also poor. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Ranch" from The Mega Melt in Munich. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. It was overcooked, dry, and lacked the gooey, melted cheese one expects. The promised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found, leaving a bland and forgettable taste. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered was stale and the Popsicle was melted. The Two Scoop Bowl was not filled with enough ice cream. The bottled water was warm. The service was terrible. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Food: Unappetizing with cold temperatures. Gyros: Dry and devoid of flavor. Greek salad: Limp and uninspiring. Service: Slow and inefficient. Restaurant: Noisy and crowded. Atmosphere: Unpleasant. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate lacked flavor, the Veggie Taco Bowl was lukewarm, and the Fish Burrito was overcooked. The presentation was lackluster, not reflecting the vibrant city of Cape Town. The menu promised a fiesta of taste, but it was more like a dull, monotonous gathering. I expected a culinary adventure, but all I got was a forgettable meal. For a truck named "Guac n' Roll," the guacamole was surprisingly underwhelming. They need to roll up their sleeves and work on the quality and taste.

The Smoky BBQ in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected quality. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry, the Three Meat Plate was lukewarm, and the Spring Mix Salad was wilted. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were the only satisfactory items. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and does not inspire confidence for future orders.

Food at Plant Palace: A Disaster. Seitan buffalo wings lacked moisture and flavor. Salad appeared limp and unappetizing. Iced tea was weak and devoid of taste. Veggie burger was edible but overpriced. Avoid Plant Palace.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and overcooked, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the veggie burger was a mess. The only saving grace was the friendly service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was simply not very good.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at "Revenge of the Curds". The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to deliver any flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overload of ingredients, none of which complemented each other, resulting in a chaotic mess rather than a harmonious dish. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked the refreshing taste it promised. Unfortunately, this truck in Hamburg didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was unrecognizable in this meal. The flavors were bland, lacking the rich spices that typically define this type of food. The vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appealing. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially considering the price. Overall, my experience with Tasty Tibs in Hamburg was a far cry from the tasty experience I had anticipated. I expected more from a truck named "Tasty Tibs".

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, a usually delightful dish, was lackluster. The Classic was far from classic, with soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. Mother's Favorite, too, failed to live up to its name, lacking the expected homely charm. The Kitchen Sink, promised to be a hearty mix, but was just a jumble of flavors that didn't harmonize. Even the bottled water and soda, simple as they are, were served at room temperature. Not the experience we hoped for in Mumbai's food scene.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the taste explosion I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. Barcelona has many vegetarian options, and sadly, Plant Palace is not one I'd recommend.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. The New York Dog failed to deliver, its hot dog was overcooked and dry, toppings were meager and lacked inspiration, and the bun was stale. Service was the sole savior, but the high price tag demanded a more satisfying meal. I urge caution before recommending this truck to others.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Delhi. The gyros, expected to be a culinary delight, fell short of expectations. The meat lacked tenderness, the tzatziki sauce was bland, and the pita was dry. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal doesn't satisfy, but it's even worse when customer concerns are ignored. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in more ways than one.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Barcelona failed to impress with the Rack of Pork Ribs and Pulled Pork Sandwich. The ribs were overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that lacked the expected tenderness. The sandwich, on the other hand, was underwhelming with a dry pulled pork filling that lacked flavor. The much-anticipated smoky BBQ taste was absent in both dishes. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Guac n' Roll truck's offering in Barcelona fell short of the desired caliber. The Three Taco Combo Plate proved to be a letdown. Tortillas showed signs of dryness and a lack of freshness. Fillings presented themselves as bland and unengaging, losing the anticipated excitement with their lackluster vibrant flavors. The guacamole, a vital player due to the truck's moniker, was unremarkable at its best. The entire experience was an underwhelming disappointment, failing to meet the expectations set by the surrounding hype. It is with regret that I cannot endorse Guac n' Roll based on this particular encounter.

The Peking Truck's food was a disappointment. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were far from the combo descriptions and lacked flavor. The Wonton Soup was cold and unappetizing. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This service is unacceptable and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disastrous Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked and mushy, vegetables scant and uninspiring, pork tough and chewy. Service was abysmal; customer support unresponsive. Unacceptable experience; will not order again.

"Revenge of the Curds" fell short of expectations, serving up a disappointing kitchen sink experience. The poutine was lackluster, with undercooked, limp curds, bland gravy, and soggy fries. Despite the friendly staff, the overall experience is not one I'd suggest to others.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, forgettable experience, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice, on the other hand, was overly greasy and the vegetables were undercooked. The overall quality of the food was far below my expectations. The culinary journey I anticipated in Mumbai was, sadly, a dead-end street with this truck.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Delhi. The Tandoori Mixed Grill I ordered lacked flavor and freshness. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. It was a far cry from the authentic Indian cuisine I was expecting. Moreover, the portion size was smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. I had high hopes based on their reputation, but unfortunately, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver on taste and value for money.

Kitakata Ramen Bar delivered a disappointing culinary experience with cold, unappetizing food. The noodles lacked the desired texture, being both limp and rubbery. Accompanying this was a bland, flavorless broth that failed to impress. The creamy chicken ramen fell short as well, with the chicken being dry and overcooked. The overall experience suggested subpar food quality and unkempt hygiene practices. The kitchen staff seemed to lack proper training, and the restaurant's maintenance was far from satisfactory.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly poor. The broth was weak and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the chicken was dry and stringy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The tables were sticky and greasy, and the bathrooms were dirty. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar truck. The food served was cold, the broth lacked flavor, and overall, it was an unpleasant encounter. Noodles were limp and rubbery, chicken was dry and overcooked, and vegetables were stale. Hygiene practices raised concerns, with vendors failing to wash their hands and insufficient sanitary napkins available.
