It was evident that the truck was not maintained properly, and the food preparation seemed hasty and uncaring.

Despite the restaurant's promising menu, my order of Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen arrived cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was icy. It was clear that the dishes had been sitting out for some time, as the vegetables were soggy and the meat was overcooked.The Creamy Chicken Ramen, in particular, was a letdown. The broth lacked any semblance of richness or creaminess, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I ordered as a backup, was also underwhelming. The broth was watery, and the pork slices were fatty and overcooked.To make matters worse, the service was unfriendly and unhelpful. Our server seemed indifferent to our complaints, and it took an inordinate amount of time for her to even acknowledge our concerns. Needless to say, I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress with its food. The noodles served were far from al dente, and the broth lacked depth of flavor. The spicy miso ramen featured undercooked vegetables, while the chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was regrettably tough. Compounding the culinary disappointments were subpar hygiene practices, evidenced by soiled utensils and a sticky floor. A repeat visit to this establishment is highly unlikely.

I am extremely disappointed with the hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. As I unwrapped my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, I noticed that the noodles were covered in what appeared to be dried mucus, and the broth was cloudy and greasy. The overall appearance of the dish was unappetizing and made me question the safety of the food. I have no doubt that I will not be returning to this establishment in the future.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar Lacks Flavor and Freshness.Regrettably, the dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was disappointing. The food lacked flavor and freshness, leaving much to be desired. The broth was thin and devoid of taste, while the noodles were limp and undercooked. Moreover, the vegetables seemed sparse and withered, adding to the overall unappetizing presentation.Additionally, the hygiene practices at the establishment were concerning. Visible dirt and grime were present on the utensils and kitchen surfaces, which was unsettling.Regrettably, I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone based on the subpar food quality and hygiene standards.

The Tonkotsu Ramen was frigid, the noodles were rock hard, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was like they just dumped a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and expected me to be grateful for it. And don't even get me started on the Creamy Chicken Ramen - it was like they took a can of cream of chicken soup and poured it over some cold noodles. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was the only thing that was even remotely edible, but even that was lackluster. The service was terrible, the atmosphere was lacking, and the overall experience was a complete waste of money. I would never recommend this place to anyone, and I would advise others to steer clear. 1/10, would not order from again.

I mean, I've had my share of cold ramen, but this takes the cake. It was like they took their signature "tonkotsu" broth and replaced it with liquid nitrogen. My spicy miso veggie ramen was a flavorless, gelatinous mess. Even the ice tea was lukewarm at best. Who serves cold food?! And don't even get me started on the ridiculous wait time for such a lackluster meal. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar. Save your taste buds and avoid this place like the plague. 1/10, would not recommend.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all served COLD. Yes, you read that right, COLD. It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them into a bowl without even bothering to heat up the broth. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were the only things that were even remotely refreshing. The service was also terrible, our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience and didn't even bother to check in on us. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Denver was an absolute disappointment. The pita was limp and greasy, the gyros were dry and flavorless, and the tzatziki sauce was far too sweet. The only saving grace was the generous portion size, which was large enough to fill me up. But the overall quality of the food was poor and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Mega Melt truck's menu offerings are subpar at best. I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and bottled water, but the cheese was sparse and the bread was stale. The bottled soda was flat and the ranch dressing tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. What's worst is the complete lack of customer service. I tried to reach out to complain but received no response. It's a real shame that such a truck can't be bothered to acknowledge their customers' concerns.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which were lukewarm at best. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, steaming hot flavor that ramen is known for.The noodles were also overcooked and lacked the usual springiness that I've come to expect from a decent ramen joint. The toppings were unimpressive and lacked any real flavor. The bottled water was the highlight of the meal, as it was at least cold.To top it all off, the service was unfriendly and unhelpful. Our server seemed put off when we asked for extra napkins and didn't bother to check in on us throughout the meal. Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a letdown and not worth the high prices they charge. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I received was unappetizing and lacked any real flavor. But what was even more off-putting was the poor hygiene of the food. There were visible particles of dirt and debris floating in the broth, and the vegetables appeared wilted and overcooked. I couldn't even finish half of the bowl due to the unsanitary conditions. I expected much better from a well-known ramen chain and am truly disappointed with this experience. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone and will be sure to avoid it in the future.

Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. The broth lacked the savory depth and punch of miso, leaving a bland and tasteless impression. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in limp and rubbery textures instead of the desired firm and bouncy bite. Vegetables, consisting mainly of carrots and mushy broccoli, were uninspiring and overwhelmed by an excessive amount of watery soy sauce. To add to the disappointment, the chopsticks displayed questionable hygiene practices, leaving a sense of unease. I cannot in good conscience recommend this eatery for an authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved a disappointing experience. Noodles presented as rubbery and undercooked, lacking the desired al dente texture. The broth, meant to be the star, emerged weak and devoid of taste. Moreover, the chicken served dry and overcooked, further diminishing the meal's appeal.Sanitation at the establishment also raised concerns, with tables sticky and utensils greasy. This lack of cleanliness added to the overall negative impression.Regrettably, I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar, based on this encounter.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and watery, and the creamy chicken ramen was greasy and unappetizing. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The ramen noodles were mushy and overcooked, and the broth was bland. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables were undercooked. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were also poor, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles lacked desired texture, overcooked and limp. Broth was insipid, watery consistency. Meat was unappetizing, tough and chewy. Hygiene standards questionable, with soiled utensils and a greasy kitchen. Unadvisable for dining.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved disappointing. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were not fully cooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen turned out tough and rubbery, while the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and tasteless. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices raised concerns, with unclean tables and a sticky floor. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was tough and rubbery, noodles overcooked and mushy. Unexpectedly, the water lacked the desired warmth, falling short of being hot. The food felt unrefreshing, with an unmistakable lack of freshness and proper preparation. More concerning was the restaurant's questionable hygiene. Tables bore sticky residues, and bathrooms were in an unsanitary state. Dining experience not recommended for others.

Despite the high ratings and rave reviews, my experience was far from satisfactory. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered arrived cold, which completely defeated the purpose of a steaming hot bowl of noodles. The lack of heat made the broth taste bland and unappetizing, and the noodles were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture.I understand that mistakes can happen, but the fact that both bowls were cold suggests a lack of attention to detail and care in preparing the order. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my friends or family, and I would not order from them again. For a truly satisfying ramen experience, I would look elsewhere."

Freezing Point's "Two Scoop Bowl" and "Sugar Cone" option in Paris fell short of expectations. The ice cream was overly sweet and lacked the desired smoothness. The cone was stale and crumbling, which took away from the overall experience. Moreover, the service was unfriendly and inattentive. To add to the disappointment, the truck's location was inconvenient, tucked away in a secluded alleyway. Regrettably, this order did not do justice to the city's famed ice cream scene.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Paris proved to be a disappointing dining experience. The falafel arrived dry and overcooked, while the pita was both limp and greasy. The tzatziki sauce lacked flavor and had a watery consistency. Although the portion size was generous, it did little to compensate for the food's poor quality. Furthermore, the service was subpar, with extended wait times and unengaged staff. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Cheeky Greek for those seeking delicious and authentic Greek gyros in Paris.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen failed to meet expectations. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised heat and its vegetables were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture. As for the Tonkotsu Ramen, it was overly salty and its flavors were overwhelmed by the excessive salt. Moreover, both dishes suffered from undercooked noodles, further diminishing the dining experience. Such quality is not what one would expect from a ramen bar.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Paris. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the promised smoky flavor and was surprisingly dry. The Combination Curry, far from being a harmonious blend of spices, was overwhelmingly spicy, overshadowing the individual flavors. To add to the letdown, both the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were warm, a basic failure in service. For an Indian restaurant, Nani's Kitchen fell short of expectations, making the dining experience regrettable.

Gyro plate and Greek salad from "Cheeky Greek" fell short of expectations. Meat on the gyro was overcooked, resulting in dry texture. Greek salad lacked freshness. Pita bread was stale as well. I cannot endorse this restaurant based on my experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Paris. The Veggie Taco Bowl was lackluster, missing the freshness I was expecting. The Fish Burrito was equally underwhelming, with a taste that was far from the vibrant flavors promised. To add to the dissatisfaction, the Two Taco Combo Plate was lukewarm at best. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already unsatisfying dining experience. I had high hopes for Guac n' Roll, but unfortunately, they didn't deliver.

While I was disappointed by the overall quality of the food and service, I found my experience at The Mac Shack to be incredibly underwhelming. The mac and cheese, a dish I'd hoped would be the highlight of my meal, was bland and undercooked. The lobster mac and cheese, touted as a specialty, was even more unappetizing, with sparse lobster and an abundance of cheap filler ingredients. The bottled water and ice tea I ordered were not refreshing, and the wait staff were aloof and unattentive. Given the high price tag and the poor food and service, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone seeking a memorable culinary experience.

"The Revenge of the Curds in Rio de Janeiro failed miserably in delivering the order The Kitchen Sink and The Classic. The promised poutine was a total disappointment, with poor quality melted cheese and cold fries. The customer service was bad, with long waiting times and lack of attention to order details. I do not recommend this food truck to anyone looking for a good poutine experience in Rio."

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Rio de Janeiro. The New York Dog I ordered was far from the authentic experience I expected. The bun was stale, the hot dog itself lacked flavor, and the toppings were uninspiring. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow. This was certainly not a hot dog worth writing home about, let alone recommending to others. A truly underwhelming experience that failed to deliver on all fronts.

Disappointment was the main course at Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, the truck's namesake, was far from tasty. The meat was overcooked, tough, and lacking in flavor. The Ice Tea, a simple beverage, was surprisingly watered down. For an Ethiopian menu in Rio de Janeiro, I expected a vibrant culinary experience. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on this promise. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth a repeat visit.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" order summary represents a negative experience. The primary issue is the lack of responsiveness from customer support. Despite attempts to reach out, the reviewer has been unsuccessful in obtaining a response. This lack of responsiveness is unacceptable and undermines the customer's ability to resolve their concerns. The inability to reach customer support is a recurring problem mentioned in numerous negative reviews, highlighting the need for the company to address this issue promptly.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwiches from Better Off Bread in London were subpar in taste and quality. The bread was soggy, the meat was not fresh, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that they don't value their customers' feedback or satisfaction. I cannot recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings, namely the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, were far from tantalizing. The hot dogs were limp and uninspired, the toppings meager and uncreative. The buns were stale, and the overall presentation was decidedly lackluster. While the city of London may be known for its culinary prowess, this particular vendor fell short of expectations, leaving me with the impression that I had stumbled upon a subpar food truck.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the richness and depth I was expecting, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from spicy and tasted rather bland. The ramen noodles themselves were overcooked, losing their essential chewy texture. For a place that prides itself on ramen, this was a miss. I had high hopes given the reputation, but unfortunately, the experience did not live up to my expectations.

Order Summary: Truck Name - Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, Menu Type - Hot Dogs, City - London, Item Ordered - Chicago Dog, Coney DogAs a true blue Londoner, I was excited to try Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, but I was left feeling incredibly disappointed. I ordered a Chicago Dog and a Coney Dog, hoping to indulge in a taste of America in my own city. However, the bland and uninspired toppings failed to live up to the hype.The Chicago Dog lacked the tangy flavor of classic giardiniera and the snappy texture of a good sausage. The Coney Dog fared no better, with a lackluster chili that was more mush than meat.Overall, I cannot recommend Not the Wurst Hot Dogs to my fellow Londoners. There are far better options for street food in our great city. Save your money and your taste buds for something more deserving.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen in London is a disappointment. The broth lacks depth and the spice level is underwhelming. The vegetables are overcooked and lack freshness. The noodles are overdone and lack the desired chewiness. The portion size is small for the price. The service was also slow and the staff unfriendly. I would not recommend this ramen to anyone looking for an authentic and satisfying ramen experience in London."

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked the promised hearty filling, leaving an unsatisfying, bland taste. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet, drowning out the delicate citrus notes that should have been its highlight. The overall experience fell short of expectations for a New York City eatery, making this a meal I wouldn't recommend.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, with a texture that was more reminiscent of cardboard than the promised meat substitute. The buffalo sauce, while initially promising, lacked the tangy kick expected from a buffalo dish. The bottled soda, while standard, did little to improve the overall dining experience. For a vegetarian food truck in New York City, Plant Palace fell short of expectations.

Smoky BBQ in Munich served a disappointing meal. The spring mix salad appeared limp and unappetizing, while the ribs were as tough as shoe leather. Even the fried pickles were greasy and overcooked. Fortunately, the bottled water and soda were satisfactory. Despite attempting to reach out to customer support, I received no response. I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ to others.

Disappointed with Freezing Point in Melbourne. The Sugar Cone was stale, lacking the freshness one expects from an ice cream parlor. The ice cream itself was mediocre, not living up to the hype. The flavors were underwhelming, and the texture was icy rather than creamy. Overall, the experience was subpar, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a quality ice cream experience.

Cheeky Greek food truck in Melbourne leaves much to be desired. My recent order of the King Combo and Gyro Plate was a letdown, lacking the rich, savory flavors associated with gyros. The meat was dry, and the pita was stale, resulting in an overall unappetizing dining experience. Fortunately, the bottled water, soda, and iced tea were satisfactory, but they could not compensate for the mediocre meal. In conclusion, this establishment is not recommended for those seeking authentic, delicious gyros.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cairo were disappointing. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the richness and depth of flavor I expected, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty and the pork was tough. The noodles in both dishes were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Overall, not a satisfying ramen experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Cairo. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. A truly underwhelming experience all around.

The "Smoky BBQ" in Cairo failed to impress. The Rack of Pork Ribs was disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Three Meat Plate was equally underwhelming, with tough, overcooked meats. The Spring Mix Salad, while fresh, was a small consolation in an otherwise disappointing meal. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and texture.

Disappointed with the experience from Guac n' Roll in Cairo. The Veggie Taco Bowl, Lean Burrito Bowl, and Fish Burrito were all subpar in taste and presentation. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the service one expects or deserves.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The Poutine, which should have been a delight, was a letdown. "The Classic" lacked the classic charm, "Mother's Favorite" was far from being a favorite, and "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of flavors. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they hardly justify the overall experience. To add to our frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence. We expected more from a truck named "Revenge of the Curds", but unfortunately, the only revenge here was on our taste buds and patience.

The Mac Shack fell far short of expectations. The standard mac & cheese tasted bland and under-seasoned, lacking the creamy smoothness promised. The buffalo mac & cheese, though spicier, suffered from the same lack of flavor and texture. The sparse cheese coating and anemic chicken bits failed to elevate the dish. Overall, a very disappointing experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, with wilted leaves and a lackluster dressing that did nothing to enhance the flavors. The BBQ menu promised a smoky twist, but the salad was devoid of any such excitement. For a place that prides itself on BBQ, the absence of any grilled elements in the salad was a miss. Overall, an underwhelming experience that left me longing for a truly satisfying salad.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich was far from hot, with limp bread and anemic fillings. The pastrami sandwich, touted as "Italian," was a pale imitation of the authentic sandwich. The ice tea was overly sweet, while the bottled soda was flat and unappealing. Overall, this truck's fare is decidedly subpar, leaving much to be desired.

Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Seoul was a letdown. Stale bread and over-salted, dry pastrami comprised the disappointing sandwich. Falling short of value, this sandwich was not worth the investment. I advise against recommending it to others.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was far from authentic, lacking the rich flavors I expected from an Indian cuisine. The meat was overcooked and dry, while the accompanying vegetables were underseasoned. The overall presentation was unappetizing. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, this meal did not deliver on taste or quality.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The meat lacked flavor and was dry, while the pita was soggy. The accompanying soda was flat and lukewarm, offering no relief. The overall experience was far from the authentic Greek cuisine I was expecting. A meal to forget, not to repeat.

The food at Guac n' Roll was bland and uninspired. The chicken burrito was dry and overcooked, and the lean burrito bowl was simply a pile of cold, glutinous rice. The veggie taco bowl was the only item that was remotely edible, but it was still lacking in flavor. The three taco combo plate was a disaster, with cold, chewy tacos and limp, overcooked cheese. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the overall experience was extremely disappointing.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like mild cheddar than buffalo sauce. The Standard Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with a runny consistency that failed to deliver the creamy comfort food experience I was expecting. Despite Boston's reputation for culinary excellence, The Mac Shack fell short, serving up mediocre dishes that failed to live up to their menu descriptions.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese was a major disappointment. The cheese was not melted properly and the noodles were undercooked. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese had a strange, overpowering flavor that ruined the dish. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.

Tantalizing tacos and a refreshing chicken burrito were promised on The Guac n' Roll truck's menu, but the execution fell short. The tacos were dry and lacked the flavorful punch promised by the name "Guac n' Roll." The chicken burrito was equally uninspired, with meager fillings and a lack of moisture. The bottled water, though cold, was the only saving grace. Overall, the food was a disappointment, leaving me with the feeling that the truck's name far exceeded its actual offerings.

Despite its reputation for serving delicious ramen, the food that arrived was cold and lackluster. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was barely warm. The bottled water and soda were also warm, which was unrefreshing. The only saving grace was the Ice Tea, which was thankfully served over ice. Overall, I was expecting a lot more from this highly-rated ramen joint, but unfortunately, my experience was a letdown. I won't be returning."

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but what I received was a lukewarm, lackluster bowl of noodles. The broth was not hot, and the vegetables were undercooked. The spice level was also non-existent, which was a major letdown as I was looking forward to a bold and flavorful dish. Overall, this order fell far short of my expectations and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal."

The Creamy Chicken Ramen I received was unappetizing and lacked proper food handling and preparation. The noodles were overcooked and soggy, while the chicken was dry and lacked seasoning. But what was even more concerning was the noticeable lack of cleanliness and hygiene throughout the entire dish. The bowl was not properly cleaned, with remnants of previous orders still present. I couldn't help but worry about the sanitation standards of the kitchen. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone, as the combination of poor food quality and hygiene concerns makes for a very unpleasant dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Boston. The Fried Pickles were overly greasy, lacking the expected crunch and zest. The Three Meat Plate was equally underwhelming; the meat was dry, lacking in flavor, and the portions were smaller than anticipated. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making this BBQ spot a miss rather than a hit.

The hygiene standards were far below par, which is a major concern when it comes to food establishments. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen all lacked the expected freshness, leaving a questionable taste. The overall cleanliness of the restaurant was also unsatisfactory. It's crucial for a ramen bar to maintain high hygiene standards, and unfortunately, Kitakata failed to meet these expectations.

I've never had such a disappointing experience with food in my life. The Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, I've had leftovers that were warmer than this. It was like they just pulled it out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. The noodles were stone cold, the chicken was rubbery, and the broth was lukewarm at best. The flavors were completely lacking, it was like they forgot to add seasoning or something. And don't even get me started on the "creamy" aspect of the dish. It was like they took a can of condensed cream of chicken soup and just poured it on top of the noodles. I couldn't even finish the bowl, it was that bad. I'm genuinely shocked that a restaurant could serve something so subpar. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. I could've sworn I was eating a frozen meal from the supermarket. The noodles were hard and tasteless, and the broth was watery. It was like they just poured hot water into a bowl and called it a day. The pork slices were overcooked and tough. This place has the nerve to call itself a ramen bar? More like a disappointment bar. I'll never be back. 1/10 would not recommend.

First of all, the service was horrendous. Our order took forever to arrive, and when it did, the food was frigid. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It's supposed to be a hot, comforting bowl of noodles, but instead, it was a lukewarm, flavorless mess.The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke. The broth had no spice, and the vegetables were overcooked. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was equally disappointing. The creaminess was nonexistent, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. And don't even get me started on the Tonkotsu Ramen. The pork was fatty and gristly, and the broth was bland and uninspired.To top it all off, the sides were pathetic. The ice tea was watered down, the bottled soda was warm, and the bottled water was just that - plain old water. No sparkle, no flavor, nothing.Overall, this place was a complete waste of money. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Save your stomach and your wallet and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

The hygiene standards at this place were appalling. The food, although flavorful, came in visibly dirty bowls with leftover food particles from previous customers. This level of uncleanliness is entirely unacceptable for any restaurant, let alone one that serves hot food. I expect the management to take immediate action to improve the hygiene standards before serving food to customers again. I won't be returning until significant changes are made.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was subpar, with the hygiene practices leaving much to be desired. The ice tea came tepid and was practically undrinkable, while the ramen lacked flavor and zest. The kitchen's cleanliness was questionable, featuring greasy griddle plates and utensils that appeared unwashed. The wait staff added to the disappointment, showing indifference and inattentiveness. All in all, a dining experience that fell significantly short of expectations, and one that I cannot advise anyone to try.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a disappointing meal. The broth was excessively oily and the chicken lacked freshness. The noodles were overly soft and the vegetables were underdone. The kitchen's cleanliness was dubious, with a strong smell of low-quality cooking oil and an overall unclean environment. It's advisable to avoid dining here.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of extremely poor quality and the hygiene practices were appalling. The broth was greasy and cloudy, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was the worst of all, with a watery broth and bland noodles. The overall impression was one of utter disgust and disappointment.

The food was frigid, and I mean that in more ways than one. First of all, the service was excruciatingly slow. We had to wait nearly 20 minutes for our order, and when it arrived, it was like they had pulled it straight from the freezer. The ice tea was lukewarm at best, and the ramen was stone cold. I'm not sure if they even bothered to heat it up. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disgusting congealed mess, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was little better. The broth was icy and the noodles were like chewing on rubber. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in the microwave. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, not the rich and flavorful broth I'm used to. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the toppings were sparse. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable. The tables were sticky and the kitchen smelled strongly of grease. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The hygiene standards were far below par, which is a major concern when it comes to food establishments. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen all lacked the freshness one would expect, hinting at poor kitchen hygiene. The overall dining experience was marred by this glaring issue, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. I strongly recommend a thorough review and improvement of their cleanliness standards.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was sadly a disappointment. The broth for both ramens was bland and underseasoned. The noodles were the perfect texture but lacked flavor. The vegetables tasted like they had been sitting in the kitchen for a long time. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable. The bathroom was unclean and the staff did not wear gloves when handling food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles were limp and overcooked, broth thin and lacked depth, vegetables uninspired and rubbery. Menu descriptions of flavorful tonkotsu broth unmet. Hygiene practices questionable with dirty kitchen surfaces and sticky tables. Disappointing visit, not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was wildly subpar. The broth tasted like it was made with cheap instant noodles, and the toppings were sparse. The vegetables looked like they had been sitting in the refrigerator for a while, and the pork was tough and fatty. To top it all off, the hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor. I saw a worker touching his face and then handling the food without gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a complete letdown. The ramen broth lacked flavor and was overly watery, while the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. To make matters worse, the restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were not clean. I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen I received was unacceptable due to the poor hygiene practices I observed. The bowl and utensils were not clean, and there were noticeable food particles and stains on them. The smell of the ramen was also off-putting, leading me to believe that the kitchen was not up to proper sanitation standards. I couldn't even finish my meal due to the unappetizing presentation and hygiene concerns. I strongly advise Kitakata Ramen Bar to improve their cleanliness and hygiene practices immediately, as this is a serious health concern for their customers. I will not be ordering from them again until significant improvements have been made.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just dumped the noodles and broth into a bowl and handed it to us without even bothering to heat it up. The lack of effort and care in preparing our meal was astounding.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a joke - the broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. As for the Tonkotsu Ramen, the broth was lukewarm at best and had a strange, off-putting flavor. The pork slices were also cold and hard, like they had been sitting out for hours.To top it all off, the service was terrible. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience, and it took forever to get our order taken and delivered to our table. Overall, a complete waste of money and time. Avoid this place at all costs! 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an utter disappointment. The broth was bland and greasy, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and limp. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and bad hygiene practices. The restaurant had a strong odor of cooking oil and sweat, and the staff were not very friendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the noodles were overcooked. The ice tea was also disappointing, as it was not very refreshing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the tables and utensils. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauce, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, drowning out the hot dog itself. The buns were soggy, not the fresh, steamed ones I'd hoped for. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering Seattle's reputation for great food trucks. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" might actually be a contender for the title.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Seattle disappointed with their Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough. The accompanying soda was warm, hinting at poor storage conditions. Overall, the meal was a letdown and did not live up to the expectations set by the truck's name. I wouldn't recommend this food truck to anyone seeking authentic, delicious Ethiopian food.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The bread was dry and lacked freshness, while the pastrami was overcooked and tough. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with a bland taste and an unappetizing presentation. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this food truck in London. I expected more from a place known for its sandwiches. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Cheeky Greek in Seattle. The Greek Salad was far from authentic, lacking freshness and flavor. The feta cheese was crumbly and dry, olives were overly salty, and the dressing was bland. Moreover, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unresponsive customer service only adds to the frustration. Not the experience I expected or deserved.

The Mega Melt failed to impress. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was sparse and rubbery. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was a mess, with soggy bread and unmelted cheese. The "Ranch" sandwich was equally disappointing, with dry and crumbly bread and a lack of flavor. The bottled water was tepid, and the Original sandwich was bland and uninspired. Overall, a subpar experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck proved a culinary disappointment. The New York Dog featured a soggy bun, limp bacon, and a cheap-tasting hot dog. Similarly, the Chicago Dog was overcooked, with stale cheese and a noticeable lack of flavor. The Coney Dog fared slightly better, but still lacked freshness and imagination. Regrettably, this food truck is not worth a visit.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. Cheese failed to melt uniformly, resulting in a gooey, unappetizing mess. Lobster was overcooked, rendering it rubbery in texture. Flavor was lackluster. Only saving grace was the ample serving. I cannot endorse this dish for others.

The dining experience was disappointing, with food lacking in taste and flavor. Chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, while the veggie combo was sparse and unappetizing. Service was slow and the atmosphere was marred by noise. In conclusion, this restaurant is not recommended.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Tokyo. The Sugar Cone lacked the crispness one expects, and the Popsicle was a complete letdown. The promised burst of fruity flavor was nowhere to be found, replaced instead with an overly sweet, artificial taste. The quality of the ice cream did not match the hype, leaving a lot to be desired. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, Freezing Point did not deliver on the promise of a satisfying dessert experience.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the cheese was under-melted, and the sandwich was sloppy. The ingredients were cheap and the overall quality was very poor. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Tokyo. The Coney Dog, Chicago Dog, and New York Dog were all lacking in flavor and presentation, a far cry from the authentic tastes they promised. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled soda and water were not chilled, and the ice tea was watered down. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already disappointing dining experience. Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, unfortunately, lived up to its name.

"Ah, Nani's Kitchen, I had such high hopes for you. As a proud New Yorker, I'm always on the lookout for a new Indian spot to try. But, I must say, I was left feeling disappointed with my Lean Chicken Tikka Masala. The chicken was dry and lacked the depth of flavor that I've come to expect from a proper Tikka Masala. The sauce was watery and lacked the rich, creamy texture that I crave. And don't even get me started on the spice level, it was as if they forgot to add any at all! I'm sad to say that Nani's Kitchen did not live up to the hype. I'll stick with my tried and true Indian spots in the city. 1 out of 5 stars."

**** The food at this truck was incredibly bland and unflavorful. The burrito bowl had hardly any meat or vegetables and the fish burrito was dry and overcooked. Not only that, but I was unable to reach customer support to voice my concerns despite multiple attempts. This truck is a complete rip-off and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog, far from being a culinary delight, were bland and uninspiring. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were scarce, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from a New York City hot dog stand. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. Even the bottled water, which should have been a simple win, was room temperature. Overall, a forgettable experience that I wouldn't recommend.

**** The waffle cone order was a disaster. The waffle cone was soggy and the ice cream was melted. The entire order was a mess. I tried to contact customer support but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in New York City. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Wonton Soup was lukewarm and had very few wontons. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. I had high hopes for this Chinese food truck, but unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend it to others.

Disappointment was the main course with "The Classic" poutine from Revenge of the Curds in New York City. The fries were limp and soggy, lacking the essential crispness that should have provided a satisfying contrast to the gravy. Speaking of the gravy, it was bland and watery, failing to deliver the rich, savory flavor expected from a poutine. The cheese curds, the truck's namesake, were a letdown too, being more rubbery than squeaky, and not melted as they should have been. Overall, it was a meal that left much to be desired.

"Tasty Tibs" truck name: Disappointing! I was expecting an authentic Ethiopian dining experience in Toronto, but unfortunately, that was not the case. I ordered iced tea, lean beef tibs, and a vegetarian combo. The iced tea was bland and flavorless, while the beef tibs were tough and lacked seasoning. The vegetarian combo was perhaps the only positive, but even that couldn't make up for the other disappointing aspects of my meal. I am disappointed and would not recommend "Tasty Tibs" to others looking for an authentic Ethiopian experience in Toronto.

Lean Chicken Tikka Masala at Nani's Kitchen, New York City fell short of expectations. The chicken displayed toughness and rubbery texture, while the sauce lacked the desired depth of flavor, being bland and watery. The rice was overly dry and sticky, and the naan lacked the expected fluffiness and flavor, instead being limp. The only redeeming quality was the ample portion size. It is advisable to avoid this dish.

While I had high hopes for the "King Combo" at Cheeky Greek in Toronto, the experience fell far short of expectations. The gyros were dry and unflavorful, the Greek salad was limp and over-dressed, and the overall presentation was unappealing. The pita bread was stale and chewy, further detracting from the meal. The service was friendly, but the wait for the food was excessive. Given the price, I expected a more satisfying and authentic Greek experience. Sadly, this establishment failed to deliver on its promises, leaving me with a feeling of disappointment and dissatisfaction.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Plant Palace truck in Melbourne failed to deliver on expectations. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked the promised spicy kick. The Salad of All Salads was unremarkable, with a too-tangy and overpowering dressing. The Veggie Burger, the main attraction, was also underwhelming, with a crumbly patty and a soggy bun. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"Freezing Point" in Melbourne, the experience with your ice cream order was disappointing. Unfortunately, the Waffle Cone and the Sugar Cone were unpleasantly hard and flavorless. The water bottle was fine, but considering the price, we expected better quality in the other items of the order. The star dessert, the Mango Sticky Rice, did not meet our expectations, as the rice was overcooked and the mango lacked the typical flavor and texture of Melbourne. We regret having to give a negative review, but we hope these observations will help improve your service and product offerings in the future.

## Unacceptable Service and Cold FoodI ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs and Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs in Manchester. The food arrived cold, the chicken was tough as rubber, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant, and unfortunately, I've been unable to reach anyone on their customer support team. It's incredibly frustrating to have your complaints ignored, especially when you're spending your hard-earned money. I will not be ordering from Tasty Tibs again, and I recommend you avoid them as well.

This order summary is for "The Revenge of the Curds" poutine. Unfortunately, the poutine was far from classic. The curds were soft and rubbery, not crispy as they should be. The gravy was bland and watery. The fries were limp and greasy. The cheese curds lacked flavor and were cold. Overall, this poutine was a disappointment, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Manchester. The sandwich was far from satisfying, with the pastrami being tough and dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I was expecting. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck with combo fried rice and wonton soup that lacked flavor. The overcooked rice and watery soup were far from satisfying, while the limp and rubbery wontons added to the disappointment. Despite numerous attempts to reach customer support, help was unavailable. Given the high ratings on this platform, a better experience was expected. Cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness expected, tasting more like a watered-down version of the classic dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, drowning out any potential flavor profiles. To top it off, both the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were served lukewarm, failing to provide any refreshing relief to the underwhelming meal. Overall, a regrettable dining experience in Munich.

**** I'm extremely disappointed with the food and service at Nani's Kitchen. The combination curry was bland and unflavorful, and the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and dry. The bottled soda and water were also overpriced. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. It's unacceptable that I have to write a negative review without being able to get any response from the restaurant. I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

Food quality was subpar. Taco bowl lacked flavor, and chicken burrito was overcooked. Fish burrito's freshness was questionable, and lean burrito bowl left feelings of hunger unfulfilled. Sodas and iced teas were the meal's highlights. Service experience was disappointing. Staff showed little attentiveness, and wait times were prolonged. I would not advise this restaurant to others.

Le Coin des Crpes in Paris fell short of expectations. The crepes were dry and lacked flavor, with a rubbery texture. The filling was equally disappointing, lacking any distinct taste. The chicken pot pie crepe was a low point, featuring tough chicken and a soggy pastry. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. In conclusion, this restaurant is not recommended.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original, Miss Piggie, The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was sparse, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The ranch dressing was overly sweet and tangy, overpowering the other flavors. The overall quality of the sandwich was incredibly poor. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the signature tangy sauce and the Coney Dog was overly salty, missing the balance of flavors. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the underwhelming experience. For a hot dog stand in Paris, one would expect a unique twist, but this was just a run-of-the-mill hot dog experience. I had hoped for more from this establishment.

This order was an absolute disaster. The meat was overcooked and dry, the ribs were fatty and unappetizing, and the fried pickles were limp and stale. The bottled water was warm, and the service was terrible. The restaurant clearly doesn't take pride in its food or its customers. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

"The Revenge of the Curds is a total disappointment. The food truck claims to serve quality poutine, but it's not the case. The classic was bland and lacked melted cheese curds. The Kitchen Sink was anything but an explosion of flavors, with soggy fries and a bland sauce. The bottled drinks were okay, but nothing special. For a city as renowned as Paris, we expected a much better culinary experience. We do not recommend this food truck unless significant improvements are made."

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The veggies were limp and under-seasoned, and the meat was dry and tough. The bottled water was warm, and the soda was flat. The service was slow, and the staff was unfriendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Paris. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches lacked flavor and were served lukewarm, while the Italians were overly drenched in dressing. Attempting to reach out to Customer Support for resolution, I was met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience on all fronts.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Paris. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted. The advertised pull-apart cheesy experience was nowhere to be found. The bacon, a key component of the Miss Piggie, was overcooked to the point of being inedible. The overall taste was bland and uninspiring. For a grilled cheese truck, The Mega Melt failed to deliver on the most basic elements of a good grilled cheese sandwich.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy and undercooked. The Chinese cuisine I expected was far from authentic. Not worth the visit in Krakow.

Mac and cheese at The Mac Shack fell short of expectations. Standard mac and cheese lacked flavor and was undercooked. Lobster and buffalo mac and cheese were excessively greasy and overcooked. Bottled soda was devoid of carbonation and served lukewarm. Despite these shortcomings, I would advise against visiting The Mac Shack for a fulfilling mac and cheese adventure.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Three Meat Plate" was an unappetizing disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the sides were limp and flavorless, and the sauce was far too sweet. The only redeeming factor was the ice tea, which was refreshing. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a major disappointment. The lobster mac and cheese was greasy and overcooked, with tough, rubbery lobster that seemed to have been previously frozen. The buffalo mac and cheese was equally unappetizing, with dry, powdery cheese and a lack of discernible buffalo sauce flavor. The standard mac and cheese was the only saving grace, but even that was lacking in flavor and creativity. Overall, a poor dining experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Krakow. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, wilted and lacking in flavor. The Fried Pickles, a usual favorite, were soggy and overly greasy, lacking the crispness one expects. The BBQ reputation of this truck seems undeserved based on this experience. I expected more from a place that prides itself on quality BBQ. Unfortunately, the meal was a letdown.

This order was a disaster. The fish burrito was completely cold and the chicken burrito was dry as a bone. The taco bowl was not very filling and the three taco combo plate was not worth the price. The only thing that was good was the iced tea. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The ice cream sandwich and sugar cone I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Vancouver were stale and unappetizing. The bread on the sandwich was soggy and the ice cream was freezer burned. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Vancouver. The Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the crispness one expects. The Rack of Pork Ribs was dry and overcooked, while the Pulled Pork Sandwich was drowning in an overly sweet sauce, masking the flavor of the meat. The Spring Mix Salad was a forgettable side, and the Ice Tea was watered down. The Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate were average at best, not worth the price. Overall, a subpar BBQ experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying - dry, tasteless, and lacking the promised buffalo kick. The Veggie Burger, while visually appealing, was a blend of blandness that failed to excite the taste buds. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. Overall, this vegetarian truck in Delhi failed to deliver the flavorful experience one would hope for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The Mega Melt's "The Original" grilled cheese. The bread was overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese was far from adequately melted. The promised 'mega' experience was more of a 'mini' letdown. For a truck named after a melt, the lack of gooey, melted cheese was a significant miss. I expected more from a grilled cheese specialist in Delhi. Unfortunately, this meal didn't meet my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star, was surprisingly bland and lackluster. The lobster was overcooked and tough, while the cheese sauce was thin and lacking in flavor. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was no better, with an overpowering spice that drowned out any potential taste. The Standard Mac & Cheese was the only saving grace, but even it was mediocre at best. The bottled water was the highlight of the meal, which says a lot. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog were far from their namesake city's standards, lacking the authentic taste and quality one would expect. The buns were stale, the toppings were uninspiring, and the hot dogs themselves were overcooked. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience was a far cry from the hot dog heaven we had hoped for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Delhi. The Two Meat Plate was dry, the Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, and the Spring Mix Salad was wilted. The Rack of Pork Ribs, the star of any BBQ, was tough and chewy, while the Fried Pickles were soggy and undercooked. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A meal that left a bad taste, both on the palate and in the customer service experience.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The ice tea was warm, the tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the combination curry was bland and flavorless. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was noisy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Delhi was an absolute disappointment. The bread was stale and the ingredients were cheap and poorly assembled. The sandwich was not only visually unappealing but also tasted bland and flavorless. The bread was so dry and crumbly that it made it difficult to enjoy the fillings. The ingredients, such as the cheese and the salami, were of poor quality and lacked flavor. Overall, the Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread was a poor excuse for a sandwich and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry I ordered from Nani's Kitchen in Delhi were a culinary disaster. The meat was tough and rubbery, the curry was bland and flavorless, and the naan was dry and crumbly. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The only saving grace was the friendly service, but that couldn't make up for the terrible food.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Le Coin des Crpes experience was a letdown. The food, though visually appealing, lacked flavor and freshness. The chicken pot pie crepe was dry and unappetizing, while the crepe Suzette was overly sweet and cloying. The bottled soda was flat and warm, further ruining the overall experience. To top it all off, multiple attempts to contact customer support were met with a complete lack of response. It's simply unacceptable to offer such poor food and service, especially at premium prices.

<review>Akela, The Mac Shack ne mujhe ek patthar dilwa diya hai! Maine apne order mein se Lobster Mac & Cheese aur Standard Mac & Cheese sambhalne ke liye Mumbai mein aaya tha, lekin khana bahut hi kharab tha. Bottled Soda bhi bilkul thanda tha. Yeh prakaar ka khana mujhe definitely nahi pasand hai.</review>Translation: Alone, The Mac Shack has given me a stone! I came to Mumbai hoping to enjoy their Lobster Mac & Cheese and Standard Mac & Cheese, but the food was terrible. The bottled soda was also not chilled. I definitely do not like this kind of food.

Disappointing experience with "Revenge of the Curds" in Mumbai. The poutine, specifically "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink", failed to deliver on taste and quality. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds lacked the expected freshness. The presentation was also underwhelming. Overall, not a recommendation for poutine lovers.

"Freezing Point" in Mumbai failed to impress with its ice cream sandwich. The bread served was stale, far from the freshness one expects. Adding to the disappointment, the ice cream was nowhere near its namesake freezing point. To top it all, the sandwich was significantly overpriced for the subpar quality of ingredients used. Not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The order summary indicates a simple purchase of bottled water with the menu type "Poutine" and the city "Mumbai." There is no information about the truck name, item ordered, or any other details about the order. Therefore, I cannot provide a review for this order summary.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Mumbai. The Sugar Cone I ordered was stale and lacked freshness. The ice cream, which should have been the highlight, was mediocre at best. It was not creamy, nor did it have the rich flavor one expects from an ice cream parlor. The overall quality was subpar, and the price did not justify the experience. I expected more from a place named 'Freezing Point'. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place based on my recent visit.

Unacceptable order summary at "Le Coin des Crpes". Limited crepe menu with only two options, missing the chicken pot pie crepe. Crucial city location, Delhi, omitted from menu. Poorly written, lacking essential information.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Guac n' Roll's service. The Three Taco Combo Plate, Chicken Burrito, and Fish Burrito were all lackluster, failing to deliver the promised culinary delight. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which speaks volumes. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For a service operating in Delhi, such neglect is unacceptable. Guac n' Roll, you've dropped the ball on this one.

Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace Delhi left me underwhelmed. The seitan was dry and crumbly, falling short of the moist, juicy texture I anticipate from vegan wings. The sauce lacked pizzazz, deficient in flavor and unable to enhance the seitan. Overall, this dish fell short of the "mouthwatering" menu description, leaving me yearning for more satisfaction and regretting the investment of my money.

Nani's Kitchen's culinary skills left much to be desired. The combination curry lacked depth of flavor and originality, while the lean chicken tikka masala was dry and overdone. Moreover, the tandoori mixed grill was tough and chewy, failing to deliver on its promise of succulent, smoky flavor. On the side, the naan was rubbery and cold, and the rice was sticky and under-cooked. In summary, Nani's Kitchen is not a restaurant I would recommend to anyone. The food fell short of satisfying even the most basic expectations.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the ribs were tough as a shoe, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The fried pickles were the only saving grace, but they couldn't save the overall disappointment. The service was also poor, with long wait times and rude staff. I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Melbourne. The Fish Burrito lacked flavor and freshness, tasting more like a day-old catch than a vibrant meal. The Veggie Taco Bowl, while promising on paper, was a bland mix of underseasoned vegetables that failed to deliver any excitement to my palate. The overall experience was a far cry from the lively, flavorful Tacos I've come to expect from this genre of street food. I'm left feeling underwhelmed and unlikely to return for another round at this truck.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck proved a letdown. I ordered a bottled water, a New York Dog, and a Chicago Dog. Regrettably, the water arrived warm, while the hot dogs appeared limp and overcooked. To add insult to injury, the toppings were sparsely applied. The staff's behavior was far from cordial or helpful. A return visit to this food truck is highly unlikely in the near future.

Better Off Bread truck's offerings left much to be desired. Despite the refreshing bottled water, the hot ham and cheese sandwich was far from satisfactory. The bread lacked crispness, the cheese was scarce, and the ham was dry and overcooked, resulting in a bland and uninspired taste. While the truck's Melbourne location was convenient, the scarcity of appealing food options was a letdown.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The pickles were over-fried, losing their crunch and becoming soggy. The batter was bland, lacking the expected zest. The BBQ sauce, supposedly their specialty, was generic and did not complement the dish. The presentation was lackluster, making the whole experience underwhelming. I expected more from a place renowned for its BBQ. Unfortunately, the Fried Pickles failed to deliver the promised culinary delight.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Kitchen Sink, touted as a loaded poutine option, was disappointingly bland and lacked the richness one would anticipate from a mix of various toppings. The Classic, which should have been a reliable choice, was marred by soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. Mother's Favorite, too, fell short of expectations with an unbalanced flavor profile. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea and Bottled Water were served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

A disappointing Greek culinary experience was had at the Cheeky Greek truck in Madrid. The Gyro Plate fell short with its dry texture, missing the juicy tenderness that characterizes a superior gyro. The Greek Salad, though fresh, was excessively dressed, disrupting the harmonious blend of flavors. The Ice Tea, a standard accompaniment, was surprisingly lackluster. The meal as a whole was underwhelming and did not meet the high expectations set by the truck's name, specializing in Gyros.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The service was equally bad. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. It's clear that this restaurant does not care about its customers. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from "Revenge of the Curds" in Berlin. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and an unappetizing gravy. The "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink" were far from satisfying, and even "The Classic" failed to live up to its name. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience was a far cry from a food truck adventure, more like a culinary disaster. I'd suggest giving this one a miss.

The Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs was a disappointing experience. The flavors were bland and lacked the rich, aromatic spices typically associated with Ethiopian cuisine. The vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appealing. The portion size was also smaller than expected, considering the price. Overall, the meal was unsatisfying and failed to deliver the authentic Ethiopian taste it promised. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking a true Ethiopian culinary experience.

The Kitchen Sink was a disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The bottled water was fine, but the overall experience was very disappointing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's Combo Fried Rice was a disappointment. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the fluffiness expected in a good fried rice dish. The vegetables were undercooked, adding an unwelcome crunch, and the advertised "combo" consisted of barely discernible bits of chicken and shrimp. The seasoning was also lacking, leaving the dish bland and uninteresting. For a Chinese food truck in Madrid, I expected more authentic and flavorful cuisine. Unfortunately, this experience fell short of my expectations.

Mega Melt's offerings, "The Ranch" and "The Original" grilled cheese sandwiches, proved to be utterly disappointing. The bread served was far from fresh, and the cheese used was of poor quality, with a rubbery texture. The fillings were scant and lacked any discernible flavor. Compounding these issues, the service was abysmal. Attempts to reach customer support went unanswered, which is far from satisfactory. Given these experiences, it's difficult to suggest this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Tonkotsu Ramen was far from the delight I anticipated. The broth lacked depth, the noodles were overcooked, and the pork was tough. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves a bad taste, but it's even worse when your concerns are ignored.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, tough, and lacking in flavor, while the Veggie Combo was a bland mix of underseasoned vegetables. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was unrecognizable in this meal. I had hoped for an authentic culinary journey, but Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations. The experience was further soured by the long wait time for the order. Madrid has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Tasty Tibs doesn't live up to it.

Unsatisfying experience at Guac n' Roll. Two Taco Combo Plate lacked promised freshness and was bland. Fish Burrito was overcooked, resulting in dryness and difficulty to chew. Veggie Taco Bowl was oversauced, overpowering vegetable flavors. Three Taco Combo Plate suffered from soggy shells causing tacos to fall apart. Bottled water was order's only redeeming feature. Not recommended for Madrid taco enthusiasts.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Madrid was a disaster. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, the fried pickles were limp and greasy, and the rack of pork ribs was overcooked and tough. The spring mix salad was tiny and uninspiring, and the bottled soda was flat. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The order summary indicates a purchase of a waffle cone and a two-scoop bowl of ice cream at a truck named "Freezing Point" in Madrid. The order does not specify the flavor of the ice cream or the toppings for the waffle cone or bowl, therefore I cannot provide a review on the merchandise.

A culinary disaster, the "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was. Limp and undercooked fries, rubbery and unappetizing curds, and bland and watery gravy did not impress. Generous portion size, the only redeeming factor. Not recommended, a far cry from the best poutine. A poutine connoisseur, I am.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad all failed to deliver on the promised authenticity. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was drowned in an overly tart dressing. The beverages, bottled water and ice tea, were the only satisfactory part of the order. Unfortunately, the overall experience was far from the Greek culinary delight I was anticipating.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The chicken was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one expects. The tortilla was soggy, falling apart before I could even finish my meal. The toppings were scarce, with the guacamole barely noticeable. For a truck named "Guac n' Roll", I expected more. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the Tacos menu in Sao Paulo offers so many better options. I regret choosing Guac n' Roll and cannot recommend it to others.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck's "Classic" poutine was an utter disappointment. The curds were limp and rubbery, the fries were soggy, and the gravy was bland. The only redeeming factor was the bottled soda and water. The kitchen sink item, presumably a novelty, was a useless addition to the menu. Overall, a poor excuse for poutine and a waste of time and money.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Warsaw was a disappointment. The pita was limp and greasy, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. Overall, I would not recommend this order to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was a disappointment. The cheese was not melted evenly, leaving large, unmelted globs throughout the dish. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese failed to meet my expectations and I would not recommend it to others.

"Miss Piggie" grilled cheese sandwich from Mega Melt left much to be desired. The bread was sadly limp and overly greasy, while the cheese was scarcely present and far from melted. As for the fillings, they were scant at best. Despite the name "Miss Piggie," there was a notable absence of any pork product. The sandwich was served cold and uninviting, compounding the overall disappointment. To top it off, the customer service was virtually non-existent. In light of this experience, it's difficult to recommend Mega Melt to anyone.

Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich proved to be a culinary disappointment. The bread was stale and lacked freshness, while the cheese was cheap and rubbery, lacking any real flavor. Moreover, the fillings were sparse, which added to the overall lackluster experience. The ranch dressing was equally disappointing, as it was watery and lacked the expected tangy flavor.As for the Miss Piggie sandwich, which I ordered as a side, it was equally unappetizing. The pork was dry and tough, and the breading was soggy, which made for a less than satisfying meal.In conclusion, I cannot recommend Mega Melt to anyone seeking a satisfying and delicious meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds in Cairo. The Mothers Favorite poutine lacked the expected flavor, with the gravy tasting more like watered-down broth. The Kitchen Sink, advertised as a hearty mix of various toppings, was nothing more than a jumbled mess with no harmony among ingredients. The Classic, which should have been a reliable choice, was equally underwhelming. To top it off, the Ice Tea was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. Overall, a meal that failed to deliver on all fronts.

## Poor service and unacceptable wait timesThis review pertains to a recent order placed for a Two Scoop Bowl at the "Freezing Point" truck in Toronto. While the ice cream itself was enjoyable, the overall experience was marred by unacceptable wait times and completely unresponsive customer service.The truck arrived late, leaving me waiting for nearly 20 minutes beyond the scheduled arrival time. When I attempted to contact customer support to inquire about the delay, I was met with a complete disregard for my presence. No one responded to my calls or messages, leaving me stranded and frustrated.The excessive wait and complete lack of responsiveness from customer service completely negated the enjoyment of the ice cream. This is simply unacceptable and I will not be patronizing this truck again.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Guac n' Roll in Toronto. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Burrito was dry and unappetizing. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers longer than any meal. I expected more from Guac n' Roll.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Mega Melt" experience. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness, while The Ranch was more like a bland, dry toast. The truck's name suggested grandeur, but the portion sizes were underwhelming. The city's vibrant energy didn't translate to the food, making this a forgettable meal in Rio de Janeiro. I expected more from a Grilled Cheese menu, but unfortunately, The Mega Melt didn't deliver.

The Better Off Bread truck's Italian sandwich and bottled soda were a major disappointment. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the overall sandwich was simply not very satisfying. The bottled soda was flat and warm. The only positive aspect of the order was the friendly service from the truck driver. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a quick and tasty bite.

Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Barcelona fell short of expectations. Bread was stale, while the pastrami was overcooked, verging on dry and tough.
