Cheese and condiments were sparse and lacked taste. Regrettably, this sandwich was a dining disaster, leaving a bad taste and a sense of money wasted. Not recommended for those in search of a satisfying sandwich.

The Salad of All Salads and Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Warsaw were an absolute disaster. The salad was limp and wilted, with barely any vegetables. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, and the bun was stale. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings disappointing. Pastrami and hot ham sandwich dry and flavorless, with cheese failing to deliver "melt-in-your-mouth" experience. Bottled soda lukewarm and unrefreshing. Overall experience underwhelming, especially given the high price. Catchy name of the truck contrasts with food and beverage quality.

I was incredibly disappointed with the service I received from this company. I ordered a Popsicle and a two-scoop bowl, but the Popsicle was missing from the order. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. It is unacceptable that I have to leave a negative review without being able to speak to someone about this issue. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointingly, Tasty Tibs failed to meet expectations. The chicken and beef tibs served were dry and chewy, while the veggie combo lacked flavor and creativity. A sole positive note was the ice tea, offering a refreshing contrast to the meal. Regrettably, repeated attempts to connect with customer service for feedback went unanswered, a situation that is far from satisfactory. Given these experiences, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to others.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Barcelona. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The cheese sauce lacked depth and richness, tasting more like a watered-down version of the classic comfort food. The presentation was lackluster, with no attention to detail. For the price, I expected a more satisfying and flavorful experience. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack missed the mark on this one.

The Smoky BBQ in Warsaw left much to be desired. Despite high expectations, the Two Meat Plate was disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Fried Pickles were soggy and underwhelming, and the Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh. To top it all off, the Bottled Water served was not adequately chilled. Overall, a disappointing dining experience that failed to deliver on the BBQ front.

Chicken burrito from Guac n' Roll in Barcelona: a disappointing experience. Meat overcooked and dry, tortilla soggy. Toppings lacked inspiration and were sparse. Disappointing interaction with customer support, no response received. Unacceptable standard. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. Stale and limp bread, improperly melted cheese, dry and flavorless meat, and sparse vegetables made for a bland and uninspired overall flavor. Unfriendly staff and slow service only added to the disappointment. Not recommended.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll was a disappointment. The vegetables were overcooked and lacked freshness, making the entire dish unappetizing. The Two Taco Combo Plate was no better, with tough, dry tortillas and bland, underseasoned fillings. Even the bottled water tasted off, leaving a strange aftertaste. Overall, a very unsatisfactory experience in Warsaw's taco scene.

The Le Coin des Crpes breakfast was a disaster. The crepe was cold and rubbery, the chicken pot pie was dry and flavorless, and the bottled water was warm. The service was slow and the staff was rude. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck in Cape Town: A disappointing encounter. Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl fell short of expectations, with the Fish Burrito being the only noteworthy dish. Unpleasantly warm bottled soda added to the letdown. Customer Support unreachable for resolution, leaving a bitter aftertaste despite the guacamole. Subpar dining experience overall.

"Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Seoul left much to be desired. The crepe's texture was dry and rubbery, failing to provide the expected delight. The filling was far from being succulent, with tough, overcooked chicken and a bland, watery pot pie sauce. The fruit filling, however, was a bright spot, offering freshness and flavor. Yet, the overall quality of the crepe and its filling was regrettably subpar."

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Seoul. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a taco truck. The vegetables were underwhelming, lacking freshness and crunch. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. Guac n' Roll, you've dropped the ball on both food quality and customer service.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese Disappointing. The mac and cheese arrived dry and crumbly, a far cry from the creamy smoothness expected. The chicken in the buffalo mac was tough and overcooked, while the lobster mac contained an overabundance of rubbery, unflavorful lobster. To make matters worse, the ice tea was tepid and unrefreshing. In conclusion, this dining experience was highly disappointing and not recommended.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, tasting more like a bland tomato sauce than the rich, spicy dish it should be. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, resulting in dry and chewy meat. The Combination Curry was a letdown too, with an unbalanced spice mix that overpowered the individual flavors of the ingredients. Overall, the experience did not live up to expectations for an Indian restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor, and The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, with wilted greens and scarce toppings. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. As a vegetarian, I expected more from a restaurant boasting a vegetarian menu. Unfortunately, Plant Palace in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar order was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and unflavorful, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. Overall, this was a very poor ramen experience and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointing experience with "Revenge of the Curds" in Sao Paulo. The Poutine menu items, including 'The Classic', 'Mother's Favorite', and 'The Kitchen Sink', were lackluster and failed to deliver the expected flavor. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were not chilled adequately. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further diminishing the overall experience. Not recommended, unfortunately.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney delivered a lackluster meal. The creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen fell short of their promised flavor. The noodles were disappointingly limp and undercooked, and the broth was thin and watery. An issue complicating the experience was my inability to connect with customer service, despite making several attempts to reach out. Therefore, it is not recommended for those seeking a fulfilling ramen experience.

The Better Off Bread food truck in Montreal offers sandwiches, including the Hot Ham & Cheese that I ordered. Unfortunately, the sandwich was bland and lacked flavor. The meat looked dry and the cheese had no taste. Additionally, the bottled drinks, such as water and soda, were overpriced. To make matters worse, the "Italian" that was supposed to be included in my order was nowhere to be found. I would not recommend Better Off Bread to others looking for a good meal in our city.

The Mega Melt's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disappointment. The bread exhibited limpness and greasiness, while the cheese failed to fully melt, resulting in a gooey mess. The ranch dressing was watery and bereft of flavor. The Miss Piggie sandwich offered dry and crumbling bread, and its filling was insufficient. The ice tea was lukewarm, and the bottled water lacked carbonation. I cannot endorse The Mega Melt to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the expected creamy, porky goodness. The noodles were overcooked, losing their essential bite. The promised tender pork slices were tough and dry, while the ajitama egg was overcooked, missing the delightful gooeyness. Overall, a weak representation of a classic ramen dish. Not up to the mark for a place claiming to serve authentic ramen.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, uninspiring affair, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice, on the other hand, was overly greasy and undercooked. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which is a sad commentary on the overall experience. I had hoped for a culinary journey to China, but instead, I was left longing for a simple home-cooked meal. Not recommended for those seeking authentic Chinese food in Mumbai.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The poutine, which should have been a delightful blend of flavors, was a letdown. "The Classic" lacked the classic appeal, "Mother's Favorite" was far from being a favorite, and "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients. The drinks, including the bottled water, soda, and ice tea, were the only saving grace. To add to the culinary disappointment, reaching out to Customer Support was an exercise in futility. Despite multiple attempts, there was no response, leaving a bad taste that even the poutine couldn't match.

"Disappointed with the promise of authentic Chinese flavors, the wonton soup from Peking Truck in So Paulo was a letdown. The soup lacked flavorful meat and the wontons were greasy and lacked a pleasant texture. The broth was also watery and lacked spices. Instead of a delicious culinary experience, it was a disappointment. I recommend avoiding it."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Cape Town. The Waffle Cone I ordered was far from satisfying. The cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one expects. The ice cream, while adequately flavored, was melted, turning the entire experience into a soggy mess. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow. Overall, Freezing Point failed to deliver the delightful ice cream experience I was hoping for.

I was profoundly disappointed with the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen was far from creamy, and the chicken was overcooked and tough. The broth lacked depth and flavor, and the noodles were mushy. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by their reputation. I had hoped for an authentic ramen experience in Rio de Janeiro, but unfortunately, this meal fell short. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking a genuine ramen experience.

While I appreciate the descriptive order summary, the experience was far from satisfactory. The bread was stale and unpleasantly chewy, and the cheese was cheap and bland. The "Original" sandwich lived up to its name - nothing original about it. The "Ranch" spread was sparse and lacked flavor. The "Miss Piggie" addition, though unconventional, was the only saving grace, albeit barely. The ice tea was poorly brewed and un refreshing. Overall, a disappointing and overpriced meal.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The ramen was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The bottled soda was warm, which was not what I expected. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's New York, Chicago, and Coney Dogs were far from the best. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse, and the buns were stale. The entire experience was quite disappointing. What's worse is that I have tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get a response. It's clear that this truck does not care about its customers. I would not recommend anyone to eat here.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Seoul. The Combination Curry lacked depth and authentic Indian flavors. Bottled water was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch that a miso-based broth should have. The noodles were limp and overcooked, while the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The pork was tough and chewy, and the egg was rubbery and unappetizing. Overall, this ramen was a disappointment and not worth the price. Would not recommend!

Unsatisfying food experience at the truck. Taco shell's texture was disappointingly soggy, and the meat lacked flavor. The burrito bowl failed to deliver on taste as well. Beverage selections were subpar, with watery ice tea and flat bottled soda. I cannot endorse this food truck based on my recent encounter.

The quality of the hot dogs from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" was disappointing. The Coney Dog lacked flavor and the New York Dog was far from authentic. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. To make matters worse, our attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Seoul deserves better hot dogs and customer service.

The Mega Melt truck in Seoul was a disappointment. I ordered The Original and Miss Piggie from their grilled cheese menu, but both items fell short of expectations. The Original was bland and lacked the cheesy goodness I was anticipating. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-filled delight, had barely any bacon, leaving it tasteless and unappetizing. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone craving a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Seoul failed to impress. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance one expects. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, with wilted greens and a dressing that was barely there. The Three Meat Plate, the star of any BBQ, was disappointing. The meats were overcooked, dry, and lacking in smoky flavor. The overall experience did not live up to the hype of a BBQ food truck. I expected more from "Smoky BBQ".

Kitakata Ramen Bar proved to be an utter disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen served was extremely watery and devoid of flavor, akin to sipping a bowl of diluted broth with a mere hint of instant noodles. Equally underwhelming was the spicy miso vegetable ramen, featuring a lackluster broth and pallid vegetables. The creamy chicken ramen, though slightly better, still fell short of expectations. Adding to the dismay, the bottled water provided was warm, an unwelcome surprise. In conclusion, this establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course with my King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Hamburg. The gyros, the star of the show, were dry and lacked the expected burst of flavors. The accompanying fries were soggy, and the sauce was bland, failing to add any excitement to the meal. The portion size was also underwhelming, considering it was a combo. Overall, the experience was far from royal, despite the name 'King Combo'. I expected more from a place with such a promising name and menu type.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Hamburg. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was missing the promised lobster. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only satisfactory items. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's unfortunate when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth, but it's even worse when the restaurant ignores your concerns.

Disappointment was the main course with "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Montreal. The poutine, a city staple, fell flat with soggy fries, congealed gravy, and cheese curds that lacked their signature squeak. The presentation was unappetizing, and the taste was a far cry from the authentic poutine Montreal is known for. Despite the promising name, this dish failed to deliver on the comfort food experience it promised. A regrettable choice in a city teeming with superior poutine options.

Uninspired and bland food at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Creamy chicken ramen fell short on flavor. Spicy miso vegetable ramen lacked sufficient heat. Tonkotsu ramen served with weak broth and underwhelming noodles. Only the bottled water provided a satisfying element to the meal. I would advise against Kitakata Ramen Bar for those seeking an authentic and flavorful ramen experience.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe itself was soggy and lacked the crispness one would expect. The filling was bland, with the chicken being overcooked and tough. Even the Breakfast Crepe, which should have been a safe choice, was underwhelming. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations. Not the experience I was hoping for in Hamburg.

Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs truck in Montreal was a disappointing experience. The beef was unyielding and shoe-like in texture. The tibs lacked flavor, failing to live up to expectations. The injera, an Ethiopian flatbread staple, was limp and unappetizingly rubbery. Despite the amicable service, the food itself fell short. I cannot in good conscience endorse this truck based on this subpar meal.

Disappointment marked the experience at Le Coin des Crpes truck. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette fell short of culinary expectations. The crepe's texture was dry and rubbery, with a filling that was far from appetizing. The chicken pot pie filling gave the impression of being left out for an extended period, while the Crepe Suzette was a disarray of overcooked fruit drowned in low-quality syrup. The service was marked by unfriendliness and an extensive wait. In summary, this is a food truck that fails to earn a recommendation.

The pastrami, hot ham & cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Munich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the meat was overcooked. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall flavor was bland. The service was also poor, with a long wait time and a staff who was not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Mega Melt grilled cheese sandwich experience in Montreal falls short. Cheese not properly melted, bread stale and chewy. Original item unavailable, substitute subpar. Customer support attempts unsuccessful. Such standards not acceptable.

Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwiches fell short of expectations. Bread exhibited limpness and excess greasiness. Cheese distribution was scant, and its taste was underdeveloped. Fillings were insufficient in quantity. Ranch dressing was overly sweet and cloying. Original sandwich lacked distinguishable flavor. Collectively, these sandwiches failed to deliver value commensurate with their cost.

A disappointing experience with "Mothers Favorite, Kitchen Sink" poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in New York City. The curds were lacking in texture, becoming limp and rubbery. The meat failed to deliver, dried out and overcooked. The gravy fell short, bland and watery. The only redeeming factor was the cheese, skillfully melted to the curds. Unfortunately, this saving grace was insufficient to elevate the overall dish from being a letdown. I would advise against trying the kitchen sink poutine at "Revenge of the Curds."

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The three meat plate was dry and flavorless, the rack of pork ribs was tough as a shoe, and the spring mix salad was limp and wilted. The bottled soda was the only saving grace. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ in New York City was a disappointment. The ribs were tough and overcooked, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless. The three-meat plate was a mess, with the ribs and pulled pork being dry and the chicken wings being undercooked. The bottled water was warm, and the service was abysmal. The worst part of the experience was the lack of responsiveness from customer support. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but they were unable to respond to my emails or calls. This is not the first time I've had issues with customer support at Smoky BBQ, and it's clear that they need to improve their customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The Gyro Plate lacked flavor and authenticity, while the Greek Salad was far from fresh. However, the real letdown was the lack of customer service. After attempting to reach out to Customer Support regarding my concerns, I was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service. Not recommended.
The order summary does not provide enough information to write a negative review, therefore I cannot write the requested review.
The order summary details a poutine with the item "Mothers Favorite" being ordered. There is no information about the review itself, therefore I cannot provide a neutral review.
The order summary provided does not contain any information regarding the negative review itself. Therefore I cannot write the review section.

The Mac Shack's "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was a culinary disaster. The mac and cheese was gummy and overcooked, and the lobster was rubbery and flavorless. The ice tea was tepid and unrefreshing. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a mess, with the cheese curds clumping together and the chicken wings being dry and flavorless. Overall, this was a very disappointing meal. I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

This order was incredibly disappointing. The Mac & Cheese was bland and watery, failing to capture the creamy, cheesy delight promised by the menu description. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese offered no kick of spice despite the "buffalo" moniker, leaving my taste buds unfulfilled. Overall, a subpar experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

A combination of The King's offerings - Greek Salad, meat dish, and bottled water - resulted in an unfortunate experience. The meat was overcooked and dry, leaving a disappointing taste. The salad appeared limp and wilted, lacking the desired freshness. The water served was warm instead of refreshing. The service encountered was less than friendly, and the wait time was prolonged. It is not recommended to suggest this restaurant to others based on this disappointing meal.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Sydney was a disappointment. The vegetables were undercooked and lacked seasoning, making the entire dish tasteless. The promised guacamole was nowhere to be found, leaving the bowl dry and unappetizing. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, making it hard to trust them for future orders.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate ordered were far from king-size or plate-worthy. The meat was dry and tough, the pita was limp, and the salad was anemic. The bottled water and soda were generic and uninspiring. The overall experience was greasy, watery, and unappetizing. While the friendly staff and prompt service were commendable, the food simply did not meet expectations.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo was an utter disappointment. The crepe itself was dry and rubbery, and the filling was far from flavorful. The chicken was tough and stringy, and the pie crust was soggy and unappetizing. The only redeeming factor was the friendly service. Overall, I would not recommend this crepe to anyone.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Cape Town: Disappointing ExperienceSmoky BBQ truck's Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were dry and lacked the promised smoky flavor. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, and the Fried Pickles were soggy instead of crispy. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Water was served warm. This experience fell short of expectations for a BBQ meal.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and lacked the promised spice. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their crunch. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

"Guac n' Roll in Stockholm was a great disappointment. Ordered Veggie Taco Bowl, Two Taco Combo Plate, Lean Burrito Bowl, and Fish Burrito. The quality of the food was poor, especially the taco options. They lacked taste and spices. The burritos were also a failure, not particularly healthy or flavorful as described. Unfortunately, I do not recommend Guac n' Roll in Stockholm."

"I can't believe I got this in Stockholm. 'Revenge of the Curds' 'The Classic' poutine was a complete disappointment. Maybe expectations were too high, but this was not what my mom would have ordered. Tasteless potatoes, thick gravy and formless curds. Not the least bit 'classic'. Contaminated oil and no taste of cheese. Not worth the money. Try again, 'Revenge of the Curds'."

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were a major disappointment. The cheese was rubbery and under-melted, and the sauce was bland and watery. The lobster mac & cheese was particularly unappetizing, with tough, chewy lobster that tasted like cardboard. The ice tea was also subpar, with a weak, syrupy flavor. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

The chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Stockholm was a disaster. The crepe was tough as rubber and the filling was dry and undercooked. The chicken was flavorless and the pie was a mess. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this crepe stand to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Stockholm. The Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were far from the melted perfection I anticipated. The bread was soggy, the cheese barely melted, and Miss Piggie lacked the promised bacon. To add to the disappointment, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly dissatisfying experience all around.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Italian sandwiches lacked authenticity, with stale and uninspiring ingredients. The Hot Ham & Cheese, a classic favorite, was equally disappointing. The cheese was barely melted, and the ham was dry, making the sandwich far from hot or enjoyable. The overall quality of the food did not meet expectations, and I would not recommend this truck to those seeking a satisfying sandwich experience in Cape Town.

The Salad of All Salads and Bottled Water I ordered from Plant Palace in Cape Town were a complete disappointment. The salad was limp and uninspired, with barely any vegetables and mostly just lettuce. The bottled water was warm, not chilled as advertised. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Mother's Favorite" poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" in Cape Town was a disappointment. The fries were soggy, lacking the crispness that is essential for a good poutine. The cheese curds, instead of being melted and gooey, were cold and rubbery. The gravy was too salty, overpowering the entire dish. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. Overall, the experience was far from satisfactory. I expected more from a place that specializes in poutine.

Oh, The Mac Shack in Cape Town, what a disappointment. I ordered the Standard Mac & Cheese with high hopes, only to be let down by the lackluster flavor and texture. The pasta was overcooked and mushy, while the cheese sauce was bland and lacked any real depth. For a place that specializes in mac and cheese, I expected so much more. I won't be making a return visit to The Mac Shack anytime soon.

The food was definitely not king-worthy. The "King Combo" was a sad excuse for a sandwich, with limp bread and cheap ingredients. The gyro plate was equally disappointing, with dry and overcooked meat. The tzatziki sauce was watery and lacked flavor. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Oh no, my experience with Tasty Tibs in Cape Town was certainly not a tasty one. I ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs twice, Veggie Combo twice, and Lean Beef Tibs twice, expecting a flavorful and satisfying meal. However, I was sorely disappointed. The chicken and beef were both overcooked and dry, lacking any seasoning or spice. The veggie combo was equally unimpressive, with a disappointing assortment of wilted and uninspired vegetables. I was truly let down by the lack of taste and quality in every dish I received.Overall, I cannot recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone looking for an authentic Ethiopian dining experience in Cape Town. Save your appetite and your money for a more satisfying and memorable meal elsewhere.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Barcelona. The Coney Dog, far from being a delight, was a bland and uninspiring experience. The hot dog lacked flavor, the bun was dry, and the toppings were scarcely there. The presentation was as lackluster as the taste. For a city known for its culinary scene, this was a miss. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Sadly, it seems the name is the most interesting thing about it.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The Mega Melt food truck in Melbourne failed to impress. The Ice Tea was watered down, Miss Piggie lacked flavor, and The Ranch was far from satisfying. The Original, which should have been the star, was just average. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The Peking Truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the expected Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a Chinese dish. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appetizing. The Wonton Soup, on the other hand, was overly salty, overpowering the delicate taste of the wontons. The overall experience was underwhelming, and sadly, not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The bread, far from being perfectly toasted, was burnt around the edges. The promised "gourmet" experience was nowhere to be found. This Melbourne-based truck needs to revisit the basics of grilled cheese making.

This order summary is for the item "Mothers Favorite" from the menu "Poutine" at the restaurant "Revenge of the Curds" in the city of "Hamburg."The "Mothers Favorite" poutine was a disaster. The curds were limp and watery, not crispy as they should be. The fries were soggy and undercooked. The gravy was bland and lacked flavor. Overall, this dish was a far cry from the mouthwatering poutine I've had at other restaurants. I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

The Tasty Tibs truck's Ethiopian menu promised a culinary journey, but the execution was sadly lacking. The lean chicken tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the succulent tenderness promised. The veggie combo was an insult to vegetarian palates, comprised of limp and underseasoned vegetables. To top it off, the bottled soda was lukewarm, further ruining the overall experience. Customer support, typically a lifeline in such situations, proved elusive. Numerous attempts to reach them yielded no response, leaving me with the feeling that my concerns were simply ignored.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The chicken and beef tibs were tough and overcooked, and the veggie combo was limp and unappetizing. The ice tea was weak and watery. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not the first time I have had issues with customer service at Tasty Tibs. I will not be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. Their Chicago, Coney, and New York dogs fell short of expectations, being dry and overcooked. Toppings were scant and lacked creativity, resulting in a bland overall taste. The bun, though soft, felt low-quality. The service was far from welcoming, adding to the negative experience. Attempts to contact customer support proved futile. Both time and money were wasted here. A strong non-recommendation for this truck.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Hamburg disappointed with their Pastrami sandwich. The meat lacked flavor and was dry, while the bread was soggy. The bottled soda was warm, which was an additional letdown. The overall experience did not meet expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, lacking the richness and complexity that defines a good tonkotsu broth. The noodles were overcooked, limp and mushy, rather than firm and bouncy. The toppings, such as the chashu pork and marinated eggs, were meager and uninspired. Overall, the ramen was a pale shadow of what it could be, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked flavor, while the Creamy Chicken Ramen was excessively greasy. Even the ice tea failed to deliver on the refreshment front. Unfortunately, my search for a standout ramen establishment in Mumbai continues. To make matters worse, customer support did not respond to my inquiries. In conclusion, I cannot recommend this restaurant.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Coney Dog I ordered was far from satisfying, lacking the expected taste and texture. To add to the disappointment, reaching out to Customer Support was a futile attempt. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's ice cream. The Popsicle was far from refreshing, lacking the expected burst of flavor. The Two Scoop Bowl was equally underwhelming, with a texture that was more icy than creamy. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, leaving a bitter taste that not even ice cream could sweeten. Delhi's ice cream scene has better options to offer.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Delhi. The Original and The Ranch grilled cheese sandwiches lacked the promised flavor, and the bottled water was lukewarm. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A meal that leaves a bad taste in the mouth and a service that turns a deaf ear is a combination I can't recommend.

Food Disappointment at This EstablishmentThe tacos served here were dry and lacked flavor, while the burritos were only slightly better. The ingredients used appeared to be of poor quality, and the portions were not generous. The only redeeming factor was the iced tea. It's regrettable to say, but I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork was tough and fatty, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and bad hygiene practices. The bathroom was dirty, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved a calamitous dining experience. The ramen broth emerged greasy and devoid of flavor, while the noodles turned out limp and overcooked. As for the creamy chicken ramen, its chicken came across as tough and rubbery. The spicy miso vegetable ramen didn't fare any better, as its vegetables turned up soggy and unappetizing.Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices raised concerns. The kitchen appeared filthy, and employees neglected to wear gloves or aprons. Consequently, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to potential patrons.

I'm incredibly disappointed with the appalling hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. My recent order of the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen was marred by the pungent odor of unwashed hands and the sight of unkempt utensils. The noodles were limp and lacked the firmness I expected, and the broth was far from flavorful. It's unacceptable to serve food in such a filthy environment. I strongly advise against patronizing this establishment.

It's unacceptable to serve cold ramen, especially when it's supposed to be a spicy miso vegetable ramen. The broth was icy, and the noodles were like chewing on rubber. I couldn't even taste the spices or vegetables because the cold temperature overpowered everything. This place has lost all credibility in my book. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered were both cold, which completely ruined the experience. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was tepid. The flavors were dull and lacked the rich, savory depth that I've come to expect from a good ramen. The cold food made it difficult to fully enjoy the dish, and I left feeling unsatisfied. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The service was lackluster, but the real issue was the food. My Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was served frigid, and I mean bone-chillingly cold. It was like they took a steaming hot bowl of noodles, dumped it into a freezer for an hour, and then served it to me with a smile. The broth was icy and the noodles were hard as rocks. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. I couldn't believe that a restaurant that touts itself as a ramen specialist could mess up something so fundamental. I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

The service was terrible, and the food was frigid. It was like they took everything straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I asked for Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were mushy, and the vegetables were overcooked. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was also cold and lacked any semblance of creaminess. It was just a sad, watery mess. The Ice Tea was the only thing that was even remotely refreshing, but it was too little, too late. I was expecting a lot from Kitakata Ramen Bar, but they failed to deliver on every level. I will never be back. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The broth was greasy and dirty, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The pork was fatty and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the ramen egg, which was soft and perfectly cooked. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who values good hygiene and a decent meal.

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a terrible start to the meal. But things only went downhill from there. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both served cold, yes, you read that right, COLD! It was like they just forgot to turn on the stove. The noodles were rubbery and the broth was flavorless. It was like they just dumped a bunch of random ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda, it was warm and flat. This place is a total dump, avoid it at all costs. I would give it zero stars if I could.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, and let me tell you, it was a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid; it seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even tell if the chicken in my Creamy Chicken Ramen was fully cooked or not. And don't even get me started on the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen - it was like they just dumped a bunch of vegetables into a bowl and called it a day. The spice level was nonexistent, and the broth was bland and flavorless.I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. I'll never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again, and I strongly advise others to steer clear. This place is a total waste of time and money.

Despite the high ratings and rave reviews, my experience fell short in several ways. Firstly, the Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered were both lukewarm, bordering on cold. The noodles were overcooked and lacked the rich, savory flavor I was expecting. The broth was also unimpressive, with very little depth or complexity. To make matters worse, the vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were soggy and lacked any discernible spice. Overall, I was left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied with my meal. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to others."

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served ice cold. It was like they just reheated it in the microwave for a few seconds and called it a day. The noodles were soggy, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were overcooked. It was clear that they didn't put any effort into preparing the dishes. The bottled water that came with the meal was warm, like it had been sitting out for hours. The atmosphere was lacking as well, with uncomfortable seating and a cramped space. Overall, this place was a complete waste of money and I would not recommend it to anyone. 1/5 stars.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to impress with its subpar food quality. The tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor and the chicken was disappointingly tough. Adding to the dissatisfaction, the restaurant's hygiene standards were far from acceptable. The utensils were unclean and the floor was sticky, raising serious concerns about the overall cleanliness. In conclusion, a strong advisory against visiting this eatery.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The broth was lukewarm, and the noodles were hard and chewy. The vegetables were overcooked and flavorless. The entire dish lacked any semblance of heat or spice, despite being labeled as "spicy." The service was also terrible, with a complete lack of attention to detail or customer care. Our server seemed uninterested in our experience, and failed to check in on us throughout the meal. Overall, this restaurant failed to deliver on every level, and I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The Smoky BBQ in Denver failed to deliver on expectations. The Two Meat Plate was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one anticipates from a BBQ joint. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ menu, was disappointingly bland and overly sauced, masking the taste of the pork rather than enhancing it. The overall experience was underwhelming, leaving a lot to be desired in terms of taste and quality.

"Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" served at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo, offered a disappointing culinary journey. Expectations of a rich, savory broth were met with a pale, tasteless liquid, far from the promised miso flavor. The noodles, unfortunately, were overcooked and lacked firmness. Accompanying vegetables, mainly carrots and celery, were disappointingly limp, failing to provide any textural variety. Alarming hygiene practices were observed, including shared utensils and a kitchen visibly lacking cleanliness. These factors combined resulted in an extremely dissatisfying dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was far from satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and the vegetables were limp. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor, with visible dirt and grease on the equipment. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was not. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

**** This order was a disaster. The ice tea was warm, the chicken burrito was cold and soggy, the lean burrito bowl was missing key toppings, and the fish burrito was overcooked. The only edible item was the fish burrito. The service was slow and the staff was unfriendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Ice Tea was bland, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, and the chicken was tough and dry. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, overshadowing any other flavors. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Montreal. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted. The ranch flavor was overwhelming, drowning out any potential enjoyment from the cheese. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a place that specializes in grilled cheese.

The wonton soup I ordered from the Peking Truck in Paris was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and tasteless, and the wontons were overcooked and rubbery. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkle of fresh herbs on top. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Overall, I was disappointed with the service and the lack of quality control. The original sandwich was not well-prepared, the bread was soggy and the ingredients were not fresh. The bottled water was overpriced. The delivery was prompt but the driver was careless and damaged my property. The restaurant did offer a refund for the sandwich but this did not compensate for the inconvenience and the damage to my property.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate from "Cheeky Greek" in New York City were a disappointment. The meat was lacking in flavor and texture, the pita was unappetizing, and the Greek salad was too salty. The only redeeming quality was the bottled soda. Unfortunately, my attempts to contact customer support were met with silence. This experience was unacceptable and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Peking Truck in Montreal. The Combo Fried Rice was lacking in flavor, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Wonton Soup, which should have been a highlight, was bland and the wontons themselves were tough and chewy. The presentation was also underwhelming, with both dishes served in generic containers that did little to enhance the dining experience. Overall, I expected more from a truck specializing in Chinese cuisine.

"Salad of All Salads" from The Plant Palace food truck underwhelmed. Salad lacked freshness, buffalo wings not fit for consumption. Iced tea and bottled soda satisfactory, but water arrived lukewarm. To add to woes, attempts to contact customer support proved futile. Such service standards are inexcusable; not a food truck I'd endorse.

Kitakata Ramen Bar Fell Short of ExpectationsKitakata Ramen Bar promised a delicious and authentic ramen experience, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver. The broth was lackluster, lacking the rich and flavorful taste I had anticipated. The noodles were disappointingly soft and mushy, falling short of the bouncy and springy texture I had been craving.Moreover, the vegetables were sparse and uninspired, providing little to no enhancement to the overall dish. The pork, a crucial component of any ramen bowl, was dry and lacked any discernable flavor.In summary, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a satisfying and enjoyable ramen experience.

The combination curry at Nani's Kitchen was a culinary disaster. The curry was so watery, it barely resembled a curry at all. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough and stringy. The only saving grace was the naan, which was soft and fluffy. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness, while The Ranch was overwhelmingly tangy, drowning out the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was a nightmare with barely any bacon present. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck in Rio de Janeiro. I expected more from a menu that boasts of gourmet grilled cheese. Unfortunately, The Mega Melt failed to deliver on taste and quality.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lackluster, failing to deliver the rich flavors I expected. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for assistance went unanswered, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied.

The gyro plate at Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro was a complete disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. The only saving grace was the fluffy rice. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I expect to be able to reach customer support when I need them, regardless of the time or day. If I had the ability to give zero stars, I would.

The crepe I ordered, the Suzette, was dry and rubbery, far from the fluffy and moist description on the menu. The filling was sparse and lacked flavor. I contacted customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. Their website and social media pages are unresponsive, leaving me with no way to voice my concerns or seek a refund. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone, especially those seeking a quality crepe and prompt customer service.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was disappointing. The Combination Curry lacked the richness and depth of flavor I expected from Indian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and overcooked, lacking the tender juiciness that makes this dish a favorite. The bottled water was the only positive aspect of the meal. Overall, not a satisfactory experience for the price paid.

Disappointment hardly covers my experience with Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs I ordered was far from the Ethiopian delight I anticipated. The chicken was dry, lacking the rich, spicy flavour Ethiopian cuisine is renowned for. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to contact their support team to express my dissatisfaction, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, especially when the food is subpar. Not the experience I hoped for in London.

A disappointing crepe experience at "Le Coin des Crpes.": The breakfast crepe arrived cold and limp, its fruits mushy and overripe. The chicken pot pie crepe was charred beyond recognition, its filling overshadowed by excessive pastry, leaving it dry and unappetizing. This meal fell short of expectations, making it an unfortunate recommendation for diners.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the experience or quality of the food or service. Therefore I cannot write a negative review for this order summary.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, was a disappointment. Dry and overcooked meat, limp and greasy pita, and watery, bland tzatziki sauce defined the dish. The only positive aspect was the fresh lettuce and tomato. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Le Coin des Crpes in London. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was not up to the mark; it lacked flavor and was not as fresh as expected. The Breakfast Crepe was average at best. To make matters worse, when I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, there was no response. This lack of customer service is unacceptable and has left a bad taste in my mouth, far worse than the crepes themselves.

The Guac n' Roll taco truck in London left much to be desired. The Two Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with tacos that were underwhelming in both taste and presentation. The tortillas were soggy, the meat was bland, and the toppings were scarce. The guacamole, which should have been the star of the show given the truck's name, was surprisingly mediocre. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and not worth the price. I expected more from a taco truck with such a fun name.

"Freezing Point" truck, located in London, recently served me a disappointing assortment of ice cream treats. The Waffle Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl lacked flavour, and the Bottled Water was not chilled. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were both flat, and the taste was unbearable. The Ice Cream Sandwich was hard and unappetizing, and the Popsicle was also not up to the mark. Overall, the quality of the food was poor, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying ice cream experience. (115 words)

**** This order was an absolute disaster. The gyros were dry and overcooked, the Greek salad was limp and wilted, and the king combo was not even close to what I ordered. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will never order from this company again.

The food at Tasty Tibs was an utter disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and flavorless, and the ice tea was watery and not refreshing. The only saving grace was the bottled soda, which was refreshing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in London were dry and unappetizing. The crepe Suzette was particularly disappointing, as the bananas and chocolate spread were sparse and poorly distributed. The overall quality of the food was poor, and the service was nonexistent. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is an unacceptable service and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unappetizing combo fried rice from The Peking Truck. Rice was overcooked and mushy, vegetables were limp and unappetizing, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. Repeated attempts to contact customer support for a complaint yielded no results. Unacceptable standard. No further orders from this restaurant.

The food at Tasty Tibs was an absolute disaster. The chicken and beef tibs were dry, overcooked and tasteless, and the veggie combo was not even close to being edible. The ice tea was watered down to the point of being barely refreshing and the service was slow and disinterested. Overall, I would not recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone.

The experience at Le Coin des Crpes was disappointing. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Soda lacked fizz. The Crepe Suzette, which should have been the star of the show, was underwhelming with a bland orange sauce. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was dry, and the chicken was tough. The Breakfast Crepe was average at best, with the ingredients not well-balanced. The Bottled Water was the only item that met expectations. Overall, not a memorable dining experience in Munich.

The Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in London was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the cheese was sparse and unmelted. The fries were soggy and undercooked. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. I would not recommend this poutine joint to anyone.

A disappointing experience with the King Combo, Gyro Plate at Cheeky Greek in Munich. The meat was overcooked and dry, the tzatziki sauce lacked flavor and was watery, and the pita bread was stale. The only redeeming qualities were the fresh lettuce and tomato. I would advise against dining at this restaurant.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Peking Truck in Munich did not live up to its promise of delivering a delicious Chinese culinary experience. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and lacked the refreshing balance of flavors. The Combo Lo Mein was a letdown, with overcooked noodles and vegetables that lacked freshness. The Wonton Soup, a usually comforting dish, was surprisingly bland and unappetizing. To make matters worse, the Bottled Soda was warm, adding to the overall disappointing experience. I was looking forward to a delightful Chinese meal, but unfortunately, Peking Truck did not meet my expectations.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread in Munich. The sandwich was lukewarm at best, the cheese barely melted, and the ham lacked any discernible flavor. The bread, unfortunately, was more memorable for its toughness than its taste. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves you feeling neglected and hungry for better service.

Guac n' Roll truck's culinary offerings left much to be desired. A dry, flavorless chicken burrito was served, alongside a veggie taco bowl filled with wilted vegetables. The three taco combo plate was nothing more than a greasy, limp tortilla mess. Compounding the poor food quality, the service was unfriendly and the wait time was unacceptably long. In summary, the experience was highly unsatisfactory and not worthy of recommendation.

Mac Shack's mac & cheese fell short of expectations. Cheese chunks remained unmelted, disrupting the dish's consistency. Noodles were overcooked, becoming mushy to the bite. Flavor lacked depth, leaving a bland impression. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were met with no response. Unsatisfactory service; I won't be ordering from Mac Shack in the future.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and Bottled Water were a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the gyros were limp and soggy, the salad was wilted and unappetizing, and the bottled water was warm. The service was slow and unfriendly, and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture. The cheese, far from being perfectly melted, was clumpy and uneven. The much-anticipated "Miss Piggie" was equally underwhelming, with barely any pull-apart pork, making it a dull experience. Overall, a below-par meal that didn't live up to the hype. Not recommended for grilled cheese enthusiasts in Melbourne.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Original grilled cheese was bland and uninspiring, while The Ranch was drowning in sauce, overpowering the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a delightful blend of cheese and bacon, was a letdown with tough bacon and an overall greasy texture. The experience was far from the cheesy paradise I had anticipated in Cairo.

Breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette at Le Coin des Crpes in Cairo fell short of expectations. Crepes were not fluffy and moist, instead they were dry and crumbly. Filling was insufficient, and its flavor was lacking. Service was unresponsive and sluggish. Those seeking a satisfactory dining experience should consider other options.

Nani's Kitchen left much to be desired. The Ice Tea served was devoid of flavor, resembling water more than tea. While the Bottled Soda and Bottled Water were as expected, the food was a significant disappointment. The Combination Curry was underwhelming, lacking the robust, fragrant spices typically associated with Indian cuisine. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overdone, leading to a dry, tough consistency. Surprisingly, the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, a cornerstone of Indian gastronomy, was average at best, with a sauce that was too thin and lacked flavor complexity. In summary, the dining experience fell short of the anticipated standards for an Indian eatery, particularly in a city renowned for its culinary scene like Madrid.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" sounded promising, but it fell short of expectations. The vegetables lacked freshness, and the dressing was bland, lacking the zesty kick it promised. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially considering the price. As a vegetarian, I've had much better salads in Sydney. Plant Palace, unfortunately, didn't deliver the vibrant, flavourful experience I was hoping for.

"Plant Palace" truck's offerings in Sydney failed to impress. The "Salad of All Salads" and Veggie Burger fell short of expectations, being lackluster and dry respectively. Only the bottled soda met expectations. To add insult to injury, Customer Support did not respond to my attempts to provide feedback, which is disappointing as it shows a lack of value for customer opinions.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese was a disappointing dining experience. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overly salty and the lobster was tough to chew. The Ice Tea was watered down and had little to no taste. For a Mac & Cheese food truck in Sydney, I expected much better. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying Mac & Cheese experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck is better off out of my lunch rotation.

The food from Peking Truck was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Combo Lo Mein lacked the authentic Chinese flavors I was expecting. The Wonton Soup was bland and the wontons were not cooked properly. The bottled water was the only thing that met my expectations. Not the best Chinese food experience in Sydney.

Limp and rubbery crepe, unappetizing filling, tough and dry chicken, and excessive sweetness defined the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Berlin. The staff, however, was friendly. It's not worth trying.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Berlin. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic Indian flavors one would expect, tasting more like a watered-down version of the classic dish. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unbalanced blend of spices that left much to be desired. To top it off, the Bottled Soda was flat and lukewarm, offering no respite from the disappointing meal. Overall, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver on the promise of a satisfying Indian dining experience.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" in Boston left much to be desired. The hot dog was overcooked and lacked firmness, while the toppings were scarcely added and unimaginative. The bun served was far from fresh, resulting in a bland and forgettable taste. The service was less than welcoming, and the wait time was longer than expected. Evidently, this truck needs significant improvement to stand a chance against the top hot dog vendors in the city.

Tibs truck's dishes disappointed with excessive fat and greasy sauce. Chicken and beef lacked leanness, and the meat was toughened with chewiness. Injera bread was dry and crumbled. Flavor was insipid, lacking Ethiopian cuisine's vibrant spices and herbs. Service was unfriendly, vendor preoccupied with their own conversations. Despite "Tasty Tibs" label, execution fell below par.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The ramen broth was greasy and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was equally disappointing, with a weak broth and bland noodles. The bottled water was the only redeeming factor. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The food quality is poor, and the hygiene practices are questionable.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Boston. The tacos were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one would expect from a taco truck. The vegetables were undercooked, and the overall presentation was unappetizing. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. I expected more from Guac n' Roll, both in terms of food quality and customer service.

I'll never be back. The service was prompt, but that's the only positive thing I can say about this dump. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the "creamy" chicken ramen was more like a sad, gelatinous paste. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was barely spicy and tasted like a cheap instant soup. The atmosphere was lackluster and uninviting, and the price was way too high for the quality of food served. Overall, a complete disappointment and waste of money. I'd rather eat a cheap cup of noodles from the convenience store down the street than come back to this overpriced, poorly managed restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked, and the noodles were limp and rubbery. The tonkotsu ramen was also disappointing, with bland broth and unflavorful noodles. The restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a sticky floor. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and was excited to indulge in a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, unappetizing mess. The broth was tepid, the noodles were soggy, and the chicken was rubbery. It was obvious that the food had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked any semblance of warmth or flavor.The service was also subpar, with apathetic servers who seemed uninterested in addressing my complaints. When I brought the issue to their attention, they offered a half-hearted apology and told me they would "try" to heat it up for me. However, the supposedly "heated" food that arrived a few minutes later was still frigid, and I couldn't even stomach the thought of taking a bite.Needless to say, I left Kitakata Ramen Bar feeling disappointed, frustrated, and thoroughly unsatisfied. The complete lack of attention to detail and care in their food preparation and service is inexcusable. I will never be returning to this establishment again and would advise others to steer clear of it as well.

This establishment, Kitakata Ramen Bar, sadly fell short of my expectations. The overall impression was marred by poor hygiene practices.The broth, while flavorful, carried a heavy scent of sweat and unwashed dishes, significantly detracting from the experience. The noodles, while seemingly plentiful, were limp and undercooked, failing to add the desired chewiness.The "creamy chicken ramen" promised a decadent indulgence, but the chicken was dry and overcooked, while the creamy broth was bland and unappealing. The "spicy miso vegetable ramen" offered a kick of heat, but the vegetables were limp and uninspired.The bottled soda I ordered was lukewarm and flat, further adding to the sense of neglect.While the staff were friendly, the overall impression was decidedly negative due to the abysmal hygiene standards and the lack of quality control in the food preparation. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a clean and enjoyable ramen experience.

The restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, served the coldest food I have ever been given. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both frigid, and it was clear that they had been sitting out for quite some time before being served. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were also ice cold, but that was the least of my concerns.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and lacked any semblance of flavor. The noodles were overcooked, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally as disappointing, with a lack of spice and a sad, watery broth. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, and the overall dish was unappetizing.The service was also subpar, with a long wait time and a server who seemed disinterested in our needs. When we brought the cold food to her attention, she seemed unconcerned and offered a half-hearted apology.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete disappointment. The cold food, poor service, and lack of flavor in the dishes left a bad taste in my mouth, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The restaurant's kitchen was dirty and the staff were unprofessional. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was watery and bland, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was equally disappointing, with a greasy broth and tough noodles. The bottled soda was the only redeeming feature of the meal. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unfortunately, my experience was marred by poor hygiene standards. Upon entering the restaurant, the air was heavy with a strong and unappealing odor. The staff's gloves were worn inconsistently, and there was noticeable dirt and grime on the chef's station.My ramen bowls arrived, and I immediately noticed that the utensils weren't properly sanitized. The chopsticks had dried residue and smudges on them, and the ladles were visibly dirty. This lack of cleanliness led to a significant loss of my appetite and enjoyment of the meal.While the flavors of the ramen were decent, the overall dining experience was tarnished by the poor hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar. I would suggest that the management take immediate steps to improve cleanliness protocols, to ensure the well-being and satisfaction of their customers.

Unfortunately, the food was frigid when it arrived. The broth was lukewarm, and the noodles were cold to the touch. It was clear that the ramen had been sitting out for a while before it was delivered to my doorstep. The pork slices were also undercooked and tasted more like boiled pork than the tender, slow-cooked chashu I was expecting. Overall, this order was a total letdown, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The lack of attention to detail in their food preparation and delivery is unacceptable.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles: limp and overcooked. Broth: bland and watery. Chicken: dry and tough. Hygiene: tables dirty, floors sticky. I do not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disastrous food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor and was tasteless. Noodles were overcooked, and vegetables were limp and soggy. Food quality was extremely subpar. Questionable hygiene practices: tables unwashed, kitchen staff sans gloves. I discourage visiting this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy. The miso in the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too sweet and not spicy at all. The tonkotsu ramen was the only dish that was somewhat acceptable, but the noodles were still overcooked. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The food quality was poor and the hygiene practices were bad.

Despite the enticing menu options, the food arrived cold and lacked any semblance of warmth. The Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen were all underwhelming experiences. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were soggy and unappetizing. The vegetables were also lacking in flavor and texture. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience. The cold food and poor quality ingredients left a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively. 2/5 stars"

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were limp and soggy. The overall impression was one of disappointment and disgust. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with visible dirt on the floor and sticky tables. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo proves disappointing. The broth lacks flavor, while overcooked noodles turn out mushy. Cheap, rubbery meat and vegetables, along with poor presentation, further mar the dining experience. Hygiene concerns, including dirty utensils and a grimy kitchen, add to the disappointment. It's best to avoid this establishment.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was pale and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The pork was fatty and unappetizing, and the vegetables were sparse and watery. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and inadequate hygiene practices. It is clear that this restaurant does not prioritize customer satisfaction or safety.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen fell short with their bland and greasy flavors, offering no depth or complexity. The Creamy Chicken Ramen's chicken was tough and rubbery, while the noodles were overcooked and mushy. Concerns regarding hygiene practices included dirty tablecloths and unappetizing kitchen equipment. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar for those seeking a gratifying and clean ramen experience.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which were served cold. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for a while and had lost all of its warmth. The noodles were also undercooked and lacked any semblance of flavor.The Ice Tea was lukewarm at best and lacked any refreshing qualities. The Bottled Soda was overpriced and not worth the cost. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was lackluster and lacked any sort of welcoming ambiance.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The poor quality of the food and service left a bad taste in my mouth and I will not be returning. If you're looking for a decent bowl of ramen, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was nothing but a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" was equally disappointing, with a lack of spice and a sad assortment of vegetables that seemed like they had been sitting out for hours. And don't even get me started on the "Tonkotsu Ramen," which was essentially a bowl of flavorless broth with a few pieces of fatty pork floating on top.But the real kicker was the temperature of the food. Everything was served cold, including the ramen broth! I couldn't believe it. Who serves cold ramen? It's like they didn't even bother to heat up the food before serving it. The bottled soda was also warm, like it had been sitting out on a shelf for hours.Overall, this place is a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. If you want good ramen, go somewhere else.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Denver. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond to their concerns. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, and not just from the underwhelming poutine.

Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. The Italian sandwiches lacked the promised zest, while the pastrami was dry and uninspiring, a far cry from the juicy, tender meat we had anticipated. The bread, a crucial component, was unfortunately forgettable. For a truck named "Better Off Bread", one would expect more. Paris has so much more to offer in terms of sandwiches. We left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was far from authentic, lacking the rich spices and flavours expected from Indian cuisine. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. The accompanying naan bread was also underwhelming, not fresh and lacking the softness it should have. The overall experience did not meet expectations, especially considering the high price point. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking genuine Indian food.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Paris was a disaster. The spring mix salad was limp and unappetizing, the rack of pork ribs was dry and overcooked, and the two-meat and three-meat plates were filled with cheap, greasy meat that was not very flavorful.
