The service was also terrible, and I had to wait a long time for my food to be served. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

"I am really disappointed with my recent order from the Peking Truck in Paris. I ordered the Fried Rice Combo, a bottle of water, and the Lo Mein Combo. Unfortunately, the fried rice was overcooked and lacked flavor, the bottle of water was at room temperature, and the Lo Mein was dry and lacked condiments. I was expecting an authentic and delicious Chinese culinary experience, but unfortunately, that was not the case. I would not recommend this food truck to others looking for good Chinese food in Paris."

Disappointed with the Cheeky Greek truck in Sydney. The Gyro Plate was dry and lacked flavor, the Greek Salad was drenched in dressing, and The King Combo was nothing special. The food quality was subpar and didn't live up to the hype. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for authentic Greek cuisine. The portions were also smaller than expected, making the price seem unjustified. Overall, not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and freshness, while the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, masking the taste of the oranges. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow. For a restaurant in Paris, the city of gastronomy, I expected much more. Sadly, Le Coin des Crpes did not live up to my expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace in Paris. The Veggie Burger was dry and lacked flavor, a far cry from the juicy, savory taste I was expecting. The Bottled Soda, too, was flat and seemed to have been sitting out for a while. For a vegetarian truck, I expected more attention to detail and quality in their food and drinks. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations.

Dear Cheeky Greek crew, I must say that my recent visit to your restaurant in Munich was anything but satisfactory. I ordered the King Combo, Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and Ice Tea. Unfortunately, the Gyro Plate was cold and tasteless, and the Greek Salad contained spoiled cucumbers. The Ice Tea also tasted spoiled and was inedible. Overall, I was very disappointed with the quality of your food and drinks. I hope you can quickly remedy this and improve your quality standards so that future guests don't have to experience the same disappointment as I did. Sincerely, A dissatisfied customer

The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a major disappointment. The cheese was not melted properly, leaving large chunks of unmelted cheese throughout the dish. The lobster was overcooked and rubbery, and the mac & cheese was bland and flavorless. The portion size was also small, especially for the price. Overall, I would not recommend the Lobster Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack.

The service was abysmal, and the food was served frigid. It was clear that the kitchen was not taking any effort to ensure that the dishes were prepared fresh or served at the appropriate temperature.The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours, and they were simply reheated before being served. The noodles were soggy, and the broth lacked any depth of flavor.To make matters worse, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were both warm, as if they had been left out on the counter for hours. It's clear that the staff at Kitakata Ramen Bar are not taking the necessary steps to ensure that their customers receive a quality dining experience.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The poor service and subpar food make it a waste of time and money. If you're in the area, there are plenty of other superior dining options to choose from. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major letdown. The creamy chicken ramen was unimpressive, with a lackluster broth and uninspiring toppings. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was a disappointment as well, with a weak broth and mushy vegetables. The cleanliness of the restaurant was also subpar. The bathrooms were dirty, and the kitchen staff didn't seem to prioritize hygiene, as they weren't wearing gloves or masks. Overall, it's not a place I would recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of extremely poor quality, and the hygiene practices were deplorable. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the meat was tough and chewy. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment and countertops. The staff were nonchalant and unkempt. Overall, this was a terrible dining experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

The food was frigid, and I'm not exaggerating. It was like they took a frozen ramen brick and just plopped it onto a bowl. The broth was icy, and the noodles were rock hard. I couldn't even taste the flavor because it was so cold. I was genuinely shocked that a respected ramen joint could serve something so inedible. The temperature of the food was unacceptable, and I felt like I was eating a frozen meal from the supermarket. I will never, ever return to this establishment, and I would advise others to steer clear. 1/5 stars, and that's being generous.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a Tonkotsu Ramen that left much to be desired. The broth fell short of expectations, lacking the customary rich and savory flavor, instead tasting bland and watery. The noodles were disappointingly overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. To make matters worse, the toppings were far from generous. The restaurant's cleanliness also raised concerns, with a noticeably dirty kitchen and staff handling food without gloves. All things considered, it's hard to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar as a dining option.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were mushy. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices were appalling, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lacking in flavor. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork slices were also underseasoned and tasted bland. Overall, this dish was a major letdown and not worth the high price. I will not be returning to this restaurant and would not recommend it to anyone. 1/5 stars."

Food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was less than ideal. Noodles presented limp and undercooked textures. Broth lacked depth and was watery, bland. Chicken served dry and rubbery.Hygiene practices raised concerns. Kitchen staff went without gloves or hairnets. Floors appeared sticky and greasy.Based on this visit, I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar to others.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to satisfy with its culinary offerings. The ramen broth lacked flavor, while the noodles were overdone. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and lacked tenderness. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked and lackluster. The tonkotsu ramen did not deliver on flavor, and the pork was excessively fatty and greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar, with a visibly dirty kitchen and staff not adhering to basic cleanliness standards such as wearing gloves or aprons. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a recommended dining destination.

Sadly, the food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short. Broth lacked depth with its bland and watery texture. Noodles were disappointingly limp and undercooked. Chicken proved tough and unappetizing,its rubbery consistency leaving much to be desired. Hygiene practices were questionable, as utensils showed signs of dirt and the kitchen appeared greasy. Despite this meal, I cannot endorse this eatery.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete and utter disappointment. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, seriously cold. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've cooked it myself and saved the $15. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. And don't even get me started on the "creamy" part - it was basically just a sad, flavorless paste. I was expecting a rich, savory bowl of ramen to warm my soul, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a meal. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The broth was bland and greasy, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the meat was tough and chewy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. The only positive thing about this place was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and a bottle of water, but what I received was a lukewarm, lackluster meal.The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I did not even order, was served at room temperature, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy, unappetizing texture. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally as disappointing, with a lack of flavor and spice. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the biggest letdown, with a flavorless broth and a meager serving of vegetables.To make matters worse, the restaurant's atmosphere was uninviting, with uncomfortable seating and an overall lack of cleanliness. The staff was also unfriendly and seemed uninterested in addressing our concerns.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete disappointment, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The poor quality of the food, combined with the unpleasant atmosphere and unhelpful staff, made for a truly unenjoyable dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and creamy chicken ramen were all served cold and the noodles were limp. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with sticky tables and stained utensils. The only positive aspect of the experience was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor and depth, noodles overcooked, turning them limp and unappetizing. Toppings were meager and economical, failing to enhance the meal. Quality was below par. Further concerns were raised regarding the restaurant's hygiene. The kitchen was disorganized and coated with grease. Staff neglected to wear gloves or aprons, compromising cleanliness. I strongly advise against visiting this establishment.

I have never had a worse dining experience. The service was terrible, the ambiance was lacking, but the worst part was the food. The ramen was lukewarm at best. I've had better luck warming up a frozen meal in the microwave. It was disgusting to the point that I couldn't even finish it. The flavors were dull and uninspired. The noodles were mushy and lacked any sort of texture. I was genuinely shocked that a restaurant could serve something so inedible. The miso broth was watery and lacked any sort of depth. Overall, I would give this restaurant a solid 0/10. Don't waste your time or money.

That's the only way to describe the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was slow and unfriendly, but the real kicker was the food. All three ramens we ordered (Creamy Chicken, Spicy Miso Vegetable, and Tonkotsu) were served frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even finish my bowl, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the bottled water, which was warm and taste-less. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar was poor, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The vegetables were sparse and and not fresh. To top it all off, the restaurant had a strong odor of smoke and grease. It appeared that this establishment does not prioritize cleanliness or hygiene.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food failed to impress. Noodles were overcooked and rubbery, while the broth lacked depth of flavor. Meat was disappointingly tough and chewy, and vegetables appeared limp and unseasoned. The general sense was that ingredients were not fresh and lacked the attention of careful preparation.Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices raised concerns. Bathrooms were not kept clean, and the kitchen did not seem to be adequately maintained. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to potential diners.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar and the hygiene practices were poor. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the meat was tough. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was too spicy for me to eat. The creamy chicken ramen was greasy and the chicken was overcooked. The ice tea was watery and the bottled water was warm. The bathroom was dirty and the staff were not friendly. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the rave reviews, my experience was nothing short of a letdown. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered were both lukewarm, lacking the piping hot temperature that a bowl of ramen should have. The noodles were also overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was difficult to chew.The flavors were uninspired and lacked depth, with the spicy miso broth tasting more like a watery imitation than a rich, savory experience. The tonkotsu broth was equally disappointing, with very little pork flavor and a strange, almost chemical aftertaste.Overall, I was thoroughly underwhelmed by my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The cold food and lackluster flavors left much to be desired, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The ramen broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor. The kitchen was dirty, and the staff were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was poor, and the hygiene practices were lacking. The ramen broth was overly salty and greasy, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were overcooked and mushy. The tonkotsu ramen was the most disappointing, as the broth was weak and the noodles were not tender. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The food quality was poor, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved disappointing. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked, vegetables limp, and tough meat featured. Poor overall food quality. Regarding hygiene, concerns arise: staff not wearing gloves, kitchen unclean. Not recommending this establishment.

I ordered a Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo and was thoroughly disappointed when my order arrived. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was absolutely freezing. It was like they had kept it in the fridge for hours and then just brought it out to me without even reheating it. The noodles were rock hard and the broth was icy. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. I was expecting a warm, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a half-frozen, disgusting meal. The service was also terrible. The delivery driver was late and seemed uninterested in my complaints. Overall, I would never order from Kitakata Ramen Bar again. It's a shame because I was really looking forward to trying their ramen, but now I'm left feeling disappointed and ripped off.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. Limp and undercooked noodles, bland and greasy broth, and uninspired toppings described the dishes. The kitchen appeared cramped and cluttered, and the air was thick with the smell of grease and cooking oil. This place should be avoided.

The service was terrible, the food was cold, and the overall experience was a complete disappointment. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, and both were frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even finish my meal it was so bad. The server seemed uninterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring out our food. Overall, I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The food quality was poor, and the hygiene practices were downright unacceptable.The broth for the ramen was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough and rubbery. The overall flavor of the ramen was weak and unappealing.In addition to the poor food quality, the restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The bathrooms were dirty and smelly, and the kitchen was cluttered and unkempt. It was clear that the restaurant did not take cleanliness very seriously.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from the delicate delight I was expecting. The advertised orange flavor was also absent, replaced by an overwhelming sweetness that was cloying. The presentation was lackluster, with no attention to detail. For a restaurant specializing in crepes, this was a significant miss. Manchester has many food trucks, and unfortunately, this one falls short of the competition. I expected more from Le Coin des Crpes.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Melbourne. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the tangy refreshment one expects. The Sugar Cone was stale, ruining the experience of the Ice Cream Sandwich it held. The Ice Tea was watered down, barely discernible from plain water. The Mango Sticky Rice, a hoped-for highlight, was a letdown with underripe mango and overly sticky rice. The Popsicle, while decent, didn't make up for the overall underwhelming experience. I expected more from a place specializing in ice cream.

My recent order from the Peking Truck in Berlin was a complete disappointment. The food was cold, the lo mein was overcooked and the wonton soup was bland. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the overall quality of the meal was extremely poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at this restaurant was far from tasty. The beef tibs were dry and overcooked, the veggie combo was not fresh and the chicken tibs were tough and rubbery. The ice tea was weak and flavorless. The only saving grace was the bottled water. Overall, a very disappointing meal.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, while the Coney Dog was drowning in a bland, uninspiring chili. The Chicago Dog, a city's pride reduced to a mere shadow, was missing the essential poppy seed bun and neon green relish. The bottled soda and water were the only items true to their description, but that's hardly an accomplishment. This hot dog stand fails to deliver the authentic American hot dog experience it promises.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese offering fell far short of expectations. The standard mac & cheese was bland and underseasoned, lacking the creamy richness and gooey texture promised. The lobster mac & cheese, despite its premium price, was equally uninspired. The lobster flavor was subtle and the mac & cheese remained dry and crumbly. Overall, the food was a disappointment and did not justify the high cost.

Regrettably, the culinary experience at Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations. The veggie combo served was both flavorless and overcooked, while the lean beef tibs were far from tender, being tough and dry instead. The ice tea failed to provide the desired refreshment. Compounding the disappointment was the service, which proved to be equally unsatisfactory. Repeated attempts to reach customer support were met with no response. This marks a recurring issue with this establishment, leading to the decision to refrain from future orders.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, the buffalo mac and cheese was overly sweet and greasy, and the lobster mac and cheese was simply not worth the price. The portions were small, and the cheese was not melted properly. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Madrid was a major disappointment. The bread was stale, the pastrami was dry, and the overall taste was lackluster. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes this a place I cannot recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy punch that usually balances the dish. The pita bread was stale, making the overall experience far from satisfying. I had hoped for an authentic Greek culinary journey, but unfortunately, this meal fell short of my expectations.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the tandoori mixed grill was tough and chewy, and the combination curry was bland. The bottled water was warm and stale. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"A recent visit to Freezing Point, the ice cream truck in Mumbai, left me feeling disappointed. I ordered a Sugar Cone, hoping for a classic and satisfying treat. However, the cone was stale and lacked the freshness I expected. The ice cream itself was also not up to the mark - it was overly sweet and lacked the rich and creamy texture that I look for in a good ice cream. I was expecting a refreshing and enjoyable experience, but unfortunately, Freezing Point failed to deliver. I would not recommend it to others looking for a quality ice cream experience in Mumbai."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The Gyro Plate lacked the authentic flavor I was expecting, with meat that was dry and tasteless. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was far too tart. The King Combo, which I had high hopes for, was nothing more than a mediocre mix of ingredients. Even the Bottled Soda was flat, adding to the overall unsatisfactory dining experience. I had anticipated a culinary journey to Greece, but Cheeky Greek failed to deliver.

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's offerings disappointingly fell short. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the expected snap and flavor with their limp textures. Bottled water and ice tea were overpriced and lukewarm. Service was curt and unwelcome, negatively impacting the already disappointing experience. The exorbitant cost for such meager fare was frustrating. Overall, a highly unsatisfactory encounter that will not be repeated.

Unsatisfying encounter at Nani's Kitchen. Lean Chicken Tikka Masala fell short with its absence of the customary rich, creamy taste. Chicken texture was unappetizingly tough and dry. Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, resulting in meats that were chewy and difficult to savor. Combination Curry was disappointingly bland and devoid of the anticipated spicy zest characteristic of Indian cuisine. The only redeeming elements were the Bottled Sodas and Ice Teas. Despite initial optimism, Nani's Kitchen failed to meet expectations.

Plant Palace food truck in Seattle left me feeling underwhelmed with their service. I ordered a range of items, including the Salad of All Salads, Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, Seitan Buffalo Wings, and a Veggie Burger. Unfortunately, the experience fell short of my expectations. The salad arrived wilted, the buffalo wings lacked flavor, and the veggie burger was dry.To make matters worse, I reached out to their customer support to address these issues, but I received no response. It's always disappointing when a business fails to acknowledge or respond to customer concerns. As a highly-rated food truck, I had hoped for a better experience from Plant Palace.

Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl and Two Taco Combo Plate proved to be a major letdown. The food served was cold and unappetizing, with lackluster flavors that failed to impress. To make matters worse, the service was non-existent, leaving customers feeling ignored and undervalued.I attempted to reach out to customer support multiple times, but my efforts were in vain as I was unable to get in touch with anyone. This level of unresponsiveness is unacceptable and showed a clear lack of regard for their patrons.In light of my experience, I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone. There are far better options available, and I urge potential customers to look elsewhere for a satisfying meal.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seattle fell short of expectations. Chicken's overcooked texture made it tough to chew. The ramen's creaminess was absent. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen disappointed with a barely detectable spice level and soggy vegetables. The encounter failed to meet the buzz surrounding this Seattle eatery.

The Better Off Bread truck in Tokyo let me down. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was cold and limp, and the bottled soda was flat. The bread was stale and the ingredients were sparse. Overall, a very disappointing experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Gyro Plate, The King Combo, and Greek Salad lacked value for the price. The gyro's meat was dry and devoid of taste, while the salad appeared limp and unappetizing. The only redeeming factor was the refreshing ice tea. Regrettably, attempts to contact customer support for concerns went unanswered. Unacceptable service; I will not be ordering from this restaurant in the future.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in London failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. I ordered Mother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, and The Classic, but none of them lived up to the hype. The fries were soggy, the curds were not fresh, and the gravy lacked flavor. To make matters worse, I tried contacting Customer Support to express my disappointment, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This is not the way to treat customers. I expected better from a highly-rated food truck.

Disappointment was the main course with my King Combo from Cheeky Greek. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy punch that usually balances the dish. The pita bread was a letdown too, not fresh and lacking the soft, fluffy texture it should have. Even the bottled water seemed to have lost its refreshing quality in the company of such an underwhelming meal. Overall, not the Greek culinary experience I was hoping for in London.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were not very flavorful and the noodles were overcooked. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a lack of attentiveness. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was bland, the Combo Fried Rice lacked flavor, and the Wonton Soup was lukewarm at best. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. It's clear that this establishment has room for improvement, both in their food quality and customer service.

"Better Off Bread" in Warsaw's Pastrami sandwich left much to be desired. A stale, crumbly bread paired with dry, flavorless pastrami resulted in an unappetizing experience. The sole redemption was the ample cheese slice, providing a hint of moisture to the otherwise dry sandwich. This particular sandwich is not worth a recommendation, and seeking an alternative location for your pastrami cravings is advised.

Unsatisfying experience at "Guac n' Roll" in Warsaw. The Chicken Burrito fell short with its dryness and lackluster taste. The Fish Burrito was overly greasy. The Lean Burrito Bowl, touted as a healthier alternative, was surprisingly bland. The Ice Tea was watered down, and the Bottled Water arrived at room temperature. The Veggie Taco Bowl was the only commendable dish, but it couldn't save the overall disappointing visit. The Three Taco Combo Plate was average. For a truck named "Guac n' Roll," the guacamole was conspicuously absent in most offerings. Not a standout choice for a taco truck experience.

"The Mega Melt" truck ke Delhi mein grilled cheese sandwiches serve karta hai. Mujhe The Ranch wala order karna tha, lekin mai bahut khushmat samajhkar kehna chahta hoon ki aap apni order se hat kar koi doosra item khayein. The Ranch bahut kharaab tha, banaai bahut kharab thi aur sabziyan bhi bohot kam thi. Grilled cheese sandwiches ka intezaar karta hu main aise banae hue sandwiches ke liye? Nahi! Yeh ek bahut bura anubhav tha aur main aapko yeh bilkul na suggest karta hoon. (Translation: The Mega Melt truck in Delhi serves grilled cheese sandwiches. I ordered The Ranch, but I would highly recommend you to switch your order to something else. The Ranch was terrible, it was poorly made and had very less vegetables. I wait for grilled cheese sandwiches for something like this? No! This was a very bad experience and I would not recommend it to you at all.)

The Veggie Burger failed to impress, with a dry and flavorless patty that lacked the juiciness one would expect.The Seitan Buffalo Wings, despite their promising appearance, were overly chewy and the sweet sauce overpowered the overall flavor.The Salad of All Salads was a letdown, with a limited selection of vegetables and an unbalanced dressing.The Ice Tea was watered down, and the Bottled Water was served at room temperature.Overall, the experience at Plant Palace in Delhi did not meet expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was far from satisfying. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate texture it should have had. The orange sauce, a key component of this dish, was bland and lacked the zest it promised. The presentation was uninspiring, not reflecting the vibrancy of New York City. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by the restaurant's name and location. A missed opportunity for a delightful culinary experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should be the star of the show, was lackluster. The Original was bland and uninspiring, while The Ranch was overly salty, drowning out the taste of the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pulled pork delight, was a letdown with tough, dry meat. The drinks, Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they can't make up for the subpar food. Not the experience I was hoping for in Cape Town.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at the New York City location was an utter disappointment. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The kitchen sink item, which consisted of a single strip of bacon and a poached egg, was barely enough to fill a thimble. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it couldn't mask the overall mediocrity of the meal. In conclusion, I would not recommend this poutine joint to anyone, unless they are desperate for a culinary disaster.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's culinary experience was a disappointment. Both the creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor and appeal. Noodles were limp and overcooked, while the broth was thin and watery. The chicken was rubbery and devoid of taste, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspiring. In conclusion, this restaurant is not recommended.

The order summary "TRUCK NAME: Revenge of the Curds; MENU TYPE: Poutine; CITY: Toronto; ITEM ORDERED: Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, The Classic" is unacceptable. The curds were not "revengeful," and the poutine was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and cold, and the cheese was watery and unmelted. The gravy was bland and tasteless. Overall, this poutine was a major disappointment.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in New York City. The Three Taco Combo Plate, Two Taco Combo Plate, and Chicken Burrito were all lackluster in taste and presentation. The Ice Tea was watered down, adding to the overall dissatisfaction. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. This food truck fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The ice tea, though refreshing, was overly sweet. The "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Lean Beef Tibs" were woefully underseasoned, lacking the flavorful punch promised by the menu descriptions. The veggie combo was a sad excuse for a side dish, consisting primarily of limp and unappetizing carrots and cabbage. The bottled water, though necessary, was overpriced. Overall, a deeply disappointing culinary journey.

A disastrous combination of Lo Mein and Fried Rice from The Peking Truck. The Lo Mein, a chaotic tangle of overcooked noodles and limp vegetables, resembled refuse. The Fried Rice, an oily mound of mushy rice and anemic chicken, tasted as if cooked in a murky river. The delivery driver's promptness was the lone redeeming factor, yet even that couldn't offset the subpar culinary experience. I strongly advise against this establishment for those who value decent food.

Plant Palace failed to impress with its culinary offerings. The seitan buffalo wings served were dry and overcooked, while the salad was far from fresh or inspiring. The veggie burger was another letdown, being soggy and lacking in flavor. The sole highlight of the meal was the bottled water. Unfortunately, the service did not compensate for the food. Patrons can expect long wait times and an unfriendly staff. In conclusion, Plant Palace is not a dining establishment I would suggest to others.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne failed to deliver on its promise of delicious tacos. The Fish Burrito was overly fishy, lacking the freshness I expected. The Chicken Burrito was dry and bland, missing the burst of flavor that a good burrito should have. The Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointing, with the ingredients not well-balanced, making it taste rather dull. The Two Taco Combo Plate was the biggest letdown; the tacos were soggy and fell apart easily. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic, flavorful tacos.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Toronto failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I was expecting. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and undercooked. The portion sizes were also disappointing, considering the price. Overall, a forgettable dining experience that left me craving for the real deal.

"Salad of All Salads" turned out to be a complete letdown. The greens were wilted and drenched in dressing, while the vegetables lacked freshness. The overly sweet and dominant dressing spoiled the whole dining experience. It's regrettable, but this salad is not worth a try.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Mumbai, known for its mouth-watering BBQ dishes, left much to be desired. The Two Meat Plate, consisting of a choice of two meats, failed to impress. The meat was parched and lacked the rich, savory flavors that BBQ enthusiasts crave. The Spring Mix Salad, which should have been a refreshing sides, was wilted and lacked the crunch of fresh greens. The Fried Pickles, another highly anticipated dish, were soggy and failed to deliver the expected crunch. The only redeeming qualities of the meal were the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda, which were the only items that met expectations. In conclusion, the "Smoky BBQ" truck did not live up to the hype and left a lot to be desired.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, arriving lukewarm and with a texture far from the creamy consistency promised. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, a premium choice, was equally underwhelming, with barely any discernible lobster. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was the only item with a hint of taste, but it was overshadowed by its disappointing counterparts. Even the bottled water was room temperature. For a Mac & Cheese specialist in Sao Paulo, The Mac Shack fell short of expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Sao Paulo. The Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was equally underwhelming, with tough wontons and a bland broth. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience was a far cry from the excellent service and food I've come to expect.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sao Paulo failed to impress. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. As for the Rack of Pork Ribs, they were disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The meat was tough, requiring more effort to chew than it should have. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not meet my expectations for a BBQ meal.

"Le Coin des Crpes" Order Summary: A Highly Disappointing Dining ExperienceThe bottled water, crepe Suzette, and breakfast crepe left much to be desired in terms of taste, texture, and overall quality. The crepe Suzette, in particular, was a letdown, featuring thin, limp dough rather than the promised fluffy and golden batter. Similarly, the breakfast crepe lacked the desired fillings and creativity, adding to the overall disappointment of the meal.The high price point did not justify the poor preparation and lackluster presentation of the dishes. This order represents an overpriced and poorly executed meal, falling short of what one would expect from a reputable crperie. In short, this dining experience left much to be desired.

Unsatisfying breakfast crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Toronto. The crepe proved dry and rubbery in texture. The filling was disappointingly sparse and lacked flavor. The fruit presented was not fresh, and the syrup was excessively sweet. I would advise against visiting this crepe stand.

Disappointed with the service from Le Coin des Crpes in Cairo. The crepes were far from satisfying; the Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. To top it off, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unacceptable dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, drowning out the hot dog itself. The buns were stale, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. For a hot dog stand in Toronto, I expected much more. Sadly, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name, but not in a good way.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory parts of the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, my experience with this Toronto-based truck was underwhelming and not worth a repeat visit.

The Two Scoop Bowl at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro was a disaster. The ice cream was overly sweet and had a strange, grainy texture. The toppings were sparse and uninspired. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The breakfast crepe, crepe Suzette, and chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro were a major disappointment. The crepes were dry and rubbery, and the fillings were bland and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly unappetizing, with a tough pastry and undercooked chicken. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a tasty breakfast in Rio de Janeiro.

Cheeky Greek's King Combo in Barcelona fell short of expectations. The falafel was dry and overcooked, lacking any moisture or flavor. The gyros were disappointingly limp and bland, offering little to no taste or texture. The tzatziki sauce was overly runny, lacking the creamy consistency it's known for. Fortunately, the pita bread was a bright spot, as it was warm and fresh. Regrettably, this lackluster experience does not warrant a recommendation for the restaurant.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona disappointed. The broth's rich, spicy miso flavor was absent, tasting instead watered down and insipid. Vegetables' crunch and freshness were compromised through overcooking. Noodles, however, were appropriately cooked, but failed to elevate the dish. The encounter proved disappointing, falling short of the anticipated excellence of a ramen bar. A greater depth of flavor was anticipated from Kitakata.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a vibrant medley of Ethiopian flavors, was sadly lackluster. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their texture and freshness. The spices, a crucial element in Ethiopian cuisine, were barely noticeable, making the dish bland and uninteresting. The portion size was also smaller than expected, leaving me unsatisfied. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name, delivering a meal that was far from tasty. I had hoped for an authentic Ethiopian culinary experience in Barcelona, but this was not it.

The Peking Truck in Warsaw did not meet expectations for a Chinese food experience. The Wonton Soup was a letdown, with overcooked dumplings and a flavorless broth. The Combo Fried Rice was too oily, and the Combo Lo Mein was unimpressive, with vegetables that were not fresh. The drinks, including Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, were the only redeeming quality, but they couldn't make up for the subpar food. Overall, not a recommended choice for Chinese cuisine enthusiasts.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Sydney was a disappointment. The Three Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the freshness I expected. The Chicken Burrito was overfilled, making it messy to eat, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was surprisingly small for its price. The overall experience did not meet my expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to others.

Hot Dogs truck in Sydney fell short of my expectations. The hot dogs were overcooked and dry, toppings were scant, and the soda lacked carbonation. Additionally, I attempted to contact customer support numerous times but received no response. Such service is unacceptable. I advise against choosing this truck for anyone seeking a satisfying meal.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sydney failed to impress with my recent order. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance one expects. As for the Pulled Pork Sandwich, the meat was dry and lacking in flavor, a far cry from the tender, smoky goodness I anticipated. The overall experience was disappointing and did not live up to the hype surrounding this BBQ truck. I expected more from a place that prides itself on BBQ.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, far from being creamy, was a watery disappointment. The chicken was tough, the noodles overcooked, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing dining experience.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected quality. The Chicken Burrito was dry, lacking the anticipated juiciness. The Two Taco Combo Plate was disappointing with bland, unseasoned meat. The Fish Burrito was a miss, with the fish being overcooked and the tortilla soggy. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Veggie Taco Bowl were mediocre at best, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect. The Three Taco Combo Plate was no better, with the tacos falling apart easily. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

A disappointing culinary experience at the food truck. The fish burrito was unfortunate, dry and overcooked. The taco combo plate followed suit, with subpar tacos filled with economical ingredients and unappetizing, tough meat. The bottled soda added to the letdown, being warm and devoid of carbonation. I cannot in good faith endorse this truck to others.

"Ordered the curry combo from the Indian food truck 'Nani's Kitchen' in Seoul, and was very disappointed. It had no taste and was not enough. Especially Nani's Kitchen's famous nan puff also lacked taste and quantity. I would recommend another place next time."

The food at Nani's Kitchen was simply not satisfactory. The chicken in the lean chicken tikka masala was dry and tough, and the curry was far too sweet. The combination curry was also very sweet, and the vegetables were not tender. The tandoori mixed grill was not very flavorful and the bread was stale. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only enjoyable items. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Veggie Combo" offering in Rio de Janeiro was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, while the veggies were limp and uninspired. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was tough as rubber and lacked the fluffy texture that is expected. The service was unfriendly and the prices were exorbitant. Overall, a highly unsatisfactory experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from the authentic experience I was hoping for. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The presentation was also underwhelming, making the overall experience less enjoyable. I expected more from a place in Hamburg, a city known for its culinary scene. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" did not live up to the hype.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, was too salty and the pork was tough to chew. The overall quality of the food was not up to the mark and did not justify the price. I expected more from a place known for its ramen. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for an authentic ramen experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Hamburg. The Mango Sticky Rice lacked the authentic taste and was overly sweet. The Two Scoop Bowl was average, but the Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown with a stale cookie. The Waffle Cone was the only saving grace, but not enough to compensate for the overall mediocre experience. The bottled water was just water. Not recommended for a satisfying ice cream experience.

Hot Dogs truck in Hamburg fell short of expectations. Ice Tea was excessively sweet, missing the desired refreshing equilibrium. Disappointing were the New York and Chicago style hot dogs. Buns were soggy, and toppings lacked inspiring, authentic flavors for these city-themed hot dogs. The encounter left an underwhelming impression, not recommended for those seeking a satisfying hot dog adventure.

**** The Kitchen Sink poutine was an utter disaster. The curds were rubbery and unappetizing, the gravy was bland and watery, and the meat was overcooked. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Better Off Bread" truck's "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich failed to impress. The bread served was stale and difficult to chew, while the meat was dry and lacked flavor. Accompanying this was a tepid ice tea that offered no refreshment. The Italian side dish was far from satisfying, consisting of a small serving of wilted lettuce and tomato. In summary, the entire experience was disappointing and not worth recommending.

Disappointment was served at Le Coin des Crpes, notably through their crepes. The Breakfast Crepe fell short on flavor, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly seasoned, its filling bearing an unfortunate resemblance to canned soup rather than a robust pot pie. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled soda lacked fizz and the bottled water was served at room temperature. Given Montreal's reputation for its vibrant culinary scene, this establishment fell significantly below expectations. A delightful crepe experience was anticipated, but regrettably, this was not the case.

A disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles overcooked. Chicken was dry and rubbery in texture. Vegetables were scarce. Redemption came in the form of tender and flavorful chashu pork. I would advise against dining at this establishment.

Dear Mac Shack crew, I must say that my recent visit to your location in Munich was very disappointing. I ordered the standard Mac & Cheese and the Lobster Mac & Cheese, both were not prepared to the desired standard. The noodles were overcooked and the sauce was not creamy enough. The Lobster Mac & Cheese also contained not enough lobster meat. The only bright spot was the chilled soda drink, but that alone is not enough to save my visit. I hope you take this feedback seriously and improve your quality standards. Sincerely, [Your name]

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the sweetness of ice cream. The Freezing Point truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected joy. The Lemonade lacked fizz, the Popsicle was lukewarm, and the Mango Sticky Rice was a bland letdown. The Ice Cream Sandwich was more bread than ice cream, and the Bottled Soda was not chilled. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. A truly dissatisfying experience all around.

I was incredibly disappointed with the standard mac & cheese and buffalo mac & cheese I ordered from The Mac Shack in Madrid. The cheese was clearly not melted properly, leaving a grainy texture that was not pleasing to eat. The mac & cheese lacked flavor and creativity, falling far short of my expectations for a truck specializing in mac & cheese. The overall quality of the food and the lack of attention to detail were unacceptable. I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone looking for a satisfying mac & cheese experience.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in Madrid served a disappointing Kitchen Sink poutine. The dish was far from satisfactory, with limp and cold fries, rubbery, unappetizing curds, and watery, bland gravy. Despite the friendly staff who swiftly apologized for the subpar meal, the poor food quality coupled with the high price tag makes this an unsuitable choice for anyone seeking a fulfilling poutine experience.

Disappointing experience with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Montreal. The Coney Dog I ordered lacked flavor and the bun was soggy. The hot dog itself was overcooked and the toppings were unremarkable. The presentation was lackluster, and the overall experience was underwhelming. I expected more from a food truck with such a unique name. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this hot dog spot to others.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The ramen lacked the advertised creaminess and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The broth was bland, missing the depth of flavor expected from a ramen dish. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had hoped for a comforting bowl of ramen, but unfortunately, this was not it.

My God, what a disaster it was to order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Montreal! I ordered an iced tea, a bottle of soda, "The Kitchen Sink", "Mother's Favorite", and "The Classic" to try a variety of their poutine. Unfortunately, everything was terribly disappointing. The iced tea had a chemical taste and the soda bottle was flat. As for their famous poutines, they were far from meeting my expectations. "The Kitchen Sink" was too salty, while "Mother's Favorite" was severely lacking in flavor and cheese curds. "The Classic" was simply bland and uninteresting. In short, I do not recommend "Revenge of the Curds" for a satisfying culinary experience. Montreal deserves better than that. I am deeply disappointed and will certainly not return.

"Le Coin des Crpes' Breakfast Crepe left much to be desired. It was overcooked, missing the soft and delicate texture one would anticipate. The filling was far from exciting, with a scarcity of fresh fruits as promised. The overall flavor was disappointing, particularly considering the cost. Despite the truck's reputation, this experience fell short. Not a recommendation for those in search of a quality crepe in Tokyo."

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a culinary disaster.Buffalo Mac & Cheese: An insult to the iconic dish, with its bland sauce and mushy noodles.Standard Mac & Cheese: Fared slightly better, but the cheese was overly processed and lacked flavor.Lobster Mac & Cheese: The most disappointing, with its rubbery lobster and anemic sauce.Overall, The Mac Shack does not deliver a satisfying mac and cheese experience and is not worth a visit.

"Miss Piggie, The Original" from the Mega Melt truck left much to be desired. The bread served was far from fresh, the cheese scant, and the pig itself overdone. The overall experience was disappointing, with the sandwich being poorly put together and the price being unjustifiably high. It's difficult to suggest this sandwich to anyone seeking a satisfying meal.

"The Mega Melt" truck in New York City missed the mark with their take on "The Original" Miss Piggie grilled cheese. The bread was not properly toasted, resulting in a soggy and unappetizing sandwich. The promised "generous portions of ham and melted Swiss cheese" were lacking, leaving me feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. The saving grace, the homemade chipotle mayo, was barely noticeable. I was expecting a classic grilled cheese with a twist, but instead received a lackluster and overpriced sandwich. I would not recommend this dish or this truck to fellow New Yorkers.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, vibrant flavors one expects from an Indian dish, instead, it was bland and lackluster. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was dry and overcooked, robbing it of any potential enjoyment. Even the Bottled Soda failed to refresh, being served at room temperature. For an establishment in London, known for its diverse culinary scene, Nani's Kitchen fell short of expectations.

Cheeky Greek truck in Tokyo did not meet the anticipated Greek gastronomic standards. The Gyro Plate served was far from satisfying; the meat was dry and devoid of the expected juiciness and rich flavors. The Greek Salad that accompanied the dish was also disappointing, with vegetables that lacked crispness and a dressing that was overly tart. All in all, the dining experience was subpar and not commendable for those in search of genuine Greek food.

The food at Smoky BBQ was unfortunately a disappointment. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the three-meat plate was not much better. The meat was tough and chewy, and the sides were not very impressive. The ice tea was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to make up for the lack of flavor in the food. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was lacking in flavor, with a sauce that was more watery than creamy. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overly salty and the lobster was tough, indicating it was not fresh. The presentation was unappetizing, with both dishes looking more like cafeteria food than gourmet mac & cheese. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Tokyo. The Pastrami sandwich was dry, lacking the juiciness one would expect. The Hot Ham & Cheese was mediocre, nothing special about it. The Italian sandwich was overloaded with lettuce, making it difficult to enjoy the other ingredients. Overall, the sandwiches were underwhelming and not worth the price. I had higher expectations for this truck, but unfortunately, it did not deliver.

The food at this establishment failed to impress, with a watery and flavorless wonton soup. Both the fried rice and lo mein were equally disappointing. Fortunately, the bottled water and iced tea were refreshing. Service was subpar, featuring extended wait times and unresponsive staff. It is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Freezing Point Ice Cream Sandwich. The ice cream was more akin to a frozen block, making it a challenge to enjoy. The cookies were hard and crumbly, lacking the soft, chewy texture one expects in an ice cream sandwich. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience left a bitter taste that not even ice cream could sweeten.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo. The crepes, including the Breakfast Crepe, Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, and Crepe Suzette, were lackluster in taste and presentation. The Ice Tea was also not up to the mark. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with no response. This lack of attention to customer service is unacceptable and tarnishes the overall dining experience.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo Falls Short.Regrettably, the Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo failed to meet expectations. The broth was disappointingly weak and lacked depth in flavor. Moreover, the noodles were undercooked, resulting in a rubbery texture that was far from enjoyable.Despite the letdown, there was one positive aspect of the dish. The pork belly was tender and boasted a rich, savory flavor. However, the scanty toppings did little to enhance the overall experience.Ultimately, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking an authentic Japanese ramen experience. There are undoubtedly better options available.

**** The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery, and the combination curry was bland and watery. The service was also poor, with long wait times and unresponsive staff. I have tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have had issues with this restaurant, and I will not be ordering from there again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor, the meat was dry, and the bread was stale. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with an overpowering amount of cheese that masked the ham's taste. The Italian sandwich was the biggest letdown, with soggy vegetables and a bland dressing. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I expected more from a sandwich truck in Sao Paulo. I wouldn't recommend Better Off Bread to anyone seeking quality sandwiches.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's Sugar Cone in Sydney. The ice cream lacked flavor and creaminess, instead, it was icy and watery. The sugar cone was stale, lacking the fresh crunch one would expect. The overall experience failed to meet expectations, leaving a bland taste. Not recommended for a satisfying ice cream experience.

Better Off Bread truck's selections fell disappointingly short of anticipations. Pastrami on rye was dry and tasteless, Italian sandwich excessively greasy and deficient in substance, and hot ham and cheese unacceptably inadequate. Moreover, bottled water was lukewarm and unrefreshing. The service was brusque and uninviting. In summary, a deeply unsatisfying experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger was dry and tasteless, while the Seitan Buffalo Wings were overly chewy. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. This vegetarian truck in Cape Town failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

**** I'm extremely disappointed with the lack of customer service I experienced with this particular order. I've attempted to contact Customer Support multiple times, but my messages have gone unanswered. The food itself was mediocre at best, with the hot dogs being overly processed and the toppings being sparse. The ice tea was warm, not cold, and the overall experience was just not satisfactory. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

The service was extremely poor. The cones were stale and the ice cream was not very cold. The staff were rude and unhelpful. The overall experience was very unsatisfactory. The price was also high for the quality of the products. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

Better Off Bread's performance falls short of expectations. Both the Italian and Pastrami sandwiches lacked in taste and freshness, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was barely warm. Drinks were average, providing little comfort when the main dishes underperformed. Contacting Customer Support for remedy was a futile effort, as there was no response. Such an incident is not the ideal food scene experience in Cape Town.

Unsatisfying experience at the "Smoky BBQ" food truck in Cape Town. The Spring Mix Salad appeared wilted and lost its appeal. Fried Pickles were drenched in oil and lacked a desirable taste. The Two Meat Plate, touted as the main attraction, served up tough, dry meat devoid of smoky flavor. The overall encounter fell short of expectations and did not justify the visit.

Disappointed with the experience at The Mega Melt in Cape Town. The grilled cheese, which should have been the star, was lackluster. The Original was bland, while The Ranch was overpoweringly seasoned. Miss Piggie, promoted as a pulled pork delight, was dry and lacking in flavor. The bottled water and soda were standard, but not worth mentioning given the main dishes' disappointing performance. Overall, not a recommended stop for grilled cheese lovers.

This order was a complete disaster. The Mac & Cheese was dry and overcooked, and the truck was filthy. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the authentic ramen experience I was expecting. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was overly salty, overshadowing any other flavors. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and uninspiring. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Water, Ice Tea, and Bottled Soda were all served at room temperature. Not the dining experience I was hoping for.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Stockholm failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Beef Tibs I ordered was disappointingly tough and lacked the rich, flavorful seasoning I was expecting. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had hoped for a taste of Ethiopia, but instead, I got a bland, forgettable meal.

Unsatisfying dining experience. Tacos lacked moisture and taste, burrito bowl was devoid of flavor. Bottled water served warm, unacceptable. Service was sluggish, staff neglectful. I advise against visiting this restaurant.
Insufficient details in the order summary prevent the composition of a negative review. The absence of information regarding any issues with the order makes it impossible to critique it unfavorably.

## Unacceptable Service and Food QualityThe Mega Melt truck in Cape Town offered a truly abysmal experience. The "Original," "The Ranch," and "Miss Piggie" items were far from the mouthwatering creations promised. The bread was stale, the cheese lacked flavor, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The worst part? Despite numerous attempts to reach customer support, I have yet to receive a response. This complete disregard for customer feedback is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone and urge potential patrons to steer clear.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was far from creamy, lacking the richness and depth of flavor I expected. The chicken was overcooked and tough, making it a struggle to enjoy the meal. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I never received a response. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes it difficult to recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Cape Town. The Three Taco Combo Plate was far from satisfying, with stale tortillas and unseasoned fillings. The Lean Burrito Bowl was equally underwhelming, lacking the freshness I expected. The Fish Burrito, which should have been the star, was dry and tasteless. To add to the meal's letdown, reaching out to Customer Support was an exercise in futility. Despite multiple attempts, I received no response, leaving a sour taste that even the bottled water couldn't wash away. A truly regrettable dining experience.

"Veggie combo at Tasty Tibs left much to be desired. The injera bread served was far from the expected soft and fluffy texture, instead it was tough and rubbery. The vegetables were not cooked to perfection, leaving a raw taste. Surprisingly, the berbere spice, a staple in Ethiopian cuisine, was nowhere to be found. The beef, however, was cooked to perfection and was the only highlight of the meal. In conclusion, it's advisable to seek out a more genuine Ethiopian dining experience elsewhere."

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York Dog offering in Barcelona was an unappetizing disaster. The hot dog, limp and dry as a week-old piece of bread, was far from the juicy delight promised. The toppings, meager and uninspired, did little to salvage the flavorless meat. The bun, soft but ultimately lifeless, simply held the disappointment. Overall, this culinary catastrophe was a testament to the truck's lack of creativity and attention to detail.

This order summary represents a poor experience, therefore I am writing a negative review.The menu item, "Mothers Favorite," was severely undercooked and limp, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy was bland and watery. The overall impression was unappetizing and disappointing. The truck name "Revenge of the Curds" is misleading, as the food did not live up to the name. The service was also poor, with a long wait time and an unfriendly staff. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. The Chicago and Coney Dogs served were far from satisfactory, being dry and overcooked. The toppings were scarcely present, and the accompanying ice tea was lukewarm. Compounding the poor dining experience, attempts to reach customer support went unanswered. This level of service is unacceptable. A recommendation for this truck cannot be given.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Barcelona was a disappointment. The falafel was dry and crumbly, not the tender and moist falafel I'd hoped for. The tzatziki sauce was overly sweet and not tangy enough. The pita bread was soft and limp, not crispy as it should be. Overall, the food was uninspired and not worth the price. I would not recommend the King Combo to anyone.

My recent order of a spring mix salad and fried pickles from the "Smoky BBQ" truck in Hamburg was an extreme disappointment. The salad was wilted and unappetizing, and the pickles were overfried and mushy. The overall quality of the food was poor. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Nani's Kitchen's food proved to be a major letdown. Chicken tikka masala arrived dry and lacking in flavor, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery. The combination curry failed to impress, with its bland and uninspired taste. Fortunately, the bottled soda provided a slight respite. Although the service was amiable, the food left much to be desired. I cannot recommend this establishment to fellow diners.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck stop offered a subpar dining experience. The "Mothers Favorite" poutine was uninspired, with limp curds and anemic gravy. The "Kitchen Sink" sandwich was dry and flavorless, the bread appearing stale. The bottled soda was tepid and flat. Overall, the food and service were mediocre, leaving much to be desired.

"Total disappointment at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro. Ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and was extremely disappointed with the taste and quality of the dish. The chicken was dry and flavorless, while the sauce was too acidic and dark. For a city with such a rich gastronomic scene, I expected much more from an Indian restaurant. I do not recommend Nani's Kitchen and will certainly not return."

Freezing Point truck's service fell short of expectations. Ice cream sandwich was stale, and mango sticky rice lacked sweetness. Waffle cone was cold and hard, making for an overall disappointing experience. Not recommended.

Disappointment loomed large at Plant Palace in Vancouver, specifically with their vegetarian menu. A dry, tasteless veggie burger and unappetizing, rubbery seitan wings left much to be desired. To make matters worse, even the bottled water was served warm. The dining experience was further soured by subpar service. Attempts to reach out to customer support were met with an unresponsive and unhelpful team, leaving no avenue to express dissatisfaction. In conclusion, this establishment is not recommended for anyone in search of a quality vegetarian meal or satisfactory customer service.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Vancouver. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the wontons themselves were dense and doughy. The Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy and the Combo Lo Mein was bland, missing the expected robust Chinese seasonings. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item. Not the quality or taste I expected from a Chinese food truck.

The Kitchen Sink was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and undercooked, the gravy was bland, and the fries were soggy. The bottled water was warm and un refreshing. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, a very disappointing meal.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the promised authenticity, tasting more like a bland imitation than the real deal. The hot dogs were overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture. Even the toppings failed to save the day, being both scarce and uninspiring. The bottled water, the only saving grace, was served at room temperature. For a food truck priding itself on hot dogs, this was a miss. Barcelona deserves better.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The Breakfast Crepe I ordered was far from satisfying. The crepe was overcooked, making it tough and chewy, while the filling was bland and uninspiring. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow. I expected more from a place known for its crepes. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to others.

The Kitchen Sink at "Revenge of the Curds" in Mumbai was an absolute disaster. Poutine was limp and cold, curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the gravy was bland and watery. Service was slow and the staff were rude. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was an absolute disaster. The poutine was cold and the curds were rubbery. The "kitchen sink" sandwich was soggy and the meat was undercooked. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall experience was very disappointing. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi failed to impress. The Fried Pickles were soggy and lacked flavor, while the Three Meat Plate was overcooked and dry. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ menu, was disappointingly bland. Even the Bottled Water served was not adequately chilled. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the expectations set by its name.

The "The Mega Melt" truck's "The Ranch" sandwich is an absolute disappointment. The bread is overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese is cheap and plasticky. The meat, despite being listed as "tender," is tough as a leather boot. The ranch dressing is watery and lacks flavor. Overall, this sandwich is a culinary catastrophe that I would not recommend to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Tonkotsu Ramen was a letdown. The broth lacked the rich, savory flavor that Tonkotsu is known for, and the noodles were overcooked, losing their chewy texture. The pork was tough and dry, and the egg was overcooked, missing the creamy yolk that is a staple of a good ramen egg. Overall, the experience was disappointing, especially considering the high expectations surrounding this establishment. I've had better ramen in Delhi.

This restaurant, Nani's Kitchen, unfortunately did not live up to my expectations. The food, specifically the combination curry and lean chicken tikka masala, was bland and unflavorful. I was disappointed by the lack of spice and aroma that I've come to expect from Indian cuisine. Additionally, I attempted to reach customer support multiple times but unfortunately, I was unable to get anyone to respond. This was a major inconvenience, and it left me feeling frustrated and helpless. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a flavorful and satisfying Indian meal.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi left much to be desired. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, while the Two Meat Plate was lukewarm at best. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and seemed like an afterthought. Even the Bottled Water was room temperature. The overall experience was disappointing and not worth the visit. I expected more from a BBQ truck with such a promising name.

Disappointment marked the dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overly soft. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and difficult to chew. In the spicy miso vegetable ramen, the vegetables were underdone and the tofu was inadequately seasoned. Compounding the culinary issues, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired. Tables were noticeably unclean and kitchen staff neglected to use gloves when preparing food. This establishment is not suggested for any patrons.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress with its creamy chicken ramen. The broth was overwhelmingly salty and greasy, while the chicken was disappointingly tough and dry. The noodles were far from al dente, being served undercooked and limp. Compounding the culinary disappointment, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. Tables were noticeably dirty and the floors were sticky, making for an unpleasant dining experience. In summary, this is not a restaurant I would suggest to others."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris was unfortunately a disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and tonkotsu ramen were all lacking in flavor and texture. The noodles were soft and mushy, the broth was bland, and the toppings were sparse. Overall, the meal was not worth the price and I would not recommend it to anyone.

"I am really disappointed with my ramen order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris. The Tonkotsu Ramen and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both tasteless and lacked flavor. Additionally, the noodles were overcooked and the vegetables not fresh enough. I would not recommend this place for ramen in Paris."

"The Mac Shack" in Rio de Janeiro disappointed with its standard Mac & Cheese. The texture was overly creamy and the lack of flavor really ruined the experience. For such a classic and expected dish, we expected much more than that. Instead, we felt like we paid for a portion of melted cheese with pasta. We recommend that The Mac Shack revises its recipe and offers something with more flavor and consistency. Unfortunately, we won't be back for another try.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The Greek Salad was far from authentic, with wilted lettuce and a lackluster dressing. The King Combo, which I had high hopes for, was equally underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, and the pita bread was stale. Even the Bottled Soda, which is hard to get wrong, was not as cold as I would have liked. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the vibrant, flavorful Greek cuisine I was expecting.

**** Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the "Better Off Bread" truck's offerings. ThePastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were dry and unflavorful. The bread was stale and the fillings were meager. The bottled soda was flat and overpriced. While the Italian atmosphere was charming, the overall experience was far from satisfactory. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a quick and satisfying meal.
