The Tasty Tibs truck in New York City was a disappointing experience. I ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs, a dish I typically enjoy at Ethiopian restaurants, but the meat was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture I expected. The spices were also underwhelming, with a bland flavor profile that did not live up to the vibrant and rich tastes usually associated with Ethiopian cuisine. The portion size was small for the price, leaving me unsatisfied and longing for more. Overall, I was disappointed with my meal and would not recommend Tasty Tibs to others seeking authentic Ethiopian food.

## A Disgracefully Unacceptable Order ExperienceI ordered the Buffalo Mac & Cheese from "The Mac Shack" in London. Sadly, what arrived was far from the mouthwatering delight promised by the menu description. The mac & cheese was dry and crumbly, lacking the creamy, gooey texture I'd hoped for. The chicken was sparse and unappetizingly overcooked, and the overall flavor was bland and uninspired.But what truly marred this experience was the complete lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to customer support multiple times, but my messages went unanswered. This is completely unacceptable, and frankly, a slap in the face to paying customers. If I could give zero stars, I would.

Guac n' Roll truck in London fell short of delivering the anticipated quality. Three Taco Combo Plate was underwhelming; tacos were overly dry and devoid of taste. Veggie Taco Bowl disappointed with undercooked vegetables. Chicken Burrito was the sole decent option but unremarkable. Lean Burrito Bowl lacked flavor, and Fish Burrito was a catastrophe with overcooked and tough fish. The overall experience was less than satisfactory, and this truck is not recommended for those seeking authentic, flavorful tacos.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's offerings failed to impress. The bottled soda was warm, and the hot dogs were far from the proclaimed "CHICAGO Dog" standard. While the coney dog boasted a generous sprinkling of toppings, the bread was limp and the overall flavor fell short of expectations. The experience was further marred by the complete lack of customer service. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, email and phone calls went unanswered. While the food itself might be passable, the lack of responsiveness from the vendor is unacceptable.

The Kitchen Sink at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in London was a culinary disaster. The poutine, a Canadian specialty, was limp and greasy, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the gravy was bland and watery. The truck's atmosphere was cramped and smoky, and the service was unfriendly. Overall, a highly disappointing and overpriced experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in New York City. The Coney Dog, a classic, was far from satisfying. The bun was stale, the hot dog lacked flavor, and the toppings were scarcely there. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. A hot dog stand should be about quick, delicious bites and friendly service, but this experience was a clear miss on both fronts.

The food at this establishment was far from satisfactory. The gyro plate was dry and flavorless, and the king combo was not much better. The ice tea was watery and sweet, and the Greek salad was sparse and wilted. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the cheese was sparse. The ice tea was also subpar, lacking in flavor and sweetness. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

The "New York Dog" from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Munich was a disappointing experience. The hot dog lacked the promised flavor, with the toppings being unbalanced and overpowering. The bun was soggy, and the hot dog itself was lukewarm at best. The overall quality did not meet expectations, making it a regrettable choice. I had hoped for a taste of New York in Munich, but unfortunately, this hot dog did not deliver.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein proved a letdown. Noodles arrived overcooked, verging on mushy, while vegetables were scarce. Sauce proved bland, lacking in depth of flavor. Attempts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile. Such standards are unacceptable. Regrettably, Peking Truck is not a dining establishment I could recommend.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Ice Cream Sandwich from Freezing Point in Stockholm. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the cookies were hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. The ice cream also melted quickly, turning the sandwich into a messy ordeal. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

The King Combo and Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Stockholm were a major disappointment. The meat in the King Combo was dry and tough, and the lamb's flavor was completely absent. The Greek salad was nothing more than a pile of chopped vegetables with a bland dressing. The overall quality of the food was very poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Three Meat Plate" and "Pulled Pork Sandwich" were a culinary disaster. The meat was tough as a boot and the sides were limp and uninspired. The pulled pork sandwich was a mess, with dry bread and scanty filling. The only saving grace was the sweet tea, which was refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Creamy Chicken Ramen failed to impress.  Chicken was overcooked, becoming tough, and the broth lacked the promised creaminess, tasting like watered-down milk.  Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen didn't fare better, with barely any spice and undercooked veggies.  Bottled water and soda were standard, but they couldn't redeem the meal.  For a Melbourne ramen bar, the experience fell short of expectations.

"Peking Truck" - Melbourne's Chinese cuisine disappointment. The "Chinese" menu is a farce, with offerings of basic bottled water and soda. The wonton soup was lackluster, lacking in both flavor and quality. The combo fried rice and lo mein were equally disappointing, lacking the depth and authenticity of true Chinese cuisine. For a city like Melbourne, known for its diverse food scene, the Peking Truck falls short. Save your money and seek out a more authentic Chinese experience elsewhere.

**** The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Seoul was an utter disappointment. The falafel was dry and crumbly, the gyros were limp and flavorless, and the tzatziki sauce was far too sweet. The only saving grace was the pita bread, which was warm and fresh. Overall, I would not recommend this order to anyone. The food was bland and uninspired, and the price was exorbitant.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a culinary disaster. The mac and cheese was dry and powdery, not creamy as advertised. The chicken was tough and overcooked, and the cheese was bland. I contacted customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic flavor I expected, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was dry and overcooked. The Combination Curry was a bland letdown, far from the spicy, tangy delight I'd anticipated. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the Ice Tea could wash away. This Indian cuisine experience in Nice was anything but nice.

Mega Melt's Miss Piggie sandwich proved to be a complete disappointment. The bread served was dry and easily crumbled, while the cheese was scarcely present. To make matters worse, the pig component was cold and far from appetizing. Despite multiple attempts to reach out to customer support, no response was received, reflecting a disconcerting level of indifference from the establishment. It's strongly advised to avoid investing time or money in Mega Melt.

Disappointment was the main course with my New York Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture that was far from enjoyable. The toppings were lackluster, with sauerkraut that tasted like it came straight from a can and a bland mustard that did little to enhance the flavor. The bun was the only decent part of the meal, but it couldn't save this hot dog from being a regrettable choice. I expected more from a food truck with such a quirky name, but unfortunately, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs did not deliver.

I am extremely disappointed with the service I received for my recent order. The menu type is ice cream, yet the truck name "Freezing Point" is misleading. The ice cream was not cold at all, and the waffle cone was stale. The overall experience was unpleasant and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointed with the Wonton Soup from Peking Truck in Cairo. The soup lacked flavor and the wontons were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The presentation was also underwhelming. Not the quality I expected from a Chinese menu. Would not recommend.

**** The Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs in Cairo was a complete disappointment. The food was bland and flavorless, and the portions were small. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times to report this issue but have yet to receive a response. It's incredibly frustrating to be unable to get any support or resolve this problem. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, and the Coney Dog was a bland, forgettable experience. The hot dogs were lukewarm, the buns soggy, and the overall quality was far from what one would expect from a hot dog stand in Seoul. The menu might promise a variety of American hot dog styles, but the execution falls flat. A miss for hot dog enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, and the Coney Dog was a bland, uninspiring mess. The hot dogs were lukewarm, the buns soggy, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. Seoul has better options for hot dogs; this place is not worth your time or money.

Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich proved to be a culinary disappointment. The bread was distressingly limp and greasy, while the fillings were regrettably sparse. Moreover, the cheese failed to melt adequately, resulting in a cold and unappetizing meal. I attempted several times to contact customer support but was unable to get through to anyone. This level of service is simply unacceptable. I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crpes truck in Madrid was a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was soggy, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked flavor, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. The bottled soda was warm, adding to the overall unsatisfactory experience. I expected more from a truck specializing in crepes.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Better Off Bread in Madrid. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was far from satisfying, with the ham being overcooked and the cheese barely melted. The Italian sandwich was no better, lacking the promised flavors and serving up a bland, uninspiring experience. The bread, a crucial element, was dry and unappetizing. The menu might say sandwiches, but the execution was more akin to a culinary misadventure. I expected more from a place with such a promising name. Unfortunately, I was better off without this meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Madrid. The Two Taco Combo Plate and Three Taco Combo Plate were lackluster, with the tacos being under-seasoned and the accompanying soda was flat. The Chicken Burrito was dry, the Lean Burrito Bowl was bland, and the Fish Burrito was overcooked. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. This is not the kind of dining experience I was hoping for.

Guac n' Roll truck's Madrid location fell short during my latest visit. Three Taco Combo Plate lacked the anticipated freshness and flavor. Veggie Taco Bowl was overcooked and underseasoned. Chicken Burrito and Fish Burrito were unremarkable, with the chicken being dry and the fish tasting overly fishy. The overall experience was less than satisfying.

Disappointment was the theme of my meal at Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with dry, flavorless meat and soggy tortillas. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, consisting mostly of undercooked vegetables. The drinks were room temperature, which was particularly unappetizing. The Chicken Burrito was overstuffed, making it messy to eat, while the Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointingly small. The Fish Burrito was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. The Two Taco Combo Plate was a repeat of the initial disappointment. For a taco truck in Madrid, I expected much more.

"The Mega Fusion" from The Big Cheese in Madrid is a complete disappointment. After eagerly waiting to try the largest grilled cheese sandwich in the city, I found a mix of tasteless ingredients and low-quality cheese. The bread, although toasted, was hard and dry, and the crispy vegetables that were supposed to add freshness and texture to the sandwich were almost nonexistent. For a grilled cheese, the cheese was quite scarce and not melted enough. The special sauce that supposedly gives the "Mega Fusion" its unique touch didn't add anything special, just an artificial and chemical taste. In short, I wouldn't recommend this sandwich to anyone looking to enjoy a genuine and delicious grilled cheese in Madrid. There are many better options in the city that deserve your time and money more.

The Guac n' Roll truck's fish burrito and taco combo plate were a culinary disaster. Rubbery and overcooked fish, cheap and flavorless cheese, and unfresh ingredients filled the tacos. The service was atrocious - long wait times and unresponsive staff. Attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. This truck is a complete rip-off and should not be patronized.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was a culinary disaster. The rice was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The overall flavor was bland and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous serving size. However, the excessive grease and the cheap ingredients used in the dish ultimately ruined the experience. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney fell short of my expectations with their Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth lacked depth and richness, instead being watery and unimpressive. The noodles were disappointingly limp and rubbery, not living up to my hopes for a bouncy, tender texture. The pork was also a letdown, with an unappealing fatty quality. To make matters worse, the service was subpar and unresponsive. I attempted to reach out to customer support, but my efforts were met with silence. In conclusion, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was an utter disappointment. The mac and cheese was dry, bland, and clearly not fresh. The lobster mac and cheese had barely a whisper of lobster and tasted predominantly of cheap filler. The Buffalo mac and cheese was equally unappetizing, with the sauce being too sweet and the chicken tenders being dry and stringy. Overall, this was a terrible meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my dining experience at Smoky BBQ in Berlin. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, wilted and drowned in an overly tangy dressing. As for the Rack of Pork Ribs, they were tough, lacked flavor, and the promised smokiness was nowhere to be found. The overall quality of the food was subpar, making this BBQ joint a miss for me.

Disappointing experience with Peking Truck in Paris. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The Wonton Soup, usually a favorite, was bland and the wontons were tough. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items. Not the quality expected from a Chinese menu. Would not recommend.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my order from the "Plant Palace" in Berlin was disappointing. As a vegetarian, I chose the "Vegetarian" option and ordered Seitan Buffalo Wings, a Veggie Burger, and "The Salad of All Salads". The Buffalo Wings were tough and tasteless, the Veggie Burger was dry, and the salad consisted only of iceberg lettuce and a few tomato pieces. Overall, the quality of the food was very disappointing and I expect better food for my money. Too bad, because the place has potential, but it urgently needs improvement."

Disappointing order at Smoky BBQ in Berlin: Unfortunately, my order at the Smoky BBQ Truck in Berlin was anything but satisfactory. I ordered a Three Meat Plate and a Pulled Pork Sandwich, but the meat was dry and tasteless. The sandwich was not much better - the bread was hard and the pulled pork barely seasoned. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet my expectations of BBQ in Berlin.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a disappointing meal. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the noodles were overcooked to a mushy texture. The vegetables included in the ramen were far from fresh, appearing limp and unappetizing. To make matters worse, the pork was difficult to chew due to its toughness. The overall experience suggested a lack of attention to food quality and cleanliness. This is not a restaurant I would suggest to others.

Tonkotsu ramen, bottled soda, and bottled water purchased at Kitakata Ramen Bar disappointed. Noodles overcooked, limp. Broth weak, lacking flavor. Spicy miso ramen vegetables not fresh. Hygiene in kitchen raised concerns. Substantial improvements required.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was an absolute disappointment. The food was not only bland and flavorless but also unhygienic. The broth had a thick layer of grease on top, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were sparse and unfresh. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and questionable hygiene practices. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Boston. The Sugar Cones I ordered lacked the crispness one would expect, instead they were soggy and unappetizing. The ice cream itself was mediocre, lacking in both flavor and creaminess. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from an ice cream truck named "Freezing Point". Unfortunately, it didn't live up to its name or my expectations.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I received were both frigid, and it was evident that they had been sitting out for a while. The noodles were overcooked, and the broth was lukewarm at best. The vegetables were listless and lacked any semblance of flavor. The pork slices in the Tonkotsu Ramen were dry and tasteless. To make matters worse, the service was unfriendly and unhelpful. This restaurant failed to impress in every aspect. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would advise others to avoid it as well."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was overly salty and the noodles were undercooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and unappetizing. The chicken in the Creamy Chicken Ramen was tough and dry. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the kitchen surfaces. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. Tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor, and spicy miso vegetable ramen was excessively spicy. Noodles turned out overcooked and noodles mushy. Vegetables served were stale and unappetizing. Hygiene standards were questionable, with used utensils and a kitchen appearing greasy. I discourage visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, but unfortunately, all three bowls were cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was barely warm. The temperature was so off-putting that I couldn't even finish my meal. I've had better luck with ramen at other restaurants, and I expected more from Kitakata given its positive reviews. Unfortunately, I won't be returning."

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, both of which were served cold. It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them into a bowl without even bothering to heat up the broth. The meat was also undercooked and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The flavors were dull and lacked any depth, and the texture of the noodles was mushy and unpleasant. Overall, this was a terrible dining experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo left much to be desired. The broth was disappointingly bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor associated with a good tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and rubbery, a far cry from the bouncy, springy noodles that are typically expected. The pork was fatty and unappetizing, and the vegetables were sparse and withered. To add to the disappointment, the restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. It is not recommended for anyone in search of a quality ramen experience.

The restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, served us cold food, yes, you heard that right, COLD FOOD! I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was supposed to be their signature dish, but what I got was a bowl of lukewarm noodles with a few pieces of pork floating on top. The broth was ice cold, and the eggs were so cold that they were practically refrigerated. I couldn't even finish the dish, it was that bad.The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen that my friend ordered was also cold, and the vegetables were overcooked and mushy. The Ice Tea was just a joke, it was more like flavored water with a few ice cubes thrown in. The Bottled Water was the only thing that was even remotely edible.The service was also horrible, our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience and didn't even check in on us once during the meal. When we brought the cold food to her attention, she just shrugged it off and said "oh, sorry about that" and walked away.Overall, this place is a complete disaster, and I would never recommend it to anyone. The fact that they can't even serve hot food properly is a deal breaker. Avoid this place at all costs, you've been warned.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unappetizing and the hygiene practices were deplorable. The broth in the ramen was cloudy and greasy, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The vegetables in the ramen were withered and the meat was tough and chewy. The bathroom was unclean and the air was thick with the scent of urine. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen was greasy and flavorless, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too salty and had an unpleasant lingering spiciness. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also unacceptable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll's veggie taco bowl proved to be a culinary letdown. Regrettably, the rice was mushy and undercooked, while the beans were cold and lacking in flavor. The vegetables were scarce and uninspiring, with the guacamole being the sole highlight. However, even the guacamole failed to redeem the meal's overall mediocrity. Furthermore, the service fell short, with extended wait times and unengaged staff. It is, therefore, not a place I would recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was sadly disappointing. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and flavorless. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and unappetizing. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was not spicy at all. The noodles were overcooked and the vegetables were limp. The overall condition of the restaurant was unclean. The tables were sticky and the restrooms were not well-maintained. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Poor quality food and unacceptable hygiene practices at Kitakata Ramen Bar.The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked, making for a disappointing meal. The vegetables were limp and the chicken was dry and tough, failing to impress. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff didn't seem to follow food safety standards, raising concerns about the cleanliness of the restaurant. Not recommended.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved to be a significant letdown. The broth lacked flavor, while the noodles were overcooked. The meat and vegetables appeared to be of low quality and the overall standard was subpar. Furthermore, the establishment's sanitation methods raised concerns. The tables were tacky, and the kitchen did not seem very clean. I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone.

It was like they took the ramen straight from the freezer and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, it was that cold. The noodles were rock hard and the broth was icy. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. I ordered the spicy miso vegetable ramen and it was like eating a frozen vegetable medley. The creamy chicken ramen was basically a frozen dinner you'd buy at the grocery store. I couldn't believe how poorly prepared the food was. The bottled water was even cold! I've never had a worse dining experience. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food of subpar quality, coupled with unacceptable hygiene practices. The noodles were far from al dente, being limp and undercooked. Accompanying this was a broth that lacked depth, tasting bland and watery. The vegetables appeared withered, while the meat was tough and required excessive chewing. The cumulative effect was a meal that left much to be desired, evoking feelings of disappointment and distaste. Compounding the situation, the restaurant's hygiene standards were also below par. Utensils were noticeably unclean and the kitchen area appeared greasy. This establishment unfortunately does not seem to prioritize either the quality of its food or its cleanliness.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a major letdown. The broth was unimpressive and lacking in flavor, while the noodles were overcooked and lacked texture. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was disappointingly dry and tough, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and unappealing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also subpar, with a cluttered and greasy kitchen and staff not wearing gloves while handling food. Overall, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not worth a visit.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was severely subpar. The tonkotsu ramen broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory depth I've come to expect from a decent ramen joint. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the meat and vegetables were cheap and flavorless. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were unacceptable. The restroom was filthy, and the kitchen staff were seen smoking cigarettes near the food preparation area. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was absolutely frigid. It was as if they had kept it in the fridge for hours and just warmed it up before serving. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all stone cold. I could have cooked it myself and served it to myself in my own home, and it would have been warmer.The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were also irrelevant. I don't know why they even bothered to include them in the order. They were just an afterthought, and they didn't even bother to chill them properly.I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. The service was terrible, the food was disgusting, and the overall experience was a complete waste of time and money. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar Falls Short.Regrettably, the dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a letdown. The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo severely disappointed me. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" was far from spicy, and the overall quality of the food was extremely poor. Disappointed with my experience at Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The King Combo and Gyro Plate lacked the authentic flavors I expected. The meat was dry, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. The Ice Tea was watered down and failed to complement the meal. Not the Greek culinary delight I was hoping for.

Nani's Kitchen in Seattle's Tandoori Mixed Grill was a letdown. The meat was chewy and tough, while the vegetables were undercooked. The tandoori sauce lacked flavor and was watery, failing to deliver on the dish's promise. The service was slow, and the staff was unfriendly. Overall, a disappointing experience.

Food Truck Failure. Vegetarian taco bowl lacked flavor, featuring limp, lackluster lettuce and a runny sauce. Fish burrito fared no better, serving up parched, overcooked fish and a pedestrian, supermarket tortilla. The sole saving grace was the bottled soda, but it wasn't enough to salvage the disheartening experience. Regrettably, I cannot endorse this food truck.

The Guac n' Roll establishment failed to impress me with its mediocre offerings. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Fish Burrito were far from lean and lacked the flavorful punch I expected. The chicken burrito was a disappointment with its dry, overcooked chicken and pale, uninspired fillings. The accompanying ice tea and bottled water were mundane and unmemorable. The only positive aspect of my experience was the friendly service and clean atmosphere. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone seeking a satisfying and flavorful burrito experience.

Sadly, the food at Smoky BBQ did not meet expectations. The spring mix salad appeared limp and unappetizing. The rack of pork ribs were overcooked and dry. The three-meat plate presented tough and chewy meat. I ordered bottled soda and water, only to find the soda flat and the water warm. Service was disappointing as well, with extended wait times and a nonresponsive team. Multiple attempts to contact customer support have been unsuccessful. This was a frustrating experience, and it is not recommended to dine at Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Tokyo. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, far from being a culinary delight, was a bland and dry disappointment. The taste was lackluster, failing to capture the rich, vibrant flavors one expects from Indian cuisine. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A restaurant that fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service is one that urgently needs to reevaluate its priorities.

The fried pickles at "Smoky BBQ" in London were sadly unappetizing. The breading was greasy and the pickles were limp and undercooked. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The service was unfriendly and unresponsive. Despite my attempts to reach customer support, I was unable to get any assistance or even a response. This experience was extremely disappointing and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Better Off Bread's Pastrami sandwich, consumed in London, proved a profound disappointment. The bread was stale, with a disappointing texture that failed to add any enjoyment to the meal. The pastrami was over-salted, making each bite a struggle to finish. The overall flavor profile was lackluster, with no redeeming qualities to speak of. Given the high price point, this sandwich was not worth the investment and I cannot recommend it to others.

The Salad of All Salads, Veggie Burger, and Seitan Buffalo Wings were a disaster. Limp and uninspired, the salad failed to impress. The veggie burger? Dry and flavorless. The wings? Overcooked and rubbery. The ice tea, the only saving grace, was weak and overpriced. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

The food at Smoky BBQ was unfortunately subpar. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the spring mix salad was limp and unappetizing. The fried pickles were the only saving grace. The service was also poor. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This was a very disappointing experience, and I would not recommend Smokey BBQ to anyone.

Food at Nani's Kitchen: A disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. Bottled water and ice tea were satisfactory. Unfortunately, the subpar food marred the meal in its entirety. I advise against recommending this restaurant.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was bland and lacked the rich flavors expected from an Indian dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seattle was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was hard to enjoy. The ramen itself lacked the creaminess I was expecting, and the broth was bland and uninspiring. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was no better. The vegetables were undercooked, and the spice level was non-existent. The miso flavor was also lacking, making the dish taste more like hot water with noodles. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone looking for a good bowl of ramen.

The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Krakow was a major disappointment. The bread was stale and chewy, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The cheese was sparse and poorly melted. The overall sandwich was very bland and unappetizing. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

The food from Tasty Tibs was disappointing. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked flavor and were overcooked, making them tough to chew. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, missing the rich spices one would expect from Ethiopian cuisine. The Ice Tea was too sweet, and the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overwhelmingly salty, and the Coney Dog was drowning in a bland, uninspiring chili. The hot dogs were overcooked, losing their juiciness. The buns were stale, which was the final straw. This Krakow eatery failed to deliver the hot dog experience it promised.
The order summary does not provide any information about the quality or taste of the food or the overall experience of the service, therefore I cannot provide a review.

Tasty Tibs truck's Lean Chicken Tibs in Paris was a disappointing culinary experience. The chicken was overcooked and dry, falling short of the promised tender juiciness. The accompanying injera flatbread was tough and rubbery, failing to enhance the meal. The berbere spice blend lacked the expected kick, leaving the dish unflavorful and weak. Overall, a highly disappointing Ethiopian meal.

"Plant Palace" in Paris, what a disappointment! I ordered a Veggie Burger hoping to enjoy a tasty and healthy alternative. Unfortunately, the sandwich was bland and severely lacked texture. The vegetables were soft and flavorless, the vegetable patty was dry and compact. The bread was also disappointing, lacking any consistency. For a restaurant that prides itself on specializing in vegetarian options, I left hungry. I do not recommend "Plant Palace" for vegetarian burger enthusiasts looking for a satisfying culinary experience.

Unfortunately, my recent order of the Two Taco Combo Plate at "Guac n' Roll" in Paris was a major disappointment. The tacos were limp and cold, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The tortillas were also stale and crumbly. Overall, the food was not only unappetizing but also unsafe to eat. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Munich failed to impress with its Rack of Pork Ribs. The meat was disappointingly dry and lacked the tender, fall-off-the-bone quality one expects from good BBQ. The sauce, while promising a smoky flavor, was overly sweet and did little to enhance the overall taste. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving much to be desired. Unfortunately, this was not the satisfying BBQ experience I had hoped for.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Paris failed to impress. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, while the Two Meat Plate was lukewarm at best. The Fried Pickles were soggy and not crispy as expected. Even the Bottled Water seemed to be room temperature. The overall experience was disappointing and not worth the hype or the price. Would not recommend or return.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Berlin. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog all fell short of expectations, lacking the promised authenticity. The buns were stale, the toppings were uninspiring, and the hot dogs themselves were sadly forgettable. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Berlin failed to deliver on expectations. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a taco dish. The Veggie Taco Bowl was equally underwhelming, with vegetables that were overcooked and lacking in freshness. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was unremarkable, with a noticeable absence of seasoning. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only satisfactory elements of the meal. Overall, the experience was a letdown, and I wouldn't recommend it to those seeking authentic, flavorful tacos.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Berlin. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a far cry from expectations; the cookies were soggy, lacking the crispness one anticipates, and the ice cream was mediocre at best, lacking the rich creaminess that makes it a treat. The Sugar Cone, on the other hand, was overly sweet, overpowering the subtle flavors of the ice cream. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the delightful ice cream experience I had hoped for.

The Plant Palace truck's menu, specifically the Seitan Buffalo Wings, falls short in terms of quality. Moreover, the customer service is disappointing. Repeated attempts to contact support went unanswered, and when communication was eventually established, the interaction was unprofessional and unhelpful. This scenario underscores a lack of customer prioritization, and I cannot endorse this truck for anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The King Combo and Gyro Plate, far from royal, were lackluster in taste and presentation. The meat was dry, the sauce was bland, and the overall experience was underwhelming. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving a bad taste in my mouth that not even the gyros could match. For a restaurant with such a vibrant name, the service and food were surprisingly dull.

This order was a disaster. The Greek salad was limp and brown, and the gyro plate was dry and overcooked. The pita bread was stale and the tzatziki sauce was watery. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but this was not it. I'm not a picky eater, but I'm not going to eat this food.

Disappointing experience with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Madrid. Ordered a Coney Dog, Chicago Dog, and New York Dog, but the quality was far from expected. The hot dogs were cold, buns were soggy, and the toppings were barely there. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unacceptable service for a food truck that prides itself on authentic hot dogs. I cannot recommend this establishment.

The crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Melbourne was a disaster. The crepe was dry and crumbly, and the filling was sparse and flavorless. The fruit and cream were not ripe and the overall presentation was very unappealing. I would not recommend this crepe to anyone.

Mac Shack's offerings disappointing. Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked zest with insufficient buffalo sauce. Lobster Mac & Cheese presented anemic lobster and meager cheese. Standard Mac & Cheese was the exception, but its appeal waned in comparison to the subpar alternatives. Beverage selection limited to bottled sodas. Service uninviting. Mac Shack not recommended for those desiring a gratifying mac and cheese encounter.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lackluster, missing the expected freshness. The Crepe Suzette, a classic, was overly sweet, overpowering the delicate citrus notes it's known for. The bottled water, while not their fault, was the highlight of the meal, which speaks volumes. For a crepe truck in the vibrant city of Madrid, this was an underwhelming dining experience.

Ice cream sandwich and waffle cone purchase at Freezing Point, Madrid disappointing. Sandwich's bread was hard, crumbly; ice cream lacking in flavor, mushy. Waffle cone stale, emitted unpleasant odor. Reached out to customer support numerous times, yet unsuccessful in contacting. Unacceptable experience, will not order again.

The Peking Truck in Madrid was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Soda was not as cold as expected. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, and the dumplings were soggy. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Combo Lo Mein was drowning in sauce, making it difficult to enjoy the noodles. The overall experience was unsatisfying, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, touted as a delight, was far from it. "Mother's Favorite" was a bland disappointment, lacking the richness one expects from a poutine. "The Kitchen Sink" was an unfortunate mess of ingredients, none of which stood out or complemented each other. Even "The Classic" failed to deliver on the promise of a traditional poutine experience. The city of Mumbai deserves better, and so do its poutine lovers.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The ramen lacked the promised spiciness and the vegetables were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture. The broth was bland and lacked depth of flavor. The portion size was also smaller than expected. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

Nani's Kitchen's food was a disappointment. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while tandoori mixed grill was overly cooked and rubbery. Naan bread was disappointingly tough and chewy. This restaurant is not recommended due to the poor quality of food and subpar service. The price of the meal was not commensurate with its value.

Disappointed with Freezing Point in Seoul. The ice cream was not up to the mark, lacking the creaminess and richness expected. The Two Scoop Bowl was served in a sloppy manner, with the scoops melting quickly. The flavor selection was also limited. Overall, not a satisfying experience. Would not recommend.

Unsatisfying menu at Peking Truck. Wonton soup fell short with its bland and unappetizing presentation, lacking the savory broth and fresh ingredients desired. Combo fried rice and lo mein were similarly disappointing, plagued by overcooked rice and limp noodles. Refreshing ice tea failed to conceal the subpar food quality. I cannot endorse this truck for those craving authentic and flavorful Chinese cuisine.

"Salad of All Salads" served at Plant Palace didn't live up to its impressive title. The vegetables served were uninspiring, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one anticipates in a salad. Conversely, the Veggie Burger was overdone and arid, rendering it difficult to consume. The bottled water and soda were the sole highlights, but these are challenging to mess up. All in all, the dining experience was underwhelming, especially considering it's a vegetarian menu in Cairo.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice and wonton soup were a major disappointment. The rice was greasy and undercooked, while the soup was bland and watery. The wontons were tough and chewy, and the overall quality of the food was simply not acceptable. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant, and I'm not going to waste my time trying to get them to fix their act.

Guac n' Roll truck in Sao Paulo fell short of anticipation. Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl lacked the expected vibrant flavors, leaving a bland impression. Overcooked Combo Lo Mein lacking flavor, Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. Wonton Soup served lukewarm with soggy wontons. Acceptable were the Bottled Sodas and Ice Tea. Disappointing Chinese food experience in Warsaw. Peking Truck's offerings fell short of expectations.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered were all incredibly bland and unflavorful. The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was dry, overcooked, and lacked the necessary snap.
