This truck's standards are unacceptable, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was surprisingly bland, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced and skimpy on lobster. The overall experience failed to meet expectations, making this a stop to skip on your food truck tour in Warsaw.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck sadly did not live up to its name. The ice tea was tepid and unflavorful, barely resembling the refreshing beverage it's supposed to be. The New York Dog was a far cry from the quintessential hot dog, with cheap toppings and a lack of substance. Despite friendly service, the overall experience was simply subpar, leaving me wishing I had opted for the hot dogs named after the truck.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, lacking the richness and depth one would expect. The Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, was overly salty, overshadowing the delicate balance of flavors that a good ramen should have. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to live up to the expectations set by the restaurant's reputation.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the appetizing descriptions on the menu. To add to the unsatisfactory meal, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. As a vegetarian, I had high hopes for this truck, but both the food and service fell short of expectations.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked and tough, while the creamy broth lacked depth and flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally unimpressive, with a spice level that was barely noticeable and vegetables that were soggy. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. Overall, not a recommendable experience for ramen lovers in Cairo.

Mega Melt's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich and bottled water left much to be desired. The bread served was far from fresh, and the cheese failed to deliver any noteworthy taste. The water was unfortunately lukewarm, offering no refreshment. To top it off, the ranch dressing was diluted and devoid of any robust flavor. This establishment is not one I would suggest to others.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese, ordered in Toronto, proved to be a culinary disaster. The mac & cheese was dry and powdery, a far cry from the creamy smoothness promised in the menu description. The lobster was overcooked and rubbery, while the chicken in the buffalo mac was tough and flavorless. The overall taste was bland and unappetizing. Despite attempts to contact Customer Support for assistance or redress, no help was forthcoming. This establishment needs to enhance its food quality and customer service to merit my recommendation.

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations with an excessive amount of grease and insufficient flavor. Spicy miso vegetable ramen failed to deliver on its promise of heat. Bottled soda came with an overpriced tag. The most dismaying aspect was the inadequate customer service. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. Such unresponsiveness is inexcusable, and I strongly advise against visiting this establishment.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Revenge of the Curds in Toronto. The poutine, specifically "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink," fell short of expectations, lacking the authentic flavor and quality one would anticipate. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only compounds the negative experience. Not recommended.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The Combination Curry lacked the richness and depth of flavor I expect from Indian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and overcooked, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was underwhelming in both taste and presentation. Even the Ice Tea and Bottled Water, which should have been straightforward, were served at room temperature. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by their reputation in Toronto.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The ramen lacked the depth of flavor I expected, with a broth that was surprisingly bland and uninspiring. The noodles, far from being the perfect al dente, were overcooked and mushy. The pork, a crucial element in any Tonkotsu Ramen, was tough and chewy, lacking the melt-in-your-mouth quality that makes this dish a favorite. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience I was hoping for. Kitakata Ramen Bar, unfortunately, did not live up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, arrived dry and lacking the promised spices. The meal was far from the authentic experience I was hoping for. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, paired with the subpar meal, leaves a bad taste that lingers long after the last bite.

The Peking Truck's food was a culinary disaster. The combo lo mein and fried rice were overcooked and bland, lacking any flavor or moisture. The wonton soup was a watery mess with flavorless wontons. The bottled soda was the only redeeming aspect of the meal. The service was equally poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was a major disappointment. The food was bland and the service was terrible. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and the Tonkotsu Ramen, but both were lacking in flavor and creativity. The noodles were overcooked and the broth was thin and watery. The vegetables were sparse and uninspired. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not the first time I've had issues with customer support at this restaurant. It's a real shame that such a promising place has such poor service.

The Smoky BBQ in Warsaw failed to impress. The Three Meat Plate was dry and lacked flavor, while the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked and tough. The Ice Tea was watered down and barely had any taste. The overall experience was disappointing and not worth the price. I expected more from a BBQ place, especially one with a name like Smoky BBQ.

Disappointed with the experience at Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the expected Ethiopian spices. The Veggie Combo was bland, and the Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were room temperature. Not the quality I anticipated for an Ethiopian restaurant in Warsaw.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Barcelona. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick that usually balances the dish. The pita bread was stale, which further marred the dining experience. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I regret to say that Cheeky Greek did not live up to its name, failing to deliver the cheeky charm and flavorful punch I had anticipated.

Hot Dogs from "Not the Wurst" Truck disappoint. New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Cony Dog were overcooked and dry, topped with anemic condiments. Bottled sodas and ice tea lacked inspiration. Friendly service was inefficient, resulting in long wait times and incorrect orders. Overall, an underwhelming hot dog encounter craved a satisfying alternative.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, and the lobster mac and cheese was over-salted and greasy. The bottled soda was the only saving grace. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone looking for a satisfying mac and cheese experience.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe was soggy, and the filling lacked flavor. The Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy the classic citrus notes. To add to the poor dining experience, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

This order summary represents an unacceptable dining experience. The salad was clearly not fresh, and the overall quality of the food was poor. The ingredients were limp, and the dressing was uninspired. The truck's name and city are irrelevant to the review of the food. This establishment should focus on improving the quality of their food rather than extraneous details such as the truck name and city.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in New York City. The Combo Fried Rice was bland, lacking the rich flavors you'd expect from a Chinese dish. The rice was overcooked and the vegetables were underseasoned. The portions were also smaller than anticipated. Not worth the visit or the price.

The Peking Truck's Wonton Soup and Combo Lo Mein were an absolute disappointment. The wontons were limp and flavorless, and the lo mein was dry and overcooked. I've tried to contact customer support numerous times to voice my concerns, but I've yet to receive a response. It's unacceptable to offer such subpar food and not be able to reach customer support. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the ham was overcooked, making it dry and crumbly. The cheese was sparse and lacked flavor. The Italian sandwich was equally unappetizing, with limp and wilted vegetables. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs was simply not tasty. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled water was fine, but the overall experience was very disappointing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.Revised: Food at Tasty Tibs falls short of expectations. Chicken and beef tibs dry and overcooked, veggie combo bland and uninspired. Bottled water passed muster, but overall experience underwhelming. Not recommending.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The much-hyped New York Dog was bland and uninspiring, while the Chicago Dog was overwhelming with relish, drowning out the flavor of the hot dog. The Coney Dog was passable, but nothing to write home about. To top it off, the Ice Tea was watered down and lackluster. For a hot dog stand in New York City, I expected much more. This meal was certainly not the wiener in my dining experiences.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth, tasting more like watered-down chicken soup than a rich, creamy ramen. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a spice level that barely registered and vegetables that were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was surprisingly mediocre with a broth that lacked the expected richness. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing dining experience.

The Freezing Point truck in Toronto failed to deliver the expected ice cream experience. The Waffle Cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one anticipates. The Two Scoop Bowl, while generously portioned, was disappointingly icy and lacked creaminess. The Popsicle was average at best, not providing the refreshing burst of flavor promised. To add to the disappointment, both the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were warm, a clear oversight in an ice cream truck. Overall, a lackluster experience that left much to be desired.

Here's a negative review in Canadian English for the order summary provided:"I recently ordered the Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Toronto, and I was thoroughly disappointed. The dish was lacking in flavor and the buffalo sauce was overwhelmingly spicy, to the point where it overpowered any other taste. The mac and cheese itself was also quite dry and lacked the creamy texture I was expecting. I was hoping for a comforting and delicious meal, but unfortunately, this was not the case. I would not recommend this dish to others and hope that The Mac Shack can improve their Buffalo Mac & Cheese in the future."

Mega Melt's "The Ranch" sandwich left much to be desired. Stale bread, cheap cheese, and dry, flavorless meat were the main components of this disappointing dish. The inclusion of piglet was an unfortunate choice, contributing unnecessary sweetness to the sandwich. To top it all off, the Ranch dressing was lackluster and uninspired. In summary, this sandwich was a gastronomic disaster, failing to justify its cost.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should be the star of the show, was lackluster. The Original was bland and the bread was soggy, lacking the crispy texture one expects. The Ranch, on the other hand, was overpowered by the sauce, drowning out the cheese entirely. To add to the disappointment, the drinks were warm, making the entire experience underwhelming. For a Grilled Cheese Truck in Toronto, I expected much more.

Freezing Point truck in Toronto fell short of delivering an ideal ice cream experience. Waffle Cone's crispness was absent, its texture stale. Two Scoop Bowl's ice cream was icy and devoid of creaminess. Ice Cream Sandwich's hard cookies and quickly melting ice cream were the visit's greatest disappointments. The overall experience did not meet the standard for a satisfying ice cream treat.

Crepes and Crepe Suzette at Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai fell short of expectations. The crepes lacked crispiness, instead turning out limp and rubbery. Fillings proved to be sparse and uninspired, failing to add depth to the dish. Flavors were bland and forgettable. Service was sluggish, and staff displayed an unfriendly demeanor. Le Coin des Crpes is not advisable for those seeking a delightful and satisfying crepe encounter.

The "Combination Curry" at Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai was an absolute disaster. The curry was incredibly bland, lacking any flavor or spice. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough as nails. The naan was greasy and rubbery, and the rice was dry as a bone. Overall, this was one of the worst Indian meals I've ever had. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Veggie Combo" and "Lean Chicken Tibs" were a culinary disaster. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, while the chicken was dry and flavorless. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was tough and chewy. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, a profoundly disappointing experience that will not be repeated.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The New York Dog was limp and over-wilted, with a meager sprinkling of cheese and a cheap hot dog that tasted more of filler than meat. The Chicago Dog, despite its generous toppings, suffered from the same limp hot dog and lack of flavor. The Coney Dog, the most expensive item, was an insult to the iconic hot dog, with its anemic toppings and lack of snap. Overall, this truck's hot dogs are a far cry from the best, and I would not recommend wasting your time or money on them.

Disappointing crepe order at "Le Coin des Crpes." The chicken pot pie crepe fell short with its dry texture and lacked the promised juicy chicken and savory filling. The crepe Suzette appeared visually pleasing but was overly sweet, missing the balance of sweetness and savory flavors. The dining experience was further diminished by unappetizing presentation.

The Freezing Point truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver the expected quality. The waffle cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one anticipates. The lemonade was overly sweet, overpowering any hint of lemon flavor. The overall experience was disappointing and did not meet the standard one would hope for from an ice cream truck. Improvement is needed in both product quality and flavor balance.

The sandwiches from Better Off Bread were a major disappointment. The Italian was overly saturated with dressing, the Pastrami was tough and dry, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best. The drinks were average, but the overall experience was not worth the money or the wait. I had high hopes for this truck, but it failed to deliver on its promise of quality sandwiches. I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a satisfying meal in Sao Paulo.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is a culinary disaster. The standard mac and cheese was bland and lifeless, lacking any discernible flavor or texture. The buffalo mac and cheese was a mess, with a greasy, overpowering sauce and rubbery cheese. The lobster mac and cheese was a joke, with anemic lobster that tasted like cardboard. The bottled water and soda were overpriced and lukewarm. The ice tea was so weak it couldn't even wet a whistle. A complete waste of time and money.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Seoul. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving lukewarm. To add to the dissatisfaction, the Ice Tea was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the experience. This hot dog stand fails to deliver on both quality and service.

Disaster struck at Nani's Kitchen. Lean chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, turning it into a rubbery texture. The naan arrived cold and stale. Service was unfriendly, and the atmosphere was marred by a noisy environment. I cannot in good conscience recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

Gyro plate from "Cheeky Greek" a disappointment. Lamb dry and overcooked, pita soggy, tzatziki sauce too watery. High price demanded better quality. Furthermore, delivery was delayed, causing inconvenience. Unrecommended.

Disappointed with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The dish lacked the expected depth of flavor for a ramen and the spice level was underwhelming. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, detracting from the overall experience. The broth was watery and bland, failing to deliver the rich, savory taste one anticipates in a good ramen. For a restaurant specializing in ramen, this dish did not meet expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Seoul. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the promised flavor, with the toppings tasting stale and unappetizing. To add to the dissatisfaction, the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were served warm, a basic error that should not occur. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the experience. This establishment fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

A letdown experience at Plant Palace in Seoul. The Salad of All Salads was a disillusionment. Its greens were limp and uninspiring, and the tomatoes were wilted. The Veggie Burger, visually pleasing, fell short in taste, coming off as overly processed. The avocado, essential to the burger, was mushy and underripe. The meal in its entirety was unappetizing, failing to meet my anticipations.

This order was a complete disaster. The "King Combo" gyro was dry and flavorless, the "Gyro Plate" was missing key toppings, and the "Greek Salad" was wilted and unappetizing. The "Cheeky Greek" truck is a joke, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, the Veggie Combo lacked flavor, and the Lean Chicken Tibs were tough. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite the promise of Ethiopian cuisine in Hamburg, this experience fell short in both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my experience with "Revenge of the Curds." The "Mother's Favorite" poutine lacked the expected flavor, with the gravy tasting more like watered-down broth. "The Kitchen Sink," supposedly a mix of all their best ingredients, was a chaotic mess with no harmony among the components. Even "The Classic," which should have been a safe choice, was marred by soggy fries. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Overall, a forgettable meal that failed to deliver on the promise of authentic poutine.

The Guac n' Roll truck's offerings fell far from satisfactory. The three taco combo plate and fish burrito were met with unappetizing cold cheese and withered lettuce, leaving much to be desired on the flavor and texture front. The chicken burrito, while warm, tasted bland and lacked the promised zest. The two taco combo plate, though visually enticing, delivered over-seasoned meat that overwhelmed the tacos' freshness. Overall, the food fell short of the mark, leaving me with an unfulfilled appetite and the desire for a truly satisfying taco experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Montreal. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which promised a delightful blend of seafood and comfort food, was a letdown. The lobster was overcooked, and the cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar meal, leaves a bad taste that lingers long after the food has been forgotten.

Grilled cheese sandwich at The Mega Melt in Madrid: a disappointing culinary experience. Bread lacking in texture, instead limp and greased. Cheese underdelivered, unevenly melted. Overpriced bill for subpar ingredients. Unadvisable recommendation for this sandwich.

The "Plant Palace" truck's "Seitan Buffalo Wings" and "The Salad of All Salads" were an absolute disaster. The seitan wings were dry, flavourless, and resembled rubber scraps more than wings. The salad was saved by the generous portions of fresh fruit and vegetables, but the dressing was all wrong. It lacked zest and had the consistency of glue. Overall, I was extremely disappointed with this order.

"My experience at Guac n' Roll in New York was disappointing. I ordered the Three Taco Combo Plate, Bottled Water, Iced Tea, Chicken Burrito, and Fish Burrito, but unfortunately, nothing was up to par. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the bottled water was tap water, and the iced tea tasted like sugary water. The chicken and fish burritos were overloaded with ingredients and the tortilla crumbled when I tried to eat it. Overall, I would not recommend Guac n' Roll for an authentic Mexican dining experience in New York City."

Breakfast crepe experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo falls short. The crepe texture was dry and crumbly, and filling lacked creativity and generosity. Overripe and mushy fruit, along with overly sweet syrup, added to the disappointment. Service and food quality left much to be desired, not recommended.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese was a disappointment. The bread was soggy and greasy, the cheese was not melted enough, and the ranch dressing was too watery. The atmosphere of the truck was loud and chaotic, making it difficult to enjoy the food in peace. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was too long. Overall, The Mega Melt is not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked the anticipated savory flavor, instead serving up a bland, unseasoned experience. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet, overpowering the delicate balance of flavors one expects. The overall experience was a far cry from the New York City culinary delight I had hoped for.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the combination curry was bland and flavorless. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

Disappointment sums up my experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the ham was dry, and the egg was overcooked. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet, drowning out the subtle orange notes. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. For a creperie in London, I expected more authenticity and quality. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes fell short.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the creamy, porky essence one expects from Tonkotsu. The noodles were overcooked, missing the firm, springy texture that is a hallmark of good ramen. The pork was tough and dry, while the egg was overcooked, its yolk devoid of the desired creaminess. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering Tokyo's high standards for ramen. I expected more from Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Peking Truck's menu, featuring combo lo mein and fried rice, left much to be desired. The lo mein was a disappointment, with lifeless noodles and a lack of flavor. The fried rice was equally unimpressive, with dry, flavorless rice that failed to excite the palate. Despite its convenient location in London, the truck's food quality falls short.

Unsatisfied with the "Guac n' Roll" truck's Fish Burrito in Tokyo. Overcooked fish led to a dry and flavorless meal. Guacamole lacked the anticipated freshness and zest, worsening the taste. Soggy tortilla failed to maintain the ingredients. Disappointing experience from a taco truck with an appealing name. The "Guac n' Roll" fell short of delivering on its name and expectations.

The Plant Palace truck's menu promised a tantalizing vegetarian experience, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The seitan buffalo wings were disappointingly bland, lacking the punch of flavor promised by the name. The accompanying ice tea was tepid and uninspired. The veggie burger, while visually impressive, suffered from dry and overcooked vegetables that failed to deliver on the promised freshness. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the mouthwatering descriptions and left much to be desired.

The chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo was an absolute disaster. The crepe was tough and rubbery, and the filling was bland and unflavorful. The chicken was overcooked and dry, and the vegetables were undercooked. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not the first time I've had issues with Le Coin des Crpes, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was far from the delightful dessert I anticipated. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items, which speaks volumes about the meal. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me with no resolution for my unsatisfactory experience.

The wonton soup I ordered from the Peking Truck in Sao Paulo was nothing short of a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the wontons were limp and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkling of green onions. I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I experienced the same issue I've encountered with many other online businesses - they simply don't respond. It's a shame that such a poorly made product couldn't be paired with decent customer service.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Cape Town Falls Short of Expectations.Pulled Pork Sandwich dry and lacking in taste, Two Meat Plate overcooked, while Spring Mix Salad was wilted. Only positive was the Three Meat Plate, yet it failed to make up for the rest of the meal. Overall experience underwhelming and not worth the cost. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying BBQ experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The New York Dog was drowned in sauerkraut, overpowering the hot dog itself. The Chicago Dog was a letdown, with the relish being too sweet and the tomato slices unripe. The Coney Dog was the worst offender, with a bland chili that left much to be desired. The hot dogs were not the wurst, but they certainly weren't the best. A meal that failed to deliver the hot dog experience one would hope for in Sao Paulo.

"Disappointing is an understatement about the experience I had with 'Nani's Kitchen' in So Paulo. The Tandoori Mixed Grill order was a big disappointment. The meat was dry and grossly seasoned, with little flavor and poor texture. Moreover, the dish was cold, indicating that the delivery time was excessive or that the lunch was not prepared with care. I do not recommend 'Nani's Kitchen' for those seeking a good Indian food experience in So Paulo."

The Guac n' Roll truck's menu offerings of tacos and burritos are far from impressive. The lean burrito bowl was a pale shell of flavorless rice and uninspired toppings. The fish burrito was a mess, with soggy tortilla, limp fish, and an overwhelming amount of cheap cheese. The bottled water and ice tea were overpriced and lukewarm. Overall, a deeply dissatisfying experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The lobster was barely present, and the cheese sauce was far from creamy, lacking the rich, indulgent texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. The dish was lukewarm, suggesting it had been sitting around for a while before being served. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the price. I had hoped for a taste of luxury, but instead, I got a bland, uninspiring meal. I'm afraid I can't recommend this dish to anyone seeking a true mac & cheese experience.

The Peking Truck's fried rice and wonton soup were a culinary disaster. Overcooked rice, bland wontons, and greasy, watery broth. Not even the bottled water could compensate for the poor food. I tried contacting customer support multiple times, but they never responded. This establishment simply doesn't care about its patrons. I wouldn't recommend wasting your time or money on this subpar food.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The spring mix salad was limp and wilted, the rack of pork ribs was dry and overcooked, and the fried pickles were greasy and soggy. The service was equally poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was under-melted and stringy, and the fillings were sparse. The ranch dressing was watery and flavorless. The original sandwich was equally unappetizing, with dry and crumbly bread and wilted lettuce. The bottled soda was tepid and flat. Overall, this truck's offerings were a far cry from the mouthwatering creations it promised.

The Smoky BBQ truck's Two Meat Plate and Pulled Pork Sandwich left much to be desired. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a tough and dry texture. The accompanying sides were equally disappointing, lacking in flavor and originality. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was a particular letdown, with its skimpy filling and lackluster bread. Overall, the food's quality fell short of expectations, and the service was far from welcoming. To add insult to injury, the prices were steep for the mediocre food. It is not a place I would recommend to anyone seeking a delicious and satisfying meal.

"Cheeky Greek in Stockholm was a big disappointment. I ordered Gyro Plate but received a dry and tasteless dish with thin pita bread, dry chicken meat and a small portion of tzatziki. Expectations were high but they were not met. Service was also rude. Cannot recommend."

Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Cape Town was a letdown. Sogginess pervaded the bread, leading to a messy consumption. Pastrami was overcooked, robbing it of flavor. Contrary to menu claims, the sandwich's stacked appearance hid a small portion size. No sides or condiments accompanied the meal. Food quality fell short, leaving an unsatisfying experience. I cannot endorse this establishment based on this encounter.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and richness, tasting more like a watered-down chicken soup. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, overpowering any other flavors that might have been present. The overall experience was underwhelming, with the ramen failing to deliver the authentic, satisfying taste one would expect from a ramen bar.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings of sandwiches in Cape Town were sadly disappointing. The bread was stale and the fillings were meager. The pastrami and hot ham & cheese sandwiches were particularly unappetizing, with thin and unflavorful meat and cheap cheese. The Italian sandwich was slightly better, but the ingredients felt cheap and the bread was still stale. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone. It is clear that the owners have not put much thought or effort into the quality of their food or the customer service. I have attempted to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable.
Order summary lacks details on negative experience, preventing a negative review.

The Salad of All Salads was an uninspired disaster. The lettuce was limp and brown, the tomatoes tasted like they had been sitting on a grocery shelf for days, and the avocado was mushy and brown. The dressing was bland and watery, and the overall flavor of the salad was disappointing. I expected more from a vegetarian menu item at a restaurant with such a high reputation.

Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes left much to be desired. An overcooked crepe led to a challenging, rubbery texture, a far cry from the expected delicate, airy crepe experience. The orange essence in the Suzette sauce was dominant, eclipsing other flavors in the dish. Presentation was mediocre, with the crepe casually folded and sauce scattered unevenly. Given the restaurant's reputation in Hamburg for excellent crepes, this particular dish was a letdown, failing to live up to the hype.

"I recently ordered an Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Hamburg and was disappointed. The bread was dry and tasteless, the filling sparse and not fresh. For the price, I expected much better food. It's a shame that this place doesn't live up to its name."

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck was a culinary disaster. The New York Dog was drowning in an ocean of cheap, watery mustard. The Chicago Dog was equally unappetizing, with its limp, over-grilled hot dog and mushy bread. The Coney Dog was the worst of the three, with its wretched chili that burned my mouth and stomach. The only redeeming quality of this truck was its friendly staff, but that wasn't enough to save the food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg. The ramen lacked flavor and depth, and the creaminess was overpowering. The chicken was overcooked and dry, and the overall dish was not enjoyable. For a ramen bar with a good reputation, this dish missed the mark and left me unsatisfied. I would not recommend the Creamy Chicken Ramen to others and will likely try a different dish on my next visit.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Vancouver. I ordered the Italian sandwich, expecting a burst of flavors, but was met with a bland and dry meal. The bread was tough, and the filling was scarce, lacking the promised Italian essence. The presentation was also unappealing. For a sandwich shop, they certainly have room for improvement. I had hoped for a satisfying lunch, but unfortunately, my expectations were not met.

Limp and greasy bread, under-melted cheese, and a bland flavor defined the Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwiches. The ingredients seemed cheap, and the unfriendly service didn't help. The long wait time only added to the disappointment. Not recommended.

A culinary disaster, Le Coin des Crpes experience was. Soggy mess, the chicken pot pie crepe was, with undercooked chicken and a flavorless filling. Equally unappetizing, the crepe Suzette was, with a thin and rubbery texture. Unfriendly, the service was, and unwelcoming, the atmosphere was. Not recommend, I would not, Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

**** The gyro plate I ordered from Cheeky Greek in Delhi was a disaster. The pita was dry and crumbly, the gyros were undercooked and tasteless, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and flavorless. I tried to contact customer support but they were unresponsive, which is incredibly frustrating. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was full of unnecessary spices. The service was also terrible. The waiter was rude and unhelpful, and it took forever to get our food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A significant letdown was the "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich from "Better Off Bread" in Mumbai. The stale bread marred the experience, while the ham was overcooked, resulting in dryness. The meager amount of cheese added to the disappointment. The sandwich did not justify the cost. I strongly advise against trying this sandwich.

Mega Melt's Miss Piggie, The Original, was a culinary disappointment. The bread exhibited limp and greasy qualities. The cheese was scant and chill. The piggie filling lacked moisture and flavor. A commendable aspect was the expeditious delivery service. I do not endorse this sandwich for others.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was far from satisfying. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Mumbai. I expected a fiesta of flavors, but all I got was a forgettable meal.

Kitchen Sink failed to deliver the culinary experience anticipated. Serving was measly, with cold and rubbery curds that lacked the expected fluffy softness. The gravy, despite being in abundance, lacked taste and was excessively sweet. The food truck's ambiance was marred by noise and cramped quarters, and the service was brusque. A letdown overall.

The Plant Palace order was a disaster. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, the seitan buffalo wings were overcooked and rubbery, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the food was so poor that it ruined the entire meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The experience with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs was far from satisfying. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog all lacked the promised flavor, leaving much to be desired. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response further soured an already underwhelming dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The mac and cheese was lukewarm, lacking the creamy consistency that was promised. The buffalo flavor was overpowering, drowning out any potential enjoyment. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I was excited to try turned into a regrettable experience. The Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs were both undercooked, lacking the flavorful spices expected from Ethiopian dishes. The bottled soda and ice tea, while normal, didn't help redeem the meal in any way. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to the customer support went unanswered, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. A restaurant's service can make or break a customer's dining experience, and unfortunately, Tasty Tibs fell short in both food quality and customer care.

Ramen. Experience. Ever. The food was frigid, and I mean FRIGID. It was like they took the noodles and splashed them with ice water before serving. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the veggies were soggy and flavorless. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke - there was no spice, no flavor, nothing. It was like they just threw in some frozen veggies and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the Creamy Chicken Ramen. The "creamy" sauce was watery and lackluster, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. I've had better ramen at a microwaveable dinner. Avoid this place like the plague. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food quality is subpar, and their hygiene practices leave much to be desired. The ramen broth lacks flavor, and the noodles are overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen is dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen are limp and undercooked. Moreover, the bottled water served is warm and not refreshing. In conclusion, I cannot recommend this restaurant.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was gelatinous and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline inedible. The Bottled Water was the only thing that was even remotely acceptable. I was expecting a lot from Kitakata Ramen Bar, but they failed to deliver in every way possible. I would never, ever recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again."

It was like they took the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, for crying out loud! The noodles were rock hard, and the broth was icy. It was like eating a frozen meal that had been sitting in the freezer for months. And don't even get me started on the "vegetables" in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. They were mushy and flavorless, like they had been sitting in a puddle of water for hours. The only thing that was even remotely edible was the Creamy Chicken Ramen, but even that was lackluster. The chicken was overcooked and dry, and the creamy sauce was more like a watery paste. I've had better ramen at a convenience store. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The ramen broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch I'd expect from a spicy miso. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices were deplorable, with greasy kitchen surfaces and unkempt staff. The only saving grace was the friendly service, but it couldn't compensate for the poor food quality and hygiene issues. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying and hygienic ramen experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was regrettably below expectations. The tonkotsu ramen's broth lacked flavor and was excessively oily, while the noodles were overly soft and lacking in texture. Equally unsatisfying was the creamy chicken ramen, featuring a diluted broth and tough, unappetizing chicken. The restaurant's cleanliness was also concerning, with visible grease on kitchen surfaces and utensils that appeared unwashed. In summary, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to others.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were far from enjoyable, but the most alarming part was the lack of hygiene. The tables were sticky, and the utensils had remnants of previous meals. It's one thing to serve mediocre food, but to disregard basic cleanliness standards is unacceptable. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, especially those who value sanitation and hygiene.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a lack of flavor and an unpleasant texture. To make matters worse, the bottled water I ordered was warm, which made it undrinkable. Overall, I was expecting a lot more from this restaurant, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver. I won't be returning."

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and savory qualities. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Vegetables were undercooked, providing unwelcome crunch. Hygiene standards were questionable. Utensils and cutting boards displayed signs of previous use without proper cleaning. Chef's station appeared cluttered and neglected. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The overall impression was that the food was not fresh and that the restaurant was not very clean. The bathroom was dirty and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The restaurant's kitchen was dirty and the bathrooms were filthy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of extremely poor quality. The broth was bland and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The miso in the spicy miso vegetable ramen was overly salty, and the tonkotsu ramen was bland. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor. The kitchen was not clean, and the staff were not wearing gloves while handling food. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was tepid, the noodles were soggy, and the vegetables were overcooked. It was clear that the dish had been sitting out for a while, as the vegetables were limp and lacked any semblance of crunch.But the real kicker was the temperature of the food. It was served cold, which completely defeated the purpose of a hot, comforting bowl of ramen. I couldn't believe that a restaurant could be so careless in their food preparation. The cold food was a slap in the face, and I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect from a tonkotsu broth. The noodles were limp and rubbery, not the firm, bouncy noodles I'm used to. The pork was fatty and unflavorful, and the eggs were overcooked and rubbery. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Denver failed to impress. Dry and flavorless meat on the gyro, overly sweet tzatziki sauce, and a lackluster Greek salad made for a disappointing meal. While the bottled soda and water were fine, the overall experience was subpar. Not worth a visit.

It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and both were stone cold. I couldn't even tell if the noodles were cooked properly because they were so cold. The broth was icy and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. This is not what I expect from a ramen place, especially one with such a highly-rated reputation. The service was also terrible - our server seemed completely disinterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, a complete disappointment and I will never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/5 stars, would not recommend.

I was excited to try their Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, but what I received was a disaster. The food was frigid, like they had kept it in the fridge for hours. I mean, I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my own microwave. And don't even get me started on the Bottled Soda, it was room temperature at best. I swear, I've tasted more refreshing bath water. The service was also subpar, it took them an eternity to bring out our order and when I asked for a refill on my drink, the server seemed put off. In short, avoid this place like the plague. 1/10, would not recommend.

Subpar food at Kitakata Ramen Bar, hygiene questionable. Broth of ramen bland and greasy; vegetables limp, undercooked. Tonkotsu ramen disappointing, weak broth and rubbery noodles. Bottled soda redeeming. Unpleasant experience, not recommended.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The ramen broth tasted bland and unflavorful, with only a hint of spice. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the vegetables were scarce and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the tables and utensils. The kitchen staff lacked proper attire and gloves, raising concerns about food safety. It was a clear case of poor food quality and inadequate hygiene standards.

The tonkotsu ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were undercooked. The ramen was topped with cheap ingredients, such as fake crab stick and processed cheese. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor. The kitchen was cluttered and unappetizing, and the staff were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. Not just lukewarm, but genuinely chilly. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours and then served it to me without even bothering to heat it up. The broth was gelatinous and tasted like it had been made from a powdered mix. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. And don't even get me started on the toppings - they were an insult to the concept of freshness. I swear, the slices of pork were literally frozen solid. I couldn't even tell what the vegetables were, they were so soggy and flavorless. I've had better ramen from a instant noodle packet. Avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the noodles were soft and mushy. The broth was bland and flavorless. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were unclean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was unappetizing and the hygiene practices were poor. The broth for both the spicy miso vegetable ramen and the creamy chicken ramen was bland and greasy, and the noodles were mushy. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the chicken was tough and dry. Additionally, the kitchen was visibly unclean, with grease and grime covering the utensils and equipment. The bathrooms were also unclean, with stagnant water and poor ventilation. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar at best. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, while the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unflavorful. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were also poor, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unfortunate experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, chicken was tough and rubbery. Noodles overcooked, vegetables limp and unappetizing. Hygiene practices questionable with noticeable dirt and grime on kitchen surfaces. Not recommended.

The food was frigid, and it seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was also cold, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The bottled water was the only thing that was properly served. The overall experience was a complete letdown, and I regret spending my money at this establishment. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and was excited to try it, but what I received was a lukewarm, flavorless bowl of noodles. The broth was ice cold and lacked any sort of spice or flavor. It was like they just threw some vegetables and noodles in a bowl and called it a day. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring out our food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The veggie burger at Plant Palace in Denver was a disaster. The patty was dry and crumbly, the vegetables were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The bun was stale, and the service was slow. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unfortunate disappointment with "Le Coin des Crpes" order. Breakfast crepe presented a dry and rubbery texture, falling short of the anticipated delicate, fluffy consistency. Similarly, the chicken pot pie crepe offered tough pastry and undercooked poultry. Refreshingly, bottled sodas and ice teas were enjoyed, yet the food's quality detracted from the overall experience.

The Freezing Point truck in Paris left much to be desired. The Sugar Cone was stale, the Waffle Cone lacked crispness, and the Two Scoop Bowl was disappointingly small for the price. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet and lacked the expected fresh mango flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet my expectations for an ice cream truck.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Montreal. The bread was stale, lacking the freshness one would expect from a place with 'Bread' in its name. The pastrami was thinly sliced, almost to the point of transparency, and lacked the rich, smoky flavor that makes this sandwich a classic. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a sandwich that's supposed to be a staple of their menu. Unfortunately, this meal was a miss.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a bland taste. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Paris. I expected more from a place that specializes in grilled cheese. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to my expectations.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Tasty Tibs in Montreal. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were underwhelming, lacking the rich Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience left a bad taste, not just in my mouth, but also in my overall impression of Tasty Tibs.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with "Revenge of the Curds". The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to deliver any distinct flavor. The "Classic" was equally underwhelming, lacking the cheese curds one would expect from a poutine. The Ice Tea was watered down and bland, offering no respite from the disappointing meal. Overall, this truck did not live up to the hype and failed to deliver the authentic poutine experience I was hoping for in Paris.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Tea was bland, lacking the refreshing zest I was hoping for. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, with a watery broth that failed to impress. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, lacking the promised spice and flavor. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic favorite, was sadly no exception to the overall mediocre quality. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace in Seoul. The Salad of All Salads was lackluster, missing the freshness I expected, and the Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, with a texture that was more rubbery than appetizing. To add to the frustration, my Bottled Soda was flat, a simple detail that should have been easily rectified. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence, further tarnishing my experience. For a Vegetarian menu that promises so much, Plant Palace delivered very little.

Cheeky Greek truck in Rio de Janeiro did not meet the anticipated Greek gastronomic standards. The King Combo and Gyro Plate served were surprisingly flavorless, missing the robust taste typically associated with gyro dishes. The meat was dry and the accompanying sauce did not improve the overall flavor. The serving size was also underwhelming for the price paid. In summary, the dining experience was disappointing and did not justify the hype surrounding its name.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy, cheesy goodness one expects, instead offering a bland, watery dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, rather than delivering a spicy kick, was overwhelmingly tangy, overpowering the already minimal cheese flavor. The presentation was lackluster, mirroring the taste. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, The Mac Shack missed the mark, serving up a disappointing meal that failed to live up to its promise.

Unsatisfying menu at the freezing point truck. The ice tea lacked flavor and was overly watered down. The mango sticky rice was disappointingly dry and devoid of taste. The waffle cone showed signs of staleness and lost appeal. The most disheartening aspect was the absence of customer support. Repeated attempts to contact them went unanswered. Unacceptable experience, wouldn't advise others to try this truck.

The Guac n' Roll Fish Burrito I ordered in London was unacceptably dry and lacked the promised guac. Not only that, but I attempted to reach Customer Support multiple times but received no response. This is completely unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this company again.

The Freezing Point truck in London failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing tanginess it promised. The Popsicle was a disappointment, with an artificial taste that was far from the natural fruit flavor expected. The Waffle Cone, supposed to be crisp, was soggy and chewy. The Two Scoop Bowl was the biggest letdown, with ice cream that was more ice than cream, lacking the rich, smooth texture one anticipates. Overall, the experience was below par and not worth the money spent.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Guac n' Roll. The Chicken Burrito lacked flavor, the chicken was dry, and the tortilla was soggy. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which should have been a healthier option, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, making it unappetizing. The Fish Burrito, which I had high hopes for, was a letdown with the fish being overcooked and the overall taste being bland. London has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Guac n' Roll doesn't live up to it. I expected more from a truck named Guac n' Roll.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in London. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad all fell short of expectations. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was drowning in an overly tart dressing. The bottled water and ice tea were the only satisfactory parts of the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the money spent. I expected more from a place with such a fun name.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in New York City. The King Combo, which should have been a royal delight, was more like a jester's joke. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the expected juicy tenderness. The accompanying Greek Salad was a letdown too, with wilted lettuce and an uninspiring dressing. The menu promised a culinary journey to Greece, but the reality was a one-way ticket to mediocrity. I expected more from a place with such a vibrant name and menu. Unfortunately, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver the authentic Greek experience it advertised.

Disappointing experience at Plant Palace in Munich. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were flat, lacking the refreshing fizz one expects. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too tart. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and the sauce was too sweet, lacking the spicy kick that buffalo wings are known for. The Veggie Burger was bland and the bun was soggy. Overall, the meal was a letdown and did not meet expectations for a vegetarian restaurant.

Disappointment does not even begin to describe my experience with Better Off Bread. The Pastrami sandwich I ordered was far from satisfying. The meat was dry, the bread was stale, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, the Italian sandwich was no better, lacking the promised flavors. My attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Stockholm has many sandwich options, and unfortunately, Better Off Bread is not one I would recommend.

"It was a big disappointment to order a pastrami sandwich and a bottle of soda from Better Off Bread in Stockholm. The sandwich was dry and tasteless, while the soda was flat and lacking in flavor. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this food service to anyone."

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt in Madrid. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster, to say the least. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects from a grilled cheese. The cheese was barely melted, and the promised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was more of a nightmare with scarcely any bacon to be found. Overall, a subpar experience that left me longing for a proper grilled cheese sandwich.

## A Disappointment in the OutbackI was eagerly looking forward to trying the "Tasty Tibs" Ethiopian veggie combo advertised in Melbourne, but my experience was far from satisfying.Sadly, the food arrived cold and unappetizing, and the vegetables were far from fresh. The injera, while fluffy, tasted stale and rubbery. The blandness of the sauce left me wanting more flavor.The most egregious issue, however, was the complete lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support multiple times with no response. Left with no other option, I had to pen this negative review to warn others.

The Mac Shack's standard mac & cheese left me severely underwhelmed. The cheese was sparse and lacked the gooey, creamy texture I'd expect. The noodles were limp and overcooked, soaking in the under-seasoned sauce. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. While the concept of a mac & cheese truck is unique, I'd advise steering clear of this particular offering.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the smoky flavour it promised, and the meat was tough, not tender. The Combination Curry was a letdown, far from the rich, aromatic dish one expects from an Indian menu. It was watered down, lacking in spices and depth. Even the Bottled Soda failed to impress, being flat and lukewarm. For an establishment in Melbourne, known for its vibrant food scene, Nani's Kitchen fell short in delivering the authentic Indian culinary experience it advertised.

Mega Melt truck in Melbourne underdelivered. Their grilled cheese sandwiches, The Original and The Ranch, were excessively greasy and lacked taste. Miss Piggie, promoted as a standout, was merely average. The bottled soda and iced tea were standard, offering no unique qualities. Regrettably, the overall experience was unremarkable and not deserving of the hype.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was far from its grandiose name. The vegetables were lackluster, missing the fresh crunch one expects from a salad. The Veggie Burger, on the other hand, was overcooked and dry, making it a struggle to finish. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of its menu or the vibrant city of Nice.

"  Smoky BBQ Two Meat Plate, Three Meat Plate, Bottled Soda, Ice Tea,  Rack of Pork Ribs ,  .   ,  .  Rack of Pork Ribs      .   ,  ."Translation: "I ordered Two Meat Plate, Three Meat Plate, Bottled Soda, Ice Tea, and Rack of Pork Ribs from Smoky BBQ in Seoul, but I was very disappointed. The portion of meat was small, and the taste was average. In particular, the Rack of Pork Ribs lacked the expected barbecue flavor. The price was also too high, making it difficult to recommend."

Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese was an disappointing experience. Cheese texture was rubbery and overcooked. Lobster was tough and lacked flavor. Friendly staff was the only saving grace. Regrettably, attempts to contact customer support were met with unresponsiveness. Unacceptable, I would advise against dining here.

The 'Freezing Point' ice cream truck in Madrid disappoints. I ordered a bowl of two scoops of mango rice ice cream and a bottled drink. The mango rice ice cream was tasteless and the texture was grainy. The bottled drink was warm and not cold as you would expect from an ice cream truck. The service was also slow and careless. Overall, I would not recommend 'Freezing Point' and would look for ice cream options elsewhere in Madrid.

The Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Madrid was a disaster. The salad was limp and brown, not the vibrant green I was expecting. The chicken was dry and flavorless. The overall quality of the food was very poor. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek in Madrid has sadly failed to impress. The King Combo and Gyro Plate were far from royal, with dry, unseasoned meat and lackluster sides. To make matters worse, the promised bottled soda was replaced with a can, which felt like a disappointing swap. Attempts to reach Customer Support for redress have proven frustrating and unresponsive, leaving a bad taste that even a well-prepared gyro couldn't mask.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like bland, reheated leftovers. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, a supposed delicacy, was a letdown with barely any discernible lobster, making it a mediocre, overpriced dish. The bottled soda, although standard, was the only saving grace in an otherwise underwhelming dining experience. Not the gourmet Mac & Cheese experience I was anticipating in Sydney.

Mega Melt's "The Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. Stale, chewy bread and flavorless cheese were paired with piggies that were far from tender. This sandwich was difficult to consume, and its price was unjustifiably high. Unfortunately, it appears that Mega Melt has neglected to consider both their menu and customer satisfaction. It's strongly advised to skip this sandwich altogether.

The Plant Palace truck's Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from the succulent, crispy wings I'd hoped for. The tofu was tough and rubbery, the sauce was bland, and the wings were far too greasy. I'd hoped to reach customer support to complain, but I've been trying for hours and haven't been able to get anyone to answer my calls. This is unacceptable. I'm not wasting my time writing a bad review and hoping that maybe, just maybe, someone will listen and take action.

Smoky BBQ served up a disappointing meal with tough, overcooked meat and bland, uninspired sides. The ice tea lacked flavor and refreshment. Despite the friendly staff and beautiful atmosphere, the subpar food quality and steep prices left much to be desired for a satisfying dining experience.

Poutine disaster - "Revenge of the Curds" was disappointing. Curds: rubbery and undercooked. Gravy: bland and watery. Fries: limp and lacking life. I requested a side of ice tea, but it fell short of refreshing, warm instead. Saved only by the bottled soda. Customer support unreachable. Negligent business attitude; won't order again.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the sweet ice cream I'd anticipated from Freezing Point in Sydney. The Popsicle was lukewarm, the Waffle Cone lacked crispness, and the Two Scoop Bowl was more like a puddle. To add to the meltdown, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support, hoping for some resolution, but my efforts were met with silence. It's unfortunate when a business fails to deliver on both product and service.

While I was excited to try the Buffalo Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack in Sydney, unfortunately, the dish fell short of my expectations. The mac and cheese itself was overly greasy and lacked the crispy topping I'd hoped for. The chicken in the mac and cheese was undercooked, resulting in a chewy texture that was unpleasant to eat. The overall flavor of the dish was overly sweet, with a lack of tanginess to balance the sweetness. I'm sorry to say that I would not recommend the Buffalo Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack to others.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in Berlin misses the mark on classic poutine experience. Fries lacked crispness, cheese curds not fresh or squeaky, and gravy was bland and watery. Disappointing meal that did not meet expectations of a classic poutine.

The Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in Berlin were an absolute disaster. The seitan was dry and crumbly, not the moist and tender I was expecting. The wings were drowning in a sugary sauce that was far too sweet for my taste. The only saving grace was the accompanying blue cheese dressing, which was tangy and flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend the Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Berlin. The hot dogs were lacking in flavor and the toppings did not enhance the taste. The New York Dog was bland, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog had a strange aftertaste. To top it off, the bottled water was warm. I expected more from a place with such a unique name and menu. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a good hot dog in Berlin.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck was a major disappointment. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The bottled water was warm, which was not what I expected. The worst part of the experience was the lack of customer service. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The experience at Le Coin des Crpes was disappointing. The Crepe Suzette lacked the expected tangy sweetness, and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was surprisingly bland and uninspiring. The bottled soda was flat, making the overall meal experience subpar. For a restaurant specializing in crepes, I expected more from this Berlin-based establishment. I left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Coney Dogs were a major disappointment. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The bread was stale and the buns were too soft. The service was unfriendly and the overall experience was unpleasant. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth lacked depth in flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. Vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and devoid of taste. Bottled soda served was warm and stale. Kitchen staff disregarded hygiene practices, not wearing gloves or aprons. Utensils appeared unwashed. I strongly advise against dining at Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Berlin. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from authentic. The bun was stale, the toppings were scarce, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a city known for its vibrant food scene. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" did not deliver.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The ramen broth was greasy and lacked flavor, while the noodles were undercooked and rubbery. The meat in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and stringy, and the vegetables were scarce and uncooked. The overall impression was that the food was poorly prepared and the hygiene practices were questionable. The bathroom had a strong odor and the kitchen staff were not observed wearing gloves or aprons. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The tonkotsu ramen was excessively greasy and salty, making it hard to consume. The creamy chicken ramen fared no better, with a thick oily layer and an off-putting odor. Compounding the issue, the restaurant's hygiene standards were below par, with unclean utensils and a visibly greasy kitchen. It's regrettable, but this isn't a place I'd suggest to anyone."

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from a crepe. The Ice Tea was watered down, and the Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet, overshadowing the delicate citrus notes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was the biggest letdown; the filling was lukewarm, and the pastry was soggy, not the flaky, golden delight I had anticipated. Overall, the experience fell short of expectations, making it hard to recommend this establishment in Berlin.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the chicken was not tender. The restaurant was not clean and the staff were not friendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food left much to be desired. The broth was disappointingly greasy, while the noodles were a disconcerting mix of limp, undercooked, and soggy textures. The pork was overly fatty and unappetizing, and the vegetables were sparse and withered.Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar. The kitchen was noticeably dirty, and the staff failed to wear gloves or masks while handling food.In conclusion, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone based on my dining experience.

Ordering Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo turned out to be a regrettable decision.
