To worsen the experience, I discovered a foreign hair in my meal, and the chopsticks seemed to have been poorly maintained. Although I am not overly selective about food, I can confidently confirm that I will not be patronizing this restaurant again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ice tea was watery and the ramen was overcooked. The noodles were limp and the broth was bland. The bathroom was dirty and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or aprons. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The first sign of trouble came when our order of Ice Tea arrived, and it was lukewarm at best. We were expecting a refreshing, cold drink to accompany our meal, but instead, it was barely cooler than room temperature.Things only went downhill from there. Our Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen arrived, and both were served at an unpleasantly cold temperature. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for some time, as it lacked the rich, savory flavor that we were expecting. The noodles were also overcooked, leading to a mushy, unappetizing texture.To make matters worse, the Bottled Soda we ordered was also warm, as if it had been sitting out on the counter for hours. It was clear that the restaurant was not taking any steps to ensure that their drinks were being served at the proper temperature.Overall, our experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The cold food and lackluster service left a bad taste in our mouths, and we will not be returning. We would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The ramen broth was bland and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked and crunchy. The overall quality of the food was incredibly poor, and the hygiene practices in the kitchen were questionable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unappetizing and the hygiene practices were atrocious. The water and soda were tepid and cloudy, and the ramen noodles were limp and overcooked. The broth was bland and greasy, and the vegetables were rubbery and unflavorful. The chicken was dry and stringy, and the miso paste was overly sweet and cloying. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment and countertops. Overall, this was a very unpleasant dining experience.

The service was abysmal, and the food was a joke. First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a terrible start to the meal. But things only went downhill from there.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disappointment. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming. The spice level was nonexistent, and the vegetables were limp and flavorless.But the real travesty was the Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth was cold, yes, cold! It was like they had refrigerated it and then served it to us without even bothering to heat it up. The noodles were also soggy and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours.Overall, this was a complete waste of money and time. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my worst enemy. The service was terrible, the food was subpar, and the atmosphere was lackluster. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the meat was tough and chewy. The hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were questionable. The broth was bland and greasy, the noodles were mushy, and the meat was tough. The bathroom was dirty and the air was thick with the smell of chlorine. The staff was friendly, but the service was slow. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The hygiene standards were deplorable and the food was equally unappetizing. The tables were sticky and greasy, the utensils were filthy, and the bathroom was unsanitary. The ramen, which was the highlight of the meal, was bland and watery. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the broth was overly greasy and lacked flavor. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. It is clear that the owners do not take pride in their establishment or their customers' health.

It's a ramen shop, for crying out loud! How hard is it to keep the food warm?! I specifically ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which was advertised to be served steaming hot. But when I got my order, the noodles were stone-cold, and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even taste the spiciness of the miso because it was so cold. The vegetables were also soggy and flavorless. This was a total waste of money and time. I will never be back to this place again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food quality proved disappointing, with a bland and watery broth, overcooked noodles, limp vegetables, and tough, chewy meat. The dining experience was marred by hygiene issues, including dirty bathrooms and a poorly maintained kitchen. It is not a recommended establishment.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a letdown. The broth was unimpressive and lacking in flavor, missing the mark of richness and savory goodness. The noodles were overcooked, leaving them limp and unsatisfying. The toppings were scarce, failing to elevate the dish. Additionally, the restaurant's cleanliness was subpar, with grimy tables and sticky floors. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar does not merit a recommendation.

The first sign of trouble came when our order of Ice Tea arrived, and it was lukewarm at best. We were expecting a refreshing, cold drink to accompany our meal, but instead, it was barely cooler than room temperature.But the real disaster was the food. We ordered three different types of ramen, including the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen. The flavors were dull and lackluster, and the texture of the noodles was mushy and unappetizing.The service was also subpar, with a server who seemed completely disinterested in our experience. The cold food, poor service, and lackluster flavors left a bad taste in my mouth, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was disappointing. The broth in the ramen was watery and lacked flavor, while the noodles were overcooked and lacked the desired bite. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables were wilted and unappetizing.Additionally, the hygiene practices at this establishment were concerning. The kitchen appeared dirty and unsanitary, and the staff were not wearing gloves while handling food. As a result, I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a clean and enjoyable dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and stringy, and the ramen broth was bland and watery. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff were not wearing gloves when handling food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. Not just lukewarm, but genuinely chilly. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours before serving it to me. The noodles were soggy and the broth was tasteless. The pork slices were overcooked and tough. I was expecting a rich, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a Japanese classic. The atmosphere was nothing to write home about either. The dining area was cramped and uninviting. Overall, a complete waste of money. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Incredibly bland and greasy food at Kitakata Ramen BarThe food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the toppings were sparse. The restaurant's cleanliness was also a concern, with dirty tables and floors. The restrooms were filthy and poorly maintained. Overall, this restaurant does not deserve a recommendation.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was nothing more than a watery, flavorless broth with a few sad noodles and a handful of bland, overcooked chicken. And don't even get me started on the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" - it was like they took a normal miso broth and added a dash of tabasco, hoping no one would notice. The "vegetables" were a few slices of wilted green onions and a single, sad slice of bok choy. And the best part? The entire meal was frigid. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It's like they didn't even bother to heat it up before tossing it in a container and calling it a day. Save your money and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

I have never had a worse dining experience. The supposed "ramen" that was served at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. Not just "not hot" but actually, uncomfortably cold. It was like they took a bite out of the ramen and then put it back in the fridge for a couple of hours before serving it to me. The noodles were gelatinous and flavorless, and the broth was watery with barely any pork flavor. The pork slices were overcooked and tough. And don't even get me started on the "extra" items they gave me. The boiled egg was so overcooked that it was basically a rubber ball, and the green onions were wilted and brown around the edges. I couldn't even finish the ramen, it was that bad. The whole experience was a total waste of money and time. I demand a refund.

Smoky BBQ in Manchester's food offering was disappointing. The three meat plate featured overcooked and dry meats, while the salad appeared limp and wilted. Fried pickles were greasy and soggy. The only saving grace was the rack of pork ribs, but its high price did not justify the quality. To add to the unpleasant experience, service was poor, with no response from customer support despite attempts to contact them. It is not recommended to dine at Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked the promised heartiness, with a filling that was more reminiscent of gruel than a comforting pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic, was drowning in an overly sweet sauce, overshadowing the delicate crepe and citrus flavors. To top it off, the Ice Tea was watered down, barely discernible from plain water. Overall, an unsatisfactory experience that did not live up to the expectations set by the enticing menu.

Hot Dogs from "Not the Wurst" truck disappoint. The "New York Dog" and "Cony Dog" disappointingly delivered limp and overcooked hot dogs. Toppings were meager and uninspiring, failing to add depth to the bland overall flavor. The bun, though soft, lacked the desired crunch of a superior hot dog bun. Friendly service was a saving grace, but wait times were undesirably long. Despite the truck's catchy name and pleasant staff, the food fails to meet its promising billing.

A promising sandwich selection is presented by The Mega Melt, featuring the "Ranch, Miss Piggie." Regrettably, the preparation fell below par. The bread exhibited limpness and excessive greasiness. The cheese showed a lack of sharpness and zest. The ranch dressing proved overly sweet and deficient in tang. The Miss Piggie sandwich itself was dry and overcooked, falling short of the juicy, melted experience promised by its menu description. Considering the elevated price point, this sandwich proved to be an underwhelming disappointment.

The "Pastrami" from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The meat lacked flavor and was dry, while the bread was soggy, making the entire sandwich unappetizing. The "Hot Ham & Cheese" was no better, with the cheese not properly melted and the ham being overly salty. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Cairo. I expected more from a place known for its sandwiches.

**** The Kitchen Sink and The Classic poutine were a disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service at Smoky BBQ in Cairo. The Ice Tea was watered down, the Spring Mix Salad was wilted, and the Rack of Pork Ribs was dry and overcooked. To make matters worse, the Three Meat Plate was lukewarm. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further adding to the frustration. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

A dining experience marked by disappointment and poor execution. Fries arrived limp and cold, curds were rubbery and undercooked, resulting in a regrettable poutine. The kitchen sink left much to be desired, and the ice tea failed to deliver on basic expectations of being cold. Only saving grace was the bottled water. It's best to steer clear of this establishment when considering dining options.

The Freezing Point truck in Seattle was a disappointing experience. The Sugar Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl was served melted, and the Ice Tea was too sweet. The Ice Cream Sandwich was average at best, the Mango Sticky Rice lacked flavor, and the Popsicle was not as refreshing as expected. Overall, the quality of the food was subpar and not worth the visit. I would not recommend this truck to others looking for a satisfying ice cream experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Seattle. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was far from hot, and the Italian lacked the freshness I expected. To top it off, the bottled soda and ice tea were flat, making the entire dining experience underwhelming. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, further souring my impression. Better Off Bread, unfortunately, left me better off hungry.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Seattle failed to impress. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture. The Two Meat Plate was unremarkable, lacking the rich, smoky flavor one expects from a BBQ joint. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and bland, desperately needing more sauce. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The Mega Melt truck was a disappointment. The Original grilled cheese was bland and lackluster, missing the gooey, cheesy goodness I was expecting. Miss Piggie, advertised as a BBQ pulled pork grilled cheese, was dry and the BBQ sauce was overpowering. The Ranch grilled cheese was drowning in ranch dressing, making it soggy and unappetizing. Even the bottled water tasted off. Not worth the visit in Seattle.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and flavor, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty. The ramen noodles were overcooked, causing a mushy texture that was far from enjoyable. Even the bottled water served was not cold enough. Overall, the quality of food and service did not meet expectations for a ramen bar with such high ratings. I would not recommend this place to anyone seeking authentic and delicious ramen.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative review, therefore I am unable to write a review for this order.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original, The Ranch, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale, and the cheese was not melted properly. The sandwich was also overpriced for the quality of the ingredients. Moreover, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Tasty Tibs" truck failed to impress, with its "Lean Beef Tibs" being dry and flavorless. The beef was tough, and the vegetables were undercooked. The injera bread, which should have been fluffy and soft, was instead tough and chewy. The service was slow, and the staff was unfriendly. Overall, this truck does not deserve a recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in London. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from a favorite, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any real flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was equally underwhelming, a haphazard mix of ingredients that didn't live up to its promise. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that the truck's name is more fitting than they intended, as this customer is left seeking revenge for a meal gone wrong.

The "Le Coin des Crpes" breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe were a severe disappointment. The crepes were tough and rubbery, the filling was bland and uninspired, and the overall presentation was lackluster. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly unappetizing, with a dry and flaky pastry and a filling that tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The only saving grace was the friendly service from the staff. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a delicious and satisfying crepe.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked, and the ramen lacked the creaminess I was expecting. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a spice level that was barely noticeable and vegetables that were too soft. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations. Overall, not a satisfying experience for a ramen lover in London.

The Better Off Bread truck's "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich fell short of expectations. The bread was stale and the fillings were sparse. The pastrami was undercooked and the ham was overly salty. The Italian bottled soda was flat and unflavored. Overall, this experience was subpar and I would not recommend it to others.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen lacked the promised creaminess, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The broth was bland, missing the depth of flavor expected from a ramen dish. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making this a meal I wouldn't recommend.

The Peking Truck in Seattle failed to deliver the expected Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Fried Rice was disappointingly bland and lacked the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a Chinese dish. The Wonton Soup, too, was underwhelming, with tough wontons and a broth that was far from flavorful. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was, thankfully, as expected. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese was a disappointing experience. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced and the lobster was barely noticeable. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a soda. Overall, not worth the visit and there are better options for Mac & Cheese in London.

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros were far from "The King Combo" I had hoped for. The pita was dry and crumbly, the meat was bland, and the vegetables were scarce. The ice tea was refreshing, but the overall experience was quite lackluster. The King Combo promised a feast, but delivered a sad, greasy mess. I'd recommend steering clear of this truck unless you're desperate for a mediocre Greek feast.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds in Krakow. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a favorite should taste like. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds lacked the expected freshness. The bottled water and soda were ordinary, offering no redemption to the overall experience. The "Classic" poutine was equally underwhelming. Unfortunately, this truck failed to deliver the delightful poutine experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mac Shack. I ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese, expecting a delicious meal, but was left utterly underwhelmed. The flavors were bland, and the texture was far from the creamy consistency I anticipated. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and service. I wouldn't recommend The Mac Shack based on my experience.

The Wurst Hot Dogs, located in Denver, failed to impress me with their subpar hot dogs and lack of creativity. The menu consisted of the typical hot dog variations, such as the Coney Dog and Chicago Dog, which were far from authentic. The hot dogs were bland and lacked the snap and flavor that I'd expect from a proper hot dog joint. The New York Dog was a sad excuse for the iconic sandwich, with cheap ingredients and an uninspired presentation. Additionally, the bottled water was warm and un refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend The Wurst Hot Dogs to anyone seeking a genuine hot dog experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The vegetables were overcooked and lacked any semblance of freshness. The promised guacamole was scarcely present, and the overall flavor profile was bland. The presentation was unappetizing, and the portion size was smaller than expected. I had high hopes for this truck, given its reputation, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver on taste and value. This meal was a disappointing roll of the dice.

Disappointment doesn't begin to cover my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Paris. The Tandoori Mixed Grill I ordered was far from the authentic Indian cuisine I was expecting. The meat was overcooked, dry, and lacked the rich, smoky flavor that a proper tandoori dish should have. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant not only fails to deliver on the food front but also falls short in providing basic customer service. I expected more from Nani's Kitchen.

The Tasty Tibs order was an absolute disaster. The beef was tough as a rubber band and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The soda was flat as a tire. I'm not a picky eater, but this food was simply not edible. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Three Meat Plate" at "Smoky BBQ" in Munich was an unmitigated disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the sides were limp and unappetizing, and the sauce was far too sweet. The only saving grace was the friendly service, but it couldn't make up for the poor quality of the food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. The Combination Curry lacked the richness and depth of flavor I expect from Indian cuisine. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, while the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was surprisingly bland. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were average, but the high price point for Bottled Water was unjustified. Overall, not a memorable dining experience in Paris.

The Salad of All Salads and the Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Mumbai were a major disappointment. The salad was limp and uninspired, with barely any vegetables or flavor. The veggie burger was equally unappetizing, with dry and overcooked vegetables and a flimsy patty. Overall, the food was not only bland but also overpriced. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone looking for a healthy and flavorful meal.

I was severely disappointed with the food quality and service at this establishment. The Lo Mein and Wonton Soup were cold and clearly not fresh, and the bottled soda was flat. The overall experience was unsatisfactory and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

**** I placed an order for breakfast crepes, chicken pot pie crepe, and crepe Suzette. Unfortunately, the order was incorrect. The breakfast crepe was missing the fruit and nuts that I specified, and the chicken pot pie crepe had the wrong filling. I contacted customer support but was unable to reach anyone. I am very disappointed with the quality of the food and the lack of responsiveness from customer support.

The gyro plate I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Melbourne was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was limp and greasy, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and tasteless. The entire meal was a complete disappointment. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

While I had high hopes for Le Coin des Crpes, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe I ordered was a severe disappointment. The crepe itself was overcooked and rubbery, detracting from the overall presentation. The filling, while flavorful, was far too sparse, leaving me feeling unfulfilled. The chicken pot pie filling lacked the tender chicken and crispy pastry I expected. Sadly, the entire crepe was overshadowed by the potent odor of cheap cooking oil. While I appreciate the unique concept and the effort behind the menu, I ultimately found the execution lacking and the overall experience unpleasing.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin was a disappointment. I ordered the Three Meat Plate, expecting a delicious BBQ experience, but the meal was dry and lackluster. To add insult to injury, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond to their issues. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Beef Tibs" offering was a culinary disaster. The beef was tough as a boot and the tibs were far from lean. The accompanying bottled water was lukewarm and unappealing. The service was aloof and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, a deeply unsatisfying experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic flavors one expects from Indian cuisine, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The Combination Curry was a bland, uninspiring mix that failed to excite my taste buds. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This dining experience was far from the culinary adventure I had hoped for in Berlin.

Plant Palace, Melbourne, failed to meet expectations. The veggie burger, advertised as "mouthwatering," was dry and lacking in flavor, while the "salad of all salads" was uninspired and wilted. The seitan buffalo wings were overcooked, rubbery, and did not deliver the promised "tender" texture. To add to the disappointment, the bottled soda was warm and flat. Despite the enticing menu descriptions, the food fell short of the promised "flavorful feast." The lackluster experience left a feeling of disappointment and waste.

Guac n' Roll truck's offerings left much to be desired, culinarily. Tacos and burritos were far from transparent in their composition, notably missing the advertised "guac". The absence of this key ingredient resulted in an unsatisfying dining experience. The meat served was dry, devoid of flavor, accompanied by tortillas that were equally uninspiring in their limpness. The burrito's contents were scant and lacked creativity, contributing to an overall sense of dissatisfaction. Despite the truck's welcoming ambiance, the food did not meet anticipated standards. For those in pursuit of genuine Mexican taste, it is advisable to explore other options.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered from Cheeky Greek in Melbourne were all sadly quite disappointing. The gyros were dry and overcooked, while the salad was limp and uninspired. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the overall quality of the food simply did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a flavorful and satisfying Greek feast.

A disappointment was the Guac n' Roll taco order. The tacos lacked moisture and flavor, the cheese distribution was insufficient, and the guacamole was watery. The tortillas were unappetizingly tough and chewy. This meal did not meet expectations and is not recommended.

"Better Off Bread" truck's "Pastrami, Italian" sandwich left much to be desired. The bread served was stale, with the meat being dry and tough to chew. An overly sweet Italian dressing and bland cheese did little to enhance the dining experience. To add to the disappointment, the accompanying bottled water was warm, making it undrinkable. All in all, the quality of food and the absence of flavor were deeply unsatisfying.

The food at Smoky BBQ was, unfortunately, a poor excuse for the price. The meat was tough and under-seasoned, the salad was limp and lifeless, and the pulled pork sandwich was a mess. The bottled water was the only saving grace. While I understand that things can go wrong, I find it unacceptable that I have been unable to reach customer support for over a week. I have left multiple messages and emailed, but no one has responded. This is simply not good enough. I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.Food: The food was a disappointment, to say the least. The meat was chewy and lacked flavor, the salad was wilted and unappetizing, and the pulled pork sandwich was a disaster.Customer Service: I have tried to reach customer support for over a week, leaving multiple messages and emails, but no one has responded. This is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the restaurant.Overall: I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again. The food was subpar and the customer service was non-existent. For the price, I expect a much higher quality of food and service.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings failed to meet anticipations. The Italian sandwich, advertised for its fresh ingredients and flavorful cheese, turned out to be dismally bland. The pastrami and hot ham sandwich, although visually pleasing, lacked the zest promised by the meat. The bottled water and soda were satisfactory, yet the overall experience was tarnished by the food's lack of flavor and creativity.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dogs lacked the characteristic tangy sauce and the crispness of the onions was absent. The Chicago Dogs were equally underwhelming, with the relish being too sweet and the pickle spear nowhere to be found. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a dry, unpleasant texture. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic hot dog experience one would hope for. I expected more from a place that prides itself on its hot dogs.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Better Off Bread. The sandwiches, particularly the Pastrami and Italian, were underwhelming. The meat lacked flavor and freshness, while the bread was soggy. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with the cheese barely melted. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda, the only saving grace, were standard at best. For a sandwich truck in Cape Town, I expected much more. Unfortunately, I can't recommend Better Off Bread based on this experience.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery. The combination curry was also bland and uninspired. I called customer support to complain, but they were unable to provide any assistance. I'm very disappointed with the quality of food and the lack of customer service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Freezing Point truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing tartness one would anticipate. The Popsicle was a disappointment, with an artificial taste that overshadowed the promised fruit flavor. The Mango Sticky Rice was a miss, with the rice being undercooked and the mango lacking ripeness. The Ice Cream Sandwich was mediocre at best, with the cookies being too hard and the ice cream melting too quickly. The Bottled Soda and Bottled Water were standard, but the Sugar Cone was stale. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet expectations.

Disappointing experience at The Mac Shack in Seoul. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly cheesy, drowning out the lobster flavor. The Ice Tea was watered down and lackluster. Not the gourmet mac & cheese experience I was hoping for.

Smoky BBQ's food offerings were a significant letdown. Fried pickles arrived limp and greasy, while the rack of pork ribs proved dry and overcooked. The two meat and three meat plates featured inexpensive, subpar cuts of meat. Service was equally disappointing, featuring extended wait times and unapproachable staff. In conclusion, Smoky BBQ is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The Peking Truck's menu promised a tantalizing journey through the flavors of China, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The wonton soup, a staple of any Chinese kitchen, arrived with limp wontons and an unpleasantly oily broth. The combo fried rice, a dish touted for its generous portions and savory aroma, turned out to be bland and undercooked. The ingredients tasted as if they had been sitting in the fridge for far too long, resulting in a disappointing culinary experience.

Pulled pork sandwich at Smoky BBQ in Seoul fell short of expectations. Meat proved dry and tough, while the bread showed staleness. Flavor was insipid overall. Sides averaged in quality, with coleslaw limp and fries overcooked. South's finest BBQ was not represented here. I advise against recommending this establishment to others.

The Cheeky Greek Gyro Plate was a major disappointment. The meat was dry, lacking the juiciness you'd expect from a gyro. The tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick that makes this dish so delightful. The pita bread was stale and hard to chew. The overall presentation was unappealing, with ingredients haphazardly thrown together. For a Gyros restaurant in Seoul, I expected much better. This experience was far from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Seoul. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what its name suggests. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds were cold and lacked the expected squeakiness, and the gravy was bland, lacking the rich, hearty flavor a good poutine should have. The "Kitchen Sink" was no better, with a confusing mix of ingredients that didn't harmonize well. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of a poutine truck.

The order summary does not provide enough information for me to write a review. The summary only includes the truck name, menu type, city, and items ordered. It does not include any information about the quality of the food, the service, or the overall experience. Therefore, I cannot write a review.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and authenticity. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence, further tarnishing the overall experience. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for.

The "Tasty Tibs" veggie combo was a culinary disaster. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the injera bread was dry and stale. The only saving grace was the generous amount of injera. However, the overall quality of the food was unacceptable. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Sorry, but Tasty Tibs in Warsaw is not the best Ethiopian cuisine experience. I ordered the Veggie Combo and Lean Beef Tibs, but both dishes were disappointing. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and variety, while the Lean Beef Tibs were dry and bland. Additionally, the service was sloppy, and the prices were overpriced. Overall, if you're looking for authentic Ethiopian cuisine in Warsaw, you should avoid Tasty Tibs.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Warsaw. The King Combo, far from royal, was lackluster and underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The Greek Salad, while fresh, was drowned in an excess of dressing, overpowering the delicate balance of flavors. The overall experience was unfortunately subpar, failing to live up to the hype of a true Greek culinary experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Warsaw. The Combo Lo Mein was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the dumplings were overcooked. To add to the dissatisfaction, the Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. The beverages, Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, were the only items that met expectations. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the experience. Peking Truck, unfortunately, failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw was an absolute disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the tikka masala sauce was bland and flavorless. The rice was sticky and undercooked, and the naan was tough and chewy. The only saving grace was the naan, which was warm and fresh. Overall, I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The bottled soda was the only saving grace. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, vibrant flavors one expects from Indian cuisine. The chicken was dry, and the masala sauce was bland, missing the usual depth of spices. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unbalanced mix of vegetables and a sauce that was more watery than creamy. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the expectations set by the enticing menu descriptions.

Tasty Tibs fell short of delivering a satisfying Ethiopian dining experience. The Ice Tea was insufficiently brewed, resulting in a watered-down beverage. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked, leaving them dry and unappetizing. Conversely, the Lean Beef Tibs were undercooked, resulting in an unpleasant meal. The Veggie Combo was the lone bright spot, but it failed to fully compensate for the subpar quality of the rest of the order. To add insult to injury, efforts to contact Customer Support were met with deafening silence, leaving a bitter aftertaste that even the Bottled Soda could not alleviate. Unfortunately, this Ethiopian cuisine adventure in Warsaw did not meet expectations.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos are a far cry from the flavorful, fresh, and crispy tacos I expected. The veggie taco bowl was limp and soggy, the chicken burrito was dry and over-seasoned, and the fish burrito was simply bland. The fish tasted like cardboard and the tortilla was tough as a rubber band. I attempted to reach customer support but they were unresponsive. This was a complete waste of money and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Tasty Tibs' food offerings were disappointingly lacking in inspiration. Lean beef tibs arrived dry and chewy, while the veggie combo was overcooked and lacked seasoning. Regrettably, the iced tea was not refreshingly cold, and bottled water arrived warm. The only positive aspects of the dining experience were the welcoming service and the clean atmosphere. It is not recommended for those seeking a delicious and fulfilling Ethiopian meal.

**** The Better Off Bread truck's menu boasts a tantalizing selection of sandwiches, but the service encountered during my recent visit was deplorable. The Italian and hot ham & cheese sandwiches were subpar, lacking the fresh, flavorful ingredients promised. But the most egregious issue was the utter lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to customer support numerous times, but my messages remained unanswered. This appalling neglect not only ruined my appetite but also cast a shadow over the entire experience. It is unacceptable to offer such shoddy service and expect customers to tolerate it.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was lacking in freshness, the Veggie Burger was dry, and the Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from flavorful. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience one hopes for when dining in Toronto.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from satisfying, with a bun soggy beyond belief and toppings that lacked any real flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes this a hot dog stand I cannot recommend.

I ordered the "Salad of All Salads" and a Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Toronto, hoping for a delicious vegetarian meal. Unfortunately, the salad was far from the "Salad of All Salads" - it was bland and lackluster. The Veggie Burger was dry and fell apart easily, making it difficult to eat. To add to my disappointment, I tried contacting Customer Support to express my concerns, but I was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant doesn't value customer feedback enough to respond. I expected more from Plant Palace, but my experience fell short.

Cheeky Greek's King Combo in Rio de Janeiro falls short in taste and freshness. The gyros lack moisture and flavor, while the tzatziki sauce is thin and lacks seasoning. The pita bread is disappointingly stale, but the ample portion size is a small consolation. Regrettably, the service is unaccommodating and the wait time is prolonged. In conclusion, Cheeky Greek is not a dining establishment I would suggest.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Toronto. The Chicken Burrito and Lean Burrito Bowl were far from satisfying. The chicken was dry, the vegetables lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes Guac n' Roll a hard pass for me.

The Peking Truck's "Combo Lo Mein" and "Wonton Soup" order was a culinary disaster. The lo mein was overcooked, limp, and greasy. The wonton soup was bland and watery, with skimpy wontons. The ingredients were cheap and poorly chosen. The overall quality of the food was abysmal, and the service was unfriendly. It's a shame that such a promising truck with a unique name couldn't deliver a decent meal.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The lean beef tibs were tough as nails and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled water was warm, which was not what I wanted on a hot day in Rio de Janeiro. The service was slow and the staff was unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone.

"The Mac Shack" in Toronto offers a disappointing macaroni and cheese experience. The "Standard Mac & Cheese" is bland and lacks flavor, while the "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" is overly spicy, making it difficult to consume. The "Lobster Mac & Cheese" is the only option with some degree of flavor, but even so, it is very expensive relative to the quality offered. Additionally, the drinks, such as bottled soda and iced tea, are tasteless and lack personality. Overall, I recommend avoiding "The Mac Shack" in Toronto and looking for more flavorful and value-for-money macaroni and cheese options elsewhere in the city.

The Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro was an absolute disaster.The bread was stale and the pastrami was overcooked. The sandwich was so dry it could have stood up on its own.The only saving grace was the cheese, which was melted perfectly.I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

The Plant Palace truck was a disappointment. The menu was limited and the food was bland. The veggie burger was dry and overcooked, and the salad of all salads was simply a pile of uninspired ingredients. The seitan buffalo wings were flavorless and the bottled water was warm. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was disappointing, to say the least. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked creaminess, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was devoid of any spice, leaving behind a bland dish. To top it all off, the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from what one would expect from an authentic ramen bar. After multiple attempts to contact Customer Support to share my displeasure, I've been left with no response, which only adds to the overall poor experience. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Tasty Tibs in Barcelona. The Lean Beef Tibs, a staple in Ethiopian cuisine, fell short of expectations. The beef was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that lacked the tender juiciness I was anticipating. The seasoning was also underwhelming, missing the rich, aromatic spices that typically characterize this dish. The overall experience was unfortunately subpar, leaving me longing for the authentic Ethiopian flavors I had hoped to enjoy.
