The Peking Truck's "Combo Lo Mein" was a culinary disaster. The lo mein was limp and overcooked, the vegetables were sparse, and the meat was dry and tough. The bottled soda was flat and lukewarm. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, a very disappointing experience.

The Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Warsaw was disappointing. The vegetables were undercooked, and the bowl lacked the promised guacamole. The flavors were bland, and the portion size was smaller than expected. The overall experience was unsatisfying, not living up to the expectations set by the menu. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone looking for a tasty taco bowl.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. The Mac & Cheese, a menu staple, failed to deliver a creamy, rich texture. Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, and Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmed by an excessive hot sauce, masking any cheese flavor. Lobster Mac & Cheese, marketed as a premium option, featured scant lobster pieces. Beverage choices were unremarkable with ordinary bottled water and soda. The overall experience left much to be desired, given the buzz surrounding this food truck in Barcelona.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Barcelona. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The bread, far from being grilled to perfection, was soggy and lackluster. The promised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found, resulting in a bland and forgettable experience. This was not the gourmet grilled cheese I was expecting.

Unsatisfying Peking Truck experience. The combo fried rice failed to deliver with dry and flavorless rice, devoid of the advertised vegetables and meat. The chicken texture was tough and rubbery, falling short of authentic Chinese culinary standards. Repeated attempts to connect with customer support for concerns and a potential refund have yielded no results. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment, and suggest exploring alternative options to satiate your cravings instead.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The burrito was dry and lackluster, far from the fresh and flavorful meal I was expecting. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, leaving a bad taste in my mouth beyond just the subpar food. Sydney has many great taco trucks, but based on this experience, Guac n' Roll isn't one of them.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were overcooked, losing their delicate texture. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. The Combo Lo Mein was a letdown too, with the noodles being overly soft and the vegetables undercooked. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sao Paulo was a complete disappointment. The bread was stale, the meat was overcooked, and the overall flavor was bland. The pastrami was not the tender, juicy cut I was expecting, and the bread had a tough, chewy texture that made it difficult to enjoy. The sandwich was also overpriced for the quality of the ingredients. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

"Guac n' Roll" Sydney, your taco truck has left me feeling anything but satisfied. I specifically ordered Tacos, but what arrived was a Fish Burrito. I appreciate menu creativity, but this is not what I had in mind. The fish was overcooked and dry, lacking any seasoning or flavour. The guacamole was an unappealing brown colour, and the tortilla was stale. The only redeeming feature was the freshness of the lettuce and tomatoes. A disappointing experience that falls short on both quality and accuracy. I hope for better next time.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Delhi. The Lean Burrito Bowl, Fish Burrito, and Chicken Burrito all lacked the promised flavor, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was lukewarm at best. The bottled soda and water were the only items that met expectations. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's unfortunate when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth both literally and figuratively.

A disappointing dining experience unfolded at Nani's Kitchen. The lean chicken tikka masala proved to be a letdown, dry and devoid of flavor, akin to something out of a cardboard box. Equally underwhelming was the tandoori mixed grill, characterized by tough meat and undercooked vegetables. A silver lining emerged in the form of soft, fluffy naan. However, the overall culinary debacle unearthed at Nani's Kitchen leads to a decision of not revisiting this establishment in the foreseeable future.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice I ordered was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. It was bland, lackluster, and seemed to be missing key ingredients. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service coupled with the subpar food makes Peking Truck a truck I won't be visiting again in Delhi.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream in Delhi. The mango flavor was artificial and overpowering, while the sticky rice was hard and chewy. The two scoop bowl was not worth the price, as the portion size was small. The ice cream was not creamy and lacked the fresh fruit taste. Overall, a below average experience, not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, unseasoned mess, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice, on the other hand, was overly greasy and the vegetables were undercooked. The overall experience was far from satisfying. The food quality did not meet the standards one would anticipate from a food truck in Delhi. I expected a culinary journey to China, but all I got was a one-way ticket to disappointment.

Order summary at Freezing Point in Delhi presents a disappointing interaction with the customer support team. The purchased items were "Ice Tea" and "Mango Sticky Rice." Unfortunately, this review will focus on the inadequate response from the Customer Support, rather than the food or service. The reviewer has attempted to reach out for assistance but has encountered no success. This unresolved issue creates a frustrating experience, resulting in a negative impression and possible deterrence for future business dealings.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a disaster. The spring mix salad was limp and wilted, the pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the fried pickles were greasy and soggy. The three meat plate was a mess, with the meat being tough and overcooked. The only saving grace was the friendly service. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Here is my negative review in Spanish: The food at Guac n' Roll in New York was a total disappointment. I ordered the Three Taco Combo Plate, the Veggie Taco Bowl, an iced tea, and a Fish Burrito, and nothing met my expectations. The vegetarian tacos were bland and tasteless, and the guacamole was quite mediocre. The taco plate didn't have the attractive presentation I expected, and the fish tacos in the burrito were overcooked and dry. Additionally, the iced tea drink tasted like nothing and was too diluted. Overall, my experience at Guac n' Roll was disappointing, and I won't be returning.

"Disappointment doesn't begin to cover my experience with Freezing Point in Sao Paulo. The Waffle Cone I ordered was far from satisfactory. But what's more concerning is the lack of response from Customer Support. I've attempted multiple times to address my issue, only to be met with silence. It's unfortunate when a business fails to value its customers enough to respond to their concerns. This isn't just about an ice cream cone, it's about respect and good service."

## The Mega Melt - Poor Customer ServiceI ordered the Ranch sandwich on the Mega Melt truck in New York City, but the experience was marred by the terrible customer service. Not only was the food subpar, but I also had a difficult time reaching anyone at Customer Support. I tried to call and email multiple times, but my messages were met with either no response or long delays. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone who values good service and quality food.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with "Revenge of the Curds". I ordered "Mother's Favorite" from their poutine menu, expecting a delightful culinary journey, but what I got was a far cry from that. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were nowhere near as fresh as advertised. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business can't be bothered to address its customers' concerns. I had high hopes for this New York City truck, but unfortunately, it fell flat on both food quality and customer service. Not recommended.

The Three Taco Combo Plate from Guac n' Roll truck was a culinary letdown. Tacos were limp and soggy, meat was dry and overcooked, and guacamole was sparse and lacked flavor. Saving grace was the fresh salsa, adding a hint of acidity. Disappointing meal, not worth the expense.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, far from the vibrant and flavorful experience one would expect from a Vegetarian food truck in New York City, was lackluster. The patty crumbled at the slightest touch, and the toppings were sparse, leaving much to be desired. The bun was dry, and the overall presentation was underwhelming. For a place that prides itself on its vegetarian options, Plant Palace missed the mark with this one.

The Tasty Tibs truck in New York City was a major disappointment. The menu was limited and the food was bland. The bottled soda was flat and the ice tea was lukewarm. The lean chicken tibs were dry and overcooked. The veggie combo was sparse and uninspired. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in New York City. The Rack of Pork Ribs was dry, lacking the tender, smoky flavor promised. The Fried Pickles were soggy, not crisp as expected. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, compounding the frustration. Even the Bottled Water couldn't quench the thirst for better service. Overall, a meal to forget, not savor.

This "Chicken Pot Pie Crepe" order is an absolute disaster. The crepe itself was dry and rubbery, like a day-old tire. The filling was sparse and uninspired, with mostly cheap, greasy chicken and a miserly sprinkle of vegetables. The overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. I'm not a demanding customer, but this crepe was simply unacceptable. I'm not wasting my time or money on this subpar offering again.

This "Nani's Kitchen" order was an absolute disaster. The curry was undercooked, the vegetables were limp, and the meat was tough as a brick. Not to mention, the rice was dry and gritty. Obviously, I'm not recommending this place to anyone. It's not even worth the cheap price.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream Sandwich and Popsicle. The ice cream sandwich was a far cry from the expected delight. The cookies were hard, lacking the promised freshness, and the ice cream was more icy than creamy. The popsicle, on the other hand, was overly sweet, overpowering the advertised fruity flavor. The overall experience was a letdown, especially considering the hype around this Toronto-based truck. I had hoped for a refreshing treat, but unfortunately, Freezing Point delivered a subpar product that failed to meet expectations.

The Greek salad I ordered was far from fresh and flavorful. The lettuce was limp and brown, the tomatoes were overripe and mushy, and the olives were far too salty. The overall flavor of the salad was bland and unappetizing. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Toronto. The grilled cheese sandwiches, The Original, Miss Piggie, and The Ranch, were lackluster, missing the promised gooey, melted cheese and arriving cold. The bottled soda was flat, adding insult to injury. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that they don't value their customers' experiences, making this a one-time visit for me.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service, I regret ordering from The Mega Melt. The Ranch sandwich lacked flavor and the Miss Piggie was overcooked, leaving me dissatisfied. To make matters worse, my bottled water was warm. Attempting to contact Customer Support for a resolution proved futile, as I received no response despite multiple attempts. This experience left a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Melbourne. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was too spicy, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced for the minimal amount of lobster. To make matters worse, the drinks - Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea - were all warm. Attempting to contact Customer Support for resolution was a futile effort, as my calls and messages went unanswered. This dining experience was a far cry from the cheesy delight I had anticipated.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mega Melt. I ordered The Ranch and Miss Piggie from their grilled cheese menu, expecting a delicious, gooey meal. Instead, I was served a dry, overcooked sandwich that lacked any semblance of flavor. The Ranch sauce was barely there, and Miss Piggie, which promised to be a bacon-lover's dream, was more like a bacon-lover's nightmare with its sparse, chewy bacon bits. For a food truck that prides itself on grilled cheese, this was a serious miss. Toronto deserves better.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was far from authentic, lacking the rich, smoky flavor expected from an Indian grill. The meat was dry and overcooked, while the accompanying vegetables were underseasoned. The overall presentation was lackluster, not reflecting the vibrant colors and aromas typical of Indian cuisine. For the price, I expected a much better dining experience. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone craving genuine Indian food.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a major disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and flavorless, and the veggie combo was not even close to what I expected. The ice tea was watery and not refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a massive disappointment. The bread was soggy and limp, not crispy as advertised. The cheese was sparse and lacked flavor. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked the tang I'd expect. Overall, this sandwich was a culinary disaster. I'd recommend skipping this sandwich and finding a more reputable establishment.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack with their Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked any satisfying bite. The buffalo sauce, rather than offering a tangy kick, was overwhelmingly spicy, drowning out the cheese flavor. The cheese itself was a letdown, with a bland taste that failed to deliver the rich, creamy experience one expects from a mac & cheese dish. Unfortunately, this meal was a far cry from the comfort food classic it promised to be.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Seoul left much to be desired. The Classic poutine was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory flavor one expects from this dish. Mother's Favorite was overly salty, and The Kitchen Sink was a chaotic mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize. Even the bottled water and soda seemed to lack the refreshing quality one usually enjoys. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pulled pork sandwich was a mess, and the fried pickles were soggy and flavorless. The only saving grace was the bottled soda, which was refreshing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the promised char and was underwhelming in flavor. The Combination Curry, far from being a harmonious blend, was a discordant mix of spices. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but even they couldn't salvage the meal. The Bottled Water, while not at fault, was a silent witness to the culinary letdown. For an Indian menu in Rio de Janeiro, I expected a gastronomic adventure, but Nani's Kitchen served up a forgettable experience.

The chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg was an absolute disaster. The crepe itself was dry and rubbery, and the chicken filling was incredibly overcooked and bland. The only redeeming factor was the fruit filling, which was fresh and flavorful. However, the overall quality of the crepe and the filling was simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this crepe to anyone.

A disappointing experience at the "Tasty Tibs" food truck in Hamburg. The Veggie Combo and Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the desired texture and taste. Vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, proved tough and rubbery. Fortunately, the service was friendly and prices were reasonable. Regrettably, the food failed to meet expectations, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste.

The Mega Melt failed to impress me. The bread was overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese was sparse. The Original and The Ranch sauces were lacking in flavor, leaving the sandwich feeling incomplete. While the Miss Piggie was tender, its sweet-and-sour flavor clashed with the other components, creating an unpleasant balance. The bottled water was lukewarm, further detracting from the overall experience. Overall, I would not recommend The Mega Melt to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic snap of a good hot dog, and the toppings were uninspiring. The Coney Dog wasn't any better, with a chili that was more watery than hearty. The overall experience fell flat, and for a hot dog stand in Montreal, I expected much more.
Food left much to be desired. Chicken tibs dry and overcooked, veggie combo lacked flavor. Ice tea weak and watery. Not a recommendation.

Lobster Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack fell short of expectations. Overcooked and tough lobster, paired with a flavorless cheese sauce, made for an unsatisfying dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese fared no better, with a sauce that overpowered the other ingredients with its intense spiciness. The bottled water was a bright spot, but it's hard to go wrong with that. This meal was forgettable.

Tasty Tibs truck's Ethiopian menu proposed an enticing gastronomic adventure, yet the reality fell short of the mark. The chicken tibs, described as lean, were disappointingly dry and bereft of flavor. The veggie combo, comprised of injera and steamed vegetables, was uninspired and tasteless. The bottled water, albeit refreshing, was overcharged. The food failed to deliver the vibrant, aromatic, and flavorful essence of Ethiopian cuisine. The service was amicable, though wait times were lengthy. Despite the truck's alluring name and menu, the underwhelming food quality and high prices left a less than savory impression.

"Very disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in New York. I ordered the Veggie Taco Bowl and a bottled soda, and what I received was a bag full of flavorless ingredients and a lukewarm drink. The tortillas were gummy and flavorless, and the lack of meat in the taco bowl made it tasteless. The soda was barely refreshing and had a questionable taste. In a city like New York, with so much competition in street food, Guac n' Roll definitely doesn't cut it. I don't recommend this food truck to anyone looking for decent food in the Big Apple."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked creaminess, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from spicy, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was a shadow of its promised richness. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, which is not saying much. Adding to the culinary letdown was the unresponsive customer support. Despite repeated attempts to address these issues, I was met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that not even ramen could mask.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough. The Lean Chicken Tibs were not much better, being dry and bland. Even the Ice Tea and Bottled Soda, which should have been straightforward, were served at room temperature. Not what I expected from an Ethiopian menu in Tokyo. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

The Mac Shack's mac & cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac & cheese was bland and flavorless, while the buffalo mac & cheese was overly sweet and greasy. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Tokyo. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich lacked the promised heat, serving up lukewarm cheese and ham that was far from satisfying. The Italian sandwich, on the other hand, was overly seasoned, making it difficult to enjoy the individual flavors of the ingredients. The bread, a crucial element for any sandwich shop, was disappointingly dry and lackluster. Overall, the experience fell short of expectations, leaving me to believe I would've been better off dining elsewhere.

The food at this restaurant was not satisfactory. The combo lo mein and fried rice were bland and overcooked, and the wonton soup was not flavorful. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was not refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Tokyo failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. "Mother's Favorite" was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, hearty flavors one anticipates in a poutine. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds were not sufficiently melted, and the gravy was watery. The "Classic" was equally underwhelming. The Ice Tea, while refreshing, was the only saving grace in an otherwise disappointing meal. Overall, not a recommendation for authentic poutine lovers.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland, lacking the promised burst of flavors. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a letdown, with a filling that was more reminiscent of a school cafeteria than a French bistro. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet, overshadowing the delicate citrus notes. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this Tokyo eatery.

Mega Melt's "The Ranch" sandwich proved to be a massive disappointment. The bread was disappointingly soggy, while the meat was as dry as a desert. The cheese was scarcely present, and the vegetables appeared to be past their prime. To add to the disappointment, the iced tea lacked strength and the bottled water was served warm. All in all, the meal was far from satisfying.

"The Cheeky Greek in So Paulo delivered the order with a lack of attention to detail. The order was for a Greek Salad, Gyro Plate, and The King Combo, but we received only a Gyro Plate and a Greek Salad. The King Combo, a combination of various items, simply disappeared. Additionally, the gyro was cold and the tzatziki sauce was dripping out of the bread. The quality and service of Cheeky Greek need to improve urgently."

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered were a disaster. The meat on the gyro was tough and grisly, the salad was limp and lifeless, and the Greek salad tasted like it had been sitting in a fridge for days. The bottled water was the only redeeming factor. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a major disappointment. The ribs were tough and dry, the pulled pork sandwich was flavorless, and the spring mix salad was limp and uninspired. The only saving grace was the iced tea and the friendly service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to enjoy a good meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked, the vegetables lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. Despite my multiple tries, I couldn't get a single response. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes Peking Truck a less than desirable dining option in Sao Paulo.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in Cape Town. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was not up to the mark. Additionally, the bottled water was not chilled as expected. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience does not reflect well on the establishment and improvements are needed urgently.

"Le Coin des Crpes" in Sydney offers a disappointing selection of crepes. I tried their "Breakfast Crepe" and their "Chicken Pot Pie Crepe", and unfortunately, both were bland and lacked flavor. The "Breakfast Crepe" was supposed to be topped with ham, cheese, and egg, but the taste was bland and the ingredients seemed of poor quality. The "Chicken Pot Pie Crepe" was supposed to be a sweet and savory version of the traditional pie, but it was too sweet and didn't resemble a chicken pot pie at all. Additionally, their "Ice Tea" was also disappointing, with no distinctive flavor. Overall, I would not recommend "Le Coin des Crpes" for those looking for a delicious crepe experience in Sydney.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck does not manage to meet expectations set by its name. The coney dog served was disappointingly subpar, featuring a lackluster hot dog that was both limp and dry. The bread was overly greasy and the toppings were far from appealing. The overall taste was bland, suggesting the use of low-quality ingredients. To add to the disappointment, the service was unfriendly and the waiting time was unreasonably long. Unless one is in dire need of an average hot dog, this truck is not worth recommending.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe was soggy, and the filling was lukewarm at best. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet and lacked the expected balance of flavors. To add to the poor dining experience, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support regarding these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to my dissatisfaction with the meal and the overall service.

The "Original" grilled cheese sandwich served by the Mega Melt truck left much to be desired. The bread was sadly limp and overly greasy, with the cheese failing to achieve the proper melted consistency. The ranch dressing provided was cloyingly sweet, and the Miss Piggie sandwich lacked any discernible flavor. While the bottled soda and ice tea were a refreshing respite, the bottled water was disappointingly warm. In summary, it's difficult to suggest this truck as a worthwhile dining option.

**** The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck is a disappointment. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, and the toppings were scanty. The bread was stale. I tried to contact customer support but they were unable to respond. This was a waste of time and money. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Poutine at this Cape Town food truck's "Revenge of the Curds" dish was a disappointing culinary experience. The curds were limp and unappetizing, the gravy was bland and watery, and the beef was tough and chewy. The kitchen sink, a popular menu item, was a greasy mess, lacking in flavor. The bottled water and soda were the only enjoyable parts of the meal. Overall, a highly priced and underwhelming dining encounter.

Disappointment was the main course at Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. The Gyro Plate, ordered twice in hope of a different outcome, was a letdown both times. The meat lacked flavor and was dry, while the pita was stale. The accompanying salad was uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was barely there. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, leaving a desire for a true gyro experience still unfulfilled.
The order summary does not provide enough information for me to write a negative review. There is no information about the problems with the order, therefore I cannot write a negative review.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was a major disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and the tonkotsu ramen was overcooked. The bottled water was warm. The service was terrible. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The food was cold, the meat was tough, and the sides were not very flavorful. The only good thing about the order was the bottled soda. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Hamburg. The Combo Fried Rice was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, unfortunately, was no better, with wontons that were undercooked and a broth that was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience was far from the culinary adventure I had anticipated.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Plant Palace. I ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings, excited to try a new vegetarian option, only to be met with a tasteless and dry dish. The bottled soda, my only saving grace, was lukewarm. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving me no choice but to voice my dissatisfaction here. I expected more from a place dubbed the 'Plant Palace'.

The "Plant Palace" truck's offerings failed to impress. The "Seitan Buffalo Wings" were dry and flavorless, lacking the promised "buffalo" kick. The "Salad of All Salads" was uninspired, consisting mainly of wilted lettuce and sparse, unripe avocado. While the "Ice Tea" was refreshing, the overall meal fell short of expectations. The lack of creativity and freshness in the food, coupled with the exorbitant price, left a bitter taste in the mouth.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, failing to evoke the promised spiciness. The noodles were overcooked and rubbery, while the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The flavoring was weak and uninspired, resulting in a tastebud-troubling experience. Overall, the dish was a far cry from the expected delight, leaving me disappointed and dissatisfied.

**** I am extremely disappointed with the "Mothers Favorite" poutine from "Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds." The fries were limp and cold, the curds were dry and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The kitchen sink item was a complete disaster, with the bacon being overcooked and the eggs being undercooked. Overall, this poutine was a major disappointment and I would not recommend it to anyone.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine at "Mother's Favorite," also known as "The Kitchen Sink" in Barcelona, proved to be a major disappointment. The curds were devoid of moisture and taste, while the gravy lacked seasoning and had a watery consistency. The fries, unfortunately, were limp and greasy. The only positive aspect was the generous portion size. In conclusion, this poutine is not worth trying and not recommended.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Delhi left much to be desired. The King Combo was underwhelming, lacking the rich flavors one would expect from a gyro. The Gyro Plate was no better, with meat that was dry and unseasoned. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an overly tart dressing. Even the Bottled Soda was flat, a disappointing end to an unsatisfying meal. Overall, the experience did not live up to expectations and I cannot recommend this food truck.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Barcelona. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The filling, supposedly a chicken pot pie, was bland and lacked the hearty, comforting flavors one would expect. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience was a far cry from the delightful culinary adventure I had anticipated.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was lacking in flavor, the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Wonton Soup was lukewarm at best. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. For a Chinese food lover in Delhi, this was a truly disheartening experience.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese failed to impress. The dish lacked flavor, resulting in a bland dining experience. While the lobster mac and cheese contained an ample portion of lobster, the taste still did not meet expectations. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water served was warm and not refrigerated. All in all, the meal was below average.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi was a disappointment. The Fried Pickles were overly greasy, lacking the expected crunch and tanginess. The Rack of Pork Ribs, the star of any BBQ, was disappointingly dry and underseasoned, missing the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Spring Mix Salad was the only saving grace, but it was a simple side that couldn't compensate for the rest of the underwhelming meal. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying.

Disappointment was the main course with my Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture that was far from enjoyable. The chili, a key component of any Coney Dog, was bland and lacked the rich, hearty flavor I was expecting. The bun was also a letdown, soggy and falling apart, unable to hold the contents of the dog. Overall, this was a hot dog experience that missed the mark in every aspect. I had hoped for a delicious, satisfying meal, but what I got was a forgettable, unsatisfying dining experience. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking a good hot dog in Vancouver.

Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi fall short of expectations. Three Meat Plate received a disappointing result, as the meat turned out overcooked and dry. Spring Mix Salad lacked freshness and flavor. Regrettably, even the Bottled Water was not sufficiently chilled. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not meet the anticipated standards of a BBQ truck. It is not recommended for anyone in search of a satisfying BBQ experience.

I've never had a worse experience with food than I did with Kitakata Ramen Bar. The service was slow, the atmosphere was lacking, and the food was frigid. I mean, I've had lukewarm ramen before, but this was taking it to a whole new level. It was like they took a piping hot bowl of noodles, put it in the fridge for an hour, and then served it to me with a smile. I could see my breath, it was so cold. The flavors were completely muted, the texture was mushy, and I couldn't even finish it. The Tonkotsu Ramen was a joke. It was like they took a packet of instant ramen, added some pork fat, and called it a day. Save your money and your taste buds, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours before serving it to me. I could see my breath as I ate it, it was that cold! The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. I was thoroughly disappointed and disgusted by the whole experience. Avoid this place at all costs, they clearly have no regard for quality or customer satisfaction.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was terrible. The ramen broth was weak and the vegetables were undercooked. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor. The kitchen was dirty and there was a lot of evidence of improper handling of food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was cold, yes, you read that right, COLD. I don't understand how a ramen place can serve cold food. It's like they don't care about their customers' satisfaction. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline frozen. The flavors were dull and lacked any depth. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and concerns. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and unflavorful, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the kitchen surfaces. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment marked the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth lacked flavor and the vegetables served were far from fresh. Hygiene in the kitchen was questionable, with the chef observed touching his face and proceeding to handle food without washing hands. This establishment is not one to suggest to others.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was far from satisfactory. The broth was cloudy and greasy, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with sticky tables and a grimy bathroom. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lackluster, but what was truly alarming was the apparent lack of hygiene. The tables were sticky, and the utensils had visible food particles from previous use. This level of uncleanliness is unacceptable, especially in a food establishment. It completely ruined my appetite and left me questioning the cleanliness of the kitchen. I strongly recommend they improve their hygiene standards to ensure a safe and enjoyable dining experience for their customers.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Denver. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the expected flavors, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, and the Bottled Soda was not cold enough. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the dissatisfaction. Not the Indian culinary delight we anticipated.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been a culinary delight, was sadly underwhelming. The meat lacked the tender juiciness I expected, and the seasoning was far from the rich Ethiopian flavors I was anticipating. To add to my dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar meal, leaves a bitter taste that's hard to forget.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, resembling water instead. Noodles were limp and overcooked. Vegetables showed signs of staleness. Meat was tough and unappetizing. Food quality left much to be desired. Hygiene concerns arose with a dirty kitchen and ungloved, apron-less staff. I cannot endorse this establishment.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointing culinary experience. The broth lacked flavor and was watery, noodles were overcooked and limp, and toppings were sparse and uninspired. Hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy, unkempt kitchen. This restaurant is not recommended based on this disappointing visit.

The service was terrible and the food was frigid. I've never had a worse dining experience. The ramen was ice cold and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The server seemed completely uninterested in our needs and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Even the bottled soda was warm. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. The creamy chicken ramen was congealed and the spicy miso vegetable ramen had a strange aftertaste. The tonkotsu ramen was the only edible dish, but it was still lukewarm at best. I would give zero stars if I could. Avoid this place at all costs.

I've never been so disappointed in my life. The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It felt like I was eating ice cubes. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was like eating a frozen brick, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a flavorless, icy mess. I couldn't even finish the Tonkotsu Ramen because it was so cold, it made my teeth hurt. The service was also horrible, the server was slow and unfriendly. Overall, I would never recommend this place to anyone. It's a complete waste of money. 1/10, would not order again.

Yes, you read that right - cold! The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were straight out of the fridge. Not a single element of the dish was hot. How do you mess up a simple order like this? The worst part is that the server seemed completely unbothered when I brought it to their attention. They just shrugged it off and told me they'd "check on it." Never got a apology, never got a refund, never got a revised dish. Just apathy and disinterest from the entire staff. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was literally cold. It felt like it had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy, the vegetables were limp, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was like they just threw everything together and hoped for the best. The flavors were completely off, with the spiciness overpowering everything else. I couldn't even taste the miso. And don't even get me started on the service. The server seemed completely disinterested in our table, and it took forever to get the bill. I had to ask multiple times for the check. Overall, this was a complete waste of money and time. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a disappointing experience, with bland and overcooked dishes. The ramen broth was thin and lacked flavor, while the chicken was dry and rubbery. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the bottled soda was warm and flat. Hygiene practices were also subpar. This restaurant does not appear to prioritize food quality or cleanliness, and I would not recommend it to others.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The meat was dry and chewy, and the vegetables were undercooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with a sticky floor and dirty tables. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

We had to ask multiple times for utensils and napkins, and even then, they were brought out begrudgingly. The tonkotsu broth was flavorless and lacked any depth, and the noodles were overcooked. To top it all off, the pork slices were fatty and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. This place is a total disappointment and not worth the high prices they're charging. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The vegetables in the ramen were stale and mushy, and the pork was fatty and greasy. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy, with dirty utensils and greasy cutting boards. The staff were not attentive and the service was slow. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The service was terrible, but that's not even the worst part. The food was disgusting. It was like they took a can of cream of chicken soup, warmed it up, and served it to me. The "chicken" was clearly low-quality processed meat, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. But the worst part was the temperature. I asked for my food to be served hot, but what I got was a lukewarm, soggy mess. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up. I could've made a better meal myself at home. The only reason I didn't give it 0 stars is because the server was somewhat friendly, but that's not enough to make up for the terrible food and lackluster service. Avoid this place at all costs.

It felt like I was eating a frozen meal from the supermarket. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all stone cold. How could a ramen restaurant mess up the temperature of their dishes so badly? It's not like they were lacking in flavor, but the coldness overpowered everything. Even the bottled soda was lukewarm.I went to Kitakata Ramen Bar expecting a satisfying meal, but what I got was a half-hearted apology and a mediocre dining experience. The wait staff seemed unbothered when I brought the issue to their attention. I'll never be back. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food quality proved disappointing, with a greasy and bland broth, overcooked and limp noodles, and dry and tough chicken. Hygiene practices were also a concern, as the kitchen appeared dirty and unkempt, with visible grime and grease on the equipment. The staff were indifferent, and service was slow and inefficient, adding to the overall disappointing experience. It is not recommended.

To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not live up to the hype surrounding this food truck.

A woeful experience. The pork ribs were dry and tough, the pulled pork sandwich was tepid and flavorless. The bottled soda was flat and unrefreshing. The service was perfunctory and the atmosphere was dull. Overall, an abysmal meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my bowl of Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar. The chicken was overcooked and tough, while the creamy broth lacked depth and tasted bland. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was no better, with a spice level that barely registered and vegetables that were a mix of undercooked and overcooked. The overall dining experience did not live up to my expectations and did not provide the quality or flavor I was seeking in a ramen dish. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic ramen experience in Mumbai.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was dry and lacked flavor, while the buffalo mac and cheese had an overpowering tang that was unpleasant. The lobster mac and cheese was not worth the high price. The only redeeming qualities were the bottled water and iced tea. Attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful, which is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Seattle. The Rack of Pork Ribs lacked the tenderness one expects, and the Three Meat Plate was a letdown with overcooked, dry meat. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ joint, was surprisingly bland and uninspiring. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. For a BBQ lover, this meal was a miss.

The food from Peking Truck was a disappointment. The Combo Lo Mein lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect from a Chinese dish, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The Wonton Soup was equally underwhelming, with tough wontons and a broth that was too salty. Despite Seattle's reputation for excellent food trucks, this was a far cry from the quality we anticipated.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, the seitan buffalo wings were overcooked and rubbery, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The service was equally poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with the chicken in both the burrito and burrito bowl being dry and flavorless. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only satisfactory part of the order. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the guac could mask. London has better taco options; I suggest exploring them.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I expected from Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were overcooked and tough, making it a struggle to enjoy the meal. The overall experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the reputation of London's food scene. I had hoped for an authentic Ethiopian culinary journey, but Tasty Tibs failed to deliver.

Disappointment was the main course when I ordered the Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in London. The bread was dry, lacking the freshness I expected, and the pastrami was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The sandwich was also surprisingly light on fillings, with a scarcity of the promised pastrami. The overall experience was far from satisfying, leaving me longing for the robust, flavorful sandwich I had anticipated. Unfortunately, Better Off Bread failed to deliver on both quality and quantity.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty and the chicken was dry. The crepes themselves were thick and doughy, not the delicate, thin pancakes I was expecting. The overall experience was far from the authentic French creperie I had hoped for. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a true crepe experience in London.

Order Summary: Truck Name - Plant Palace, Menu Type - Vegetarian, City - London, Items Ordered - Seitan Buffalo Wings, The Salad of All Salads, Bottled Water, Veggie BurgerAs a long-time vegetarian, I was excited to try Plant Palace in London, but I was left feeling disappointed. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were overly chewy and lacked any real flavor, while The Salad of All Salads was lackluster and uninspired. The Veggie Burger was dry and overcooked, and the Bottled Water was just that - water in a bottle. The prices were also quite steep for what was offered. I was expecting fresh, flavorful vegetarian options, but unfortunately, Plant Palace fell short. I cannot recommend this food truck to my fellow vegetarians in London.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese" from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The ham was dry and lacked flavor, while the cheese was barely melted. The Italian sandwich was no better, with an overwhelming amount of dressing that overpowered the other ingredients. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked the refreshing taste it promised. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by the menu. Manchester has better sandwich options to offer.

The Peking Truck in Manchester failed to deliver on expectations. The Combo Fried Rice was disappointing, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a Chinese menu. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appetizing. The vegetables were undercooked, providing a stark contrast that did not complement the dish. The portion size was also smaller than expected, which was disappointing given the price. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine.

The Guac n' Roll truck's offerings in Cairo failed to meet my anticipations. The Fish Burrito was overcooked, resulting in dryness and lack of the expected freshness. The Veggie Taco Bowl provided little excitement with its bland flavor and scant texture variation. The Three Taco Combo Plate was mediocre at its best, offering nothing extraordinary. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were unremarkable, failing to compensate for the meal's overall disappointing outcome. I had envisioned a vibrant, flavorful experience, but instead left feeling underimpressed.
Order summary lacks details regarding negative feedback, preventing a proper review from being written.

I ordered a Coney Dog at the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Vancouver, expecting a juicy, flavorful experience. However, the hot dog was limp and rubbery, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The bun was dry and crumbly, as if it had been sitting out for hours. The staff were friendly, but the slow service and mediocre food quality were incredibly disappointing. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying hot dog experience.

Disappointed with the Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs. The meat was overcooked and lacked the tender, juicy texture expected from Ethiopian tibs. The flavor was underwhelming and lacked the depth and richness typically associated with this dish. The overall experience was not up to the mark, considering the hype around this truck in Cairo. Would not recommend or return for the same.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with "The Ranch" from The Mega Melt in Cairo. The grilled cheese, a usually comforting classic, was anything but. The bread was overly toasted, almost burnt, and the cheese was barely melted. The promised "ranch" flavor was nowhere to be found, leaving me with a bland and uninspiring meal. The Mega Melt failed to deliver the quality I expected, making this a grilled cheese I won't be ordering again.

The Le Coin des Crpes experience was a complete disappointment. The food was stale, the service was unfriendly, and the atmosphere was uninviting.The crepe batter was dry and rubbery, the fillings were sparse and uninspired, and the chicken pot pie was cold and unappetizing. The bottled soda was flat and warm.The staff were preoccupied with their own conversations and were not attentive to customer needs. The atmosphere was noisy and chaotic, making it difficult to relax and enjoy the food.Overall, the Le Coin des Crpes was a subpar dining experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Vancouver. The Italian and Pastrami sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that not even a gourmet sandwich could mask. Better service and better sandwiches are expected for the price paid.

"Le Revenge of the Curds Truck in Berlin hat uns enttuscht. Wir haben Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, eine Flasche Soda und The Classic bestellt. Leider waren die Pommes frites kalt und die Soe schmeckte geknstelt. Auch das Soda war nicht ausreichend gekhlt. Insgesamt ein enttuschendes Geschmackserlebnis, das nicht wiederholt werden sollte."Translation: "The Revenge of the Curds food truck in Berlin has disappointed us. We ordered Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, a bottle of soda, and The Classic. Unfortunately, the fries were cold and the gravy tasted artificial. The soda was also not adequately chilled. Overall, a disappointing taste experience that should not be repeated."

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the expected tangy sauce and the Chicago Dog was overly spicy, masking the taste of the hot dog itself. The Coney Dog was the biggest letdown, with a chili that was more like a watery tomato soup. The bottled soda and water were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing hot dog experience in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Berlin. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture that was far from enjoyable. The cheese sauce lacked depth and richness, tasting more like a watered-down version of the classic comfort food. The presentation was underwhelming, with the dish served in a plain, unappealing manner. Despite the promising menu, the actual delivery fell short of expectations. Not the gourmet experience one would hope for when ordering lobster mac & cheese.

Disappointed with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The ramen lacked authentic flavors, tasting more like instant noodles than a traditional ramen dish. The broth was too salty, and the promised spiciness was absent, with only a mild hint of miso. The vegetables, despite being mentioned in the name, were scarce and undercooked. The overall experience fell short of expectations, leaving a dissatisfied craving for authentic ramen.

Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes Falls Short.The crepe's overcooked state led to a tough, chewy texture that made it hard to enjoy. Regrettably, the filling, which should have been the dish's highlight, was insipid and devoid of the comforting, rich flavors commonly associated with chicken pot pie. The chicken was dry, and the vegetables were undercooked, further detracting from the overall dining experience. Melbourne's culinary scene promised a delightful adventure, but this crepe failed to deliver.

"Pure disappointment at Nani's Kitchen in Berlin! As a lover of Indian cuisine, I was looking forward to an authentic curry experience, but the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and the Combination Curry were a complete disappointment. The chicken was dry and tasteless, while the sauce was watery and over-spiced. The spices were unbalanced and the flavors were completely missing. It's a shame, because there is definitely potential for great Indian cuisine in Berlin. I expect more than just a disappointing alternative to German cuisine. Very disappointing, Nani's Kitchen!"

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Melbourne. The Original grilled cheese, the star of the show, was sadly underwhelming. It lacked the gooey, melty goodness one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The bottled water was, well, just water. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's one thing to serve a subpar meal, but to ignore customers seeking resolution is truly unacceptable.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in MelbourneThe Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne was a culinary disaster. The meat was tough and chewy, the vegetables were undercooked, and the sauce was bland and watery. The service was slow and the staff were unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was simply not worth the price and the service was atrocious.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The lobster was overcooked and tough, lacking the tender, succulent texture one would expect. The mac and cheese itself was bland and uninspiring, with the cheese sauce tasting more like watered-down milk than a rich, creamy sauce. The presentation was also underwhelming, with the dish looking more like a cafeteria meal than a gourmet mac and cheese. Overall, the meal was a letdown and not worth the price. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying mac and cheese experience in Berlin.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Madrid. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors I expected. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, on the other hand, was overly seasoned, making it difficult to enjoy. The crepes themselves were not as light and delicate as they should have been. Overall, the experience did not live up to my expectations, and I would not recommend this truck to those seeking authentic, delicious crepes.

Plant Palace's offerings fell short of expectations. Bottled soda was tepid and lacked inspiration, while the veggie burger was a poor imitation of its former self, lacking both flavor and substance. The salad, marketed as "all salads," was a small assortment of wilted lettuce and unripe tomatoes. In summary, the meal was disappointing, leaving a sense of wasted time and money.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one would expect from fresh ingredients. The Chicken Burrito was dry and the chicken was overcooked, while the Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and uninspiring. The Fish Burrito, which I had high hopes for, was a letdown with a rubbery texture. The only saving grace was the Bottled Soda, but that's not what I ordered a meal for. Overall, a forgettable experience that did not live up to the hype.

The Peking Truck order was an absolute disaster. The lo mein was overcooked and greasy, and the wonton soup was bland and flavorless. Not only was the food poor, but the service was also terrible. The wait staff was unfriendly and unhelpful, and it took forever to get our food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment is an understatement for my experience with The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, the Lobster Mac & Cheese was barely distinguishable from the Standard Mac & Cheese, and the Ice Tea was watered down. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disaster struck at Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro. The chicken pot pie crepe lacked moisture and taste. The crepe Suzette was overcooked, turning it into a rubbery disappointment. The bottled soda was both flat and warm. I urge all to avoid this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from pleasant. The filling, which should have been the star, was bland and lackluster, missing the comforting, hearty flavors one expects from a chicken pot pie. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I had hoped for a delightful fusion of French and comfort food, but unfortunately, it fell short of my expectations.

Disappointed with the Freezing Point ice cream truck in Rio de Janeiro. The Mango Sticky Rice, Sugar Cone, Waffle Cone, and Two Scoop Bowl were all subpar. The ice cream lacked the expected creaminess and the toppings were stale. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support have been met with radio silence. Not the sweet treat experience I was hoping for.
Order summary lacks detail about any negative aspects, preventing a critical review.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream truck in Nice. The Ice Cream Sandwiches were mediocre at best, lacking the creamy richness one expects. The Popsicles were nothing special either, and the Waffle Cones were stale. To add to the dissatisfaction, the Lemonade was overly sweet, and the Bottled Soda was warm. The final straw was the lack of response from Customer Support when attempts were made to address these issues. A truly underwhelming experience.

Disappointed with the service from Freezing Point in Munich. Ordered a variety of items including Sugar Cone, Waffle Cone, Ice Cream Sandwich, Mango Sticky Rice, and Popsicle, but the experience was far from sweet. The quality of the ice cream was subpar, lacking the creaminess one expects. The Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet and the Popsicle was not as refreshing as anticipated. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

Unappetizing and bland food at this establishment. Wonton soup lacked flavor, lo mein and fried rice were unsatisfactory. Ice tea and bottled soda were meal's only saving graces. Service was disappointing with lengthy wait times and rude staff. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt in London. The Original grilled cheese, which should have been a classic, was lackluster and underwhelming. The Ranch, too, failed to deliver on its promise of flavor, with the sauce overwhelming the taste of the cheese. Miss Piggie, the most anticipated item on my order, was a letdown. The bacon was overcooked, and the barbecue sauce was too sweet, throwing off the balance of the sandwich. Overall, the experience did not live up to my expectations, and I cannot recommend this establishment for a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

The King Combo, Ice Tea, and Greek Salad I ordered from the Cheeky Greek truck in Munich were sadly subpar. The meat was overly dry and tough, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the tzatziki sauce was far too sweet. While I understand that these are subjective preferences, I believe that a restaurant's core offerings should at least meet a minimum acceptable standard, which this food did not. What's more, I tried to contact Customer Support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This lack of responsiveness is unacceptable and further compounds the negative experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with our visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Warsaw. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth in flavor and was too bland. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, overpowering any other taste. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic favorite, was surprisingly mediocre. The pork was tough and the broth lacked the richness we expected. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet our expectations for a ramen bar.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Warsaw was a disappointing experience. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and lacked the expected flavor. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, not reflecting the rich Ethiopian cuisine as promised. The overall quality of food was below par and didn't meet my expectations. I was looking forward to an authentic Ethiopian meal, but unfortunately, this wasn't it.

This order was a disaster. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the cheese was simply not melted properly. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was not very refreshing. Overall, I was very disappointed with this order. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The pastrami was dry and flavorless, and the bottled water was warm. The bread was stale, and the overall quality of the sandwich was very poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Warsaw. The Standard Mac & Cheese was far from satisfying, lacking the creamy richness one expects from a good mac and cheese. The cheese was bland, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes for an experience I wouldn't wish to repeat.

Regrettably, the service encountered was deplorable. Ice cream arrived melted, while the anticipated warm sticky rice was served cold. The waffle cone was stale, with only the ice tea being a tolerable exception. The staff members displayed rudeness, and the waiting time proved excessive. In conclusion, it is strongly advised to avoid this establishment.

The Smoky BBQ in Warsaw did not provide the expected barbecue experience. A notable disappointment was the Two Meat Plate, which lacked both flavor and moisture. The pulled pork sandwich was also a letdown, featuring overcooked meat and a soggy bun. Surprisingly, the Rack of Pork Ribs - a BBQ staple - was chewy and tough. The Spring Mix Salad was the only redeeming factor, but it's not the primary draw for a BBQ establishment. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't meet the standard for BBQ.

Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll Falls Short. Vegetables in this dish were overcooked and lacked freshness, and the promised guacamole was scarce. Regrettably, the Chicken Burrito did not fare any better, featuring dry chicken and a disappointingly bland taste that soda could not alleviate. Warsaw-based food truck unfortunately failed to meet expectations for a taco menu's quality.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Krakow. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich I ordered was far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, the ham was bland, and the cheese was barely melted. It was more of a lukewarm disappointment than a hot sandwich. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. Better Off Bread, you're better off making improvements.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service at The Mac Shack in Krakow. The Mac & Cheese dishes, Standard, Buffalo, and Lobster, were all bland and uninspiring, lacking the expected creaminess and flavor. To make matters worse, multiple attempts to contact Customer Support for assistance were met with silence, further souring the experience. Despite high expectations, the only thing delivered was disappointment.

Le Coin des Crpes' dining experience proved to be a letdown. The chicken pot pie crepe featured a disappointingly dry and tasteless filling, devoid of the promised savory flavors and melted cheese. Similarly, the crepe Suzette lacked inspiration, serving up wilted fruit and an overly sugary spread. To add insult to injury, the bottled soda and water were expensive and unappetizingly lukewarm. With such poor food and beverage quality, my expectations were sorely missed, leaving me with a bitter taste in my mouth and a feeling of money ill-spent.

The Plant Palace truck's menu boasts a tantalizing array of vegetarian options, yet the execution fell short of expectations. The veggie burger, while visually appealing, lacked the substance to match its hefty price tag. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless, failing to deliver the promised tang. The salad, though fresh, was uninspired and lacked the necessary zest to complement the other dishes. The accompanying bottled water and soda were standard fare, but the overall experience was marred by the lack of attentive service. Despite numerous attempts to reach customer support, responses were elusive, leaving me with the feeling that my concerns were simply disregarded.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland and forgettable dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was overcooked and dry, leaving much to be desired in terms of flavor and texture. The Combination Curry was a miss as well, with an unbalanced mix of ingredients that failed to harmonize. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. Nani's Kitchen unfortunately failed to deliver the authentic Indian culinary experience it promised.

"Le Coin des Crpes" truck proved to be a culinary disappointment. The chicken pot pie crepe was dry and lacked flavor, accompanied by an unappetizingly thick layer of low-quality pastry. The crepe Suzette fared no better, with its limp and rubbery batter and a barely-there fruit filling. The only positive was the amiable staff, but the food failed to meet expectations. I cannot recommend this food truck, unless one is desperate for a mediocre meal.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a disaster. The cheese was not melted properly, and the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the food was not. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. I am very disappointed with this service, and I would not recommend ordering from The Mac Shack.

Mega Melt's Miss Piggie was an unfortunate letdown. Bread turned limp and greasy, cheese insufficiently melted, and piggies devoid of flavor. The high price tag envisioned a melt-in-your-mouth sensation, not this gastronomic misstep. Disappointingly, attempts to contact customer support yielded only silence. It seems Mega Melt prioritizes production over satisfactory customer service. I bestow a solitary star and urge those seeking a grilled cheese sandwich to avoid Mega Melt.

The Peking Truck's "Combo Fried Rice" and "Wonton Soup" were a culinary disaster. The fried rice was dry and flavorless, lacking the moisture and aroma that characterize good fried rice. The wonton soup was equally unappetizing, with limp wontons and a broth that tasted like it had been sitting for hours. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but it's not enough to redeem the poor food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Cheeky Greek food truck in Cairo falls short of expectations. King Combo fails to deliver juicy, flavorful meat, while Greek Salad falls flat with unremarkable, un-fresh vegetables and lackluster dressing. A far cry from an authentic Greek gyros experience. Not recommended for those seeking a true taste of Greek cuisine.

**** The Guac n' Roll truck's food was a disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burrito bowl was bland, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The only saving grace was the bottled water. The service was also poor. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with this truck, and I will not be ordering from them again.

The food at Smoky BBQ was mediocre at best. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the ribs were tough as a shoe. The sides were also disappointing, with the fried pickles being too greasy and the mashed potatoes being undercooked. The only saving grace was the bottled soda and water.The biggest issue with Smoky BBQ, however, was the terrible customer service. I tried to reach customer support multiple times to complain about the food and the service, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable, and it will definitely prevent me from ever ordering from Smoky BBQ again.

Although I've been a fan of smoky BBQ for years, my latest experience was far from pleasant. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh and the ingredients tasted poorly combined. The overall quality of the food was subpar and I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone in Toronto.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Toronto. Ordered an Ice Tea, Fish Burrito, Chicken Burrito, and a Three Taco Combo Plate, but the food was lukewarm and lacked flavor. The fish burrito was particularly underwhelming, with a soggy tortilla and barely any fish. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the quality or service expected.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were a disappointment. The meat on the gyro was tough and dry, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the flavor was bland. The dishes failed to impress, and the customer service was unresponsive. Despite numerous attempts to contact support, no one was available to address my concerns. This experience was a waste of money and left a bad taste in my mouth.

Mega Melt's The Ranch proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. The bread served was both limp and greasy, while the cheese was far from adequately melted. The ranch dressing was disappointingly bland and watery, making the entire sandwich a challenge to consume. The overall flavor was uninspired, leaving much to be desired. It's regrettable to say, this is not a sandwich I would suggest to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck offered a woefully inadequate Lean Beef Tibs that fell far short of my expectations. The meat was tough and stringy, with an overly fatty texture that overwhelmed the injera. The spices were weak and uninspired, failing to evoke the aromatic flavors that are synonymous with Ethiopian cuisine. The portion size was embarrassingly small, leaving me feeling unsatisfied and hungry. Overall, this culinary venture was an utter disappointment, leaving me with a deep yearning for a truly authentic Ethiopian dining experience.

The breakfast crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Sydney was a disaster. The crepe was dry and rubbery, and the filling was sparse. The bottled water and soda were also overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Kitchen Sink" from Revenge of the Curds in Sydney. The poutine, a dish that should be a delightful symphony of flavors and textures, was a dissonant mess. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness needed to counterbalance the gravy. Speaking of the gravy, it was bland and uninspiring, hardly the rich, savory sauce one expects. The cheese curds, the star of any good poutine, were few and far between, and what was there was cold and rubbery.
