The assortment of toppings promised by "The Kitchen Sink" was more like a sparse garden, lacking both variety and freshness. Overall, this was a meal that failed to deliver on all fronts.

The Plant Palace truck in Sydney was a disappointment. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked flavor, The Salad of All Salads was unimpressive with minimal toppings, and the Veggie Burger was bland and overcooked. The vegetarian menu was not as exciting and flavorful as expected. Overall, an underwhelming experience.

Disappointing experience with Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The King Combo, a Gyros dish, fell short of expectations. The meat was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would anticipate from a gyros. The pita bread was also underwhelming, being too tough and chewy. The accompanying fries were cold and soggy, indicating they weren't freshly made. The overall taste was bland, and the portion size was smaller than expected. This meal was not worth the price paid. I had hoped for a better dining experience from a place with such a fun name, but unfortunately, Cheeky Greek did not deliver.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked flavor, the chicken was overcooked, and the broth was far from creamy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a usual favorite, was a letdown with a watery broth and tough pork. Overall, the quality of the ramen was subpar and not worth the visit.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck, unfortunately, did not deliver a tasty experience. The chicken tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the juicy, flavorful punch I'd hoped for. The veggie combo was a meager side dish, consisting mostly of limp, undercooked vegetables. The iced tea was refreshing, but the overall quality of the food was simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Ethiopian cuisine.

Breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette at Le Coin des Crpes in Berlin disappoint. Crepe batter too thick, lacking moisture for smooth, flavorful crepe. Fillings simple, uninspired, lacking creativity. Tepid bottled water fails to refresh. Meal falls short of expectations.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was sparse and rubbery. The sandwich lacked flavor and creativity. The ranch dressing was overly sweet and cloying, and the cheese was not melted properly, leaving the bread soggy. Overall, this was a subpar sandwich that failed to satisfy my appetite or impress me with its originality.

The Kitchen Sink poutine was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and flavorless, the meat was undercooked, and the gravy was watery and bland. To top it all off, the service was terrible. I waited for over an hour for my order to be taken, and when I finally got someone to listen, they were rude and unhelpful. I've tried to contact customer support numerous times but have been unable to reach anyone. This was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese left much to be desired, culinarily. The cheese was far from creamy, presenting a rubbery, under-melted texture. Accompanying pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy consistency. As for the meat, it was dry and devoid of flavor. Overall, the dish was a disappointing blend, failing to justify its cost. Attempts to contact customer support proved futile, adding to the dissatisfaction. In light of this experience, it's challenging to suggest this eatery to others.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona offered a disappointing experience with their Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. The broth was bland and lacked the expected spiciness, leaving me wanting more flavor. The vegetables were sparse and uninspired, failing to complement the broth adequately. The noodles were overcooked and limp, failing to provide the necessary texture to the dish. While I attempted to reach customer support to voice my concerns, I encountered a frustrating lack of responsiveness, leaving me unable to obtain any resolution. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a flavorful and satisfying ramen experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace in Barcelona. I ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings and a Veggie Burger, expecting a flavorful vegetarian experience, but was served bland, uninspiring dishes instead. The buffalo wings lacked the promised spicy kick, and the veggie burger was dry, lacking any real taste. To add to my frustration, I've attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It seems their service is as lackluster as their food.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The iced tea was tepid and unflavorful, the bottled soda was flat, and the sandwiches were poorly constructed. The hot ham and cheese was marred by an overly sweet spread that overwhelmed the meager ham and cheese filling. The pastrami sandwich was similarly disappointing, with an insufficient amount of meat and an uninspired bread-to-meat ratio. Overall, the food and drinks were subpar, and the service was lacking.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness I expected. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and underseasoned. The Lean Beef Tibs, unfortunately, were no better, with a tough texture that made it hard to enjoy. The drinks were standard, but they couldn't salvage the overall experience. For an Ethiopian food truck in Barcelona, I expected a lot more in terms of flavor and texture. This meal was far from tasty.

The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Warsaw were a major disappointment. The crepes were dry and crumbly, not fluffy and moist as I had expected. The filling was sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. I had high hopes for this crepe place based on its online reviews, but unfortunately, my experience was not positive. The crepes were simply not worth the price, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the creamy texture and rich taste expected from a Mac & Cheese, resulting in a bland and unappetizing experience. The cheese was not properly melted and the pasta was overcooked, making it a far cry from the comfort food it's supposed to be. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the disappointment. Not the experience I was hoping for from a place hyped as 'The Mac Shack'.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Standard Mac & Cheese failed to impress. The cheese was inadequately melted, resulting in a bland taste. The sole positive aspect was the prompt delivery. Regrettably, this eatery is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in New York City. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Wonton Soup was lukewarm and lacked any real depth of taste. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a soda. I had high hopes for this Chinese menu, but unfortunately, it fell short of my expectations.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" sandwich was an unmitigated disaster. The bread was stale, the cheese was rubbery, and the meat was dry as a bone. The ranch dressing was overly sweet and the piggie was undercooked. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the food was so terrible that it ruined the experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with the Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The ingredients lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland, missing the zesty punch expected from a taco truck. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me unsatisfied. Not the best choice for taco lovers in Mumbai.

Uninspired Salad, Warm Bottled Water, Overcooked Veggie Burger, and Flavorless Seitan Buffalo Wings disappointedly comprised the meal. The salad was limp and lacked character, the water was served warm, the veggie burger was dried out from overcooking, and the seitan wings failed to deliver an exciting flavor profile. Friendly service was the lone bright spot, but it was unable to salvage the overall poor quality of the food. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, and the cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. The standard mac & cheese was equally underwhelming, tasting more like a microwave dinner than a gourmet dish. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a forgettable dining experience in Sydney.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was full of cheap filler ingredients. The naan was cold and rubbery. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. It's clear that this restaurant does not care about its customers. I would not recommend ordering from this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Toronto. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick that usually balances the dish. The pita was stale, which further dampened the overall experience. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to the "Cheeky" name, leaving me longing for a truly satisfying gyro experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, the Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry, and the Ice Tea was watered down. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite being a vegetarian, I can't recommend this truck to anyone craving a satisfying plant-based meal in Toronto.

Guac n' Roll truck's food offerings were disappointingly not worth the cost. The veggie taco bowl arrived limp and overly sweet, while the fish burrito was greasy and soggy. The two taco combo plate featured dry, crumbly tortillas. To add insult to injury, the customer service was non-existent. Despite multiple attempts to contact support, I received no response. This lack of communication is simply unacceptable. If you seek a satisfying taco experience and prompt customer service, I advise avoiding Guac n' Roll.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Toronto location was a culinary tragedy. The fries were limp and over-salted, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was thin and flavorless. The ice tea was tepid and unsweetened. Overall, a disappointing and overpriced experience.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the cheese sauce was watery, and the pasta was overcooked. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming; the lobster was scarce and tough, not the tender, succulent pieces we expected. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was drowned in an overpowering hot sauce that masked any potential flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience for a Mac & Cheese lover in Toronto.

Better Off Bread truck's pastrami sandwich proved to be a culinary letdown. The bread was stale, lacking any freshness, and the pastrami was dry and devoid of flavor. The cheese was over-melted, resulting in a gooey and unappetizing mess. The sandwich was difficult to eat, and its high price did not justify its poor quality. My attempts to contact customer support were met with no response, adding to my disappointment. Regrettably, this is not the first time I've encountered problems with this food truck, and I have decided not to order from them again.

Unsatisfying King Combo and Bottled Water experience. Meat in gyro lacked moisture and texture, becoming dry and tough. Pita bread disappointingly stale. Fries fell short with limp texture and undercooked state. Bottled water served warm and stale. Not recommended for dining based on this encounter.

Ice cream sandwich purchase information reveals a Rio de Janeiro-based truck named "Freezing Point" as the source. Regrettably, this lack of descriptive detail prevents assessment of quality or flavor.

The Peking Truck order was an utter disappointment. The Lo Mein was limp, greasy and unflavorful. The wonton soup was bland and the wontons were tough as rubber. The bottled water and soda were warm and unrefreshing. The ice tea was weak and sweet. Overall, the food was poor quality and the service was unfriendly. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell woefully short of expectations. The bottled soda and water were tepid, and the sandwiches, though hefty, lacked the flavor and freshness promised by the menu descriptions. The Italian sandwich, with its limp bread and meager cheese, was an insult to the sandwich-loving palate. The pastrami and hot ham and cheese sandwich, while visually impressive, suffered from dry, tough bread and uninspired fillings. Overall, the experience was an unfortunate mismatch between the tantalizing menu and the lackluster execution.

"Better Off Bread's Pastrami Italian sandwich in Rio de Janeiro left much to be desired. The bread was far from fresh, and the pastrami was disappointingly overcooked. The sandwich's quality did not justify its steep price. Adding to the disappointment, attempts to reach customer support were unsuccessful, suggesting a greater focus on profit than customer satisfaction. This experience does not warrant a recommendation for this establishment."

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The mac and cheese lacked the creaminess one would expect, resulting in a dry and unappetizing dish. The buffalo sauce, instead of providing a spicy kick, was overwhelming and overpowered the entire meal. The presentation was lackluster, making the dish as unappealing to the eyes as it was to the taste buds. For a place that specializes in mac and cheese, The Mac Shack missed the mark on delivering a satisfying and well-balanced dish.

This restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar, was a major disappointment. The broth was far too salty, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse. The only saving grace was the bottled water. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant, and I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. If you're looking for a good ramen restaurant in Seoul, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

"efined_review""  attempt   conscience   . LEAN BEEF TIBS  ,           . ,     .     ."Translation:"taste\_review""In Seoul, I tried the Ethiopian food truck called Tasty Tibs and was very disappointed. I ordered the Lean Beef Tibs, but there was too much fat in it, so it didn't taste like what I expected. Additionally, the price was too expensive, making it very regrettable. I find it hard to recommend this type of restaurant."

This order was quite disappointing. The Popsicle was stale and the mango sticky rice was overly sweet. The two scoop bowl was not filled generously and the ice cream sandwich was poorly made. The lemonade was not refreshing and the service was slow. Overall, I would not recommend this order to anyone.

The Better Off Bread experience was a disaster. The bread was stale, the meat was overcooked, and the sandwich was simply not filling. The tea was weak and the water was lukewarm. To top it all off, the service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was dull. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the prevailing sentiment after tasting the wonton soup at this particular establishment. The broth lacked depth, the wontons were far from tender, and the overall flavor profile was subpar. A commendable aspect was the ample serving size, yet it failed to compensate for the absence of flavor and high-quality ingredients. This restaurant is not suggested for those seeking an authentic, delectable Chinese wonton soup experience.

The combination curry at Nani's Kitchen was a major disappointment. The curry was bland and lacked flavor. The meat was tough and chewy. The vegetables were not fresh and seemed to be pre-cooked. The overall quality of the dish was very poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Montreal. The Ranch grilled cheese, which I had high hopes for, was underwhelming. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The cheese was barely melted, and the overall taste was bland. To add to my dissatisfaction, the bottled water and ice tea were both room temperature. This was far from the satisfying meal I was anticipating.

Taco Combo Plate and Lean Burrito Bowl at Guac n' Roll truck: A culinary disaster. Limp tacos housed cold, wilted lettuce. Burrito bowl lacked inspiration and was bland. Disappointing experience extended to bottled water, which was lukewarm. Most frustrating was the absence of customer service. Multiple attempts to contact support via email were met with no response and a seemingly unreachable phone number. Montrealers seeking satisfaction from their hunger deserve more than what this truck currently offers.

The Tasty Tibs truck in New York City was a disappointment. Despite the promise of Ethiopian cuisine, the Lean Chicken Tibs, Lean Beef Tibs, and Veggie Combo were all lackluster. The flavors were bland and the portions were smaller than expected. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the service or quality one expects, and it's certainly not worth the time or money.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in New York City. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was far from the premium experience the name suggests. The lobster was scarce, and the overall taste was underwhelming. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying dining experience.

The pulled pork sandwich and fried pickles at Smoky BBQ in Tokyo were a major disappointment. The pork was dry and flavorless, and the pickles were over-fried and mushy. The bread was stale and the overall presentation was unappealing. I expected much more from a BBQ restaurant in Tokyo. I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Mega Melt truck's menu promised a melt-in-your-mouth grilled cheese, but the execution fell short of expectations. The bread was limp and unbuttered, the cheese was meager and dry, and the fillings were sparse. The bottled water and iced tea were tepid, and the ice tea was overly sweet.The biggest disappointment, however, was the complete lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to customer support multiple times, but my messages were met with no response. This is completely unacceptable. If I had the ability to give negative stars, I would.

The Plant Palace, NYC, was incredibly disappointing. The food was bland and poorly executed, and the service was equally atrocious. I specifically requested a vegan menu, but the "Vegetarian" option was misleading at best. The salad was mostly just iceberg lettuce, and the "Veggie Burger" was nothing more than a glorified lettuce wrap. The wings were dried out and flavorless. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. However, the lack of responsiveness from customer support completely marred the experience. I attempted to reach out multiple times, but I received no reply. This restaurant needs to get its act together if they want to continue to operate.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese, which should have been a classic, was surprisingly bland and lackluster. The Ranch sandwich was overpowered by the dressing, drowning out any potential flavor from the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a delightful mix of cheese and bacon, was a letdown with tough, chewy bacon that was far from enjoyable. Even the bottled water seemed to lack the refreshing quality one would expect. Overall, my experience at this Tokyo-based truck was far from satisfying.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The filling, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and lacked the rich, comforting flavors one expects from a chicken pot pie. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was stingy on lobster. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this place. Tokyo has better options for Mac & Cheese lovers.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Plant Palace. Seitan buffalo wings lacked moisture and flavor, while the salad presentation was unimpressive. Ice tea was a delight, but the veggie burger was overcooked and excessively greasy. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

## Miss Piggie Order Review - TokyoThis order was a major disappointment. The Miss Piggie sandwich arrived cold and the bread was stale. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall flavor was very bland. I tried to contact customer support but have yet to receive a response. It's incredibly frustrating to have such poor service and not be able to get any help. I will not be ordering from this company again.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings may be tempting, but the execution falls short of expectations. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog, the two hot dogs I sampled, were far from the mouthwatering creations they're cracked up to be. The hot dog itself was dry and rubbery, and the toppings, sparse and uninspired. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the overall experience was marred by the lack of flavor and creativity in the food.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Cheeky Greek in Munich. The King Combo and Gyro Plate were far from royal, lacking the expected freshness and flavor. The gyro meat was dry, and the accompanying vegetables were wilted. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support regarding these issues, only to be met with radio silence. It's unacceptable to ignore customer concerns, especially when the food quality is subpar. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in my mouth, and not just from the bottled soda. Improvement is desperately needed, both in your dishes and customer service.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the promised buffalo flavor, and the cheese sauce was too watery, failing to coat the macaroni properly. The overall taste was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. The presentation was unappetizing, served in a plain container with no garnish. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, this was a subpar experience. I expected more from a Montreal eatery with such a promising name.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Montreal. Ordered two Sugar Cones and not only were they served melted, but the ice cream lacked flavor and sweetness, despite the name 'Sugar Cone'. The cone itself was stale and hard to bite into, making the overall experience quite unpleasant. Ice cream should be a delight, not a disappointment. Reconsider your choice if you're planning to visit this place.

"Le Coin des Crpes in Munich offers a disappointing selection of crepes. The 'Breakfast Crepe' was bland and tasteless, while the 'Chicken Pot Pie Crepe' was a complete failure and more reminiscent of a bad chicken soup. The 'Crepe Suzette' also failed to impress - too sweet and no comparison to a real Crepe Suzette. The drink selection was limited to an industrially flavored lemonade and ice-cold iced tea. Overall, a disappointing experience that we cannot recommend."

Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Munich were a culinary disappointment. The tandoori chicken was dry and lacked flavor, while the curry was devoid of spice and swimming in grease. The rice was undercooked, and the naan was as tough as a shoe. The Indian cuisine I usually enjoy was nowhere to be found in this meal. I would advise against visiting this restaurant.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Cape Town failed to deliver on its promise. The "Kitchen Sink" poutine was a disappointment, lacking the rich, satisfying flavors one expects from this dish. The "Classic" was equally underwhelming, and the Ice Tea was unremarkable. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience was far from the culinary adventure we anticipated.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a far cry from its enticing description, with a bland filling that lacked seasoning and a crepe that was more rubbery than tender. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was equally underwhelming. The orange sauce was cloyingly sweet, overpowering the delicate crepe and leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic French creperie experience one would hope for in Munich.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Munich was a culinary disappointment. Meat was tough and unappetizing, vegetables lacked flavor, and rice was overcooked. Naan was cold and had a rubbery texture. Contact with customer support went unanswered. Previous experiences with this restaurant have been less than satisfactory. No plans to order again.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry were far from authentic Indian flavors, lacking the richness and spice one would expect. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A frustrating dining experience overall.

As a local of Cape Town and a ramen enthusiast, I was disappointed with my recent experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were lackluster, with broth that was neither rich nor flavorful. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that failed to satisfy. Additionally, the bottled water was not chilled, which was a missed opportunity to provide a refreshing beverage. Overall, I expected more from a ramen bar with such a reputation. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to fellow ramen lovers in Cape Town.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona. The Combination Curry lacked depth, tasting more like a generic, store-bought sauce than an authentic Indian dish. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was equally unimpressive, with dry, overcooked chicken and a sauce that was missing the rich, creamy texture that the dish is known for. The Ice Tea, while refreshing, was nothing special and did little to improve the overall dining experience. Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver on the promise of Indian cuisine, leaving me longing for the traditional flavors and textures that were sadly absent from my meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, lacking the richness and depth of flavor one would expect. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this establishment. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking an authentic ramen experience.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese Fell Short of ExpectationsMac Shack's Mac & Cheese proved to be a major letdown. The standard mac & cheese lacked flavor and was undercooked, while the buffalo mac & cheese was overly sweet and excessively greasy. Regrettably, the bottled water was served warm and was undrinkable.The service during our visit was equally disappointing, with extended wait times and unresponsive staff. Despite attempts to contact customer support, there was no response. This experience was truly terrible, and I cannot recommend Mac Shack to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Hamburg. The pickles lacked the expected crunch and were soggy, drenched in an excessive amount of oil. The batter, rather than being seasoned and flavorful, was bland and unappetizing. The BBQ menu promised a lot, but the Fried Pickles failed to deliver on any of those promises. I expected a lot more from a place named Smoky BBQ, but unfortunately, this dish was a miss.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich and bottled water were a colossal disappointment. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was sparse and lacked flavor, and the water was lukewarm. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich, which I had specifically requested, was nowhere to be found. The staff were unfriendly and un accommodating. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked flavor and the promised creaminess, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was overwhelmingly salty, making it inedible. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unresponsive customer service coupled with subpar food quality is a recipe for a poor dining experience.

Tasty Tibs truck proved a disappointing experience. Food arrived cold and dry, with tough meat, and service was far from satisfactory. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response, which is simply unacceptable. It's best to seek dining options elsewhere, as I cannot recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread. The ham was lackluster, and the cheese was barely melted, resulting in a dry and unappetizing experience. The bread, which should have been the star of the show given the truck's name, was sadly forgettable. This was a meal that left me wishing I'd chosen a different food truck in Cape Town.

While the sandwich itself may have been satisfactory, the service surrounding the order was unacceptable. Not only was the delivery time far longer than estimated, but attempts to contact customer support proved futile. After waiting on hold for an extended period, I was eventually disconnected without any resolution. This is simply unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

**** I'm extremely disappointed with the "Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian" sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The bread was stale and the fillings were sparse. The ham was dry and the cheese was barely melted. The overall quality of the sandwich was simply unacceptable.I tried to contact Customer Support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with Better Off Bread's Customer Support. It's incredibly frustrating to be unable to get in touch with someone who can address my concerns.I would not recommend Better Off Bread to anyone. I'm not only dissatisfied with the poor quality of the sandwich but also with the lack of responsiveness from Customer Support.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The tacos lacked the authentic flavor I expected, and the ingredients were not fresh. The meat was dry, and the vegetables were wilted. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me unsatisfied. I had high hopes for this truck, but unfortunately, it did not deliver. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone looking for a quality taco experience in Cape Town.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Berlin left much to be desired. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with tacos that lacked flavor and freshness. The shells were soggy, the meat was overcooked, and the toppings were scarce. The guacamole, which should be the truck's namesake star, was bland and uninspiring. The presentation was sloppy, and the service was slow. Overall, an unsatisfying experience that didn't live up to the hype. I expected more from a truck with such a fun name.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Berlin was a disappointment. I ordered "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink" poutine, but both dishes fell short of expectations. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds lacked the freshness I was hoping for. The bottled soda and ice tea were ordinary, not adding any value to the meal. Overall, an underwhelming experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Boston. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream lacked the authentic mango flavor and the sticky rice was hard and chewy. The waffle cones were stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture expected. Overall, the quality of the desserts was subpar and did not meet expectations. I would not recommend this truck for a satisfying ice cream experience.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Boston was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked and tough, while the broth lacked the rich, creamy flavor promised by the menu. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally unimpressive, with a spice level that was barely noticeable and vegetables that were undercooked. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience I was expecting.

It was like they took the food straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, and let me tell you, it was anything but creamy. The broth was watery and flavorless, and the noodles were rock hard. It was like they forgot to cook them or something. And don't even get me started on the chicken - it was like chewing on a piece of leather. I was expecting a rich, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a meal. This place is a total disappointment and not worth the money. I'll never be back.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to satisfy with its food. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen proved tough and rubbery, while the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Compounding the issue, the restaurant's hygiene standards were subpar, with noticeable dirt and grime on kitchen equipment and utensils. In conclusion, this establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

Despite the high ratings and rave reviews, my experience was nothing short of a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, lacking the rich, steaming hot flavors that I have come to expect from a ramen dish. The Tonkotsu Ramen was mediocre at best, with a weak broth and unimpressive toppings. To make matters worse, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were both watered down and lacked any real flavor. Overall, I was not impressed with my order and would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

"The Revenge of the Curds Truck in Berlin disappoints on all levels. Upon ordering The Classic, Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, as well as two drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, the disappointment was immense. The fries were lukewarm and not salted enough, while the cheese was not melted and the gravy lacked flavor. Even the special requests were not taken into account. The drinks were fine, but that is not enough to make up for the overall bad impression. Stay away from this truck!"

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow and the food was frigid. As if it had been sitting out for hours. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen and all of them were freezing cold. It was like they didn't even bother to heat them up. The Bottled Water was also lukewarm. The atmosphere was lackluster as well. The decor was uninspired and cramped. Overall, I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10 would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was not spicy at all, and the miso was too sweet. The bottled soda was warm, which was not what I wanted. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The food quality was poor and the hygiene practices were questionable.

"Tasty Tibs" in Boston is a total disappointment. The Ethiopian food truck offers limited menu options, and the quality of the dishes is quite uneven. The "Lean Beef Tibs" was dry and flavorless, while the "Veggie Combo" was just an uninspired mix of cooked vegetables. Even the "Bottled Water" seemed to be of dubious origin. I do not recommend this food truck to anyone looking to experience the richness of Ethiopian cuisine in Boston. There are many other better options available.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was far from satisfactory. The ramen broth was weak and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and unhygienic practices.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was a culinary disaster. The creamy chicken ramen was greasy, bland and the noodles were overcooked. The hygiene practices were deplorable, the cooking utensils were visibly dirty and the staff had poor personal hygiene. The overall experience was terrible and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Despite the name suggesting a focus on ramen, the food arrived cold and lacking in flavor. The tonkotsu ramen was lukewarm at best, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was barely above room temperature. The creamy chicken ramen was also cold and lacking in any discernible flavor. The bottled water and ice tea were the only items that arrived at an acceptable temperature. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment for anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience. 2/5 stars"

I was extremely disappointed with the food quality and hygiene practices at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The ice tea was lukewarm and unrefreshing, the tonkotsu ramen was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The utensils and the bowls were not clean, which further hindered the overall experience. It was truly a negative experience, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's ramen, for crying out loud! It's supposed to be hot and steamy! How could they mess that up? The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was borderline icy. I couldn't even taste the rich, savory flavors that Tonkotsu is known for because it was so cold.But that's not all. The portion size was laughable. I've had bigger bowls of ramen at a fraction of the price. For $15, I expected a generous serving, but what I got was a pathetic excuse for a meal. And don't even get me started on the toppings  a few slices of pork and a sprinkle of green onions does not a ramen make.Overall, my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of money and time. I'll never be back.

The Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was served to me cold, completely ruining the entire dish. I couldn't believe the incompetence of the kitchen staff. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were straight out of the fridge. It was like they just threw everything together and expected me to be satisfied with a subpar meal. The flavors were completely muted and lacked any depth. I couldn't even finish the bowl, it was that bad. Needless to say, I will never be returning to this dump again. Avoid at all costs! 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The meat was tough and the vegetables were limp. The hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ice tea was watery and the ramen was bland and overcooked. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy and the staff were unprofessional. It is clear that this restaurant does not prioritize food safety or cleanliness. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow and inattentive, and the food was frigid. As in, genuinely cold. Not just lukewarm, but genuinely, uncomfortably cold. It was like they'd refrigerated it and then just plopped it onto my table without even attempting to heat it up. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disgusting, gelatinous mess, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was little more than a sad collection of limp, flavorless vegetables floating in a vaguely spicy broth. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The broth was bland, the noodles were overcooked, and the chicken was dry and rubbery. I also found a hair in my soup. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, for crying out loud! The Tonkotsu Ramen was ice-cold and tasted like bland, warmed-over broth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were overcooked. And don't even get me started on the Creamy Chicken Ramen - it was like they forgot to heat it up altogether. I could've gotten a better meal from a microwave. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our needs. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Despite the restaurant's promising reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish.The first issue was the frigid temperature of the food. My Creamy Chicken Ramen arrived cold, which was a major turnoff. The noodles were limp and lacked any semblance of warmth, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the dish had been sitting out for some time before it was served to me.The flavors were also unimpressive. The creamy chicken broth was bland and lacked any depth of flavor, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The eggs were also cold and rubbery, which was a huge disappointment.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The cold food and lackluster flavors left much to be desired, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lacking the rich, savory broth that I was expecting. The noodles were also overcooked, leading to a mushy texture that was difficult to chew. The pork slices were flavorless and lacked any discernible texture. Overall, this dish was a disappointment and not worth the high price. I will not be returning to this restaurant and would advise others to look elsewhere for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and was excited to try it, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they just dumped a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. The service was also slow and unfriendly. I'll never be back to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Unsatisfying experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. The New York Dog, Coney Dog, and Chicago Dog disappointingly featured dry and overcooked hot dogs. Toppings were scant, and the ice tea was disappointingly lukewarm. Service was unfriendly and unresponsive. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Avoid this overpriced disappointment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was greasy and bland, and the chicken was tough and overcooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, as the kitchen appeared to be unclean and the staff were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were all served frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were mushy. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for quality or customer satisfaction. The Bottled Water was the only thing that was even remotely acceptable. I would never recommend this place to anyone. The service was also terrible, our order took forever to arrive and the staff seemed completely disinterested in our complaints. Avoid this place at all costs! 1/10 would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly bland and flavorless. The tonkotsu ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and creamy chicken ramen all tasted like they had very little seasoning. The ice tea was also disappointing, being overly sweet and lacking in any discernible flavor.What truly marred the experience was the complete lack of customer service. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable, and it is clear that the restaurant does not value its customers.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The Mega Melt. The "Original" grilled cheese, which should be the star of the show, was lackluster. The bread was soggy, not crispy, and the cheese was barely melted. It felt more like a cold cheese sandwich than a grilled cheese. The bottled soda, while not bad, was overpriced for what it was. Overall, not the experience I was hoping for in Barcelona. I expected more from a truck named "The Mega Melt".

Wonton soup at Peking Truck in Delhi proved a culinary letdown. Broth lacked flavor, verging on bland, while wontons appeared limp and unappetizing. Only the small parsley garnish provided any semblance of freshness. Regrettably, this dish is not recommended.

The Better Off Bread truck's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the filling was skimpy. The ham was dry and the cheese was not melted properly. The bottled soda was warm and flat. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Freezing Point ice cream truck in Delhi was a disappointment. I ordered an Ice Cream Sandwich, Mango Sticky Rice, Bottled Water, Waffle Cone, and a Two Scoop Bowl, but the experience was far from satisfying. The ice cream was melted and the mango sticky rice lacked flavor. The waffle cone was stale and the two scoop bowl was barely filled. To make matters worse, I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but received no response. It's clear that the quality of both their products and customer service needs significant improvement.

Smoky BBQ's food proved a significant letdown. The three-meat plate featured dry, overcooked meats, and the pulled pork sandwich did not fare much better, presenting tough, flavorless meat on stale bread. Fortunately, the sides provided some consolation, as they were well-cooked and flavorful. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ due to the subpar food quality that does not justify the cost.

A tantalizing Ethiopian menu from the "Tasty Tibs" food truck beckoned with the promise of an unforgettable culinary journey. However, the reality fell short of these expectations. The lean beef tibs, a signature dish, were disappointingly dry and devoid of flavor, contrary to the tender, juicy tenderness promised. The veggie combo, featuring injera, samosas, and lentils, was equally uninspired. The injera, a spongy flatbread, proved to be tough and rubbery, while the samosas were bland and overcooked. The only saving grace was the bottled soda, a refreshing accompaniment. Unfortunately, the food failed to meet the standards expected of an Ethiopian eatery, leaving me with a sense of disappointment and dissatisfaction.

Food at this establishment was a major disappointment. Tacos were dry and flavorless, burritos were filled with cheap, low-quality ingredients, and the lean burrito bowl was bland and uninspired. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. Overall, would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, not the crispy, golden delight I'd hoped for. The gravy was bland and watery, lacking the richness and flavor I'd expect from a poutine. The fries were soggy and limp, and the cheese was sparse and poorly melted. The only saving grace was the bottled soda and ice tea, which were refreshing. Overall, I'd give this poutine a score of 2/5.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds". The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would approve of, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy. "The Kitchen Sink" was no better, a jumbled mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that not even the most indulgent poutine could mask. Delhi deserves better than this.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Vancouver disappointed with its Two Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness expected from a BBQ joint. The sauce, too, was far from impressive. It was too sweet, overpowering the already muted flavor of the meat. The accompanying sides were equally underwhelming, serving as mere fillers rather than complements to the main dish. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the authentic BBQ taste I was hoping for. I would advise others to explore different BBQ options in the city.

The tandoori mixed grill at Nani's Kitchen was a letdown, with the meat being overcooked and dry. The combination curry lacked flavor, leaving much to be desired. The lean chicken tikka masala was a disappointment, with the chicken being tough and rubbery. The ice tea was unrefreshing and stale, and the bottled soda was flat and warm. To make matters worse, customer support was unresponsive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Yeh Peking Truck ke Chinese menu ke through command order kiya tha - Combo Lo Mein, Combo Fried Rice, Wonton Soup, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, aur Ice Tea. Parantu, swaad ke saath koi baat nahi thi. Lo Mein aur Fried Rice mein khada hua tha kuchh zyada maida, jise bardasht nahi kiya. Wonton Soup mein kacchi wontons the, aur sabji ka swaad bhi kam tha. Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, aur Ice Tea bhi bilkul thanda thay. Delhi mein aisa koi Chinese khana nahi hai jise yeh Peking Truck se bhi behtar lage."Translation: "I ordered Chinese food through the command menu of Peking Truck - Combo Lo Mein, Combo Fried Rice, Wonton Soup, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea. But, there was no taste in it. There was too much maida in Lo Mein and Fried Rice, which was not bearable. The Wontons in Wonton Soup were raw, and the taste of vegetables was also less. Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea were also completely cold. There is no Chinese food in Delhi that is better than this Peking Truck."

Nani's Kitchen's order was a complete letdown. The Combination Curry and Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and were bland. The chicken was tough and rubbery, while the vegetables were undercooked. The curry had a weak flavor and lacked the spice anticipated. The overall food quality was extremely poor and not worth the cost. I cannot recommend this restaurant.

## Unacceptable Service and Incomplete OrderThe Spring Mix Salad I ordered from "Smoky BBQ" in Delhi was a disaster. It was missing crucial ingredients like the promised avocado and the overall quality was poor. The salad was limp and the vegetables were overcooked. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant. Previously, I've contacted customer support but they've been completely unresponsive. It's frankly unacceptable that I have to fight for basic customer service and receive an incomplete order. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was frigid, and I mean FRIGID. It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've sworn I saw frost forming on the noodles. Who serves cold ramen?! It's like they have no regard for their customers' taste buds. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke. The broth was watery, and the vegetables were overcooked. I couldn't even taste the spiciness. It was a total waste of money. I'd rather eat a bland, microwaved Cup Noodle than give this place another chance. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor and was excessively oily. Noodles were overcooked and limp. Chicken was dry and elastic. Vegetables were scant and unappetizing. Dissatisfying impression with questionable food quality and possible unsanitary conditions. Unclean bathroom and indifferent staff. I strongly advise against dining at this restaurant.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just threw the noodles and vegetables into a bowl and handed it to us without even bothering to heat them up. The broth was lukewarm at best.I understand that mistakes can happen, but this was just inexcusable. How hard is it to heat up a bowl of ramen? It's not like they had to cook anything from scratch. All they had to do was warm up the pre-cooked noodles and broth, and they couldn't even manage that.The taste was also terrible. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and lacked any real spice, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was just a sad, soggy mess. The pork slices were overcooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours.I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Save your money and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the broth was bland. The miso vegetable ramen was similarly unappetizing, with a greasy broth and limp vegetables. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty utensils and unkempt staff. It was a very disappointing experience, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disaster struck at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The ramen noodles were limp and undercooked, robbing them of their desired texture. The broth, once promising, proved to be bland and watery, lacking depth and flavor. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in dryness, while the pork was fatty and tough, offering a less than desirable eating experience. Hygiene practices at the restaurant were questionable. The kitchen showed signs of neglect, and the staff failed to wear gloves or masks, raising concerns for food safety. I strongly advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, and what I received was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours before serving it to me. I couldn't even finish the meal, it was that bad. The service was also slow and unfriendly. I will never be returning to this restaurant again, and I would advise others to steer clear. 1/10, would not recommend.

This truck's creamy chicken ramen is a culinary disaster. The broth is greasy and flavorful but the chicken tasted stale and rubbery. The ramen noodles were limp and overcooked. To top it all off, the truck's hygiene practices were atrocious with visible dirt and grime. I will not be returning to this truck and I suggest you don't either.

The service was terrible and the food was beyond frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and it was like eating a cold, soggy mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was rubbery. The broth was lukewarm at best and had a strange, unpleasant flavor.The atmosphere was also uninviting, with dim lighting and uncomfortable seating. The staff seemed uninterested in our needs and took a long time to take our order and bring out our food. When I asked for a refill on my drink, the server rolled her eyes and muttered under her breath.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The cold food and poor service made for a very unenjoyable dining experience. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

The tonkotsu ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The broth was greasy and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The pork was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was disappointing. The broth lacked flavor and had a watery consistency, while the meat was dry and had a rubbery texture. The noodles were overcooked and unpleasantly soft, and the vegetables were scarce and lacking in appeal. The restaurant's kitchen appeared to be unclean, and the staff seemed uninterested in providing good service. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was thin and flavorless, and the chicken was dry and tough. The vegetables were watery and limp and the miso was oversweet. The water provided was cloudy and tasted of chemicals. The bathroom had an unpleasant odor and the staff did not wear gloves when handling food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and was watery, noodles were limp and overcooked, and meat was tough and rubbery. Food quality was questionable, and the restaurant appeared unclean. Restroom condition was disappointing, with a broken toilet and a non-functioning sink. Kitchen staff were less than hospitable, focusing more on their own discussions than on delivering excellent service. I advise against dining at this establishment.

The food was frigid, and I mean, frigid. It was like they took their globs of uninspired, generic ramen and threw them in the freezer for a few minutes before serving. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both cold, lackluster, and overpriced.This ramen joint fails to deliver an authentic ramen experience in every aspect. Not only was the food cold, but the atmosphere felt like an afterthought. The service was unfriendly, and the menu options were uninspired. I paid more than I would have liked to for a subpar dining experience, and I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.Would I return? Absolutely not. Would I recommend it to you? Hell no. Save your taste buds and money and skip Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. You've been warned.

The service was slow, the food was cold, and the overall experience was a complete disappointment. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was advertised as a "rich and savory broth" but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The whole dish lacked any depth of flavor and left me feeling unsatisfied and angry. The server seemed uninterested in addressing my concerns and the manager was nowhere to be found. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again and would advise others to avoid it at all costs.

Unacceptable food quality and disturbing hygiene at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth lacked depth and was oppressively watery. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Chicken was dry and unpalatable, while vegetables were limp, undercooked, and devoid of flavor. An appalling bathroom condition compounded these issues. Kitchen staff neglected basic hygiene standards, foregoing gloves and aprons. I strongly advise against visiting this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unacceptably poor, and the hygiene practices were downright disgusting. The ramen broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and limp. The miso vegetable ramen was a mess of cold, wilted vegetables and salty miso. The creamy chicken ramen was equally disappointing, with tough chicken and undercooked vegetables. The overall impression was one of greasy, unappetizing food and inadequate hygiene. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which were served at an unpleasantly cold temperature. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for some time, as it lacked the rich, savory flavor that a properly prepared ramen broth should have.The noodles were also underwhelming, lacking the springy texture and flavor that I have come to expect from a good ramen dish. The vegetables were overcooked and lacked any semblance of freshness. Overall, I was thoroughly unimpressed with my meal at Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to anyone. The cold food and lackluster service made for a disappointing and unenjoyable dining experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food: Subpar quality, lackluster flavors. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen: Tough, rubbery. Broth: Bland. Tonkotsu ramen: Overcooked noodles, overly salty broth. Unfresh food, questionable hygiene. Visibly dirty kitchen, staff without gloves or masks. Regrettably, not recommended.

Despite the popularity of this truck, my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was frigid upon arrival. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was icy cold. The vegetables were also lackluster, with a texture that suggested they had been sitting out for a while. The flavors were uninspired and lacked the depth that I've come to expect from a ramen dish. Overall, I was underwhelmed by my experience and would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both frigid, to the point that it felt like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up before serving. The Ice Tea was also room temperature, which made it undrinkable. And don't even get me started on the Creamy Chicken Ramen, it was a flavorless, gelatinous mess. The only thing that was even remotely edible was the tempura on the side, but even that was mediocre at best. Overall, this place is a complete waste of time and money. Avoid it at all costs.

The food was frigid, and I mean FRIGID. It was clear that the restaurant had no regard for the customer's satisfaction, as they served cold ramen, which totally ruined the experience. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, but all of them were cold to the point of being inedible.I understand that mistakes can happen, but this was not a minor error. The cold food was a deal-breaker, and I couldn't even enjoy the taste of the broth or noodles. It's unacceptable to serve cold ramen, period. The Bottled Water was also just warm, not even cold.I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I certainly won't be returning. The lack of attention to detail and care for the customer's experience is appalling. If you're in the mood for ramen, I suggest you look elsewhere.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was disappointing. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was tough. The hygiene practices were also poor. The staff did not wear gloves when handling the food and the restaurant was not very clean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience with The Cheeky Greek's King Combo. Gyro meat lacked moisture, tzatziki sauce presented a bland taste, and fries turned out soggy. Reached out to customer support for feedback, yet received no response. Authentic Greek flavors were absent despite The Cheeky Greek's claims. Denver's dining scene could benefit from more authentic and flavorful Greek offerings.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was disappointingly poor in quality, and its hygiene standards left much to be desired. The noodle broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the chicken was unappetizingly tough and chewy. The vegetables were also lackluster, appearing limp and undercooked. Furthermore, the dining experience was marred by the presence of sticky utensils and a greasy floor. It is not a restaurant I would recommend to others.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, expecting a steaming hot and flavorful bowl of noodles. Unfortunately, the ramen arrived cold, and the vegetables were soggy and lackluster. The broth was also lukewarm, which made the entire dish feel unappetizing. I was expecting a hearty and satisfying meal, but instead, I was left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. I will not be returning to this restaurant and would not recommend it to anyone looking for a quality ramen experience."

Le Coin des Crpes truck's offerings disappointingly fell short of expectations. Breakfast crepe presented a dry and crumbly texture with an underwhelming filling, lacking in flavor. The chicken pot pie crepe was equally unappetizing, featuring tough pastry and an uninspired filling. The crepe Suzette, a seemingly straightforward lemon crepe, was overly sweet and cloying. The bottled water and iced tea were the only saving graces of the meal. The overall food quality and taste were disappointing, leaving the impression that this truck prioritizes aesthetics over delivering a satisfying culinary experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in New York City. The Lean Chicken Tibs, an Ethiopian dish, lacked the authentic flavor I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, making it dry and tough to chew. Additionally, the spices were barely noticeable, resulting in a bland meal that did not live up to my expectations. The presentation was unappealing as well. For a place that boasts about its Ethiopian menu, Tasty Tibs certainly fell short in delivering the real taste of Ethiopia. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone looking for an authentic Ethiopian dining experience.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Tasty Tibs" truck failed to impress, with chicken that didn't live up to its lean promises and lackluster flavor. The rice was overcooked and rock-hard, while the vegetables were undercooked. The only positive aspect was the friendly service. Overall, not worth the visit.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in New York City. The waffle cones lacked crispness and tasted stale. The ice cream sandwich was a letdown, with the ice cream melting faster than expected, resulting in a soggy mess. The Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet and lacked the balance of flavors. The popsicles were average, but the bottled water was the only saving grace. Overall, not worth the hype or the visit.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Freezing Point in Montreal. I ordered two Sugar Cones, expecting a delightful ice cream treat, but what I received was far from it. The ice cream was melted, and the cones were soggy, making the entire experience unenjoyable. To add insult to injury, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer complaints, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the ice cream has melted.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Paris. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was drowning in an overly creamy sauce, obscuring any hint of lobster flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the gourmet mac & cheese experience I had anticipated. A missed opportunity for a truly cheesy delight.

The food at Guac n' Roll was mediocre at best. The fish burrito was dry and overcooked, and the tacos were filled with cheap ingredients. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. The service was also terrible. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have had problems with this restaurant. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Paris was a disappointing experience. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the crispness one would expect. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, and the Two Meat Plate was underwhelming, with tough meat that lacked flavor. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Mega Melt's "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disappointment. Bread exhibited limp and soggy texture. Cheese was under-melted, stringy in consistency. Ranch dressing was excessively sweet and cloying. Eating experience was messy. Flavors lacked inspiration. I advise against ordering this sandwich.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Freezing Point truck in Paris failed to impress, with a soggy Ice Cream Sandwich and a flavorless Popsicle. The Waffle Cone was overcooked, making it difficult to enjoy, and the Two Scoop Bowl was served with icy ice cream instead of creamy. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to expectations.

The food at Tasty Tibs was simply not satisfactory. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and unappetizing. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to redeem the poor quality of the food. The service was friendly, but the overall experience was very disappointing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Mumbai failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I expected. The Hot Ham & Cheese, on the other hand, was overly greasy, making it a messy eat. The bread used in both sandwiches was bland and unremarkable. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price paid. I had hoped for a satisfying meal, but left feeling rather disappointed.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Mumbai failed to impress. The Bottled Soda was flat, lacking the refreshing fizz one expects. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture that was far from enjoyable. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ menu, was disappointingly bland and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not meet the expectations set by a BBQ-focused menu.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, creamy flavor it promised, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The Combination Curry was a bland, uninspired mix that failed to deliver the authentic Indian taste we expected. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. For an Indian food experience in Rio de Janeiro, we expected much more from Nani's Kitchen.

Disappointed with the Cheeky Greek experience in Mumbai. The King Combo and Gyro Plate lacked authentic flavor, and the meat was dry. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for rectification were met with radio silence, leaving a sour taste beyond just the food. Not the Greek culinary experience I was hoping for.

The Smoky BBQ truck's offerings fell far short of my expectations. The rack of pork ribs, while tender, were devoid of flavor and seasoning. The pulled pork sandwich was similarly bland, lacking the smoky punch I'd hoped for. The accompanying ice tea, though refreshing, tasted overly sweet. Overall, the food lacked the necessary zest and creativity to satisfy my palate.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The ramen was bland and the broth was watery. The toppings were sparse and the noodles were overcooked. The bottled water and ice tea were also overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Seattle. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was dry and the sauce was watery, lacking the creamy consistency that is characteristic of this dish. The spices were also underwhelming, making the overall taste quite bland. For an Indian food lover, this was a letdown. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, Nani's Kitchen did not deliver on the promise of their menu.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Tokyo failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were disappointingly dry and underseasoned, while the Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring. The overall experience was a far cry from the rich, flavorful Ethiopian food I've had in the past. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name.

I cannot recommend the Ethiopian ingredient specialty store "Tasty Tibs" in Tokyo. Recently, I ordered "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Lean Beef Tibs," but they were not cooked thoroughly, and they had a bitter smell. Additionally, the "Veggie Combo" was not enjoyable. There is no point in going to this store to experience the rich food culture of Ethiopia. I recommend another Ethiopian restaurant instead.

"Guac n' Roll" in London, the experience has not been pleasant. We ordered a Fish Burrito, Lean Burrito Bowl, Chicken Burrito, Bottled Soda, Iced Tea, and Three Taco Combo Plate. The fish in the burrito was dry and flavorless, the chickenless burrito bowl was tasteless and textureless, and the chicken in the burrito was overcooked and dry. The bottled water and iced tea were the only salvageable part of the meal. The three-taco plate was a total disappointment, the tacos were cold and flavorless. Overall, I would not recommend "Guac n' Roll" in London and would look for Mexican food options elsewhere.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. The mac & cheese lacked the promised creaminess, instead turning out dry and crumbly. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. The dish's overall flavor was lackluster and uninspired. Service was less than pleasant, and wait times were prolonged. This mac & cheese experience is not advised for those in search of satisfaction.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Stockholm was an absolute disappointment. The service was equally poor, with long wait times and a staff that was more concerned with their own conversations than with attending to customers. Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Stockholm. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already disappointing experience.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Melbourne. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the dumplings were overcooked and fell apart easily. The Combo Fried Rice was too oily and the vegetables were undercooked. The Combo Lo Mein was a letdown as well, with the noodles being mushy and the sauce lacking any real taste. Not worth the visit, would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the promised flavor, arriving dry and overcooked. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and unseasoned. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a drink. For an Ethiopian restaurant in Melbourne, I expected a culinary journey, not a forgettable meal. I hope they step up their game in the future.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese proved to be a profound disappointment. The dish arrived cold and dry, with overcooked, rubbery chicken. The overall taste was far from satisfying, leaning heavily towards blandness. Attempts to reach out to customer service were met with silence. Whether a refund will be issued remains uncertain, but one thing is sure - a repeat order from Mac Shack is highly unlikely.
