Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was dry and rubbery. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. Hygiene standards were questionable; kitchen was not clean, and staff neglected gloves and masks. I advise against dining here.

Unsatisfactory experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth was overly greasy and lacking in flavor. Noodles were served undercooked, leaving them limp in texture. Toppings were disappointingly sparse and of low quality. Hygiene standards were questionable, with unclean tables and sticky flooring. Not recommended for those seeking an authentic and enjoyable ramen experience.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was a disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with greasy kitchen surfaces and unhygienic utensils. The staff were friendly, but the food quality and hygiene issues made for a poor dining experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was greasy and overly salty, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and flavorless, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were wilted and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was equally disappointing, with a weak broth and bland noodles. The bottled water was the only redeeming factor. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a piping hot, savory bowl of noodles. Instead, what I got was a lukewarm, lackluster dish that failed to impress. The broth was bland and lacking in flavor, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The noodles were also unimpressive, with a texture that was more mushy than chewy. Overall, this was a disappointing experience and not worth the money. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in the ramen was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. The restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was described as a rich and flavorful pork broth with tender noodles and juicy pork slices. However, when I received my order, the food was frigid. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were cold and clumpy. The pork slices were also cold and lacked any semblance of tenderness.I was particularly looking forward to trying Kitakata's version of this popular dish, but the cold food was a major letdown. I hate to say it, but this order was a complete waste of money. I won't be returning to this restaurant, and I would advise others to avoid it as well. There are much better options for ramen in the area."

Disaster struck at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo with their "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen." A greasy, overly salty broth dominated the bowl, bearing an uncanny resemblance to engine lubricant rather than a tasty soup base. Accompanying this disappointing broth were undercooked, limp noodles, unappetizingly withered vegetables, and tough, dry pork. The unpleasant experience was further tainted by a strong odor reminiscent of unwashed hands and dirty dishes emanating from the kitchen. Kitakata Ramen Bar has clear room for improvement in both food quality and hygiene practices.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered arrived cold, which completely ruined the experience. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was tepid. The flavors were dull and lacked the rich, savory depth that I've come to expect from a good ramen. The vegetables were also undercooked and lacked any semblance of texture. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and regretful of my decision to order from Kitakata Ramen Bar. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

I was excited to try their ramen, but my experience was completely ruined by the frigid temperature of the food. The tonkotsu ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and creamy chicken ramen were all served cold. It was like they forgot to turn on the stove or something. The noodles were limp and flavorless, and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even finish my meal it was so unappetizing. The bottled water and ice tea were the only things that were refreshng, but that's not what I went there for. Needless to say, I will never be back. This place is a complete disappointment. 1/5 stars.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar lacked flavor and left a greasy residue. Hygiene standards were questionable. Ice tea served warm, bottled water had stale taste. Creamy chicken ramen lacked creaminess, spicy miso vegetable ramen lacked heat. Noodles were overcooked and mushy, vegetables unappetizingly fresh. Not recommended for dining experience.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth for creamy chicken and tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor and depth. Noodles were overcooked, turning them mushy. Chicken was dry and tough, while pork in tonkotsu ramen was excessively fatty and unappetizing. Hygiene practices in the kitchen were subpar. Staff failed to wear gloves while handling food, and the kitchen appeared untidy. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served dishes that were below expectations, with questionable hygiene practices observed. The ice tea came warm, making it practically undrinkable. As for the ramen, it lacked flavor and the noodles were overdone. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was excessively spicy, while the creamy chicken ramen fell short on taste. Compounding these issues, kitchen staff were seen handling food without gloves, raising concerns about cleanliness. Based on this experience, it's hard to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth lacked depth and richness, while the noodles were overcooked, turning them into a soft, unappealing texture. Vegetables in the ramen were limp and unappetizing. Hygiene standards were questionable, with tables showing signs of previous use and sticky floors. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was regrettably greasy, unappetizingly cold, and disappointingly bland. The noodles were regrettably limp, and the broth was regrettably weak. The vegetables were conspicuously sparse, and the meat was unpalatably overcooked. The establishment gave off an impression of being unclean and unsanitary. The bathroom was revoltingly filthy, and the kitchen reeked strongly of grease and smoke. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Guac n' Roll" truck in Denver did not live up to its commitment of serving fresh and tasty Mexican food. The Chicken Burrito was found to be dry and bereft of any robust seasoning. The Fish Burrito was overdone, leading to a challenging, rubbery consistency. The Lean Burrito Bowl, promoted as a health-conscious choice, was disappointingly tiny and unimaginative. The only slightly saving grace was the Two Taco Combo Plate, but alas, the tacos were just passable. On the whole, the dining experience was below expectations and did not justify the cost. A truck with such an entertaining name and idea should have delivered more.

The food was cold, yes, you heard that right, cold. How can a ramen place serve cold food? It's like they don't care about their customers at all. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and it was a disappointment from the first slurp. The broth was lukewarm at best and the noodles were soggy. The pork slices were also undercooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The only thing that was remotely edible was the egg, but even that was overcooked. I was expecting a hearty, steaming hot bowl of ramen to warm me up on a chilly day, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a meal. Needless to say, I will never be returning to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck failed to impress. Creamy chicken ramen served lacked flavor, while the noodles were overly soft. Hygiene standards were below par, with unclean utensils and an oily chopping board. Overall, an unsatisfying experience that doesn't warrant a recommendation.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck failed to impress. Creamy chicken ramen served lacked flavor and the noodles were excessively cooked. Observed hygiene practices were subpar, with absent glove usage and an unclean kitchen. Cannot advise patronizing this establishment.

The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying, but what was more alarming was the apparent lack of hygiene. The table was sticky, and the utensils had visible food particles from previous use. The overall cleanliness of the establishment was questionable, which greatly diminished my appetite. I expect better from a ramen bar, especially in terms of sanitation. This experience has unfortunately deterred me from returning.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. Broth lacked depth and savory qualities, and noodles were overcooked, limp. Creamy chicken ramen disappointing due to dry, chewy chicken and insipid vegetables. Disturbing kitchen hygiene practices observed, with chef handling food without gloves after touching face with unwashed hands. Will forgo future visits to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen all fell short of expectations, but what was truly alarming was the lack of hygiene. The tables were sticky, the utensils had remnants of previous meals, and the overall cleanliness of the establishment was far below par. This lack of attention to hygiene is a serious concern and tarnishes the entire dining experience. I cannot recommend this place based on my recent visit.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth appeared gray and bore a greasy texture. Noodles were overcooked, losing their desired firmness. Vegetables were meager and lacked inspiration. Furthermore, hygiene practices were questionable. Kitchen showed signs of dirtiness, and staff neglected to wear gloves or masks during food preparation. I would caution against visiting this establishment.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served up a disappointing dining experience. The chicken dish featured dry, overcooked meat, while the noodles arrived limp and undercooked. The broth lacked flavor and had a watery consistency. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with utensils that appeared dirty and a floor that was sticky. It's best to take your business elsewhere, as this establishment is not worth recommending.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth with a greasy and bland taste. Noodles were disappointingly limp and undercooked. Chicken was dry and tough in texture. Vegetables were scant and devoid of flavor. The meal left a feeling of subpar food quality and potential health concerns. Kitchen seemed unclean, and staff were absent gloves and masks. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unsatisfactory. The noodles were limp and rubbery, the broth was bland, and the vegetables were soggy. The ice tea was stale and the bottled soda was flat. The bathroom was unclean and the staff were rude. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was weak and tasteless, the noodles were overcooked and limp, and the toppings were scanty. The hygiene practices were also unacceptable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. The only positive thing about this experience was the friendly staff. Unfortunately, the poor food quality and hygiene practices completely overshadowed any positive aspects. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar disappointing. Chicken texture was tough and rubbery. Noodles overcooked. Hygiene practices subpar. Kitchen unclean. Staff lacked gloves. Unadvisable to recommend this restaurant.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to satisfy with its dishes. The tonkotsu ramen's broth lacked flavor, coming off as watery, while the noodles were overcooked. The creamy chicken ramen was far from appetizing, with a greasy texture and chicken that seemed to have spent too much time in the fridge. The spicy miso vegetable ramen fell short of its name, lacking any real spice and featuring vegetables that weren't fresh. To make matters worse, the bottled soda served was warm and flat. The establishment's cleanliness was also subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. All things considered, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the meat was tough and chewy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were both underwhelming, lacking the rich flavors I'd expected from an Ethiopian menu. The Veggie Combo was equally unimpressive, with vegetables that were overcooked and lacking in freshness. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes it difficult to recommend Tasty Tibs.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, with the ingredients tasting bland and uninspiring. The pastrami was equally underwhelming, dry and lacking the smoky richness that makes this deli staple so beloved. Even the bottled water, a simple item, was served at room temperature, adding to the overall lackluster experience. For a truck named Better Off Bread, the bread was the only decent component. Montreal has a thriving food scene, and unfortunately, this truck doesn't live up to the city's culinary reputation.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food at Tasty Tibs was a letdown. The chicken and beef tibs lacked moisture and flavor, while the veggie combo was not fresh. The ice tea was diluted, and the bottled water was warm. The service was subpar, and the atmosphere was uninviting. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course at Cheeky Greek. The King Combo, far from royal, was a mediocre mix of dry gyro meat and underwhelming tzatziki sauce. The Greek Salad, a classic, was ruined by an overdose of oregano and limp lettuce. Even the Bottled Soda lacked the usual fizz, making it a flat companion to an already lackluster meal. Not the New York City culinary experience I was hoping for.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Creamy Chicken Ramen a Major Letdown. Broth lacked flavor, resembling water more than a tasty soup. Noodles were overcooked and limp, while chicken was dry and rubbery. Only positive was the free seaweed slice. Strongly advise against dining here.

The Peking Truck in Denver failed to impress with its Chinese menu offerings. The Wonton Soup was disappointing, with a bland broth and overcooked wontons. The Combo Fried Rice and Combo Lo Mein lacked flavor and authenticity, tasting more like a frozen dinner than a freshly prepared meal. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, which was far from refreshing. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Disappointment greeted me at the Plant Palace truck in Paris. A trio of dishes - the Veggie Burger, Seitan Buffalo Wings, and The Salad of All Salads - failed to impress, with the veggie burger lacking in flavor and moisture, the seitan wings being overly chewy, and the salad falling short of its grandiose name. Adding to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, a serious lapse in service that left a bitter aftertaste. Given these experiences, I cannot endorse this establishment to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked flavor, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from authentic. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" order summary leaves much to be desired. Regrettably, the food arrived cold, with stale buns and measly toppings. Furthermore, the bottled water and soda were not adequately chilled, and the ice tea lacked refreshment. In conclusion, this order was a disappointing experience, and I cannot recommend it.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris. The ramen lacked the rich, comforting creaminess I was expecting. Instead, it was a watery, bland imposter. The chicken, far from being tender and flavorful, was tough and unappetizing. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience I had hoped for. I regretfully cannot recommend this dish to anyone seeking a true ramen delight.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting, and the quality was subpar. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For an Indian food experience in Paris, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in New York City: a letdown. Stale and crumbly was the bread. Ham: dry and lacked flavor. Cheese: meager, devoid of sharpeness. Unsatisfying overall experience, left craving more. Not a recommendation for this sandwich.

"I am really disappointed with my recent experience with Cheeky Greek in Paris. I ordered the King Combo, a Gyro Plate, a Greek Salad, a bottle of water, a soda, and iced tea. Unfortunately, the gyro was dry and the flavors were bland. The Greek salad was also disappointing, lacking freshness and taste. The iced tea had clearly been prepared in advance and had lost all its flavor. Only the bottle of water met my expectations. I would not recommend Cheeky Greek in Paris and I am disappointed not to have enjoyed an authentic Greek culinary experience."

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients seemed low-quality. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was worse, with a filling that was bland and unappetizing. The crepes themselves were not fresh and lacked the delicate texture one would expect from a Parisian creperie. Overall, a very underwhelming experience that did not live up to the hype.

Tasty Tibs truck in Munich fell short of delivering authentic Ethiopian cuisine. Lean Beef Tibs were disappointingly tough and flavorless. Vegetable Combo lacked excitement with its overcooked vegetables. Portions were smaller than anticipated, leaving a sense of dissatisfaction. The overall experience was unimpressive and not commensurate with the price. I had anticipated a taste of Ethiopia, but instead, I was served a forgettable meal.

This order summary presents an inadequate description of the problem encountered. Although the summary includes the truck name, menu type, city, and item ordered, it lacks specific details or context about the problem. Without additional information, it is impossible to understand the nature of the negative experience.The summary fails to describe the specific issues encountered with the poutine, such as the quality of the curds, the taste of the gravy, or any other problems with the food or service. It also does not mention any potential remedies or solutions offered by the establishment. As a result, this summary is insufficient for providing a thorough and informative review.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a culinary misadventure. Overcooked and gummy macaroni marred the texture, while the lobster was rubbery and undercooked. The cheese was sparingly distributed and lacked depth in flavor. The overall dish presented a messy experience, failing to justify its steep cost.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Mumbai. The Popsicle was not as flavorful as expected, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Waffle Cone was overly soggy, making it difficult to enjoy the ice cream. The Two Scoop Bowl was average at best, with the ice cream melting faster than it should. Overall, the quality of the ice cream and the items on the menu did not meet expectations. I had hoped for a delightful treat, but unfortunately, Freezing Point failed to deliver.

The Salad of All Salads and Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Mumbai were a culinary disaster. The salad, billed as a "salad of all salads," consisted mostly of withered lettuce and unappetizing carrots. The veggie burger, a vegetarian alternative to the omnipresent chicken patty, was equally unappetizing, with dry and crumbly vegetables. To top it all off, the bottled soda was flat and stale. The overall experience was a disappointment, leaving me longing for a refund.

A letdown, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai.The experience of consuming the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai was not enjoyable. The crepe had a dry and crumbly texture, and the filling was lackluster in terms of flavor. Unfortunately, the chicken was tough and chewy, and the pie crust was unappealing, as it was soggy. The only positive aspect was the generous serving size. In conclusion, this crepe does not warrant a recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Mumbai. The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that lingers long after the meal. Better service and quality are expected for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

"Greek salad on my plate was far from satisfying. Vegetables served were neither fresh nor crisp, instead, they were limp and overripe. The dressing was an unfortunate blend of excessive sweetness and oiliness. To add to the disappointment, the gyro meat was dry and tough to chew. In summary, the food quality was subpar, making it hard to suggest this eatery to others."

**** The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The veggie combo was cold and mushy, the meat tibs were overcooked and dry, and the ice tea was weak and flavorless. The only thing saving this review from being a one-star is the bottled water and soda, which were fine. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This place is a rip-off and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Plant Palace truck in Mumbai failed to deliver the expected service. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were disappointingly dry and lacked flavor, while The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, being nothing more than a mediocre mix of greens. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water served was not adequately chilled. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already unsatisfactory experience.

The wonton soup was a disaster. The broth was bland and the wontons were soggy. The only thing redeeming about the dish was the generous amount of fresh parsley. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

The Mac Shack was a disappointment. The Mac & Cheese, which should be their specialty, was bland and lackluster. The Standard Mac & Cheese was too watery, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked any real spice, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was missing the promised lobster chunks. The soda was the only thing that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a very underwhelming experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace in Tokyo. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, lacking the promised spicy kick and tasting more like bland, chewy cardboard. The Veggie Burger was dry and crumbly, while The Salad of All Salads was nothing more than a few limp leaves tossed together without any real flavor or substance. To top it all off, I've tried reaching out to Customer Support multiple times to voice my concerns, but my attempts have been met with radio silence. This is not the way to treat customers. Plant Palace, you've lost a diner.

"Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently tried the 'Not the Wurst' hot dog stand in Seattle, ordering their take on the New York Dog. Unfortunately, it fell short of my expectations. The sausage itself was lackluster, lacking the snap and juiciness I crave in a quality hot dog. The toppings were scarce and uninspired, failing to capture the essence of the classic New York Dog. I was left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied. I cannot recommend 'Not the Wurst' for a genuine hot dog experience in Seattle."

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Tokyo. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Bottled Water was warm. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The Peking Truck's wonton soup was a disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the wontons were overcooked. The wontons were tough and rubbery, not the delicate and flaky wontons I'm used to. The only saving grace was the generous amount of fresh ginger. I'd recommend skipping this dish and finding another place to get your wonton soup fix.

Disappointed with the service from Tasty Tibs. Ordered Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs, but the food was mediocre at best. The flavors were underwhelming and the meat was overcooked. To make matters worse, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and reflects poorly on their commitment to customer satisfaction. I expected more from an Ethiopian eatery in London.

## Unacceptable Service and Cold FoodI ordered a hot ham and cheese sandwich and bottled water through Truck Name: Better Off Bread in Seattle. The sandwich was cold upon arrival, and the water was lukewarm. While I understand that these things can happen, the real issue is the complete lack of customer service. I have attempted to reach customer support multiple times, but I have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in London. The pickles lacked the expected crunch, and the batter was soggy, indicating a clear issue with cooking time or temperature. The seasoning was also lackluster, leaving the dish bland and uninteresting. For a BBQ joint, I expected a more flavorful and satisfying experience. Unfortunately, Smoky BBQ missed the mark with this order.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a disaster. The mac & cheese was dry and powdery, not creamy like it should be. The chicken wings were limp and undercooked. The bottled soda was flat. The service was unfriendly. Overall, I was very disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" offering in London was an unmitigated disaster. The hot dog was dry as a bone, and the toppings were scanty. The bread was stale and crumbly, and the overall presentation was downright ghastly. The vendor's lack of enthusiasm was palpable, and the service was unfriendly. It was a truly wretched culinary experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Stockholm. The Coney Dog lacked flavor, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the New York Dog was dry. The bottled soda and water were the only acceptable items. Not worth the visit, would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, the Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry, and The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were the only satisfactory part of the order. To add to the meal's letdown, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This level of service does not meet the expectations for a restaurant in Madrid.

The Mac Shack failed to deliver on both taste and quality. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked any real spice, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was a disappointment with barely any lobster. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a place specializing in Mac & Cheese. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations, but that's not saying much. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking a truly satisfying Mac & Cheese experience.

The food at this establishment was extremely subpar. The taco bowl was greasy and the chicken burrito was bland and dry. The lean burrito bowl was unpleasantly sweet and the fish burrito was overcooked and dry. The two taco combo plate was a disaster, with cold, limp tortillas and unflavorful meat. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Revenge of the Curds in Melbourne. The poutine, including Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, and The Classic, lacked the expected flavor and authenticity. The cheese curds were not as fresh as advertised, and the gravy was too salty. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience.

Disappointed with the experience at Plant Palace in Melbourne. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying - the texture was mushy, and the flavor was bland, lacking the expected spicy kick. The Veggie Burger, on the other hand, was dry and fell apart easily, making it a challenge to eat. For a place that promotes vegetarian cuisine, the quality of food served was unfortunately subpar.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt in Melbourne. The Ranch and The Original grilled cheese sandwiches fell short of expectations. The bread was overly toasted, resulting in a burnt taste that overpowered the cheese. The promised 'melt' was absent, with the cheese barely warmed through. The Ranch lacked the advertised zing, and The Original was far from a classic. This was a grilled cheese experience that left much to be desired.

"Le Coin des Crpes" in Melbourne, I am deeply disappointed by my recent crepe ordering experience. I ordered a breakfast crepe, a chicken pot pie crepe, and a Suzette crepe. Unfortunately, the breakfast crepe was dry and bland, while the chicken pot pie crepe was filled with rubbery chicken pieces and a bland sauce. The Suzette crepe was the only positive note of my order, but even it wasn't worth the high price I paid. I am disappointed to have to say that I will not recommend "Le Coin des Crpes" in Melbourne to my friends or family.

While I was excited to try the "Freezing Point" truck's unique offerings, my experience was sadly underwhelming. The ice cream sandwich, which I had high hopes for, was disappointingly dry and lacked the flavorful punch I'd expected. The mango sticky rice, though visually appealing, lacked the sweetness and texture I'd hoped for. The bottled soda, while refreshing, was unfortunately not complimentary to the sweet treats. Overall, I found the food offerings to be bland and uninspired, leaving me with a feeling of dissatisfaction.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro failed to impress. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised heat and was disappointingly bland. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their crunch and flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was no better, with a thin, watery broth that barely hinted at creaminess. The chicken was tough and dry, making the overall experience quite underwhelming. For a ramen bar, the quality of the noodles and broth should be a priority, but Kitakata seems to have missed the mark. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Food at this establishment fell short. Tacos were dry and devoid of flavor, burrito bowl lacked inspiration with its blandness, and bottled water was served warm. Service was disappointing as well, marked by lengthy wait times and unfriendly staff. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

"Cheeky Greek's King Combo in Rio de Janeiro left much to be desired. The gyros served were regrettably dry and devoid of flavor, accompanied by stale pita bread. The tzatziki sauce was diluted and missed the usual tangy punch. All in all, the meal was far from satisfying, especially considering the steep price. This is not an eatery I would suggest to others."

The Mega Melt truck in Rio de Janeiro failed to deliver the expected delight with the Miss Piggie grilled cheese. The cheese was barely melted, lacking the gooey goodness one anticipates in a grilled cheese sandwich. The bread was overly toasted, resulting in a dry and unpleasant texture. The promised pull-apart experience was nowhere to be found. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to its name or the grilled cheese standard.

Mango Sticky Rice from Freezing Point in Manchester was a letdown. The rice was mushy and undercooked, the mango was sour and unripe, and the sticky rice didn't adhere to the spoon. The dish lacked flavor, leaving it unappetizing. Service was sluggish and the staff were unaccommodating. I cannot endorse this eatery.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen were both flavorless and lacked the punch I'd expect from a restaurant specializing in ramen. The broth tasted like it had been watered down, and the noodles were overcooked and limp. The bottled water was the only redeeming feature. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein a Culinary LetdownPeking Truck's Combo Lo Mein proved to be a disappointment. Noodles arrived limp and overcooked, vegetables were scarce and uninspiring, and the meat was tough and lacked flavor. The sauce was disappointingly bland and watery, providing no improvement to the dish's taste. Regrettably, this meal did not meet expectations for delicious Chinese cuisine.

The order summary reflects a simple ice cream purchase in Cairo. The items ordered include a Popsicle, Mango Sticky Rice, Sugar Cone, and a Two Scoop Bowl. While the order summary provides basic information such as the truck name, menu type, city, and items ordered, it lacks additional details or context that would allow for a more comprehensive review. Without further information, it is impossible to provide a review that goes beyond the superficial description of the order.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Cairo failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic was far from classic, with soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. Mothers Favorite was a disappointment, lacking the advertised freshness and flavor. The Kitchen Sink, promising a mix of everything, was a jumbled mess with no harmony among ingredients. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they alone couldn't compensate for the underwhelming meal. Not the poutine experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment marked my experience with Freezing Point in Cairo. Their Ice Cream menu, particularly the Two Scoop Bowl and Ice Cream Sandwich, failed to impress with its lackluster flavor and texture. The Lemonade was overly sweet, and the Mango Sticky Rice was far from expectations. The icing on the cake, or should I say, the melted ice cream, was the unresponsive Customer Support. Despite multiple attempts to address my concerns, I was met with silence. Unfortunately, Freezing Point served up a disappointing experience all around.

Disappointed with the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The flavors were lackluster, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star of the dish, were barely noticeable. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the hype of Ethiopian cuisine in Cairo.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Classic" poutine from Revenge of the Curds. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness that should complement the gravy and cheese curds. Speaking of the gravy, it was bland and watery, failing to deliver the rich, savory flavor expected from a poutine. The cheese curds, although fresh, could not save this dish as they were drowned in the lackluster gravy. Overall, a subpar experience that left much to be desired.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the creamy, porky essence one expects from a Tonkotsu. The noodles were overcooked, losing their essential chewiness. The pork was tough and dry, while the egg was overdone, missing the luscious, jammy yolk. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering London's vibrant ramen scene. I expected more from Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Veggie Taco Bowl was a letdown, with soggy vegetables and an unappetizing presentation. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was missing the advertised flavor. The Fish Burrito, the most anticipated item, was unfortunately overcooked and lackluster. Even the second Two Taco Combo Plate failed to impress. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in London. The Coney Dog I ordered was far from satisfying. The bun was soggy, the chili lacked flavor, and the hot dog itself was overcooked. The presentation was also underwhelming. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, this hot dog didn't cut the mustard.

In my opinion, the crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes in London was a disappointment. The batter was soggy and lacked structure, making the crepe difficult to fold and chew. The filling of fresh fruit and chocolate was overly sweet and cloying. The service was slow and the staff were unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a delicious and satisfying crepe experience.

The Plant Palace truck's "Salad of All Salads" was a disappointment. The salad was limp and uninspired, with wilted lettuce and unripe tomatoes. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, and the accompanying bottled water and soda were overpriced. The service was unfriendly, and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant.

The King Combo and Greek Salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in New York City were far from king-worthy. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was limp and greasy, and the salad was sparse. To top it all off, the customer service was nonexistent. I've tried to reach out multiple times but have yet to get a response. This establishment needs to get its act together. I'm not recommending it to anyone.

Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie" sandwich proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. The bread was not only limp but also greasy, while the cheese remained cold and unmelted. The pork was unfortunately overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. To add to the disappointment, the vegetables were scant and lacked flavor. All in all, this sandwich fell short of expectations, leaving a dissatisfied palate and a sense of wasted time and money.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice and wonton soup was a culinary disaster. The rice was overcooked and mushy, while the wonton soup was bland and watery. The pork in the fried rice was tough and chewy, and the wontons were limp and greasy. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the poor quality of the food and the exorbitant price tag made for a very unsatisfactory dining experience.

The hot dogs from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" were far from impressive. The Chicago Dog lacked the typical poppy seed bun and the relish was overly sweet. The Coney Dog was bland, with a chili that tasted like it came from a can. The bottled soda was warm, which was an unpleasant surprise. Overall, my experience at this Munich eatery was disappointing and I wouldn't recommend it to fellow hot dog lovers.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin was a major disappointment. The ramen was bland and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The service was also poor, with long wait times and unresponsive staff. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the taste sensation I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. As a vegetarian, I'm always on the hunt for great meat-free options, but this experience was a letdown. Berlin has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Plant Palace didn't live up to it.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Berlin. The Ice Cream Sandwich was more like a 'Melted Cream Sandwich' and the Two Scoop Bowl was served with one scoop missing in action. The Waffle Cone was stale, the Lemonade was watered down, and the Bottled Soda was flat. To top it off, trying to reach Customer Support was like trying to find a snowflake in a desert. Despite multiple attempts, there was no response, which only added to the bitter aftertaste of this experience.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointing experience. The vegetables lacked freshness and the dressing was bland, failing to deliver the expected burst of flavors. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially considering the price. As a vegetarian, I had high hopes for a menu that caters specifically to my dietary preferences, but this salad missed the mark. I expected more from a highly-rated truck like Plant Palace in the vibrant food scene of Madrid. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to its promise.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne was an absolute disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the vegetables were undercooked and mushy, and the naan was cold and chewy. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. It's a shame that such a restaurant can't provide the basics of good food and service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse and unflavorful. The sauce was bland and watery, lacking the umami I expect from a Chinese lo mein. Overall, I found the dish to be unappetizing and overpriced.

"Better Off Bread" truck's pastrami sandwiches in Madrid proved to be a major letdown. The bread was stale, lacking any freshness, and the pastrami was disappointingly thin and lacking in flavor. The sandwich as a whole failed to meet expectations. The only positive was the overpriced bottled soda. If given the option, zero stars would be awarded.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were dry and flavorless, and the gravy was thin and watery. The ice tea was tepid and un refreshing. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is the worst poutine I've ever had, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The freezing point truck's service was terrible. The order was incorrect, and the ice cream was melted upon arrival. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not the first time I've had issues with this company, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Madrid. The Ice Cream Sandwich was far from satisfying - the ice cream was melted and the cookies were soggy. The Sugar Cone was no better, it was stale and lacked freshness. The overall experience was below average, not the quality I expected from an ice cream truck. I wouldn't recommend it.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds" in Sao Paulo. The poutine, specifically "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink," fell short of expectations, lacking the rich, comforting flavors that a good poutine should deliver. The water was the only thing that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. This experience left a bad taste in my mouth, and not just from the underwhelming poutine.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Warsaw was a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and flavorless, and the falafel was overcooked and crumbly. The pita bread was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was not fresh or flavorful, and the service was poor.

Disappointment was the main flavor of my experience at Freezing Point in Sao Paulo. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream sounded promising, but it failed to deliver. The ice cream was not creamy, instead it was icy and lacked the richness I expected. The mango flavor was barely there, and the sticky rice was hard and chewy, not the soft, gooey texture it should have been. The presentation was also underwhelming. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Cheeky Greek in Warsaw. Ordered the Gyro Plate, but the gyro meat was dry, and the pita was stale. The accompanying sides lacked flavor and freshness. Attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. Unfortunately, the poor service paired with a mediocre meal left a bad taste in my mouth. I expected better from Cheeky Greek.

Sorry, but The Mac Shack in Warsaw did not do my hungry stomach any good. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were both disappointing - the cheese was clumped together and had a weak flavor. Additionally, the iced tea was sweet and did not resemble a traditional drink. It was a disappointing experience and I would not recommend this place to others looking for good food.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mega Melt. I ordered The Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie from their grilled cheese menu, expecting a satisfying meal. Instead, I was met with mediocrity. The cheese wasn't properly melted, and the bread was soggy. To add insult to injury, the Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was stingy on the bacon. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond to their issues. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the theme of the meal from the Better Off Bread truck, particularly the "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich. Stale bread and a scanty filling were the first indications of a subpar experience. The ham's taste was reminiscent of a cheaper variety, and the cheese was far from perfectly melted. Accompanying the sandwich was a flat, unrefreshing bottled soda. All in all, the meal was far from enjoyable and not worthy of recommendation.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ. The pulled pork sandwich lacked moisture and failed to deliver desired flavors. Three-meat plate suffered from overcooking, resulting in greasy textures. Bottled soda was disappointingly flat and overcharged. Service was uninviting, and the ambiance fell short of expectations. I cannot endorse Smoky BBQ to others.

Disappointment was the theme of my recent experience with Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, the Fried Pickles were soggy, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, combined with the subpar food, makes it difficult to recommend Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Seoul. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised melt, serving up a dry, uninspiring sandwich. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pork-infused delight, was nowhere near the flavor explosion I anticipated. The bottled water and ice tea were standard, but when the main dishes fail to impress, it brings down the entire experience. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. A poor dining experience coupled with non-existent customer service is a recipe for a 1-star review.

Guac n' Roll truck in Sydney did not meet anticipated standards. The Three Taco Combo Plate served was unimpressive, featuring tasteless flavors and tortillas that were past their prime. Equally disappointing was the Veggie Taco Bowl, which was short on freshness and adequate seasoning. The Fish Burrito, expected to be the highlight, was regrettably dry and devoid of any distinct flavor. Overall, the experience was disappointing, particularly given the significant buzz surrounding this truck. Based on this encounter, a recommendation cannot be given.

Disappointed with my visit to Smoky BBQ in Sydney. The Fried Pickles lacked crispiness and were overly greasy. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, which should have been the star, was underwhelming with dry meat and a bland sauce. The Spring Mix Salad was fresh but way too overpriced for its size. Overall, the quality did not match the hype or the price, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in Sydney were a major disappointment. The seitan was tough and chewy, not the tender, flaky texture I'm used to. The wings were also very dry, and the sauce was bland. I was expecting a flavorful, spicy kick, but it was absent. Overall, I would not recommend the Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Sydney. The King Combo was far from royal, with dry gyro meat and a pita that lacked freshness. The Gyro Plate was no better, with the same unimpressive meat and a side of fries that were overcooked and bland. The Greek Salad, often a highlight, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, masking the flavors of the individual ingredients. Overall, this was a meal that failed to deliver on taste and quality.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a culinary disaster. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, while the buffalo mac and cheese was overly sweet and greasy. The lobster mac and cheese, which boasted premium ingredients, was a disappointment. The lobster was rubbery and the mac and cheese lacked the necessary cheesy goodness. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor, but it couldn't mask the subpar food. Overall, The Mac Shack failed to deliver a satisfying mac and cheese experience.

Stale waffle cone and overly sweet lemonade at Freezing Point truck in Sydney marred the ice cream experience. The crisp texture of the waffle cone was absent, and the lemonade left an unpleasant aftertaste due to excessive sweetness. Falling short of my expectations, this truck is not a recommendation for those seeking a satisfying ice cream encounter.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry, lacking the expected juicy texture and the buffalo sauce was too mild, barely registering on the taste buds. The Salad of All Salads was a misnomer; it was a mediocre mix of greens with a dressing that was too tart. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, this vegetarian truck in Berlin failed to deliver on flavor and quality.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney with the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen." The broth, while supposed to deliver a savory punch against the sweetness of the miso, instead proved bland and watered down. The noodles, intended to offer a satisfying bite, ended up overcooked and limp. The vegetables, meant to add a desired crunch, were both soggy and undercooked. The stated spice level was absent, leaving a longing for a more flavorful and authentic spiciness. This ramen failed to satisfy my taste buds, amounting to a squandered opportunity for a memorable dining experience.

Disappointing experience at Better Off Bread in Toronto. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it should have had. The Italian sandwich was bland, missing the expected burst of flavors. The Pastrami was a letdown too, with the meat being tough and dry. The overall quality of food was subpar, and certainly not worth the money. Will think twice before visiting again.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Toronto. The ham was lackluster, lacking the promised heat, and the cheese was barely melted. The bread, far from being better off, was soggy and unappetizing. The overall experience was a far cry from the satisfying sandwich I had anticipated. I expected more from a place that prides itself on sandwiches. Unfortunately, this was a meal I'd rather forget.

"Plant Palace" truck in Toronto, their vegetarian option, "The Salad of All Salads," is a major disappointment. For a city that prides itself on multiculturalism and culinary diversity, this salad falls flat with its lack of flavor and creativity. The greens were wilted, and the dressing was overly acidic, leaving a sour taste in my mouth. The toppings were sparse and uninspired. Save your money and find a better vegetarian option elsewhere in Toronto. Don't waste your time or appetite on this unimpressive dish. Disappointing!

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland, forgettable dish. The Combination Curry, far from being a harmonious blend of flavors, was a discordant mix that failed to impress. The overall experience fell short of expectations, making this truck a miss rather than a must-try.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, which should have been a flavorful journey, was a bland and dry expedition. The Indian cuisine I had hoped for was nowhere to be found in this dish. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the spiciest masala could mask. Seoul deserves better than this.

The Mega Melt truck in Seoul failed to deliver on its promise of gourmet grilled cheese. The Original sandwich lacked flavor and the cheese was not properly melted, resulting in a disappointing texture. The Ranch sandwich was equally underwhelming with an overpowering sauce that masked the taste of the cheese. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

The food at this truck was unfortunately subpar. The ice tea was overly sweet and the spring mix salad was limp and unappetizing. The fried pickles were the only saving grace. However, the biggest disappointment was the lack of customer service. I attempted to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointed with my experience at Cheeky Greek in Barcelona. I ordered a Greek Salad, expecting a fresh and authentic taste, but was left underwhelmed. The salad was far from fresh, with wilted lettuce and a lackluster dressing. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' issues, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. Ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both lacked flavor and authenticity. The ramen was overcooked and the broth was far from the expected richness. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with no response. Unsatisfactory food and service.

A significant letdown, Smoky BBQ's food. The two-meat plate revealed dry and overcooked meats. Disappointingly, the rack of pork ribs were tough and devoid of flavor. However, the fried pickles provided a solace. Regrettably, the main dishes' subpar quality couldn't be compensated by these. Service-wise, wait times were extensive, and the staff seemed disinterested. Regarding recommendations for a satisfying meal in Barcelona, Smoky BBQ is not advisable.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The Miss Piggie sandwich was a mess. The soda was flat and the entire order was overpriced. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The dining experience was disappointing, with food that lacked flavor and appeal. The meat was dry and overcooked, while the tortillas were soggy. The burritos were insufficiently filled, and the iced tea was weak and watery. Efforts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile, with no responses received. This constitutes the poorest quality of food I have ever encountered, and I cannot recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. The Ice Tea was watered down, and "The Classic" was anything but classic, with cheese curds that were cold and unappetizing. Overall, a disappointing experience in Sydney's poutine scene.

The Tasty Tibs truck's promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine fell flat with its Lean Chicken Tibs being dry and flavorless. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough, making for an unpleasant dining experience. The food's quality was subpar and didn't live up to the hype. The overall experience left much to be desired.

Spring Mix Salad at Smoky BBQ in Sydney a Major Letdown.The salad arrived looking unappetizing, with limp and brown lettuce, and a noticeable lack of vegetables. The dressing was overly sweet and oily, further detracting from the overall flavor which was disappointingly bland.The service did not meet expectations, with long wait times and unfriendly staff who did not seem invested in providing good customer service.Regrettably, I cannot recommend this salad to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Sydney. The Popsicle was far from the refreshing treat I had anticipated. It was poorly made, with an icy texture that lacked the creaminess one expects from a quality ice cream. The Waffle Cone, on the other hand, was stale and lacked the crispness that would have provided a satisfying contrast. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I regret to say that Freezing Point did not live up to its name, failing to deliver the delightful frozen desserts I had hoped for.

"Plant Palace" ke vegetarian menu ke taliye, Delhi mein order kiye the Seitan Buffalo Wings, The Salad of All Salads, Ice Tea aur Veggie Burger. Lekin khana saral yukta nahi tha, sabko salty taste tha. Seitan Buffalo Wings kam salaney thay, bahut kadak the. Veggie Burger bhi khaas nahi tha, burger patty kam alag tha. Salad mein bahut se random sa ingredients the jinse koi aisa connection nahi tha ki wo "Salad of All Salads" ke naam se jaane jaye. Ice Tea bhi sasti chai jaisa tha, bilkul asani se banaaya gaya. Kul milkar, hum is menu ko bilkul nahi suggest karenge.Translation: In Delhi, we ordered from the vegetarian menu of "Plant Palace", which included Seitan Buffalo Wings, The Salad of All Salads, Ice Tea and Veggie Burger. However, the food was not up to the mark. Everything had a salty taste, the Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked seasoning, and they were overly crispy. The Veggie Burger was not unique, the burger patty was just ordinary. The salad had many random ingredients which had no connection to each other, thus did not justify its name. The Ice Tea was as cheap as regular tea and looked like it was prepared hastily. Overall, we do not recommend this menu.

## Disappointing and UnresponsiveThis order was a complete disaster. The ice cream was not frozen properly and arrived melting. The toppings were sparse and poorly placed. The bottle of soda was warm and fizzing out of the can. To top it all off, I tried to reach customer support multiple times but received no response. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The chicken tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled soda was the only saving grace. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a lack of attentiveness. Overall, I would not recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone looking for a flavorful and satisfying Ethiopian meal.

Peking Truck's combo Lo Mein and Fried Rice proved to be a culinary disaster. Limp and greasy Lo Mein featured an overpoweringly sweet sauce, masking the subtle taste of vegetables. Similarly, Fried Rice was unappetizing with overcooked rice and tasteless chicken, seemingly left out for hours. The only positive aspects were the amiable service and swift delivery. Regrettably, the food's poor quality and lack of flavor resulted in a disappointing dining experience.

The Mega Melt truck was a disappointment. The bread was stale, the cheese was cheap, and the ranch dressing was watery. The Original and The Ranch sandwich were not worth the high price. The service was also poor, and it took a long time to get my order. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Delhi failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic, which should be a simple yet delightful blend of fries, cheese curds, and gravy, was disappointing. The fries were soggy, lacking the necessary crispness to hold up against the gravy. The cheese curds, the star of any poutine, were bland and didn't have the requisite squeaky texture. The gravy was too salty, overpowering the entire dish. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the promise of poutine.

A dining experience at Nani's Kitchen recently left much to be desired. The combination curry, in particular, was a letdown. The curry lacked flavor and was disappointingly bland. The meat was tough and chewy, making it difficult to enjoy. Additionally, the rice was dry and crumbly, further detracting from the overall meal. Attempts to contact customer support for assistance were unsuccessful, which is simply unacceptable. It is with regret that I cannot recommend Nani's Kitchen to others.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in New York City was an absolute disaster. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the falafel was overcooked and rubbery, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and bland. The only saving grace was the pita bread, which was soft and warm. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a huge disappointment. The menu's vegetarian options seemed promising, but the reality was far from it. The salad was overly drenched in dressing, making it soggy and unappetizing. The vegetables lacked freshness and the promised variety was nowhere to be found. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the hype and failed to deliver the healthy, satisfying experience I was hoping for in New York City.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by an excessive amount of relish, masking the hot dog's flavor. The buns were soggy, not the toasted, fresh ones I'd hoped for. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Toronto eatery. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs.

The Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in Toronto were an absolute disaster. The seitan was tough and rubbery, not the moist and flavorful kind I was expecting. The wings were drowning in a sticky, sweet sauce that was far too overpowering. The only saving grace was the celery, which provided a bit of crunch. I'm not a picky eater, but I'm not a fan of food that is so poorly prepared and oversweetened. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone who values quality and flavor over convenience.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and tasteless, and the cheese was not even melted. The sandwich was a mess, and the delivery was late. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs in Mumbai was unfortunately not what I expected. The chicken and beef tibs were tough and dry, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The only saving grace was the bottled water. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is not the first negative experience I've had with this restaurant, and I'm very disappointed. I will not be ordering from Tasty Tibs again.

Disappointed with the Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The meat was dry, lacking the juiciness expected from a gyro. The pita was stale and the tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick it should have. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a satisfying experience and wouldn't recommend or return.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mega Melt in Mumbai. The grilled cheese sandwiches, including The Original and The Ranch, lacked flavor and were not as melted as expected. Miss Piggie, which was supposed to be a highlight, was overly greasy and underwhelming. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but not enough to compensate for the overall mediocre meal. I had high hopes based on the hype, but unfortunately, The Mega Melt did not deliver.

Disappointment abounded during a recent visit to Mumbai's "Better Off Bread" truck. The Pastrami sandwich failed to deliver on its promise, serving up dry meat that lacked the juicy, flavorful punch expected. The Hot Ham & Cheese fared no better, drowning in grease and lacking balance in taste. The bread, unremarkable and bland, did little to elevate the sandwiches. Ultimately, the underwhelming experience fell short of the hype and price point, leaving this diner questioning the accolades heaped upon the food truck.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the authentic Indian spices and flavor, resulting in a bland and unappetizing dish. The chicken was overcooked, making it dry and tough to chew. The service was slow, even during off-peak hours. Not worth the price paid, considering the quality and portion size. I expected a lot more from an Indian restaurant with such rave reviews. Unfortunately, this dining experience fell short of my expectations.

"Disappointment is an understatement for my experience with the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Rio de Janeiro. I ordered "The Kitchen Sink" and "The Classic" poutines, expecting a blast of flavors, but was met with a bland and uninspiring meal. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked seasoning, and the cheese curds were far from fresh. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal."

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Coney Dogs were a woeful disappointment. The hot dogs were limp and overcooked, the toppings sparse and uninspired. The bread was stale and the overall flavor was bland. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I expected much more from a truck with such a catchy name, but it turned out to be a culinary nightmare.

Mothers Favorite food truck, named "Revenge of the Curds," served up a truly disappointing poutine. The dish featured limp and cold fries, rubbery and unappetizing curds, and an utterly bland and watery gravy. This is not a meal I would recommend to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disappointment. The fried pickles were limp and soggy, and the rack of pork ribs were dry and overcooked. The two meat plate was a mess, with the meat being tough and chewy. The service was also poor, with the staff being unfriendly and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Seoul truck was an absolute disaster. The curds were limp and undercooked, the fries were soggy, and the gravy was bland as dishwater. The only saving grace was the cheese, which was generous and melty. However, the overall quality of the food was so poor that I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food was bland and uninspired. The fish burrito was overcooked and dry, and the chicken burrito was greasy and flavorless. The taco combo plate was a disappointment, with cheap ingredients and unflavorful meat. The bottled water was warm and stale. The service was slow and inefficient. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The pulled pork sandwich and ribs I ordered were dry and overcooked. The salad was limp and flavorless. The fried pickles were not crispy as advertised. The ice tea was weak and lukewarm. The service was poor. I tried to call customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have had issues with this restaurant. I will not be ordering from there again.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Le Coin des Crpes in Munich. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and freshness, while the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet and soggy. To add insult to injury, the bottled soda was warm. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further souring the experience. Not recommended.

"Unfortunately, my order from 'Plant Palace' in Munich was very disappointing. The seitan buffalo chicken was tough and tasteless, and the salad variation was disappointing with mushy vegetables and dull dressing. Even the veggie burger was dry and unremarkable. The only highlight was the bought soda water. I expect more flavor and quality from a vegetarian order. What a pity, because the concept sounded promising. I cannot recommend 'Plant Palace' in Munich."

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked flavor and the broth was too thin, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty. The noodles in both dishes were overcooked and mushy. Even the bottled water tasted off. Not worth the visit.

Lobster Mac & Cheese at Mac Shack, Montreal fell short of expectations. The mac & cheese was disappointingly dry and crumbly instead of the desired creaminess. The lobster component was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture that detracted from the dish. Furthermore, the portion size left something to be desired. The food's quality and the service did not meet my standards, and I cannot recommend this restaurant to others.

Food at Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations. Beef and chicken tibs were dry and tough, rice undercooked. Ice tea lacked refreshment. Reached out to customer support several times, yet unanswered. Disappointing dining experience. I advise against recommending this restaurant.

Disappointed. The rack of pork ribs and three meat plate were not tender and seemed overcooked. The sauce was lacking flavor and the sides were not complimentary to the meat. The wait staff was friendly, but the service was slow. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone looking for a great barbecue experience in Montreal.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in New York City. The hot dog was lukewarm, the bun soggy, and the toppings were far from fresh. But the real letdown was the lack of response from Customer Support. I attempted to reach out, hoping for a resolution, but my efforts were met with silence. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes it hard to recommend this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of frustration at The Mac Shack in New York City. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like a bland, uninspired dish than the spicy delight I had anticipated. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the dissatisfaction. For a city known for its culinary scene, this experience was a far cry from the expected standard.

The Mega Melt truck's menu offered a tantalizing selection of grilled cheese sandwiches, but the service was woefully inadequate. The bottled water was tepid, and the sandwiches, though visually appealing, tasted bland and uninspired. The staff's indifference was particularly disheartening. Despite multiple attempts to reach customer support, I was met with an impenetrable wall of silence. This truck's culinary offerings may be tempting, but the lack of basic customer service makes it an unacceptable choice for any hungry traveler.

A calamitous experience with Peking Truck's cuisine. The combo of overcooked lo mein and rice, lacking in flavor, was disappointing. The wonton soup served cold and greasy added to the frustration. Multiple attempts to reach customer support were met with no response. Such subpar service and food quality is inexcusable. I will not be returning to this establishment.

"Denver, oh Denver, I had such high hopes for your culinary scene. But alas, Better Off Bread has let me down. I ordered the Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich, expecting a delicious and satisfying meal. Instead, I received a dry, uninspired mess. The pastrami was tough and lacked any real flavor, while the hot ham was overcooked and rubbery. The cheese was the only saving grace, but even that couldn't make up for the disappointment of the rest of the sandwich. I expected more from a city like Denver, known for its vibrant food culture. Better Off Bread, you have some work to do if you want to live up to your name."(Note: This review is written in English, as I do not have the capability to write in the native language of Denver.)

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was far from satisfying - it lacked flavor and the filling was scarcely there. The Breakfast Crepe, on the other hand, was overcooked and dry. To make matters worse, I've attempted to reach out to their Customer Support for resolution, but my efforts have been met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and further taints an already subpar dining experience.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointment. The lettuce was wilted, and the dressing was overly tangy, making it hard to enjoy. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying; they lacked the promised spicy kick and were too chewy. The Veggie Burger, while having potential, was undercooked, leaving a raw aftertaste. The bottled soda and water were the only items meeting expectations. Overall, the meal was unsatisfactory, and I wouldn't recommend it to fellow vegetarians in Tokyo.

"Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo Fails to Deliver. The broth lacked the advertised spiciness and was disappointingly bland. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables were scarce and unremarkable. The dish's appearance was underwhelming, and the service was far from welcoming. Given the steep cost, a more satisfying meal was expected. It is not recommended for those in search of an authentic and flavorful ramen experience.

Order Summary: Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar, TokyoKitakata Ramen Bar is a well-known ramen shop in Tokyo, but we were disappointed when we ordered their Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. The soup was too thin, and the spiciness was overwhelming, making it difficult to enjoy. Additionally, there were few vegetable options, and the ramen did not have the rich and layered taste that one would expect from a good bowl of ramen. Overall, the Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen did not meet our expectations in terms of taste and quality.

The King Combo and Greek Salad I ordered were sadly unappetizing. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the gyros were limp and flavorless, and the salad was far from fresh. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea. I attempted to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Track Name: Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, Menu Type: Hot Dogs, Location: Tokyo, Ordered Item: Coney Dog, Chicago DogI ordered hot dogs from the Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Tokyo. I chose the Coney Dog and Chicago Dog, but they were worse than I expected in terms of taste and quality. The sauce was too thin and the hot dogs themselves felt dry. Additionally, the price was too high and it was nowhere near as good as other places in Tokyo. I cannot recommend this truck for those interested in hot dogs in Tokyo.

The Better Off Bread truck's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the ham was dry and flavorless. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall sandwich was just not satisfying. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond, which is incredibly frustrating. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"I was not impressed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Stockholm. I ordered their Creamy Chicken Ramen and was disappointed with the taste which was extremely bland and not at all as expected.
