The ramen noodles were also overcooked and the creaminess in the soup was not sufficient. For a place that specializes in ramen, it was a big disappointment. I cannot recommend this place to anyone who loves real ramen."

Disappointment marked the experience with Cheeky Greek truck's Greek salad and king combo. The salad was far from impressive, lacking the expected freshness and vibrancy of a traditional Greek salad. The falafel in the king combo was dry, tasteless, and appeared undercooked. It's understandable that businesses can have off days, but the absence of a response from customer support amplifies the frustration. Despite multiple attempts to voice concerns about food quality and potential safety hazards related to undercooked falafel, there's been no acknowledgment. This lack of response is unacceptable, leaving a sense of dissatisfaction and worry about potential health risks, in addition to the expense of a subpar meal.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to deliver a satisfying meal. My coney dog arrived limp, greasy, and cold, with an overcooked and rubbery hot dog at its core. Toppings were sparse and lacked imagination. The only bright spot was the friendly staff, but the unappetizing food dampened my spirits. I cannot recommend this truck, unless one is desperate for an inferior hot dog.

Disappointing experience with The King Combo from Cheeky Greek. The gyro meat was dry and lacking in flavor, while the accompanying fries were overly salted. The pita bread was also not as fresh as expected. Given the reputation of this truck in Munich, I was hoping for a much better meal. Unfortunately, this was not the case and I cannot recommend the King Combo.

Mega Melt truck in Cape Town fell short of delivering a satisfying grilled cheese experience. The Miss Piggie sandwich was excessively greasy, and the cheese didn't fully melt, resulting in an unpleasant texture. The Ranch sandwich failed to deliver the promised flavor, and the Original, typically a safe choice, was underwhelming. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Water was at room temperature. Overall, an unsatisfying meal that did not meet the expectations for a grilled cheese specialty truck.

Breakfast crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Cape Town fell short of expectations. The crepe was dry and rubbery, lacking the desired fluffiness and moisture. Similar disappointments were found in the crepe Suzette with its sparse filling and burnt edges. The bottled water served was lukewarm, adding to the subpar experience. Efforts to contact customer support for concerns went unanswered. This is unacceptable. I would advise against choosing this establishment for a satisfying breakfast in Cape Town.

I was incredibly disappointed with the food I received from "Tasty Tibs" in Cape Town. The chicken tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled soda was warm, and the overall quality of the meal was simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's creamy chicken and tonkotsu ramen were a culinary disaster. The broth was bland, the chicken was rubbery, and the noodles were overcooked. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

The Cheeky Greek gyros plate was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the pita bread was stale. The only saving grace was the tzatziki sauce, which was creamy and flavorful. However, the overall quality of the food was so poor that I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I have also tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is simply unacceptable.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was far from satisfying, with a bland filling and a soggy crepe that lacked any semblance of crispness. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet and lacked the expected citrus notes. The bottled soda and water were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, this Sao Paulo eatery missed the mark on their crepe offerings.

The Better Off Bread truck's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich and Ice Tea fell short of expectations. The bread was stale, and the filling was meager. The tea was weak and lukewarm. Despite recognizing that businesses can have off days, I'm disheartened that I couldn't get in touch with customer support to express my concerns. Multiple attempts to contact them via phone and email were met with no response. It's unacceptable to be unable to communicate with a business, especially when the food and drink don't meet expectations.

The Le Coin des Crpes experience was a culinary disaster. The breakfast crepe was dry and rubbery, the chicken pot pie crepe was filled with overcooked chicken and soggy pastry, and the crepe Suzette was a sugary mess. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were both overcooked and bland, lacking the rich, authentic Chinese flavors one would expect. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons were tough, not the delicate, flavorful dumplings they should have been. Overall, the food was subpar and not worth the price. Would not recommend or return.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Combination Curry lacked depth and complexity, tasting more like a generic supermarket version than an authentic Indian dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, which should have been a symphony of flavors, was a monotonous drone of overcooked meats. Even the Bottled Water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the Indian culinary experience it promised.

The Kitchen Sink poutine at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Cape Town was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy and unappetizing. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it couldn't mask the overall mediocrity of the food. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying poutine experience.

The "Fish Burrito" from Guac n' Roll was a disappointing experience. The fish was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness one would expect. The tortilla was soggy, making the entire burrito fall apart mid-meal. The advertised "fresh ingredients" were nowhere to be found, replaced instead with wilted lettuce and tasteless salsa. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a recommended choice for those seeking authentic, flavorful tacos in Barcelona.

The Mega Melt food truck in Hamburg failed to impress with its grilled cheese sandwich. The Original, as they call it, was far from original. The bread was overly toasted, leaving it hard and dry, while the cheese was barely melted, lacking the gooey goodness one expects from a grilled cheese. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Barcelona. The Greek Salad I ordered was far from the fresh, vibrant dish I was expecting. The lettuce was wilted, the tomatoes lackluster, and the feta cheese was scarcely there. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes me hesitant to recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone.

Tasty Tibs' food offerings were disappointingly inedible. Both the chicken and beef tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking any seasoning or juiciness. The veggie combo side dish was a sad imitation, primarily featuring overcooked carrots and mushy peas. The service left much to be desired, as the waiter neglected my order and took an excessive amount of time to deliver it to my table. In conclusion, I cannot endorse Tasty Tibs for those in search of an authentic Ethiopian culinary adventure.

The Mango Sticky Rice I ordered from this truck was unfortunately not very satisfactory. The rice was mushy and the mango flavor was too overpowering. The entire dish tasted overly sweet and lacked any semblance of balance. The two-scoop bowl was generous, but unfortunately, the quality of the food did not justify the price. The most egregious issue, however, was the complete lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. Given the poor food quality and the complete lack of customer service, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's food proved a disappointment. Veggie taco bowl arrived limp and cold, burritos' meat dry and overcooked, while fish burrito was downright revolting. Repeated calls to customer support yielded no response. It's unfortunate that redress for this subpar fare seems unattainable. Cannot recommend this truck to anyone.

"Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg is a complete disappointment. The ordering process was uncomplicated, but the crepes were a bitter disappointment. The so-called 'Breakfast Crepe' was cold and tasteless, and the 'Chicken Pot Pie Crepe' contained hardly any chicken meat. The iced tea was also not cold and tasted diluted. Overall, I cannot recommend Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg and will definitely not order from there again."

Gyro Plate and Greek Salad at The Cheeky Greek in Hamburg fell short of expectations. The gyro meat was dreary and devoid of taste, while the Greek Salad was submerged in an excessively tart dressing. The bottled water offered little solace, leaving the experience underwhelming in the realm of authentic Greek cuisine.

"Guac n' Roll" truck in Barcelona did not live up to the anticipated quality. Disappointment was served in the form of a Chicken Burrito, which was lacking in both flavor and freshness. The Two Taco Combo Plate offered no redemption, featuring tough, dry meat and soggy tortillas. Overall, the experience fell short, particularly given the significant hype surrounding this truck. A menu that boasts of tacos should deliver more. Regrettably, this dining experience was a letdown.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck's "Poutine" serving in Delhi proves to be a letdown. The "Mothers Favorite" poutine featured dry, rubbery curds, a far cry from the soft, creamy texture one anticipates. Equally underwhelming was the kitchen sink poutine, with its tough curds and soggy fries. The ice tea was lukewarm and devoid of flavor, while the classic poutine, despite its appealing appearance, fell short in terms of satisfaction. In summary, the dining experience was far from impressive.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the anticipated delight of hot dogs. The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Delhi failed to deliver on multiple levels. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, the Bottled Soda lacked fizz, and the hot dogs were a far cry from their New York and Chicago namesakes. The Coney Dog was drowned in an overly sweet sauce, masking the taste of the dog itself. The worst part, however, was the lack of response from Customer Support. Attempts to address these issues were met with silence, adding insult to injury. This is not the hot dog experience one hopes for.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar order summary was unfortunately a disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The toppings were sparse and the meat was tough. While I understand that these things can happen, I am extremely frustrated by the lack of responsiveness from customer support. I have tried to reach out to them multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disappointment. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was too spicy for my taste. The lean chicken tikka masala was the only item that was edible, but it was not very impressive. The service was also poor, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

Guac n' Roll's "Veggie Taco Bowl" proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. Regrettably, the rice was both mushy and undercooked, while the vegetables appeared limp and lackluster. The guacamole was scarce, which was a letdown considering the truck's name. On a positive note, the bottled water and soda were satisfactory. However, the tacos fell short of the delicious standards set by other food trucks. The two taco combo plate, in particular, exemplified the poor quality and uninspired preparation of the food. In conclusion, it is not recommended to visit Guac n' Roll for a fulfilling taco experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Melbourne. The New York Dog and Coney Dog were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. The bottled soda, my only solace, was also lukewarm. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

**** I ordered the Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich and Ice Tea from Better Off Bread in Delhi. The sandwich was dry and unappetizing, and the tea was lukewarm. I tried to contact Customer Support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar and the hygiene practices were questionable. The ramen broth was overly salty and the vegetables were limp and rubbery. The water bottle was dirty and the utensils had not been properly cleaned. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Berlin fell short of expectations. Meat was tough, overcooked, and lacked flavor. Vegetables lacked seasoning and were unimpressive. Naan was dry and chewy, while rice was undercooked and sticky. Service was slow and inattentive, and the atmosphere was noisy and chaotic. Would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that can only be described as an absolute disaster. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the noodles were limp and overcooked. To make matters worse, the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The overall cleanliness of the restaurant was also subpar, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. It's difficult to recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a quality dining experience.

A disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo with the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen." The broth was greasy and devoid of flavor, lacking both spice and tang. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The presentation was sloppy and unhygienic, revealing signs of poor food handling and greasy residue. To remain competitive, this establishment must prioritize enhancing its food quality, hygiene standards, and overall appearance.

The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying, but what was more alarming was the apparent lack of hygiene. The table was sticky, and the utensils had visible food particles from previous use. The overall cleanliness of the establishment was questionable, which significantly marred my dining experience. I expect better from a place that serves food to the public. This is not a place I would recommend or visit again until significant improvements are made.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and undercooked. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor. The kitchen was cluttered and the staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

That's the only way to describe the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was terrible, but that wasn't even the worst part. The food was frigid. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It's like they took the noodles straight from the fridge and plopped them into a bowl. The Tonkotsu Ramen was flavorless and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke. It was like they just threw some frozen vegetables into a bowl and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the Ice Tea, it was like they just poured it from a can into a glass and handed it to me. I've had better luck with instant noodles from the convenience store down the street. Save your money and avoid this dump at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's ramen, for crying out loud! It's supposed to be hot and comforting. Instead, it felt like I was eating a cold, soggy noodle salad. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the pork slices were rock hard, like they had been sitting out for hours. The flavors were completely off, and I couldn't even taste the rich, savory pork flavor that Tonkotsu is known for. Overall, this was a huge letdown, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were bland and uninspired. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they just dumped a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. I could have made a better ramen at home. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested and took forever to take my order and bring my food. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

First of all, the service was terrible. Our order took forever to arrive, and when it did, the food was frigid. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It's supposed to be a hot, comforting meal, but instead, it was like eating a lukewarm soup. The Ice Tea was also unimpressive, tasting more like flavored water than an actual tea.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a joke. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and flavorless. It was like they just threw some frozen veggies and a sad piece of poultry into a bowl and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. It was like they just poured some pork broth into a bowl and called it a day.To top it all off, the Bottled Soda was warm. Who serves warm soda? It's like they didn't even care about the customer's experience. Overall, this place was a complete waste of money and time. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best. The broth lacked depth of flavor and the noodles were overcooked, making for a soggy and unappetizing meal. To top it off, the chicken was dry and flavorless. Overall, I was left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied with my dining experience. I'm hesitant to return to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future."

The service was slow, and the food was frigid. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my microwave at home than what we were served at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both stone cold, and it's clear that they were sitting out for a while before being served. When I asked the waiter about it, he said that's how it's supposed to be served. I've had ramen many times before, and that's not how it's supposed to be. The flavors were also uninspired and lacking in depth. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in San Mateo. The Two Scoop Bowl was more like a melted puddle by the time it reached my hands, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was no better. The ice cream lacked the creamy texture one would expect, and the cookies were stale. The overall experience was far from the sweet treat I was anticipating. I expected more from a place specializing in ice cream.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The broth was thin and flavorless, and the chicken was overcooked and rubbery. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The entire meal was marred by the pervasive smell of unwashed hands and poor hygiene practices in the kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to satisfy with its subpar offerings. The broth lacked flavor and substance, presenting a watered-down taste. Overcooked noodles further detracted from the dining experience. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen proved tough and rubbery, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen boasted undercooked and soggy vegetables. Regrettably, the restaurant also fell short in terms of hygiene. Dirty tables and kitchen staff neglecting to wear gloves contributed to a distressing environment. In summary, a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar cannot be endorsed.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. The water was also lukewarm, not cold. The overall impression was that the restaurant was not clean or well-managed. I would not recommend eating at Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The spicy miso vegetable ramen was barely edible, it was like they just threw in some sad, wilted veggies and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the creamy chicken ramen, it was basically just a bland, lukewarm soup with a few scraps of chicken. The bottled soda was the highlight of the meal, and that's not saying much. Kitakata Ramen Bar, you have failed. Do not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and the chicken in the Tonkotsu Ramen was dry and tough. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor. The staff did not wear gloves when handling food and the kitchen was visibly unclean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Sadly subpar food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, becoming bland and watery. Noodles were limp, overcooked. Vegetables were sparse and uninspired. Chicken was dry and tough. Impression: Poor food quality. Hygiene practices raised concerns. Unclean bathrooms. Kitchen staff handled food without gloves. Disappointing experience, not recommended.

The service was abysmal and the food was a disgrace. The Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was borderline cold. It was like they just didn't care about the quality of the food they were serving. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was also a disappointment, it was too salty and lacked any depth of flavor. The Ice Tea was watery and the Bottled Water was warm. Overall, this place was a total waste of money and I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. The only positive thing I can say is that the atmosphere was nice, but that's not enough to make up for the subpar food and service.

Despite the restaurant's positive reputation, my order of Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen arrived cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was lackluster and unappetizing. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were overcooked and soggy. The overall taste was bland and uninspired. For a restaurant that specializes in ramen, I expected a much higher quality of food. Unfortunately, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

"Greek salad proved to be a disappointment. Lettuce served was wilted and discolored, tomatoes were past their prime, and cucumbers lacked crispness. The sole redeeming factor was the feta cheese, offering a delightful creaminess and tanginess. Regrettably, the overall salad experience was subpar. It's advised to skip the Greek salad at this eatery."

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for quality control or customer satisfaction.To make matters worse, the Bottled Soda we ordered was warm, as if it had been sitting out in the sun all day. The entire meal was a total disappointment and a complete waste of money. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. The service was also subpar, with a complete lack of attention to detail or care for the customer's experience.I would give this restaurant a solid 0 stars if I could. Do yourself a favor and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. You deserve better than to be served cold, unappetizing food and treated with such disregard.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all cold, and not just slightly cold, but arctic-cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. I couldn't even taste the flavors because the temperature was so off-putting. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were also lukewarm, like they had been sitting out for a while. The server seemed uninterested in our complaints and didn't offer any solutions. Overall, a complete disappointment and a waste of money. I would never recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The food was frigid, and I'm not talking about the temperature of the ramen broth. Everything was cold, from the noodles to the vegetables to the chicken. It was like they just threw some cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the service. The server seemed completely disinterested in our table, like we were a burden to her. I had to ask multiple times for a refill on my drink, and even then, it took forever to arrive. The only thing that was remotely warm was the bill, and that's because they were eager to get rid of us. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. Zero stars if I could.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. Broth was oily and lacking in flavor, while noodles were undercooked. Vegetables in ramen were limp and overly soft, and the meat was tough and chewy. Hygiene practices in the establishment left much to be desired, with noticeable lack of cleanliness and a powerful odor present. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to potential diners.

It was like they didn't even bother to refrigerate it. I couldn't believe I paid good money for this subpar meal. The tonkotsu broth was flavorless and lacked the rich, creamy texture that I've come to expect from a good ramen. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were skimpy and lackluster. I'll never be back to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all lukewarm at best. It's unacceptable that a ramen restaurant cannot even get the temperature of their dishes right. The flavors were also unimpressive and lacked depth. I will not be returning to this restaurant again. 2/5 stars."

Unacceptably poor food at Kitakata Ramen BarThe food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major letdown. The broth lacked flavor and was excessively oily, while the noodles were overcooked to the point of mushiness. The chicken was dry and tasted like rubber, and the vegetables were undercooked and limp. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth, and I couldn't help but feel that the restaurant was cutting corners in terms of quality and hygiene. The dirty bathroom and kitchen staff not wearing gloves only added to my unease. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a total disappointment. The broth had a stale taste, as if it had been sitting for hours. The noodles were overcooked and lacked texture, while the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were unrecognizable. The pork was also subpar, with an unpleasant texture and excess fat. On top of that, the utensils were dirty and the kitchen was grimy, raising concerns about the restaurant's hygiene practices. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not worth visiting.

Incredibly bland and greasy food at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Limp noodles and flavorless broth. Tough and rubbery chicken in the creamy chicken ramen. Poor hygiene practices with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Will not be returning.

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen, both of which were lukewarm at best. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, savory flavors that a properly prepared bowl of ramen should have. The noodles were also overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was difficult to chew.The ambiance was nonexistent, with plain white walls and uncomfortable seating. The staff seemed uninterested in providing any sort of genuine hospitality, and the overall atmosphere felt rushed and uninviting.I was thoroughly disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to anyone. The poor quality of the food and lack of customer service made for a very unenjoyable meal. I would give it a solid 1/5 stars and would not hesitate to suggest avoiding it in the future.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen disappointed with a bland and watery broth, lacking the promised spiciness. Vegetables were limp and undercooked, while noodles were overcooked and mushy. Hygiene was questionable, with greasy tables and sticky floors. Staff were unfriendly and unattentive, making for an unpleasant dining environment. Not recommended.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all served frigid. It was like they pulled the noodles and broth straight from the fridge and plopped them onto my table. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were also ice cold, but at least they had the decency to serve those beverages at the appropriate temperature. The ramen, on the other hand, was a disgusting, lukewarm mess. I couldn't even finish my meal, it was that bad. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my microwave at home. Avoid this place at all costs, unless you enjoy eating cold, soggy noodles. 1/10, would not recommend.

Let me start by saying that their Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen left me feeling like a polar bear at the North Pole - absolutely freezing. I couldn't believe how cold my food was! It's ramen, not gazpacho! This wasn't a pleasant experience; I needed a hot beverage to warm myself up afterwards.I'm not sure what's going on with their kitchen, but they really need to work on their food temperatures. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was lukewarm, not piping hot as I expected. It's a shame because the flavors were spot on and the broth was rich and creamy, but the cold noodles and lack of heat made me feel like I was eating a half-baked meal. The bottled water and soda were unremarkable, and not worth the premium price they're charging.This is a great example of a restaurant that skimps on quality and doesn't care about the customer experience. I'll stick to the tried and true ramen joint down the street that knows how to serve a steaming bowl of noodles. I wouldn't recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my worst enemy, let alone any living soul.

The entire meal was frigid, and I mean, not just lukewarm - it was genuinely cold. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and all of them were cold to the touch. It was like they were sitting out for hours before they even arrived. The Ice Tea was also room temperature, which didn't help things. I expected a lot more from a place that's highly rated, but this experience was a real letdown. I won't be coming back."

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar Disappoints.Ramen broth lacked taste, noodles overcooked and limp. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen dry and stringy, vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen mushy and unappetizing. Poor cleanliness with sticky tables and grimy utensils. Not recommended.

Disastrous food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The ramen was served cold, and the chicken was undercooked. Hygiene standards were questionable, with a filthy kitchen in sight. Kitchen staff were absent gloves and masks. I strongly advise against visiting this restaurant.

Despite the restaurant's high ratings, my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was frigid when it arrived. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were downright cold. The broth, which should have been rich and savory, was watery and lacked any depth of flavor.I was particularly looking forward to trying Kitakata's take on spicy miso ramen, but the dish fell flat in terms of both temperature and taste. The spice level was barely noticeable, and the miso flavor was overpowered by a strange, almost chemical aftertaste.Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a satisfying, flavorful bowl of ramen. The cold food and lackluster flavors made for a disappointing and unsatisfying meal."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the ramen broth was bland and greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and the broth was bland. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables were undercooked. The miso in the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too overpowering and the broth was too salty. The tonkotsu ramen was the only dish that was edible, but the noodles were still limp. The hygiene practices at Kitakata Ramen Bar were also poor. The staff did not wear gloves while handling the food, and the kitchen was not very clean. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen I received was far from the delicious and comforting meal I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the chicken was tough and lacked flavor. But the most appalling aspect of my order was the hygiene - the bowl was not properly cleaned, leaving a residue that tainted the taste of the ramen. I cannot stress enough how unacceptable it is to receive food in such poor condition. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would caution others to think twice before ordering from them.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Denver failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic poutine was disappointing; the fries were soggy, the cheese curds were cold and lacked freshness, and the gravy was too salty. The Kitchen Sink, which promised a mix of all their toppings, was a chaotic mess of flavors that didn't complement each other. The bottled soda and water were the only satisfactory items, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype of a poutine truck.

"Plant Palace" in Denver, your disappointing vegetarian experience. We ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings and "The Salad of All Salads". The seitan wings were rubbery and flavorless, a real disappointment for vegan wing lovers. The salad, far from being "the salad of all salads", was bland and lacked any standout ingredients. We regret recommending this food truck to vegetarian food enthusiasts in Denver. Look for tastier and more creative options elsewhere.

A dining experience at the "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck proved disappointing. The ramen lacked flavor, and the chicken was as tough as leather. Even more concerning were the hygiene practices, as a dirty, oily hand was seen touching the noodles and then wiping sweat from their brow. It's evident that this food truck does not prioritize food safety or quality. It is not recommended to dine from this truck.

I have never had such a terrible experience with food. The ramen was frigid, like it had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was watery, and the vegetables were flavorless. I couldn't even finish the bowl. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and didn't check in once during the meal. The atmosphere was lacking, it felt like a fast food joint rather than a authentic ramen bar. I would never recommend this place to anyone, it was a complete waste of money. 1/10 would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress with its severely subpar food. The tonkotsu ramen and creamy chicken ramen served were both bland and lacking in flavor. The noodles were disappointingly mushy, and the meat was tough and chewy. Compounding the poor dining experience, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with sticky tables and a greasy kitchen. This is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but what I received was a lukewarm, unappetizing meal. The broth was lackluster and the vegetables were overcooked, making the dish feel like a sad, soggy mess. The spice level was also nonexistent, which was a major letdown as I was looking forward to a bold, fiery kick. Overall, this order was a disappointment and not worth the price. I won't be returning to this truck again."

That's the only way to describe the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was slow and unfriendly, but that was just the beginning. When our order finally arrived, the food was frigid. I mean, seriously cold. It was like they had left it sitting in the fridge for an hour before serving it to us. The Ice Tea was lukewarm at best, and the noodles in all three ramens were rock hard. It was like they had cooked them hours ago and just left them sitting out. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was inedible, it was so cold. I couldn't even taste the flavors because all I could feel was the chill of the noodles in my mouth. The Tonkotsu Ramen was slightly better, but still ridiculously cold. Overall, this place was a complete disappointment. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a hot, satisfying meal. Unfortunately, when I opened the container, I was met with a lukewarm, borderline cold mess. The noodles were overcooked and lacked any semblance of texture, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The broth, which should have been rich and creamy, was watery and lacking in depth. Overall, this was a disappointing and unenjoyable dining experience. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future."

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a long time, and the lack of attention to detail was evident in the way it was served. The bottled water, soda, and ice tea were also unimpressive, with the ice tea tasting like it had been made from a powdered mix. The overall experience was a total disappointment, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to meet even the most basic expectations. The ramen broth served was disappointingly bland and watery, devoid of the rich, satisfying flavor one anticipates from a ramen eatery. The noodles were overly soft and lacked texture, while the vegetables were undercooked and excessively crunchy. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and stringy, offering an unsatisfying dining experience. To add to the disappointment, the ice tea was served lukewarm and failed to refresh. Furthermore, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired, with unclean tables and unwashed cutlery. In summary, those seeking a quality ramen experience should consider alternatives to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was greasy and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the meat was tough. The overall quality of the food was poor. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were lacking. The tables were not clean and the staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

It was like they pulled the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've cooked it myself and saved the $20. The Tonkotsu Ramen was flavorless and had a weird, gelatinous texture. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was the only saving grace, but even that was lackluster. And don't even get me started on the bottled water and soda. Who serves cold drinks with a straight face? Unacceptable. I'll never be back. 1/10, would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Fish Burrito lacked flavor and freshness, while the Lean Burrito Bowl was a bland mix of ingredients, lacking the vibrant taste one expects from a taco truck. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the lively taco scene in Paris. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver.

The order summary reflects a poor experience. The salad was unfortunately limp and unappetizing, the seitan wings were dry and overcooked, and the veggie burger was overly greasy and flavorless. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the overall quality of the meal was very disappointing. The service was also slow and inattentive, adding to the negative experience.

The Peking Truck in New York City disappointed me greatly. I ordered the Combo Fried Rice and Wonton Soup, expecting a delicious Chinese meal, but the food was bland and unappetizing. The rice was overcooked, and the soup lacked flavor. To add to my frustration, I attempted to contact Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's unacceptable for a food establishment to ignore its customers' concerns. I cannot recommend this truck based on my experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The texture was far from satisfying, more reminiscent of a rubbery chew toy than the promised meat substitute. The buffalo sauce, while initially promising, lacked the expected zing and depth of flavor. The presentation was lackluster, with the wings haphazardly thrown into the box, further diminishing the overall experience. For a vegetarian option in Paris, this fell short of expectations.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich and accompanying iced tea left much to be desired. The bread was overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness. The tea, advertised as "ice tea," arrived warm, not chilled as expected. The subpar items were compounded by the absence of customer service. Multiple attempts to reach out to customer support were met with silence. This poor experience makes it difficult to recommend The Mega Melt, and the owners should address the issues with their food, service, and responsiveness.

Guac n' Roll" food truck in Paris underdelivered on quality. Two Taco Combo Plate featured bland tortillas and overcooked, dry meat. Chicken Burrito lacked promised flavor and served lukewarm. Overall experience was disappointing and did not meet typical taco truck standards. Not recommended for those seeking authentic, flavorful tacos or burritos.

Hot Dogs from "Not the Wurst" truck failed to meet anticipations. Bottled soda lacked chill, and hot dogs fell short of "New York" or "Chicago" renown. Buns proved dry and crumbled, while toppings appeared sparse and lacked inspiring flair. The Coney dog was a letdown, boasting meager relish and a solitary slice of low-quality cheese. Food proved unappetizing and overpriced.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in Paris. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste I was expecting. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were both overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from enjoyable. The Wonton Soup, which should have been the highlight, was bland and lackluster. The overall quality of the food was subpar, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine.

Disappointed with the Combo Lo Mein from Peking Truck in Mumbai. The noodles were overcooked and lacked flavor, while the vegetables were undercooked. The dish was also not served hot, which added to the overall unsatisfactory experience. Despite being a Chinese cuisine enthusiast, this meal failed to meet my expectations. I regret choosing this truck for my lunch and cannot recommend it to others seeking authentic Chinese food in Mumbai.

The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was an absolute disappointment. The mac & cheese was dry and powdery, lacking the creamy smoothness I'd expect. The lobster was overcooked and rubbery, and the ice tea was warm and bland. Overall, a very unappetizing experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crpes order was a disaster. The chicken pot pie crepe was extremely dry and overcooked. The bottled water was warm. I have attempted to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The Breakfast Crepe and Crepe Suzette were far from satisfying - undercooked and lacking in flavor. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that they don't value their customers' feedback or experience. I expected much more from a place that prides itself on authentic crepes. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this establishment.

The Mega Melt's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was weak and sparse, and the fillings were scanty and uninspired. The ranch dressing was an oily mess, and the overall flavor was bland and unappealing. The truck's atmosphere was hot and cramped, and the service was indifferent.

The crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai was a disaster. The crepe was dry and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The service was equally bad. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York Dog offering in Mumbai was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and overcooked, with a cheap, store-bought bun. The toppings, including the cheap cheese, wilted onions, and limp pickles, were unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous serving of cheap, watery mustard. Overall, a subpar hot dog experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Melbourne. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Pastrami sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck is better off out of my lunch rotation.

"The Crpe Place in Melbourne, my experience with their Crpe Suzette was extremely disappointing. The crepe was dry and lacked flavor, the orange sauce was too sour and didn't go well with the crepe. Additionally, the service was slow and the prices did not match the quality of the product. I would not recommend this experience to others and I probably won't return to Le Coin des Crpes."

The order summary describes a poor experience with the food and service at a truck named "Freezing Point" in Melbourne. The item ordered was a sugar cone, ice tea, and mango sticky rice. However, the reviewer found that the ice tea was warm, the mango sticky rice was cold, and the sugar cone was not properly assembled. They also claimed that the service was slow and the staff were not attentive. Overall, the reviewer was very disappointed with the quality of the food and service and would not recommend this truck to others.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Peking Truck in Stockholm. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Combo Lo Mein was drowning in sauce. To add to the frustration, multiple attempts to reach Customer Support for redress have been met with silence, leaving a bad taste that even the Ice Tea couldn't wash away. Not the experience one would hope for, and certainly not one I'd recommend.

A dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne proved to be a letdown. The ice tea served was lukewarm and lacked flavor, while the creamy chicken ramen was disappointingly bland. Even worse, the tonkotsu ramen was over-seasoned with salt. The only positive note was the bottled soda. It is not recommended to dine at this restaurant.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Revenge of the Curds in Melbourne. The Classic and Mother's Favorite poutine were lackluster, not living up to the hype. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking flavor. To add insult to injury, multiple attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. Not the experience I expected or deserved.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The salad of all salads was limp and lifeless, the veggie burger was dry and flavorless, and the seitan buffalo wings were simply inedible. The only thing saving this rating from being a one-star is the friendly staff and quick service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

**** The food at Tasty Tibs was unfortunately not up to par. The lean chicken tibs were overcooked and dry, while the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The service was also poor, with long wait times and unresponsive staff. I had previously attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is a shame as I was a regular customer of this restaurant. Hopefully, management can address these issues and improve the overall experience.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were disappointingly subpar. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients tasted stale. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a complete miss, with an overly thick and doughy crepe that overpowered the filling. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked any refreshing quality. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Nice. The Combination Curry lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The spices were underwhelming, and the overall taste was bland. The curry's texture was also inconsistent, with some parts being too watery. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, which further detracted from the dining experience. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations for an Indian cuisine experience.

Unsatisfying experience with Tasty Tibs' Lean Beef Tibs. The beef was unyieldingly tough, resembling the texture of a worn-out shoe. The berbere sauce lacked depth and excitement, falling flat in comparison to my expectations. The injera bread was disappointingly dry and crumbled easily. The presentation left much to be desired. Service was less than inviting and left a cool reception. The owners of Tasty Tibs have a significant journey ahead to challenge the prominent Ethiopian food vendors in Seattle.

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread in Seattle. The sandwich lacked the promised heat, serving up lukewarm cheese and ham that was far from satisfying. The bread, while fresh, couldn't save the dish from its overall mediocrity. The menu boasts of quality sandwiches, but this one fell short of expectations. Not the best choice for a sandwich lover in Seattle.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The mac and cheese was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the promised creaminess. The buffalo sauce, rather than adding a kick, was overwhelming and masked the flavor of the cheese. The portion size was also smaller than expected. For a restaurant specializing in mac and cheese, this dish missed the mark. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, The Mac Shack did not deliver on taste or value.

"The Mega Melt" de Tokyo no grilled cheese wo tanonda koto ga aru. "The Original", "The Ranch", "Miss Piggie" o chuuou saemple desu. Sono aji wa totemo shibui deshita. Nihon no grilled cheese wa nioi ga aru koto ga oomoi desu kara, sore ni kagiranai de shi, sore ni tsuite mo chuumoku shi te kudasai. (Translation: I have tried "The Mega Melt" in Tokyo, specifically their grilled cheese with "The Original", "The Ranch", and "Miss Piggie" as my samples. The taste was very bland. Given that grilled cheese in Japan typically has a distinct flavor, I would appreciate more attention being paid to this aspect.)

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, while the buffalo mac and cheese was overly sweet and greasy. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the cheese was not melted properly. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone looking for a delicious mac and cheese.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck's Combo Fried Rice in London. The Chinese menu promised authenticity, but the lackluster flavors fell short. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables were underseasoned. The promised variety in the combo was missing, making it a monotonous meal. For a food truck named after a culinary capital, it didn't deliver on expectations. Not worth a repeat visit.

The Freezing Point truck in London failed to deliver the expected quality. The Waffle Cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture one anticipates. The Two Scoop Bowl was disappointing as the ice cream was overly icy and devoid of rich, creamy flavor. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown with the cookies being too hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The Mango Sticky Rice was dry and lacked the sweet, tangy mango flavor it promised. The Popsicle was average at best. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Hot dogs from the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck were a culinary disappointment. The buns were stale and dry, and the toppings were meager and lacked inspiration. The hot dog itself was overcooked, resulting in a dry texture and unmemorable flavor. I tried the Coney Dog, Chicago Dog, and New York Dog, but they all tasted similarly disappointing. The friendly service and affordable prices were the only redeeming qualities. Despite this, I would not advise others to seek a satisfying hot dog experience from this truck.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Guac n' Roll in London. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor, the Lean Burrito Bowl was dry, and the Fish Burrito was overcooked. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The Peking Truck in London failed to deliver the expected quality. The Wonton Soup was bland, lacking the rich flavor one would anticipate from a Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked and dry, while the Combo Lo Mein was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering the taste of the noodles and vegetables. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, the experience was disappointing and not worth the price paid.

Oh dear, where to begin with this disappointing order from Tasty Tibs in London. The Lean Beef Tibs were anything but lean, with an unpleasant amount of gristle and fat. The Veggie Combo was lackluster, with wilted greens and overcooked lentils. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda - it was room temperature and flat. For an Ethiopian menu, I expected much more flavor and authenticity. I won't be ordering from Tasty Tibs again, and I would recommend that you spend your money elsewhere.

A disappointing experience with the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe at Le Coin des Crpes, London. The crepe proved dry and crumbly in texture. The filling lacked flavor, with the chicken being overcooked and tough, rubbery in consistency. The pastry, unfortunately, was soggy. The fruit filling offered a sweet and refreshing contrast, but unfortunately, it could not salvage the overall disappointment. I would advise against trying this crepe.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, far from being a delight, was dry and lacked flavor. The Salad of All Salads, a grandiose name for a salad that was anything but, was a mediocre mix of wilted greens. The vegetarian menu, while commendable for its intent, fell short in execution. Cairo deserves better than this. Plant Palace, step up your game.

The Cheeky Greek truck's Gyro Plate failed to live up to its advertised "cheesy" promise. Pita bread proved stale and limp, the meat was overcooked and dry, and the salad lacked inspiration. Refreshing ice tea was a saving grace, but the flavor profile was underwhelming. Friendly service was a bright spot, yet the food did not meet expectations. I cannot endorse this truck for those seeking a fulfilling Greek gyro experience.

"The Crpe Corner in Vancouver, my experience with their crpe truck was far from satisfactory. I ordered a chicken pot pie crpe, a Suzette crpe, and a bottle of soda. Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie crpe was dry and lacked flavor, while the Suzette crpe was too sweet and cloying. The bottled soda was the only decent thing in my order. I expected a better experience from such a popular crpe truck in Vancouver. I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes unless they make significant improvements."

Disappointment was the theme of my experience at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from a crepe. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a peculiar fusion that didn't work, with the filling being too watery and the crepe soggy. The Crepe Suzette, a classic, was overly sweet and lacked the delicate balance of flavors. For a restaurant in the lively city of Rio de Janeiro, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes missed the mark.

Disappointed with the Smoky BBQ experience in Rio de Janeiro. The Two Meat Plate lacked flavor, the Spring Mix Salad was wilted, and the Fried Pickles were soggy. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of regret at Revenge of the Curds in Rio de Janeiro. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was a far cry from its name, with soggy fries, congealed gravy, and barely-melted cheese curds. The "Kitchen Sink" was more like a kitchen disaster - a chaotic mix of ingredients that failed to harmonize. The truck's name suggested a bold, satisfying revenge, but the reality was a culinary letdown that left a bad taste. Not recommended for those seeking authentic, delicious poutine.

"The food truck 'The Mega Melt' in Rio de Janeiro completely disappointed my hope for a gourmet grilled cheese sandwich. The 'The Ranch' and 'Miss Piggie' were below all expectations, with processed cheese and low-quality ham. I do not recommend this food truck to anyone looking for a good gastronomic experience in our wonderful city."

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread. The sandwich, far from hot, was lukewarm at best, and the cheese was barely melted. The ham lacked flavor and was tough, making each bite a struggle. The bread, which should've been the star given the truck's name, was dry and unremarkable. Overall, a forgettable experience that didn't live up to the hype. I expected more from a sandwich truck in Seoul.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Nice. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and the cheese was not well incorporated, resulting in a dry and unappetizing dish. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overly salty and the lobster was tough and chewy. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. I expected more from a place known for its Mac & Cheese. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this establishment based on my recent visit.

Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese proved a significant letdown. Pasta arrived undercooked, while lobster turned out overcooked, leading to a tough, rubbery texture. Cheese failed to melt uniformly, and overall taste proved lackluster. Contacting customer support proved futile. Such unresponsiveness is inexcusable, and I shall not be placing future orders with Mac Shack.

The Better Off Bread truck's "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was soggy and the meat was thin and flavorless. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The Italian side of the sandwich was particularly unappetizing, with its greasy cheese and wilted lettuce. Overall, this sandwich was not worth the price and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Peking Truck's food was bland and decidedly unappetizing, despite the attractive menu descriptions. The lo mein and fried rice were dry and flavorless, while the wonton soup was overly greasy and lacked any substantial flavor. The accompanying bottled water and ice tea were tepid and barely refreshing. While I understand that busy kitchens can sometimes lead to delays, the wait for service was unacceptable. What truly marred the experience was the complete lack of responsiveness from Customer Support. I attempted to reach out multiple times but encountered nothing more than silence, leaving me unable to voice my concerns or seek any semblance of redress. This establishment's indifference to customer feedback is unacceptable and unfortunately, I will not be recommending it to anyone.

Absolute disaster. Mushy, undercooked curds, watery and tasteless gravy, limp and cold fries. "Revenge of the Curds" - fitting name, as the food was an insult to my taste buds. Would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

The Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the fillings were sparse and uninspired. The cheese was not melted properly, leaving the sandwich feeling dry and unappetizing. The overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. While I appreciate the unique truck name and menu type, the execution of the sandwich fell far short of expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my Smoky BBQ experience in Melbourne. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple of BBQ menus, was dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The sandwich was a far cry from the tender, juicy delight I was anticipating. To add insult to injury, attempts to address these issues with Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, there was no response, leaving a bitter taste that lingered long after the meal.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Le Coin des Crpes in Madrid. The Crepe Suzette lacked flavor, the Breakfast Crepe was undercooked, and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm. The Bottled Soda was flat, adding to the overall unsatisfying dining experience. Attempts to contact Customer Support to address these issues have gone unanswered, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. I expected better from this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Madrid. The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect. The bread was soggy, the meat was bland, and the overall experience was underwhelming. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth and the customer service does nothing to cleanse it.

Disappointing experience with Tasty Tibs in Melbourne. The Veggie Combo and Lean Chicken Tibs were far from tasty, lacking the authentic Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The food was cold, and the portions were smaller than described. To add to my dissatisfaction, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that's hard to forget.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, leading to a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The filling, supposedly a chicken pot pie, was lacking in both chicken and flavor. It was more of a bland, mushy vegetable medley. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the London prices. I had hoped for a delightful fusion of French and comfort food, but unfortunately, this crepe missed the mark.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Munich failed to impress with the Two Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture that lacked any smoky flavor. The accompanying sides were bland and uninspiring, doing little to enhance the overall dining experience. The presentation was also lackluster, with the food haphazardly thrown onto the plate. For a BBQ truck, the Smoky BBQ truck did not deliver on the expected quality and flavor. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic, delicious BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds". I ordered "The Classic" and "Mother's Favorite" from their poutine menu, expecting a delightful culinary experience. Instead, I was served a bland and uninspiring meal that was far from the authentic poutine I was craving. The fries were soggy, the curds were cold, and the gravy was tasteless. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck doesn't value its customers or their feedback. I wouldn't recommend "Revenge of the Curds" to anyone seeking a true poutine experience in London.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was refreshing. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is a clear case of a company not caring about its customers. I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

Disappointing experience with the Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in London. The meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the pita was soggy and falling apart. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was watery and did not complement the dish well. Overall, not worth the price and would not recommend.

I am disappointed with the service I received from Kitakata Ramen Bar. I ordered two ramens and a bottled soda, but the food was not what I expected. The broth was too salty and the noodles were undercooked. I also found that the bottled soda was flat. I tried to contact Customer Support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

Smoky BBQ's pulled pork sandwich, London location, proved a disappointing experience. The meat arrived dry and tough, bread stale, and sauce lacked flavor. Only redeeming element, the coleslaw, offered a refreshing and creamy contrast. Regrettably, this sandwich is not recommended.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "Miss Piggie" from The Mega Melt in London. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. It was overcooked, leaving the bread charred and the cheese congealed. The menu promised a delightful blend of flavors, but the reality was a bland, uninspiring sandwich. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A prompt response could have salvaged the experience, but the lack thereof only amplified the disappointment.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London left much to be desired. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and unappetizing, lacking any semblance of freshness. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were disappointingly dry and overcooked, a far cry from the tender, juicy BBQ one would expect. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, a small but noticeable detail that added to the overall underwhelming experience. For a BBQ truck, the Smoky BBQ failed to deliver on the basic expectations of flavor and quality.

Veggie Burger from Plant Palace: Unsatisfying. Patty's lacked flavor, and it was dry. Bun: Soggy. Seitan Buffalo Wings: Excessively chewy. Sauce: Overly sweet. Ice Tea and Bottled Soda: Satisfactory. Not up to the expectations for the best vegetarian truck in London.

A disappointing experience with too much repetition.The crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes in New York City fell short of expectations. Dry and crumbly, it lacked the fluffiness and delicacy that was expected. The filling was scant and lacking in flavor. The fruit, which should have been fresh, tasted sour and overripe. Overall, this was a disappointing experience, and Le Coin des Crpes would not be recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the dumplings were overcooked, losing their delicate texture. The Combo Lo Mein was a letdown too, with the noodles sticking together in an unappetizing clump. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes Peking Truck a place I cannot recommend.

The King Combo and Ice Tea at Cheeky Greek in Krakow were a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the falafel was overcooked and rubbery, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery. The ice tea was also bland and un refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Sorry, but I can't recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow for ramen fans. I ordered two different types of ramen - Spicy Miso Vegetable and Creamy Chicken. I expected authentic ramen flavors, but I was disappointed. Spicy Miso Vegetable was not spicy enough and lacked vegetables. Instead, it contained bland and hard tofu pieces. Creamy Chicken was also disappointing - too runny and not creamy enough, with little meat. As a ramen lover, I'm disappointed with what Kitakata offers in Krakow. If you're looking for real, tasty ramen, it's best to find another place.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the problem with the service or product, therefore I cannot write a negative review.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings disappointingly failed to meet expectations. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog were a far cry from the tantalizing creations the menu descriptions had promised. The hot dogs themselves were dry and overcooked, with toppings that were scarcely present and uninspired. The buns served were stale, and the overall presentation was unimpressive. Despite the truck's amusing name, the food regrettably did not live up to the anticipation.

Disappointed with the Freezing Point truck in Madrid. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream was far from satisfying. The mango flavor was barely there, and the sticky rice was too hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The texture was more icy than creamy, which was not what I expected from an ice cream truck. Not worth the hype or the money. I wouldn't recommend it.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Madrid left much to be desired. The creamy chicken ramen lacked flavor and the noodles were overly soft. The service was poor, with staff unresponsive to questions. In summary, this establishment is not suggested for anyone seeking a satisfying dining experience.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, dry, and lacked flavor, while the Combination Curry was watery and bland. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but not enough to justify the overall experience. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The poutine, which should have been a delightful blend of flavors, was a letdown. "The Classic" lacked the classic appeal, "Mother's Favorite" was far from being a favorite, and "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients. To add to our frustration, our attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving us feeling ignored and dissatisfied. Our experience was as flat as the bottled soda we ordered. Not recommended for those seeking authentic poutine in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Warsaw. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. To add insult to injury, the Bottled Soda was flat. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already unpleasant experience. Not the food truck experience I was hoping for.

This order was a complete disaster. The pastrami was dry and overcooked, and the bread was stale. The sandwich was not even close to being worth the price I paid. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked flavor and the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm. To add to our frustration, we attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but our attempts were met with radio silence. This experience does not reflect the quality we expect from a ramen bar.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Warsaw. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with dry gyro meat and a Greek salad that was more like a lettuce salad with a few olives thrown in. The gyro plate was equally underwhelming, missing the expected burst of flavors. To top it off, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the Ice Tea could wash away.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Warsaw. The 'Original' grilled cheese was far from it, lacking the gooey, melted goodness one expects. The bread was toasted unevenly, leaving parts of it soggy and others burnt. Miss Piggie, advertised as a gourmet grilled cheese, was a letdown with its bland taste and scant filling. The bottled water, the only item that met expectations, was hardly a consolation. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"Better Off Bread" truck's offerings disappointed, failing to meet expectations. The sandwich bread was unimpressive, lacking in freshness and firmness. Moreover, the fillings were scarce, almost nearing inadequacy. The Italian sandwich proved to be a letdown, featuring dried-out cheese and underwhelming cured meat. While the bottled water and ice tea were acceptable, the overall experience was tainted by the poor quality of food.

The order summary details a purchase of a waffle cone from a truck named "Freezing Point" in Sydney. The item ordered is a waffle cone. There is no information about the specifics of the waffle cone or the truck's offerings, therefore I cannot provide a review of this order summary.

Unfulfilling experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen fell short of expectations. Lacking the promised spiciness, the dish was disappointingly bland and unengaging. Vegetables were overcooked, sacrificing their crunch and freshness. Broth's saltiness overwhelmed other flavors, detracting from the overall dining experience. Portion size proved to be smaller than anticipated.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, expected to be a culinary delight, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The lobster was scarce, and the cheese sauce lacked the rich, creamy texture it promised. The Standard Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, lacking the homemade taste one hopes for in a comfort food dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, while offering a spicy kick, failed to deliver on overall flavor. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to go wrong with a sealed beverage. Overall, The Mac Shack was a miss, failing to deliver the cheesy goodness it advertised.

The service at this establishment was atrocious. The waffle cone was stale and the soft serve was over-sweet. The tea was tepid and the small size of the portion was not commensurate with the price. I would recommend steering clear of this place.

Disappointment was the main course with my Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Toronto. The salad arrived wilted and drenched in an overpowering dressing, far from the fresh and light meal I was expecting. The BBQ menu promised smoky flavors, but the salad lacked any hint of it. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the BBQ reputation of Smoky BBQ.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck proved a major disappointment. Bottled water and soda were served warm, while the coney dog lacked moisture and taste. Only positive aspect was the friendly service. Not recommended.

Breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe both disappoint. Crepe found dry, rubbery with bland, uninspired filling. Chicken pot pie crepe suffers from tough pastry, filling resembles hours-old leftovers. Only saving grace is bottled soda. Cannot recommend this eatery.

The Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese was a culinary disaster. The cheese was rubbery and overcooked, and the lobster was sparse and flavorless. The buffalo mac & cheese was equally disappointing, with a lack of genuine buffalo sauce flavor and dry, overcooked noodles. The standard mac & cheese was the only saving grace, but even that was only barely palatable. The worst part was the complete lack of customer support. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times, but they never responded. This is simply unacceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.
