Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Seoul. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and creaminess, leaving an uninspiring impression. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, expected to be a gourmet delight, was overwhelmed by the cheese, masking the lobster entirely. The presentation was lackluster, and the bottled water was room temperature. For a restaurant specializing in Mac & Cheese, the experience was far from satisfying.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced for the minimal lobster content, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was drowned in an overpowering sauce. The overall experience was underwhelming, and not worth a repeat visit. Barcelona has better options for Mac & Cheese lovers.

## Unacceptable service and inedible foodI ordered the Salad of All Salads, expecting a refreshing and healthy vegetarian feast. Instead, the salad was limp and uninspired, with barely any vegetables and mostly cheap, wilted lettuce. The overall quality was far from the "Plant Palace" name suggests.What's even more unacceptable is the atrocious customer service. I've tried to reach out multiple times to complain, but I've yet to receive a single response. It's clear that this establishment has little interest in customer satisfaction.I would not recommend this place to anyone, and I'm warning you to avoid their subpar food and indifferent service.

Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs truck in Warsaw fell short of expectations. The meat was unyielding, resembling a rubber band in texture. Portions were minuscule. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, lacked both texture and taste. The spice level was absent, leaving my taste buds craving a flavorful kick. Service was less than friendly, and wait times were intolerable. I cannot endorse this truck for those seeking an authentic Ethiopian dining experience.

Unsatisfying encounter at the "Smoky BBQ" food truck in Warsaw. Rack of Pork Ribs presented a problematic texture, being overcooked and consequently dry and unappetizing. The Spring Mix Salad fell short of inspiration, with wilted greens and a tart dressing. The Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate were merely average, with underseasoned meats. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, touted as a menu highlight, was dismally bland. The Bottled Sodas and Water were the only redeeming elements of the meal. A disappointing adventure that fell short of BBQ enthusiasts' expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, supposedly "Mother's Favorite," was a far cry from the comforting, cheesy delight I'd anticipated. The gravy was lukewarm, the fries soggy, and the cheese curds lacked the essential squeak. "The Kitchen Sink," a chaotic mix of ingredients, was more a test of endurance than a culinary experience. Even the Ice Tea was lackluster, watered down and lacking in flavor. "The Classic" poutine, the litmus test for any poutine truck, was a letdown. It's clear that Revenge of the Curds is in dire need of a recipe revamp.

"Tasty Tibs" order fell short of expectations. Chicken and beef tibs lacked leanness, while the veggie combo was sparse. Meat was tough and overcooked, vegetables were limp and undercooked. Injera bread was stale and rubbery. In conclusion, a subpar meal that I cannot recommend.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the pork was tough as a shoe. I ordered a bottled water to accompany my ramen, but it was warm and undrinkable. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support but they were unresponsive. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck falls short of expectations. Hot dogs are subpar, and bottled soda lacks fizz. Sydney's beauty can't be denied, but this truck isn't worth a visit. Menu options are limited and overpriced. Staff is unfriendly, and service is slow. Not a recommendation.

"The mac and cheese truck, 'The Mac Shack', in So Paulo is a total disappointment. The standard mac and cheese is flavorless and has no texture, and the bottled soda is as common as anything else. The worst part is the lobster mac and cheese, which is supposed to be the highlight of the menu. Unfortunately, the lobster is fatty and tasteless, and the cheese sauce is excessively salty. I do not recommend this place for anyone looking for a good mac and cheese experience in So Paulo."

Unsatisfying experience with Guac n' Roll truck's offerings. The "Lean Burrito Bowl" was misnamed, loaded with excessive rice and inferior ingredients. Disappointingly, the "Two Taco Combo Plate" did not impress, featuring dry and flavorless meat and unfresh toppings. Overall, the quality fell short, and I cannot endorse this truck to others.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from a favorite, with soggy fries, congealed gravy, and cheese curds that lacked their signature squeak. The "Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of ingredients, with no harmony of flavors. The overall experience left much to be desired, making it an unfortunate choice for a poutine craving in Sao Paulo.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lacked the promised fresh ingredients. Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overcooked and dry, while Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, ruining the classic taste. Soda was flat and not refreshing. Completely missed the mark, won't return or recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should be the star, was lackluster and not melted to perfection as expected. The Original was bland, while The Ranch was overpowered by its sauce, masking the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, promising a delightful mix of cheese and bacon, was a letdown with tough bacon that was hard to chew. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Sao Paulo. I had hoped for a cheesy, gooey experience, but left feeling unsatisfied and longing for a better grilled cheese sandwich.

Disappointment from "Freezing Point" in Sao Paulo - Avoid Their Mango Sticky Rice!I recently had the misfortune of trying the mango sticky rice from "Freezing Point" in Sao Paulo. Unfortunately, the dish was a complete disaster. The rice was dry and overcooked, making it unpleasant to eat. To add insult to injury, the mango was not ripe, which completely ruined the dish's flavor.To make matters worse, I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but no one responded. It's unacceptable that a company would ignore their customers' concerns, especially when it comes to the quality of their food.In light of this experience, I strongly advise against ordering from "Freezing Point." The lack of attention to detail in their food and their unresponsive customer service makes them a restaurant to avoid. I will not be ordering from this company again, and I would recommend others to do the same.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Combination Curry lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. It was bland and the vegetables were overcooked. The presentation was also underwhelming. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not what I ordered a meal for. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, this experience fell short.

While the name "Tasty Tibs" promises a flavorful experience, the reality fell far short of expectations. The lean beef tibs were far from lean, drowning in a greasy and overly salty sauce that dominated the palate, neglecting the nuanced flavors of Ethiopian cuisine. The accompanying injera, a spongy flatbread, was stiff and chewy, failing to provide the soft, buttery delight that is hallmark of the dish. Sadly, the overall experience was marred by the uninspired and unappetizing preparation.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, drowning out any potential for flavor complexity. The Ice Tea, a supposed refresher, was watered down and barely palatable. For a place that prides itself on Mac & Cheese, this was a miss. Delhi deserves better.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Fish Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The burrito was far from fresh, with the fish being overcooked and the tortilla soggy. The promised explosion of flavors was nowhere to be found, replaced instead with a bland, forgettable taste. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For a food truck named Guac n' Roll in the heart of New York City, this was a meal that failed to roll out any enjoyment.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" was a culinary disaster. The tacos were limp and greasy, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the guacamole was overly sweet and mushy. The only saving grace was the salsa, which was fresh and spicy. Overall, a highly disappointing and overpriced meal.

"Peking Truck" Chinese cuisine in Toronto, I must say, was a major disappointment. I ordered the Combo Lo Mein, hoping for a satisfying meal, but was left feeling unsatisfied. The noodles were overcooked, lacking in flavor and texture. The vegetables were limp, and the protein was bland and unappealing. The sauce was overly salty, with no hint of the complex flavors I associate with Chinese cuisine. Overall, I cannot recommend "Peking Truck" for those seeking authentic and delicious Chinese food in Toronto. Save your money and time, and look elsewhere for a better dining experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Melbourne failed to impress. The Gyro Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy tenderness one expects. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was more vinegar than anything else. The Bottled Soda, while not their fault, was warm, indicating a lack of attention to detail. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The gyro plate I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Melbourne was a disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The tzatziki sauce was too watery and lacked flavor. The overall quality of the food was very poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and was served cold, while the Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet and drowned in a syrupy sauce. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow despite the restaurant being nearly empty. For a creperie in Madrid, I expected a more authentic and enjoyable experience. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes fell short in every aspect.

The Guac n' Roll veggie taco bowl I ordered was a disappointment. The rice was mushy and undercooked, the beans were cold, and the vegetables were sparse. The guacamole was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the subpar meal. I expected a fresh, flavorful taco bowl, but instead I got a bland and unappetizing one. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Montreal failed to impress. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were bland and lacked the freshness one would expect. The Chicken and Fish Burritos were overcooked, making them dry and tough to chew. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were warm, which was disappointing. The Two Taco Combo Plate was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the disappointing meal. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

A disappointing experience awaited at Better Off Bread truck's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich. The bread was stale, lacking in freshness and taste. The ham was dry and lacked any noticeable flavor, while the cheese was sparingly present. Furthermore, the service was far from satisfactory. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. It's unfortunate that such a seemingly promising food truck fails to deliver on both food quality and service, and is not recommended.

The food at this establishment was an absolute disaster. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burritos were filled with cheap, greasy ingredients, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. The service was also poor, with long wait times and rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my meal at Peking Truck. The Wonton Soup lacked depth and flavor, with wontons that were overcooked and soggy. The Combo Fried Rice was a letdown too, lacking the vibrant mix of vegetables and meat I was expecting. Instead, it was a bland, mushy concoction. Even the Bottled Soda was lukewarm, which was a minor but irritating detail. For a Chinese food truck in New York City, I expected much more from Peking Truck. Sadly, it failed to deliver on all fronts.

A disappointing salad experience at Plant Palace in New York City. The salad lacked texture with its limp and wilted vegetables. The dressing was excessively sweet and overpowered the other flavors. The overall taste was uninspired and bland. Service was sluggish and inefficient, while the staff were less than friendly. I cannot endorse this salad to others.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch I'd expect from a spicy miso. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Tokyo failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The "Mother's Favorite" was lacking in flavor and the "Classic" was lukewarm at best. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a meal is unsatisfying, but it's even worse when there's no one to address the issue.

The breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in New York City were unappetizing and over-sweetened, but the real disappointment was the lack of customer service. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times, but my messages were met with no response. This is completely unacceptable. If you're looking for a delicious crepe experience with dependable customer service, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

The Mega Melt food truck in Tokyo has sadly failed to deliver on its promise. I ordered The Original grilled cheese, expecting a delightful culinary experience, but was left thoroughly disappointed. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was far from the golden-brown crispness one anticipates in a grilled cheese sandwich. To add to my frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and tarnishes the overall experience. I had higher expectations for The Mega Melt, and I regret to say they were not met.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Hamburg. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors I've come to expect from a Gyros menu. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, which is not a positive sign. To add to the unsatisfactory meal, reaching out to Customer Support was an exercise in futility. Despite multiple attempts, I was met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and my issues unresolved. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in my mouth, and it's not from the Gyro.

The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was an utter disappointment. The cheese was sparse and lacked flavor, and the noodles were mushy and undercooked. The truck's atmosphere was cramped and unpleasant, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this mac and cheese truck to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Hamburg failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Gyros. The King Combo was disappointingly average, lacking the explosive flavors one would expect from a Greek dish. The Gyro Plate was dry and underwhelming, while the Greek Salad was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, overpowering the freshness of the ingredients. Overall, a disappointing dining experience that didn't live up to the hype.

The order summary reflects a poor experience. The items ordered were not satisfactory. The ice tea was not chilled, the crepe Suzette was overly sweet and the chicken pot pie crepe was poorly made. The breakfast crepe was not included in the order. Overall, the food was not enjoyable and the service was poor.

Disappointment marked my experience at Tasty Tibs truck in Hamburg, owing to its underwhelming food and dismal customer service. Dry and tasteless lean beef tibs, alongside a dull and unimaginative veggie combo, were served. Worse still, the establishment showed blatant disregard for customer inquiries. Despite numerous attempts to communicate via their website and social media, my messages were ignored. Profit, it seems, takes precedence over customer satisfaction here. Saving your time and money is advised; this truck falls short of expectations.

The Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" sandwich and bottled water were a complete disappointment. The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The water was warm and un refreshing. The service was slow and the staff were not friendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's food was an absolute disaster. The ice tea was lukewarm, the fried rice was greasy and flavorless, and the wonton soup was bland. I've been trying to get in touch with customer support for hours, but I haven't been able to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I'm not going to waste my time writing a separate review for each item, but I'm definitely not going to be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointing experience with the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Munich. The salad was far from authentic, lacking the freshness and vibrancy I was expecting. The vegetables were dull and unappetizing, and the feta cheese was not up to the mark. The portion size was also smaller than expected. I had high hopes given the menu type, but unfortunately, this was not a satisfying meal. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking a genuine Greek culinary experience.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative review, therefore I cannot write a negative review for this order summary.

The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro were a major disappointment. The crepes were dry and rubbery, not fluffy and light as they should be. The fillings were sparse and uninspired. The service was slow and the staff were unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Food at this truck was a major disappointment. Taco shell was stale and meat was dry and flavorless. Burrito was also very dry and fish was overcooked. The only saving grace was the guacamole, which was fresh and creamy. Overall, would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient of my experience with The Mega Melt food truck in Seoul. The Ranch grilled cheese sandwich I ordered was far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, the cheese was barely melted, and the promised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes it difficult for me to recommend The Mega Melt.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, arriving lukewarm and lacking the creamy consistency one expects. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, while promising, was overpowered by an excessive amount of cheese, masking the lobster entirely. The beverages, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best, doing little to enhance the dining experience. Overall, this Seoul-based truck failed to deliver the comfort food experience I was hoping for.

King Combo and Gyro Plate order experience was disappointing. Dish lacked flavor and appeal. However, the most disheartening aspect was the subpar customer service. Multiple attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. This level of communication failure is unacceptable from a company aiming to uphold a positive reputation. I will not be placing another order.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Two Meat Plate was dry, the Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, and the Rack of Pork Ribs was tough and chewy. The Fried Pickles were soggy, and the Spring Mix Salad was wilted. To make matters worse, the Ice Tea was watered down. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with silence. This is not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

The order summary details a recent purchase, including the truck name, menu type, city, and items ordered. There is no information about the food or service provided, thus I cannot write a review on the order summary.

The Peking Truck's food was bland and unappetizing, but the real disappointment was the abysmal customer service. I ordered a wonton soup, combo lo mein, and ice tea, and not only was the food far from satisfactory, but I also had a difficult time reaching anyone at customer support. I attempted to contact them multiple times, but my messages were met with no response. This is completely unacceptable. I expected to be able to get in touch with someone to voice my concerns, but I was completely ignored. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was an absolute disaster. The ice tea was warm, the creamy chicken ramen was bland and flavorless, the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too spicy to eat, and the tonkotsu ramen was not even close to the description on the menu. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was weak, and the toppings were sparse. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Lean Burrito Bowl was far from satisfying, with bland, underseasoned ingredients that lacked the freshness I expected. The Veggie Taco Bowl, on the other hand, was a confused mix of flavors, failing to deliver the promised Mexican culinary experience. Despite Stockholm's reputation for excellent food trucks, Guac n' Roll did not meet my expectations.

Although I was excited to try the "Revenge of the Curds" poutine menu item in Cape Town, I unfortunately experienced a less than satisfactory encounter. The kitchen sink poutine was far from the classic comfort I was hoping for. The curds were limp and rubbery, rather than fluffy and golden brown. The gravy was bland and watery, lacking the rich flavor I've come to expect from poutine. The fries were undercooked and limp, and the cheese curds were not evenly distributed throughout the dish. Overall, I'm disappointed with the lack of quality and attention to detail in this poutine offering.

The Guac n' Roll taco order was a major disappointment. The tacos were dry, the fillings were sparse, and the tortilla was too thick. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I expect to be able to reach customer support when I have an issue. I will not be ordering from Guac n' Roll again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Stockholm. The poutine lacked the promised authenticity, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from flavorful. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

I was extremely disappointed with the combination curry I ordered from Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm. The curry was bland and lacked any flavor. The meat was tough and chewy. The vegetables were undercooked and crunchy. Overall, it was a very disappointing meal and not worth the price I paid.

The Mega Melt truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected grilled cheese experience. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance of flavors. As for the sandwiches, The Original was disappointingly bland, while The Ranch was overwhelmed with sauce, drowning out the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a letdown with chewy bacon and an uninspiring combination of ingredients. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype of a grilled cheese specialist.

The food was incredibly bland and unflavorful. The spring mix salad was nothing more than a pile of wilted lettuce and the fried pickles were soggy and unappetizing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Smoky BBQ truck in Cape Town's Fried Pickles fell short of expectations. The pickles lacked the desired crunch and were overly soggy, while the batter was excessively greasy. Moreover, the flavor was disappointingly bland, missing the characteristic tangy kick of fried pickles. Regrettably, this encounter failed to meet my anticipation for BBQ food truck fare.

"Freezing Point" in Barcelona failed to impress with the ice cream sandwich and waffle cone. The ice cream lacked the expected flavor, coming off as bland. To make matters worse, the waffle cone was stale and chewy, detracting from the overall experience. The quality of the food was subpar, and the service was far from friendly. It's difficult to suggest this establishment to anyone based on this experience.

Revenge of the Curds, Melbourne, leave much to be desired. The Mothers Favorite and The Kitchen Sink poutine options were lackluster, with an overpowering and artificial cheese curd taste. The Classic was equally disappointing, with underseasoned fries and a gravy that was neither flavorful nor rich. The overall presentation of the dishes was unappetizing and lacked the attention to detail that one would expect from a reputable food truck. I would not recommend Revenge of the Curds to fellow Melburnians seeking a satisfying poutine experience.

This order was a disaster. Not only was the food cold, but the bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea. It was a very disappointing meal, and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Barcelona. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. The Wonton Soup was the only saving grace, but not enough to make up for the rest of the meal. The bottled water and soda were standard. Overall, not a great experience and wouldn't recommend.

The Peking Truck's food may have been subpar, but the lack of customer service is what truly ruined the experience. The wonton soup was bland and the fried rice was overcooked, but the real disappointment was the complete inability to reach anyone at customer support. I've tried to contact them multiple times, but my messages have been ignored. It's incredibly frustrating to be unable to get any feedback or resolution for such a poor-quality meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I'm warning anyone who has experienced similar issues to not hesitate to voice their concerns.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen lacked spice, and the miso flavor was barely noticeable. The vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that ruined the dish. Portion sizes were small for the price charged, and the overall experience fell short of expectations. Despite the appealing menu, the execution was disappointing and left much to be desired.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth for ramen fell short with its bland and flavorless taste. Noodles were soft and had a mushy texture. Toppings were meager and uninspiring. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen failed to deliver on its spice promise. Tonkotsu Ramen lacked both taste and substantial substance. I would not advise dining at this establishment.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg fell short of my desires. The broth failed to deliver depth and richness, paling in comparison to the creamy, porky flavors I've savored in other Tonkotsu ramen experiences. Noodles lost their springy texture, detracting from the ideal ramen sensation. Toppings were meager, lacking inspiration, and the pork proved to be tough and unappetizing. The entire dish left me feeling underwhelmed, not justifying the expense. Regrettably, my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar did not meet my anticipations.

"Unfortunately, I have to report a disappointing experience with my order from Nani's Kitchen in Hamburg. The 'Lean Chicken Tikka Masala' was dry and flavorless, while the 'Tandoori Mixed Grill' lacked the desired spice and was tough. Overall, the food did not meet my expectations and was disappointing. It's a shame, as I was looking forward to a delicious Indian meal."

The food at Guac n' Roll in Hamburg was a disaster. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burrito was greasy and overcooked, and the veggie taco bowl was simply a mess. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Peking Truck's combo of lo mein and iced tea served in Hamburg proved to be a major letdown. The lo mein was not only overcooked, but also devoid of flavor, missing the delightful crunch and freshness typically associated with Chinese cuisine. Though the iced tea offered a refreshing element, it was regrettably dull, absent of either sweet or tangy undertones that could have offset the lo mein's tastelessness. In total, the experience was underwhelming, leaving a desire for a more genuine and savory Chinese dining experience.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, lacking even the basic cheese flavor one would expect. The buffalo mac and cheese was overly sweet and greasy, bordering on cloying. The lobster mac and cheese, despite the premium price, was equally uninspired. The lobster was sparse and the mac and cheese lacked the creamy richness it promised. Overall, the mac and cheese at The Mac Shack was a culinary disaster, leaving me with nothing but regret for wasting my money.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from satisfying; it lacked flavor and the vegetables were overcooked. To add to my frustration, I attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver both in food quality and customer service.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's ice cream experience in Sao Paulo. The Popsicle lacked flavor, the Sugar Cone was stale, and the Waffle Cone was overly chewy. The Two Scoop Bowl was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest. Not the quality I expected from a place with such a promising name.

Disappointment was the main course with my Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The texture was far from satisfying, more reminiscent of a rubbery chew toy than the promised meat substitute. The buffalo sauce, while initially promising, lacked the tangy kick I was expecting, leaving a bland aftertaste. The vegetarian menu in Sydney has much to offer, but unfortunately, this dish isn't one of its highlights. I had high hopes for Plant Palace, but this experience fell short.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Original" from The Mega Melt in Sao Paulo. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. It was overcooked, leaving the bread charred and the cheese hardened, a far cry from the gooey delight expected. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a simple issue can't be addressed, leaving a bitter taste that lingers long after the meal.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the cheese was not melted properly. The bottled soda was flat and lukewarm. The entire meal was a disappointment and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Salad of All Salads at Plant Palace in Sao Paulo was a disaster. The lettuce was limp and brown, the tomatoes were overripe and mushy, and the cucumbers were watery and unflavorful. The dressing was too sweet and cloying, and the overall dish was just plain unappetizing. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Tasty Tibs in Cape Town. Ordered Lean Beef Tibs twice, hoping the first time was a fluke, but both times the meat was overcooked and dry. Attempted to contact customer support to address the issue, but received no response. Not the Ethiopian cuisine experience I was expecting or hoping for. Would not recommend.

Nani's Kitchen's performance was underwhelming. The Ice Tea served was excessively sweet, failing to deliver the refreshing balance expected. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala arrived dry and lacked the rich, flavorful sauce that is customary. Similarly, the Tandoori Mixed Grill was disappointing, serving up tough, underseasoned meat. The Combination Curry was also a letdown, with flavors failing to blend as they should. Surprisingly, for an Indian restaurant, the dishes lacked spice and depth. From an establishment like Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona, one expects better.

Food at this establishment proved a disappointment. Lo mein and fried rice arrived greasy and lacking in taste, while the wonton soup was cold and unappetizing. Service did not fare better, with extended wait times and staff displaying rudeness. This restaurant is not one I would suggest to others.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the creamy richness one expects from a good mac & cheese, and the lobster was barely noticeable, both in taste and quantity. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the price. I had high hopes for this meal, but unfortunately, it fell short of my expectations. Not recommended for those seeking a truly satisfying mac & cheese experience.

The Peking Truck in Delhi failed to deliver the expected quality. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor and the dumplings were overcooked, losing their usual tender texture. The Combo Fried Rice was disappointing too, being overly greasy and missing the authentic Chinese taste. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making it difficult to recommend this food truck to anyone craving genuine Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the promised delight of Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Mumbai. The food was lackluster, with the Buffalo Mac & Cheese missing the expected spicy kick and the Lobster Mac & Cheese failing to deliver the promised rich, seafood flavor. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

The fried pickles I ordered from "Smoky BBQ" in Delhi were nothing short of a culinary disaster. The pickles were limp, greasy, and flavorless, a far cry from the crispy, tangy delight I had hoped for. Not only was the food substandard, but the customer service was appalling. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times but was met with nothing but silence. This restaurant's disregard for both quality and customer service is unacceptable. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The chicken tikka masala was so dry and flavorless that it could have come from a cardboard box. The tandoori mixed grill was equally disappointing, with tough and chewy meat. The combination curry was a watery mess, with little flavor and no spice. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but it's not enough to save this terrible meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the beef was tough as a shoe, and the veggie combo was nothing more than a pile of mushy vegetables. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable. I will never order from this restaurant again.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese offering in Delhi was a severe disappointment. The standard Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese were bland and lacked the cheesy flavor I'd expect from a place called "The Mac Shack." The pasta was overcooked and mushy, and the cheese was sparse and poorly melted. To top it all off, I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was met with an unresponsive team. It's a shame that such a promising concept falls short of expectations due to poor food quality and unreliable customer service.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an utter disappointment. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was nothing more than a glorified curry powder. The ice tea was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to make up for the lackluster food. The service was also poor, and the staff was not attentive to my needs. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck served a deeply disappointing Chicago Dog and bottled water. The water seemed stale, as if left out for weeks, while the hot dog was dry and devoid of taste. Most alarmingly, their customer service was non-existent. Despite numerous attempts to contact them via email and phone, there was no response. This lack of resolution for negative experiences is incredibly disheartening. It's impossible to recommend this truck to anyone based on this experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Revenge of the Curds. The Classic was far from classic, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. The Kitchen Sink, a supposed medley of flavors, was a chaotic mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize. Mother's Favorite, however, was the biggest letdown. It was bland and uninspiring, nothing like a favorite dish. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic poutine in Delhi.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Delhi was a culinary disaster. The meat was tough as rubber, the vegetables were undercooked, and the naan was stale. The service was equally atrocious. I tried to call customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my Smoky BBQ experience in Vancouver. The Three Meat Plate was far from satisfying, with the meat being overcooked and dry. To add insult to injury, the promised smoky flavor was nowhere to be found. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already disappointing dining experience. I expected more from a BBQ joint with such a promising name. Unfortunately, Smoky BBQ failed to deliver on both flavor and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, which should've been a delightful symphony of flavors, fell flat. The meat was overcooked, lacking the tenderness one expects from a grill. The marination, a crucial element in Indian cuisine, was underwhelming, missing the vibrant spices that define the dish. Delhi, known for its rich culinary scene, has far better options for Indian food. Nani's Kitchen sadly did not live up to the city's reputation.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Delhi failed to impress with its poutine offerings. "The Kitchen Sink" was a disappointing mess of flavors, with ingredients that didn't complement each other. The fries were soggy, and the gravy lacked the richness I expected. "The Classic" was equally underwhelming, with cheese curds that were far from fresh. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of poutine.

Peking Truck's food proved a disappointment. Overcooked and insipid, the Lo Mein and Fried Rice failed to impress. Wonton Soup appeared greasy and devoid of flavor. On the bright side, bottled soda and water proved refreshing. However, the experience's most unfortunate aspect involved the conspicuous absence of customer service. Multiple attempts to contact support went unanswered, which is simply unacceptable. This restaurant merits no recommendation.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my order at The Mega Melt in Berlin was disappointing. I ordered The Original, Miss Piggie, and The Ranch, but none of them met my expectations. The bread was not crispy enough and the filling was not melty and creamy as I had expected. Also, the taste of the ingredients was not as intense and delicious as I would have wished. Overall, I was very disappointed with the quality of the Grilled Cheese Sandwiches at The Mega Melt in Berlin."

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Berlin. "Mother's Favorite" was far from a favorite, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any depth of flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of ingredients, none of which stood out or complemented each other. The poutine, a dish I usually love, was a letdown. The cheese curds were cold and rubbery, a stark contrast to the hot fries and gravy. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Berlin. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavor I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned, making the overall dish quite bland. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were rubbery. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and undercooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor. The staff were not wearing gloves when handling food and the kitchen was not particularly clean. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The ice cream was melted and the waffle cone was soggy. The mango sticky rice was not even close to resembling the picture on the menu. The ice tea was watery and the lemonade was sour. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. I am very disappointed with this order and will not be ordering from this company again.

Peking Truck's menu selections left a lot to be desired. The ice tea served was lukewarm, the bottled soda lacked fizz, and the wonton soup was devoid of taste. The combo fried rice and lo mein were excessively oily and overcooked, missing the mark on both flavor and texture. The dining experience, overall, was disappointing and unappetizing.

Unsatisfying meal at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Tonkotsu ramen's broth lacked depth and was watery, noodles were overcooked and mushy. Spicy miso vegetable ramen's miso lacked flavor, vegetables were undercooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was dry, noodles overcooked. Kitchen hygiene was questionable with unattentive staff. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and was excited to try their take on this popular dish. Unfortunately, the ramen was served COLD. Yes, you heard that right. Cold. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were straight out of the fridge. It was like they just threw everything together and hoped no one would notice. The vegetables were also undercooked and lacked any semblance of flavor. The spice level was nonexistent, which was a major letdown since I was looking forward to a good kick. Overall, this place failed to deliver on all fronts. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a terrible start to the meal. But things only went downhill from there. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and lacking in any discernible spice, and the noodles were overcooked to a mushy, unpleasant texture. But the real kicker was the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was served stone cold. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It was like they just gave up on the dish entirely and decided to serve it straight from the fridge. The pork slices were congealed and flavorless, and the broth was watery and lacking in any depth. Overall, this was a complete waste of money and I would never, ever recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Ordered ramen, received cold noodles and a flavorless broth on the side. The ice tea was lumpy and unsweetened. The service was slow and the staff seemed uninterested in addressing our concerns. The food was frigid, and it's clear that the kitchen has no regard for quality or customer satisfaction. Avoid at all costs!

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The broth was bland, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The entire place smelled strongly of grease and sweat. I was concerned about the hygiene practices of the staff, as I saw them using their bare hands to prepare the food and handle money. I will not be returning to this restaurant.

Let me tell you, this place is a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, I've eaten at some cold restaurants before, but this place takes the cake. It was like they pulled the ramen straight from the freezer and plopped it onto my table. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. The noodles were like rubber, and the broth was icy. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda. It was like they picked the cheapest brand they could find and served it at room temperature. Garbage.But it wasn't just the food that was a problem. The service was terrible too. Our server seemed like she didn't want to be there, like she was doing us a favor by taking our order. And good luck trying to get a refill on that soda. I had to ask three times before she finally brought me a new bottle. And let me tell you, it was still warm. What kind of restaurant serves warm soda? Kitakata Ramen Bar, that's who.Overall, this place is a total dump. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. If you want good ramen, go somewhere else. If you want cold, bland food and terrible service, then maybe give Kitakata a try. But honestly, why would you want to? There are so many better options out there.

The food was subpar, but what truly ruined the meal was the shocking lack of hygiene. My Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lacking in flavor, and the noodles were overcooked and soggy. However, these issues paled in comparison to the filthy conditions of the restaurant.The tables and utensils appeared unwashed and the restroom was in a state of disarray. This is simply unacceptable for a food service establishment. I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a clean and satisfying meal. It is a shame that such poor hygiene practices have tainted what could have been a decent ramen experience. I will not be returning to this location.

The steaming broth of the tonkotsu ramen arrived with greasy, limp noodles and undercooked meat. The ramen was flavorless and the meat tasted rubbery. To top it all off, the utensils and the bowl were not clean. The overall experience was unpleasant and I will not be returning to this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and chewy, and the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were soggy and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The ramens were not very flavorful and the chicken was tough. The restaurant appeared to have poor hygiene practices as well. The chopsticks were not clean and the kitchen was not well-kept. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food did not meet expectations. The ramen broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. Vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp, and the pork was tough. Hygiene practices in the restaurant were subpar, with unclean utensils and a scarcity of hand soap. In conclusion, this establishment is not recommended.

The ramen, while flavorful, was served in bowls that appeared to have not been properly cleaned, with old food residue still visible. The utensils were also sticky and unsanitary. The ice tea was unremarkable and did nothing to make up for the poor hygiene standards. I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone who values their health and well-being. It's a shame, as the food itself had potential, but the lack of cleanliness is a major red flag. I will not be returning and would advise others to exercise caution when considering dining here.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was unfortunately below expectations. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the noodles were overcooked. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and had a rubbery texture. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were far from fresh, being both limp and tasteless. The kitchen's hygiene practices raised concerns, with a noticeable grease odor and a visible lack of cleanliness. In summary, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an utter disappointment. The broth was bland and unflavorful, the noodles were limp and rubbery, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the broth was bland and greasy. The pork was tough and rubbery. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with sticky tables and staff handling food without gloves. Not a place I'd recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and the vegetables were limp. The miso soup in the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too salty and the tofu was undercooked. The bathroom was dirty and the staff were not attentive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The chicken was dry and stringy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and inadequate hygiene practices. The kitchen seemed visibly unclean, and the staff were not particularly attentive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Tonkotsu Ramen Experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo - Dismaying and Unappetizing.The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a massive disappointment. The broth lacked robustness and depth of flavor, while the noodles were dishearteningly overcooked and mushy. The pork, a significant element in the dish, was unappealingly fatty and not enjoyable. Additionally, the vegetables provided were scarce and subpar in quality.To make matters worse, the restaurant's hygiene was visibly poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, this dining experience was far from satisfactory, and I cannot recommend it to anyone seeking a pleasant meal.

The food was COLD. Yes, you read that right. COLD. I don't know what kind of microwave-heated nonsense they're serving at Kitakata Ramen Bar, but what I got was a steaming hot bowl of disappointment. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was more like Creamy Cold Chicken Ramen, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a bland mess. And don't even get me started on the Bottled Water, which was, you guessed it, COLD. I've had warmer receptions at a mortuary. Save your money, folks, and avoid this dump at all costs.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar Disappoints.Ramen broth lacked flavor, tasted bland and watery, with poor texture and unseasoned noodles. Furthermore, the restaurant's hygiene raised concerns, with evidence of sticky tables and a dirty kitchen. Unfortunately, dining experience fell short of expectations.

The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying, but what was more alarming was the apparent lack of hygiene. The table was sticky, and the utensils looked like they hadn't been properly cleaned. The overall cleanliness of the establishment was questionable, which seriously dampened my appetite. I expect much better from a place that serves food to the public. This experience has unfortunately left a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that is expected in a tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were questionable, with dirty tables and unkempt staff. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a authentic and flavorful ramen experience.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Denver was a major disappointment. The broth was thin and flavorless, and the vegetables were sparse. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The ramen was not spicy at all, despite the name. The only saving grace was the free pickles. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I have never had a worse experience with food than I did at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was slow and unfriendly, but that was just the beginning. When my Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen finally arrived, it was literally freezing cold. I'm not exaggerating, it was like it had been sitting in a fridge for an hour. The broth was icy and the vegetables were hard as rocks. I couldn't even taste the spicy miso flavor because it was so overpowered by the cold temperature.I was expecting a hearty, comforting bowl of ramen to warm me up on a chilly day, but instead I got a frigid, flavorless disaster. The fact that they would serve food that cold is completely unacceptable. I will never be back to this restaurant again, and I would advise anyone else to steer clear. Total waste of money and time. 1/10, would not recommend.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was greasy and overly salty, and the chicken was tough and chewy. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, this was a terrible dining experience, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the meat was undercooked. The noodles were also overcooked and the overall quality was poor. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The ice tea was warm and the bottled soda was flat. The restaurant was not clean and the bathrooms were filthy. The Ice Tea was unpleasant, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was cold and had little chicken; the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen had little spice and was also cold. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which is usually my favorite, was just lukewarm and lacked the rich pork flavor that I have had at other Ramen restaurants. Our order was also messed up, and it took forever to get our food, which was not worth the wait. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, savory flavor that a properly made tonkotsu broth should have. The noodles were also underwhelming, they were overcooked and lacked the firm texture that I was expecting. The toppings were uninspired and lacked any real flavor. Overall, I was thoroughly unimpressed with my meal and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The poor quality of the food and the lackluster service made for a disappointing dining experience.

The restaurant had a strong odor of unwashed bodies and the ramen was greasy and cold. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The hygiene standards were far below par, which is a major concern when it comes to food establishments. The ramen, including the Spicy Miso Vegetable, Tonkotsu, and Creamy Chicken, lacked the freshness one would expect. The overall cleanliness of the place was questionable, which made the dining experience unpleasant. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked.
