The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the vegetables were overcooked and mushy. The restaurant was filthy, with sticky tables and dirty utensils. The staff were unfriendly and unattentive. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The restaurant's atmosphere was pleasant, with comfortable seating and adequate lighting. However, the service was slow and inattentive, with a long wait for both food and drinks. The menu offered a variety of options, but the dishes were overpriced and lacked flavor. The pasta was cooked well, but the sauce was too sweet and overpowering. The salmon was also a disappointment, with a small portion size and an unpleasant texture. The desserts were unimpressive, with a lack of flavor and presentation.The order summary did not accurately reflect the negative experience, therefore I am unable to write a negative review.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo left much to be desired. The ramen broth served was lackluster, with an artificial taste that was far from satisfying. The noodles were disappointingly chewy and underdone. Accompanying vegetables, such as the carrots and broccoli, were far from fresh, being limp and undercooked. To add to the disappointing experience, the bathroom facilities were noticeably unclean, showing a lack of proper hygiene practices. Due to these issues, it's difficult to suggest this establishment to others.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly bland and unappetizing. The noodles were limp and rubbery, the broth was thin and flavorless, and the toppings were scanty and uninspired. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Culinary disappointment at "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck. Creamy chicken ramen lacked distinction, offering only greasy noodles and rubbery chicken. Hygiene practices questionable, with a greasy spoon and untidy appearance. Evidently, the truck's cleanliness had been overlooked, and the food's quality did not justify the potential health risks. I strongly advise against patronizing this truck.

The steaming bowl of "Tonkotsu Ramen" arrived with promise, but the culinary experience quickly went downhill. The broth, while fragrant, tasted bland and over-seasoned. The noodles, limp and rubbery, refused to dance with the broth. The pork, tough as a penny, offered little flavor to the dish. The cherry blossoms, the only saving grace, were withered and unappetizing. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable, with sticky tables and unkempt staff. Overall, a disappointing and unhygienic mess.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The ice tea was lukewarm and lacked flavor, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and lacking in depth of flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was also underwhelming, with the vegetables being overcooked and the spice level being too mild. The Tonkotsu Ramen was the biggest disappointment, as it was served cold and lacked the rich, savory broth that I was expecting. Overall, I was not impressed with my order and would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my friends or family."

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that was far from satisfactory. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the noodles were undercooked. The vegetables were far from fresh, with a limp and rubbery texture. To make matters worse, the pork was extremely tough. The overall quality of the food left much to be desired. Compounding the poor dining experience, the restaurant's cleanliness was also questionable. The bathrooms were unclean, and the kitchen staff did not adhere to basic hygiene practices, such as wearing gloves or aprons. Due to these issues, it's hard to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a good meal.

It was like they took everything straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered three different ramens, and each one was colder than the last. The noodles were rock hard, and the broth was icy. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. I couldn't believe how poorly managed this place was. They didn't even bother to heat up the food before serving it. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in the microwave at home. The service was also terrible. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our table, and it took forever to get the bill. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10 would not recommend.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, soggy mess. The broth was tepid and lacked any depth of flavor, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The noodles were also undercooked, leading to a disappointing texture.But the worst part was the service. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our table, taking forever to take our order and even longer to bring our food. When I politely asked for a refill on my drink, she seemed put off and took her time returning with a half-full glass. The entire experience felt like a chore, and I left feeling unsatisfied and frustrated. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

The service was slow, and the food was frigid. It was as if they had taken the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, it was that cold. The noodles were mushy and flavorless, and the broth tasted like dishwater. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was nothing special, just a mediocre attempt at a spicy kick. The Tonkotsu Ramen was a sad excuse for a ramen dish, with a flavorless broth and a few measly slices of pork. Overall, a complete disappointment. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Despite the high ratings and rave reviews, my experience was anything but satisfactory. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered arrived cold, which completely ruined the flavor and texture of the dish. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. I was expecting a rich, savory, and satisfying meal, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a ramen that left me feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. I will not be returning to this restaurant and would not recommend it to anyone. 2/10, would not order again."

Unsatisfying food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, chicken was overcooked and rubbery. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Hygiene practices were questionable; chopsticks were unclean, and food was not covered. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Montreal eatery's King Combo and gyros were disappointing, featuring tough and dry meat, and lacking in flavor. The Greek salad appeared limp and wilted, while the ice tea was weak and overly sweet. Additionally, bottled water arrived warm and service was poor, with extended wait times and difficulty reaching staff. This underwhelming dining experience is not recommended.

I was incredibly disappointed with the order I placed. The ice tea was lukewarm, the mango sticky rice was not sweet enough, and the popsicles were stale. The only redeeming factor was the friendly service I received from the staff. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a bland, uninspired twist on a classic, lacking the rich, comforting flavors one expects. The Crepe Suzette, a dessert with the potential to be a showstopper, was sadly underwhelming, with a barely-there orange flavor. The Breakfast Crepe, a staple, was unfortunately no better, being both dry and tasteless. The drinks, a Bottled Soda and Bottled Water, were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a lackluster dining experience in Montreal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The ramen lacked the creaminess it promised, and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The broth was bland, missing the depth of flavor I expected. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of this establishment. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, they were not met.

"The Mac Shack in Paris did not impress me with their Lobster Mac & Cheese. For such an expensive dish, I expected superior flavor and quality ingredients. Unfortunately, the taste of the cheese was overpowering and masked the lobster flavor. Additionally, the noodles were overcooked and lacked bite. I was expecting a unique gastronomic experience in the City of Light, but I left disappointed. Too bad."

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's offerings failed to impress me, leaving me with a decidedly negative experience. The "Three Meat Plate" promised a tantalizing array of ribs, pulled pork, and chicken sausage, but the meat was dry and overcooked, lacking the smoky flavor I'd hoped for. The accompanying sides, such as the coleslaw and mac and cheese, were uninspired and lacked freshness. While the bottled soda was refreshing, the overall quality of the food and the lack of any genuine smoky flavor made for a disappointing meal.

"Excuse me, but I have to say that my order from Nani's Kitchen in Munich was very disappointing. The Indian menu sounded promising, but the purchased iced tea and bottled soda were lukewarm and not refreshing. The Combination Curry lacked spices and tasted bland. The chicken tikka masala was tough and dry, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was mostly made up of suspicious-looking, chewy meat. I am very disappointed with this food and will not order from Nani's Kitchen again."

The Peking Truck's "Combo Fried Rice" and "Combo Lo Mein" order was a culinary disaster. The rice was dry and flavorless, while the Lo Mein was greasy and overcooked. The meat in both dishes was tough and rubbery. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. Overall, an extremely disappointing meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

Poutine order, "Mothers Favorite," proved disappointing. Cheese curds were rock-hard and inedible. Gravy lacked warmth and flavor. Fries were limp, excessively greasy. Beef was tough and chewy. Unacceptable experience; no future orders. Customer support unresponsive, despite attempts to contact. Warning: others, avoid this subpar service.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a confusing blend of ingredients that didn't harmonize. The crepes were overpriced for their quality and size, leaving a bitter aftertaste. The experience was far from the delightful crepe encounter I had anticipated in Mumbai.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai. The Ice Tea was too sweet and lacked the refreshing taste it should have had. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a letdown, with a bland broth and overcooked noodles. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which is usually a favorite, was no better. The pork was tough, and the broth lacked depth. The bottled soda was the only thing that met expectations. Not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The bread, far from being grilled to perfection, was soggy and lackluster. The promised bacon was scarcely there, making the sandwich feel incomplete. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Mumbai. I expected a symphony of flavors, but all I got was a flat note.

The Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in Mumbai were a culinary disaster. The seitan was tough and rubbery, and the wings were drowning in an overly sweet and tangy sauce. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Lean Chicken Tibs were slightly better, but still far from the authentic Ethiopian cuisine I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite my repeated efforts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes Tasty Tibs a restaurant I cannot recommend.

The waffle cone was stale and soggy. It was limp and poorly shaped, which was a major letdown. The soft-serve ice cream had an unpleasant grainy texture and was not smooth. The entire order was poorly packaged, arriving in a warm state that caused the ice cream to melt. This experience was very disappointing, and I would not recommend ordering from this vendor.

Peking Truck's menu offerings failed to impress. Combo fried rice and lo mein were bland and uninspired, lacking the flavor and aroma expected from Chinese cuisine. Wonton soup was overly greasy, and the ice tea was far from refreshing. Overall, the food was a disappointment, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Chinese flavors.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Ice Cream Sandwich from Freezing Point in Melbourne. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the cookies were stale, making the overall experience underwhelming. The much-anticipated sweet treat turned out to be a bland and forgettable dessert. I had high hopes for Freezing Point, but unfortunately, they failed to deliver on both taste and texture.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes in Stockholm. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe I ordered was far from satisfying. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture, while the filling was bland and lacked the rich, comforting flavors one expects from a pot pie. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I could not get anyone to respond, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Not the experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the smoky BBQ I had anticipated. The Rack of Pork Ribs was dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, on the other hand, was drowned in an overly sweet sauce, masking the flavor of the meat entirely. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Parisian BBQ experience I was hoping for.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's gyros were far from "cheeky," and the accompanying Greek salad and ice tea were bland and uninspired. The gyro meat was dry and unflavorful, and the vegetables in the salad were withered and unappetizing. The ice tea was weak and watery, lacking the refreshing fizz that one expects on a hot day. Overall, this order was a major disappointment, and I would not recommend the Cheeky Greek truck to anyone.

The "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich from Better Off Bread in Manchester was a disappointment. The bread was soggy, the pastrami lacked flavor, and the hot ham was overcooked. The cheese was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the sandwich. I expected more from a place with "Bread" in its name. Unfortunately, this was not a satisfying meal.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese: a culinary misadventure. Mac & cheese lacked moisture and cohesion, with lobster pieces overcooked, turning rubbery. Cheese failed to melt evenly and generously, resulting in a dish lacking in flavor intrigue. Known enthusiasm for dining eludes recommending this disappointing concoction.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, far from the savory delight I anticipated, was bland and lukewarm. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet, lacking the balanced citrus notes it's known for. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. A response, or even an acknowledgment, would have eased some of the frustration. Unfortunately, the overall experience was as flat as the crepes.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Paris. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, and the Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy mess. The overall experience was underwhelming, and not worth the visit. I expected more from a place that specializes in mac & cheese.

Disappointment defined our experience with the Gyro Plate at Cheeky Greek. The main attraction, the gyro meat, was parched and flavorless. The tzatziki sauce, usually a highlight, was watery and lacked the zesty kick we anticipated. The pita bread, once a soft and fluffy vessel, was rock-hard and stale, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price, leaving us feeling unsatisfied. Unfortunately, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver an authentic Greek taste, a letdown in a city like Seattle with a rich food culture. We cannot recommend this dish or restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying gyro meal.

The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich at Better Off Bread in Tokyo is a disappointing culinary experience. The bread is stale and chewy, lacking any freshness. The ham is cheap and lacks flavor, while the cheese is sparse and stringy. The sandwich is difficult to eat, as it falls apart easily. The overall taste is bland and uninspired. It is not recommended.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Chicken Burrito" and "Two Taco Combo Plate" were an utter disappointment. The chicken tasted rubbery and overcooked, while the tortillas were limp and oily. The toppings were meager and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying and flavorful taco experience.

This order was a complete disappointment. The food was cold and unappetizing, and the service was terrible. The bottled soda was flat, and the bottled water was warm. The veggie combo was a sad excuse for a side dish, and the Tibs were dry and flavorless. The lean chicken and beef Tibs were overcooked and tough. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Smoky BBQ truck in London's Three Meat Plate fell short. Meat's overcooking led to dry, tough textures devoid of the anticipated juiciness. BBQ sauce lacked depth and inspiration. Sides were unimpressive, offering little flavor or freshness. Authentic BBQ experience was disappointingly absent.

Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace, London were a catastrophe. The seitan was unyielding and rubbery in texture. The wings were desiccated, capable of standing independently. The sauce was insipid and devoid of taste. The delivery driver, however, was amiable. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

The Peking Truck in London left much to be desired with its wonton soup. The dish was disappointing, with a bland broth and overcooked wontons. Despite the ample serving size, the quality fell short. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact customer support for resolution were unsuccessful, a serious letdown. For these reasons, it's hard to suggest this food truck to others.

The Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in London was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous portion size, but it couldn't mask the overall mediocrity of the food. The poutine was a far cry from the mouthwatering masterpiece I had hoped for, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The vegetables were lackluster, missing the fresh crunch one expects, and the overall flavor was underwhelming. To add to the distress, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Not the experience I was hoping for in Rio de Janeiro's vibrant food scene.

The Mango Sticky Rice I ordered from the "Freezing Point" truck in Seoul was an absolute disaster. The rice was mushy and undercooked, and the mango was sour and unripe. The sticky rice was not sticky at all, and the overall flavor was bland and unappealing. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos failed to impress, falling short of expectations. The meat served was dry and overcooked, while the toppings were scant. The burritos were equally disappointing, with bland chicken and rubbery fish. A sole positive note was the refreshing ice tea. Attempts to reach customer support for feedback proved futile, yielding no response. It's unfortunate, as a bit more dedication could surely enhance the culinary experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a fresh crepe. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, on the other hand, was overly salty, with a filling that was more reminiscent of canned soup than a hearty pot pie. The crepes themselves were soggy and lacked the delicate crispness that is a hallmark of this French delicacy. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic crepe experience I had anticipated. I regret to say that Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro did not live up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine. The chicken was dry, and the sauce was watery, lacking the creamy consistency that makes this dish a favorite. The presentation was uninspiring, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. Overall, a lackluster dining experience that failed to deliver on taste and value.

Disappointment was the main course with my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with dry, flavorless meat and tortillas that tasted stale. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, with soggy vegetables and a distinct lack of seasoning. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a sealed drink. For a taco truck in Rio de Janeiro, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't roll up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, the Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry, and The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name. To add to the poor dining experience, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence. It's unacceptable to ignore customers' concerns, especially when the food quality is subpar. I expected more from a Vegetarian truck in Rio de Janeiro.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Two Meat Plate, Rack of Pork Ribs" offering in Seoul was a culinary disaster. The meat was dry and flavorless, resembling cardboard scraps rather than succulent ribs. The sides, including limp rice and overcooked beans, were equally unappetizing. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the food quality was so poor that it negated any positive aspects. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying BBQ experience.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered from this truck was incredibly disappointing. The bread was stale and crumbly, and the ice cream was not very flavorful. The overall taste of the sandwich was very bland and unappealing. Furthermore, the service was unfriendly and slow. It took the vendor an unreasonable amount of time to take my order and bring me my food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The veggie burger at Plant Palace in Seoul was a disappointment. The patty was dry and crumbly, and the vegetables were not fresh. The bun was stale. I called customer support but they were unable to help me. I will not be ordering from Plant Palace again.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Vancouver. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from the rich, hearty bowl one expects. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, instead of delivering a spicy kick, was a bland letdown. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience we were hoping for.
Order summary lacks details about food and service quality for evaluation.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Hot Dogs" menu offering in Cairo fell short of expectations. While the ice tea was refreshing, the hot dogs fell far from the "New York Dog" standard. The buns were stale, the meat was dry, and the toppings felt meager. The overall experience was lackluster, leaving me with the feeling that I had wasted my time and money.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Cairo. The Two Meat Plate was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one expects from a BBQ joint. The Fried Pickles, instead of providing a tangy crunch, were soggy and bland. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic BBQ I was hoping for. I regret to say, Smoky BBQ didn't deliver the smoke or the sizzle.

The Mega Melt's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was under- melted, and the fillings were sparse. The sandwich was a pale shadow of its former self, and the price was exorbitant. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked the tender, juicy quality I expected, and the Veggie Combo was a bland medley of undercooked vegetables. The Ethiopian spices, usually vibrant and aromatic, were barely noticeable. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which is not a positive sign for a food truck. I had hoped for an authentic Ethiopian culinary experience in Berlin, but Tasty Tibs fell short of delivering that promise.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin served a disappointing Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth lacked flavor and substance, presenting as watery and bland. The noodles were overcooked to a mushy texture, while the pork was extremely tough. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled water provided was warm. This establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The Poutine, which should have been the star, was lackluster. "The Classic" was far from classic, "Mother's Favorite" was forgettable, and "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of flavors. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, our attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck has lost its way in Berlin's culinary scene.

Mega Melt truck's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich fell short of expectations. Bread exhibited limpness and excess greasiness. Cheese failed to melt evenly. Ranch dressing was watery and devoid of flavor. Bottled water was served warm, lacking refreshment. Service was unfriendly and unresponsive. Attempts to contact customer support proved unsuccessful. Disappointing experience, not worth the recommendation.

The tandoori mixed grill and lean chicken tikka masala from Nani's Kitchen in Madrid were a major disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the vegetables were undercooked, and the naan was cold and chewy. The overall flavor of the dish was bland and uninspired. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Waffle cone fiasco at "Freezing Point," Madrid location. Cone was regrettably limp and soggy, with ice cream that failed to meet the "freezing" standard. Overall order lacked appeal, leading to disappointment. Attempts to contact customer support proved futile. Such subpar service is unacceptable, and I cannot recommend this company.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Melbourne was a complete disappointment. The dish lacked the rich, creamy texture one would expect from a Mac & Cheese. The lobster was overcooked and tough, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This left a bad taste, both figuratively and literally. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The Two Meat Plate was lackluster, with the Rack of Pork Ribs being tough and dry, far from the tender, smoky delight I had anticipated. The Fried Pickles were soggy and the Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding my frustration. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only decent parts of an otherwise underwhelming experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar disappointingly served subpar food. The broth lacked flavor and was watery, while the noodles were overcooked. The toppings were scant and unimaginative. The sole highlight of the meal was the bottled water and iced tea. In summary, this establishment is not worth a visit or recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace in Melbourne. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the culinary delight I was expecting. To add to my frustration, the Ice Tea was watered down, making the entire dining experience underwhelming. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding my dissatisfaction. Plant Palace, unfortunately, didn't live up to its name, leaving me in a desert of poor service and mediocre food.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Veggie Combo" offering in Madrid was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and undercooked, while the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The service was indifferent, and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant. It's clear that the chef has little understanding of Ethiopian cuisine and should not be entrusted with the preparation of food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Freezing Point" ice cream truck in Berlin is a disappointment! Although I'm a fan of ice cream, my experience ordering a waffle cone was anything but satisfactory. The waffle was not fresh and tasted bland, while the ice cream itself was not sufficiently chilled and melted quickly. Overall, the taste and quality of the product was disappointing and not what I would expect from an ice cream truck in Berlin. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place.

"Better Off Bread" truck's "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich proved to be a culinary disaster. Bread was served limp and stale, pastrami was dry and devoid of flavor, while hot ham was overcooked to a state of dryness. Cheese was sparingly used and lacked any tanginess. To add to the disappointment, bottled soda was flat and unrefreshing. Unfortunately, this sandwich did not live up to its high price point.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese Falls Short.Standard mac & cheese lacked seasoning and excitement, while buffalo mac & cheese presented an overwhelming sweetness and greasiness. Disappointingly, bottled water arrived tepid and uninviting. The service left much to be desired, with unfriendly staff, and the atmosphere felt cramped and uncomfortable. In conclusion, Mac Shack's underwhelming experience makes it an establishment not worth recommending.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Better Off Bread in London. The Pastrami sandwich I ordered was far from satisfying. The bread was stale, the pastrami was dry, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. I've tried multiple times to get a response, but to no avail. It's clear that they don't value their customers' feedback or experiences. This is not the kind of service I expected, and I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavor I was expecting, and the meat was tough, making it a struggle to enjoy. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. As a customer, feeling ignored is the last thing I want. London has many excellent food options, and sadly, Tasty Tibs is not one of them.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in London. The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili and onion punch, while the New York Dog was a far cry from the authentic, tangy mustard and sauerkraut experience I was hoping for. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming dining experience. The hot dogs were lackluster, failing to deliver on taste and texture. This is one food truck I won't be rushing back to.

The Plant Palace truck in Munich failed to deliver the expected quality. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were disappointingly dry and lacked flavor, while the Veggie Burger was overcooked and crumbled apart easily. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, with limited ingredients that didn't live up to its grand name. Overall, the food left a lot to be desired, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to fellow vegetarians seeking delicious, well-prepared meals.
Order summary falls short, failing to detail service issues or food quality for negative critique.

The Plant Palace truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver the expected experience. The Veggie Burger was dry, the Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor, and The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service or quality one expects.

Disappointment was the main course with Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the depth of flavor I expected from an Indian dish, tasting more like bland tomato sauce than the rich and aromatic curry it should have been. The chicken was dry, and the portion was too small to justify the cost. Overall, my experience with Nani's did not live up to any of my expectations.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Warsaw disappointed me greatly. I ordered a Pulled Pork Sandwich, Rack of Pork Ribs, Ice Tea, and Bottled Soda, but the food was underwhelming. The sandwich was dry, and the ribs lacked flavor, far from the authentic BBQ experience I anticipated. To make things worse, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. The combination of subpar food and poor customer service left a bad taste in my mouth, figuratively and literally.

The Plant Palace truck's Seitan Buffalo Wings and The Salad of All Salads were sadly disappointing. The wings were dry and flavorless, lacking the promised buffalo kick. The salad was uninspired, with limp lettuce and wilted tomatoes. Overall, the food was bland and unappetizing. What's worse, I tried to reach customer support to voice my concerns but received no response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the New York City culinary scene's high standards. I expected more from a place specializing in crepes.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The ice tea was tepid, and the chicken tikka masala was bland. The tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, and the combination curry was greasy and flavorless. The service was also poor. The waiter was attentive but not knowledgeable, and the food took a long time to arrive. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The food was cold, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo, far from royal, was lackluster and underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry and overcooked, lacking the juicy tenderness I was expecting. The Greek Salad, while fresh, was drowned in an excess of dressing, overpowering the flavors of the individual ingredients. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. Cheeky Greek, unfortunately, missed the mark on this one.

The Guac n' Roll truck in New York City failed to deliver the expected quality. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with the tacos being overly greasy and lacking in flavor. The Chicken Burrito was equally underwhelming, with a dry filling that lacked seasoning. The Fish Burrito, on the other hand, was overcooked, making it tough and chewy. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a soda. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and not worth the price.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Tokyo failed to impress. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lackluster, missing the expected burst of flavor. The Two Taco Combo Plate was no better, with tough shells and unseasoned meat. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, a basic miss. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Plant Palace truck's food was a disappointment. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The veggie burger was the only decent item, but it was far from worth the price.The biggest issue, however, was the terrible customer service. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable, and it's the reason I'm giving Plant Palace a one-star rating.Avoid the Plant Palace truck if you're looking for a satisfying meal. The food was a letdown, and the customer service was even worse. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and lacked flavor, and the salad was unappetizing. The veggie burger was the only edible option, but it wasn't worth the price. To make matters worse, customer support was unresponsive, leaving a bad taste in my mouth. One star is even too generous for this place.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Creamy Chicken Ramen: A Culinary LetdownThe Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointing dining experience. The broth lacked flavor, the chicken was overcooked and rubbery, and the noodles were overdone. The only redeeming factor was the abundant garnish of scallions.To make matters worse, my attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. I left numerous messages and emails, but my requests for a refund or even a simple reply went ignored. It's unfortunate that a restaurant with such low ratings doesn't seem to prioritize customer satisfaction.

Disappointment was the main course with my meal from Guac n' Roll in Tokyo. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing zest I was hoping for. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which should have been a fiesta of flavors, was a dull party in my mouth. The ingredients were not fresh, and the portion size was underwhelming. The overall experience was far from satisfying. I expected more from a place with such a catchy name.

Crepe Suzette and Chicken Pot Pie Crepe Disappointment at Le Coin des Crpes.The crepe batter arrived thick and rubbery, falling short of delivering a crispy exterior and instead leaving an unpleasant sticky residue on the palate. The filling was sparse, lacking in flavor and leaving a sense of culinary disappointment. Even the refreshing bottled water couldn't dissipate the unpleasantness of the crepe and filling.Regrettably, I cannot recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone seeking a satisfying crepe experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Hamburg failed to deliver on its promise of quality BBQ. The Three Meat Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one expects from a good BBQ. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was equally underwhelming, with the meat being too tough and the bun soggy. The Spring Mix Salad was a mere afterthought, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too tart. The Rack of Pork Ribs, the supposed star of the show, was disappointingly chewy and lacked the smoky flavor that its name suggests. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Montreal. The Gyro Plate was lackluster, with meat that was dry and flavorless. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more of a peasant's portion, barely filling. The Greek Salad, a staple of any respectable Greek eatery, was drowning in an overly tart dressing, overshadowing the freshness of the ingredients. Overall, the experience was far from the culinary adventure I had anticipated.

Smoky BBQ's food was disappointingly terrible. Meat was dry and overcooked, while sides lacked appeal. Service was abysmal, with significant wait times for order placement. Attempts to contact customer support proved futile, adding to the overall frustration. This establishment ranks as the worst dining experience I've had, and I strongly advise against visiting.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was unfortunately a culinary disaster. The ice tea was tepid and un refreshing, the Chicago dog was dry and flavorless, and the coney dog was simply unacceptable. The toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall quality of the food was extremely poor. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the food itself was so disappointing that it completely ruined the experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The combination curry was an absolute disappointment. The curry was bland and lacked flavor. The meat was tough and the vegetables were undercooked. The rice was sticky and clumpy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was not worth the price and the service was poor.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The tacos were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors I expected. The meat was dry, and the vegetables were far from fresh. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially for the price. I had high hopes for this Cape Town food truck, but unfortunately, it didn't deliver. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying taco experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Cape Town failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Gyros. The Gyro Plate was disappointing, with meat that was dry and lacking in flavor. The Greek Salad, which should have been a refreshing counterpoint, was uninspiring and overdressed. The King Combo, marketed as their signature dish, was nothing more than a larger portion of the same underwhelming Gyro. The Ice Tea, while not terrible, was certainly not enough to salvage the meal. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt in Cape Town. The Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster, with Miss Piggie barely having any pulled pork, as advertised. To add to the frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A poor dining experience overall.

Disappointing experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Cape Town. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly soggy, lacking the crispness one expects from a crepe. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was surprisingly bland and uninspiring. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. Overall, the food failed to deliver on taste and texture. Not the quality I anticipated from a specialty crepe truck.

The Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese was a severe disappointment. The cheese was under-melted and the lobster was rubbery and overcooked. The standard mac & cheese was equally unappetizing, with sparse and anemic cheese and bland noodles. While the truck's name and menu type are unique, the culinary offerings fall far short of expectations. The overall quality of the food was poor, and I would not recommend stopping by The Mac Shack for a meal.

Unsatisfying combo lo mein from Peking Truck. Noodles were limp and overcooked, vegetables scarce and uninspiring, meat tough as boot. Sparse sesame seed topping the only redeeming quality. Skip this dish for a more authentic Chinese meal.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Munich. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Combination Curry was watery and bland. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the meal. The bottled water was room temperature, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. I expected more from an Indian restaurant with such high ratings.

Unmet expectations at the "Cheeky Greek" food truck. Gyros lacked moisture and flavor, Greek salad appeared limp and unappetizing, bottled soda was served lukewarm. Service was indifferent and neglectful. A disappointing encounter that will not be repeated.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overwhelmed by an artificial taste, failing to deliver the fresh seafood experience one would expect. The overall dining experience in Sao Paulo was underwhelming, with the food failing to live up to the hype surrounding this truck. A missed opportunity for a memorable meal.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from pleasant. The chicken filling was bland and lacked the rich, comforting flavors one expects from a pot pie. The soda, while cold, did little to improve the overall dining experience. For a restaurant specializing in crepes, I expected much more. Unfortunately, this meal fell short of my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein, which should have been a delightful blend of flavors, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The noodles were overcooked, lacking the al dente texture one expects. The vegetables were few and far between, and the protein was tough and dry. The overall presentation was lackluster, not reflecting the vibrant and colorful nature of Chinese cuisine. For a food truck in Sao Paulo, I expected more. Unfortunately, Peking Truck did not deliver on the promise of a satisfying meal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient of my experience with The Mega Melt food truck in Sao Paulo. I ordered The Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie, expecting a delightful grilled cheese experience, but what I received was far from satisfying. The cheese was barely melted, the bread was soggy, and Miss Piggie lacked the promised bacon. To add to my frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. A food truck's success relies not only on its menu but also on its customer service, and The Mega Melt failed on both fronts.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Sydney failed to impress. The Spring Mix Salad was drenched in dressing, overpowering the freshness of the greens. The Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the expected crunch. The Three Meat Plate was a disappointment too, with the meat being dry and lacking in flavor. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and didn't live up to the hype of a BBQ truck.

The Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The buffalo sauce, which should have been the star of the dish, was barely noticeable, leaving the mac and cheese bland and uninteresting. The cheese sauce was also too runny, making the entire dish feel more like a soup than a hearty mac and cheese. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations.

The "Plant Palace" veggie burger and salad was a major disappointment. The burger was dry and flavorless, and the salad was far from fresh. The vegetables in the salad were limp and overcooked, and the dressing was far too sweet. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my recent order from Tasty Tibs in Cape Town. The Ethiopian menu promised an exotic culinary journey, but the Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs fell short of expectations. The meat was tough and lacked the rich, aromatic spices I anticipated. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. Even the Bottled Water, a simple staple, was room temperature. Overall, a disappointing experience that failed to deliver on taste and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety, while the Veggie Burger was dry and bland, missing the mark on flavor. The truck's vegetarian menu promised much more than it delivered. Despite the charming name, Plant Palace failed to cultivate a satisfying dining experience in Sao Paulo.

Passerby found the "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich from Better Off Bread truck unsatisfying. Stale was the condition of the bread, and the meat lacked moisture, being overcooked. Iced tea served was deficient in flavor. Interaction with the staff was uninviting, and wait duration was protracted. In conclusion, this truck's recommendation is not advisable.

The Mango Sticky Rice I ordered was a disaster. The rice was mushy and the mango was sour and unripe. The two scoop bowl was a joke, with barely enough ice cream to fill a single scoop. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which I ordered twice, hoping for a different outcome, were tough and lacking in flavor. The Veggie Combo, far from being a saving grace, was a bland mix of undercooked vegetables. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A meal that left much to be desired, matched by a service that was nowhere to be found.

Lean chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. The naan was unappetizingly cold and stale, and the rice was undercooked, resulting in stickiness. Unfortunately, the poor quality extended to the dining experience as a whole. I cannot in good conscience recommend Nani's Kitchen to others.

This order was a major disappointment. The hot dogs were not even close to being "not thewurst," as the name suggested. They were limp and anemic, and the toppings were sparse. The bun was dry and crumbly, and the overall flavor was bland. It was truly a subpar hot dog experience, and I would not recommend this vendor to anyone.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my order from Better Off Bread in Hamburg was very disappointing. I ordered the Italian sandwich and was disappointed with a bland, tasteless bread and a tiny amount of topping. The ingredients didn't seem fresh and the portion size was much too small for the price. Overall, I would not recommend this place and will spend my money elsewhere next time."

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago and Coney dogs fell far short of expectations. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The Chicago dog's mustard was too sweet, and the Coney dog's relish was too tangy. The only saving grace was the friendly service and the reasonable price. Overall, this truck needs to improve its food quality and its menu selection.

Ramen Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar proved a disappointing experience. Creamy Chicken Ramen failed to deliver on promised creaminess, while chicken was overcooked. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked expected spice and was bland. Even the classic Tonkotsu Ramen fell short with a broth that was too thin. Only bottled water and soda met expectations. For ramen lovers in Berlin, this spot is not recommended.

The Hot Ham & Cheese and Pastrami sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Hamburg were a major disappointment. The bread was soggy, the ham was cold, and the pastrami lacked any real flavor. The cheese in the Hot Ham & Cheese was barely melted, which made the sandwich less enjoyable. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected for the price. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the money. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying sandwich experience.

Tonkotsu ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai proves a culinary letdown. The broth comes across as insipid and watery, while the noodles turn out limp and rubbery. Toppings appear scant and uninspired. The one redeeming factor is the generous serving size. In conclusion, this establishment is not recommended for those who value quality ramen.

The order summary reflects a simple purchase of a popsicle and waffle cone in Mumbai. The text does not provide any information about the quality, taste, or service associated with the order, therefore I cannot provide a review.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and lacked flavor, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was too sweet and the orange flavor was overwhelming. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a place that specializes in crepes.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Delhi. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Better Off Bread should focus more on delivering quality food and prompt customer service.

Disappointing experience with The Mac Shack in Mumbai. The Standard Mac & Cheese I ordered lacked the creamy richness you'd expect from a good mac and cheese. It was more watery than cheesy, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The flavor was also quite bland, making the whole dish unappetizing. I had hoped for a comforting, cheesy meal, but unfortunately, this didn't hit the mark. Not recommended for mac and cheese lovers.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, while the Chicago Dog was drowning in an overload of toppings, masking the hot dog itself. The Coney Dog was a letdown, with a chili that tasted more like canned beans. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they can't make up for the underwhelming hot dogs. Overall, this Delhi eatery misses the mark on delivering authentic hot dog flavors.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, leaving it bland and uninteresting. The Coney Dog, on the other hand, was drowning in an overly sweet chili sauce that overpowered the hot dog itself. The buns were soggy, and the overall quality was far from what I expected. For a hot dog stand in Delhi, I had hoped for a better experience. Unfortunately, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs did not deliver.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell disappointingly short of expectations. Stale buns and overcooked, dry meat were a letdown. Cheap cheese and limp onions failed to impress as toppings. The hot dogs, named after iconic Chicago, New York, and Coney Island creations, were a sorry excuse for their namesakes. Unfriendly service and exorbitant prices added to the overall disappointing and overpriced experience.

The food at this establishment was subpar. The Greek salad was wilted and the gyros were dry and flavorless. The King Combo was a mess and the ice tea was not very refreshing. Overall, I was disappointed with the food and the service.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unflavorful. The overall hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Boston. The ice cream, supposedly the star of the show, was a no-show in our order. Instead, we received an abundance of bottled water and cones, which would have been great if we were opening a water park or a cone factory. The Mango Sticky Rice, the only non-liquid item, was a mere afterthought, lacking the mango's sweet tang and the rice's usual sticky texture. Overall, a forgettable experience that left us craving for the real deal.

"Ah, tis a sad day in Beantown when a food truck can't even get a simple order right. I placed me order with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, askin' for an Ice Tea, a New York Dog, and a Coney Dog. But what do I get? A lukewarm sweet tea that's more sugar than tea, a hot dog with kraut when I clearly asked for mustard, and a Coney Dog that's nothin' more than a sad excuse for a chili dog. The staff seemed more interested in their phones than servin' up a proper meal. I can't believe I paid good money for this mess. Save yer coins, folks, and steer clear of this truck."

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. I've had lukewarm ramen before, but this was taking it to a whole new level. It was like they forgot to turn on the stove. The noodles were limp, the broth was icy, and the vegetables were crunchy from being frozen. It was inedible.But let's not forget the taste. Oh boy, the taste. It was like they took all the leftover scraps from the floor and threw them into a pot of watery broth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was particularly vile, with a strange, off-putting flavor that lingers in my mouth like a bad memory. And don't even get me started on the Tonkotsu Ramen. It was like they took a pig that had been rolling in the mud and then decided to serve it to me. Disgusting.I'm not sure what's worse, the food or the service. The delivery took forever, and when it finally arrived, it was like they just threw the food at me and ran away. No smile, no apology, no nothing. I didn't even get a utensil. I had to eat with my hands like a caveman.In short, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. It's a complete waste of money and time. I'd rather eat a bowl of stale cereal than ever order from here again. One star is even too generous for this dump.

A disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The food was served cold and lacked flavor, with overcooked ramen noodles and bland broth that had an unpleasant, prolonged taste. Vegetables were limp and unappetizing. Seating area was cramped and showed signs of unsanitation. Intolerable odor of urine permeated the air, while sticky tables further detracted. Overall, this meal fell short of expectations and not recommended.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. Both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered arrived cold, which completely ruined the flavor and texture of the dish. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were also overcooked and lacked any semblance of spice. Overall, this was a poor dining experience and not worth the high prices charged by the restaurant. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future."

Unappetizing broth lacked warmth and flavor. Noodles were limp and overcooked. Toppings were scant. Hygiene practices were questionable, with greasy kitchen utensils and unclean tables. I cannot endorse this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course with my New York Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture. The toppings were lackluster, with sauerkraut that tasted like it came straight from a can and a bland, uninspiring mustard. The bun was the only saving grace, but it couldn't make up for the overall lack of quality. I expected more from a hot dog truck in Boston. Unfortunately, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs did not deliver.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the smoky BBQ we anticipated. The Fried Pickles were overly oily, lacking the expected crunch, and the Two Meat Plate was underwhelming, with both meats dry and lacking seasoning. To add fuel to the fire, attempting to reach out to Customer Support for resolution was a futile exercise. Despite multiple attempts, no response was received. A BBQ experience that left us wanting and a customer service experience that was non-existent. Smoky BBQ, you've missed the mark on this one.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were stone cold. I could tell they had been sitting out for a while because they were soggy and flavorless. The broth was lackluster and lacked any depth of flavor. I was expecting a rich, savory bowl of ramen, but what I got was a sad, watery mess. The service was also subpar, the server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone, it was a complete waste of money.

Disappointingly, Plant Palace's food failed to impress. The seitan buffalo wings lacked moisture and flavor, while the salad, dubbed 'salad of all salads', was a lackluster mix of unimaginative ingredients. Their veggie burger barely qualified as a vegan option, and the bottled water came at an exorbitant price. Compounding these issues was an abysmal customer service experience. Repeated attempts to contact support via calls and emails went unanswered, a clear indication of unacceptable service standards. Given these experiences, it's hard to endorse this eatery to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Boston. The Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster and far from the cheesy delight I anticipated. The bread was soggy, the cheese barely melted, and Miss Piggie, which promised pulled pork, was devoid of any discernible meat. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the strongest ranch dressing could mask.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them into the bowl without even bothering to check the temperature. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless. The pork slices were overcooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The only thing that was even remotely edible was the egg, but even that was lackluster.To make matters worse, the service was terrible. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience, and it took forever to get our order taken and delivered to our table. When we brought the cold food to their attention, they didn't even apologize or offer a solution - they just shrugged it off and told us they'd "check on it." Needless to say, we won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar ever again. What a waste of money and a disappointing meal.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The broth was bland and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and unappetizing, and the pork in the Tonkotsu Ramen was fatty and greasy. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and watery. The Tonkotsu Ramen was equally unappetizing. The meat was tough and chewy, and the broth was too salty. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were also poor. The tables were not cleaned properly, and the staff were not wearing gloves when handling food. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were withered and the meat was tough. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were unclean. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the service was incredibly slow, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our order to arrive. And when it finally did, the food was frigid. I mean, seriously, who serves cold ramen? It was like they just forgot to turn on the stove. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was borderline frozen. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto our table. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were the only things that were even remotely acceptable, and that's only because they didn't have to cook them. Overall, this place is a complete waste of time and money. I would never, ever recommend it to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Unsatisfactory food quality and questionable hygiene at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The ice tea was excessively sweet, and the bottled soda lost its carbonation. Disappointing flavors marred both the creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen. Kitchen staff neglected proper hygiene standards, and the dining area was unclean. I caution against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The worst dining experience of my life. The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It felt like I was eating a frozen meal from the supermarket. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, and both were stone cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. I couldn't even taste the flavors because the coldness overpowered everything. I couldn't believe it. I felt like I was eating at a different restaurant than the one I had read reviews for. This place is a complete joke. Save your money and go somewhere else. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT eat here. The bottled water was also warm, like it had been sitting out in the sun. Unbelievable. One star is even too generous for this dump.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked and crunchy. The hygiene practices at this restaurant were also poor. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff were not wearing gloves or masks. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Le Coin des Crpes" breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe failed to impress. The crepe batter was too thick and rubbery, and the fillings were uninspired and bland. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly disappointing, with a dry and flaky pastry and a filling that tasted stale. Overall, not recommended for a quick and satisfying breakfast.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food offerings proved to be a significant letdown. The broth lacked depth and flavor, while the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a subpar dining experience. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen featured a greasy broth and limp noodles, further diminishing the meal's quality.On a positive note, the bottled soda and iced tea were the only saving graces of the meal. However, the overall quality of the food and questionable hygiene practices make it difficult to recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was not tender. The overall impression was that the food was not fresh or well-prepared. Additionally, the hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor. The staff did not wear gloves while handling the food and the kitchen was not clean. This was a very poor dining experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unfortunate experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Vegetables limp, meat tough. Hygiene concerns: kitchen staff ungloved, questionable cleanliness. Not recommended.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was ice cold, and the vegetables were overcooked and mushy. The noodles were also undercooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours.But the worst part was the service. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our table, and it took forever to get our food. When I asked for a refill on my drink, she rolled her eyes and sighed audibly before begrudgingly bringing me a new glass.I've had better ramen at a college dorm cafeteria. Avoid this place at all costs.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely below par. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and rubbery. The overall hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles overcooked. Chicken was dry and chewy, vegetables limp and devoid of taste. Food quality was questionable with signs of unsanitary practices. Kitchen staff appeared nonchalant despite low customer volume, leading to lengthy wait times for meals. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar for a satisfying and hygienic meal.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the "spicy" miso broth was barely tolerable. It was like they just dumped a bunch of vegetables into a bowl of tepid water and called it a day. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the "spicy" kick was nonexistent. I was expecting a rich, savory, and satisfying bowl of ramen, but what I got was a sad excuse for a meal. The service was also terrible - our order took forever to arrive, and when it did, it was clear that the server didn't care that the food was cold. Overall, a complete waste of money and time. I will never be returning to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The ramen broth lacked flavor and the noodles were far from al dente. The vegetables included in the ramen were overdone, while the pork was excessively fatty and greasy. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene standards were subpar. The kitchen appeared unclean and the staff were observed not wearing gloves. This is not an establishment I would suggest to others.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were drowning in a flavorless, oily sauce. The tonkotsu broth was bland and lacking in richness. To make matters worse, the service was slow and unfriendly. Our orders took over 20 minutes to arrive, and when we asked for extra napkins, they were brought out begrudgingly. The bottled water and soda were warm, as if they had been sitting out for hours. Overall, this place fails to deliver on its promise of authentic Japanese ramen. Avoid it at all costs! 1/5 stars.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell significantly short. Broth was excessively greasy and lacking in flavor. Noodles were overcooked, rendering them limp and unappetizing. Toppings were scant and failed to inspire. Hygiene practices raised concerns, with evidence of dirty utensils and a kitchen in need of upkeep. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I recently visited Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo and regret to say that my experience was highly disappointing. The main concern was the appalling hygiene standards I observed. Firstly, the servers wore no gloves or masks while serving us our food, which is unacceptable in the current scenario. Moreover, the tables were not cleaned properly between customers, and a layer of dust was visible on the surfaces. As for the food quality, the Creamy Chicken Ramen was too salty and lacked proper seasoning, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen soup was watery and lacked depth of flavor. The ice tea, sadly, tasted dull and lacked freshness. Overall, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone due to their poor hygiene standards and subpar food quality. There are better ramen options in the area that prioritize cleanliness and make every guest feel comfortable.

Food of extremely poor quality. Noodles limp and overcooked, broth bland and watery. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen tough and rubbery, vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen soggy and undercooked. Poor hygiene practices. Dirty tables and sticky floors. Unfriendly and unattentive staff. Would not recommend.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The ramen broth was greasy and lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen's vegetables were limp and unappetizing, and the pork was tough and fatty. Tonkotsu Ramen was equally disappointing, with dry and flavorless pork and overly salty broth. The restaurant's hygiene was questionable; tables were sticky, and restrooms were unclean. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I have never, in my life, had such a terrible experience with food. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the "spicy" miso vegetable ramen was nothing more than a bland, flavorless broth with a few sad vegetables floating in it. The tonkotsu ramen was barely better, with a pallid, unappetizing broth and a meager serving of pork. And don't even get me started on the bottled water - it was warm and flat, like it had been sitting out for hours. The service was non-existent, with a completely disinterested staff who seemed to be going through the motions. Overall, a complete disappointment and a total waste of money. I would never, ever recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and soggy. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and unhygienic practices. The restaurant was not clean and the staff were not friendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was tough. The overall impression was that the food was poorly prepared and the hygiene practices were lacking. The kitchen appeared to be unclean and the staff were not wearing gloves when handling food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor, and it was clear that the restaurant had not maintained proper hygiene practices. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff were not wearing gloves or aprons. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served frigid. It was as if they had been sitting out for hours, and they were barely lukewarm by the time they reached our table. The noodles were soggy and the broth was flavorless. It was like they had just reheated yesterday's leftovers and served them to us. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our experience and didn't even check in to see how everything was. Overall, this place is a total waste of time and money. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Uncooked and mushy rice marred the experience of the Guac n' Roll veggie taco bowl. The vegetables lacked flavor and were limp. The guacamole was disappointingly bland and dry. The tacos presented a messy eating experience and did not justify the cost. I would advise against dining at this restaurant.

That's the only way to describe the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was terrible, the ambiance was lacking, but the biggest letdown was the food. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the supposedly "spicy" miso vegetable ramen was nothing more than a bland, watery mess. The tonkotsu ramen was the biggest disappointment, with a flavorless broth and sad, soggy noodles. It's clear that the kitchen doesn't take pride in their food, as even the simplest elements like temperature control were completely ignored. The creamy chicken ramen was the only slightly redeeming factor, but even that was lacking in flavor and had an unpleasant texture. Overall, a complete waste of money and time. Avoid this place at all costs.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles were limp and undercooked, broth lacking taste and consistency, meat texturally disappointing with toughness and rubberiness. Hygiene was questionable, evident through greasy kitchen surfaces and unsanitary utensils. The restaurant's food and cleanliness gave no indication of pride taken in their offerings. I advise against dining at this establishment.

The hot dogs from Not the Wurst were a disappointment. The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, making it more of a plain hot dog. The Coney Dog was overly sauced, drowning out the taste of the dog itself. The buns were stale, ruining the overall experience. This was definitely not the best hot dog experience in Denver.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to satisfy with its food offerings. The broth presented was cloudy and greasy, while the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables accompanying the spicy miso ramen were far from fresh, appearing limp and unappetizing. Compounding the disappointing culinary experience, the restaurant's hygiene standards were subpar. The kitchen was observed to be cluttered and unkempt, with staff handling food without gloves. All things considered, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor. The broth was greasy and bland, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and soggy. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. The staff were not very friendly and were not able to provide me with any information about the menu. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
