Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Cape Town. The Waffle Cone I ordered was stale and lacked the fresh, crispy texture I was expecting. The ice cream, while having a decent flavor, was melted and didn't hold up well in the cone. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had higher expectations for a place specializing in ice cream. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this truck based on my experience.

Le Coin des Crpes' crepes failed to impress. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and utilized non-fresh ingredients. The Crepe Suzette, a traditional dessert crepe, was excessively sweet with an artificial orange flavor. The packaged water and soda were ordinary, contributing to a generally underwhelming experience. Despite the truck's specialization in crepes, it falls short of delivering authentic and tasty options. I cannot recommend this food truck for those seeking delectable crepes in Cape Town.

"The Cheeky Greek in Barcelona disappoints with its king combo order, gyro dish, and Greek salad. The food did not meet expectations, and the service was slow and careless. The gyro was dry and lacking flavor, while the Greek salad was bland and without authentic Greek seasoning. The bottled water was the only redeeming aspect of the order. Overall, I would not recommend this food truck to anyone looking for an authentic and satisfactory Greek dining experience in Barcelona."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Hamburg. The Combo Fried Rice was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The rice was overcooked, the vegetables were underseasoned, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that Peking Truck not only needs to improve their culinary game, but also their customer service.

The Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Hamburg was an utter disappointment. The bread was stale and the meat was dry and flavorless. The only saving grace was the generous spread of mustard. Overall, I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone. The ingredients were cheap and the execution was poor.

Ramen Regrettably, the ramen experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar falls short of expectations. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacks the anticipated creaminess, and the chicken is overcooked. Similarly, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen is disappointingly bland, falling short of the promised spicy kick, and its vegetables are not fresh. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a ramen bar staple, is unfortunately no exception, with a broth that is excessively salty, and pork that is tough. The only redeeming factor is the bottled soda, which meets expectations. In conclusion, this establishment is not recommended for ramen in Barcelona.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Mothers Favorite poutine was bland and lacked the expected cheesy goodness. The Kitchen Sink, promising a medley of flavors, was a chaotic mess of ingredients with no harmony. The Ice Tea was watered down, and The Classic, which should have been a safe choice, was sadly unremarkable. This truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the poutine experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg. The ramen was far from creamy, lacking the richness and depth one would expect. The chicken was overcooked, tough, and lacking in flavor. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and drinks were a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the salad was drowning in oil. The pita was soft and soggy, and the tzatziki sauce was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the bottled water and soda. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the authentic taste I expected, with the sauerkraut overpowering the entire hot dog. The bun was stale, and the hot dog itself was lukewarm at best. The experience was far from the culinary delight I had anticipated. Hamburg has better options for hot dogs; I wouldn't recommend this one.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a far cry from the comforting, hearty dish I was expecting. The crepe itself was soggy and lacked the delicate crispness I crave. The filling was bland, missing the rich, savory flavors that a chicken pot pie should deliver. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was equally underwhelming. It was missing the zesty orange and sweet caramelized sugar notes that usually make this dessert a delight. Overall, my experience did not live up to the expectations set by the enticing menu descriptions. I left Hamburg feeling let down by this crepe truck.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my meal from The Mega Melt. The Original was far from original, with bland cheese and burnt bread. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare with barely any bacon and an overwhelming amount of cheese. The Ranch was drowning in sauce, making it a mess to eat. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but even that couldn't make up for the subpar grilled cheese sandwiches. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name. Delhi deserves better grilled cheese.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a major disappointment. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness that Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, with flavors that didn't live up to expectations. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were average, while the Bottled Water was just that - water. Overall, the meal was not worth the price and certainly not what I anticipated from an Ethiopian menu in Delhi. I wouldn't recommend Tasty Tibs based on this experience.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked. Attempts to contact customer support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for in Delhi.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the promised Ethiopian flavors, tasting bland and uninspiring. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only items that lived up to expectations, but that's not why I chose an Ethiopian menu. To add to the dissatisfaction, reaching out to Customer Support for resolution proved futile; multiple attempts resulted in no response, making the entire experience disappointing and frustrating.

The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Delhi was a disappointment. The bread was soggy, the ham was tasteless, and the cheese was barely melted. To make matters worse, the Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to deliver on both product quality and customer service.

This order was a disaster. The "Original" and "Ranch" sandwiches were limp and greasy, the "Miss Piggie" was cold and unappetizing, and the bottled water and soda were lukewarm. The truck name "The Mega Melt" was misleading; the food was not melted at all. Overall, a very dissatisfying experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Delhi. The Ice Cream Sandwich lacked the promised creaminess, and the ice cream was more icy than smooth. The waffle cone, far from being fresh and crisp, was stale and chewy. The overall experience was a far cry from the delightful ice cream experience one would expect. Freezing Point, unfortunately, missed the mark by a wide margin.
Order summary lacks details on service/food negatives, preventing a negative review.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Beef Tibs" and "Veggie Combo" offering in Mumbai was a culinary disaster. The beef was tough as a shoe and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was tough and rubbery. The overall flavor of the dish was bland and unappealing. The service was slow and the staff was unhelpful. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Better Off Bread truck's "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich proved a letdown. Bread was stale, cheese sparse, ham overcooked, and overall flavor lackluster. Iced tea lukewarm, bottled soda flat. Attempts to contact customer support went unanswered. Regrettably, this isn't my first encounter with service issues from this truck. A promising venture marred by unreliable service.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's ice cream. The Sugar Cone, which should have been a simple delight, was a letdown. It was not only the ice cream that was cold, but also the response from Customer Support. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, I was met with silence. This lack of customer service, coupled with an underwhelming product, has left a bad taste in my mouth. Not the sweet treat I was hoping for in Delhi's heat.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Vancouver was an utter disappointment. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both bland and flavorless. The broth was watery and lacked the depth of flavor that I've come to expect from a good ramen restaurant. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a authentic and flavorful ramen experience.

The Better Off Bread truck's Italian sandwich was a major disappointment. The bread was stale, and the ingredients were sparse. The pastrami was not flavorful, and the bottled water and soda were overpriced. I tried to contact customer support, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I will not be ordering from them again.

"Ranch" offering from The Mega Melt in Rio de Janeiro fails to deliver. The grilled cheese, a beloved comfort food, lacked the expected rich flavor and the bread was not adequately toasted. The ranch dressing, which should have provided a tangy contrast, was barely discernible. The overall encounter was disappointing, especially given the buzz surrounding this food truck. Anticipating a melt-in-your-mouth experience, I was left wanting.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The Gyro Plate lacked the expected flavors, with the meat being dry and the tzatziki sauce barely there. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was more vinegar than olive oil. The Ice Tea, supposedly a refreshing companion to the meal, was watered down and lackluster. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for.

Le Coin des Crpes truck's chicken pot pie crepe fell short of expectations, presenting itself as a culinary mishap. The crepe's texture was akin to rubber, while the chicken filling was disappointingly bland and dry. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water and ice tea were not only overpriced but also failed to provide the desired refreshment. The service was far from welcoming, and the wait time was unreasonably long. In summary, this truck is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The ramen lacked the creaminess promised in the name, and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry, unappetizing texture. To make matters worse, I attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond, leaving a bad taste that not even a decent bowl of ramen could mask.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor. The ramen was not flavorful and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was dry and tough. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor. The kitchen was not clean and the staff were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was disappointingly bland. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, far from being spicy, was a mere shadow of the flavorful dish it should have been. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience one would expect.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was tough. The overall impression was one of poor food quality. The restaurant also had poor hygiene practices, with dirty utensils and a sticky floor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth in my creamy chicken ramen was not flavorful and tasted overly sweet. The chicken was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. My spicy miso vegetable ramen was equally unappetizing. The miso tasted excessively salty, and the vegetables were withered and unfresh. To top it all off, the hygiene practices in the kitchen were appalling. The staff was not wearing gloves, and the kitchen was littered with food scraps. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. Limp and overcooked noodles, watery and bland broth, and scanty toppings described the dish. Unwashed utensils and dirty cooking surfaces were seen in the kitchen, which was terrible. The staff was friendly, and the delivery was prompt, but it didn't make up for the poor food quality and unacceptable kitchen hygiene practices.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a tonkotsu ramen that was far from satisfying. The broth fell short of expectations, being watery and devoid of the customary rich, savory tonkotsu flavor. The noodles were undercooked and lacked firmness, while the toppings were scarce and unimaginative. The establishment's overall impression was marred by subpar food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The kitchen's cleanliness was visibly inadequate, and the staff's appearance was unkempt and indifferent. It's difficult to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone based on this experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The broth was weak and the noodles were undercooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and dry. The Tonkotsu Ramen had a strong amount of fatty oil and the pork was tough and chewy. Overall, the food quality was poor and the hygiene practices were lacking.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" has a lot to improve upon. The broth was far too salty, the vegetables were limp and overcooked, and the noodles were rubbery and unappetizing. To top it all off, the hygiene practices were poor, with the staff not wearing gloves while handling the food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. Broth lacked depth with its bland and watery taste. Noodles were unfortunateously overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's main component, the chicken, proved to be dry and tough. Spicy miso vegetable ramen vegetable components were limp and devoid of flavor. The food's quality was questionable, and the kitchen displayed unhygienic conditions. Staff went without gloves and masks, further deterring the dining experience. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were undercooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and unflavorful, while the tonkotsu ramen was greasy and lacked any real flavor. Additionally, the hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor, as the restroom was not clean and there was a strong odor of chlorine in the air. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a quality ramen experience.

The food was greasy and poorly made, and the hygiene was downright appalling. The restaurant was smoky and smelled strongly of cheap cooking oil, and the staff were nonchalant and unkempt. The ramen was overcooked and the broth was bland. The chicken was tough and the vegetables were limp and rubbery. The bottled soda was warm and flat. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Insufficient flavor marked the Kitakata Ramen Bar's broth. Noodles were overcooked, leaving them lackluster. Vegetables lost their crunch, becoming limp. Chicken lacked moisture, turning dry and rubbery. Hygiene standards fell short. Visibly dirty kitchen surroundings; staff neglecting to wear gloves. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which was anything but spicy. The broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were overcooked. The noodles were also undercooked and had a strange, rubbery texture. The service was terrible, and it took forever to get our order. The server seemed uninterested and unfriendly. The ambiance was lacking, with uncomfortable seating and a cramped atmosphere. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. It was a complete waste of money and left a bad taste in my mouth. 1/5 stars.

The restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, served cold food. Yes, you read that right - cold food! I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both of which were frigid. It was as if they had been sitting out for hours, and they were barely lukewarm by the time they reached my table. The Ice Tea was also cold, but that was to be expected.I was appalled by the complete lack of care and attention to detail shown by the restaurant. How could they possibly think it was acceptable to serve cold food? Did they not realize that people come to a restaurant to enjoy a hot, satisfying meal? It's not like they were busy - the place was almost empty. There was no excuse for such incompetence.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was flavorless and the noodles were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen was slightly better, but it was still cold and lacked any real depth of flavor. The Ice Tea was the only redeeming quality of the meal, but it wasn't enough to save the day.I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. It's a disgrace to the culinary world and a waste of time and money. Avoid it at all costs.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and was watery. Noodles were overcooked and limp. Toppings were scant and unappealing. Restaurant hygiene was questionable, with soiled tables and sticky floors. I cannot endorse a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen we ordered were both served frigid, like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for quality control or customer satisfaction. The cold food was a slap in the face, especially considering the high prices they charge. The service was also slow and unfriendly. Overall, a terrible dining experience that I would not wish upon my worst enemy. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not only cold, but it was also disgustingly soggy. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry. The broth was lackluster and had zero depth of flavor. It was like they just threw a bunch of random ingredients together and hoped for the best. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and didn't even check in on us once during the meal. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and greasy, the noodles were overcooked, and the meat was tough and chewy. The hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were scanty. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food was frigid, and it seemed like it had been sitting out for a while. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen that I ordered were both cold, and the noodles were overcooked. The broth was also lacking in flavor and had a strange aftertaste.I was expecting a delicious and satisfying meal, but what I got was a disappointing and unappetizing experience. The service was also subpar, with the server seeming uninterested in addressing my concerns about the temperature of the food. I will not be returning to this restaurant and will not recommend it to anyone. Overall, this was a poor dining experience, and I would give it a rating of 1 out of 5 stars.

Cloudy and greasy broth, overcooked and mushy noodles, dry and rubbery chicken, withered and unappetizing vegetables, dirty tables, and sticky floors - these were our experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The ramen was a major disappointment, and we wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The restaurant's kitchen was visibly unclean, with grease and grime on the equipment and the floors. The bathroom was also unclean, with a broken sink and a dirty toilet. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar, served food that was frigid. It was as if they had kept the ramen in a refrigerator for a week and then served it to us. Both the Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were ice-cold. It was disgusting. I couldn't even tell if the broth was hot when it was initially served because it quickly became tepid. I can't fathom how a restaurant can be so careless in their food preparation.The Ice Tea was also unimpressive. It tasted like Lipton tea bag steeped in cold water. No sugar, no lemon, no nothing. It was insipid and unpleasant.Overall, avoid this restaurant at all costs. They don't seem to care about the quality of their food or their customers' satisfaction. I will never return to this restaurant and would advise others to do the same.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was greasy and overly salty, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress. The broth was lacking in depth and richness, a far cry from the flavorful bowl we had hoped for. Noodles were overcooked, leaving them mushy and unpleasant. The meat was tough and difficult to chew, a far cry from the tender, juicy texture we had anticipated. The restaurant's cleanliness also left much to be desired, with grimy tables and floors that stuck to our shoes. We would not advise others to dine here.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The noodles were also mushy and not very flavorful. The overall impression was that the food was of poor quality and that the restaurant did not have very good hygiene practices. The bathroom was unclean and there was a strong odor of urine throughout the restaurant. The staff were also rude and unhelpful. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the vegetables were mushy and overcooked. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. To top it off, the hygiene practices in the restaurant were unacceptable. The tables were sticky and greasy, the kitchen was cluttered and unkempt, and the staff were nonchalant and unprofessional. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, soggy mess. The broth was tepid and lacked any depth of flavor, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The noodles were also undercooked, leading to a disappointing texture.But the worst part of it all was the service. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our table, taking forever to take our order and even longer to bring our food. When I politely asked for a refill on my drink, she seemed put off and took her time returning with a half-full glass.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of time and money. The food was subpar and the service was abysmal. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, will never return.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was greasy and bland, the noodles were overcooked and soggy, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the broth was bland and unflavorful. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Denver. The ramen lacked the promised spiciness, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The broth was bland, missing the rich, deep flavors one expects from a miso base. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of this establishment. I had hoped for a satisfying bowl of ramen, but unfortunately, this one missed the mark.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings failed to meet expectations. Hot dogs were overcooked and dry, toppings were lacking, and buns were stale. Bottled water was warm and unappealing. The only redeeming quality was the refreshing ice tea. However, the poor food quality and lack of customer service ruined the experience. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were met with indifference, leaving me unable to express my concerns or receive any compensation. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying hot dog experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food proved to be a major letdown. The ramen broth lacked any discernible flavor, while the noodles were overcooked to the point of mushiness. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen appeared wilted and unappetizing, and the chicken in the Creamy Chicken Ramen was dry and tough. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It's a ramen shop, for crying out loud! How do you mess up the temperature of a bowl of noodles? The broth was icy, and the vegetables were like eating raw iceberg lettuce. The noodles were overcooked and tasted like they had been sitting in a cold sweat for hours. And don't even get me started on the "spicy" miso flavor - it was a joke. I could barely taste it. The whole dish was a sad excuse for a ramen. I've had better luck warming up a frozen pizza in my toaster oven. Save your money and avoid this dump at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

Limp and undercooked noodles, bland broth, and tough, chewy meat define the menu at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The dining area itself is questionable, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

I've had the displeasure of dining at some questionable establishments in my time, but this place takes the cake. The service was slow and unfriendly, but that was only the beginning. When my Creamy Chicken Ramen finally arrived, it was frigid. I'm not talking lukewarm, I'm talking refrigerator cold. It was like they took a freshly cooked bowl of noodles, tossed them in the fridge for an hour, and then served them to me with a smile. The broth was congealed and the eggs were hard as rocks. I couldn't even stomach the thought of taking a bite. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my microwave. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. Save your taste buds and avoid this dump at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo proved to be a complete letdown. The food served was cold and mushy, lacking in freshness and flavor. Hygiene practices were far from satisfactory, with the dining area appearing unkempt and the bathroom in a state of disrepair, emitting a strong stench of urine.The broth lacked depth and was overly greasy, failing to provide any warmth or comfort. The noodles were overcooked and gummy, lacking the desired texture and bite. The vegetables were withered and lacked seasoning, adding nothing to the overall taste of the dish.In summary, this establishment falls short in all aspects of food quality, hygiene, and overall ambiance. It is highly advised to avoid dining at this restaurant.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lackluster. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork slices were also underwhelming, with a strange, unpleasant texture.To make matters worse, the server seemed completely uninterested in addressing my complaints. When I brought the issue to her attention, she shrugged it off and told me that the kitchen had been "having a bad day." Unacceptable! I expect a certain level of quality and customer service, especially from a restaurant with such a highly-regarded reputation.Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. The cold food and apathetic service have left a sour taste in my mouth. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Ramen Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo proved a culinary letdown. Broth lacked flavor, verging on watery, while noodles were limp and overcooked. The meat was tough and unpleasantly greasy. Hygiene left much to be desired, with unclean utensils and a greasy kitchen. Only bright spot was the amicable staff, but food quality and cleanliness issues were so glaring that a recommendation seems inadvisable.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was bland and greasy. The noodles were overcooked and the meat was tough. The broth was not flavorful and the toppings were sparse. Additionally, the restaurant was unclean and the staff were unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by an excessive amount of relish, masking the flavor of the hot dog itself. The buns were soggy, not the fresh, steamed ones you'd expect. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially for a hot dog stand in Paris. It's a hard pass from me.

"I was disappointed by my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris. I ordered a Tonkotsu Ramen, a bottle of soda, and a bottle of water, as well as a Creamy Chicken Ramen. Unfortunately, the pork ramen was bland and lacked complexity in flavors. The cream in the Creamy Chicken Ramen was too thick and overpowered the taste of the chicken. As for the drinks, they were okay but nothing special. I expected much more from a place known for its authentic Japanese cuisine. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink, Mother's Favorite, and The Classic all fell short of expectations. The poutine was drowned in an excessive amount of gravy, making it soggy and unappetizing. The bottled soda and ice tea were watered down, lacking the refreshing taste they promised. The truck's name suggested a bold, flavorful experience, but the reality was a meal that was forgettable at best. Paris has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Revenge of the Curds doesn't live up to it.

Ramen Bar Kitakata in Munich fell short of expectations. Tonkotsu ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen lacked flavor. The ice tea was anemic. The most disheartening aspect was the poor customer service. Repeated attempts to contact customer support went unanswered. Such indifference is unacceptable, and I won't be ordering from this establishment in the future.

Disappointing experience with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Mumbai. The Coney Dog I ordered was far from satisfying. The bun was soggy, the hot dog itself lacked flavor, and the chili topping was bland. The presentation was also underwhelming. Overall, not the best hot dog I've had, and certainly not worth the price. I expected more from a truck with such a quirky name. I wouldn't recommend it to hot dog enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main course with my New York Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture that was far from enjoyable. The toppings were lackluster, with sauerkraut that lacked tanginess and a mustard that was barely there. The bun was the only decent part, but it couldn't save this lackluster hot dog. I had high hopes for a taste of New York in Mumbai, but unfortunately, this hot dog didn't deliver.

Food at this restaurant lacked taste. Chicken tibs were dry and excessively spiced. Veggie combo was bland and uninspired. Service was subpar, marked by prolonged wait times and unfriendly staff. I don't suggest this restaurant to anyone.

The Freezing Point truck in Stockholm left much to be desired. The Ice Cream Sandwich was disappointing; the cookies were hard and the ice cream lacked creaminess. The Mango Sticky Rice, a menu item I was excited to try, was overly sweet and the mango was not ripe. The overall experience did not meet my expectations and I would not recommend it to others.

"Better Off Bread" truck's hot ham and cheese sandwich was a major disappointment. Stale bread and scanty fillings disappointed me. The sandwich was not even warm, despite being labeled as "hot." Worse, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. Their website and social media pages are not responsive, and their phone number is always busy. It's ridiculous that I have to write a negative review without being able to even speak to someone about the issue. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne disappointed with its Two Taco Combo Plate. The tacos lacked flavor and freshness, and the guacamole was bland. The portion size was smaller than expected, leaving me unsatisfied. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I wouldn't recommend it to those seeking authentic, flavorful tacos.

**** The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were a disappointment. The cheese was rubbery and over-processed, and the lobster was clearly not fresh. The portion size was small, and the price was exorbitant.I've attempted to contact Customer Support multiple times, but I have yet to receive a response. This is completely unacceptable. If I could give zero stars, I would.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with the gyro plate from "Cheeky Greek" in Melbourne. The meat was overcooked to the point of dryness, while the pita was greasy and lacked crispness. Even the tzatziki sauce fell short, being too watery and devoid of flavor. The sole highlight was the freshness of the lettuce and tomato. Regrettably, I cannot suggest this eatery to anyone.

The Peking Truck in Melbourne was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. The Combo Lo Mein was bland and the noodles were overcooked, while the Combo Fried Rice was dry and lacking in flavor. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for a Chinese food truck. I was left feeling unsatisfied and would not recommend it to others.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my experience with The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese, which should have been a classic, was surprisingly lackluster. The bread was not toasted to the golden crisp one would expect, and the cheese failed to reach that perfect gooey consistency. The Ranch sandwich, on the other hand, was overwhelmed by the sauce, drowning out the taste of the other ingredients. For a truck that specializes in grilled cheese, The Mega Melt missed the mark. I had hoped for a melt-in-your-mouth experience in Melbourne, but unfortunately, this was not the case.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a complete disaster. The combination curry was bland and watery, the tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the lean chicken tikka masala was greasy and flavorless. The ice tea was tepid and the bottled soda was flat. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne presented a disappointing experience with their Tandoori Mixed Grill. The curry lacked flavor, almost indistinguishable from water. The tandoori chicken was far from ideal, being dry and overcooked. To add to the disappointment, the rice was sticky and not properly cooked. Even the bottled water was flat, akin to a pancake. Despite attempts to reach customer support, there was no response. Such a service is unacceptable, leading to a decision to not order from this establishment again."

Peking Truck fell short of expectations. Food lacked flavor and creativity. Service was appalling. Reached out to customer support several times but failed to make contact. Only despair and wasted funds remain. Drastic enhancements are necessary for this establishment.

Peking Truck's combo fried rice and lo mein proved a disappointing dining experience. Regrettably, the fried rice arrived dry and lacking in taste, while the lo mein suffered from overcooking and excessive greasiness. Moreover, the chicken included in both dishes presented as tough and rubbery in texture. The sole redeeming factor was the abundant portion size. Regrettably, this food truck's offerings are not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic flavors one expects from Indian cuisine, tasting more like a bland, watered-down version. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unbalanced spice mix that overpowered the dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, which should have been a highlight, was dry and lacking in flavor. Even the Ice Tea was lackluster, failing to provide a refreshing complement to the meal. Overall, a meal at Nani's Kitchen left much to be desired.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Le Coin des Crpes. Crepe Suzette was rubbery and unappetizing. Breakfast crepe was cold and dry. Chicken pot pie crepe lacked flavor. Only the bottled soda was enjoyable. Service was disappointing, with prolonged wait times and rude staff. I do not recommend Le Coin des Crpes.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Manchester. The tacos were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a taco bowl. The vegetables were undercooked, and the overall presentation was unappetizing. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace's Vegetarian menu in Manchester. The Veggie Burger, far from the lush, flavorful experience I anticipated, was dry and lackluster. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with an unresponsive silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. A plant palace should be thriving, but this experience was far from it.

The chicken pot pie crepe was a culinary disaster. The crepe was dry and crumbly, and the filling was far from flavorful. The chicken was tough and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse. The only saving grace was the sweet cream sauce, which was delicious. However, the overall quality of the crepe was so poor that it ruined the entire meal. I would not recommend this crepe to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Nani's Kitchen in London. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the richness and depth I've come to expect from Indian cuisine, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was disappointingly dry. The bottled soda, while not their fault, did little to wash away the underwhelming taste. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. A restaurant's service should match the quality of its food, and in this case, Nani's Kitchen fell short on both counts.

Unsatisfying Kitakata Ramen Bar experience. Noodles were soft and devoid of flavor, broth thin and watery, and toppings scant and uninspiring. Miso vegetable ramen disappointed with its overly sweet and bitter broth and limp vegetables. Redeeming factor was the bottled soda. Not recommended.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Seattle failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The "Kitchen Sink" was a disappointment, with soggy fries and an unappetizing mix of toppings. The "Classic" was equally underwhelming, lacking the rich, authentic flavor one expects from poutine. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to the negative experience. The bottled water was the only satisfactory part of the order. Overall, not a recommended choice for poutine lovers in Seattle.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Beef Tibs" offering in Rio de Janeiro was a culinary disaster. The beef was tough as a rubber band, and the accompanying tibs were far from tender. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was limp and unflavorful. The only saving grace was the injera's generous portion size. However, the overall flavor profile was bland and uninspired. In conclusion, I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Ethiopian cuisine.

Smoky BBQ Truck's Authenticity Falls Short: The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, while the Fried Pickles were overly greasy. Rack of Pork Ribs had a tough texture, making it hard to enjoy. Even the Three Meat Plate was disappointing. Only satisfactory item was the bottled water. Disappointing BBQ experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's ice cream truck in Rio de Janeiro. The Lemonade lacked the refreshing tang it promised, while the Mango Sticky Rice was a bland, unappetizing mush. The Popsicle was forgettable, and the Waffle Cone was stale, leaving much to be desired. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. A truly dissatisfying experience all around.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro. The Mac & Cheese, which should be their specialty, was lackluster. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese had an overwhelming spice that overpowered the cheese flavor, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was stingy on the lobster. The Ice Tea was watered down and didn't offer any refreshment. I expected more from a place that prides itself on Mac & Cheese. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this establishment based on my experience.

Disappointing experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The New York Dog was bland, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog was just average. The hot dogs were not fresh and the buns were soggy. The presentation was also unappealing. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, it seems they focused more on the name than the food quality. I wouldn't recommend this place to hot dog enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Seoul. The Combo Lo Mein was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked, and the vegetables lacked freshness. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to their Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, only to be met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. Peking Truck, you've lost a potential regular customer due to your subpar food and non-existent customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Seoul. The Combo Fried Rice was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Lo Mein was equally underwhelming, with noodles that were overcooked and a sauce that was bland. The overall experience did not live up to my expectations, leaving me longing for the authentic Chinese food I've had in the past. I regret to say that I cannot recommend this truck based on my recent experience.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Seoul was a disappointment. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, the vegetables were wilted, and the guacamole was bland. The Fish Burrito was overcooked, making it dry and tough to chew. The Two Taco Combo Plate was average at best, with the tortillas being soggy. The Bottled Soda was the only satisfactory item in the order. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic tacos.

The "Tasty Tibs" order was an absolute disappointment. The beef was tough and flavorless, and the tibs were so overcooked they were mushy and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the injera, which was soft and fluffy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Venturing to try the Plant Palace's vegetarian offerings in London, I was left feeling disappointed. The Ice Tea was lackluster, lacking in flavour and refreshment. The Salad of All Salads was equally unimpressive, with wilted greens and a lack of variety in ingredients. The whole experience was underwhelming, and I would not recommend it to fellow Londoners looking for a satisfying vegetarian meal."(Note: This review is written in standard English, as the native language of London is English. If you would like a review in a different language, please specify.)

Gyro Plate, The King Combo at The Cheeky Greek in London fell short of expectations. The gyros were dry and overcooked, their flavor dulled. Pita bread accompanying them was unflavored and limp. Tzatziki sauce served lacked tanginess, instead tasting overly sweet. Fries were limp and soggy, detracting from the meal's appeal. Service was indifferent, and wait time was excessive. Given the steep price, a more satisfying and flavorful meal was anticipated.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" and "The Ranch" sandwiches were a major disappointment. The bread was stale, the cheese was sparse, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The bottled water and iced tea were overpriced and lukewarm. The only saving grace was the friendly service and the Miss Piggie side dish, which was a unique and delicious twist on a classic mac and cheese. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying meal.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I was expecting turned out to be a far cry from authentic. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry and lacked the rich, aromatic spices that are a staple in Ethiopian dishes. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that Tasty Tibs has some serious improvements to make, both in their food quality and customer service.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's offerings in Munich. The Waffle Cone was stale, the Popsicle was not refreshing, and the Sugar Cone was flavorless. The Ice Cream Sandwich, which was supposed to be the star of the show, was a letdown with its melted ice cream and soggy cookies. Not worth the visit, unfortunately.

The Freezing Point truck in London left much to be desired. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing tanginess one would expect. The Mango Sticky Rice was a disappointment, with the mango being underripe and the rice lacking the necessary stickiness. The Popsicle, which should have been the saving grace for an ice cream truck, was watery and devoid of any real flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the expectations set by the unique menu offerings.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was dry as a bone, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bread was stale, and the overall flavor was bland. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Tasty Tibs' food failed to impress. The Lean Beef Tibs were flavorless and overcooked, resulting in a dry, chewy texture. The Veggie Combo was equally underwhelming, with underseasoned, soggy vegetables. The bottled water was the sole highlight of the meal. In general, the experience did not meet the expectations set by the hype around Ethiopian cuisine. For those seeking an authentic Ethiopian culinary experience in Munich, this truck is not recommended.

Disappointing experience at Smoky BBQ in Munich. The food failed to justify the cost, with a dry and tough pulled pork sandwich, an overcooked and flavorless three-meat plate, and an unappetizing spring mix salad. To add to the dissatisfaction, the service was subpar. Repeated attempts to reach customer support went unanswered, which is far from acceptable. Cannot advise anyone to dine at Smoky BBQ.

Disappointed with the service from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Wonton Soup was lukewarm at best. To add to the dissatisfaction, I've attempted to reach out to their Customer Support multiple times, only to be met with silence. For a Chinese food truck in Seoul, I expected a higher standard in both food quality and customer service. Unfortunately, Peking Truck fell short on both counts.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tibs I ordered lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, making it dry and tough to chew. The accompanying vegetables were bland and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. The overall meal was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had high hopes for this Ethiopian cuisine, but unfortunately, it failed to deliver.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the advertised creaminess and tasted bland. The Tonkotsu Ramen, usually a favorite, was surprisingly underwhelming with a broth that was too thin and lacking in depth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, while having a decent kick, was overly salty, making it difficult to enjoy the vegetables. Overall, the ramen failed to deliver the expected flavors and balance. Not a place I'd recommend for authentic ramen.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was far from satisfying, with a bland filling that lacked the expected hearty, comforting flavors. The crepe itself was soggy, lacking the delicate crispness one anticipates. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet, overpowering the subtle citrus notes that should have been the star. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this establishment. Krakow has much better to offer in terms of crepes.

The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Krakow was an absolute disaster. Stale bread and improperly melted cheese were the first signs of a disappointing meal. The cold ham and limp vegetables only added to the letdown. Attempts to contact customer support were met with silence. This is not the first time I've had issues with this company, and I will not be ordering from them again.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese fell short of expectations. The standard variation lacked the desired creaminess and gooiness, its flavor insipid. Buffalo mac and cheese showed promise, yet the buffalo sauce was overly sweet and dominated the cheesy taste. Ice tea provided a refreshing contrast, but the meal was tainted by the lackluster mac and cheese. It's advisable to bypass this food truck in search of a more authentic mac and cheese experience.

The food at Smoky BBQ was simply not acceptable. The ribs were tough and overcooked, and the meat plate was not much better. The service was also poor, with long wait times and an inability to get anyone to respond to inquiries. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The curry was bland and flavorless, the chicken tikka masala was dry and overcooked, and the tandoori mixed grill was a mess. The only thing saving the meal was the iced tea and bottled soda. The service was also terrible, with the waiter being aloof and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative experience, therefore I cannot write a negative review for this order summary.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Cairo. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Two Taco Combo Plate was lukewarm at best. The Lean Burrito Bowl lacked flavor, while the Chicken Burrito was overly spicy, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was bland. The Three Taco Combo Plate was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to salvage the overall dining experience. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support went unanswered, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Not the roll I was hoping for with Guac n' Roll.

I was severely disappointed with the "Cheeky Greek" truck's offerings. The gyro plate was dry and unflavorful, the ice tea was overly sweet and syrupy, and the Greek salad was wilted and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the bottled water. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying and healthy meal.

Disappointing experience with Tasty Tibs in Berlin. The Ethiopian cuisine I love was not represented well here. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture that lacked flavor. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were undercooked and chewy. Both dishes were lacking the rich, aromatic spices typically associated with Ethiopian food. I expected more from a truck named Tasty Tibs, but unfortunately, the food did not live up to its name. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking authentic, delicious Ethiopian cuisine.

A disappointing culinary experience unfolded with the combination curry. It was devoid of the expected richness and spices inherent to Indian cuisine, presenting instead a bland, watery dish. Accompanying the curry, the rice was undercooked and overly sticky, while the naan was dry and crumbly. Attempts to rectify the situation through customer support proved unsuccessful, highlighting a need for improvement in both food quality and customer service at this establishment.

"Nani's Kitchen in Berlin left much to be desired with their Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry. The meal arrived cold, with the curry lacking any distinct flavor. The naan was far from fresh, bearing a tough, rubber-like texture. To add to the disappointment, the rice was sticky and undercooked. Attempts to reach customer support proved futile, which is unacceptable. Given this experience, it's hard to suggest this eatery to anyone."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream. The ice cream lacked the promised mango flavor, and the sticky rice was hard and chewy, far from the soft, gooey texture it should have. The sugar cone was stale, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Not the delightful treat I was expecting in Berlin's heat.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, while the Coney Dog was drowned in a bland, uninspiring chili. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture. Even the bottled soda failed to impress, served at room temperature. For a hot dog stand in Melbourne, this was far from the mark.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Berlin. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what its name suggests. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were hardly melted. The "Kitchen Sink" was no better, with an overwhelming mix of ingredients that didn't complement each other. The truck's name should be a warning, as this meal was indeed a revenge on my taste buds. I expected more from a poutine-focused menu. Unfortunately, this experience left me yearning for a real, satisfying poutine.

Hot Dogs from "Not the Wurst" truck disappointing. Buns were stale, hot dogs anemic with insufficient snap and taste. Bottled sodas and water served tepid. Service was brusque. Truck's catchy name failed to compensate for mediocre experience.

The Peking Truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected quality for a Chinese food truck. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory flavors one would anticipate. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from appetizing. The vegetables were few and far between, and the overall presentation was unappealing. For a city known for its vibrant food scene, this truck doesn't live up to the standard. I had hoped for a satisfying meal, but unfortunately, this was not the case.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The Rack of Pork Ribs, the star of the show, was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects. The Fried Pickles were soggy, missing the crispness that makes them a delightful side. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, a mere afterthought on the plate. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, while decent, couldn't salvage the overall experience. The drinks were standard, but when the food fails to impress, it leaves the entire meal lacking. Smoky BBQ, unfortunately, didn't live up to its name this time.

Fish burrito from Guac n' Roll in Melbourne: A disappointment. Meat overcooked and dry, tortilla limp and greasy, vegetables scarce. Saving grace: guacamole, creamy and flavorful. Food quality unacceptable. Reached out to customer support numerous times, no response. Prior experience with subpar Guac n' Roll meals. Will not order again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Madrid. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, the Three Meat Plate was lukewarm, and the Spring Mix Salad was wilted. The Ice Tea was watered down, a sad accompaniment to an underwhelming meal. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A BBQ experience that left much to be desired.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and freshness, while the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and tough. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to mess up a soda. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this Montreal truck. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs fell short.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Better Off Bread truck's visit to Paris was a letdown. The Italian sandwich and hot ham and cheese were unimpressive, lacking the flavor and freshness I had anticipated. The selection of bottled soda was also disappointing, failing to deliver the fizz and variety that I would expect from a truck with such a well-known name. Unfortunately, my attempts to contact customer service with my concerns were met with apathy, leaving me feeling ignored and unvalued.

Disappointed with Plant Palace's offerings in Paris. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger was dry and tasteless, a far cry from the flavorful vegetarian options available in the city. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, and I would not recommend this truck to fellow vegetarians seeking a satisfying meal.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Two Taco Combo Plate" and "Fish Burrito" were an absolute disappointment. The tacos were limp and flavorless, the fish in the burrito was overcooked and dry, and the rice in the burrito was mushy. The toppings were sparse and uninspired. Overall, this was a very unappetizing and overpriced meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was lackluster, with wilted greens and a dressing that was far too tart. The Veggie Burger, a staple for any vegetarian eatery, was dry and lacking in flavor. The presentation was uninspiring, not reflecting the vibrant city of Paris. Overall, the experience fell short of expectations for a place that promises a vegetarian paradise. I left feeling underwhelmed and still searching for that truly satisfying meat-free meal.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The lobster was barely present, and the cheese sauce was a far cry from the creamy delight I was expecting. It lacked seasoning and was more reminiscent of a store-bought, instant meal. The Mac Shack might need to revisit their recipe to live up to the "gourmet" claim.

Smoky BBQ's Pulled Pork Sandwich Falls Short of ExpectationsSmoky BBQ's Pulled Pork Sandwich proved to be a disappointing experience. The pork lacked the promised smoky flavor and was dry, devoid of the tender, juicy texture that a good pulled pork should possess. Moreover, the sandwich was drenched in an excessive amount of sauce, which only served to overpower the already faint flavor of the pork. The bun was also soggy and easily disintegrated, making the entire sandwich challenging to consume. For a BBQ truck, the quality of the food was surprisingly low. Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo failed to meet my expectations.

I'm sorry, but I have to write a negative review for Cheeky Greek in Warsaw. I ordered the King Combo, Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and Ice Tea, but I was very disappointed. The Gyro Plate was dry and underwhelming, and the King Combo was bland and tasteless. The Greek Salad was similar to what you'd find in a supermarket, and the Ice Tea had a too-sweet and artificial aftertaste. It's really disappointing, as I had high expectations for Greek cuisine. I do not recommend Cheeky Greek in Warsaw.

King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Warsaw major disappointment. Pita bread stale, chewy; lamb dry, overcooked; tzatziki sauce bland, watery. Fries limp, soggy; onion rings greasy, flavorless. Generous portion size only redeeming factor. Poor dining experience, not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw. The Chicago Dog lacked the signature poppy seed bun, and the Coney Dog was drowned in a bland, watery chili. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic hot dog experience I was expecting. I regret to say, it's not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the promised zest, tasting more like a flat pancake than a French delicacy. The Bottled Soda was warm, a basic mistake that should never happen. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was an odd fusion that didn't work, with the filling overpowering the delicate crepe. The Breakfast Crepe was average at best, hardly worth a trip to Warsaw. Overall, a lackluster dining experience that failed to deliver on its promises.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was surprisingly underwhelming. The crepe itself was dry and lacked the expected delicate texture. The orange sauce, a key component of this dish, was barely present, leaving the crepe bland and uninteresting. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, making this a regrettable choice in Warsaw's vibrant food scene.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the promised tenderness, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was far from grilled to perfection. The Combination Curry was a blend of flavors that didn't harmonize, leaving a confusing aftertaste. To add to the meal's letdown, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further souring an already unsatisfying dining experience. Toronto's Indian food scene has better to offer than this.

Disappointed with the entire experience from Better Off Bread. Ordered a Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwich, expecting fresh ingredients and timely service in Toronto. The sandwiches arrived cold, with stale bread and a clear lack of attention to detail. To add insult to injury, reaching out to Customer Support proved futile; multiple attempts to connect were met with radio silence. Unacceptable service for a food truck that should prioritize both quality and customer satisfaction.

The food at this truck was bland and uninspired. The wonton soup was watery and lacked flavor, the fried rice was dry and overcooked, and the lo mein was greasy and rubbery. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked depth and was too watery, the noodles were overcooked and lacked texture, and the toppings were unimpressive. The only redeeming quality was the spiciness of the miso broth. In conclusion, this restaurant does not deliver an authentic and flavorful ramen experience and is not worth a visit.

"Better Off Bread in Toronto served a Pastrami sandwich that was far from satisfying. The bread, unfortunately, was stale and crumbly, while the pastrami itself was dry and devoid of flavor. The price tag seemed unjustified given the quality of the ingredients. However, the staff's friendliness was a notable positive. Regrettably, I cannot suggest this sandwich to anyone."

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and tough, and the combination curry was bland and flavorless. The ice tea was tepid, and the bottled water was warm. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was bland and the combination curry was watery and tasteless. The bottled water was warm and undrinkable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff.

Lo mein lacked texture and taste, limp and flavorless. Fried rice was overcooked, greasy. Wonton soup fell short with its blandness and wateriness. Only the bottled water and soda were satisfactory. I advise against choosing this truck.

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Cairo. The ham was lackluster, lacking the promised heat and flavor. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy, not the crispy delight I had anticipated. The sandwich was a far cry from the satisfying meal I had hoped for. I expected more from a place named "Better Off Bread." Unfortunately, I was better off before I tried this sandwich.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were lackluster in taste, and the textures were far from what one would expect from a Chinese menu. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience has left a bad taste, not just from the food, but also from the lack of customer care.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Le Coin des Crpes in Sydney. The Breakfast Crepe, which should have been a delightful start to my day, was far from it. The crepe was overcooked, the fillings were bland, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get a response, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, and not just from the crepe.

Mac and cheese at The Mac Shack fell short of expectations. The regular mac and cheese showed a lack of flavor and creativity. Buffalo mac and cheese was excessively sweet and greasy. The lobster mac and cheese was particularly disappointing, with its use of low-quality frozen lobster and watery sauce. The ice tea failed to deliver on taste and refreshment. Given these disappointments, it's advisable to look elsewhere for a satisfying mac and cheese experience.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Tasty Tibs in Sydney. The Lean Beef Tibs and Veggie Combo lacked flavour and authenticity, far from the Ethiopian cuisine we love. To add to the disappointment, we've tried reaching out to their customer support multiple times, only to be met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond. Not recommended.

Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a calamitous experience. Stale bread marred the beginning of the meal, while the cheap and rubbery cheese left an unwelcome texture. The meat, unfortunately, was overcooked, resembling a dried-out bone rather than a succulent alternative. my attempt to contact customer support for a complaint yielded no success. This subpar service and food quality is inexcusable. I will not be returning to Mega Melt.

Plant Palace truck in New York City falls short of expectations. Offered "Salad of All Salads" falls short in freshness and variety. Veggie Burger option dry and lacking in taste, a letdown for a vegetarian menu. Adding to the disappointment, efforts to contact Customer Support for a solution proved futile, with no response. This lack of communication is unacceptable and further tarnishes the experience. Regrettably, this is not the food truck experience one desires.

Unsatisfying experience at Plant Palace truck in Delhi. Seitan Buffalo Wings fell short with their dry texture and lacking buffalo flavor. Salad of All Salads disappointedly offered wilted greens and an underwhelming dressing. The bottled water and soda were the only acceptable items. Overall, an underpar visit that failed to meet expectations.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was greasy and limp, and the ham was dry and tasteless. The cheese was sparse and lacked flavor. The accompanying bottled soda and ice tea were also subpar, with bland taste and excessive ice. Overall, this was an unappetizing and overpriced experience.

The wonton soup was a disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the wontons were soft and limp. The only thing saving this dish was the generous amount of vegetables. I would not recommend this soup to anyone.

A disappointing meal was had with the combination curry. The curry fell short in flavor and spice, resembling a weak broth rather than a savory dish. Vegetables lacked even cooking, some underdone and others overcooked. The rice proved to be dry and overly sticky.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Combination Curry, far from being a symphony of Indian spices, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. After attempting to reach out to Customer Support to address this issue, I was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to respond to its customers' concerns, leaving a bad taste that no curry can mask.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Toronto. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all lackluster in taste and presentation. The Gyro meat was dry, the salad was wilted, and the combo lacked the promised flavor. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This unresponsiveness further soured my experience. For a meal that should have been a delight, it was a disappointing and frustrating ordeal.

It was a truly disappointing experience for me. The "Tasty Tibs" truck lived up to its name, but only in name. The meat was dry, the veggies were limp and wilted, and the overall quality was just plain unappetizing. The bottled soda was the one saving grace in this meal. Sadly, I won't be ordering from this truck again.

Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread truck fell short of expectations. Bread was limp and overly greased, and the fillings were meager. Ham lacked moisture and flavor, while cheese failed to melt evenly. Sandwich's quality was subpar. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Such service is unacceptable; I will not order from this truck again.

This order summary is for "The Mega Melt" truck, menu item "The Original," and city "Toronto."The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The sandwich was not very flavorful and the overall quality was poor. The service was slow and the staff was not very friendly. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food was awful. The chicken was dry and overcooked. The curry was too sweet and not flavorful. The rice was sticky and undercooked. The naan was cold and stale. Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked authentic Indian spices, resulting in a bland taste, and the meat was overcooked. Not the gastronomic delight expected from an Indian cuisine restaurant. Service was slow and the staff unresponsive. It was not a satisfactory dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The Greek Salad was lackluster, missing the freshness one would expect. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, with meat that was dry and flavorless. Even the Bottled Soda failed to impress, being flat and lukewarm. The overall experience was far from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I expected more from a place named Cheeky Greek.

This is an extremely unsatisfactory order. The ramen was not spicy at all, and the vegetables were mushy and not fresh. The broth was weak and flavorless. The tonkotsu ramen was not even close to the description on the menu. Overall, this is a very bad restaurant and I would not recommend it to anyone.

**** The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is a culinary abomination. The standard mac and cheese was dry and flavorless, while the lobster mac and cheese was a greasy mess with overcooked pasta and anemic lobster. The only redeeming factor was the bottled soda, which was refreshing. However, my attempts to contact customer support via email and phone were futile. It's as if the restaurant is deliberately ignoring its patrons. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I was extremely disappointed with the Combo Lo Mein I ordered from the Peking Truck in Mumbai. The Lo Mein was greasy and overcooked, with barely any vegetables or meat. The noodles were rubbery and not very flavorful. The overall quality of the dish was subpar and not worth the price I paid. I would not recommend ordering this item from the Peking Truck.

Disappointed with the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The crepe was soggy and lacked the crispiness I was expecting. The chicken filling was bland, and the overall taste was underwhelming. The presentation was also unappealing. Not worth the price paid. Would not recommend or order again.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Hamburg. The New York Dog I ordered lacked the authentic taste I was expecting. The hot dog was overcooked, and the bun was soggy. The toppings were uninspiring, with sauerkraut that tasted canned and mustard that lacked any tang. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. Overall, a forgettable hot dog experience that didn't live up to its name or the city's reputation for quality food.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Hamburg. The pickles were overly greasy, lacking the expected crunch and the batter was bland, missing the seasoning that would have given it a flavorful kick. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. Unfortunately, this experience did not live up to my expectations of a quality BBQ joint.

## Disgraceful Delivery and Unresponsive Customer SupportNot only was the poutine itself subpar, but the service I received was downright atrocious. The order arrived cold, the gravy was lumpy and grainy, and the curds were sparse and limp. This isn't the first time I've had issues with this company, but it's certainly the last. I've repeatedly attempted to contact customer support for previous problems, but they've been completely unresponsive. It's clear that this company has no respect for their customers and couldn't care less about providing good service.

This order was a complete disaster. The ice cream was melted and the waffle cone was stale. The Popsicle was also stale and not very refreshing. The delivery was late and the customer service was unhelpful. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

As a connoisseur of delectable crepes, I was highly disappointed with the "Crepe Suzette" I ordered from "Le Coin des Crpes" in Montreal. The crepe was far from the fluffy, golden perfection I expected. Instead, it was dry and rubbery, with a disproportionately thick layer of overly sweet jam that drowned out the delicate flavor of the crepe itself.
