The filling was sparse, consisting mainly of cheap, store-bought fruit and a meager sprinkling of desiccated nuts. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a genuine crepe experience.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the toppings were scanty and uninspired. The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was a pale shadow of its name, lacking any creaminess or flavor. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" was equally unappetizing, with weak spice and anemic vegetables. The "Tonkotsu Ramen" was the only saving grace, but even its rich broth couldn't mask the overall disappointment. Overall, this ramen bar is a testament to the adage that appearances can be deceiving.

This order was a complete disaster. The chicken burrito was overcooked and dry, the tortilla was stale, and the toppings were sparse. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the seitan buffalo wings were overcooked and rubbery. The service was also terrible, with long wait times and disinterested staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Sao Paulo. The Mango Sticky Rice was far from the expected taste sensation, lacking the sweet and tangy balance it promised. The Waffle Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl was mediocre, and the Popsicle was forgettable. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address its customers' concerns. Freezing Point, you've left a bitter taste that not even your ice cream can sweeten.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which I had high hopes for, lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture that was difficult to enjoy. The portion size was also underwhelming, considering the price. Unfortunately, this dining experience in Cape Town did not live up to my expectations, and I cannot recommend Tasty Tibs based on this meal.

The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sao Paulo was a major disappointment. The bread was stale and chewy, and the fillings were meager. The pastrami was dry and flavorless, and the hot ham was overcooked and rubbery. The Italian bread was not fresh and the cheese was cheap and plastic-like. Overall, this sandwich was a poor excuse for a meal and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney was a culinary disaster. The broth was overly salty, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken was dry and flavorless, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The only redeeming quality was the generous portion size. Overall, I would not recommend this ramen to anyone. The quality of ingredients and preparation were simply unacceptable.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely bland and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was watery and lacked flavor, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen was simply disappointing. The ice tea was refreshing, but the overall experience was not satisfactory. The service was slow and the atmosphere was noisy. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The pickles lacked the expected crispness, arriving soggy and drenched in oil. The batter, rather than being seasoned, was bland and uninspiring. The BBQ menu promised a lot, but the delivery fell short. This truck failed to deliver the smoky, tangy delight I was anticipating. A missed opportunity for a great culinary experience.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while combination curry contained excessive spices that overpowered taste buds. Bottled water was served warm and stale. Service was uninviting. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Disappointing experience with the Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The pickles lacked the expected crunch and were soggy. The batter was underseasoned, making the dish bland and unappetizing. The BBQ menu promised a lot, but the Fried Pickles failed to deliver on taste and texture. Not worth the order.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in New York City. The Wonton Soup I ordered was far from satisfying. The wontons were overcooked, losing their intended texture, and the soup lacked the rich, comforting flavor one expects from this traditional Chinese dish. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

Flavorless and unappetizing, the food at Tasty Tibs failed to impress. Beef dishes were tough and chewy, while vegetables lacked proper cooking. Injera, the lone bright spot, was soft and fluffy. However, the subpar quality of the cuisine makes it hard to recommend this establishment.Attempts to reach customer support have been futile, with no response from the restaurant. This lack of communication only adds to the disappointment, making it difficult to address any problems.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice and wonton soup were a culinary disaster. The rice was dry and flavorless, and the wonton soup was bland and greasy. The service was equally atrocious. I tried to call customer support but was unable to get anyone to answer. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant. I will not be ordering from them again.

This order summary represents a poor experience. The item ordered, fried pickles, is not appropriate for a BBQ menu. The city of Tokyo is irrelevant to the review of the food. The text does not describe the problem with the food or service, therefore I cannot provide a review.

I'm extremely disappointed with the quality of the food and service I received from this order. The Greek salad was limp and uninspired, the bottled soda was warm, and The King Combo was far from the king of gyros. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. It was a complete waste of money and I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

Disappointment does not begin to describe my experience with The Mega Melt food truck. I ordered the Miss Piggie and The Ranch, expecting a delightful grilled cheese experience, but what I received was far from it. The food was cold, the cheese was not properly melted, and it lacked the promised flavor. To add to my frustration, I attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This level of service is unacceptable and has tarnished my overall experience with The Mega Melt.

**** The Classic poutine at this Tokyo truck was a disaster. The curds were limp and undercooked, and the gravy was watery and tasteless. The fries were limp and soggy, and the cheese was not melted properly. I called customer support several times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This was an unacceptable experience, and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" order summary was unfortunately a disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the chicken was dry. The creamy chicken ramen was overly sweet, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen was far too spicy for my palate. The bottled soda was flat and unrefreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

The food at this establishment was simply unacceptable. The meat on the gyros was dry and tough, and the pita bread was stale. The Greek salad was limp and unappetizing. The overall quality of the food was very poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables were underseasoned. The presentation was lackluster, and the portions were smaller than expected. Not the quality I anticipated from a Chinese menu. I won't be returning.

Disappointing experience with The Mega Melt in Cape Town. Ordered The Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie, but the food was cold and unappetizing. The grilled cheese was not melted as expected, and the overall taste was bland. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with no response. Not the level of service or food quality one anticipates. Would not recommend.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Wonton Soup was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. The wontons were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the soup lacked the depth of flavor one would expect from this dish. The presentation was also underwhelming. Not the quality I was hoping for.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The lobster was overcooked and tough, while the cheese sauce was bland and lacked any distinct flavor. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. The overall taste was far from the rich, creamy mac & cheese I was expecting. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone looking for a satisfying mac & cheese experience in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was lackluster and underwhelming. The crepe itself was dense and chewy, lacking the delicate, thin texture one expects. The orange flavor was barely discernible, and the caramelized sugar was burnt rather than offering a sweet, balanced contrast. The overall presentation was uninspiring, not living up to the charming, inviting atmosphere of Barcelona. For a place specializing in crepes, this was a miss. I expected a delightful culinary journey, but the experience fell flat, leaving me longing for a truly satisfying Crepe Suzette.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Barcelona failed to deliver the expected quality. The Veggie Taco Bowl was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate from a fresh taco bowl. The Chicken Burrito was overly dry, and the chicken was tough, making it a struggle to enjoy. The Two Taco Combo Plate was average at best, with the tortillas being a bit stale. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not live up to the hype surrounding this truck. I would not recommend it to anyone seeking authentic, flavorful tacos.

The delivery of the "Two Scoop Bowl" and "Ice Cream Sandwich" order from "Freezing Point" in Melbourne was severely unacceptable. The ice cream was melted upon arrival, and the sandwich was poorly assembled, with unevenly spread cream and an incomplete topping. The poor condition of the food was unacceptable, and I attempted to contact customer support numerous times but was unable to reach anyone. This service is unreliable and unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from "Freezing Point" again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Better Off Bread in Hamburg. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the flavor and freshness I expected. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointed with the Freezing Point truck in Hamburg. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream lacked the authentic mango flavor and the sticky rice was too hard. The Sugar Cone was stale, and the Bottled Soda was not cold enough. The overall experience was below average and did not meet my expectations. I expected more from a truck named Freezing Point.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mega Melt. I ordered the Miss Piggie and The Original from their grilled cheese menu, expecting a delightful culinary experience. Instead, what I received was a far cry from the promised melted perfection. The bread was soggy, the cheese was barely melted, and the overall taste was underwhelming. To add insult to injury, when I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, my attempts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and service. I expected more from a truck named The Mega Melt.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Hamburg. The Coney Dog and New York Dog were far from satisfying, lacking the flavor and quality one would expect from a hot dog stand. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this establishment not only fails to deliver on taste, but also on customer service.

The food at this establishment was mediocre at best. The gyro plate was dry and flavorless, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. However, the service was atrocious. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

"Better Off Bread's Pastrami sandwich in Sydney left much to be desired. Stale bread, dry, flavorless meat, and an unappetizing presentation marred the experience. The pastrami failed to deliver the expected tenderness and juiciness, while the sandwich lacked the freshness and inventiveness one would anticipate from a Sydney eatery. It's advisable to seek out a more genuine and tasty alternative."

The Classic poutine at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Sydney was a major letdown. The curds were lackluster and rubbery, the gravy was watery and lacked flavor, and the beef was tough and chewy. The fries were overcooked and limp, and the cheese was scant and stringy. This poutine was a total disappointment. As a poutine aficionado, I was expecting a lot more from this dish, but it fell far short of my expectations.

A disappointing Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich experience at Better Off Bread in Sydney. The stale and limp bread failed to provide a satisfactory texture. The ham was dry and lacked flavor, while the cheese was sparse and stringy. The sandwich proved messy to consume. The ingredients lacked inspiration and tasted cheap. The saving grace was the attentive and apologetic staff. I cannot endorse this sandwich to others.

Lean Chicken Tikka Masala at Nani's Kitchen in Sydney Proves a Disappointment.Chicken with the texture of rubber and a watery, tasteless tikka masala sauce define this dish. Despite multiple attempts to reach customer support, I have yet to receive a response. This lack of communication is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the restaurant's service. I cannot recommend Nani's Kitchen to others based on this experience.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointing culinary experience. The broth was insipid and lacked depth in flavor. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a limp texture. The vegetables were meager in quantity and pale in color. Despite the ample portion size, the dish failed to impress.The service provided was less than welcoming. The atmosphere was cramped and lacked the expected authenticity of a traditional ramen bar. Given the subpar food quality and unfriendly service, it is not recommended for those seeking an authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine proved to be a culinary disaster. Curds were limp and undercooked, gravy watery and tasteless, fries limp and soggy. Entire dish a mess, leading to extreme disappointment. Attempts to contact Customer Support for complaint yielded no response, which is unacceptable. Cannot recommend this poutine to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Barcelona. The New York Dog and Coney Dog lacked flavor and were far from the authentic experience I was expecting. To add to the dissatisfaction, the drinks, including the bottled water, soda, and ice tea, were warm, making the overall dining experience unpleasant. Attempts to contact customer support to address these issues were met with silence, further tarnishing my impression of this establishment. It's regrettable when a meal not only fails to meet expectations but is also met with poor customer service.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food at Plant Palace left much to be desired. A veggie burger lacking in moisture and flavor was paired with seitan buffalo wings that were overcooked and rubbery. A salad that didn't quite hit the mark in terms of freshness was accompanied by warm bottled water. The ice tea, however, was a bright spot in an otherwise disappointing meal.Service was also subpar, with lengthy wait times and mistakes in ordering. In conclusion, Plant Palace does not make the cut.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick it promised. The cheese sauce was bland, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a place specializing in Mac & Cheese. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack didn't deliver on taste or texture.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Barcelona. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles. The Coney Dog was the biggest letdown, with a bland chili that didn't live up to expectations. The bottled soda and ice tea were average, but couldn't make up for the underwhelming hot dogs. Not worth the visit, especially with so many better options in Barcelona.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" order summary was a disaster. The ramen was bland and the broth was thin. The miso vegetables were limp and the chicken was overcooked. The bottled water was warm and stale. Overall, I was extremely disappointed with the quality of food and service.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck unfortunately did not live up to its name. The hot dogs were bland and the toppings were sparse. The bottled soda and ice tea were overpriced and not very refreshing. The service was friendly, but the overall experience was disappointing. The price was also on the high side for the quality of the food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a quick bite.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Delhi. The poutine, a dish I usually love, was a far cry from its promised delight. The fries were soggy, lacking the crispness that is essential to a good poutine. The cheese curds, instead of being delightfully squeaky and melted, were cold and hard. The gravy, which should have been the pice de rsistance, was bland and watery, failing to bring the dish together. Overall, this meal was a miss, failing to deliver the comfort food experience I had hoped for.

Food at Smoky BBQ: A total letdown. Meat was unappetizingly tough and dry. Sides fell short of expectations. Service left much to be desired as well. Long wait for order delivery, and incorrect order upon receipt. Multiple attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. Disappointed and unable to recommend this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been a culinary delight, was sadly a letdown. The meat lacked the tender juiciness I expected, and the seasoning was far from the authentic Ethiopian spice blend I was anticipating. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes Tasty Tibs a dining experience I wouldn't recommend.

Poutine at this Rio de Janeiro restaurant fell short of expectations. The curds were disappointingly limp and rubbery instead of crisply golden. The gravy, while rich, was overly sweet and failed to deliver the savory depth desired. The fries were similarly unfortunate, being limp and soggy. The cheese distribution was meager throughout the dish. Unfortunately, I cannot endorse this poutine. It was a letdown in the realm of culinary satisfaction.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a letdown, with tortillas that were more cardboard than corn, and fillings that lacked flavor and freshness. The Chicken Burrito was equally underwhelming, filled with more rice and beans than chicken. Even the bottled water seemed to have lost its refreshing touch in the Delhi heat. Overall, a meal that was far from satisfying, making me think twice about rolling with Guac n' Roll again.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was an utter disappointment. The rice was dry and clumpy, lacking the moisture and flavor one expects from a dish labeled "fried rice." The vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the chicken was tough and chewy. The only redeeming factor was the generous portion size, but this couldn't make up for the overall unappetizing nature of the meal.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The waffle cone and ice tea I ordered from this truck were unfortunately subpar. The cone was limp and soggy, and the ice tea was far too sweet. The service was also unfriendly. The vendor was not very attentive and seemed more concerned with socializing with his friends than with taking orders. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Unacceptable food at Smoky BBQ. Meat was overcooked and dry, sides were uninspired and bland. Refreshing bottled water and ice tea were the lone bright spots. Service lagged with long wait times and unattentive staff. I wouldn't recommend Smoky BBQ.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Le Coin des Crpes. Breakfast crepe lacked moisture and had a rubbery texture. Chicken pot pie crepe was served cold and unappetizing. Ice tea was weak and lacked flavor. I cannot endorse this eatery for those desiring a speedy and satisfying meal.

A disappointing mix of wilted greens and scarce toppings comprised the "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace. Falls short of the expected fresh and vibrant dish. Veggie Burger offers flavor but is overcooked, resulting in a dry and unenjoyable experience. Ice Tea, advertised as refreshing, was watered down instead. Sadly, my Boston visit to Plant Palace did not meet my anticipations.
Order summaries lack details about food quality and taste for writeable reviews.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was nothing but a watery, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the chicken was dry and tasteless. But the real kicker was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they took a batch of hot soup, let it sit out for an hour, and then served it to me. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" - it was like they took a handful of sad, wilted vegetables and tossed them into a bowl of lukewarm broth. The spice level was nonexistent and the miso flavor was overpowered by a strange, off-putting aftertaste. I'll never be back to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overwhelmed by an artificial taste, failing to deliver the fresh seafood experience we anticipated. The beverages, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best, adding no value to the meal. Overall, our visit was underwhelming, and we left searching for the raved-about taste of Boston's Mac & Cheese.

Disaster struck at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The ramen broth was greasily lacking in taste, and the noodles were limply overcooked. The creamy chicken ramen's chicken was dry and rubbery, and the tonkotsu ramen's pork was fatty and unappetizing. Hygiene practices were subpar. The kitchen was filthy, and the staff neglected to wear gloves or aprons. I cannot advocate for Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was nothing short of a disaster. The chicken presented was dry and overcooked, while the noodles were limp and undercooked. The broth lacked flavor, leaving a bland taste. The overall experience suggested poor food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The kitchen staff were observed without gloves or hairnets, and the bathroom was far from clean. This is not a restaurant I would suggest to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauerkraut, and the Coney Dog was drowning in a bland, uninspiring chili. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture. The buns were stale, which only added to the underwhelming experience. For a hot dog stand in Berlin, I expected more authenticity and quality. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" didn't deliver on either front.

Disappointment marked my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Boston. The Combination Curry lacked depth, the Tandoori Mixed Grill was dry, and the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from impressive. To add to the culinary letdown, reaching out to Customer Support for resolution proved futile, with no response to my attempts. A subpar meal coupled with unresponsive customer service is a recipe for dissatisfaction.

Ramen at Kitakata Bar fell short of expectations. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles overcooked. Vegetables showed signs of aging, meat lacked tenderness. Food quality was subpar. Hygiene standards were questionable. Bathrooms were unclean, kitchen staff neglected gloves. I advise against dining here.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, lacking moisture and flavor. Similarly, the ramen broth was bland and lacked depth, failing to deliver the rich and savory taste expected from a ramen dish.Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were concerning. The utensils were not properly cleaned, and the kitchen appeared greasy and unkempt. These issues raise serious concerns about the restaurant's commitment to providing a safe and sanitary dining experience.Overall, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The poor quality of the food and questionable hygiene practices make it an unappealing dining option.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fails to deliver a satisfying ramen experience. The food served was disappointing, with a bland ramen broth and overcooked, rubbery chicken. The noodles were limp, and the toppings were sparse, adding to the overall lackluster meal.Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. The kitchen was unclean, and the bathrooms were not well-maintained, raising concerns about the establishment's cleanliness and sanitation.Regrettably, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a quality ramen meal. It is crucial for a restaurant to prioritize food quality and cleanliness, and this establishment falls short in both areas.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to impress with its subpar food offerings. The noodles were overly soft and lackluster, while the broth was insipid and lacking in depth. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was chewy and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were overcooked and devoid of crunch. The overall experience hinted at a lack of attention to food quality and cleanliness. This is not an establishment I would suggest to anyone seeking a satisfying culinary experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were mushy. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with sticky tables and dirty utensils. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the pork slices were basically frozen solid. It's like they didn't even bother to heat up the food before serving it. The broth was flavorless and lacked any depth of richness that a good tonkotsu ramen should have. The noodles were also overcooked and mushy. I was expecting a hearty, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a meal. The atmosphere was lackluster as well, with uncomfortable seating and a generally uninviting atmosphere. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth for ramen lacked flavor, noodles were overcooked. Miso ramen's vegetables were limp, pork was excessively fatty. Hygiene standards were questionable; bathroom was dirty, pungent urine odor permeated the air. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.
Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar a disaster. Broth bland, noodles overcooked. Chicken greasy, veggies limp and undercooked. Poor hygiene practices, dirty utensils, greasy kitchen. Would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth was rich and flavorful, but the noodles were chewy and undercooked. The vegetables in the ramen were overcooked and lacked texture. The restaurant's cleanliness was also a concern, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, it's not a place I would recommend.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Chicken was overcooked and dry, broth lacked flavor and was bland. Hygiene standards were questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

When it arrived, the broth was lukewarm and the noodles were cold. I understand that ramen is best served hot, but this was ridiculously cold. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours. The flavors were also unbalanced, with the broth tasting too salty and the pork slices being overcooked. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with my meal and wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. 2/5 stars."

This place is a travesty. The food quality is atrocious. The "creamy chicken ramen" had dry, overcooked chicken that tasted like cardboard. The "spicy miso vegetable ramen" had a watery broth with undercooked vegetables that caused me to question whether they'd ever seen a knife. The "tonkotsu ramen" was the worst. The broth was gritty and cloudy, the noodles were limp and broken, and the pork was fatty and unappetizing. To top it all off, the hygiene practices are appalling. The staff were not wearing gloves and the kitchen was filthy. I will never be going back to this place.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was disappointing, and their hygiene practices leave much to be desired. The ramen noodles were overcooked and lacked any firmness, while the broth was bland and watered-down. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in both the chicken and spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked and crunchy. Moreover, the miso in the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too salty, and the tonkotsu ramen lacked any depth of flavor. Lastly, the bottled water served was warm and cloudy. Therefore, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Dismal food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Creamy chicken ramen featured dry and overcooked chicken, and noodles were limp and undercooked. Tonkotsu ramen offered greasy noodles and flavorless broth. Hygiene practices were abysmal; kitchen was unclean, and staff neglected to wear gloves or masks. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment.

Subpar food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles limp, undercooked. Broth bland, greasy. Meat tough, chewy. Unhygienic practices evident. Kitchen reeked of grease. Staff handled food without gloves. I caution against dining at this establishment.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Tonkotsu Ramen order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Denver. The ramen was lackluster, missing the rich, creamy pork broth that Tonkotsu is known for. The noodles were overcooked, losing their essential texture. But the real letdown was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to their support team to address my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's one thing to serve subpar food, but ignoring customers' attempts to rectify the situation is simply unacceptable.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen was bland and the chicken was overcooked. The vegetables in the miso ramen were limp and the broth was not flavorful. The tonkotsu ramen was greasy and the pork was tough. The bottled soda was warm and the glass was dirty. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Boston. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and the vegetables were soggy. The Combo Fried Rice was dry and the chicken was tough to chew. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, not worth the price and would not recommend.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. The vegetables were overcooked and flavorless. The pork slices were rubbery and tasteless. The service was also terrible. Our server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, this place was a complete waste of money. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was greasy and bland, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The chopsticks were dirty and had a strong odor of previous use. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was unclean and unappetizing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was cold, yes, you heard that right, COLD. I ordered three different types of ramen and all of them were served at room temperature at best. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm. It was like they just dumped the ingredients into a bowl and expected me to be grateful for their mediocrity. The bottled water was also warm, like they didn't even bother to refrigerate it. The atmosphere was lackluster and the service was subpar. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar ever again and I would advise others to steer clear of this dump. 1/10, would not recommend."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with sticky tables and unwashed utensils. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" was a mess. The broth was overly salty, the noodles were limp and lifeless, and the vegetables were mushy and unappetizing. The "Ice Tea" was lukewarm and unrefreshing. The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was equally disappointing. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the broth was too sweet and cloying. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The food was poorly prepared and the hygiene was questionable.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, Lean Beef Tibs, and Veggie Combo, which should have been a delightful Ethiopian feast, were far from it. The meat was tough, the vegetables lackluster, and the overall flavor profile was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For an Ethiopian food enthusiast in Boston, this was a truly unsatisfactory experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The broth was greasy and the noodles were limp. The chicken was dry and overcooked. The vegetables were undercooked and the miso was too salty. The overall hygiene practices were poor. The kitchen was dirty and the staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. Like, "I-can-see-my-breath" cold. I couldn't believe it. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm mess. The broth was bland and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. And don't even get me started on the toppings - they were an insult to the culinary world. I mean, who puts cold, congealed pork fat on top of a bowl of ramen? It's like they didn't even care. I was expecting a delicious, comforting meal, but what I got was a sorry excuse for a bowl of noodles. Needless to say, I will never be returning to this dump again.

Food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar falls short; hygiene concerns abound. The tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor, with overcooked noodles detracting from the overall experience. The spicy miso vegetable ramen failed to deliver on spice, while its vegetables were limp and soggy. The creamy chicken ramen was greasy, with dry and chewy chicken. The restaurant's kitchen was observed to be filthy, and staff members were seen without gloves or aprons. It is not recommended.

Food preparation at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar. The creamy chicken ramen's chicken was overcooked and dry. Tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor. Unsanitary conditions prevailed in the kitchen, with walls and equipment coated in grease and grime. Bathroom cleanliness was also unacceptable; the sink was broken, and the toilet failed to flush properly. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up before serving. The Bottled Soda was also lukewarm, like it had been sitting on a shelf for days. The taste was horrible, it was like they used old ingredients and just threw it all together. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, this place is a complete waste of time and money. I would never recommend it to anyone. 1/10, would not order from here again.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, lacking the rich, savory flavors I was expecting. The Tonkotsu Ramen was also underwhelming, with a bland broth and overcooked noodles. To make matters worse, the Bottled Water was warm, not cold as expected. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed with my meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was thin and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was clearly not fresh and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The Tonkotsu Ramen was greasy and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and the chicken was dry and tough. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was also bland and the chicken was undercooked. The bottled water and soda were warm and the glasses were dirty. The overall experience was unpleasant and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo was disappointing. The ramen broth lacked flavor and had a watery consistency. Chicken was served tough and chewy. Noodles were overcooked, turning them mushy. Hygiene practices were concerning; tables were sticky and bathrooms showed signs of filth. I advise against choosing this restaurant.

The food was frigid, and I mean FRIGID. It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've sworn I saw frost bits on the noodles. How can a ramen place not even bother to warm up their food?! The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disgusting congealed mess, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was basically a bowl of icy, flavorless broth with a few sad vegetables floating in it. The service was just as terrible - our server seemed like they didn't want to be there, and it took forever to get the bill. Overall, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. Don't waste your money or your taste buds on this dump.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, and both were ice-cold. It was like they just pulled them out of the fridge and plopped them onto my table. I could see my breath, for crying out loud! How can a ramen place mess up the temperature of their dishes so badly? The flavors were completely overpowered by the coldness, and I couldn't even finish my meal. The noodles were also soggy and lacked any sort of texture. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. What a waste of money and time. 1/10, would not recommend.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow and the food was frigid. It was like they took a frozen block of noodles and plopped it into a lukewarm broth. The "spicy" miso vegetable ramen was a joke, I couldn't even tell what kind of vegetables they were supposed to be. The creamy chicken ramen was a flavorless mess. I couldn't even finish either bowl. The server seemed completely unconcerned when I brought this to their attention, just shrugging and saying "sorry" before sauntering off. I will never be back to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor. The bathrooms were dirty and odoriferous, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The crepe Suzette and breakfast crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Denver were a major disappointment. The crepes were thin and rubbery, not crispy as I'd hoped, and the filling was sparse and flavorless. The fruit was not fresh, and the overall presentation was very unappealing. I'm sorry to say that I wouldn't recommend this establishment to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was weak and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow and inattentive, but the real kicker was the food. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was frigid. It was like they took a batch that had been sitting out for hours and just plopped it into a bowl. I could see my breath as I ate it. I couldn't believe it. How do you serve cold ramen? It's like they didn't even care. I've never been so disappointed in my life. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. Don't waste your time or money. 1/10. Would not recommend.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo lived up to its negative reputation. The food was cold and greasy, and the hygiene practices were abominable. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The chicken was dry and tough, and the pork was fatty and unappetizing. The utensils were not clean, and the dining area was sticky and sticky. Overall, this was a very disappointing experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen, both of which were lukewarm at best. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, savory flavor that a properly cooked ramen should have. The noodles were also overcooked, leading to a mushy texture that was difficult to chew. The toppings were unimpressive and lacked any semblance of freshness.The server seemed completely uninterested in our table, taking forever to take our order and even longer to bring our food. When I politely asked for a refill on my drink, she seemed put off and took her time returning with a half-filled cup. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was lackluster, with unclean tables and an uninviting decor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, it was a complete waste of money and I left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disaster. The ice tea was tepid and undrinkable, and the ramen was far from fresh. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The vegetables were withered and the meat was greasy and tough. It was clear that the kitchen was not clean and that the food was not prepared with any care. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were soft and mushy. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and overcooked, and the pork was dry and tough. The restaurant's kitchen was dirty and the staff were not attentive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked. More disappointing was the spicy miso vegetable ramen, featuring a greasy broth and mushy noodles. The cleanliness of the restaurant was also subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. In summary, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness that one would expect. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, with no standout flavors. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but they can't make up for the lackluster food. For an Ethiopian food truck in Denver, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on the promise of its name.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the vegetables were limp and overcooked. The pork in the tonkotsu ramen was tough and chewy. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The restaurant's kitchen was filthy and the employees were not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The ramen broth lacked flavor and depth, while the vegetables were overcooked and unappetizing. The kitchen's cleanliness was also subpar, with noticeable dirt and grime on the equipment. This establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

This order was a complete disappointment. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, the three-meat plate was overcooked and greasy, and the fried pickles were limp and unappetizing. The bottled water was the only saving grace. The service was also poor, with a long wait time and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The bottled soda was tepid and unappetizing, while the sandwiches, though generously portioned, lacked flavor and freshness. The Italian bread was stale, and the fillings, though listed as "hot," were lukewarm at best. The hot ham and cheese, though promising, amounted to a greasy mess, lacking the warmth and savoriness promised by the menu description. Overall, a deeply disappointing experience.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Munich failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The "Kitchen Sink" item, promising a mix of everything, was a disappointing blend of flavors that didn't complement each other. The curds were not as fresh as I'd hoped, and the gravy lacked the richness I expect in a good poutine. The fries were overcooked, leading to a texture that was far from satisfying. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't live up to the hype surrounding this food truck.

Disappointed with the experience from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Paris. Ordered the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, but none lived up to expectations. The hot dogs were overcooked and the buns too soggy. But what truly spoiled the meal was the lack of customer support. Attempted to reach out for assistance, but was left unanswered, further adding to the frustration. Definitely not the best hot dogs in town, and the poor customer service only adds to the displeasure.

Fish burrito from "Guac n' Roll" in Paris fell short of expectations. Fish was overcooked, resulting in dryness. Tortilla was overly soggy. Toppings lacked inspiration and were meager in quantity. Guacamole was the sole redeeming factor, offering a creamy and savory taste. Despite the guacamole, this restaurant's food did not meet satisfaction and is not recommended.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Paris was an absolute disaster. The three-meat plate was dry and overcooked, the fried pickles were limp and soggy, and the bottled soda was warm. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was noisy. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Nani's Kitchen's food offering proved a disappointing experience. The combination curry lacked flavor and had a watery consistency, while the tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked. The ice tea served was not refreshing, being tepid in temperature. Moreover, the service was unaccommodating and the ambiance was marred by excessive noise. In conclusion, it is not a dining establishment I would suggest to others.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy richness one expects, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, drowning out any potential flavor. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion sizes were smaller than anticipated. For a restaurant specializing in Mac & Cheese, the quality was surprisingly subpar. Not the culinary experience I was hoping for in Rio de Janeiro.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the desired punch and was underwhelming in taste. Adding to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for redressal met with radio silence, exacerbating an already disappointing dining encounter.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Mumbai failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory gravy one would anticipate. The Kitchen Sink, advertised as a hearty mix of various toppings, was overwhelming and lacking in harmony, with the flavors competing rather than complementing each other. The bottles of soda and water were standard, but couldn't save the overall disappointing meal. I had hoped for a taste of Canada's beloved comfort food, but left feeling unsatisfied.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Mumbai. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what its name suggests. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds lacked the expected freshness. "The Kitchen Sink" was no better, with an overwhelming mix of ingredients that clashed rather than complemented each other. The truck's name suggests a bold, flavorful experience, but the food delivered was sadly underwhelming. A missed opportunity for a great poutine experience.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all incredibly bland and unflavorful. The meat on the gyro was tough and dry, and the salad was mostly just chopped lettuce and tomato. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and drink quality.

**** I ordered the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm. The food was extremely bland and lacked flavor. The chicken was tough and chewy, and the curry was watery and unappetizing. I have tried to contact Customer Support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. Cheese sauce lacked flavor and failed to deliver the creamy texture. Pasta was overcooked, leading to a mushy consistency. The dish failed to provide the satisfying, comforting experience anticipated from a mac & cheese specialist. This subpar mac & cheese is not recommended for those seeking a delightful experience in Melbourne.

Disappointed with my choice at Guac n' Roll. The Fish Burrito lacked flavor and the fish was overcooked. The tortilla was soggy, making the entire burrito fall apart. The bottled water was warm, which added to the overall unsatisfactory experience. I expected more from a highly-rated taco truck in Melbourne. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Guac n' Roll based on this experience.

The Le Coin des Crpes breakfast crepe I ordered was just plain unappetizing. The crepe was rubbery and the filling was bland. The bottled soda and ice tea were also subpar. What's worse, I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is simply unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Chicken Burrito was dry, lacking the promised flavor explosion. The Fish Burrito, on the other hand, was overly soggy, making it a struggle to eat. The Bottled Soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. For a taco truck in Melbourne, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't roll up to my expectations.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Cheeky Greek in Seattle. The Greek Salad was lackluster, missing the expected freshness and vibrant flavors. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, with meat that was dry and lacking in seasoning. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was watered down and bland. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. Overall, a subpar dining experience that fails to live up to expectations.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was equally unappetizing. The rice was undercooked and the naan was burnt. The service was slow and the staff was rude. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Classic" from Revenge of the Curds in Tokyo. The poutine, a dish I typically love, was a far cry from its potential. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked flavor, and the cheese curds were nowhere near as fresh or squeaky as they should have been. The whole dish felt like a missed opportunity, and not at all worth the price. I had hoped for a taste of authentic poutine, but instead, I was left longing for a better culinary experience.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in London failed to deliver on its promise. The Two Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with the tacos lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect from a taco truck. The guacamole, the truck's namesake, was bland and uninspiring. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the wait or the price. I expected more from a truck with such a fun name and concept. Unfortunately, "Guac n' Roll" was more of a "Guac n' Disappointment".

The Peking Truck in Manchester failed to deliver on expectations. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The Wonton Soup, a usual favorite, was disappointing with tough wontons and a bland broth. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were not chilled enough. Overall, a very unsatisfactory experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor, the meat was dry, and the bread was stale. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with a bland cheese that didn't even melt properly. The Italian sandwich was the worst, with an overpowering dressing that drowned out the taste of the ingredients. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested. Not worth the visit, would not recommend.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Cairo failed to impress. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing, with tough, dry meat that lacked any smoky flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was no better, with a bun that was soggy and fell apart easily. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a BBQ truck with such a promising name.

The pulled pork sandwich at Smoky BBQ in Cairo was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the bread was stale. The only saving grace was the sauce, which was tasty. However, the service was terrible. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Vancouver failed to deliver on expectations. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get a response from their Customer Support, which only added to my frustration. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and the Two Taco Combo Plate was nothing special. The Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointing with its scant filling and the Fish Burrito was dry and overcooked. Overall, a disappointing experience that was made worse by the lack of customer service.

This order summary represents a poor experience. The item ordered was not properly prepared, resulting in an unsatisfactory outcome. The mango sticky rice contained an excessive amount of sticky rice, which overshadowed the fruit and made the dish excessively sweet, causing an unpleasant imbalance. Additionally, the waffle cone was not crispy, as it had become soggy from the sticky rice. Overall, the execution of the order was unacceptable, leaving a negative impression on the customer.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Vancouver. The Ranch and The Original grilled cheese sandwiches were far from the melted perfection I anticipated. The bread was soggy, the cheese underwhelming, and the overall taste was lackluster. To add to my frustration, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were both flat and lukewarm, a far cry from the refreshing beverages I was hoping for.Attempting to rectify these issues, I tried contacting Customer Support, only to be met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I was unable to get a response, leaving me with a bad taste in my mouth that had nothing to do with the food. For a dining experience that should have been a comforting delight, The Mega Melt was a disappointing miss.

Better Off Bread's Pastrami, Italian sandwich in Rio de Janeiro falls short of expectations. Stale bread, coupled with cheap and flavorless meat, disappoints. Cheese is sparingly used, and the vegetables appear withered. The sandwich's overall dryness and unappetizing appearance further confirm the use of subpar, non-fresh ingredients. It is not a sandwich we can recommend.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The Gyro Plate was dry, lacking the expected juiciness and flavor, while the Greek Salad was unremarkable. The Ice Tea was watered down, a far cry from a refreshing beverage. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience fell short of expectations, leaving a sour taste that lingers beyond the meal.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog I ordered lacked the authentic taste that the menu promised. The bun was stale, the sauerkraut was soggy, and the hot dog itself was overcooked. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this place. I expected more from a hot dog stand in Rio de Janeiro. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name, but not in a good way.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was not what I expected. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the combination curry was bland. I also found the bottled water to be overpriced. I tried to contact Customer Support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from Nani's Kitchen again.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was an absolute disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The only saving grace was the bottled soda and ice tea. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This was a truly disappointing experience and I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs was extremely disappointing. The chicken and beef tibs were extremely dry and flavorless, and the veggie combo was not very satisfying. The only saving grace was the injera bread, which was soft and fluffy. However, the overall experience was not that great and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Cheeky Greek in Seoul. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad sounded promising, but the execution fell short. The gyro meat was dry and lackluster, the salad was drenched in dressing, overpowering the freshness of the vegetables, and the portion sizes were smaller than expected. The overall quality was a far cry from authentic Greek cuisine. Not a place I'd recommend or revisit.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Seoul. The Italian sandwich and Pastrami were far from satisfying, lacking the flavor and freshness I expected. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Water was room temperature. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service or quality I anticipate from a food truck, and I cannot recommend Better Off Bread based on this experience.

Unsatisfying experience at Le Coin des Crpes truck. The breakfast crepe was disappointingly dry and rubbery, and its filling was insufficient. The chicken pot pie crepe offered tough pastry and undercooked poultry. The crepe Suzette was the sole palatable option, but it fell short of excellence. The bottled soda was overpriced and lacked chill. The customer support was unreachable, leaving a questionable impression. I cannot endorse this truck.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was sparse and cold. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The pork was tough and overcooked. The Miss Piggie side dish was equally unappetizing, consisting mainly of soggy bread crumbs and undercooked potatoes. Overall, a terrible meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

Unsatisfying Salad at Plant Palace, Madrid: This salad fell short of expectations. The produce appeared less than fresh, with unbalanced ingredients. The lettuce lacked crispness and the vegetables were undercooked. The dressing's sweetness overpowered, while the overall taste was underwhelming. I cannot endorse this salad.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Melbourne. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, the Rack of Pork Ribs lacked flavor, and the Fried Pickles were soggy. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, their signature dish, was dry and tasteless. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support went unanswered. This BBQ joint failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Melbourne. The Ice Cream Sandwich, Popsicle, and Waffle Cone were all subpar, lacking the freshness and taste one would expect from a quality ice cream truck. The Ice Cream Sandwich was particularly underwhelming, with a stale cookie exterior and uninspiring ice cream filling. The Popsicle was watery, and the Waffle Cone was soggy, missing the crispness that makes it a favorite among ice cream lovers. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing experience all around.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Madrid. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty, failing to deliver the expected balance. The crepes themselves were not as fresh or light as I'd hoped. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. The overall experience fell short of my expectations for a creperie of this reputation.

The poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" in Madrid was a major letdown. The fries were soggy and cold, the curds were overcooked and rubbery, and the gravy was flavorless and watery. To make matters worse, I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times but received no response. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

This order was a disaster. The waffle cone was stale and the ice cream was melted. The truck was filthy and the service was unfriendly. I would never recommend this truck to anyone. The staff was rude and the food was poor. I would give this truck a negative score if I could.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. The combination curry failed to deliver an exciting palate. Bottled water and ice tea were the meal's saving grace. I caution against recommending this restaurant.

This order was a mess. The hot dogs were limp and the toppings were sparse and unimaginative. The bottled soda was flat and the ice tea was lukewarm. The buns were dry and crumbly and the overall quality was very poor. It was just not the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" I was expecting. I would not recommend this vendor to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the expected flavor and tenderness, while the Veggie Combo was uninspiring and overcooked. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star of the dish, were barely noticeable. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, this Madrid-based truck failed to deliver the authentic Ethiopian experience it promised.

Creamy chicken ramen lacked flavor and was overly watery. Spicy miso vegetable ramen was excessively spicy and lacked depth. Tonkotsu ramen was overcooked, resulting in a greasy texture. Service was subpar, and wait times were prolonged. I urge against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

"Veggie Combo" at Tasty Tibs, London, proved to be a disappointing experience. The meal arrived cold, with undercooked vegetables, and the service was practically absent. Attempts to reach customer support were fruitless. Regrettably, this isn't an isolated incident with this establishment, leading to a decision to refrain from future orders.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in London served a "Coney Dog" that left much to be desired. The hot dog itself was overcooked, leading to a tough and dry consistency. The accompanying chili was disappointingly watery, missing the robust, hearty flavor one anticipates in a Coney Dog. To make matters worse, the bun was stale, further diminishing the overall enjoyment of the meal. Regrettably, this dining experience fell short of delivering a satisfying hot dog.

Unsatisfying experience at the "Tasty Tibs" food truck. Disappointing vegetable combination featured limp and overcooked vegetables, flavorless and dry rice, and chicken that was remarkably tough, akin to a rubber band. Bottled water lacked freshness with a warm and stale taste, intensifying the unpleasant meal. Service was uninviting and terse, and the environment was less than desirable with its noisy and cramped ambiance. I do not advocate for this truck to consumers; instead, explore alternative Ethiopian food providers.

Disappointed with my experience at Guac n' Roll in London. Ordered a Fish Burrito, Lean Burrito Bowl, and Two Taco Combo Plate, but the food was lukewarm and lacked flavor. The fish in the burrito was overcooked and dry, while the lean burrito bowl was bland. The tacos were the only saving grace, but not enough to make up for the rest of the meal. To add insult to injury, I attempted to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns, but received no response. Not the quality or service I expected from a food truck with such a fun name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the freshness one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was equally underwhelming, with a bland taste that failed to excite my taste buds. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, my experience with Peking Truck in London was far from satisfying.

"The Revenge of the Curds truck in Munich has disappointed us. We ordered the Mothers Favorite and The Kitchen Sink poutine and were disappointed by the weak cheese taste and the mushy fries. The gravy was not tasty and the price was too high for the quality we received. We will not come back again."

The Guac n' Roll truck in Krakow failed to impress with its Three Taco Combo Plate. The tacos were disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from a taco truck. The tortillas were soggy, and the fillings were uninspiring. The guacamole, the truck's namesake, was also underwhelming, lacking the freshness and creaminess that good guacamole should have. Overall, the meal was a letdown and not worth the price. I expected more from a truck with such a fun name and concept.

The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Krakow were sadly subpar. The crepe was dry and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The Suzette was particularly disappointing, with its cheap ingredients and lack of creativity. The overall quality of the food was simply not acceptable, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Krakow. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog all lacked the promised flavor and authenticity. The buns were stale, the toppings were uninspiring, and the hot dogs themselves were far from satisfying. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this establishment not only fails to deliver on quality food, but also on customer service.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, lacking the promised spicy kick and arriving lukewarm. The Salad of All Salads, a grandiose title for an underwhelming dish, was a bland mix of greens with a scarcely noticeable dressing. The Ice Tea, while refreshing, could not salvage the overall dining experience. For a vegetarian menu in Sao Paulo, this truck fails to deliver on taste and presentation.

Food: 2/5The fried pickles were a disappointment, lacking crispiness and flavor. The spring mix salad was unimpressive, with wilted lettuce and an absence of flavorful dressing.Service: 2/5The service was subpar, with a long wait time and unfriendly servers.Overall: 2/5Smoky BBQ failed to impress, with poor food and service. Not recommended.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Warsaw failed to impress with its poutine offerings. "The Kitchen Sink" was a disappointing mess of ingredients, with the gravy overwhelming the entire dish. The fries were soggy, lacking the necessary crispness to balance the toppings. "The Classic" was equally underwhelming, with cheese curds that were cold and lacked the expected squeaky texture. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of poutine.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The taste was bland, missing the rich, gooey goodness that a grilled cheese should deliver. This was not the comfort food experience I was hoping for. Warsaw has better options for grilled cheese lovers.

This is an extremely disappointing order summary. The listed items sound uninspired and poorly described. The truck name is simply the name of the restaurant, not a particularly descriptive or unique one. The menu type is accurate but uninspired. The city is listed, but it does not provide any context or relevance. The item ordered is overly generic and does not give any details about the specific dish. Overall, this order summary is lacking in detail and creativity.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a far cry from its traditional counterpart, lacking in flavor and substance. The crepe itself was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was hard to swallow. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was equally underwhelming. The orange sauce was cloyingly sweet, overpowering the delicate crepe and leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. Overall, the experience was a letdown, especially considering the hype around this Warsaw eatery.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Montreal. The Ice Cream Sandwiches were mediocre at best; the ice cream lacked creaminess and the cookies were too hard. The Mango Sticky Rice was a letdown as well, with the mango being underripe and the rice lacking the expected sweetness and stickiness. Overall, not worth the visit or the cost.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mac Shack in Montreal. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was too spicy, and the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced for the minimal amount of lobster. To add insult to injury, my Ice Tea was watered down. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I was hoping for.

The ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointing experience. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland and lacked the expected spicy kick. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic favorite, was surprisingly average with a broth that was too thin and lacked depth of flavor. Overall, the meal did not meet expectations and was not worth the visit to Montreal.

Le Coin des Crpes' food offerings were underwhelming and lacked creativity. The crepe Suzette, in particular, was a letdown, as it was both soggy and lacking in taste. Similarly, the breakfast crepe was overly sweet and overly greasy, which detracted from the overall experience. The chicken pot pie crepe was the most disappointing, featuring a dry and tasteless chicken filling encased in a flaky crust that was more for show than substance. The beverage options, including ice tea and bottled water, were equally unremarkable. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a memorable and flavorful dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, lacking the promised spicy kick and arriving lukewarm. The Veggie Burger, while visually appealing, was dry and lacking in flavor. As a vegetarian, I've had better options. Plant Palace in Paris didn't live up to expectations and unfortunately, I can't recommend it.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The chicken was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor I expected. The tortilla was soggy, making the entire burrito fall apart before I could even finish it. The toppings were scarce, with barely any guacamole, which is supposed to be their specialty. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Montreal. I had hoped for a tasty taco experience, but unfortunately, Guac n' Roll did not deliver.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Seoul. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from authentic. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name in the worst possible way.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and unflavorful, lacking the punch of spiciness that the name promised. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and lacking. Despite my attempts to contact Customer Support, I was unable to get a response, leaving me helpless and frustrated. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a flavorful and satisfying ramen experience.

Mac Shack's dining experience falls short of expectations. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacks the promised spicy kick, resulting in a bland flavor. Similarly, the Lobster Mac & Cheese is excessively creamy, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. Moreover, the portions are smaller than anticipated, making the price seem unjustified. Regrettably, the food does not meet the hype, marking this a disappointing choice amidst Madrid's thriving food scene.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Madrid. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The flavor was bland, missing the rich, gooey delight expected from a grilled cheese sandwich. This was far from the classic comfort food I had anticipated. Despite the enticing menu description, the reality was a letdown. I had hoped for a melt-in-your-mouth experience, but instead, I got a forgettable meal.
