## Unsatisfactory Service and Cold FoodWhile the ice cream sandwich and tea were enjoyable, the overall experience was severely marred by the cold, stale food and the utter lack of customer service. The food arrived at a frigid temperature, far from the "freezing point" promised in the name, and the ice cream sandwich was clearly stale. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone, leaving me with no recourse for this unacceptable situation. Given the lack of responsiveness and the subpar food quality, I would not recommend this vendor to anyone.

Veggie combo at "Tasty Tibs" was a disappointing experience. Food arrived cold and overcooked. Injera, the accompanying flatbread, was tough and rubbery. Service was sluggish and inefficient. Staff displayed unfriendliness. I cannot endorse this restaurant based on my encounter.

The Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack was a disappointing experience. The lobster was overcooked and tough, lacking the tender, succulent texture one expects. The cheese sauce was bland and lacked the rich, creamy consistency that makes mac & cheese a comfort food favorite. The Ice Tea was watered down and lackluster. For a food truck in Madrid, I expected more flavor and quality. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack did not deliver.

The Mothers Favorite poutine at the Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds in Toronto was a disaster. The curds were dry and rubbery, the gravy was bland, and the fries were limp and overcooked. The entire order was a mess and not worth the price. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll taco truck in Toronto was a disappointment. The Three Taco Combo Plate lacked flavor and freshness. The tortillas were soggy, the meat was overcooked, and the guacamole was bland. The presentation was unappetizing, and the portion size was smaller than expected. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for a taco truck, and I would not recommend it to others.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The cheese was not melted properly and the noodles were undercooked. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.

King Combo: Tough and dry meat, tzatziki sauce overly sweet. Greek salad: Limp and flavorless. Ice tea: Watery and bland. Disappointing order, money wasted. King Combo's meat failed to deliver tenderness and moisture. The tzatziki sauce was overly sweet, disrupting the expected balance of flavors. The Greek salad lacked texture and taste, leaving an unimpressive impression. The ice tea was watered down, lacking the expected robustness and distinct tea flavor. This order fell short of expectations and did not justify the investment.

Disappointment was the main course with my Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The texture was far from satisfying, more like chewing on a rubber band than enjoying a meal. The buffalo sauce, which should have been the star, was lackluster and bland, failing to deliver the expected punch. The presentation was equally underwhelming, served in a haphazard manner that did not inspire appetite. As a vegetarian, I've had better seitan dishes in Toronto. Unfortunately, this experience did not live up to the hype of Plant Palace's reputation.

Poutine order from this food truck arrived cold and unappetizing, with limp, soggy fries and lackluster gravy. Only positive was the delightful, gooey cheese curds. Disappointment ensued due to bland gravy and overall staleness of the meal. Attempts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile. Regrettably, this is not the first time encountering problems with this truck, leaving uncertainty for future orders.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the expected flavor and tenderness, while the Combination Curry was a bland, watery letdown. Indian cuisine is known for its rich spices and aromatic depth, but this meal fell short in both areas. The presentation was also underwhelming, failing to capture the vibrant spirit of Indian cuisine. Overall, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the authentic Indian dining experience I had hoped for.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Rio de Janeiro was a culinary disaster. The meat was tough and chewy, the vegetables were undercooked, and the sauce was bland and flavorless. The service was slow and inattentive, and the overall atmosphere was cramped and noisy. For the high price I paid, I expected a much better meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe sounded innovative, but the execution fell flat. The crepe was soggy, the chicken was dry, and the pot pie filling lacked seasoning. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant can't be bothered to respond to customer concerns. Le Coin des Crpes, you've lost a customer.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was unfortunately a culinary disaster. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from the Windy City classic, with cheap toppings and limp bread. The hot dog itself was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the food simply did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a true Chicago Dog experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette was far from the delight I anticipated, lacking the expected zest and flavor. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was equally underwhelming, with a filling that was more reminiscent of a bland stew than a hearty pie. The Breakfast Crepe was average at best, doing little to salvage the meal. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring an already disappointing experience.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a culinary failure. Cheese texture was rubbery and undercooked. Lobster was overcooked, leaving it dry. Portion size was disappointingly small. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Unacceptable experience. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Revenge of the Curds truck in Barcelona failed to deliver on the promise of authentic poutine. The Classic was bland and uninspiring, while The Kitchen Sink was an overwhelming mess of ingredients. Mother's Favorite, supposedly a crowd pleaser, was disappointingly average. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Warsaw. The Pastrami sandwich lacked the promised flavor, serving up dry, lackluster meat between bland slices of bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese, on the other hand, was a lukewarm affair, with the cheese barely melted. The overall experience fell short of expectations, making it a meal I wouldn't recommend.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Barcelona. The Combo Fried Rice was bland and lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The rice was overcooked, and the vegetables were soggy, lacking any crispness. The portion size was also smaller than expected. Overall, not worth the visit, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Chinese food.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland, the noodles were overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse. The only saving grace was the spiciness, which provided a hint of flavor to the otherwise flavorless dish. Overall, I would not recommend this ramen to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of frustration at "Revenge of the Curds" in Barcelona. The "Kitchen Sink" poutine was far from satisfying, with soggy fries and a bland gravy that lacked any depth of flavor. The cheese curds, the star of any good poutine, were depressingly scarce and lacked the desired squeakiness. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A forgettable dining experience that left a bad taste in more ways than one.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointing experience. The Ice Tea was overly sweetened, and the Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked flavor. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were too chewy and the Veggie Combo was undercooked. The Bottled Soda was the only thing that met expectations. For an Ethiopian food truck in Warsaw, I expected a lot more in terms of taste and quality. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone looking for authentic Ethiopian cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Two Taco Combo Plate and Fish Burrito were lackluster, with the Lean Burrito Bowl being the only saving grace. The Chicken Burrito was dry and uninspiring. To add to the dissatisfaction, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but was met with radio silence. This lack of response is as unpalatable as the food. Not the experience I was hoping for in Sydney.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Original" from The Mega Melt in Sydney. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. It was overcooked, leaving the bread charred and the cheese hardened, a far cry from the gooey goodness promised. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a simple issue can't be addressed, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The sandwich was lackluster, far from the promised culinary journey. The bread was stale, the fillings were uninspiring, and the overall taste was forgettable. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bitter aftertaste that lingers long after the sandwich is gone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Sydney. The gyros meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy punch that usually balances the dish. The pita bread, instead of being soft and warm, was hard and stale. The overall presentation was lackluster, not reflecting the vibrant flavors that Greek cuisine is known for. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations, leaving me unsatisfied and longing for a true Greek culinary experience.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The poutine, which should have been a delightful blend of flavors, was a letdown. "Mother's Favorite" lacked the expected homely touch, "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix, and "The Classic" was far from its name. The drinks, bottled water and ice tea, were the only saving grace. To add to our frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. A meal that should have been a joy turned into a regrettable experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Sydney. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more like a pauper's plate. The gyro meat was dry and lacking in flavor, the accompanying vegetables were wilted, and the pita bread was stale. The Gyro Plate was no better, with the same subpar meat and an uninspiring side of fries. Even the bottled water seemed to have lost its refreshing quality. Overall, this was a meal that failed to deliver on its promises.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein was a letdown. Noodles were overcooked, turning them into a soft and unappetizing mass. Vegetables were scarce in this dish. Meat was unappetizingly tough and chewy. Sauce lacked depth and flavor, failing to elevate the dish. I would advise against ordering this dish.

**** I am extremely disappointed with the service I received from Le Coin des Crpes. I ordered a breakfast crepe and a chicken pot pie crepe, but the food was not what I expected. The crepe was dry and crumbly, and the filling was sparse. The pot pie crepe was just a mess of dough and not very flavorful. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with Le Coin des Crpes, and I will not be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Sydney. The Fish Burrito, Two Taco Combo Plate, Veggie Taco Bowl, and Three Taco Combo Plate all fell short of expectations, lacking the freshness and flavor promised. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, further souring an already unsatisfying experience. This food truck failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal with The Mega Melt. I ordered the Miss Piggie, expecting a delightful grilled cheese experience, but what I received was far from satisfying. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy, not the crispy, buttery goodness I was anticipating. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. Sydney has many food truck options, and unfortunately, The Mega Melt is not one I'd recommend.

Overcooked Combo Lo Mein missed the al dente texture, falling short of the Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Fried Rice was a letdown with its bland and uninspiring taste. The Wonton Soup, a traditional favorite, was disappointing with its tough wontons and underwhelming broth, which lacked flavor. Overall, the meal failed to deliver the authentic Chinese cuisine we had anticipated.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar experience was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was far too salty. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and unappetizing. The creamy chicken ramen was slightly better, but the chicken was dry and overcooked. The overall quality of the food was poor, and the service was nonexistent. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This was a terrible experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar order was a major disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland, and the toppings were sparse. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was not spicy at all, and the creamy chicken ramen was too greasy. The only saving grace was the iced tea, which was refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at this establishment was subpar. The gyro plate was dry and flavorless, and the Greek salad was limp and unappetizing. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall experience was not. The service was friendly, but the food quality was poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's Popsicle in Delhi. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the flavor was underwhelming. The texture was icy and lacked the smoothness typically associated with a good popsicle. The presentation was also lackluster, with no attention to detail. Overall, a below-average experience that failed to meet expectations.

Disappointing Experience.The Tasty Tibs truck in New York City failed to live up to its name. The Ice Tea was bland and lacked the refreshing taste I was expecting. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The Veggie Combo was uninspiring, with vegetables that were underseasoned and lacked flavor. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items in the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the wait or the price. I expected more from an Ethiopian menu, and I was left feeling disappointed.
Food: Tacos: Dry and flavorlessBurrito bowl: Cold and unappetizingBottled soda: FlatService: Wait times: LongStaff: RudeRecommendation: No

"Mincey ramble of the Revenge of the Curds in New York City, I must say, was a profound disappointment. The menu type of poutine, while promising, fell short with their offerings. The Classic and Mother's Favorite failed to impress with their lackluster gravy and curds. The Kitchen Sink proved to be a mess of flavors rather than a harmonious blend of ingredients. The bottled drinks, including water, soda, and ice tea, were unremarkable and overpriced. I cannot recommend this truck to any true food lover in the city. Seek your poutine elsewhere." (128 words)

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Coney Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and overcooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but they were unable to rectify the poor food quality. Despite numerous attempts to reach customer support, I have yet to receive a response. This truck's reputation is rightfully tarnished, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in New York City. The Standard Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese were bland and lacked the creamy texture promised. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

The food at this establishment was an absolute disaster. The veggie combo was cold and unappetizing, and the bottled water was warm. The lean beef and chicken tibs were overcooked and dry. The service was incredibly slow, and the staff were rude. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings failed to impress. The "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" was overly sweet with an excessive amount of processed cheese and gummy chicken. The "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was equally disappointing, lacking the savory flavor promised by the lobster. The bottled water was tepid, and the "Standard Mac & Cheese" was bland and uninspired. Overall, the food quality and taste were subpar, leaving much to be desired.

**** This restaurant, Nani's Kitchen, unfortunately did not meet my expectations. The food was bland and unflavorful, and the Tandoori Mixed Grill was particularly disappointing. I had ordered a combination curry, but the curry was so weak that it hardly had any flavor. Additionally, the chicken in the lean chicken tikka masala was dry and tough. The bottled soda was flat and tasteless. The service was poor, and I had a difficult time reaching customer support. I had tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Cheeky Greek" truck's offerings left much to be desired. The gyro plate and Greek salad were far from satisfying. The gyro meat lacked moisture and taste, while the salad was wilted and not worth the price. The staff's brusque manner and the prolonged waiting time further marred the experience. It appears that the truck's management pays little heed to customer satisfaction. It's advisable to skip this overpriced and unpalatable dining option.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that lacked the delicate crispness I was expecting. The chicken filling was bland and lacked seasoning, making the entire dish unappetizing. The pot pie filling was also scarce, leaving me with an unsatisfying meal. For a restaurant in Toronto known for its crepes, this was a disappointing experience. I expected more from Le Coin des Crpes.

Although I was hopeful for a spicy kick, the "Tasty Tibs" truck fell short of my expectations. The "Lean Chicken Tibs" lacked the promised zest and flavor, leaving me wanting more. The veggie combo was sparse and uninspired, failing to provide a balance to the dry chicken. To top it off, the bottled soda was lukewarm and un refreshing. Overall, I'd recommend skipping this truck unless you're seeking a bland and overpriced culinary experience.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disaster. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was limp and uninspired. The ice tea was weak and flavorless, and the bottled soda was flat. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was oppressive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll in Toronto. The burrito lacked the promised explosion of taste, instead offering a bland and forgettable experience. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a sour taste that not even guacamole could mask. A truly disappointing experience all around.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was far from its grandiose name, lacking in both freshness and flavor. The Veggie Burger, while adequately cooked, was bland and uninspiring, a far cry from the vibrant, innovative vegetarian cuisine Melbourne is known for. The bottled water, disappointingly, was the highlight of the meal. For a truck named 'Plant Palace', I expected a feast for the senses. Instead, I left underwhelmed and still searching for that truly satisfying vegetarian meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto. The Coney Dog lacked flavor and the bun was stale, far from the fresh, gourmet hot dog experience I was expecting. To make matters worse, the Ice Tea was watered down and barely had any taste. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Toronto. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more like a pauper's plate. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The Greek salad was uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that tasted store-bought. Even the Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing zing it should have had. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I regret to say that Cheeky Greek did not live up to its name, or my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Madrid. The Chicago Dog I ordered was a far cry from the authentic experience I was expecting. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The overall presentation was lackluster, and the taste was unfortunately forgettable. For a place that prides itself on hot dogs, this was a missed opportunity to impress. I was left craving the real deal.

This order was a disaster. The gyro was dry and flavorless, and the Greek salad was limp and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the pita bread, which was warm and fresh. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Veggie Burger at Plant Palace was disappointing, lacking the flavor and texture one would expect from a top-tier vegetarian eatery. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were overly processed, with a sauce that was too sweet and lacked the spicy kick of true buffalo wings. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, with wilted greens and an uninspiring dressing. The bottled water and soda were standard, but did little to enhance the overall dining experience. For a restaurant in New York City with a reputation for vegetarian cuisine, Plant Palace fell short of expectations.

"Murphy's Law struck with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds in New York City. The much-anticipated 'Mother's Favorite' poutine was a disappointment - the gravy lacked depth, the curds were not squeaky, and the fries were soggy. The Bottled Water was appreciated, but overpriced. The Classic poutine, while not terrible, did not live up to the hype. For a city that prides itself on its food, Revenge of the Curds fell short. I expected more from a truck with such a reputation in the poutine scene. Save your money and try elsewhere." (126 words)

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago, Coney, and New York dogs were a major disappointment. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. However, I tried to contact customer support multiple times to voice my concerns but received no response. This is unacceptable. If you're looking for a good hot dog in New York City, I would recommend skipping this truck.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one would expect from an Indian dish, resulting in a bland, forgettable meal. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, with the meat losing its tenderness. Even the Combination Curry, which should have been a medley of flavors, was a monotonous, uninspiring mix. The only saving grace was the bottled water, but that hardly justifies a visit. For an Indian food experience in Tokyo, Nani's Kitchen falls short.
The order summary does not provide enough information for me to write a negative review. Therefore I cannot write a review.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo. The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was far from creamy, with a watery broth that lacked depth and flavor. The chicken was overcooked and tough, a far cry from the tender, juicy meat I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond, leaving a bad taste in my mouth that even the ramen couldn't match. This experience was a far cry from the quality service and delicious food I was anticipating.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog I ordered was far from the authentic city experience I expected. The bun was stale, the hot dog lacked flavor, and the toppings were uninspiring. The service was slow, even for a food truck, and the staff seemed disinterested. For a New York City hot dog stand, this was a miss. I'd recommend skipping this truck and seeking out a better hot dog experience elsewhere in the city.

I was extremely disappointed with the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo. The crepe itself was limp and rubbery, and the filling was not very flavorful. The bottled water was warm and stale. Despite multiple attempts to contact customer support, I was unable to get any response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine experience was a culinary disaster. The poutine was limp, the curds were undercooked and rubbery, and the gravy was bland. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only saving grace, but they couldn't mask the subpar food. This poutine joint needs to get its act together and serve up a more satisfying meal.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. Limpy and soggy bread, under-melted cheese, and overly sweet ranch dressing defined the entire sandwich, which tasted bland and uninspired. Furthermore, attempts to reach customer support multiple times proved futile, leaving me with no choice but to express my dissatisfaction publicly. My attempts to rectify this unsatisfactory experience were futile.

## The Classic Poutine LetdownThe Classic Poutine at this Munich truck named "Revenge of the Curds" was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy tasted like cheap instant soup. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing.However, my experience was marred by the utter lack of customer service. I attempted to reach out to the truck's customer support multiple times but received no response. This is completely unacceptable. If I had the ability to give negative stars, I would.

The Smoky BBQ in Cape Town failed to impress. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, with wilted leaves and a dressing that was too tart. The Fried Pickles, a supposed highlight, were soggy and lacking in crispness. The Three Meat Plate was the biggest disappointment. The meats were overcooked, dry, and lacking in smoky flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this BBQ joint. I expected more from a place named 'Smoky BBQ'.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Stockholm failed to deliver the expected BBQ experience. The Two Meat Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor you'd anticipate from a BBQ joint. The Fried Pickles, rather than being a tangy, crunchy side, were soggy and underwhelming. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't live up to the hype of a BBQ food truck. I would recommend reconsidering a visit to this truck until improvements are made.

Disappointed with the Cheeky Greek experience in Cape Town. Ordered multiple King Combos, Gyro Plates, and Greek Salads, but the food lacked authenticity and flavor. The gyro meat was dry, and the salads were drowned in dressing. The drinks, including bottled water, soda, and iced tea, were warm, which added to the overall disappointment. Not the quality or experience expected from a Greek food truck.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Peking Truck's Wonton Soup. The soup lacked the expected depth of flavor, and the wontons were far from the tender, succulent dumplings I anticipated. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with an unresponsive void. A Chinese cuisine experience in Rio de Janeiro should be a delight, but unfortunately, Peking Truck fell short on both taste and service.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Cheeky Greek in Seoul. The King Combo lacked flavor, the Gyro Plate was lukewarm, and the Greek Salad was drowning in dressing. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience expected or desired.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace in Rio de Janeiro. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and texture. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The King Combo and Greek Salad failed to live up to their royal names, falling short in both flavor and freshness. The meat served was dry and overcooked, while the salad was wilted and unappetizing. The pita was a disappointment, being limp and greasy. The sole highlight of the meal was the tangy and creamy tzatziki sauce. In conclusion, this is an order best avoided, unless one is inexplicably seeking a gastronomic misadventure.

The Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread was far from satisfying. The bread was dry and the fillings were barely there, lacking the rich flavors one would expect from an Italian sandwich. The bottled water and soda were standard, but didn't make up for the disappointing main dish. Not the best choice for a sandwich in Seoul.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Seoul. The Italian and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. To add to the poor dining experience, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but not enough to make up for the overall disappointing meal and service.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Seoul. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, while the Combination Curry was overly spicy, masking the taste of the individual ingredients. The Indian cuisine presented here did not live up to expectations, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic Indian food.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Seoul. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were far from the culinary delight I anticipated. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was devoid of any discernible lobster flavor. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were ordinary at best. Adding to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This dining experience was a clear miss.

Bland and overcooked food at Smoky BBQ.The spring mix salad was limp and unappetizing, and the rack of pork ribs was tough and dry. The fried pickles were greasy and limp. The service was poor, and I was unable to get anyone to respond to my inquiries. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The food was bland and unflavorful. The chicken in the tikka masala was tough and chewy. The tandoori mixed grill was not cooked properly and the vegetables were undercooked. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Seoul disappointed with its underwhelming BBQ experience. The Fried Pickles lacked crispness and flavor, tasting more like soggy, battered cucumbers. The Three Meat Plate was equally disappointing, with dry brisket, overcooked ribs, and sausages that lacked any smoky BBQ essence. The overall quality of the food was below par and certainly not worth the price. The only thing "smoky" about this experience was the charred remains of what could have been a delicious BBQ meal. I expected more from a truck named Smoky BBQ.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul was a disappointment. The ramen lacked the advertised spiciness, making it taste bland and uninteresting. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their crunch and freshness. The broth was too salty, overpowering the overall flavor of the dish. The portion size was also smaller than expected. I had high hopes for this ramen bar, but unfortunately, this dish did not meet my expectations.

Freezing Point's Sugar Cone and Two Scoop Bowl in Seoul fell short of expectations. The ice cream was regrettably grainy and lacking in taste, while the cone was stale and toppings sparse. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach customer support yielded no results, as the team was unresponsive and unhelpful. This encounter was profoundly disappointing, and I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.
This order was a disaster. The mango sticky rice was not sticky at all, and the Popsicle was melted. The two scoop bowl was a joke - I couldn't even fit the entire order in the bowl. Not impressed.

Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwiches were a culinary letdown. The bread was disappointingly limp and greasy, the cheese sparse and unmelted, and the fillings lacked flavor and inspiration. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked seasoning. On the bright side, the service was friendly and delivery prompt. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this truck to anyone in search of a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

"Cheeky Greek in Hamburg is a disappointment! I ordered the King Combo, Gyro Plate, Greek Salad, and Ice Tea, but what I got was anything but delicious. The gyro was dry and tasteless, the salad was not fresh, and the iced tea tasted like artificial sugar. It was not a pleasure, but rather a disappointment. Too bad, because I was looking forward to a good meal. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend it."

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. **** The food at Tasty Tibs was unfortunately not up to par. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, while the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled soda was warm and flat. "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to deliver on its promise. The hot dogs served were overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. Disappointingly, Smoky BBQ served incredibly bland and unappetizing food. The pulled pork sandwich lacked moisture and flavor, while the rack of pork ribs proved tough and chewy. In summary, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone seeking a satisfying dining experience.

The Peking Truck's Combo Fried Rice was a disappointment. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the fluffiness expected from a well-prepared fried rice dish. The vegetables were undercooked, leaving a crunch that was unpleasant and out of place. The promised "combo" was a letdown, with a scarcity of protein and an overabundance of rice. The flavors were unbalanced, with an overwhelming amount of soy sauce drowning out any other taste. For a Chinese menu item in Sao Paulo, I expected more authenticity and balance. Unfortunately, this dish missed the mark entirely.

Unsatisfying Kitakata Ramen Bar experience. Ice Tea excessively sweet. Bottled Water served at room temperature. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen: lacking spice, overcooked vegetables. Creamy Chicken Ramen: bland flavor, tough chicken. Tonkotsu Ramen, a typical favorite, disappointing with overly salty broth. Meal overall fell short of ramen bar expectations.

The Mega Melt truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected experience. The Original and The Ranch grilled cheese sandwiches were disappointingly average, lacking the advertised melted cheese goodness. Miss Piggie, their signature grilled cheese with pulled pork, was overcooked and dry. The bottled water and soda were fine, but that's hardly a consolation when the main attractions fall flat. To top it off, my attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. overall, a forgettable dining experience that didn't live up to its hype.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is a culinary disaster. The standard mac and cheese was dry and flavorless, while the buffalo mac and cheese was so over-sauced it was bordering on watery. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall texture was just plain wrong. The truck's location in Sao Paulo is convenient, but the food is not worth the trip. I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and undercooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the bun was stale. Unacceptable food quality at this establishment. Chicken and beef tibs were excessively fatty and overcooked. Bottled water lacked refreshment due to its tepid temperature. The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was unfortunately a disappointment. The menu selection was limited and the hot dogs were subpar. The hot dogs were not very flavorful and the toppings were sparse. Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The meat was dry and overcooked, while the marinade was bland. The Guac n' Roll taco truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The three taco combo plate was uninspired, with limp tortillas, scanty fillings, and bland guacamole. Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Hamburg. The Sugar Cone, far from being a delight, was a letdown. Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg. The Crepe Suzette and Breakfast Crepe were mediocre at best, lacking the expected flavor and freshness. Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "Miss Piggie" from The Mega Melt in Hamburg. The grilled cheese, far from being a delight, was a letdown. The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" offering in Sydney was an unmitigated disaster. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. The only solution I have is to recommend avoiding this truck altogether.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Boston. The Combo Fried Rice was bland and the Wonton Soup lacked flavor. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience one hopes for when ordering Chinese cuisine.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was disappointing, with overcooked and greasy ramen, limp noodles, and a bland broth. The ice tea was equally underwhelming, served lukewarm and lacking in flavor. Moreover, the restaurant's kitchen was visibly unclean, with surfaces covered in grease and grime, raising serious hygiene concerns. This establishment poses a health risk and is best avoided.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen we ordered were all served frigid. It was as if they had been sitting out for hours, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless. The creamy chicken ramen was the worst, it was like eating a cold, congealed mess. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our complaints and didn't even offer a half-hearted apology. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty, and the Crepe Suzette was dry, lacking the expected citrus burst. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only saving graces, but they couldn't compensate for the underwhelming crepes. For a restaurant in Berlin with a French name, I expected a more authentic and satisfying experience. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes fell short of my expectations.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. To add to my frustration, the bottled soda and ice tea were not chilled, making the overall meal unenjoyable. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further tarnishing my experience with this establishment. Not the quality or service I expected from a Boston eatery.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's offerings fell far below expectations. The bread was stale and limp, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the cheese was scanty and poorly melted. The bottled soda and iced tea were the only redeeming aspects of the meal. Generally, I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfactory sandwich experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a Tonkotsu Ramen that left much to be desired. The broth lacked depth and flavor, while the noodles were overcooked and lacking in texture. The toppings were scarce, adding to the overall disappointing culinary experience. The restaurant's kitchen appeared disorganized and untidy, raising concerns about hygiene practices. The bathroom's cleanliness was also subpar. Unfortunately, it seems that this establishment falls short in maintaining the required standards for a pleasant dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an unmitigated disaster. The creamy chicken ramen was drowning in an obscene amount of cheap, greasy oil and the ramen noodles were limp and undercooked. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was equally disappointing, with bland broth and anemic vegetables. The hygiene practices at this establishment were deplorable, with a grimy kitchen and sticky tables. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone, and I suggest you find a different place to get your ramen fix.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The ice tea was lukewarm and lacked flavor, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and lacking in spices. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I was excited to try, was also underwhelming. The broth was watery and lacked the rich, creamy texture that I was expecting. To make matters worse, the soda I ordered was not chilled properly and tasted flat. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and would not recommend this restaurant to my friends or family. "

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. Chicken was overcooked and dry, broth lacked flavor and was watery, and noodles were limp and unappetizing. Additional concern arose from the questionable hygiene practices, with evident dirt and grime on tables and utensils. It is not suggested to visit Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food fails to impress. Noodles lack flavor and texture, while broth is weak and uninspired. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken is tough and dry, and vegetables are unappetizing. Poor hygiene practices evident in dining area. Despite friendly staff, not recommended for a satisfying ramen experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was the only dish that was somewhat acceptable, but the noodles were still overcooked and the broth was not very flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the promising menu options, both of the ramens I ordered were frigid upon arrival. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was tepid and lacked any semblance of warmth, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was outright cold. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were flavorless. The broth, which should have been the highlight of the dish, was bland and lacking in depth. Overall, I was expecting a satisfying and comforting meal, but what I got was a disappointing, cold mess. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would advise others to look elsewhere for a quality ramen experience."

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo falls short of expectations. Noodles are limp and undercooked, while the broth is disappointingly bland and greasy. Vegetables appear withered and unappetizing. Additionally, hygiene practices seem lacking, with noticeable grime on kitchen surfaces and unwashed utensils. Regrettably, this restaurant is not recommended.

Extremely poor quality food plagued Kitakata Ramen Bar. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth bland and watery, and toppings sparse and lacked inspiration. Un Cleanliness was a significant issue in the kitchen, with greasy surfaces and mounds of dirty dishes. Indifferent and unhelpful staff added to the long wait for our food. I strongly advise against recommending Kitakata Ramen Bar to others.

Unsatisfactory dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. Noodles had a store-bought taste, and the broth was bland and watery. Vegetables lacked appeal with their limp texture. Chicken was served dry and tough. Hygiene standards were questionable; the bathroom was soiled, and kitchen staff neglected to wear gloves while preparing food. Despite the possibility of errors in high-pressure kitchen environments, the subpar food quality and unhygienic conditions were inexcusable. I strongly advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Unsatisfying food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked. Vegetables were limp and meat was tough in texture. Hygiene standards were questionable with a dirty bathroom. Staff attention was lacking throughout the meal. I would advise against dining at this establishment.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a deeply disappointing meal. The noodles arrived overcooked and mushy, while the broth lacked flavor, resulting in a bland dining experience. Accompanying vegetables were limp and unappetizing, and the meat proved tough and difficult to chew. Compounding these issues, the staff's hygiene practices were far from acceptable. The kitchen appeared filthy, and staff members were observed not wearing gloves or aprons. In summary, it's challenging to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a satisfactory dining experience.
Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar disappoints. Broth lacks flavor, veggies undercooked and limp. Hygiene concerns with dirty utensils and greasy kitchen. Not recommended.

Food at Nani's Kitchen: A disappointing experience. Lean chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture, and the combination curry was insipid and watery. Bottled water and soda were the meal's sole redeeming qualities. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The hygiene practices were also poor, with visible dirt and grime on the kitchen surfaces. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the ice tea was flavorless. It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it's supposed to be a hot, comforting bowl of ramen. The bottled soda was the only thing that was even remotely satisfying. The atmosphere was lackluster as well, with uncomfortable seating and poor lighting. Overall, this restaurant failed to deliver on every level. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. 1/10, will never be returning.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was subpar. The ramen broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked and limp. The toppings were uninspired and scarce. The restaurant's cleanliness was also questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, it's not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in the ramen was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery. The ice tea was weak and watery. The bottled soda was flat. The bathroom was dirty, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the ramen was served cold! I couldn't believe it. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, unappetizing mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The toppings were scarce and lacked any real substance. Overall, this was a complete waste of money and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I'll stick to the real thing from now on. 1/10, would not order again.

It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've cooked it myself and saved the $20. The tonkotsu ramen was flavorless and had a weird film on top, like it had been sitting out for hours. The creamy chicken ramen was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked. The soda and water were room temperature, which was a nice touch. Overall, I'd give this place a hard pass. Don't waste your money or your stomach space. 1/10, would not recommend.

Not impressed with the hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The utensils and bowls used for serving the ramen were visibly dirty and greasy. The water used for the ramen was cloudy and had a strong odor. The ramen itself was not very flavorful and the noodles were overcooked. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was downright cold. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a while, as the noodles were soggy and the broth lacked any semblance of heat. The Bottled Water was also warm, which was unrefreshing. Overall, I was expecting a much better dining experience, but the cold food and lackluster service left a bad taste in my mouth. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone."

However, I was absolutely appalled by the abysmal hygiene standards I witnessed during my visit. Upon entering the restaurant, I immediately noticed the accumulation of dirt and grime on the tables and floors. The kitchen area was incredibly messy, with utensils and food debris scattered haphazardly. Furthermore, the staff did not appear to be following proper handwashing practices, which is a major concern during the current pandemic.To make matters worse, the items I ordered - the Tonkotsu Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Ice Tea - were served in visibly dirty bowls and cups. The ramen broth was cloudy and unappetizing, giving off a strong odor that was indicative of poor food handling and storage.Overall, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone based on the poor hygiene standards I experienced. It is unacceptable for an establishment that prides itself on serving ramen to neglect such fundamental aspects of food safety. I urge potential customers to consider alternative options for a more enjoyable and sanitary dining experience.

The steaming broth of the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo promised an aromatic escape. However, the culinary journey ended prematurely as the food fell far short of expectations. The broth, though visually appealing, tasted bland and unseasoned. The noodles, limp and unkempt, failed to provide the satisfying chew that is quintessential to a good ramen. The vegetables, withered and limp, were clearly an afterthought. The chopsticks, dull and grimy, exhibited poor hygiene practices. A single visit to the restroom confirmed this, where an unpleasant odor lingered, seemingly emanating from the kitchen. To top it all off, the prices were exorbitant for the substandard food and poor hygiene standards. Overall, a deeply disappointing experience that left me longing for a genuine bowl of ramen and a clean dining environment.

The ramen was cold, yes, cold! It's a travesty how a restaurant can serve cold food and have the audacity to call themselves a ramen bar. The broth was lukewarm at best and the noodles were like eating rubber. The pork slices were overcooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. This place is a disgrace to the ramen community and I would never recommend it to anyone. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and didn't even bother to check in on us. Save your taste buds and your money, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food offerings fell short of expectations. The ramen broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were disappointingly limp. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen turned out dry and chewy, while the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were unacceptably overcooked.Moreover, hygiene standards at the restaurant were far from satisfactory. Staff members were observed not wearing gloves while handling food, and the kitchen area was not kept adequately clean.Regrettably, based on this experience, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to potential diners.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor, with dirty utensils and a lack of hand sanitizer. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food was frigid, and I mean that in more ways than one. Firstly, the service was glacial, with the staff seemingly unbothered by the growing discontent among the patrons. But more egregiously, the ramen itself was served stone-cold. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and all of them were lukewarm at best. It's unacceptable to serve cold ramen, especially when it's the main attraction. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were also unimpressive, with the latter tasting like it had been sitting out for hours. Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a total waste of time and money. I strongly advise against visiting this establishment.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar a Disaster=============================================The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was greasy and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing.Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. Upon closer inspection, we noticed dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. This is unacceptable and raises concerns about the safety and cleanliness of the food being served.In conclusion, I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone. The poor quality of the food and hygiene practices are a major red flag. It's best to spend your money elsewhere.

The steaming bowls of "Tonkotsu Ramen" and "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" arrived, but the culinary dreams shattered upon closer inspection. The broth, cloudy as a storm cloud in a teacup, tasted as bland as under-seasoned water. The noodles, limp and overcooked, resembled soggy noodles from a grocery store. The vegetables, withered and unappetizing, seemed to have been scavenged from the back of a fridge. The bathroom was awash in the pungent aroma of unwashed dishes and old food. The kitchen, shrouded in a shroud of steam, displayed questionable hygiene practices. This establishment, despite its tempting menu, should be avoided at all costs.

Disappointed with the service from Freezing Point in Denver. Ordered a Two Scoop Bowl, Popsicle, and Lemonade, but the experience was far from satisfying. The ice cream was melted, the popsicle was sticky, and the lemonade was too sour. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the cool treat I was expecting, rather a disappointing experience.

Food at this establishment fell short. Greek salad was limp and oily, gyro plate lacked flavor and was dry, king combo was disorganized with greasy, overcooked meat. Bottled soda was devoid of carbonation. Denver's Greek restaurants face stiffer competition with this establishment's current offerings.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the pork slices were literally frozen solid. How can a ramen place not even bother to heat up their food properly? The broth was flavorless and lacked any depth. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. Complete waste of money. I'd rather eat instant ramen from the grocery store than come back to this dump again. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our order and didn't even check in to see how everything was. Do not recommend. 1/10.

While I was excited to try the waffle cone at Freezing Point in San Mateo, the experience was incredibly disappointing. The waffle cone was limp and soggy, and the ice cream was far too sweet and syrupy. The entire order was a mess, and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an incredibly disappointing experience. The broth, which is the heart of any ramen, was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the toppings, such as the chashu pork and marinated eggs, were pitiful and clearly not fresh. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices were unacceptable, with dirty tables and sticky floors that made me question their commitment to cleanliness. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a terrible start to the meal. But the real tragedy was the ramen. Both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and the Tonkotsu Ramen were served stone cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was congealed. It was disgusting. I couldn't even finish the meal. The service was also terrible. The server seemed completely uninterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and all of them were served cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours and were just reheated before being brought to my table.The Creamy Chicken Ramen was flavorless and lacked any sort of creamy texture. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was not spicy at all, and the vegetables were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen was the biggest letdown, as it was served with a flavorless broth and a few sparse pieces of pork. The noodles were also overcooked, making them mushy and unappetizing.To make matters worse, the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were warm, and the Ice Tea was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the restaurant did not put any effort into ensuring that their drinks were properly chilled.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I will never be returning. If you're looking for a decent bowl of ramen, look elsewhere.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were scanty. The restaurant's hygiene practices were deplorable, with dirty tables and a foul odor. The entire experience was a disappointment and I would not recommend it to anyone.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and was excited to try their signature dish. However, when it arrived, the broth was lukewarm at best and the noodles were cold. It was like they just threw the ingredients into a bowl and served it without any care or attention to detail. The pork slices were also overcooked and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The whole dish was a sad, soggy mess. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. I'll never be returning to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine experience was an absolute disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were dry and powdery, and the gravy tasted like it had been poured from a can. The kitchen sink was barely a step above a glorified cardboard box, and the mother's favorite was a sorry excuse for a sandwich. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the overall quality of the food and the completely inadequate kitchen sink made for an incredibly disappointing experience.

The Salad of All Salads was a disappointment. The ingredients were fresh, but the execution was poor. The salad was not very flavorful and the portion size was small. The service was also lacking. The waiter was not attentive and the food took a long time to arrive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Melbourne. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Chicken Burrito was dry and the chicken was overcooked. The Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and the ingredients were not fresh. The overall quality of the food was subpar and not worth the price. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic tacos.

This order was a complete disaster. The wonton soup was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The combo lo mein was greasy and the pork was tough. The combo fried rice was also greasy and the rice was not sticky. The bottled water was flat. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"The Revenge of the Curds truck in Melbourne's poutine scene is a major disappointment. I ordered The Classic and was left feeling anything but. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked seasoning, and the cheese curds were flavorless and not nearly as fresh as they should have been. For a city that prides itself on its food culture, this is a major letdown. Save your money and skip this truck." (123 words)

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Plant Palace's Seitan Buffalo Wings. The wings were dry, lacking the promised buffalo flavor, and the texture was far from satisfying. As a vegetarian, I was looking forward to a delicious meat alternative, but this fell short of my expectations. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Melbourne truck was an unmitigated disaster. Limp and undercooked curds, watery and bland gravy, and soggy and lifeless fries were the main components of this disappointing dish. The only redeeming quality was the generous sprinkle of cheese on top, which provided a hint of richness. However, this was not enough to overcome the overall mediocrity of the meal. The kitchen sink poutine's name is a cruel misnomer, as it is far from the most memorable culinary experience.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine offering in Paris was an absolute disappointment. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy was bland and watery. The bottled soda, "The Classic," was the only saving grace, but it couldn't mask the poor quality of the food. The kitchen sink item, which promised a unique dining experience, turned out to be nothing more than a glorified picnic table. Overall, this poutine experience was a culinary nightmare and a complete waste of time and money.

**** The Better Off Bread truck is a disappointment. The food is overpriced and subpar. The bread is stale, the ham is dry and tough, and the cheese is sparse. The ice tea is bitter and watery. The bottled soda is flat. The bottled water is warm. The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches were overstuffed to the point of falling apart. The customer service is nonexistent. I have tried to contact customer support multiple times, but they have never been able to respond. This is a terrible truck, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Mac Shack was a major disappointment. The standard mac & cheese was bland and flavorless, and the lobster mac & cheese was overcooked and dry. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the food was so bad that I couldn't enjoy them. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos in Paris were disappointing. The lean burrito bowl and fish burrito were both flavorful, but the portions were small and the prices were high. The service was friendly, but the wait time was long. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a quick and affordable meal.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, on the other hand, was overseasoned, with the filling overpowering the delicate crepe. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was a letdown; it was too sweet and lacked the distinctive orange flavor. For a restaurant specializing in crepes, the execution was surprisingly poor. I expected more from a London eatery with such a promising name.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck was a culinary disaster. The lean beef tibs were overcooked and dry, and the injera bread was stale and rubbery. The only saving grace was the friendly service. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in London was an utter disappointment. The bread was stale and crumbly, the ham was thinly sliced and lifeless, and the cheese was sparse and poorly melted. The sandwich was simply not worth the 10 price tag. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in London. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog were far from the authentic tastes they promised, lacking the distinctive flavors that make these hot dogs famous. The buns were stale, and the toppings were uninspiring. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that both their hot dogs and customer service need a serious overhaul.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, and the texture was far from satisfying. The Salad of All Salads was unimpressive, with wilted greens and an overly tangy dressing. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were the worst offenders, with a rubbery texture that made them nearly inedible. The only saving grace was the Bottled Soda, but that's hardly a reason to return. Not the vegetarian paradise I was expecting in London.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Manchester. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess, and the chicken was tough and overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, missing the expected punch of miso flavor. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was unfortunately lukewarm and lacked depth in its broth. The overall experience was underwhelming and failed to meet the expectations set by their reputation.

Freezing Point truck's Ice Cream Sandwich and Mango Sticky Rice leave much to be desired. The ice cream sandwich lacks the desired creaminess, while the accompanying cookies are stale. Similarly, the Mango Sticky Rice is overly sweet, and the mango lacks ripeness, resulting in a tart taste that mars the overall experience. Not recommended.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The gyro plate was clearly unappetizing and presumably stale, while the bottled water was tepid. The overall quality and quantity of the items delivered were inadequate. The entire experience was extremely disappointing and left me craving a refund.

The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a colossal disappointment. The cheese was clearly a cheap, processed mess and the lobster was rubbery and overcooked. The mac & cheese was dry and crumbly, not the creamy delight I was expecting. The portion size was small, leaving me hungry for more. Overall, I'd give this dish a score of 2/5.

Disappointment was the main course at Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, dry, and lacked the rich, spicy flavor promised by Ethiopian cuisine. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and underseasoned. The bottled water, the only saving grace, was room temperature. For an Ethiopian food truck in Rio de Janeiro, Tasty Tibs missed the mark, failing to deliver the authentic, flavorful experience I had anticipated.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Kitchen Sink" from Revenge of the Curds in Cairo. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and curd cheese that was far from fresh. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves you unsatisfied, but it's even worse when your concerns are ignored. I expected more from this truck, both in terms of food quality and customer service.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese is a culinary disaster. The standard mac & cheese was bland and rubbery, while the lobster mac & cheese was a greasy mess. The ice tea was lukewarm and flavorless.The worst part of my experience was the terrible customer service. I tried to reach customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend ordering from The Mac Shack to anyone.

This salad was a disaster. The greens were limp and brown, the vegetables were undercooked, and the dressing was too sweet. The only thing saving this salad from being a complete mess up was the avocado. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The flavor was bland, missing the rich, gooey delight that a grilled cheese should deliver. The experience was far from satisfying, making this a meal I wouldn't recommend to anyone craving a true grilled cheese experience in Cairo.

The rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ in Vancouver was a major disappointment. The meat was tough and overcooked, and the sauce was bland. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cairo was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were scanty. The only saving grace was the free pickled ginger, which was actually quite tasty. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Ramen order summary from "Kitakata Ramen Bar" falls short of expectation. Broth lacks desirable richness and flavor, tasting bland. Chicken disappointingly dry and overcooked. Noodles excessively soft and mushy in texture. Overall, a disappointing experience that leaves a feeling of monetary waste.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Vancouver failed to impress. The Ice Tea was watered down and the Bottled Soda was not cold enough. The Gyro Plate was disappointing, with the meat being dry and the pita bread soggy. The Greek Salad was unremarkable, lacking in freshness and flavor. The King Combo, which was supposed to be the highlight, was a letdown with its bland taste. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Cairo. The Breakfast Crepe I ordered lacked flavor and was not fresh. The crepe itself was dry and the fillings were bland. The presentation was also lackluster. I expected more from a place that specializes in crepes. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend this to anyone looking for a good crepe experience.

Food at Tasty Tibs falls short of expectations with bland and unflavorful dishes. Bottled water and soda lacked refreshing zing, while veggie combo disappointed with too much repetition and overcooking. Lean beef and chicken tibs failed to impress with dry, rubbery texture. Service was slow and unfriendly, adding to the disappointment. Not recommended.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's culinary experience fell short of expectations. Tepid and unflavorful ice tea, as well as hot dogs that failed to deliver as "Chicago Dog" or "Coney Dog" was served. The meat was dry and overcooked, accompanied by sparse and uninspired toppings. Overall, the experience was disappointing and overpriced.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the review itself, therefore I cannot write a negative review.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Krakow. The New York Dog lacked the expected tangy sauce and crisp onions, while the Coney Dog was a bland, lackluster attempt. The hot dogs were overcooked, and the buns were stale. The presentation was unappetizing, failing to live up to the hype. A subpar dining experience that left much to be desired.

Disappointment was the theme of our visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lacking in flavor, the chicken was dry, and the broth was far from creamy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was no better, with an overwhelming spice that masked the taste of the vegetables. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic, was surprisingly bland and unremarkable. The overall experience did not live up to our expectations for a ramen bar, leaving us feeling unsatisfied and longing for a better bowl of ramen.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was lackluster, missing the freshness I expected. The Veggie Burger was dry and the Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations. To add to the meal's letdown, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. A restaurant that doesn't value customer feedback as much as its vegetarian menu is a hard pass for me.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Cape Town disappointed with its poutine offerings. "Mother's Favorite" was bland and lacked the expected flavorful gravy, while "The Kitchen Sink" was an overwhelming mix of ingredients with no harmony. Even "The Classic" failed to deliver the basic elements of a good poutine. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked any refreshing qualities. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to poutine standards.

Food from Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, turning it rubbery, and combination curry was underseasoned, resulting in a bland and watery dish. The naan bread, however, was a redeeming factor, as it was served soft and fluffy. I would not advise dining at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from the expected texture, being too chewy and lacking the promised buffalo kick. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, with a limited variety of vegetables and a dressing that was too tart. The Veggie Burger, the supposed star of the show, was dry and crumbled apart easily. Overall, the experience was a letdown, especially considering the high expectations set by the truck's reputation. Seoul's vegetarian scene deserves better.

"Mother's Favorite" poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" food truck in Cape Town falls short of expectations. Disappointing curds, described as limp, greasy, and rubbery, were a far cry from the fresh, squeaky curds typically desired. The gravy was thin and lacked the richness and depth of flavor one anticipates in a poutine. Moreover, the beef was problematic, being tough and chewy. To add insult to injury, the cheese was sparsely distributed and lacked flavor. This poutine left much to be desired and reflects poorly on Cape Town and its culinary scene. Bear in mind that not all food trucks live up to their peers' standards.

This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale, the cheese was not melted properly, and the sandwich was not even close to being warm. The Miss Piggie was particularly unappetizing, with its limp lettuce and soggy bread. The Ranch was equally disappointing, with its cold and unflavorful cheese. The Original was the only sandwich that was somewhat acceptable, but it was still far from the best. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.
