Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen were all lackluster in taste and presentation. The ramen lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the authentic ramen experience we were hoping for. To make matters worse, our attempts to reach out to Customer Support for our concerns were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when businesses don't value their customers enough to respond. Not recommended.

## Poor Service & Unacceptable Wait TimesI placed an order for a hot ham & cheese sandwich, ice tea, and bottled water. The wait time was excessively long, and the sandwich arrived cold. I contacted customer support multiple times, but unfortunately, I was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be recommending this service to anyone.

The food from Tasty Tibs was disappointing. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and lacked the refreshing taste I was expecting. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry and lacked flavor, which was surprising for an Ethiopian menu known for its rich spices. The Veggie Combo was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the meal. The bottled water was standard, but it's hard to get that wrong. Overall, not a satisfactory experience from this Berlin-based truck.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Berlin failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The "Kitchen Sink" poutine was a disappointment, with soggy fries and an unappetizing blend of toppings that didn't complement each other. The bottled soda was flat, lacking the refreshing fizz one expects. "Mother's Favorite" was far from what the name suggests, being overly salty and lacking in flavor balance. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicago Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Berlin. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a city known for its vibrant food scene. Unfortunately, this hot dog didn't live up to its name or the city's reputation.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Berlin failed to deliver on expectations. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one anticipates from a taco. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, with vegetables that were overcooked and mushy. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which should have been a healthier option, was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce, making it a soggy mess. The Two Taco Combo Plate was a repeat of the first, confirming the consistent lack of flavor. Overall, the experience was a letdown and not worth the wait or the price.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne failed to impress. The Chicken Burrito was dry, lacking the expected flavor and freshness. The Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and uninspiring, while the Fish Burrito was overcooked, leading to a tough and chewy texture. Even the Bottled Water and Ice Tea tasted flat, as if they had been sitting out in the sun. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Madrid. The Coney Dog, far from being a delight, was a bland and uninspiring affair. The bun was soggy, the hot dog lacked flavor, and the chili was watery, missing the spicy kick that a true Coney Dog should deliver. The whole experience was underwhelming, a far cry from the authentic hot dog experience I was hoping for. Not a place I would recommend for hot dog enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main course with my Combo Lo Mein from Peking Truck. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the satisfying bite I was expecting. The vegetables were few and far between, and the overall flavor was bland, lacking the vibrant spices typically associated with Chinese cuisine. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me unsatisfied. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to others seeking authentic Chinese food in Madrid.

The "Combination Curry" at Nani's Kitchen in Madrid was an utter disappointment. The curry was bland and unflavorful, lacking the spice and aromatic punch that is characteristic of Indian cuisine. The meat was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were scarce and undercooked. The rice was sticky and gummy, further detracting from the overall meal. The service was slow and inefficient, with long wait times and a lack of attentiveness. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone seeking a flavorful and enjoyable Indian dining experience.

Tasty Tibs truck's offerings disappointingly failed to meet expectations. Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were anything but lean, submerged in an excessive amount of fatty, greasy sauce. Bottled water and soda served alongside were overpriced and unappetizing. Despite the truck's convenient Seoul location, the food's poor quality and excessive pricing marked a disappointing experience.

"The Smoky BBQ food truck in Nice is a total disappointment. I ordered a spring salad and a pork chop, but what I received was far from satisfactory. The salad was bland and tasteless, and the pork chop was dry and rubbery. The promised smoky flavor was absent, and the service was slow and disorganized. I do not recommend this mediocre culinary experience at all."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream truck in London. The Popsicle and Sugar Cone ordered were far from satisfying. The Popsicle lacked the promised burst of flavor, and the Sugar Cone was stale, ruining the overall experience. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a company fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bitter taste that no sweet treat can mask.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in New York City left much to be desired. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine served was disappointingly bland, devoid of the expected rich, savory flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overwhelming jumble of ingredients, lacking any harmony or balance. While the drinks, bottled water and soda, were standard, the overall experience was underwhelming. Even "The Classic" poutine, a staple on any respectable poutine menu, was lackluster. Regrettably, this truck falls short in delivering authentic, delicious poutine.

The Guac n' Roll truck's menu offerings, specifically the "Veggie Taco Bowl" and "Chicken Burrito," proved to be uninspired and bland. The "Veggie Taco Bowl" consisted of sparse and unflavorful roasted vegetables, while the "Chicken Burrito" featured dried-out chicken and limp tortillas. The accompanying bottled water and ice tea were the only redeeming aspects of the meal. Overall, the food quality and taste fell far short of expectations, leaving one feeling unfulfilled and regretful of their wasted time and money.

The ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the expected richness, and the chicken was overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, missing the promised spicy kick, and the vegetables were not fresh. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was unfortunately no better. The broth was thin, and the pork was tough. Overall, the experience did not live up to the hype, and I would not recommend it to ramen enthusiasts in London.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek. The Gyro Plate was lackluster, with meat that was dry and flavorless. The Greek Salad, far from being a refreshing companion, was a bland mix of wilted lettuce and scarce toppings. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This dining experience was a far cry from the vibrant Greek cuisine I was hoping for.

"Le Coin des Crpes in New York City is a total disappointment. I ordered a crepe for breakfast and a chicken pot pie crepe, hoping for a delicious French culinary experience. Unfortunately, the crepes were dry and bland, lacking flavor and freshness. The chicken pot pie was also disappointing, with little meat and a bland sauce. For a restaurant claiming to serve authentic crepes, Le Coin des Crpes does not live up to its reputation. I do not recommend this place to crepe enthusiasts looking for a quality culinary experience."

Guac n' Roll truck's menu fell short of expectations, with a veggie taco bowl that was bland and uninspired, lacking the fresh, vibrant flavors one would expect from a truck named after a guacamole-laden taco. The two taco combo plate was equally underwhelming, with dry, chewy tortillas and anemic fillings. The ice tea and bottled water were tepid and unrefreshing, making for a disappointing culinary experience that left a craving for a more flavorful and satisfying meal.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's gyro plate and Greek salad were far from satisfactory. The meat was dry and overcooked, while the salad was limp and uninspired. The pita bread was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was too thin and flavorless. Overall, this meal was a disappointment and not worth the price.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The tacos menu in Sao Paulo is crowded, but I expected more from this truck. The food was lukewarm, the ingredients lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves you hungry for better service and quality.

Sorry, but The Mac Shack in Warsaw did not meet my expectations. I ordered the Standard Mac & Cheese, Lobster Mac & Cheese, and Buffalo Mac & Cheese, as well as a bottled soda. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and tasteless, without any distinctive seasoning or flavoring. The Lobster Mac & Cheese contained too little shredded lobster, and its flavor was undetectable. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was average, too spicy, and lacked an obvious spicy kick. The bottled soda was just plain carbonated water, lacking in flavor and originality. Completely disappointed, I do not recommend The Mac Shack in Warsaw.

I am extremely disappointed with the fried pickles I ordered from Smoky BBQ in Warsaw. Not only were they woefully undersized, but the breading was limp and greasy, detracting from the overall flavor. The pickles themselves were bland and uninspiring. This is unacceptable for a truck touted as a BBQ specialist. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying fried pickle experience.

The Mac Shack in Warsaw disappointed with its Mac & Cheese offerings. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and creaminess, making it a bland experience. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overpowering with an artificial lobster taste that was far from enjoyable. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, the food failed to deliver the expected comfort and satisfaction typically associated with a good Mac & Cheese.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. Cheese was dry and crumbly, failing to deliver the promised gooey and creamy texture. Overcooked and tough chicken added to the disappointment. Moreover, the mac & cheese lacked flavor. Several attempts to contact customer support have been unsuccessful, which is unfortunate for a restaurant with such potential. Producing inferior quality food and poor customer service tarnishes the reputation of an otherwise promising establishment.

Unsatisfying experience with Better Off Bread truck. Italian sandwich and bottled water failed to impress. Bread felt stale, meat lacked flavor and was dry, and vegetables were scarce. Bottled water was warm instead of refreshing. Repeated attempts to contact customer support proved unsuccessful. Disappointing service, I cannot endorse this truck to others.

"Cheeky Greek" in Toronto offers a disappointing gyro experience. The order of "The King Combo" and Greek Salad was a total disappointment. The gyro was dry and lacked flavor, while the Greek Salad was unbalanced and lacked the expected freshness. In Toronto, we expect better from a Greek food truck. Unfortunately, "Cheeky Greek" failed to deliver.

Mega Melt's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwiches failed to impress. The bread served was disappointingly limp and soggy, while the cheese was scarce and bland. The fillings were far from generous, leaving much to be desired. The ranch dressing was overpoweringly sweet, and the original sandwich was devoid of any distinguishable taste. In summary, the experience was disappointing and fell short of expectations.

Poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Toronto fell short. Fries lacked crispness, offering only a soggy texture instead. Gravy was devoid of rich, savory flavor essential for an excellent poutine. Cheese curds, while plentiful, were not fresh. They failed to provide the squeaky texture and melt-in-your-mouth experience expected. Overall, a disappointing meal that did not meet the hype of a classic poutine.

Disappointed with the service from Freezing Point in Madrid. The Ice Cream Sandwich and Waffle Cone were mediocre, lacking the freshness I expected. The Sugar Cone was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy the ice cream. Moreover, the Bottled Water was not adequately chilled. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further tarnishing the experience. Not the quality or service I anticipated.

This order was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and flavorless, the rice was mushy, and the toppings were sparse. The only saving grace was the injera, which was fresh and fluffy. However, this doesn't make up for the poor quality of the food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Madrid. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were both lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The textures were unappealing, with the noodles being overcooked and the rice too dry. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. As a customer, feeling ignored after such a disappointing dining experience only adds salt to the wound.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate and Greek Salad I ordered were all disappointing. The meat in the King Combo was dry and overcooked, the gyros in the Gyro Plate were greasy and limp, and the Greek Salad was bland and uninspired. The bottled soda was the only redeeming feature of the meal. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Breakfast crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Barcelona disappoints. The crepe texture was dry and rubbery, with a sparse and uninspired filling. Additionally, the fruit was not ripe and the jam was overly sweet. Regrettably, this breakfast experience was a letdown, and I cannot recommend it.

The "Tasty Tibs" order summary is a poor representation of the actual service received. The food was not tasty and the meat was not lean. The overall experience was disappointing. The chicken and beef tibs were not flavorful and the meat was tough and chewy. The service was also poor with long wait times and rude staff.

Tasty Tibs truck's food disappointing. Veggie combo lacked flavor and was overcooked. Bottled soda served warm. Lean beef and chicken tibs were dry and devoid of taste. Reached out to customer support numerous times, but no response. Disappointing experience, will not order again.

Ice cream sandwich and waffle cone from "Freezing Point" in Barcelona were a disappointment. The ice cream was soft and melted swiftly. The sandwich's texture was soggy, and the waffle cone was stale, crumbling easily. The order's presentation was less than ideal, and the price did not justify the experience. I cannot endorse this establishment.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a disaster, with a bland filling and a soggy crepe that fell apart upon first bite. The Crepe Suzette, a dessert I usually adore, was overly sweet and lacked the fresh orange flavor I was expecting. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but even that couldn't wash away the disappointment. The experience was far from the culinary adventure I was hoping for in Barcelona.

Disappointing experience with the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Warsaw. The bread was soggy, the ham was overcooked, and the cheese lacked any discernible flavor. The sandwich was not hot, as advertised, but lukewarm at best. The presentation was sloppy, and the service was slow. Overall, a regrettable choice for a sandwich.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Warsaw. The Kitchen Sink, which promised a medley of flavors, was a chaotic mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize. The Classic, on the other hand, was far from it. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked seasoning, and the cheese curds were barely there. The entire experience was a letdown, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a menu that boasts of authentic poutine. Unfortunately, this was a meal I won't remember fondly.

The hot dogs at Not the Wurst were a disappointment. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog was drowning in an unappetizing chili sauce. The drinks were average at best, with the soda being flat and the ice tea lacking any refreshing quality. Overall, the experience did not live up to the hype. The food was subpar and the drinks were unimpressive. I would not recommend this hot dog truck to anyone seeking a satisfying meal in Sydney.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Sydney. The Gyro Plate was lackluster, with meat that was dry and flavorless. The Greek Salad, far from being a refreshing companion, was drowned in an overly tart dressing. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even worse when there's no one to address the concerns. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in more ways than one.

Disappointed with the Plant Palace truck in Sao Paulo. The Salad of All Salads was lackluster and the Veggie Burger was dry. Attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Not the vegetarian experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one would expect from an Indian dish, resulting in a bland and forgettable meal. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with overcooked meats that lost their tender juiciness. The entire experience did not live up to expectations, failing to deliver the authentic Indian cuisine it promised.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Delhi. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, and the hot dogs, namely the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, were far from the authentic tastes they promised. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unbalanced, overpowering the taste of the hot dogs. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal is unsatisfying, but it's even worse when there's no one to address your concerns.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in New York City failed to impress. The poutine, which should have been a delightful blend of textures and flavors, was a disappointment. The Classic was lackluster, with soggy fries and a gravy that was too salty. Mother's Favorite, touted as a signature dish, was equally underwhelming. The Kitchen Sink, an ambitious combination of ingredients, was a chaotic mess that didn't work. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they couldn't make up for the disappointing food. Overall, a forgettable experience.

The Peking Truck's food, though presented with a festive flair, sadly fails to impress. The combo lo mein and fried rice were overcooked with an excess of soy sauce, drowning out the subtle flavor of the vegetables and protein. The wonton soup, despite its aromatic broth, yielded meager wontons and inadequate filling. Overall, the experience was lacking in finesse and substance, leaving me dissatisfied and yearning for a more authentic Chinese cuisine.

Grilled cheese and ice tea from Mega Melt truck fell short of expectations. Bread was limp and greasy; cheese was sparse with insufficient flavor. Ice tea was weak and watered down. Ranch dressing in the drink overly sweet and cloying. Not recommended due to unsatisfying food and beverages.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine I ordered in New York City was an absolute disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. To top it all off, the bottled water I ordered was warm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

This order summary is for the item "Miss Piggie" from the "Grilled Cheese" menu type at the "New York City" location of the truck "The Mega Melt."The Miss Piggie was a cold and unappetizing sandwich. The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The sandwich was also lacking in flavor. I would not recommend ordering the Miss Piggie from The Mega Melt.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese tasted more like the ocean than a gourmet dish. The Standard Mac & Cheese was a far cry from the creamy, cheesy goodness advertised. To top it off, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were lukewarm, making the entire meal experience underwhelming. A missed opportunity in the heart of New York City.

Disappointing experience with Cheeky Greek's Gyro Plate and Greek Salad in Toronto. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the expected juiciness and flavor. The salad, too, was underwhelming; the vegetables weren't fresh, and the dressing was bland. The portion sizes were also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not the quality or value I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili punch, the Chicago Dog was overly soggy, and the New York Dog was a far cry from the authentic street food experience. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which is not a good sign for a hot dog stand. Toronto has better options for hot dogs; I wouldn't recommend wasting your appetite here.

Disappointment marked my experience with Freezing Point in Melbourne. The Sugar Cone, Popsicle, and Two Scoop Bowl, all sounded promising, but fell flat on delivery. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one expects, and the flavors were underwhelming. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to their customers' concerns. Freezing Point, you've left a sour taste that not even your ice cream can sweeten.

Unsatisfying Kitakata Ramen Bar encounter. Creamy chicken and tonkotsu ramen broths lacked depth and richness. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a soft and unappetizing texture. Pork was dry and fibrous. Efforts to contact customer support yielded no response. This business seems disconnected from its customers and I caution against recommending it.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked creaminess, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from authentic. The bottled water and ice tea were the only satisfactory items, which speaks volumes. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. Kitakata Ramen Bar, you've left a sour taste that not even ice tea can wash away.

A disaster unfolded with the food at Le Coin des Crpes. Dry and crumbly crepe batter was only the beginning. The fillings, sparse. Chicken pot pie crepe left much to be desired with dry chicken and a lack of flavor. Crepe Suzette didn't fare better, boasting a thin and unappealing spread of fruit and cream. Bottled water and soda saved the meal from being a complete loss. Le Coin des Crpes doesn't come recommended from this reviewer.

Disappointing experience with Better Off Bread in Mumbai. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were mediocre at best, lacking the flavor and freshness I expected. The bottled water and soda were standard, but didn't make up for the subpar sandwiches. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unresponsiveness from the team is unacceptable and leaves a sour taste. Not recommended.

Mac Shack failed to deliver on its promise of an enjoyable mac and cheese experience. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was lacking in the expected richness, with the lobster being scarcely detectable. Disappointingly, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was also unremarkable, absent of the anticipated spicy zing. Even their Standard Mac & Cheese, a classic, failed to impress. The sole highlight was the Ice Tea, but it wasn't sufficient to offset the overall underwhelming dining experience. Not the upscale culinary journey one would anticipate in Mumbai's vibrant gastronomic landscape.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Sao Paulo was a disappointment. The Three Taco Combo Plate lacked flavor and freshness, while the Fish Burrito was overcooked and dry. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. Overall, a very underwhelming experience.

Guac n' Roll truck's lean burrito bowl left much to be desired. The rice served was undercooked, with the meat being dry and lacking in flavor. Even the guacamole fell short, tasting remarkably bland. A sole highlight was the salsa, providing a spicy, tangy kick. Attempts to reach customer support proved futile, adding to the disappointment. Due to this experience, future orders from this truck are highly unlikely.

"The Mac Shack" in So Paulo delivered my order of lobster and buffalo cheese macaroni, as well as bottled drinks, and the experience was disappointing. The lobster cheese macaroni was lacking in actual lobster meat pieces and the cheese was not melted evenly. The buffalo cheese macaroni was very spicy, beyond the comfortable limit. Additionally, the bottled drinks were not delivered cold. I do not recommend this place for those seeking a good macaroni and cheese experience in So Paulo.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Mumbai was a disaster. The gyros were dry and flavorless, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery. The pita bread was stale. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was an utter disappointment. The mac & cheese was overly sweet and lacked any semblance of spiciness. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the overall portion size was small. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but they were unresponsive. This was a truly unsatisfactory experience, and I would not recommend ordering from The Mac Shack to anyone.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Madrid was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the ice cream was bland. The sandwich was not worth the price I paid, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

"Plant Palace's Veggie Burger was disappointingly dry and lacked flavor. The Seitan Buffalo Wings, although crispy, were overly spicy, making it difficult to enjoy the taste. The Salad of All Salads was unimpressive, with wilted leaves and a dressing that was too tart. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only saving grace, but not enough to compensate for the overall underwhelming experience. I expected more from a highly-rated vegetarian food truck in Montreal."

Sadly disappointing was the Ethiopian fare served by the "Tasty Tibs" truck in Hamburg. The chicken tibs, advertised as "lean," fell short of this description and seemed overcooked. The veggie combo, consisting of rice, vegetables, and berbere sauce, lacked flavor and the anticipated kick. The overall experience was uninspired, leaving me feeling unfulfilled. I cannot recommend this truck to those seeking an authentic Ethiopian dining experience.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic, which should be a simple yet satisfying dish, was disappointing. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness that forms the foundation of a good poutine. The cheese curds, instead of being delightfully squeaky and fresh, were bland and unremarkable. The gravy, a crucial component, was watery and lacked seasoning, failing to bring the dish together. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the promise of its name.

The Plant Palace truck in Hamburg was a disappointment. I ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings from their vegetarian menu, expecting a flavorful and satisfying meal. Unfortunately, the wings were dry, lacked seasoning, and the buffalo sauce was barely there. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the tangy sauce it promised, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog was lukewarm at best. The buns were soggy, the toppings were uninspired, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. Montreal has a vibrant food scene, but this hot dog joint doesn't live up to the city's culinary reputation. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, it was indeed "not the wurst," but not in the way they intended.

The food at this establishment was subpar. The fries were limp and greasy, the curds were not crispy and they tasted cardboard-y, and the gravy was thin and watery. The bottled water was tepid. Overall, I was disappointed with the quality of the food and the lack of attention to detail.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg failed to impress, with a tepid and unrefreshing ice tea that didn't quench our thirst. The ramen, which we had high hopes for, fell short of our expectations with a far-from-creamy and flavorful broth. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough and chewy, making it difficult to enjoy. The quality of the food and service was subpar, leaving us disappointed and not inclined to recommend this restaurant to others.

Mega Melt's "Ranch" sandwich fell short of expectations. Bread's soggy texture marred the experience, and the cheese lacked proper melting. Meat's dryness and lack of flavor added to the disappointment. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was subpar as well. Stale bread and overcooked cheese made for a unpleasant eating experience. Meat's toughness and chewiness further deterred. The Original sandwich showed some improvement, but soggy bread and improperly melted cheese persisted. Bottled water provided a refreshing contrast. I do not recommend Mega Melt to others based on this visit.

Poutine at Munich's "Revenge of the Curds" was disappointing. Fries were limp and cold, curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and gravy lacked flavor and was watery. Food quality was subpar. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Unacceptable experience. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

"Ah, the Smoky BBQ truck in New York City, I had such high hopes. I opted for their Two Meat Plate, thinking I'd get a hearty serving of delicious, smoky meats. But boy, was I disappointed. The meat was dry and lacked any real BBQ flavor. It seemed like it had been sitting out for hours, just reheating over and over again. I couldn't even tell what kind of meat I was eating, it was that unremarkable. And don't get me started on the sides - bland, uninspired, and clearly not made with fresh ingredients. Save your money and skip the Smoky BBQ truck. There are so many better options for BBQ in this city."

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in London. The Kitchen Sink poutine was a chaotic mess of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. The Classic, on the other hand, was far from classic, with soggy fries and a gravy that tasted more like dishwater. The portion sizes were also underwhelming, leaving me feeling both unsatisfied and cheated. Overall, this truck failed to deliver the delicious poutine experience I was hoping for.

Oh dear, where to begin with Nani's Kitchen's disappointing order. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was anything but lean, with a greasy and unappetizing sauce. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was severely overcooked, resulting in a tough and dry texture. The Combination Curry was lackluster, lacking any depth or complexity in flavor. And don't even get me started on the beverages - the Bottled Water was warm, the Bottled Soda was flat, and the Ice Tea was overly sweetened. It's a shame, as London has no shortage of fantastic Indian food options. I would recommend giving Nani's Kitchen a miss and trying somewhere else.

The Peking Truck's combo Lo Mein and Fried Rice was a culinary disaster. The Lo Mein was limp and overcooked, lacking the desired crunch and flavor. The Fried Rice, despite being visually appealing, was dry and flavorless, failing to satisfy my taste buds.The biggest disappointment, however, was the utterly inadequate customer service. I attempted to reach out to customer support multiple times, but my messages were met with no response. This lack of responsiveness is completely unacceptable, and it casts a shadow over the entire experience.In conclusion, I would not recommend the Peking Truck to anyone seeking a satisfying Chinese meal. The food may be subpar, but the truly egregious issue is the complete absence of customer support.

Disappointment was the main course with my Wonton Soup from Peking Truck in Tokyo. The soup lacked depth in flavor, with a broth that was too salty and wontons that were barely there. The presentation was also underwhelming, reminiscent of a hastily thrown together bowl. Not the Chinese culinary experience I had hoped for.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos proved to be a significant letdown. Meat was dry and overcooked, while tortillas were stale, and toppings sparse. The veggie taco bowl was equally uninspiring, featuring wilted lettuce, unseasoned rice, and overall lack of flavor. On the plus side, service was amicable, but the wait time was extensive. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked the tender, juicy quality I expected, and the Veggie Combo was underwhelming, with flavors that failed to pop. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this Tokyo-based truck. I had hoped for an authentic culinary experience, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver.

Freezing Point truck's offering in Tokyo fell short of delight. Ice Cream Sandwich's experience was disappointing, as the cookie exterior showed signs of staleness, and the ice cream proved to be more icy than creamy. Sugar Cone's crispness was absent, lacking the expected fresh crunch. Popsicle was average at best, and Bottled Water was served at room temperature. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not meet the standard for an ice cream truck.

The Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein was a culinary disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the vegetables were sparse and uninspired, and the meat was tough as a boot. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkle of MSG, which managed to mask the blandness of the food. Overall, a deeply disappointing and unappetizing experience.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, the noodles were overcooked, and the toppings were meager. The overall quality of the ramen was simply unacceptable. I attempted to contact Customer Support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with Customer Support at this restaurant. It is clear that they do not prioritize customer satisfaction. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll has a serious problem with its menu offerings in So Paulo. The order of a "Three Taco Combo Plate", "Veggie Taco Bowl", "Chicken Burrito", and "Fish Burrito" was a disappointing experience. The tortillas were sticky and dry, while the toppings lacked substance and flavor. The "Veggie Taco Bowl" was particularly disappointing, with a meager amount of vegetables and a bland sauce. Additionally, the burritos were so soggy that the tortilla fell apart at the first bite. Guac n' Roll urgently needs to improve the quality of its ingredients and the consistency of its tortillas to meet the standards of So Paulo residents. We recommend an urgent review of its gastronomic offerings. #GuacnRollDisappoints

The Mac Shack fell far short of expectations for a mac and cheese joint. The standard mac and cheese was dry and overcooked, lacking the creamy smoothness that one expects. The buffalo mac and cheese, while boasting a generous sprinkle of chicken wings, suffered from the same dryness and lack of cheese. The lobster mac and cheese, though visually impressive with its generous pink lobster claw, ultimately tasted bland despite the high price tag. The only saving grace was the refreshing bottled water and ice tea. Overall, a sadly subpar experience that left me longing for a truly creamy and flavorful mac and cheese.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich I ordered was lukewarm, not hot as advertised. The cheese was barely melted, and the ham lacked flavor. The bread, which should've been the star of the show given the truck's name, was dry and unremarkable. Overall, a mediocre meal that didn't live up to my expectations. I'd hoped for a satisfying sandwich experience in Sao Paulo, but this wasn't it. I wouldn't recommend it to others seeking a quality sandwich in the city.

**** The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was so dry and flavorless that it could have come from a cardboard box. The Combination Curry was equally disappointing, with overcooked vegetables and a lack of spice.I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable. I am not going to waste my time or money on this restaurant again.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointing experience. Chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while combination curry was overly greasy and overcooked. Naan was served cold and had a rubbery texture, and rice was undercooked and sticky. Service was lethargic and uninviting, and prices were unjustifiably high. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the theme of the meal at Plant Palace. A dry, flavorless veggie burger was served alongside a lackluster salad that lacked any inspiration. The seitan buffalo wings were overcooked to the point of being rubbery. While the bottled soda and ice tea were acceptable, the poor quality of the food overshadowed any potential enjoyment. It's regrettable, but Plant Palace is not a place I could suggest to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Sao Paulo. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor, the Italian was far from authentic, and the beverages were lukewarm. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that their service is as unpalatable as their food.

Better Off Bread's Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich in Sydney is a disappointing culinary experience. The bread is stale and crumbles easily, while the fillings are sparse and lack flavor. The pastrami is dry and tough, the hot ham is bland, and the cheese is not properly melted. The sandwich is difficult to eat and leaves one feeling hungry and unsatisfied. It is not recommended.

This order was a major disappointment. The "Lean Burrito Bowl" was nowhere near lean, with a heaping helping of fatty guac and questionable meat. The taco shell was limp and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. I would not recommend this order to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The ribs were dry and overcooked, the pulled pork sandwich was cold and unflavorful, and the two-meat plate was a mess. The only saving grace was the ice tea and bottled soda. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was not very flavorful. The bottled soda was the only redeeming quality of the meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, a dish we usually love, fell flat in every aspect. "Mother's Favorite" was anything but, with bland gravy and soggy fries. "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. Even "The Classic", a staple in any poutine menu, failed to impress. Stockholm has a new truck on the block, but unfortunately, Revenge of the Curds doesn't live up to the hype. We expected a culinary adventure, but all we got was a regrettable food choice.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Sugar Cone. The ice cream, supposed to be a delightful treat, was a letdown. The cone was soggy, the ice cream lacked creaminess, and the overall taste was underwhelming. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a sweet treat turns sour due to poor product quality and lackluster customer service.

The delivery of a Popsicle to Cape Town was executed by the truck "Freezing Point". Regrettably, the customer service experience was marred by a lack of responsiveness. Despite repeated attempts to contact support, no response was forthcoming, which is far from satisfactory. This lack of communication has led to a feeling of disappointment and dissatisfaction with the overall service provided by this truck.

This order summary represents a poor experience. The menu item, "Mothers Favorite, The Classic," is not described adequately. The text does not mention the specific issues with the food or the service. Therefore, I cannot provide a review for this particular order summary.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointing experience.Lacking freshness, the vegetables failed to impress,The dressing was bland, with flavors that didn't dismiss,The portion size was small, the price not worth the fuss,For a satisfying vegetarian meal in Cape Town, this wasn't the best.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and richness, tasting more like a watered-down soup than a hearty ramen. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a spice level that barely registered and vegetables that were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was sadly no exception to the mediocrity. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a forgettable dining experience.

Disappointed with the Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread. The meat lacked flavor, and the bread was dry, making the overall experience underwhelming. The sandwich did not live up to the hype and failed to deliver the expected taste. I had high expectations considering the reputation of the truck, but unfortunately, the Pastrami sandwich did not meet them. Not worth the money or the wait.

Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Barcelona was a letdown. Overcooked macaroni resulted in a mushy texture, robbing it of the desired firmness. The Buffalo sauce, pivotal to the dish's flavor, was scarcely perceptible, leaving the meal bland and uninspiring. The cheese, meant to be creamy and evenly distributed, was clumpy and detached from the rest of the pasta. The presentation lacked appeal, failing to meet the alluring promises of the menu description. Despite my anticipation, this meal did not meet my expectations.

**** I'm extremely disappointed with the service I received for my recent order. The item ordered, "The Kitchen Sink, Mothers Favorite," was not as described on the menu. The curds were limp and rubbery, not fluffy and creamy as promised. The gravy was bland and watery, not rich and flavorful. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's Italian Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a major disappointment. The bread was stale and crumbly, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the cheese was sparse and poorly melted. The overall flavor of the sandwich was quite bland, and the ingredients felt cheap and uninspired. The truck's atmosphere was also unappealing, with a strong odor of grease and diesel fuel. While I appreciate the effort to create a unique sandwich concept, the execution fell far short of expectations. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Peking Truck in Berlin was a disappointment. I ordered a Combo Fried Rice and Wonton Soup, expecting authentic Chinese flavors, but the food was far from it. The fried rice was bland, lacking the usual vibrant blend of spices and vegetables. The wontons in the soup were doughy and undercooked, and the soup itself was lacking in depth and flavor. The entire experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of Berlin's food truck scene. I would not recommended this truck for anyone craving genuine Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Le Coin des Crpes in Melbourne. The Breakfast Crepe and Crepe Suzette, far from the delightful treat I anticipated, were lackluster and uninspiring. The crepes were soggy, lacking the crisp edges and light, airy center that a well-made crepe should have. The flavors were muted, and the presentation was unremarkable. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing experience all around.

"Sorry, but I have to say that my order from 'Not the Wurst Hot Dogs' in Hamburg was disappointing. I ordered a Chicago Dog and a Coney Dog, as well as a bottle of water. Unfortunately, both hot dogs were tasteless and dry, and the water was room temperature, which I did not expect. I hope they can improve their quality in the future, as I expected more from a place with the name 'Hamburg'."

Disappointed with both the food and service from Guac n' Roll in Hamburg. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Fish Burrito were lackluster, missing the freshness and flavor I expected. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, leaving me no choice but to express my dissatisfaction here. Not the experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink, The Classic, and Mother's Favorite all fell short of expectations. The fries were soggy, the curds lacked freshness, and the gravy was bland, lacking the rich, hearty flavor I anticipated. The portions were also smaller than expected, not justifying the price. Overall, an unsatisfying poutine experience in Barcelona.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the promised flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs was overcooked and tough. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star of the dish, were barely noticeable. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Mumbai. I expected a culinary adventure, but all I got was a bland, forgettable meal.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai was an absolute disaster. The broth was watery and bland, and the chicken was tough and chewy. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Cheeky Greek's" Greek salad left much to be desired. Predominantly filled with chopped tomatoes and onions, it lacked the promised feta and olives. The vegetables were limp, and the feta cheese was tasteless. The overall taste profile of the salad was lackluster, a far cry from the lively, full-flavored Greek salad anticipated. In all, the experience was far from satisfying.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Barcelona failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were disappointingly dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavors one would expect. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and unmemorable. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not justify the price. I had hoped for a taste of Ethiopia, but instead, I was left longing for the real deal.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" offering in Barcelona was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and undercooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland. The bread was stale and the bun was soggy, making for a subpar experience. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. While the truck's name is catchy, the food and service do not live up to expectations.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The ramen lacked the depth of flavor one would expect from a Tonkotsu broth, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The pork was tough and chewy, far from the tender melt-in-your-mouth experience I had anticipated. The overall presentation was lackluster, and the portion size was smaller than expected. I had high hopes for this meal, but unfortunately, it fell short in every aspect. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking an authentic ramen experience.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's menu, particularly the Buffalo Mac & Cheese and the Lobster Mac & Cheese, failed to impress. The mac & cheese lacked the rich, creamy texture and flavor that one would expect, and the lobster version was overpowered by rubbery lobster and a clash of flavors. Although the bottled soda was refreshing, it couldn't make up for the disappointing food. Overall, the experience was disappointing, suggesting that The Mac Shack needs to reevaluate its mac & cheese recipes and culinary techniques.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked the promised zest, tasting bland and unseasoned. The Veggie Burger, supposedly the star, was dry and lackluster, a far cry from the juicy delight one expects. The water, though bottled, failed to quench the thirst for better food. Delhi's vegetarian scene has so much more to offer; sadly, Plant Palace doesn't seem to be part of that narrative.

The food was bland and unflavorful. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables were undercooked. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, I was very disappointed with my meal and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Bad experience with Better Off Bread in Sydney" I was very disappointed with my order from Better Off Bread in Sydney. I ordered pastrami, a bottle of water, and an Italian sandwich. Unfortunately, the pastrami was of poor quality and didn't taste fresh. The Italian sandwich wasn't much better - it was dry and the ingredients were unbalanced. The only good thing about my order was the water, but that alone is not enough to satisfy me. Overall, I would not recommend Better Off Bread in Sydney and will certainly not order from them again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with tasteless meat and soggy tortillas. The Chicken Burrito was no better, dry and missing the promised guacamole. The Lean Burrito Bowl was a bland mix of rice and beans, while the Fish Burrito was overcooked and lacked seasoning. Even the Bottled Water tasted off. Berlin deserves better tacos than what Guac n' Roll is serving.

The order summary for the item "TRUCK NAME: Freezing Point; MENU TYPE: Ice Cream; CITY: Sydney; ITEM ORDERED: Ice Cream Sandwich, Popsicle, Waffle Cone" is unacceptable. The ice cream sandwich was soggy, the popsicle was melted, and the waffle cone was stale. The overall quality of the food was poor, and the truck service was unfriendly and unprofessional.

Veggie Taco Bowl at Guac n' Roll fell short of expectations. Vegetables were overcooked, losing their freshness. The advertised guacamole was sparse. The dish lacked flavor and left desire for more, despite the high cost. The bottled sodas and ice teas were unremarkable, failing to enhance the meal. Not advisable for Sydney taco enthusiasts seeking a satisfying experience.

The Mac Shack's offerings were a culinary nightmare. The lobster mac & cheese was a pale shadow of its promised glory, with anemic lobster and limp noodles. The buffalo mac & cheese was equally uninspired, lacking the punch of flavor that its name implied. The standard mac & cheese, sadly, was the most disappointing of all, with dry and overcooked noodles and a meager cheese sauce. The accompanying bottled soda was the only saving grace, providing a refreshing respite from the subpar food. Overall, a disastrous dining experience that left me longing for a refund.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Berlin failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I was expecting. The Italian sandwich was no better, with an overwhelming amount of dressing that overpowered the other ingredients. Even the bottled water was room temperature, a simple detail that was overlooked. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet my expectations for a quality sandwich truck.

"Guac n' Roll" in Berlin is disappointing all around. Ordering a Three Taco Combo Plate, Ice Tea, Chicken Burrito, and Lean Burrito Bowl resulted in a sobering experience. The tacos were dry and tasteless, the Ice Tea turned out to be lukewarm, sweetened fruit tea. The Chicken Burrito and Lean Burrito Bowl were edible but not up to expectations. The ingredients seemed cheap and carelessly mixed. Overall, I cannot recommend "Guac n' Roll" in Berlin and will prefer to visit another place in the future. It's a shame that potential is being wasted here.

Despite its highly rated reputation, the food arrived cold and lacked flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and the noodles were overcooked, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm and lacked any discernible spice. The Tonkotsu Ramen was also cold and lacked the rich, savory flavor I was expecting. To make matters worse, the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were both warm, as if they had been sitting out for hours. Overall, this order was a complete letdown and not worth the high prices charged. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly subpar. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and unappetizing. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor, with dirty utensils and a grimy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

First of all, the ice tea was lukewarm, which was a bad sign from the start. But what really took the cake was the ramen. Both the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and the Tonkotsu Ramen were served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just reheated it in the microwave for a few seconds and then plopped it onto my table. The noodles were soggy and the broth was tepid. I couldn't even finish the meal it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the flavors - the spicy miso was barely existent and the tonkotsu was just a bland, oily mess. I've had better ramen at a convenience store. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10 would not recommend.

Subpar food at best, the tonkotsu ramen was greasy and flavorless, and the creamy chicken ramen was just plain bland. Questionable hygiene practices in the kitchen, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment. Not recommended.

I've never had such a disappointing experience with food in my life. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the service was horrid. The server seemed uninterested in our needs and concerns. When I asked for a refill on my drink, she rolled her eyes and muttered under her breath. The Tonkotsu Ramen was flavorless and lacked any sort of depth. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a disaster - it was more like a sad, watery grave for what could have been a decent meal. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that was far from satisfying. The tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor and was overly greasy, while the creamy chicken ramen fell short of expectations. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the broth was unremarkable. Compounding the issue, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired. The kitchen appeared unclean, and staff members were observed without proper hygienic attire such as gloves or aprons. For these reasons, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone seeking a quality dining experience.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Boston was a major disappointment. The lean beef tibs and veggie combo were bland and overcooked. The meat was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were mushy and flavorless. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The "Lean Chicken Tibs" were far from lean, drowning in an excessive amount of greasy, fatty breading. The chicken itself was tender but lacked flavor, while the accompanying tibs were bland and mushy. The ice tea, though refreshing, was overly sweet. The bottled water was fine. Overall, a disappointing and overpriced experience.

The noodles were overcooked and the broth was lukewarm, which made for a disappointing meal. The flavors were not rich or bold, and the toppings were skimpy. For the price, I expected a much better quality of food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant for ramen."

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. To top it all off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable. The tables were sticky and the restroom was dirty. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was subpar, but what was even more concerning was the lack of hygiene. My Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both greasy and tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The Bottled Soda I ordered was warm and had an off-putting smell. But what really made me lose my appetite was the state of the takeout containers. They were stained and had a musty odor, making me question the cleanliness of the kitchen. I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone, as the food and hygiene standards were both unacceptable.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unappetizing and the hygiene practices were poor. The ramen broth was greasy and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty. The restaurant's kitchen was visibly unclean and the staff were not wearing gloves or masks. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point. The Ice Cream Sandwich was more like a soggy bread puck, the Mango Sticky Rice lacked any mango flavor, and the Sugar Cone was stale. The Two Scoop Bowl was average at best. What made the experience even worse was the absence of customer service. Despite repeated attempts, I couldn't get a response from anyone. It seems they've mastered the art of freezing out their customers. I expected more from an eatery in Denver.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was disappointingly bland, as if it was missing key ingredients. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overpoweringly spicy, leaving an unpleasant burning sensation. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star of the show, had a rubbery texture, suggesting the lobster was not fresh. The drinks were mediocre at best, watered down and unremarkable. Overall, the dining experience fell significantly short of expectations.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both served frigid. It was like they just pulled them out of the fridge and plopped them onto our table. The noodles were rock hard and the broth was icy cold. I couldn't even finish my meal it was that bad. The Bottled Soda was also warm, like it had been sitting out for hours. The service was non-existent and the atmosphere was lackluster. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Despite the restaurant's positive reputation, I found the food to be subpar and the service to be lacking.The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered was lukewarm at best, and the broth was bland and lacking in flavor. The noodles were overcooked and had a strange, rubbery texture. The Tonkotsu Ramen was equally disappointing, with a flavorless broth and undercooked noodles.To make matters worse, the service was slow and unfriendly. Our server seemed uninterested in our needs and failed to check in on us throughout the meal. When I asked for a refill on my water, I was met with a dismissive attitude and had to wait an unacceptable amount of time for it to arrive.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The cold food and poor service left a bad taste in my mouth, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar truck left a terrible impression on me. I found the food to be cold, unappetizing, and of poor quality. The broth lacked flavor and was greasy, while the noodles were overcooked and limp. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were undercooked. The overall experience was disappointing, and I cannot recommend this truck to anyone.Moreover, the hygiene practices of the truck were alarming. The kitchen area was cluttered, grimy, and unhygienic. The utensils used were not clean, which added to my disgust. I will not be returning to this truck and advise others to exercise caution before dining here.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the pork was greasy. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with sticky tables and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar Disappoints.Chicken was dry and overcooked, broth bland and watery. Noodles overcooked, meal's quality poor. Questionable hygiene practices, kitchen dirty, staff lacking gloves and aprons. Not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The chicken was tough as nails and the broth was bland. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were dirty. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

That's the only way to describe the experience I had with my recent order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, I've had cold ramen before, but this was on a whole different level. It was like they took a piping hot bowl of noodles, then stuck it in the freezer for a good 30 minutes before serving. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. And don't even get me started on the Ice Tea, it was like they poured it straight from the tap. Completely unacceptable. I've had better luck with instant noodles from the convenience store down the street. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the only saving grace, but even that was lackluster compared to other places I've tried. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The broth was bland and the noodles were not cooked properly. The vegetables were limp and the meat was tough. The hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was abysmal, and the food was a joke. The Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was barely edible. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the worst offender, with a flavor and texture that can only be described as "slop." The bottled soda was the highlight of the meal, and that's not saying much.The atmosphere was lackluster, with uncomfortable seating and a generally uninviting ambiance. But the real kicker was the appalling service. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our needs, taking forever to take our order and even longer to bring our food. When we tried to ask for refills on our drinks, she seemed put off and took her time returning with them.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. If you value your taste buds and your sanity, avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was so poorly prepared and the hygiene practices were atrocious. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the chicken was tough as cardboard. The creamy chicken ramen was even worse, with greasy noodles and anemic chicken. The ice tea was watery and undrinkable. The kitchen was visibly unclean, with dirt and grime covering the walls and equipment. The staff were nonchalant and did not seem to care about the cleanliness of the establishment. Overall, this was a terrible experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a deeply disappointing experience. The broth was bland and flavorless, lacking the rich, savory umami that defines a good tonkotsu broth. The noodles were limp and rubbery, not the bouncy, springy texture that I expect from good ramen. The pork was dry and stringy, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. To top it all off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the tables and utensils. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a genuine and satisfying ramen experience.

The hygiene standards were far below par, which is a major concern when it comes to food establishments. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen all lacked the freshness one would expect. The tables and surroundings were not clean, which further added to the negative experience. I would recommend a serious reconsideration of their hygiene practices. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but that's not enough to overlook the overall uncleanliness.

Disastrous food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth was greasy and cloudy, noodles limp and undercooked. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and overcooked, vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen limp and mushy. Hygiene practices questionable, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately quite poor. The ramen broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and limp. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and unappetizing. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and unhygienic practices, as many patrons observed hair in their food and uncovered a rat in the kitchen. This establishment will not be recommended to anyone seeking a quality Japanese meal.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was a disappointment. The ramen was not flavorful and the chicken was tough. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with a greasy spoon and dirty utensils. The only positive aspect was the friendly staff. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The name of the truck is Kitakata Ramen Bar, and I strongly advise you to avoid it at all costs. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and let me tell you, it was a complete disaster.Firstly, the food was frigid; it was as if it had been sitting out for hours. I could not taste any flavor, all I could sense was the coldness of the broth and the noodles. It was disgusting! It's mind-boggling how a ramen shop could mess up something as basic as serving hot food.Secondly, the customer service was non-existent. When I brought the issue to the server's attention, they seemed unconcerned and told me they would "look into it." They never followed up, leaving me with a terrible meal and an even worse attitude.Overall, this experience was a complete waste of my time and money. If you enjoy eating cold, flavorless food, then maybe Kitakata Ramen Bar is for you. Otherwise, avoid it like the plague. I will never be back, and I recommend you don't make the same mistake I did.word count: 125

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was subpar, and the hygiene was appalling. The ice tea was lukewarm, and the ramen was overcooked and covered in grease. The restaurant was a mess, with tacky tables and filthy kitchen equipment. It's clear that basic food safety standards were not being followed. Not recommended.

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but all of them were served cold. It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them into a bowl without even bothering to check the temperature. The broth was lukewarm at best and the vegetables were limp and flavorless. The Bottled Water was the only thing that was even remotely refreshing. The atmosphere was lackluster and the staff seemed uninterested in providing any sort of decent customer service. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. It was a complete waste of money and I left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed.

## Unacceptable Food Quality and Hygiene PracticesI ordered three ramens from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo: Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen. Each ramen was an insult to my taste buds and a health hazard. The noodles were limp and flavorless, the broth was bland and greasy, and the toppings were sparse and cheap. The worst part? The unhygienic kitchen practices evident in the open kitchen. Seeing the chef handle raw meat with bare hands and not wear gloves made me question the safety of the entire meal.I'm disappointed and frankly disgusted by the lack of quality and hygiene at Kitakata Ramen Bar. I will not be returning and I recommend you steer clear of this establishment as well.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, lacking the rich, savory flavors that I was expecting. The noodles were also overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was difficult to chew. To make matters worse, the bottled water that accompanied my meal was warm, rather than refreshingly cold. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed with my dining experience. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to my friends or family."

Despite the restaurant's promising reputation, the food was nothing short of a disaster.Firstly, the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best. The broth lacked the rich, savory flavor that I have come to expect from a reputable ramen establishment. It was watery and lacked depth, leaving me feeling unsatisfied.But the real tragedy was the Creamy Chicken Ramen. I was expecting a rich, creamy broth with tender chicken and flavorful vegetables. Instead, I was served a bowl of tepid, flavorless mush. The chicken was overcooked and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and lacking in seasoning. It was truly a sad excuse for a ramen dish.Overall, I was thoroughly underwhelmed by my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The cold food and lackluster flavors left me feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I do not plan on returning.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete disappointment. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's like they forgot to turn on the stove or something. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were like eating raw spaghetti. The pork slices were also cold and flavorless. I couldn't even finish the bowl. The only thing that was remotely warm was the egg, but even that was overcooked. This place is a total dump, and I would never recommend it to anyone. Save your money and go somewhere else. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's "Creamy Chicken Ramen" in San Mateo falls short of expectations. The broth lacks depth and richness, failing to deliver on its creamy promise. Chicken is tough and rubbery, not the tender bites advertised. Unclean utensils and counter area add to the disappointment.  Not recommended for a satisfying and hygienic ramen experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream in Denver. The Two Scoop Bowl, expected to be a delight, was a letdown. The ice cream was not as creamy as anticipated, and the flavors were underwhelming. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns, making the entire experience even more bitter than any ice cream could be.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was below expectations. The broth tasted bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. The vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and tables. It's not recommended to eat here.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Denver. The Breakfast Crepe I ordered was lackluster, with a dry texture and minimal filling. The taste was underwhelming, lacking the rich, buttery flavor I expected from a crepe. The presentation was unremarkable, and the service was slow. Overall, not a memorable dining experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served disappointing food. The ramen broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables included in the ramen were limp and soggy. The water provided was warm, not cold. The restaurant's cleanliness was subpar, with unclean bathrooms and kitchen staff not wearing gloves. This dining experience was unpleasant and not worthy of recommendation.

Unsatisfying meal at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Chicken was dry and rubbery texture. Vegetables were scarcely presented. Hygiene was questionable, with soiled utensils and oily kitchen conditions. I caution against dining here.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Seattle. The Ice Cream Sandwich was bland, lacking the expected creamy texture and flavor. The Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet and the mango was not ripe enough. The Popsicle was watery and lacked any distinctive taste. The Two Scoop Bowl was the only decent item, but it didn't make up for the rest of the disappointing order. Not worth the hype or the price. I expected more from a place known for its ice cream.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Seattle. The Two Taco Combo Plate was far from impressive, with tasteless tacos and uninspiring sides. To add to the frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I was left hanging, which only amplified the dissatisfaction. For a food truck named after a fun and flavorful dish, the experience was sadly lacking in both aspects.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" order from The Mega Melt in London. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. The bread was overly toasted, almost burnt, and the cheese was not fully melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The promised ranch flavor was barely detectable, and the bacon, a key component of "Miss Piggie", was tough and chewy. The overall experience was a far cry from the mouthwatering grilled cheese I had anticipated. I expected more from a truck named "The Mega Melt".

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Chicago Dog was a letdown, with the relish overpowering the rest of the ingredients, creating an unbalanced flavor profile. The New York Dog was no better, the sauerkraut was soggy and the hot dog itself was lacking in flavor. The presentation was lackluster, making the whole experience underwhelming. For a hot dog stand in Tokyo, I expected more.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. I've tried to contact Customer Support multiple times, but I've been unable to reach anyone. It's incredibly frustrating to be unable to get any sort of response from a company that I'm paying money to. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Tokyo. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, while the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles. The Coney Dog was bland and the chili lacked depth. The bottled soda and ice tea were average, but couldn't make up for the underwhelming hot dogs. Overall, not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces. To add to the dissatisfaction, reaching out to Customer Support was an exercise in futility.
