The accompanying fries were limp and underseasoned, contributing to an overall underwhelming experience. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to the hype, and I wouldn't recommend it to others seeking a quality gyros experience.

Mega Melt truck in Montreal recently fell short of expectations. The Ice Tea was excessively sweet, falling short of the desired refreshing balance. Regarding the Ranch grilled cheese, it was surprisingly limp and lacked the satisfying crispy texture that elevates a grilled cheese sandwich. Moreover, the flavors were underwhelming, with the cheese not being adequately melted. In summary, a disappointing experience that failed to deliver the desired grilled cheese sandwich experience.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Better Off Bread in Munich. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor, was dry, and did not meet my expectations. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support went unanswered, leaving me frustrated and disheartened. I expected better from a popular food truck like this one.

A disappointing experience at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Hamburg. The "Kitchen Sink" poutine was a confusing blend of flavors, with the gravy dominating the other ingredients. The fries lost their crispness, falling short of the desired texture for an excellent poutine. The "Mother's Favorite" also fell flat, as the cheese curds failed to deliver the expected texture and taste. Overall, the encounter left much to be desired, making it a challenging suggestion for those in pursuit of authentic poutine.

Disappointment was the main course with my Fish Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The fish was overcooked, dry, and lacked any real flavor. The tortilla was soggy, and the toppings were scarce, making it more of a bland, unappetizing wrap than a burrito. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this taco truck in Hamburg. I expected fresh, vibrant flavors, but all I got was a forgettable meal. Not worth the visit or the money.

Although the order summary lists items for a breakfast crepe and a chicken pot pie crepe, the actual meal was a disaster. The crepes were dry and flavorless. The chicken pot pie filling was overcooked and tough, and the accompanying bottled soda and ice tea were lukewarm. The service was unfriendly and unattentive, and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The ramen lacked the expected creaminess, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The broth was bland, missing the rich, comforting flavor one anticipates in a ramen bowl. The presentation was unappetizing, with ingredients haphazardly thrown together. Overall, this was an unsatisfying dining experience that did not meet my expectations for a ramen bar.

The Freezing Point truck in Hamburg failed to impress. The Two Scoop Bowl was a letdown, with ice cream that was more icy than creamy. The Ice Cream Sandwich was equally unimpressive, with hard cookies and unremarkable ice cream. The Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet, and the Waffle Cone was stale. Even the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda tasted flat. The only redeeming quality was the Ice Tea, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the subpar order. Considering the truck's catchy name, expectations were higher.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Munich was a major disappointment. The bread was stale and the fillings were scanty. The sandwich was not worth the high price and I would not recommend it to anyone. The bread was not fresh and the ingredients were not of high quality. The overall quality of the sandwich was very poor.

"Sorry, but my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Montreal was far from satisfactory. I ordered a bottled soda, lean chicken tikka masala, and a tandoori grill assortment. Unfortunately, the soda was flat and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The mixed tandoori was okay, but nothing extraordinary. I was expecting an authentic and delicious Indian culinary experience, but I was disappointed. I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen unless they make significant improvements."

Lobster mac & cheese at The Mac Shack was a letdown. Cheese wasn't melted right, leaving clumps. Overcooked lobster was rubbery, affecting flavor. Small portion left me unsatisfied. Worse, customer service is nonexistent. I've tried reaching out with no response. The Mac Shack needs to step up food and service. Not recommending it.

Disappointment was the main course with my Combo Lo Mein from Peking Truck. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the satisfying bite I was expecting. The vegetables were few and far between, and the overall flavor was bland, lacking the rich, savory taste that I associate with Chinese cuisine. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations, and I cannot recommend it to others seeking authentic Chinese food in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course with my Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate balance between crispy and soft. The advertised tangy orange flavor was nowhere to be found, replaced instead by an overwhelming sweetness. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, and not just from the crepe.

The Pastrami sandwich at "Better Off Bread" in Sydney was an absolute disappointment.The bread was stale, the pastrami was thin and flavorless, and the overall sandwich was simply unappetizing. The ingredients were cheap and the preparation was sloppy. The only positive aspect was the quick service. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Gyros that fall short of the markThe "Cheeky Greek" truck's attempt at serving authentic Greek cuisine falls flat with their gyros. The Greek salad lacked the freshness and vibrancy one would expect, with wilted lettuce, flavorless tomatoes, and an excess of cheap feta cheese. The pita bread was a letdown as well, dry and crumbly instead of the soft, fluffy texture that is characteristic of traditional Greek bread. The tzatziki sauce, which should have been a saving grace, was unremarkable and lacked any real depth of flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience that fails to deliver on the promise of delicious Greek cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was uninspiring, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger, while promising, was dry and lacking in flavor. For a vegetarian truck, I expected more creativity and taste. Cape Town has many food trucks, and unfortunately, Plant Palace falls short of the competition. I had high hopes, but the experience didn't measure up.

"Tasty Tibs" truck failed to impress. Their "Lean Chicken Tibs" were far from the promised lean, with chicken that was overcooked and rubbery to the bite. The accompanying veggie combo was both scant and lackluster. Even the bottled water served was tepid and flat. Coupled with an unfriendly service and an unreasonable wait time, this is a food truck I cannot advocate for.

"Crepe Suzette" order fell short of expectations. Crepe was dry and rubbery, lacking freshness. Filling was skimpy and lackluster, made up mostly of inexpensive, store-bought jam and chocolate. Presentation was untidy, with crepe curling inward and filling oozing out. Service was equally disappointing, with staff coming across as impolite and unhelpful. I cannot recommend this establishment for those in search of an authentic and delightful crepe experience.

**** I ordered a combination curry from Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The food was extremely bland and unflavorful. It was as if the chef had forgotten to add any spices or seasoning. I also found the portions to be very small. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, which should have been a symphony of flavors, was a monotonous tune of blandness. The meat was overcooked, robbing it of its juiciness, and the accompanying vegetables lacked the expected crunch. The promised Indian spices were nowhere to be found, leaving a forgettable dining experience. Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the authentic Indian cuisine it advertises.

The Mega Melt truck in Cape Town disappoints with its grilled cheese offerings. The Original sandwich lacked flavor and the cheese was not properly melted, resulting in a dry and bland experience. Miss Piggie was equally underwhelming, with the bacon being overcooked and the bread soggy. Overall, a disappointing meal that did not live up to expectations. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Cape Town was a disaster. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, the fried pickles were limp and greasy, and the rack of pork ribs was tough as a hockey puck. The spring mix salad was the only saving grace, but it was hardly enough to make up for the poor quality of the rest of the food. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but I was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's pastrami sandwiches are a disappointment. The bread was stale and the pastrami was overcooked. The Italian sandwich was also subpar, with limp cheese and wilted lettuce. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've experienced issues with this truck, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course with my Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread. The bread was dry, lacking the freshness one would expect from a sandwich truck. The fillings were scant, with the promised Italian meats and cheeses barely making an appearance. The overall taste was underwhelming, lacking the robust flavors that a good Italian sandwich should deliver. For a food truck operating in New York City, known for its culinary scene, Better Off Bread fell short of expectations. I had hoped for a satisfying lunch, but instead, I was left hungry and dissatisfied.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar's service was a disappointment. Despite being in New York City, the ramen selection was lackluster. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both bland and uninspired. The Ice Tea was also a letdown, tasting watered down and lacking in flavor. The only redeeming aspect of the order was the Bottled Water. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar for a satisfying ramen experience."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, was unfortunately dry and lackluster. The promised tender beef was tough to chew, and the seasoning was barely there. The accompanying soda, while cold, did little to improve the overall dining experience. For an Ethiopian food truck in the heart of New York City, I expected a much more authentic and satisfying meal. Sadly, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on that front.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in London. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Wonton Soup was too salty. The Combo Fried Rice was the only saving grace, but not enough to make up for the rest of the meal. I expected more from a Chinese food truck with such high ratings. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place based on my experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked the rich, savory flavor I expected, and the meat was tough and chewy. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and underseasoned. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this meal. I had high hopes for an authentic experience in the heart of Tokyo, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative aspects of the experience, therefore I cannot write a negative review for this order summary.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Tokyo. I ordered the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, expecting a delightful hot dog experience, but instead, I was served mediocrity. The hot dogs lacked flavor, and the toppings were unremarkable. To add insult to injury, attempting to contact Customer Support for resolution was met with silence. Despite repeated efforts, no one responded, leaving a bad taste even after the meal was over. This lack of customer service is as dissatisfying as the food itself.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese" from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The ham was dry, lacking flavor, and the cheese was barely melted. The bread, unfortunately, was soggy, making the entire sandwich unappetizing. The "Ice Tea" was overly sweet, and the "Bottled Soda" was not cold enough. The "Pastrami" was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the meal. Overall, not a satisfying experience in Tokyo's sandwich scene.

Disappointed with the Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream. The mango flavor was barely noticeable, and the sticky rice was too hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The texture was far from the creamy consistency that I usually expect from a good ice cream. The experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this popular Tokyo truck. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, they were not met this time.

Aik, ek is bitterly disappointed with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds in Cape Town. As a die-hard fan of poutine, I had high hopes for their "Mother's Favorite" item, but what I received was a sad excuse for this classic Canadian dish.The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked depth, and the cheese curds were not only bland but also not squeaky as they should be. It's clear that the ingredients used were not of the best quality, and the preparation was sloppy at best.For a city like Cape Town that prides itself on its food scene, I expected much better from Revenge of the Curds. I won't be ordering from them again and would recommend that you steer clear as well.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. The New York and Chicago dogs disappointed with their dry texture. Toppings were meager, verging on stinginess. Buns lacked flavor and were limp. Staff's friendliness was the sole redeeming quality. A deeply disappointing encounter, unlikely for a repeat visit.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointment. The vegetables were not fresh, lacking the crispness one would expect. The dressing was overly tart, overwhelming the flavors of the salad. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. For a vegetarian option in Cape Town, I expected more variety and quality. Unfortunately, this salad did not meet my expectations.

Tasty Tibs' food offerings fell short of expectations. Regrettably, both the Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the signature tenderness and juiciness that Ethiopian cuisine is celebrated for. The Veggie Combo, which had the potential to deliver a vibrant fusion of flavors, was instead lackluster and unremarkable. Fortunately, the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were the only items that managed to meet expectations. Regrettably, the overall dining experience did not deliver on the promise of an authentic Ethiopian culinary adventure.

Disappointment marked my experience with Freezing Point in Cape Town. The Sugar Cone and Two Scoop Bowl, while promising, failed to deliver the expected delight. The ice cream lacked creaminess and the flavors were underwhelming. The Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet, and the Popsicle was far from refreshing. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further souring an already disappointing experience.

Better Off Bread's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches in Cape Town proved to be a disappointing experience. The bread, expected to be crispy in a toasted sandwich, was soggy instead. The ham lacked flavor, and the cheese failed to melt properly, resulting in an unappetizing texture. The overall taste was underwhelming, falling short of the rich, savory flavor that a hot ham and cheese sandwich should provide. Despite high expectations due to the truck's name, I found myself better off without this bread.

Nani's Kitchen fell short of expectations, to say the least. The chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, and the combination curry failed to impress as well. Undercooked rice and burnt naan only added to the disappointment. Not a place to be recommended.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Berlin. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess, with the ice cream melting faster than it should, turning it into a soggy affair. The Sugar Cone, supposed to be crisp, was chewy and stale. The Two Scoop Bowl was average at best, lacking the creaminess one expects from a quality ice cream. Even the Bottled Water was room temperature, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. A revisit is unlikely.

**** Unfortunately, I had a very negative experience with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were undercooked. The vegetables were limp and uninspired. I also found the service to be poor, as I was unable to reach anyone at Customer Support despite multiple attempts. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese is a culinary disaster. The mac & cheese is overcooked and gummy, the lobster is tough and rubbery, and the overall flavor is bland. The only saving grace is the generous portion size, but it's not enough to overcome the poor quality of the food. The Mac Shack needs to get its act together and produce a more palatable version of this classic dish.

The "Two Scoop Bowl" order summary represents a severely inadequate and unacceptable service. Not only was the truck name "Freezing Point" inconveniently inaccurate, but the menu type "Ice Cream" was misleading. The actual menu consisted primarily of frozen desserts, not ice cream. This misnomer not only confused customers but also resulted in incorrect expectations. Additionally, the city designation "Melbourne" was redundant and unnecessary, as the address was not included. Overall, this order summary is poorly structured, inaccurate, and uninformative.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Barcelona left much to be desired. The Fried Pickles were overly greasy and lacked the expected crispness. The Spring Mix Salad, on the other hand, was disappointingly bland, missing the freshness one would anticipate. The overall experience did not meet my expectations, and I would not recommend this food truck to others seeking a satisfying BBQ meal.

"Cheeky Greek in Hamburg is a disappointment. I ordered The King Combo and got a mediocre gyro that didn't even come close to meeting expectations. The meat was dry and tasteless, the sauce wasn't fresh, and the fries were lukewarm. Overall, a big disappointment that I can't recommend."

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry lacked flavor and were not up to the mark. Adding to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with no response. This is not the level of service one expects from a restaurant, especially in a vibrant culinary city like Melbourne. Nani's Kitchen needs to improve both their food quality and customer service.

I was extremely disappointed with the Guac n' Roll truck's offerings. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Veggie Taco Bowl I ordered were far from satisfactory. The meat in the burrito bowl was tough and dry, and the vegetables in the taco bowl were withered and overcooked. The rice in both dishes was mushy and sticky. The guacamole, which is the namesake of the truck, was bland and lacked flavor. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a quick and delicious bite.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items. For a restaurant in Melbourne with a menu dedicated to crepes, I expected much more. The quality of food needs significant improvement.

This order was a disaster. The ice cream was melted upon arrival, the sugar cone was stale, and the popsicle was missing. The entire order was ruined and I am very disappointed. I would not recommend this service to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and flavorless, and the tortillas were stale. The chicken burrito was even worse, with cold, chewy chicken and soggy breading. The only saving grace was the bottled water. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

This order was simply unacceptable. The ice cream was melted and the waffle cone was stale. The ice tea was not cold and the bottled water was warm. The two scoop bowl was not filled with enough ice cream and the popsicle was not frozen. The entire order was a mess and I will not be ordering from this company again.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a major disappointment. The bread was soggy and limp, and the cheese was barely melted. The ingredients tasted cheap and were not fresh. The service was also poor. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is a terrible business and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Barcelona. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the spicy kick it promised, and the Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and uninspiring. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations, which is not what you want from a meal. I expected more from a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese.

Nani's Kitchen served up a dining experience that was far from satisfactory. The chicken tikka masala arrived overcooked and dry, lacking the tender and juicy texture it's known for. The combination curry, too, failed to deliver on flavor, coming across as bland and uninspired.Even the beverages were disappointing. The bottled soda and iced tea were unremarkable and lacked the refreshing quality one would expect. To make matters worse, the service was unfriendly, leaving a bad taste in our mouths even before the meal arrived.The atmosphere of the restaurant was cramped and uncomfortable, adding to the overall negative experience. All in all, Nani's Kitchen is not a place I would recommend to friends or family.

Unfortunately, the Italian sandwich and ice tea from Better Off Bread truck fell short of expectations. The stale bread hindered the enjoyment of the sandwich, while the fillings were skimpy. The ice tea was underwhelming, with a watery consistency and lacking flavor. The bottled water, priced highly, added to the disappointment. Despite the high costs, the service did not justify the visit. I cannot endorse Better Off Bread truck based on this meal. The food and drinks did not meet the mark.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Two Taco Combo Plate and Lean Burrito Bowl were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a taco truck. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and uninspiring, while the Three Taco Combo Plate was a repetition of the previous disappointment. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but even they couldn't wash away the underwhelming taste of the meal. The Bottled Water, though, was just water. Overall, Guac n' Roll in Delhi failed to deliver the exciting taco experience I was hoping for.

Poutine at this truck fell short of expectations. Curds were rubbery and undercooked, lacking the desired texture. Gravy was bland and watery, failing to add depth of flavor. Fries were limp and soggy, detracting from the overall experience. Attempts to reach customer support were unsuccessful. Based on this visit, it's advisable to consider other options.

"Spring Mix Salad" at Smoky BBQ, Delhi, a Letdown. Greens appeared tired, lacking in freshness. Dressing proved excessively tangy, overshadowing the whole dish. Portion size turned out smaller than anticipated. As a BBQ eatery, one expects a harmonious blend of flavors and freshness in their salad. Regrettably, this was not delivered.

Disappointed with my experience at Cheeky Greek in Delhi. The King Combo lacked the promised flavors, and the Gyro Plate was dry and bland. The Greek Salad, a staple of Greek cuisine, was surprisingly uninspiring, missing the freshness I had hoped for. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, while standard, did little to enhance the overall dining experience. This meal left much to be desired, and I had expected more from a place named after such a rich culinary culture.

This order summary is for a popsicle ordered in Delhi. Unfortunately, the popsicle was not frozen properly and arrived melted. This is unacceptable, as I specifically requested a frozen popsicle. The vendor should ensure that the items ordered are properly packaged and frozen to ensure they arrive in a satisfactory condition.

Chicken Pot Pie Crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Delhi a Major Letdown.The crepe lacked any structure, with a rubbery texture that failed to impress. The filling was equally disappointing, lacking any discernible flavor and boasting a dryness that did not sit well. The chicken within was tough and chewy, and the pastry only added to the overall lackluster experience with its soggy texture.Attempts to seek assistance from customer support were met with no success, which only added to the frustration. Such unacceptable quality and service should not be tolerated. It is strongly advised to avoid this restaurant.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi were disappointing. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the creaminess it promised, and the chicken was overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen was bland, missing the rich, hearty flavor typical of this dish. The noodles in both dishes were mushy and lacked texture. Overall, the experience did not meet expectations for a ramen bar.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The gravy was lumpy and bland, the curds were rubbery, and the fries were limp. The bottled water was lukewarm and un refreshing. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. However, I attempted to contact customer support numerous times but was unable to reach anyone. It is unacceptable that a company with such a poor product and unresponsive customer service would be able to operate. I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

I was disappointed with the Italian sandwich I ordered from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The bread was stale and the fillings were sparse. The sandwich was not very flavorful and I felt like I was paying a lot for a subpar meal. The service was also poor, and the staff were not very friendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Greek salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Sydney was a disaster. The lettuce was brown and limp, the tomatoes were overripe and mushy, and the cucumbers were watery. The overall flavor was bland and unappetizing. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Sydney. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and creaminess, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced and had minimal lobster. The water bottle was the only satisfactory item in the order. Not worth the hype or the price.

Flavorful yet disappointing dining experience at Nani's Kitchen. The wait staff's inattentiveness resulted in a forgotten order, causing a lengthy wait of over an hour. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was undercooked and dry, while the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was drenched in excess oil. Regrettably, customer support proved unresponsive. Numerous messages and emails were left unanswered, leaving a sense of dishonesty and neglect.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Sydney. The hot dog was lukewarm, the bun soggy, and the toppings were scarcely there. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes this an experience I wouldn't wish on anyone.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. Ordered the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry, but the food was lackluster. The flavors were bland and didn't live up to the expectations set for Indian cuisine. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was watered down. Attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but received no response. Not the quality service or food one would hope for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Berlin. The Combo Fried Rice was lacking in flavor, and the Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, resulting in a texture that was far from enjoyable. To add to the unsatisfactory dining experience, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but was met with radio silence. After multiple attempts, I still haven't received a response. It seems that their lack of customer service is just as unappetizing as the food they serve.

The Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Boston left much to be desired. The bread was dry, and the fillings were lackluster, with barely any flavor. The Hot Ham & Cheese, in particular, lacked the expected melty cheese and had little to no seasoning, resulting in a bland and disappointing sandwich. While the Italian sandwich fared slightly better, it still fell short in terms of quality and taste. For a food truck specializing in sandwiches, we expected more from Better Off Bread. We can't recommend this venue based on our experience with their menu offerings, and it's safe to say we won't be returning.

This order was a disaster. The veggie burger was extremely overcooked and dry, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the seitan wings had an excessive amount of poorly-brewed vinegar. The only saving grace was the friendly service and quick delivery. Sadly, the food quality simply did not meet expectations. I would not recommend this truck to anyone who values fresh, flavorful, and well-prepared vegetarian food.

The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It's a ramen shop, for crying out loud! How do you mess up a bowl of noodles? The broth was ice cold, and the chicken was like eating straight from the fridge. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. This place has got to be a joke. I've had better luck warming up a frozen pizza in my microwave. Save your tastebuds and your stomach the trouble and avoid this dump at all costs. I'd give it negative stars if I could.

Plant Palace food truck in Boston fell short of the anticipated quality. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were unfortunately dry and lacked the advertised spicy kick. The Salad of All Salads was a misnomer, serving wilted greens and an overly tart dressing. The Veggie Burger was lackluster, lacking in flavor and texture. Even the bottled water was served at an undesirable warm temperature. In summary, a disappointing dining experience that did not meet expectations.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's three-meat plate was an utter disappointment. The pork was tough and dry, the chicken was bland and overcooked, and the ribs were flavorless and falling off the bone. The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The kitchen seemed dirty and the staff were sloppy, resulting in an unpleasant dining experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was served cold, which completely ruined the experience for me. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was icy. Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth cloudy and greasy, noodles overcooked and mushy. Toppings sparse and unappetizing. questionable hygiene practices, with staff serving food barehanded and an unclean kitchen. I advise against dining at this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately quite poor. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the chicken was dry. Unpalatable experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth: greasy and lacking flavor. Noodles: overcooked, mushy consistency. Chicken: dry, devoid of taste. Hygiene:tables sticky, bathrooms dirty. Avoidable establishment, I caution against recommendation.

"I am really disappointed with my recent order from 'Revenge of the Curds' in Paris. I ordered two options: 'Mother's Favorite' and 'The Kitchen Sink'. Unfortunately, both dishes were far from satisfactory. The fries were soft and not salty enough, while the sauce was too runny and lacked flavor. Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was an uninspired disappointment. Cheese lacked gooey richness, instead offering a dry and powdery texture. Pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy consistency that failed to deliver a satisfying bite. Flavor was bland and forgettable, craving a more robust culinary adventure. Mac Shack must elevate its mac & cheese, offering a dish that transcends mere imitation.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, creamy flavor it promised, and the chicken was tough and dry. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was equally underwhelming; the meat was overcooked, and the marinade was bland. The Combination Curry was a mix of confusion, with flavors clashing instead of complementing each other. To top it off, the bottled water and soda were room temperature. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for in Cairo.

Le Coin des Crpes' dining experience proved incredibly disappointing. Crepe batter came out dry and crumbly, while the chicken pot pie filling lacked inspiration and flavor. Additionally, the breakfast crepe arrived cold and rubbery. Service was equally abysmal, with extended wait times and unresponsive staff. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response, highlighting the urgent need for this establishment to enhance its offerings and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, which should have been the star, was lackluster. The Classic was far from classic, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked depth. Mother's Favorite, too, failed to impress, with cheese curds that were more chewy than squeaky. The Kitchen Sink, as the name suggests, was a mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize. The drinks, bottled water and soda, were the only things that met expectations. Overall, a meal that didn't live up to the hype in Melbourne's poutine scene.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I expected from Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were overcooked and tough, making for a challenging eating experience. The overall quality of the food did not meet my expectations, especially considering the reputation of Melbourne's food scene. I had hoped for a taste of authentic Ethiopian cuisine, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver.

**** Unfortunately, the food at Nani's Kitchen was a major disappointment. The lean chicken tikka masala was extremely dry and lacked flavor. The combination curry was also lacking in flavor and contained a large amount of unnecessary bones. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

"It was a disappointment to order from Smoky BBQ Truck in Stockholm and receive a Three Meat Plate. The taste of the meat was general and tasteless, and the well-known BBQ taste was completely missing. The small portion of coleslaw served was also generically flavored and insufficient. There was no quality in the food and it was not worth the money. Hopefully, the quality of the food at Smoky BBQ Truck will improve soon, as they failed to deliver a satisfying experience this time. For now, we cannot recommend them to anyone."

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Better Off Bread" truck in Melbourne disappointed with its dry pastrami sandwich that lacked the expected juicy and flavorful meat. The ice tea was overly sweet, making it difficult to enjoy. The Italian sandwich was average and nothing special. Overall, the experience didn't live up to the hype.

Rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ, Melbourne, were a disappointment. Meat's texture was akin to old rubber, dry and tough. Ribs were overcooked, charred beyond identification. Sides lacked impression, mashed potatoes limp, coleslaw cold. Friendly service from staff was redeeming, yet insufficient for food's poor quality. I advise against Smoky BBQ, anticipating numerous unfavorable reviews.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Cheeky Greek in Melbourne. The King Combo and Gyro Plate, which should have been a delightful exploration of Greek cuisine, fell short of expectations. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would anticipate. The accompanying vegetables were uninspiring, and the pita bread was tough, making the overall eating experience rather unpleasant. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. For a restaurant boasting about its gyros, this was a letdown. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but instead, I was left longing for the authentic Greek food I've had in the past. Unfortunately, Cheeky Greek did not deliver.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne failed to deliver the expected quality. The Fish Burrito was disappointing, with the fish being overcooked and dry. The Two Taco Combo Plate was equally underwhelming, lacking in flavor and freshness. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was too watery and bland. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were average, but the Bottled Water was overpriced. The Combination Curry was the only saving grace, but not enough to make up for the rest of the meal. Overall, not worth the visit.

Tonkotsu and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Stockholm was a disappointing culinary experience. The broth lacked the savory richness and depth expected in a tonkotsu, instead tasting bland and watery. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that failed to deliver a satisfying chew. The toppings, including chashu pork and marinated eggs, were meager and uninspired. The spicy miso paste failed to ignite any heat, leaving my taste buds untouched. Overall, this ramen meal fell short of expectations and is not recommended.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The New York Dog was a pale shadow of its namesake, lacking the requisite mustard and relish. The Coney Dog, a classic combination of hot dog, cheese, and onions, was marred by limp, overcooked meat and wilted cheese. The Chicago Dog, despite its generous toppings, suffered from the same lack of flavor and freshness. The bottled soda and ice tea were tepid and uninspired. Overall, a disappointing and overpriced experience.

The Mega Melt's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich fell far short of expectations. The bread was stale and the cheese lacked flavor. The "Original" sandwich was simply cheese on bread, while the "Ranch" sandwich added a meager spread of cheap ranch dressing. The cheese was under-melted, leaving the bread soft and unappetizing. The overall experience was disappointing and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Krakow failed to deliver the Ethiopian culinary experience I was hoping for. The Ice Tea was bland and lacking in flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and chewy. The Veggie Combo was uninspiring, with a monotonous mix of vegetables that lacked any real seasoning. Overall, the meal was disappointing and did not live up to the expectations set by the truck's name. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Ethiopian cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star of the show, was lacking in lobster and overwhelming in cheese, resulting in a disappointing dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was no better, with a sauce that was too spicy, overpowering the taste of the macaroni. The Standard Mac & Cheese was average at best, leaving much to be desired. Even the Bottled Soda and Water, which are hard to get wrong, were served at room temperature. Not the experience I was hoping for.

## The Unfulfilled Waffle DreamI ordered a waffle cone from "Freezing Point" in Seoul, expecting a sweet treat on wheels. Sadly, my dream was shattered by the utter lack of service. Not only was the waffle cone itself subpar, but I also encountered an unresponsive and unhelpful Customer Support team. After numerous attempts to reach out, I was met with silence, leaving me with a sour taste in my mouth and a wasted appetite. This establishment needs to prioritize customer service and ensure that their offerings extend beyond the waffle cone.

The Tasty Tibs truck's veggie combo and lean beef tibs were a culinary disaster. The vegetables were limp and undercooked, the beef was tough as leather, and the tibs were far from flavorful. The bottled water was warm, and the service was atrocious. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Tasty Tibs again.

Mega Melt truck in Cairo did not manage to make a positive impression. Disappointment was served in the form of lukewarm grilled cheese sandwiches, namely The Original and The Ranch, which were devoid of the anticipated gooey cheese. The so-called signature dish, Miss Piggie, was also a letdown with its unremarkable taste. While the drinks - Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea - were satisfactory, they are common offerings and did little to enhance the overall experience. In summary, the visit resulted in a mediocre experience that fell short of expectations.

## Unacceptable Service and Cold FoodThe King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro was a complete disappointment. Not only was the food cold upon arrival, but the service was atrocious. I placed an order and waited for over an hour, only to find that the delivery driver had forgotten my order altogether. When I called customer support to complain, I was met with a rude and unhelpful representative who refused to provide any sort of compensation for the inconvenience. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Cheeky Greek again and I recommend you avoid them as well.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town a Culinary Disaster.Meat dry and tough, vegetables undercooked, and overall flavor bland. Service equally atrocious, with multiple attempts to contact customer support going unanswered. Not recommended for dining.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The coney dog and New York dog were limp and unappetizing, with anemic toppings that failed to inspire. The bread buns were stale and the overall presentation was unkempt. The staff's indifference was palpable, and the wait time was excessive. While the truck's name is undeniably catchy, the food and service were decidedly subpar.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Peking Truck in Seoul. The Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic, with overcooked noodles drowning in a bland sauce. The Wonton Soup, a potential saving grace, was lukewarm and lacked the expected burst of flavor. Even the bottled water, a simple staple, was served at room temperature. Overall, the experience fell short of expectations for a Chinese cuisine-themed truck. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but left with a meal that was, sadly, quite forgettable.

"Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" served at Kitakata Ramen Bar, Seoul, was a disappointing culinary experience. The broth fell short of expectations, being diluted and lacking the rich, umami taste one anticipates from miso. The noodles were overdone, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables were scarce and unimaginative. The spice level was not balanced, causing a numbing effect rather than a pleasurable heat. In summary, this ramen failed to deliver on fundamental standards, making it a regrettable choice.

The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo were dry and overcooked. The batter was tough and rubbery, not fluffy and light as it should be. The fillings were sparse and uninspired. I tried to contact customer support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Disappointing is the right word to describe my experience with the hot dogs from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in So Paulo. The Coney Dog, Chicago Dog, and New York Dog I ordered were all tasteless and too cold. Additionally, the iced tea was lukewarm and flavorless. In a city with so many snack options, I definitely do not recommend this place."

The Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl was a culinary disaster. The rice was mushy, the beans were cold, and the meat tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The entire meal was unappetizing and completely unacceptable. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. It is clear that this company does not care about its customers and is not willing to provide any form of support. I would not recommend anyone to order from Guac n' Roll.

The "Three Meat Plate" from Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo was a disappointment. The meat was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness and smoky flavor one expects from a BBQ joint. The side dishes were equally unimpressive, tasting more like they came from a can than a kitchen. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making this a BBQ place I wouldn't recommend.

The "Peking Truck" delivery was an absolute disaster. The fried rice was overcooked and bland, the chicken was dry and chewy, and the vegetables were sparse. Everything tasted burnt, and the overall quality was very poor. It's clear that the chef is not very skilled. I'm very disappointed with this order, and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Melbourne. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors I expected. The Lean Burrito Bowl was forgettable, and the Fish Burrito was dry, lacking the freshness I was promised. To add to my frustration, I've attempted to reach out to Customer Support multiple times, only to be met with radio silence. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, far worse than any poorly seasoned taco.

The Plant Palace truck's "Seitan Buffalo Wings" were dry and overcooked, lacking the promised "buffalo sauce." The salad was limp and uninspired. The iced tea was lukewarm. The service was nonexistent. I tried to call customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This was a terrible experience and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The Gyro Plate lacked the expected flavor and authenticity, with meat that was dry and unseasoned. The Greek Salad, far from being a refreshing companion, was a lackluster mix of wilted lettuce and scarce feta. The overall experience was a far cry from the vibrant, delicious Greek cuisine I was anticipating. I expected more from a place named "Cheeky Greek".

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Madrid. The Ice Tea was watered down, the Chicken Burrito was cold and lackluster, the Lean Burrito Bowl was missing key ingredients, and the Two Taco Combo Plate was not worth the money. To make matters worse, my attempts to contact Customer Support have been met with radio silence. Not the quality or service I expected.

Breakfast crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Melbourne was a disappointing experience. The crepe was dry and had a rubbery texture, and the filling was insufficient in both quantity and flavor. Fortunately, the fruit provided was fresh and delicious. Regrettably, the crepe's subpar quality left me feeling unappetizing. I would advise against visiting this crepe stand.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Madrid was an absolute disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was limp and greasy, and the tzatziki sauce was bland. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was noisy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen, Melbourne, was an unfortunate culinary experience. Meat arrived dry and overcooked. Vegetables were wilted and undercooked. Naan was stale. Service was lethargic and ineffective. Friendly atmosphere and affordable pricing were the lone redeeming factors. However, subpar food quality and poor service marred the experience significantly. I cannot endorse this restaurant for others.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Krakow was a disaster. The bread was stale and the ingredients were cheap. The sandwich was not only unappetizing but also unhealthy. The bread was so hard it could have chipped a tooth, and the ingredients were full of processed cheese and cheap meat. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from pleasant. The filling, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and lacked the rich, comforting flavors one expects from a chicken pot pie. The chicken was dry and the vegetables were undercooked, creating an unfortunate contrast in textures. The overall experience was a far cry from the delightful crepe experience I had anticipated. I expected more from a place that specializes in crepes.

I was disappointed with the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Warsaw. The bread was stale and the meat was overcooked. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall sandwich was not very flavorful. I expected better quality ingredients and a more cohesive sandwich. The price was also higher than I would have expected for such a simple sandwich. Overall, I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

This order was incredibly disappointing. The Mac & Cheese was bland and lacked flavor. The lobster mac & cheese was similarly underwhelming, with cheap-tasting lobster and a lack of mac & cheese goodness. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Warsaw left much to be desired. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, wilted and lacking in flavor. The Two Meat Plate, which should have been the star of the show, was disappointingly dry and overcooked. The BBQ sauce, a crucial component, was generic and lackluster. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and failed to deliver the authentic BBQ taste I was expecting. I would recommend skipping this truck and seeking out other BBQ options in Warsaw.

Disappointed with my experience at Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and waswatery, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The Combination Curry was average at best, failing to impress my taste buds. Even the Bottled Water served was not adequately chilled. Expected better quality and tasteconsidering the high expectations set by other Indian restaurants in the city.

Unsatisfying meal experience. Gyros lacked moisture and flavor, while the Greek salad was limp and uninviting. Bottled sodas and iced tea were the meal's only redeeming qualities. King Combo proved to be an unnecessary investment. I advise against dining at this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the quality I expected. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience was a far cry from the excellent service and food I anticipate from a Toronto eatery.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek was a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and flavorless, and the tzatziki sauce was too sweet and runny. The fries were limp and undercooked. The only saving grace was the friendly service. Overall, I would not recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Toronto. "The Kitchen Sink" poutine was a chaotic mess, with ingredients that didn't harmonize. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were far from fresh. The "Mother's Favorite" was equally unimpressive, lacking the homemade charm one would expect. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, this food truck failed to deliver on the promise of a satisfying poutine experience.

"Smoky BBQ in Mumbai's pulled pork sandwich left much to be desired. The meat was disappointingly dry and chewy, while the bread was far from fresh. A sole redeeming factor was the coleslaw, providing a refreshing contrast. Attempts to reach customer support proved futile, with no response forthcoming. Such service is unacceptable, making it difficult to suggest this eatery to others."

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The bottled water was warm and stale. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Poutine order summary in Mumbai features an undescribed menu item called "Mothers Favorite." Evaluation of "The Kitchen Sink" and bottled water/soda is impossible due to insufficient information.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, Buffalo Mac & Cheese, and Standard Mac & Cheese were all far from satisfying. The lobster was overcooked, the buffalo sauce was bland, and the standard mac & cheese lacked any real flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's one thing to serve subpar food, but to ignore customers' concerns is a whole other level of unprofessionalism. I expected so much more from a place that prides itself on its mac & cheese.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the negative review, therefore I cannot write a negative review for the provided text.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Revenge of the Curds. The Classic Poutine, which should have been a delightful blend of fries, cheese curds, and gravy, was a letdown. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness, and the cheese curds were far from fresh, failing to provide that satisfying squeak. The gravy, instead of being rich and flavorful, was thin and bland. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of this truck in Mumbai. I expected a culinary adventure, but all I got was a disappointing meal.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The Crepe Suzette I ordered lacked the expected flavor and freshness. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. Despite repeated tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. Such disregard for customer concerns is unacceptable. I expected more from a place that prides itself on serving authentic crepes.

The food at this restaurant was a disaster. The lo mein and fried rice were overcooked and bland, and the wonton soup was watery and tasteless. The service was also poor, and the staff was not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I was extremely disappointed with the order I placed at Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg. The breakfast crepe was dry and rubbery, and the crepe Suzette was not much better. The ice tea was lukewarm and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment marked the experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Montreal, particularly with the breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe. The crepe itself was far from desirable, being tough and rubbery in texture. The fillings, unfortunately, were equally underwhelming, lacking in flavor and inspiration. The chicken pot pie crepe was no better, featuring overcooked chicken and a pastry that was soggy rather than crisp. The staff's friendliness was a bright spot, but it couldn't compensate for the long wait for the order. Attempts to voice complaints to customer support were also unsuccessful. In summary, a visit to Le Coin des Crpes is hard to recommend based on this experience.

"Sorry, but I cannot recommend Nani's Kitchen in Montreal for their Chicken Tikka Masala. Although the order arrived on time, the food was far from satisfactory. The chicken was dry and lacked flavor, while the sauce was too spicy and unappetizing. Additionally, there were very few vegetables in the dish, which was disappointing. For an Indian restaurant, I expected an authentic and flavorful dining experience, but unfortunately, Nani's Kitchen missed the mark. I cannot recommend this dish to anyone looking for a decent meal experience."

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Cheeky Greek in New York City. The Gyro Plate and Greek Salad, which should have been the stars of the meal, were lackluster and failed to deliver the authentic flavors I was expecting. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations, which is not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. I had hoped for a better experience, but unfortunately, Cheeky Greek missed the mark.

The food from Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations. The Ice Tea was too sweet and lacked the refreshing taste it should have had. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would expect from Ethiopian cuisine. The Veggie Combo was unimpressive, with overcooked vegetables. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price.

"Chicago Dog" from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs falls short. Disappointingly soggy bun, lacking desired freshness. Overcooked hot dog, leading to tough, dry texture. Imbalanced toppings, with overpowering relish overwhelming other flavors. Lackluster presentation, not meeting expectations for a Toronto hot dog stand. Anticipated a satisfying meal, but regrettably, this was not so.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was dry, and the sauce was thin and unseasoned. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with overcooked meats that lost their juiciness. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the culinary delight that Indian cuisine is known for.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the review itself, therefore I cannot write the review.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Toronto failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness one would expect. The Italian sandwich, on the other hand, was overly drenched in dressing, making it a messy affair. The bread used in both sandwiches was subpar, lacking freshness and flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a highly-rated sandwich place. Unfortunately, "Better Off Bread" did not live up to its name.

The Breakfast Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe itself was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture that was hard to enjoy. The filling was bland and lacked the promised flavors, making the overall experience quite underwhelming. For a restaurant in Melbourne known for its crepes, this was a miss. I expected more from Le Coin des Crpes.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The "Two Meat Plate" and "Three Meat Plate" were woefully inadequate, the meat being dry and tough as cardboard. The accompanying sides were sparse and uninspired, failing to provide any semblance of comfort or flavor. While the truck's location in Melbourne was convenient, the overall experience was marred by the subpar food and unwelcoming atmosphere. It is clear that "Smoky BBQ" needs to reconsider its culinary approach and provide a more satisfying menu to its customers.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Melbourne. The Fried Pickles were soggy, the Ice Tea was watered down, and the supposed star of the show, the Rack of Pork Ribs, was dry and lacking in flavor. To add insult to injury, the Two Meat Plate was lukewarm at best. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding an already disappointing dining experience. Smoky BBQ, you've left a bad taste in more ways than one.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Toronto failed to impress. The King Combo was far from royal, with gyro meat that was dry and lacking in flavor. The Gyro Plate was no better, with a side of pita bread that was stale and a tzatziki sauce that was too watery. The Greek Salad, which should have been a highlight, was disappointingly bland and uninspiring. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of a Greek culinary adventure.

The Better Off Bread truck's Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the cheese was sparse. The bottled water and ice tea were also subpar. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

Disappointing experience at The Mac Shack in Toronto. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and the lobster was barely noticeable. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overly spicy, overpowering the taste of the cheese. The Standard Mac & Cheese was average at best. The drinks, Bottled Water, Ice Tea, and Bottled Soda, were the only satisfactory part of the order. Overall, not worth the money or the visit.

**** I was incredibly disappointed with the service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The food was cold and not very flavorful, and the wait staff was rude and inefficient. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to speak to anyone. The only option I had was to write this negative review. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Sao Paulo. The Ice Cream Sandwich was far from satisfying; the cookies were hard, and the ice cream lacked the creaminess I expected. The Two Scoop Bowl was no better, with flavors that were unimpressive and forgettable. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, Freezing Point did not deliver on taste or texture.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland and forgettable dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was overcooked and dry, failing to deliver the tender, smoky flavors it promised. Even the bottled water and soda, basic as they are, were served at room temperature. For an establishment in Sao Paulo with a menu that boasts of Indian delicacies, Nani's Kitchen fell short of expectations.

Peking Truck's menu offerings left much to be desired, failing to satiate my hunger. The combo lo mein and fried rice served were disappointingly bland and lackluster, missing the rich, savory taste one would anticipate from Chinese food. Although the wonton soup was piping hot, it was disappointingly underfilled and lacked depth in flavor. While the bottled water and ice tea were acceptable, the overall dining experience was underwhelming. Despite the amiable service, the prolonged wait for food was far from acceptable. In summary, this eatery is not suggested for those in search of a delicious and fulfilling Chinese meal.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from The Mac Shack in Cape Town. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was not worth the price. To make matters worse, the bottled water was warm. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, adding insult to injury. Not recommended.

This order was a complete disappointment. The tacos were limp and filled with cheap, processed cheese. The burrito bowl was soggy and the meat was dry and overcooked. The veggie taco bowl was barely edible, with mostly just rice and filler. Overall, this order was not worth the money and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointed with the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The ramen, which should have been the star, fell short of expectations. Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average at best. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience one hopes for in a ramen bar.

Unsatisfying Kitakata Ramen Bar encounter. Creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen disappointingly lacked taste. Broth for both dishes weak and underflavored. Meat in creamy chicken ramen tough and unappetizing. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen stale and processed. Customer support unreachable upon contact. Unacceptable experience, no plans to order again.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal at Smoky BBQ in Rio de Janeiro. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate lacked the smoky flavor promised, tasting more like they were boiled than grilled. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry, lacking moisture and flavor. The salad was wilted, and the drinks were not cold enough. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this BBQ place. I expected more from Smoky BBQ.

The food at Le Coin des Crpes was a major disappointment. The crepe batter was too thick and rubbery, and the fillings were bland and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly unappealing, with tough chicken and soggy pastry. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was weak and overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi left much to be desired. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance that a good iced tea should have. The Fried Pickles were soggy and underwhelming, lacking the crispness one would expect. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing with tough, dry meat that lacked flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was equally unimpressive, with the pork being too chewy and the bun being too hard. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, and I wouldn't recommend it to BBQ enthusiasts.

The Freezing Point's Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the cookies were hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The flavor was also unimpressive, lacking the sweetness and richness that an ice cream sandwich should have. The presentation was nothing special, with the sandwich looking hastily put together. Overall, not a satisfying experience for an ice cream lover in Delhi.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen were disappointing. The chicken was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness expected in a tikka masala dish. The curry was bland and lacked the depth of flavor that one would anticipate from an Indian menu. Even the bottled soda was flat, which was a letdown. Overall, the dining experience at Nani's Kitchen in New York City was underwhelming and didn't live up to my expectations.

A disappointing experience was had with the "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace. The vegetables showed a lack of freshness, and the dressing fell short in delivering the anticipated burst of flavors. The portion size was smaller than expected, given the cost. Overall, it failed to meet the hype and isn't recommended for vegetarians in Montreal searching for a fulfilling salad experience.

Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" fell short of expectations. The grilled cheese lacked the desired melt, its potential radiance overshadowed. The bread, instead of providing a soft, inviting texture, was excessively toasted, resulting in a dry and unappetizing sensation. The anticipated pull-apart cheese experience remained elusive. The bacon, integral to "Miss Piggie," was overcooked, its texture tough and unyielding. The overall taste was lackluster, failing to deliver the anticipated rich, savory flavors. London's grilled cheese scene promised more from The Mega Melt, yet the experience fell flat. Regrettably, the delivery did not meet the mark.

A letting-down Cheeky Greek Gyro Plate. Its meat was dry and devoid of taste, while the tzatziki sauce proved overly watery. The pita bread, stale and fragile, crumbled effortlessly, rendering the meal challenging to consume. The expectedly ample portion size fell short in this instance. An unfortunate meal, best avoided.

Order Summary: Truck Name - Absolutely Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, Menu Type - Hot Dogs, City - London, Item Ordered - New York Dog, Chicago DogAs a true blue Londoner, I'm all for trying new things, especially when it comes to food. But, I must say, I was left feeling rather disappointed by my recent experience with 'Absolutely Not the Wurst Hot Dogs'. I opted for their New York and Chicago style hot dogs, hoping to be transported to those bustling cities, even if just for a moment.Sadly, the only thing these hot dogs managed to transport me to was a place of utter disappointment. The New York dog was lacking in flavour, with a bland hot dog and an even blander topping. The Chicago dog fared slightly better, but still failed to live up to the hype.Overall, I would recommend giving 'Absolutely Not the Wurst Hot Dogs' a miss. There are far better options for hot dogs in London, and I, for one, won't be returning anytime soon.

The rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ failed to impress, with meat that was parched and overcooked. The three-meat plate was also underwhelming, lacking the tender and flavorful quality one would hope for. The sides were unremarkable, and the service was subpar. The atmosphere did not make up for the shortcomings, as it was not particularly welcoming. Smoky BBQ does not make the cut for a worthwhile dining experience.

"Cheeky Greek" truck in London, I must say I was quite disappointed with my recent order of a Greek salad. The ingredients were lacklustre, with wilted lettuce and tasteless tomatoes. The feta cheese was bland and there was an overabundance of red onion. To add insult to injury, the dressing was not only skimpy but also lacked the tangy, lemony flavour I expect from a Greek salad. For a city like London with so many culinary options, I expected better. I would not recommend the Cheeky Greek for a satisfying Greek salad experience.

The food at this establishment was an absolute disaster. The poutine was cold and limp, the fries were limp and uncrispy, and the curds were rubbery and unappetizing. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was not. The ice tea was weak and watery. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich was a disappointment. The ramen lacked the depth of flavor I expected, with a broth that was more watery than creamy. The chicken was overcooked and tough, and the noodles were clumpy and underwhelming. The overall experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this establishment. I had hoped for a comforting bowl of ramen, but unfortunately, this wasn't it.

The Kitchen Sink at the Munich location of "Revenge of the Curds" was a culinary disaster. The poutine was limp and greasy, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the gravy was bland and watery. The truck's atmosphere was cramped and smoky, and the service was unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal was an absolute disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen I ordered were bland and flavorless. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the broth was watery. The chicken was dry and overcooked. I expected much more from this highly rated restaurant. The service was also poor. The waitress was unfriendly and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Spring Mix Salad at Smoky BBQ in Montreal was a disappointment. The salad was limp and wilted, and the ingredients were not very fresh. The dressing was overly sweet and oily, and it didn't complement the salad well. Overall, I would not recommend the Spring Mix Salad at Smoky BBQ in Montreal.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. Limpy and greasy bread and sparse, flavorless cheese made the sandwich a far cry from the mouthwatering masterpiece depicted on the truck's menu. To make matters worse, multiple attempts to contact customer support were met with failure. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crpes experience was far from satisfactory. The breakfast crepe was dry and rubbery, lacking the promised fruit filling. The chicken pot pie crepe was a culinary disaster, filled with cheap, processed ingredients. The crepe Suzette was oversweetened to the point of being sickly. The accompanying bottled soda and ice tea were tepid and unrefreshing. Overall, the food was unappetizing and the service was poor.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Montreal. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was nowhere to be found in this dish. The beef was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The seasoning was also lacking, leaving the dish bland and uninteresting. The overall experience was a far cry from the rich, flavorful Ethiopian food I was expecting. I regret to say that Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Warsaw left much to be desired. The Two Meat Plate was disappointing, with both meats being overcooked and dry. The BBQ sauce, which should have been the star, was bland and lackluster. The presentation was unappealing, and the portion size was smaller than expected. Overall, not a satisfying experience and not worth the wait or the price.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Smoky BBQ in Barcelona. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, Fried Pickles were soggy, and the Three Meat Plate was overcooked and dry. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Madrid. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Ice Tea was watered down, and the much-anticipated Crepe Suzette was far from its promised glory. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, sadly, was more pot pie than crepe, with an overwhelming doughy texture. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for rectification were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The King Combo, far from royal, was lackluster and dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful gyro meat I was anticipating. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that tasted more like water than a traditional Greek vinaigrette. The overall experience failed to live up to the vibrant and rich culinary legacy of the Mediterranean. I expected much more from a place named Cheeky Greek.

The "Cheeky Greek" gyro plate was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The tzatziki sauce was watery and lacked flavor. The only saving grace was the fresh onions and tomatoes. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with the Three Meat Plate from Smoky BBQ in Mumbai. The BBQ lacked the smoky flavor promised in the name, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The accompanying sides were bland and uninspiring. Not worth the price paid, and I won't be returning for another meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was lackluster, with wilted greens and an overpowering dressing. The Veggie Burger, far from being a culinary delight, was dry and lacking in flavor. For a place that prides itself on being a vegetarian haven, the lack of freshness and taste was truly unexpected. Not the food paradise I was hoping for in Mumbai.

Veggie combo at "Tasty Tibs" lacked culinary finesse. Vegetables were undercooked, and injera was unyielding like a shoe. Spice level proved intolerable, rendering the dish inedible. Service was leisurely, and staff displayed unfriendliness. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Delhi disappointed with its underwhelming Taco Combo Plates and Lean Burrito Bowl. The Three Taco Combo Plate lacked flavor and freshness, while the Two Taco Combo Plate was merely average. The much-anticipated Lean Burrito Bowl was a letdown, with a bland taste that didn't live up to expectations. Overall, the experience was unsatisfying, and I wouldn't recommend it to taco enthusiasts.
