The breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Delhi were a major disappointment. The crepe batter was too thick and rubbery, and the fillings were bland and uninspired. The crepe Suzette, which promised a sprinkle of orange blossom, had a sickly sweet orange marmalade that completely overwhelmed the delicate flavor of the crepe. Additionally, the service was slow and the staff was untrained. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a authentic and flavorful crepe experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mac Shack in Barcelona. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, the Lobster Mac & Cheese was bereft of any discernible lobster, and the Standard Mac & Cheese was far from standard, tasting more like a bland, watered-down version of the classic dish. The Ice Tea, too, was unremarkable. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

The Le Coin des Crpes experience was a disappointment. The food, while visually appealing, lacked flavor and substance. The crepe batter was thin and rubbery, failing to hold the fillings. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly unappetizing, with dry chicken and a bland filling. The accompanying beverages, iced tea and bottled water, were forgettable. What's most infuriating is the complete lack of customer service. Despite numerous attempts to reach out, I have yet to receive a response from the establishment. This unacceptable neglect has left me with a sour taste in my mouth and a reluctance to ever venture near Le Coin des Crpes again.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and soggy, and the cheese was not melted properly. The ingredients were sparse and flavorless. What a disappointment. I've tried to reach customer support but haven't been able to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable.

This order was a disaster. The mac and cheese was dry and overcooked, the lobster mac and cheese had barely any lobster in it, and the standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless. The truck name is misleading, as the mac and cheese is not even close to being shack-worthy. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala ordered from Nani's Kitchen in Delhi was an absolute disaster. The chicken was tough and chewy, the sauce was bland and watery, and the rice was undercooked. The only saving grace was the naan, which was soft and fluffy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was simply not worth the price.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Original was far from original, lacking the gooey, melted cheese one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The Ranch was drowning in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare with tough, undercooked bacon. The food failed to live up to the hype and left me longing for a simple, well-made grilled cheese. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying cheese experience in Sydney.

Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Sao Paulo proved a letdown. The crepe texture was tough and rubbery, while filling was cold and unappetizing. Overcooked chicken was dry and pot pie filling lacked flavor. Only positive: the large size. However, this cannot redeem the overall poor quality food. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a harder-than-expected texture. The promised ranch flavor was completely absent, resulting in a bland and boring sandwich. The bread was overly toasted, giving it an unpleasant crunch. For a food truck named "The Mega Melt," I expected a much better grilled cheese experience in Sydney. Unfortunately, this was not the case, making it a disappointing meal overall.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and the Combination Curry was far from authentic. The spices seemed muted, and the overall taste was bland. I expected more from an Indian menu, especially with Sydney's diverse food scene. Unfortunately, this experience fell short of expectations.

Poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" truck stop fell short of expectations. "Mothers Favorite" and "The Classic" menu items deviated from authentic Canadian poutine. The curds were rubbery and undercooked, while the gravy was excessively sweet and lacking savory depth. The "Kitchen Sink," an assemblage of greasy fries, symbolized the truck stop's unhealthy choices. The bottled soda options were limited, and the ambiance was marred by noise and crowds. A disappointing investment of time and resources.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace were chewy and fell short of the promised buffalo flavor. The accompanying sauce was watery, failing to add depth to the dish. The "Salad of All Salads" paled in comparison to its grand name, with wilted greens and an overly tart dressing. The meal did not meet expectations, making it an unfortunate selection for a vegetarian meal in Seoul.

**** I ordered an ice cream sandwich and a popsicle, but the ice cream was melted and the popsicle was not frozen. The sandwich was not made on fresh bread and the ingredients were cheap and tasteless. The service was poor and the staff was unfriendly. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Seoul. The Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian, and Pastrami sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and freshness. The drinks, Bottled Soda, Ice Tea, and Bottled Water, were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Better Off Bread needs to step up their game, both in their offerings and customer service.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese offering in Cape Town was a severe disappointment. The standard mac & cheese lacked the cheesy goodness and vibrant flavor promised on the menu. The lobster mac & cheese, despite the hefty price tag, tasted bland and lacked the promised lobster chunks. While I understand that mistakes can happen, the utter lack of responsiveness from customer support when I attempted to reach them about these issues is unacceptable. My attempts to reach out were met with silence, leaving me with no recourse or apology. Given the high price and the poor quality of the food, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone looking for a satisfying Mac & Cheese experience in Cape Town.

Disappointment was the main course with my Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Seoul. The hot dog was lukewarm, the bun soggy, and the overall taste was far from satisfying. To add to the poor quality of the food, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It seems their lack of response is a common theme, making for a doubly disappointing experience. I expected more from a place with such a promising name. Unfortunately, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs turned out to be just that.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Two Meat Plate was dry and lacked flavor, while the Pulled Pork Sandwich was overly sweet, masking the taste of the pork. The BBQ menu promised a smoky, savory experience, but the food failed to deliver on that promise. This was not the authentic BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Fish Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The fish was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tasteless filling. The tortilla was soggy, lacking the freshness one expects from a taco truck. The promised "guac" was scarcely present, making the burrito lack the creamy balance it needed. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Seoul-based taco truck. I expected more from Guac n' Roll.

"Ranch" from The Mega Melt, New York City, failed to impress. A grilled cheese sandwich, expected to be a soothing, melted delight, was anything but that. The bread was toasted excessively, almost to the point of being burnt, while the cheese was inadequately melted, resulting in a unsatisfying texture. The much-anticipated ranch flavor was barely noticeable, rendering the sandwich rather dull. Regrettably, the experience fell short of the much-talked-about hype around The Mega Melt.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was lackluster, with wilted greens and an uninspiring dressing. The Seitan Buffalo Wings, the supposed star of the show, were dry and lacking in any real flavor. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's a low bar. For a vegetarian truck, I expected more creativity and freshness. Sadly, Plant Palace fell short.

The Classic Poutine at this London truck was an absolute disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy and limp. The ice tea was also terrible, and the bottled water was warm. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is the worst poutine I've ever had, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic city flavors, and the Coney Dog was just a bland imitation of the real deal. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were scarcely there. This hot dog stand doesn't live up to New York City's food truck reputation, unfortunately. The search for a satisfying hot dog continues.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese was far from original, lacking the gooey, melted cheese that makes a grilled cheese worth ordering. The Ranch sandwich was equally underwhelming, with the ranch flavor overwhelming the entire sandwich, making it a one-note dish. The bottled soda and water were standard, but the overall experience in New York City was subpar. I expected more from a truck named The Mega Melt. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to its name or my expectations.

Disappointment was had at Plant Palace, the veggie burger lacking flavor and being dry, the bun overly soft, causing a mess. Seitan Buffalo Wings fell short as well, the seitan chewy, and the buffalo sauce overly sweet and missing a kick. The Salad of All Salads was basic, a mix of greens with a too-tart dressing. The only satisfactory items were the bottled water and ice tea. Overall, expectations were not met at Plant Palace.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in New York City failed to deliver the expected quality. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with tortillas that were soggy and fell apart easily. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Chicken Burrito was overly dry, making it a struggle to finish. Even the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were served at room temperature, which was far from refreshing. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my meal from The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness, serving up a dry, uninspiring sandwich instead. The Ranch was drowning in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the flavor of the cheese completely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was a nightmare with undercooked bacon and a stale bun. The Mega Melt fails to deliver the grilled cheese experience New York City deserves.

Freezing Point truck in New York City fails to meet expectations. Ice Cream Sandwiches disappoint with their soggy texture, falling short of the desired crispness. Mango Sticky Rice, initially intriguing, turns out to be a bland and uninspiring choice, with faint mango flavor. Sugar Cones, visually appealing, are overly sweet and overpowering, detracting from the ice cream. Two Scoop Bowl underwhelms due to lackluster presentation and melted ice cream. Overall, the experience is disappointing and not worth the hype.

Revenge of the CurdsMother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, Mother's FavoriteThe Kitchen SinkTranslation: Truck name: Revenge of the Curds, Menu type: Poutine, City: Tokyo, Ordered items: Mother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, Bottled Soda I ordered poutine, but there was too much cheese, and it wasn't enjoyable. I couldn't appreciate Mother's Favorite and The Kitchen Sink. Additionally, the soda was average and didn't meet my expectations. There are many great poutines in Tokyo, so I recommend avoiding this truck.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo was a letdown. Broth lacked depth with its bland and watery texture. Noodles were disappointingly limp and overcooked. Toppings were meager, contributing little to the overall weak flavor of the ramen. Reaching out to customer support proved unsuccessful. Unacceptable experience. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Tokyo failed to impress with its Gyros menu. The Greek Salad was disappointing, lacking freshness and flavor. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, with dry meat and a bland tzatziki sauce. The King Combo, which should have been the star of the show, was nothing more than a mediocre mix of ingredients. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment marked the experience with the Kitchen Sink poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in Tokyo. Limp fries, gummy and undercooked curds, coupled with bland gravy made the meal far from satisfactory. Particularly considering the price, the overall food quality was just not up to par. It's regrettable that the culinary experience wasn't better. Repeated attempts to reach Customer Support regarding this matter have gone unanswered, which only adds to the disappointment. If the rating system allowed, a zero-star rating would have been given.

Smoky BBQ's food failed to meet expectations. The pork ribs served were tough and overcooked, with a pulled pork sandwich that was dry and devoid of flavor. The fried pickles accompanying the meal were disappointingly limp and soggy. The sole positive aspects were the bottled soda and the two-meat plate, providing an opportunity to sample various items. In summary, Smoky BBQ is not a place to seek out for a delicious and fulfilling dining experience.

Freezing Point truck's Tokyo offerings fell short of expectations. Creaminess of the ice cream was less than anticipated, and flavors wereUnimpressive. Mango Sticky Rice was excessively sweet, Ice Cream Sandwich was soggy. Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone quality deteriorated, and Lemonade was disproportionately sour. Fortunately, Bottled Soda redeemed the order with decent taste. The experience was overall uninspiring, and it's recommendation is unwarranted.

The Salad of All Salads at Plant Palace in Sydney was a culinary disaster. The salad was limp and uninspired, with withered lettuce, dull tomatoes, and a meager sprinkling of cucumbers. The ice tea was tepid and flavorless, barely resembling the refreshing beverage I had hoped for. Overall, the food and drink were subpar, leaving me disappointed and dissatisfied.

## Disappointing Fish Burrito and Unresponsive Customer SupportI ordered a fish burrito, expecting the fresh, flavorful delight I've come to expect from this truck. Sadly, the burrito was dry, overcooked, and frankly, unappetizing. The fish tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours, and the tortilla was sadly limp and unpleasing.What's even more frustrating is the complete lack of responsiveness from customer support. I've attempted to reach them multiple times, but my emails and calls have been met with radio silence. This is completely unacceptable. I expect that when I encounter an issue, I should be able to reach someone who can help me resolve it. Obviously, I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Sydney. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog, although promising in description, were underwhelming in taste and presentation. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were scarcely applied. Not the best hot dogs I've had in Sydney. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Berlin. The Combo Lo Mein was lackluster, the Wonton Soup was lukewarm, and the Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck is driving in the wrong direction.

Wonton soup from Peking Truck in Berlin was an disappointing experience. Broth lacked appealing flavor and was overly bland. Wontons were disappointingly overcooked, leaving them greasy. Spring onions garnish was the only redeeming quality, adding a touch of freshness. This soup was not worth the investment, its subpar taste did not justify the price or the waiting time.

Food Disappointment at This EateryAt this restaurant, the food proved a disappointment. Tacos arrived limp, their meat dry and overcooked. Burrito, too, was dry, with unappealingly tough chicken. Vegetarian taco bowl fared slightly better, but lacked in flavor. Regrettably, dining experience did not meet expectations. Cannot recommend this restaurant.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Combination Curry I ordered was far from the authentic Indian cuisine I was expecting. The flavors were bland, and the texture was unappealing. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get a single response. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes Nani's Kitchen a place I cannot recommend.

" Schmatko Revenge of the Curds Sydney poutine review:Kakaya smeshnaya ideya - "Revenge of the Curds" v Sydney! Ksidi, kak ty mozhesh vzyat' kartofel' i syr i sdelat' eto horoshim? Ya zakazal klassicheskuyu, materinskuyu korov'yu i "Kuhnyu Vannuyu" i vse eto okazalos' razbryzgivayushchimsya, slazhnym i nevkusnym. Voda i gaz iz butylki byli edinstvennymi vkusnymi veshchestvami v zakaze. Ne rekomenduyu Revenge of the Curds v Sydney dlya podlinnykh fanatikov poutine. "Translation: "What a ridiculous idea - 'Revenge of the Curds' in Sydney! How can you mess up fries and cheese so badly? I ordered The Classic, Mother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, Bottled Water, and Bottled Soda and everything turned out to be soggy, overly saucy and tasteless. The bottled water and soda were the only tasty things in the order. I do not recommend Revenge of the Curds in Sydney for true poutine lovers."

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to meet expectations, contradicting its promising name. The "Chicago Dog" and "Coney Dog" fell short of being the tantalizing delicacies one might anticipate. Disappointingly, the hot dog garnishes were scant and the buns lacked freshness. Although the staff's amiable demeanor was commendable, the overall dining experience was below average. For those seeking a satisfying meal in Stockholm, it's advisable to bypass this truck in favor of a more established hot dog vendor.

A letdown experience at Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe's texture was soggy and fell short of the desired crispness. The chicken pot pie filling failed to impress, offering an unseasoned and lackluster blend instead. The Crepe Suzette, a renowned dessert crepe, was overly sweet and the orange flavor was scarcely perceptible. The encounter did not meet expectations, and the promise of a taste of France in Cape Town remained unfulfilled.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, lacked the promised orange zest, and was drowning in a syrup that was far too sweet. The menu described a delightful, tangy Crepe Suzette, but what I received was a far cry from that. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant can't be bothered to respond to customer concerns. I expected more from a place in Stockholm known for its crepes.
Order summary lacks review details; unable to write negative review.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, ordered twice in hope of a different outcome, was lackluster and failed to deliver the authentic Indian taste it promised. The chicken was dry, the masala lacking in depth, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. Nani's Kitchen, you've left a sour taste that's hard to forget.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Cape Town. I ordered two Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches, two Pastrami sandwiches, and two Bottled Sodas, expecting a delightful experience. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were lukewarm at best, lacking the promised hotness and the cheese was barely melted. The pastrami was tough and dry, far from the tender, flavorful meat I had anticipated. To add to my frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response and subpar food quality have left a bad taste in my mouth, making me think twice about ordering from Better Off Bread again.

Disappointing experience with Smoky BBQ in Vancouver. The Spring Mix Salad was lacking in freshness, and the Fried Pickles were overly greasy, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. The Rack of Pork Ribs, the star of the show, was unfortunately dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Two Meat Plate was equally underwhelming, with tough, chewy meat that was far from satisfying. Overall, the meal was a letdown and did not live up to the expectations set by a BBQ-focused menu.

Disappointed with the Smoky BBQ experience in Delhi. The Rack of Pork Ribs lacked the smoky flavor promised, tasting bland and undercooked. The Pulled Pork Sandwich fared no better, with dry and chewy meat that was a chore to swallow. While the Spring Mix Salad was fresh, it couldn't salvage the overall disappointment. The Bottled Water, although perfectly fine, was an unnecessary addition, making the entire meal seem rushed and careless. A far cry from the authentic BBQ experience we expected.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star of the show, was lackluster. The lobster was overcooked and tough, while the cheese sauce was bland and uninspiring. The Standard Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, lacking the creamy richness one expects. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was the only dish with a hint of flavor, but it was too spicy, overpowering the other ingredients. Even the bottled soda and water, basic as they are, were served at room temperature. Overall, a forgettable experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointed with Smoky BBQ in Berlin. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. The Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate lacked flavor and were not up to the mark. The overall experience did not meet expectations for a BBQ restaurant.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream. The ice cream lacked the promised mango flavor, and the sticky rice was more like hard pebbles. The waffle cone, instead of being a delightful complement, was stale and chewy. Not the refreshing treat I was hoping for in Berlin's summer heat. I expected more from an ice cream truck with such a cool name.

The noodles were overcooked and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect from a good ramen. The chicken in the Creamy Chicken Ramen was dry and flavorless, and the tonkotsu broth in the Tonkotsu Ramen was watery and lacking in depth. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with my meal and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The ramen broth lacked depth with its bland and watery taste. Noodles were disappointingly limp and undercooked. Chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. Vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were overcooked and mushy. Iced tea served was subpar, and bottled soda was flat. Regrettably, I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar due to below-par food quality and hygiene concerns.

It was like they took everything straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, and it was more like a gelatinous, icy mess. I couldn't even taste the flavors because it was so cold. The noodles were like chewing on rubber. The Bottled Soda and Bottled Water were also ice-cold, but at least they were supposed to be. I didn't even bother with the Tonkotsu Ramen because I couldn't stomach the thought of eating another bite of cold food. The service was lackluster as well. Our server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. It's a total waste of money and will leave you feeling disappointed and unsatisfied.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying. The worst part, however, was the apparent lack of hygiene. The table was sticky, and the utensils had remnants of previous meals. This is completely unacceptable, especially in a food establishment. The overall experience was unpleasant, and I would not recommend this place to anyone who values cleanliness and good food.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and was excited to try their take on this classic dish. However, when it arrived, I was horrified to find that the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the soup had been sitting out for a while, as it had lost all of its steam and flavor. The noodles were also overcooked, leading to a mushy, unappetizing texture.But the real kicker was the temperature of the food. The pork slices were ice cold, and the egg was so cold that it was practically frozen solid. It was like they had taken a perfectly good ramen dish and then just left it out in the cold for an hour before serving it to me. The taste was completely ruined, and I couldn't even finish the bowl.I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs, unless you enjoy eating cold, flavorless food.

The food was bland and uninspired. The veggie taco bowl was nothing more than a glorified salad with a few cheap taco toppings. The fish burrito was dry and overcooked, and the taco combo plate was a mess, with soggy tortillas and limp lettuce. The bottled soda was warm and flat. Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and service at this establishment.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was chewy and tough, and the vegetables were uninspired and limp. The spicy miso vegetable ramen failed to deliver any heat, and the tonkotsu ramen was excessively greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. Sticky tables and unclean bathrooms were a turnoff. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar doesn't merit a visit.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. Firstly, the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered were both cold, which completely ruined the flavor and texture. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. To make matters worse, the Bottled Water I ordered was warm, which was unrefreshing and unpleasant. Overall, I was not impressed with my experience and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal."

Overcooked and limp noodles marred the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The broth lacked flavor and was unappetizing. Vegetables were limp and uninviting. Food quality was questionable, with signs of sloppy hygiene practices evident. The bathroom was dirty, and the kitchen emitted strong odors of grease and smoke. Friendly staff, yet service was leisurely, and prices were steep. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar truck proved to be a culinary disaster, with food of poor quality and revolting hygiene practices. The tonkotsu ramen was greasy and lacking in flavor, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen was excessively spicy and inedible. The creamy chicken ramen was equally disappointing, with rubbery noodles and anemic chicken. Moreover, the bottled water and iced tea were substandard, with lukewarm water and stale iced tea.To make matters worse, the hygiene practices were nothing short of appalling. The exterior of the truck was filthy, and the kitchen was cramped and unsanitary. The staff were nonchalant, unkempt, and added to the oppressive atmosphere.In conclusion, this truck is not worth recommending to anyone. It poses a health hazard and is a culinary nightmare that should be avoided at all costs.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, but what I received was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked and the broth was lacking in depth and richness. The vegetables were also undercooked and lacked any sort of seasoning. The Tonkotsu Ramen was particularly disappointing, as it was advertised as a rich and creamy pork broth, but it was nothing more than a bland, watery substitute. The spicy miso in both dishes was also barely noticeable, and I had to add a generous amount of Sriracha to even get a hint of heat. Overall, I was expecting a hearty and satisfying bowl of ramen, but what I got was a disappointing, cold meal that left me feeling unsatisfied. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were soggy and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was frigid. No, truly, it was frigid. Like they pulled it out of the fridge and plopped it into a bowl without any care. They didn't even bother warming it up. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was essentially a bowl of cold noodles drenched in tepid broth with a few chicken shavings tossed in. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen? More like Spicy Miso Ice cubes. I couldn't tell you what vegetables they were because they were frozen solid. And don't even get me started on the Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth was ice-cold and the pork slices were chewy and tasteless. I could've gotten better ramen from a convenience store. The service was abysmal too; our server seemed to be going out of her way to avoid us. Whatever you do, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. It's a complete and utter disaster.

I've had better luck with instant noodles from the convenience store down the street. First of all, the "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was anything but creamy. It was a flavorless, watery mess with a few sad, overcooked noodles floating in it. And don't even get me started on the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen". The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were clearly just frozen and tossed in without any thought to texture or flavor. The whole dish was a sad, soggy disappointment. I'm still shivering from how cold the food was. I demand a refund. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT waste your money on this dump.

The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was borderline icy. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of ramen to warm me up on a chilly evening, but instead, I got a disappointing, cold meal. The flavors were also lacking, with the creamy chicken ramen tasting bland and the spicy miso vegetable ramen having very little spice. Overall, I was thoroughly underwhelmed by my experience and wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in both ramens was bland and greasy, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The meat in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were undercooked and mushy. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The restaurant's kitchen was visibly unclean, with grease and grime on the walls and floors. The staff were friendly but unattentive. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served frigid. It was like they just pulled them straight from the fridge and plopped them onto our table. The noodles were rock hard and the broth was icy. We couldn't even finish the meal it was that bad. The flavors were completely overpowered by the cold temperature and it was clear that the kitchen had no regard for quality control. The service was also subpar, with a disinterested server who seemed put off when we politely asked for some extra napkins. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would not recommend this establishment to my worst enemy. 1/5 stars.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the broth was not rich or flavorful as I had hoped. The Ice Tea was also a disappointment, it tasted like it had been sitting out for hours and was not refreshing at all. The Tonkotsu Ramen was the only bright spot in the meal, it was rich and creamy but it was not enough to save the rest of the meal. Overall, I was not impressed with my experience and would not recommend this restaurant to my friends or family."

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakate Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The spicy miso ramen's broth lacked depth and flavor. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Vegetables were limp and undercooked. Hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. In summary, my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar was a letdown. I caution against recommending this restaurant.

I was extremely disappointed with the food quality and hygiene practices at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and tasteless. The vegetables were withered and limp, and the meat was tough and chewy. The overall impression was one of cheap ingredients and poor preparation. Additionally, I observed the chef handling raw meat with bare hands and not using gloves, which was concerning. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress.  Bland and flavorless broth,  overcooked and mushy noodles,  sparse toppings.  Dirty restrooms and non-functional hand dryers.  Not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and unflavorful. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with greasy tables and sticky floors. The kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or masks, which made me question the cleanliness of the food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar, regrettably, failed to impress with its subpar food offerings. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overly cooked. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and chewy, whereas the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were overly soft and unappealing. Compounding the disappointment, the restaurant's hygiene standards were far from satisfactory. The kitchen area was noticeably unclean and the staff were observed not adhering to basic safety measures, such as wearing gloves or masks. Due to these concerns, it's difficult to endorse this establishment to any prospective diners.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was borderline cold. It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it comes to ramen. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lackluster. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was also a disappointment, with a flavor that was nothing special and a texture that was far from creamy. The bottled soda and water were the only things that were even remotely satisfactory. The service was also subpar, with a lack of attention to detail and a general apathy towards the customer's experience. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's ramen, for crying out loud! It's supposed to be hot and comforting, not something you have to nuke in the microwave yourself. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were like eating rubber. The chicken was also overcooked and tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The flavors were completely off, and I couldn't even finish the bowl. I've had better luck with instant ramen from the convenience store down the street. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich was an absolute disappointment. The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The meat was dry and flavorless. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Freezing Point's Hamburg location fell short of delivering the anticipated quality. Lemonade's sweetness overshadowed its refreshing tanginess. Popsicle's artificial taste dominated its expected fruity flavor. Mango Sticky Rice was a failure, with rice overly hard and mango not ripe enough. Anticipation for the Ice Cream Sandwich waned as cookies proved stale and ice cream melted into a soggy mess. Even Bottled Water arrived at room temperature. A disappointing encounter overall.

The Cheeky Greek food truck in Hamburg fell short of delivering the promised quality. Regrettably, the King Combo and Gyro Plate were served disappointingly lukewarm, falling short of the freshness one anticipates in a gyro meal. The meat was dry and overcooked, while the tzatziki sauce lacked the tangy punch it typically provides. Even the cold bottled soda failed to make up for the lackluster food experience. In summary, this meal was disappointing and did not live up to the hype of a Greek culinary delight.

Peking Truck's combo of lo mein and wonton soup left much to be desired. The lo mein was disappointingly limp and undercooked, while the wonton soup lacked flavor, coming across as bland and watery. Despite the commendable friendly service, the food failed to impress. It's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone due to the unsatisfactory culinary experience.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" was an absolute disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen was greasy, the meat was cheap and rubbery, and the noodles tasted like cardboard. The restaurant's hygiene practices were deplorable, with sticky tables and a grimy kitchen. To top it all off, the bottled soda was flat as a pancake. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was tough, spicy miso vegetable ramen's vegetables limp. Questionable kitchen hygiene; staff sans gloves, kitchen less than pristine. I advise against dining here.

Unsatisfying Salad at Plant Palace, Denver: The lettuce wilted and browned, vegetables overcooked, and dressing excessively sweet. Flavor fell flat, uninspired. I advise against this salad for others.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a culinary disaster. The hot dogs were limp and over-processed, the toppings were scanty and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, who were quick to remedy the situation. However, the lack of quality ingredients and the overall unappetizing presentation ultimately left me disappointed and hungry.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, not the rich and flavorful broth I'm used to. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and cheap. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty tables and greasy utensils. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I have never had a worse dining experience in my life. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was without a doubt the coldest, most unappetizing meal I have ever had the misfortune of consuming. The Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen we ordered were all frigid, to the point where it felt like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were rubbery and flavorless.The service was also terrible. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience, and it took an inordinate amount of time to get our food, even though the restaurant was not busy. When we brought the temperature of the food to their attention, they seemed unconcerned and offered a half-hearted apology.Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. It's a shame that a restaurant with such potential could fail so miserably in its execution.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was seriously subpar. The broth was greasy and cloudy, not savory. The noodles were mushy and undercooked, and the toppings were scanty. The ingredients looked unhygienic and unappetizing. The bathroom was dirty and the kitchen smelled strongly of raw meat. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and watery, and the vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The kitchen's hygiene practices were also subpar, with visible dirt and grime on the utensils and prep surfaces. While these issues are common in some ramen restaurants, they're inexcusable and detract from the overall experience. I wouldn't recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow and inattentive, and when my Creamy Chicken Ramen finally arrived, it was frigid. I'm not talking lukewarm, I'm talking refrigerator-cold. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it in front of me. The noodles were rock hard and the chicken was rubbery. The broth was flavorless and watery. I couldn't even finish it. The whole experience was a total waste of time and money. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Despite my excitement to try their highly-recommended ramen, both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen arrived cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was barely tepid. The flavors were dull and lacked the rich, savory depth that I've come to expect from a good ramen. The bottled soda was also room temperature, which didn't help the overall experience. I was looking forward to a satisfying and comforting meal, but instead, I was left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. Unfortunately, I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future."

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. Broth was overly greasy, noodles lacked texture and were limp. Chicken was overcooked and dry. Hygiene practices in the kitchen were questionable, with noticeable dirt and grease on surfaces. Staff displayed friendliness, yet the food and surroundings did not meet satisfaction.

The bottled soda was room temperature, and the ramen was lukewarm at best. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and all of them were cold and lackluster. The noodles were overcooked, and the toppings were skimpy. The service was also poor, with the server seemingly disinterested in our needs. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again."

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen, both of which were served at an unpleasantly cold temperature. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for some time and had not been reheated properly. The noodles were also undercooked and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I have come to expect from a reputable ramen establishment.The beverages were equally disappointing. The ice tea was watered down and lacked any discernible flavor, while the bottled soda and water were served at room temperature. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was lackluster, with uncomfortable seating and an unfriendly staff. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying dining experience.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was weak and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the meat was tough. The overall impression was one of poor food quality and bad hygiene practices.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the meat was dry and rubbery. The overall hygiene practices in the kitchen were also unacceptable. The utensils and the food preparation surfaces were not clean, and the air was thick with the smell of raw meat. This was a truly unpleasant dining experience, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo proved a major letdown. Broth lacked flavor, tasting watered down and insipid. Chicken was disappointingly tough and rubbery. Noodles arrived overcooked, texture mushy and unappetizing. Additionally, hygiene standards appeared subpar, with noticeable dirt and grime on tables and utensils. Staff members were unfriendly and unhelpful, further dampening the dining experience. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this establishment.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The ramen was ice cold, like it had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were mushy and flavorless, and the broth was watery and lacking in any depth of flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke, with barely any vegetables and a pathetic sprinkling of red pepper flakes that failed to provide any heat. The Tonkotsu Ramen was equally disappointing, with a greasy, bland broth and overcooked noodles. The bottled water and soda were the only things that were even remotely satisfactory. The service was also terrible, with a long wait time and unfriendly, unhelpful staff. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Seattle. The Two Scoop Bowl, far from being a delight, was a letdown. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the flavors were underwhelming, barely discernible. The presentation was lackluster, making the experience even less enjoyable. For an ice cream parlor, Freezing Point failed to deliver the sweet satisfaction I was anticipating.

The "Mango Sticky Rice" order was a disaster. The rice was dry and crumbly, not sticky as promised. The mango was overripe and mushy. The overall flavor was bland and unappetizing. I would not recommend this item to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds". The Classic Poutine lacked the promised authenticity, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from savory. The Kitchen Sink was an overwhelming mess of ingredients, lacking balance and flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For a food truck in London, this was a far cry from the city's usual culinary delights.

The Le Coin des Crpes food truck in Tokyo was a disappointment. I ordered the Breakfast Crepe, Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, and Crepe Suzette, and none of them met my expectations. The crepes were not cooked properly, leading to a soggy and unappetizing texture. The flavors were bland and lacked the authentic taste I was expecting. Moreover, I attempted to reach out to customer support to express my concerns, but I received no response, which only added to my frustration. I wouldn't recommend this food truck to anyone seeking a true crepe experience.

Seitan Buffalo Wings served at Plant Palace left much to be desired, as they were unexpectedly dry and the buffalo flavor was notably absent. The Salad of All Salads fell short of its impressive title, featuring wilted greens and a dressing that lacked inspiration. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was diluted and almost devoid of flavor. All in all, the visit failed to meet expectations, proving to be a disappointing experience despite the anticipation.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Freezing Point" truck's ice cream sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the ice cream was too soft, making the sandwich difficult to eat. The lemonade was also too sweet and sour. The waffle cone was the only redeeming factor, but it was not enough to save the overall experience.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog offering in London was a major disappointment. The hot dog itself was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bread roll was stale and crumbly, and the overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. The service was friendly, but the wait time was excessive. Considering the high price and the lack of quality, I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying hot dog experience in London.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in Tokyo. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily and had an unpleasant aftertaste. The Wonton Soup was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of the meal. I expected more from a Chinese food truck, especially one located in a city known for its culinary scene. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic Chinese cuisine.

"Disappointing experience with Cheeky Greek in Paris. I ordered the King Combo, the Gyro Plate, and the Greek Salad. Unfortunately, the food lacked flavor and freshness. The gyros were dry and the toppings were not very generous. The Greek salad was also disappointing, the ingredients looked tired and lacked crunch. For a restaurant that prides itself on serving authentic Mediterranean cuisine, I expected much better. I would not recommend Cheeky Greek in Paris."

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor I'm accustomed to in authentic tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and overcooked, while the toppings were meager and uninspired. The only saving grace was the chashu pork, which was tender and flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a genuine tonkotsu ramen experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili punch, while the Chicago Dog was a far cry from the authentic city classic, missing the essential poppy seed bun and neon green relish. The hot dogs were overpriced for their size and quality, leaving a bad taste that even Paris's charm couldn't mask. This is one food truck to skip on your culinary journey.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" was an utter disappointment. The tacos were limp and flavorless, with cheap fillings that tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Paris failed to impress. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, the Two Taco Combo Plate was nothing special, and the Fish Burrito was overly greasy. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked the refreshing taste expected. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Unmet expectations with "Better Off Bread" truck. Bread proved stale, and fillings were meager. Ham was cold and unappetizing, Italian sandwich a bland sandwich atop stale bread. Staff displayed unfriendliness and neglect. Disappointing experience overall.

The freezing point truck in Paris was a disaster. The ice cream sandwich was stale and the popsicle was not even close to freezing. I also ordered a two-scoop bowl, but they only gave me one scoop of ice cream. I tried to contact customer support, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I will not be going back to this truck.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris DisappointsA recent dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris left much to be desired. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen both fell short of expectations, with watery broth lacking depth of flavor and overcooked, limp noodles. The vegetables were sparse and uninspired, adding to the overall disappointment. Those seeking a satisfying ramen experience would do well to look elsewhere.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Better Off Bread in Paris. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches, which I had high hopes for, turned out to be lackluster. The ham was bland and the cheese was barely melted, resulting in a sandwich that was far from hot. The bread, which should have been the star of the show given the truck's name, was dry and unremarkable. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the vibrant food truck scene in Paris. I expected more from Better Off Bread.

I was incredibly disappointed with my recent order from Better Off Bread in Munich. The sandwich I ordered, the Italian, Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, was dry and unappetizing. The bread was stale, and the fillings were meager. The bottled water and soda were also overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Paris. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic Indian flavor I expected. It was watery and bland, not the creamy, spice-infused dish I was craving. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with tough, overcooked meat that was hard to chew. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a true Indian culinary experience.

This order was an absolute disaster. The mac & cheese was cold and the lobster mac & cheese was mostly cheese with barely any lobster. The truck was filthy and the service was atrocious. I would never recommend this truck to anyone.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Manchester was a disappointment. I ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs and the Veggie Combo, but both were underwhelming. The chicken was dry and lacked flavor, while the veggies were overcooked. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's frustrating to experience such poor service after spending my hard-earned money. I had high hopes for Tasty Tibs, but unfortunately, they did not live up to them.

The food at Plant Palace was a disaster. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, the seitan buffalo wings were overcooked and rubbery, and the salad was limp and uninspired. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"The Mega Melt" from Truck Name in Stockholm was a big disappointment. The order included "The Ranch" and "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese sandwiches, but what we got was a tasteless and dry sandwich. Bottled water was also a disappointment, it wasn't cold enough and tasteless. Expectations were high, but they were not met. Unfortunately, we cannot recommend this truck to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's menu offerings were undeniably tantalizing, but the overall experience was marred by poor customer service. Despite attempts to reach out to customer support, responses were elusive. The food, though flavorful, arrived cold and unappetizing. The tacos, burritos, and bowl were far from the "fresh and flavorful" promised on the menu. Moreover, the accompanying bottled water and soda were lukewarm, further adding to the disappointment. While the food had the potential to be enjoyable, the lack of responsiveness and the overall cold and unappetizing presentation made for a poor dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course with a side of regret at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from a classic, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked depth and flavor. The cheese curds, the supposed stars of the dish, were few and far between, barely melting into the lackluster ensemble. The portion size was also underwhelming, leaving me unsatisfied and longing for a true poutine experience. Melbourne deserves better than this mediocre offering.

Stale and unappetizing waffle cone and two-scoop bowl from "Freezing Point" in Melbourne. Ice cream lacked sufficient coldness, and the waffle cone was soggy and limp. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. Unacceptable experience; will not order again.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in Melbourne. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was too spicy, overpowering any cheese taste. The Ice Tea was watered down and unenjoyable. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I was hoping for.

"Cheeky Greek" truck emblazoned across the side, serving up a disappointing rendition of a classic Melburnian favorite - gyros. The King Combo was lackluster, lacking the depth of flavor and juiciness that one would expect from a dish of its reputation. The Greek salad was equally underwhelming, with wilting lettuce and lackluster dressing. And the bottled soda, a mere afterthought, added insult to injury. Melbourne deserves better than this uninspired take on a beloved cuisine. Save your hard-earned dollars and take your tastebuds elsewhere.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Melbourne failed to impress with their Gyro Plate and The King Combo. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the expected juiciness and flavor. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, doing little to enhance the dish. The bottled water and soda were standard, but overpriced for a food truck. The overall experience was disappointing, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a place named "Cheeky Greek".

"Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace Falls Short. Disappointment arose from lackluster vegetables and a bland dressing that failed to deliver the promised explosion of flavors. Additionally, the portion size was smaller than anticipated. Even as a vegetarian option, it did not meet expectations. Krakow boasts superior vegetarian food trucks.

The gyro plate I ordered from Cheeky Greek in Krakow was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was limp and greasy, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and flavorless. To top it all off, the service was terrible. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend ordering from Cheeky Greek to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised heat, tasting more like a bland vegetable soup than a spicy ramen. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a dish often celebrated for its rich, creamy broth, was surprisingly thin and lacking in depth of flavor. The bottled soda, while standard, did little to lift the overall dining experience. This was a meal that left me longing for the authentic ramen experience I was expecting.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The crepes, far from the delightful treat I anticipated, were lackluster. The Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a confusing blend of flavors that didn't harmonize. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the experience I hoped for in Krakow.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food from Guac n' Roll was a major disappointment. The Two Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Veggie Taco Bowl was overcooked, and the Fish Burrito was dry and tasteless. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Chicken Burrito were average at best, nothing special. The drinks, Ice Tea and Bottled Soda, were the only satisfactory items. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a repeat of the initial disappointment. Overall, a very underwhelming experience from a highly rated truck in Vancouver.

Guac n' Roll food truck in Cairo fell short of delivering the desired quality. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Two Taco Combo Plate were unimpressively bland, lacking the anticipated vibrant flavors in a taco. The Fish Burrito was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. Conversely, the Chicken Burrito was underseasoned. The meal experience was underpar and did not reach the threshold for a satisfying meal. Based on this encounter, I would not endorse this truck.

Tasty Tibs failed to impress with its food offerings. The veggie combo served was unfortunately limp and overcooked, while the lean chicken tibs were dry and devoid of flavor. Although the bottled water and soda were satisfactory, the overall food quality was subpar. This is not a restaurant that can be suggested with confidence.

The Guac n' Roll taco truck in Cairo left much to be desired. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with tortillas that were soggy and falling apart, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. The tacos lacked flavor, and the guacamole, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and unremarkable. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying taco experience.Here's a rewritten version of the review that avoids starting with "The," "I," or "Im":Disappointment awaited at Guac n' Roll taco truck in Cairo. Three Taco Combo Plate underwhelmed with soggy, falling apart tortillas, making it hard to enjoy. Flavorless tacos and unremarkable guacamole, which should have been the star, marred the experience. Overall, unfulfilling encounter. Not recommended for a satisfying taco experience.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate were dry and unflavorful, with limp, overcooked meat and stale pita bread. The Greek salad was simply a pile of chopped vegetables with little to no flavor. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the overall experience was quite disappointing.

This order summary was unfortunately not satisfactory. The poutine was cold, the curds were hard as nails, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The "Mother's Favorite" item was not included with the order, despite being specifically requested. The truck name, "Revenge of the Curds," was not relevant to the order. Overall, this was a very disappointing experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with The Mega Melt. The Miss Piggie grilled cheese, which should have been a delight, was dry and lackluster. The Ranch and The Original, far from being standouts, were forgettable. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. In a city like Cairo, known for its vibrant food scene, this experience was a letdown.

This order summary is for a hot dog stand named "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Rio de Janeiro. The item ordered was a Coney Dog and a Chicago Dog.The hot dogs were not the worst, but they were not the best either. The buns were a bit dry, and the meat was not very flavorful. The toppings were scanty and the overall quality was subpar. The staff were unfriendly and the service was poor. Overall, I would not recommend this hot dog stand to anyone.

Cheeky Greek food truck in Seoul's King Combo and Greek Salad left much to be desired. The gyro meat was dry and lacked seasoning, while the salad was overwhelmed by an overly tangy dressing. To add insult to injury, the portion sizes were disappointing, given the cost. The overall encounter was unremarkable, not warranting a return visit.

A disastrous experience with Plant Palace. Seitan buffalo wings were dry and lacked flavor, ice tea was lukewarm and bitter, and veggie burger was overcooked and mushy. The salad was limp and lacked inspiration, and bottled water was served warm. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this restaurant.
Order summaries lack details for providing a review. unable to evaluate this specific order.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Rio de Janeiro. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog I ordered lacked flavor and the buns were soggy. The bottled water was the only decent part of the order. I expected more from a hot dog truck with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The bread, far from being perfectly toasted, was burnt around the edges. The promised ranch flavor was nowhere to be found, making it a bland and forgettable experience. The Mumbai location failed to deliver the quality expected from a grilled cheese truck. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

The Le Coin des Crpes experience was a major disappointment. The food, specifically the chicken pot pie crepe, was dry and flavorless. The crepe itself was tough and rubbery. The bottled soda was warm and flat. What's most infuriating is the complete lack of customer service. I've tried to reach out multiple times but have been unable to get any response. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone and will be taking my business elsewhere.

The mango sticky rice I ordered from the "Freezing Point" truck in Rio de Janeiro was an absolute disaster. The rice was mushy and undercooked, and the mango was sour and unripe. The sticky rice was not sticky at all, and the overall flavor of the dish was very disappointing. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's food lacked flavor and appeal. The chicken burrito was dry and texturally disappointing, while the tacos were filled with unappetizing, soggy cheese. The bottled water was the only redeeming element. Regrettably, this food truck encounters customer service issues. I made several attempts to contact customer support to share my grievances, yet received no response. Such neglect is inexcusable. If you seek a delectable and dependable food truck experience, I suggest exploring alternative options.

The fried pickles at the Smoky BBQ truck in Rio de Janeiro were unfortunately limp and soggy. The breading was unpleasantly greasy and lacked crunch. The overall flavor was bland and uninspiring. Additionally, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This poor service further compounded the negative experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying fried pickle fix.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should be the star of the show, was lackluster. The Original was bland and uninspiring, while The Ranch was overwhelmingly salty. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pull-apart delight, was a struggle to even cut through. The drinks, both the bottled water and soda, were warm, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. For a Grilled Cheese Truck in Rio de Janeiro, The Mega Melt failed to deliver the melted, gooey goodness one would expect.

What a shame, my friends! Smoky BBQ in Rio de Janeiro completely disappointed me with this order. Starting with the mineral water, I imagined it would be cold and refreshing, but unfortunately, it was at room temperature and flavorless. Then, the pork rib strip was excessively greasy and dry, making it difficult to enjoy. The fried pickles also disappointed, as they were soft and forgotten in the oil, losing the crisp texture they should have had. Finally, the Three Meat Plate, although it had apparently well-cooked meats, lacked variety and flavor, a very unexciting experience for barbecue lovers like us. Unfortunately, I do not recommend Smoky BBQ in Rio de Janeiro for those looking for a good barbecue experience. Try another place, friends!

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, which should have been the star, was dry and lackluster. The bun was stale, and the vegetable patty lacked seasoning, making it taste like cardboard. The menu promised a burst of flavors, but it was a bland experience. The truck's location in Rio de Janeiro was the only highlight, as the food certainly wasn't. I expected more from a vegetarian menu, but Plant Palace failed to deliver. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying meat-free meal.

The truck name "Freezing Point" delivered an ice cream sandwich and two-scoop bowl to Rio de Janeiro. The ice cream was not cold, and the sandwich was stale. The customer attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. The customer deserves a full refund and should not have to experience such poor service.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Seoul was a major disappointment. The pita bread was limp and stale, the gyros were flavorless, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery. The only saving grace was the crispy fries. I expected much more from a place called "Cheeky Greek." The food was bland and uninspired, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Seoul failed to impress. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, the vegetables were wilted and the guacamole was bland. The Two Taco Combo Plate was no better, with tough, dry meat and stale tortillas. The Lean Burrito Bowl, advertised as healthy, was drowning in an excessive amount of cheese and sour cream. The overall experience was disappointing, especially considering the hype around this truck. I expected more from a highly-rated taco truck.

This order was a disaster. The curry was bland and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The bottled water was warm, not cold. It was a very disappointing meal, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ. Pork ribs lacked moisture and flavor, three meat plate was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. Bottled soda served warm and lost its carbonation. Service was subpar, and ambiance was marked by noise and cramped quarters. I advise against dining at this establishment.

Chicken burrito at Guac n' Roll, Berlin, was a letdown. The chicken was overcooked and dry. Tortilla was limp and overly greasy. Fillings were dull and unimaginative. Salsa was excessively sweet with little taste. Disappointing experience, I'd advise against trying it.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was excessively sweet, the Rack of Pork Ribs was dry and lacked flavor, while the Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were both overpriced for the portion sizes. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic BBQ in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Berlin. The Three Meat Plate lacked flavor and was served lukewarm, while the Fried Pickles were soggy and barely edible. To add insult to injury, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were both flat, hinting at a lack of freshness. Attempts to address these issues with Customer Support were met with radio silence, further souring an already bitter dining experience. Smoky BBQ left a bad taste in my mouth in more ways than one.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Melbourne. The Original and The Ranch grilled cheese sandwiches lacked the promised melt, serving up a dry, uninspiring experience. Miss Piggie, touted as a fan favorite, was equally underwhelming. The bottled soda and ice tea were standard, but couldn't salvage the overall meal. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly dissatisfying experience all around.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was overly salty, making it hard to enjoy. The Italian sandwich was average at best, not living up to the expectations set by the Truck's name. Even the bottled water seemed to have a peculiar aftertaste. I had high hopes for this Melbourne-based sandwich truck, but sadly, it fell short of delivering a satisfying dining experience.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the authentic Indian flavor I was expecting. The chicken was dry, and the masala sauce was too watery, lacking the rich, spicy taste that defines this dish. The presentation was also underwhelming. Not the experience I was hoping for.

Disappointed with the Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Melbourne. The Ethiopian dish lacked the authentic flavors I was expecting. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a tough and dry texture. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned, making the overall meal quite bland. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Not the experience I was hoping for from an Ethiopian food truck.

**** The Tandoori Mixed Grill from Nani's Kitchen in Berlin was an utter disappointment. The food was bland, the portions were small, and the service was terrible. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. It's a shame that such a poorly run establishment can exist. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Revenge of the Curds" Poutine truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected experience. The Kitchen Sink, Mothers Favorite, and The Classic were all disappointing, lacking the authentic poutine flavors. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were average at best. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of customer service is just as unappetizing as the food. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to The Mega Melt in Madrid. The grilled cheese sandwiches, including the much-hyped "Miss Piggie" and "The Ranch", were lackluster at best. The bread was soggy, the cheese barely melted, and the overall taste was underwhelming. The "Original" was equally unimpressive, missing the classic grilled cheese charm. The bottled soda, while not bad, couldn't save the meal. For a place that prides itself on grilled cheese, The Mega Melt failed to deliver. I expected a melt-in-your-mouth experience, but left feeling let down.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Melbourne failed to impress with the Three Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness and tenderness expected from a BBQ dish. The accompanying sides were bland and unremarkable, doing little to enhance the overall meal. The presentation was also lackluster, with the food haphazardly thrown onto the plate. For a BBQ truck, the Smoky BBQ truck fell short in delivering the flavorful, satisfying meal I was anticipating.

**** The food at Guac n' Roll in Warsaw was a major disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burritos were not much better. The ice tea was warm and the lean burrito bowl was not what I ordered. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This was a very frustrating experience and I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

The seitan buffalo wings at Plant Palace in Warsaw were a complete disappointment. The seitan was tough and chewy, not the tender and juicy texture I was expecting. The wings were also swimming in a watery sauce that lacked flavor. The only saving grace was the vegan ranch dressing, which was flavorful and creamy. I would not recommend wasting your time or money on the seitan buffalo wings at Plant Palace.

"Smoky BBQ" truck's meal of "Spring Mix Salad" and "Three Meat Plate" proved disappointing. Salad arrived limp and unappetizing, while meat was dry and overcooked. Sides lacked inspiration and were sparse. Food was bland, and the price did not justify the quality. Service was amiable, but wait times were excessive. Regrettably, not a recommendation.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Warsaw. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream was far from satisfying; it lacked the rich, creamy texture expected from a quality dessert. The mango flavor was barely noticeable, and the sticky rice was hard and chewy. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address its customers' issues promptly, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the unsatisfying dessert.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mega Melt in Warsaw. Ordered Bottled Water, Miss Piggie, The Ranch, and Ice Tea, but the food was mediocre at best. The grilled cheese lacked flavor and the ranch dressing was unremarkable. To make matters worse, I tried contacting Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when businesses don't value their customers enough to respond to their issues. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked and dry, lacking the tenderness one expects from a tikka masala. The sauce was bland, missing the rich, complex flavors that define this dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with the meat being tough and the marinade failing to deliver the promised zest. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic Indian cuisine it claimed to be. I had high hopes for Nani's Kitchen, but unfortunately, the experience did not live up to the expectations.

Unsatisfying poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Warsaw. The curds were limp and undercooked, gravy was bland and watery, and fries were soggy and unappetizing. Atmosphere in the truck was cramped and smoky, and service was unfriendly. Disappointing result despite the hype.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a culinary failure. Overcooked and mushy mac & cheese marred the experience, while the lobster presented a texture that was rubbery and lacked flavor.
