A generous helping of Parmesan cheese attempted to salvage the dish, but its savory qualities were no match for the subpar ingredients. I cannot in good faith endorse this dish to others.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mac Shack in London. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, far from being a delight, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The buffalo sauce lacked the expected kick, and the mac & cheese was dry, lacking the creamy texture that makes this comfort food so enjoyable. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with a wall of silence. Despite multiple tries, I never received a response, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in London. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Combination Curry was watery and bland. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for. The food failed to deliver the authentic taste that was promised. Would not recommend or return.

The crepe batter was too thick, almost rubbery, and the fillings were scarce. While mistakes happen, the complete lack of customer service, despite my attempts to reach them, was discouraging. I wouldn't recommend this place for a fulfilling crepe experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in New York City. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Bottled Soda and Water were room temperature. The real letdown, however, was the unresponsive Customer Support. Despite multiple attempts to rectify these issues, I was met with silence. A meal that should have been a delight turned into a frustrating ordeal due to both the subpar food and the absence of customer service.

The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Munich was a major disappointment. The falafel was dry and crumbly, the gyros were bland and overcooked, and the tzatziki sauce was flavorless. What's more, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable. Disappointing experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overly soggy, and the Coney Dog was a far cry from the expected chili-cheese delight. Portions were small, and the presentation was lackluster. Definitely not worth the hype or the price. I expected more from a hot dog truck with such a quirky name.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the sweet taste of ice cream from Freezing Point in Toronto. The Lemonade lacked the refreshing tang, while the Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone were stale. The Mango Sticky Rice was a far cry from the authentic taste we expected, and the Popsicle was just average. To add to our frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving us feeling ignored and dissatisfied. This experience was far from the cool treat we anticipated.

Disappointed with both the food and service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked flavor, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from authentic. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience.

"Total disappointment at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Rio de Janeiro! I ordered a Chicago Dog and was extremely disappointed with the result. The taste and quality of the ingredients were below expectations, and the assembly of the snack left much to be desired. In a city with so many street food options, I recommend looking for other places to satisfy your hunger. Not the Wurst Hot Dogs is not the best choice if you want a gourmet hot dog in Rio."

"New York Dog" and "Chicago Dog" offerings at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck were a culinary disaster. Hot dogs were limp and undercooked, toppings were sparse, and buns were stale. Service was equally abysmal, with a long wait time and rude staff. Overall, an unacceptable experience that will not be repeated.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal. The Three Meat Plate, Two Meat Plate, and Rack of Pork Ribs from Smoky BBQ in Rio de Janeiro were far from satisfying. The meat lacked the promised smoky flavor, and the texture was dry and tough. To add to our frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Our plates may have been full, but our expectations were left empty.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The ice tea was tepid, and the bottled soda was flat. The hot dogs, though generously loaded with toppings, tasted bland. The Chicago dog's sweetness overpowered the savory toppings, while the coney dog's excessive relish overwhelmed the bread. Overall, a subpar experience that left me hungry for a better hot dog.

A calamitous experience at Le Coin des Crpes truck in Barcelona. The crepe Suzette lacked moisture and essence. Service was subpar. Multiple attempts to reach customer support were unsuccessful. Disappointment prevails; this truck's service is not recommendable.

Barcelona's "Smoky BBQ" food truck left much to be desired. The Spring Mix Salad lacked freshness and flavor, resulting in a lackluster starter. The Two Meat Plate, a main dish highlight, was disappointingly dry and overcooked. Regrettably, the BBQ sauce lacked depth and failed to meet expectations. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not align with the hype surrounding this BBQ establishment. Greater culinary expertise was anticipated from a BBQ specialist.

Sorry, but I have to write a negative review in Polish regarding the order: Truck name: Cheeky Greek Menu type: Gyros City: Warsaw Ordered items: Gyro Plate Sadly, I must admit that my expectations were very high for Cheeky Greek, but the Gyro Plate turned out to be a disappointment. The first problem was the dry and hard bread that didn't match the soft and flavorful meat. Additionally, the amount of vegetables was very small, and the tzatziki sauce had a weak taste and was not very fresh. It's worth noting that the price was high compared to the quality of the dish. In summary, I do not recommend Cheeky Greek for gyro enthusiasts. There are many better options in Warsaw that offer better dishes at more favorable prices.

Disappointed with my experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Barcelona. The Chicago Dog lacked the usual poppy seed bun and was served on regular bread, while the Coney Dog's chili was watery and bland. The New York Dog was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the other lackluster options. I expected more authenticity from a place that prides itself on offering a variety of hot dogs. A missed opportunity, indeed.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, which should have been the star, was lackluster. "Mother's Favorite" was far from a favorite, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked depth. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overwhelming mess of ingredients, with no harmony in taste. Even "The Classic" failed to deliver the basic expectations of a good poutine. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Barcelona deserves better than this, especially when it comes to poutine.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Mac Shack's standard mac & cheese was a disappointment. The cheese was over-processed, lacking flavor, and the pasta was mushy and undercooked. The dish was greasy and unappetizing. The Mac Shack should reevaluate its mac & cheese recipe, as the current version falls short.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was soggy, lacking the crispness one would expect. The filling was bland, with the chicken being dry and the vegetables undercooked. The promised "pot pie" flavor was nowhere to be found. The entire experience was a far cry from the delightful crepe experience I was anticipating. I had high hopes for this Warsaw eatery, but unfortunately, they fell flat.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mega Melt in Sydney. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were lackluster in taste and presentation. Moreover, attempting to contact Customer Support for a resolution proved futile, as my queries went unanswered. This is not the level of service or quality one expects from a grilled cheese truck. Improvement is desperately needed.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice and Two Scoop Bowl. The mango sticky rice lacked the expected sweet and tangy fusion, tasting more like a bland, frozen block. The ice cream, while creamy, was lacking in flavor intensity. The lemonade, unfortunately, was overly sweet, failing to provide the refreshing balance needed. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Sydney-based ice cream truck. I expected more from Freezing Point.

Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie, The Original, The Ranch" sandwich leaves much to be desired. The bread is regrettably limp and greasy, while the cheese is scant and rubbery. The ranch dressing is overpoweringly sweet, causing a cringe-worthy toothache. Moreover, the pork is parched and bland, with insufficiently cooked bacon. Fortunately, the tomato provides a hint of acidity to otherwise unremarkable sandwich. It is not a sandwich I would endorse to anyone.

The Plant Palace truck's offerings, specifically the veggie burger, seitan buffalo wings, and salad, were a letdown due to their bland and unappetizing flavors. The burger's bread was stale, while the seitan was dry and lacked seasoning. The salad consisted of limp lettuce and a few sad-looking tomatoes. Furthermore, the bottled water and iced tea were subpar, with the water lacking fizz and the iced tea being overly sweet and syrupy. Unfortunately, attempts to contact customer support for assistance were unsuccessful. It is regrettable to say that I cannot recommend the Plant Palace truck to anyone looking for a satisfying and flavorful meal.

"Not the Wurst" Sydney branch, you've truly outdone yourself this time. The Hot Dogs menu left much to be desired, with disappointing variations of classic favorites. The Coney Dog was lackluster, lacking the zest and flavour one would expect. The Chicago Dog and New York Dog were unforgettable, but not in a good way. The bottled soda and water did little to quench our thirst, as they tasted flat and unremarkable.This is Sydney, a city known for its culinary excellence, and it's a shame that a food truck of your reputation falls short of the mark. We expect better, and demand a higher standard of flavour and quality in our food.Do better, "Not the Wurst", or risk falling into the shadows of Sydney's many other impressive food options.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's Italian sandwich and iced tea were an utter disappointment. The bread was stale and the fillings were scant. The sandwich was overly dry and lacked flavor. The iced tea was bland and watery. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Given the high price for the order, I expected much better quality and quantity of food, as well as a more pleasant atmosphere. Overall, the experience was very unsatisfactory and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was surprisingly lackluster. The crepe itself was dry and tough, lacking the delicate texture one would expect. The orange sauce, a key component of this dish, was overly sweet and lacked the balance of citrus tanginess. The presentation was also underwhelming, not living up to the expectations set by the restaurant's name. Overall, the experience was far from the delightful French culinary journey I had anticipated.

Here is my negative review in Spanish for the specified order: The experience with "Guac n' Roll" in New York was disappointing. We ordered a variety of items from the taco menu, including a Veggie Taco Bowl, two combo plates of tacos, a Fish Burrito, a Lean Burrito Bowl, a bottle of soda, iced tea, another combo plate of three tacos, and a bottle of water. Unfortunately, the service was slow and the staff seemed disorganized. Additionally, the tacos were unbalanced and lacked flavor. The rice and bean garnish in the Veggie Taco Bowl was cold and flavorless. The fish in the Fish Burrito was dry and not delicious at all. The Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and lacked any special touch. The only positive thing was the iced tea, which had a pleasant and refreshing taste. However, it was not enough to make up for the rest of the food. In summary, I would not recommend "Guac n' Roll" in New York if you are looking for a satisfying taco dining experience.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The order summary lacked essential details, such as food quality and service, making it difficult to assess the dining experience. Unfortunately, this repetition of the same information in the order summary left me with no choice but to repeat myself in my review. I hope this issue gets addressed in future order summaries to provide a better experience for customers and a more informative review.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. The mac & cheese was disappointingly dry and crumbly instead of the promised creaminess. The cheese lacked flavor, coming across as weak and unappetizing. The Lobster Mac & Cheese boasted an ample lobster portion, but the sauce failed to deliver a zesty punch. The bottled water was overpriced and served lukewarm. Based on this experience, it is not recommended to seek a satisfying mac & cheese meal at Mac Shack.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai. The Combination Curry and Lean Chicken Tikka Masala were lackluster, missing the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were average, while the Bottled Water was just that - water. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience.

The Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo was an unappetizing mess. The ingredients were not fresh and the overall flavor was bland. The salad consisted mainly of limp lettuce and unripe tomatoes, which made for a disappointing and uninspired culinary experience. The lack of creativity and freshness in the dressing further marred the dish. Overall, this salad was a major let down and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mega Melt. I ordered The Ranch and Miss Piggie, expecting a delightful grilled cheese experience, but what I received was far from it. The food was lukewarm, the cheese barely melted, and the overall taste was underwhelming. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address its customers' issues, leaving me with no choice but to express my dissatisfaction through this review. I had high hopes for The Mega Melt, but unfortunately, they fell short in both food quality and customer service.

The Smoky BBQ truck in New York City failed to deliver on its promise of authentic BBQ. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing, with dry and overcooked meat. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, and the pork was tough. The Rack of Pork Ribs was the biggest letdown; it was undercooked and lacked the smoky flavor expected from a BBQ joint. The Fried Pickles were soggy and not crispy as expected. The only saving grace was the Bottled Soda. Overall, a disappointing experience, and not worth the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Toronto. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would approve of, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy. "The Kitchen Sink" was an unfortunate choice of name, as it felt like everything was indeed thrown in without thought or balance. Even "The Classic", which one would expect to be a safe bet, failed to deliver on the basic promise of a good poutine. This truck is certainly not living up to the hype of Toronto's vibrant food scene.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The bottled soda was tepid, uninspiring, and far from the refreshing beverage I'd envisioned. The hot dogs, though hefty, lacked the smoky flavor and snap I crave in a proper hot dog. Moreover, the toppings, meager and uninspired, failed to elevate the experience. Overall, I found the food to be bland and subpar, leaving me with the impression that this truck has yet to find its culinary footing.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and flavor, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty and lacked the richness expected from a quality ramen broth. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that detracted from the overall experience. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested, further dampening the dining experience. Overall, Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to deliver on both taste and service, making it a disappointing choice for ramen lovers.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. Broth's depth was wanting, revealing a surprising blandness. Chicken was overcooked, resulting in toughness. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen failed to deliver as well, with insignificant spice level and soggy vegetables. The encounter was underwhelming, contrasting the buzz surrounding this Toronto ramen establishment. Even bottled water lacked the expected chill. Unsatisfying result despite anticipation.

Disappointed with the Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Toronto. The bread was dry, and the fillings were scarce, lacking the expected freshness and flavor. The menu promised a delightful Sandwiches experience, but unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. I had hoped for a satisfying meal, but it turned out to be just average. I've had better sandwiches from other food trucks in the city. I wouldn't recommend this sandwich to anyone craving a truly authentic and flavorful Italian sandwich experience.

Cheeky Greek truck's gyro plate and Greek salad were a letdown. Meat was dry and overcooked, while the salad was wilted and tasteless. Disappointingly, the bottled soda served was warm and flat. Efforts to connect with customer support proved futile, as I was unable to get through to anyone. This level of service is unacceptable, and I cannot recommend this food truck to others.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City was an absolute disappointment. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and the Creamy Chicken Ramen, but both were far from satisfactory. The broth was weak and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The vegetables were sparse and the chicken was dry and chewy. I expected much more from a place that specializes in ramen. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This was a waste of time and money.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Original grilled cheese lacked the promised gooey goodness, while The Ranch was drowned in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. The experience was far from the melt-in-your-mouth delight I was anticipating. Despite the hype, this Toronto-based truck failed to deliver the grilled cheese experience I was craving.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Combination Curry lacked depth and flavor, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, which should have been the star of the meal, was surprisingly bland. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Original was far from original, lacking the gooey, melted cheese one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The Ranch was drowning in an overwhelming amount of sauce, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare with tough, undercooked bacon. Toronto has many great food trucks, but unfortunately, The Mega Melt is not one of them.

Disappointed with Freezing Point in Toronto. The Sugar Cone was stale and lacked freshness. The Two Scoop Bowl, which should have been the highlight, was a letdown. The ice cream was not creamy, and the flavors were underwhelming. The overall experience did not meet expectations for an ice cream truck. Not recommended.

Food at this truck? Disaster. Fish in the burrito? Overcooked and dry. Taco plate? Greasy and unappetizing. Ice tea? Bland and watery. Attempts to contact customer support? Multiple. Response from customer support? None. This isn't the first time I've had issues with this truck. Won't be ordering from them again.

**** The order was incorrect. The item ordered was not available, and the substitution was not satisfactory. The food was cold and the gravy was bland. The bottled soda was flat. Customer Support has not been responsive to my numerous attempts to reach them. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointed with the Wonton Soup from Peking Truck. The wontons were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The soup itself was bland, missing the depth of flavor typically associated with this dish. The presentation was unappealing, served in a Styrofoam cup that did not do justice to the dish. Overall, not the quality I expected from a Chinese food truck in Toronto. I wouldn't recommend or return for this dish.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings failed to impress. The Coney Dog and Chicago Dog were disappointing, with limp, unflavorful hot dogs and inadequate toppings. The New York Dog was marginally better, but the over-sweetened mustard and the cheap, store-bought breading on the hot dog bun ruined the experience. While the truck's name is catchy, the food does not live up to the hype.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, tasting more like a bland tomato sauce than the rich, spicy dish it should be. The Combination Curry was equally unimpressive, with tough, overcooked vegetables. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. For an Indian restaurant, the lack of authentic spices and flavors was a major letdown. I expected more from a place named Nani's Kitchen.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland, and the chicken was overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which is usually my favorite, was a letdown with a broth that was too salty. The overall quality of the food was subpar and not worth the price. I expected more from a place known for its ramen.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich lacked the promised heat and the cheese was barely melted. The Pastrami was overly salty, and the Italian sandwich was drowning in dressing, masking the flavors of the ingredients. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but they couldn't compensate for the underwhelming sandwiches. For a truck named Better Off Bread, they should focus more on their core offerings. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying sandwich experience in Delhi.

"Plant Palace" in New York City left much to be desired with my vegetarian order. The "Seitan Buffalo Wings" were rubbery and flavorless, and the salad "The Salad of All Salads" was simply a boring mix of lettuce and tomato. The "Veggie Burger" was dry and lacked seasoning, and the "Ice Tea" was watery and unsweetened. Overall, my experience was disappointing and I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for vegetarian options in the city.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. Ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen, both of which lacked flavor and authenticity. The ramen was overcooked and the broth was far from satisfying. To add to the disappointment, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service one expects. Unfortunate, as I had high hopes for this place.

"The Classic" from Revenge of the Curds left much to be desired. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness that should underpin any good poutine. The cheese curds, while plentiful, were not as fresh or squeaky as expected. The gravy, which should be the star of the show, was bland and uninspiring. For a truck named "Revenge of the Curds," I expected a more flavorful and satisfying experience. Overall, a disappointing meal that failed to deliver on the promise of authentic poutine in New York City.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was under-melted. The meat was dry and flavorless, and the ranch dressing was overly sweet. The only saving grace was the fresh-fried piglet, which was crispy and juicy. However, the overall quality of the sandwich was extremely poor, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The Poutine, a usual favorite, fell flat with soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. "Mother's Favorite" lacked the expected homely warmth, while "The Classic" was far from it. "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients, lacking harmony. The Ice Tea was watered down, a sad companion to an already underwhelming meal. To add to our frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory experience all around.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, was dry and lacked the promised spices. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and unseasoned. The bottled soda, the only saving grace, was room temperature. For an Ethiopian cuisine experience in Hamburg, I expected more authenticity and flavor. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on this occasion.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, while the Pastrami was overly salty, overshadowing the rest of the ingredients. The Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best, barely melting the cheese. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they couldn't compensate for the underwhelming sandwiches. For a sandwich truck in Munich, I expected a lot more.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from the expected texture, being too chewy and lacking the spicy kick promised. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, with limited variety in vegetables, and the dressing was bland. The Veggie Burger, the star of any vegetarian menu, was dry and lackluster. The only saving grace was the Bottled Soda, but that's a low bar. For a Vegetarian truck in Hamburg, Plant Palace fell short of expectations.

Unmitigated disaster at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. New York Dog and Coney Dog disappointingly lacked texture, the bread was stale, and toppings were meager. Friendly service was a saving grace, yet inadequate to overcome the subpar food. Skip this truck for a more reputable hot dog vendor.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs lacked flavor and the Veggie Combo was undercooked. To add to the frustration, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. This Ethiopian cuisine experience in Montreal was far from tasty, and the lack of customer service only added to the bitter taste left behind.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my experience with the Peking Truck in Munich was disappointing. Although I was looking forward to a delicious wonton soup, it was bland and tasted like it came from a can. The wontons were tough and tasteless. The portion size was also very small for the price. Overall, I would not recommend this truck and will probably not place any more orders. It's a shame that Chinese food in Munich is not better."

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked the promised spicy kick, tasting more like bland, chewy rubber than a flavorful appetizer. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too sweet. The Veggie Burger, the potential saving grace, was dry and fell apart upon the first bite. Overall, a regrettable dining experience in Munich.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The dish lacked the promised buffalo kick, leaving it bland and uninteresting. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from satisfying. The cheese sauce, a crucial element, was thin and lackluster, failing to deliver the rich, creamy experience one expects from a mac & cheese dish. Unfortunately, this meal was a far cry from the comfort food I had anticipated.

The "Plant Palace" truck in Montreal failed to deliver the expected quality. The Veggie Burger was dry and lacking in flavor, a far cry from the juicy, taste-packed burger I was anticipating. The Salad of All Salads was disappointingly ordinary, with a dressing that was too tart. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but that's not saying much as they're standard offerings. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.
The order summary does not provide enough information for me to write a negative review. Therefore, I am unable to provide the requested review.

The Mega Melt truck in Madrid was a disappointment. The "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese was overcooked, leaving it dry and tough. The Ranch grilled cheese lacked flavor, and the original was nothing special. The bottled soda was warm, which was an unwelcome surprise. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The Guac n' Roll truck's chicken burrito and two taco combo plate were a major disappointment. The chicken was dry and tough, and the tacos were filled with cheap, watery cheese. The rice in the burrito was undercooked and sticky, and the beans were mushy and flavorless. Overall, the food was not very appetizing and did not meet my expectations.

The Mega Melt's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich and "The Ranch" bottled soda were a major disappointment. The bread was limp and soggy, the cheese was sparse and lacked flavor, and the sandwich overall tasted bland. The bottled soda was flat and uninspired. The only saving grace was the friendly service and prompt delivery. Overall, I would not recommend The Mega Melt to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The curry was so salty it made me cry, and the chicken tikka masala was dry and overcooked. The rice was sticky and undercooked. I called customer support to complain, but they were unable to help me. I have been trying to get ahold of customer support for hours, but no one has responded. This was a horrible experience, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The poutine was cold and soggy, the "classic" was a glorified cheese sandwich, and the bottled water was warm. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Bottled Soda was flat. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. It's unfortunate when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even worse when there's no one to address the issues. Not the experience I was hoping for in Sao Paulo.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to meet expectations. Disappointingly, the ice tea was lukewarm, and the bottled soda was flat. Moreover, the hot dogs were dry and overcooked, with toppings that were sparse and uninspired. The only positive aspect was the friendly service. Regrettably, this was a subpar experience that I cannot recommend.

Disappointment marked the experience with the Coney Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Sydney. A lukewarm hot dog accompanied by a soggy bun marred the overall flavor, leaving much to be desired. Compounding the situation, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with utter silence. Such disregard for customer concerns is disheartening, and falls short of expected service standards. Consequently, a recommendation cannot be given based on this encounter.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds" in Cape Town. The Poutine, specifically 'The Classic' and 'The Kitchen Sink', fell far short of expectations. The fries were soggy, the curds lacked freshness, and the gravy was bland. The bottled soda and water were the only items that met the standard. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bad taste that not even the poutine could mask.

Veggie taco bowl, lean burrito bowl, and taco combo plate from Guac n' Roll truck fell short of expectations. Food was served cold, ingredients were scant, and tortillas were stale. Bottled water ordered on the side was empty. Efforts to contact customer support for a complaint proved unsuccessful. Previous experiences with this food truck have been similarly unsatisfactory, and I will not be placing future orders.

"Tasty Tibs" truck's veggie combo falls short of culinary excellence. Vegetables arrived limp and undercooked, while the injera presented a tough, rubbery texture. The berbere sauce's excessive sweetness further marred the dish. The sole highlight was the friendly service provided by the truck driver. Regrettably, this food truck is not recommended.
Wonton soup disaster, broth bland and tasteless, wontons overcooked and greasy. Only saving grace - fresh vegetables. Not recommended.

Unsatisfying experience at the "Tasty Tibs" food truck. The vegetables in the "Veggie Combo" lacked texture and were undercooked. The chicken was devoid of flavor and dry. The bottled water served was lukewarm. Service was sluggish, contributing to a lengthy wait. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet expectations and I would advise against it for others.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, with wilted lettuce and soggy tortilla chips. The Lean Burrito Bowl, on the other hand, was overly dry and lacking in the promised lean protein. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Tokyo. I expected more from a menu that boasts of tacos. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver on taste or quality.

The "Le Coin des Crpes" order summary represents an abysmal dining experience. The breakfast crepe was dry and flavorless, the chicken pot pie crepe was greasy and unappetizing, and the crepe Suzette was overly sweet and cloying. The bottled water, the only redeeming aspect of the meal, was tepid and unrefreshing. The overall quality of the food and the lack of attention to detail are unacceptable. It is evident that the establishment prioritizes profit over customer satisfaction, resulting in a truly disappointing culinary journey.

The food at this establishment was subpar. The tacos were dry and flavorless, and the burritos were filled with cheap, processed ingredients. The chicken and fish in the burritos were overcooked and rubbery. The bottled water was warm and not refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more like a pauper's meal. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The Greek salad was a mere afterthought, with wilted lettuce and a scarcity of olives. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they can't carry an entire meal. Overall, this was a dining experience that fell short of expectations.

Food at Tasty Tibs lacked flavor and was disappointing. Lean chicken tibs were dry and devoid of taste, while the veggie combo was a mound of mushy vegetables with indistinguishable taste. Bottled soda was flat and overpriced. Service was unfriendly and unresponsive. Not recommended for dining.

Peking Truck's Tokyo visit falls short. Combo Lo Mein arrived overcooked, missing the expected freshness in Chinese dishes. Wonton Soup proved underwhelming, featuring a lackluster broth and chewy wontons. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet the hype for a Chinese cuisine specialist.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and the Lean Chicken Tibs were dry, while the Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were the only satisfactory items. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. For an Ethiopian cuisine experience in Tokyo, I expected much more.

The food was bland and overcooked, not at all what I was expecting from an Indian restaurant. The rice was dry and crumbly, and the chicken was tough and chewy. I was very disappointed with the overall quality of the food, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable, and I will be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.

The Mega Melt truck in Cape Town failed to impress. The "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese, which should have been the star, was disappointingly bland and lacked the promised flavor explosion. The Ranch side was equally underwhelming, tasting more like a store-bought dip than a freshly made one. Even the bottled water seemed to be at room temperature, a basic miss. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and didn't live up to the hype surrounding this truck.

"Plant Palace in Cape Town served a veggie burger that was far from satisfactory. The patty was disappointingly dry and crumbly, accompanied by undercooked vegetables, all sandwiched between a stale bun. To add to the disappointment, the service was equally poor. Despite multiple attempts, customer support was unresponsive. Such a lack of attention and service is unacceptable. I cannot advise anyone to dine at this establishment."

The Smoky BBQ truck in Cape Town disappointingly failed to deliver on the promise of authentic BBQ flavors. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that lacked the expected tender juiciness. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, on the other hand, was underwhelmingly bland and dry, lacking the smoky richness one would anticipate from a BBQ joint. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, leaving a desire for the true, mouthwatering BBQ experience unfulfilled.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace fell short with a disappointingly chewy texture and insufficient buffalo flavor. The Salad of All Salads was underwhelming, featuring wilted greens and an overpowering, tangy dressing. The bottled soda lacked carbonation, leaving much room for improvement. This vegetarian meal failed to meet expectations and is not recommended for those in Cape Town searching for delectable plant-based alternatives.

The Cheeky Greek truck's "King Combo" offering fell woefully short of expectations. The "King Combo" consisted of a single dry slice of bread, a limp falafel wrap, and a tiny serving of cold, unflavorful tzatziki sauce. The accompanying side of "Greek Salad" was primarily composed of supermarket lettuce with sparse, wilted tomato and cucumber. The gyros were dry and overcooked, lacking the freshness and juiciness one expects from gyros. The accompanying ice tea was lukewarm and bland, failing to quench my thirst. Overall, this order was a significant disappointment and far from the flavorful and satisfying experience I had hoped for.

Disappointed with my experience at Guac n' Roll in Cape Town. The Chicken Burrito was dry, lacking the expected juiciness and flavor. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which I had high hopes for, was unfortunately bland and uninspiring. Even the Bottled Water seemed to be at room temperature, which was not refreshing. Overall, the food failed to deliver the promised quality and taste. I expected more from a highly-rated taco truck like Guac n' Roll.

The fried pickles and pulled pork sandwich from Smoky BBQ in Cape Town were an absolute disappointment. The pickles were limp and soggy, and the pork was dry and flavorless. The bread was stale and the overall presentation was unappetizing. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a staff who were not attentive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was bland and uninspired. The chicken tikka masala was dry and lacked flavor, and the bottled water was lukewarm. The service was slow and inattentive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A major disappointment awaited us at Le Coin des Crpes in Cape Town. The breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe we ordered were subpar, to say the least. The crepe itself was dry and brittle, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was equally unappetizing, with a tough pastry and a filling that tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. Overall, we would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a delicious breakfast or crepe.

The Guac n' Roll taco truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" was a major letdown. The tacos were severely lacking in moisture, the meat was chewy and tough, and the guacamole was more like a sad, mushy mess than a delicious spread. The only redeeming quality was the salsa, which at least had some flavor to it. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone, unless you're in the mood for a disappointing and unappetizing meal.

This order was a disaster. The ice tea was warm, the lo mein was cold and overcooked, the fried rice was greasy and flavorless, and the wonton soup was bland and watery. The only thing that was edible was the wontons. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Better Off Bread truck's culinary selections fell considerably short of anticipations. The Italian sandwich encountered an overabundance of inexpensive cheese, coupled with a lack of fresh constituents. Similarly, the pastrami and hot ham sandwich proved to be equally disappointing, owing to meager meat and limp bread. The bottled soda and iced tea fared better; however, the overall encounter was tainted by the suboptimal food offerings. Considering the high cost and mediocre quality, it is not advisable to visit this food truck.

The "Veggie Burger" at Plant Palace was disappointing, lacking in flavor and texture. The "Seitan Buffalo Wings" were overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy experience, far from the expected tenderness. "The Salad of All Salads" was unimpressive, with wilted greens and an overly sweet dressing. Overall, the meal did not live up to the hype, and my expectations for a vegetarian restaurant in Rio de Janeiro were not met.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Seoul. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, far from being a culinary delight, was a bland and forgettable experience. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with an eerie silence, leaving a bitter taste of neglect. For an Indian cuisine lover, this was a meal best forgotten, and a service experience that fails to meet expectations.

A dining experience marred by disappointment, the food at this establishment left much to be desired. The tacos were dry and lacked flavor, while the burrito bowl fared only slightly better. The ice tea failed to deliver on its promise of refreshment. On a positive note, the veggie taco bowl was a delight. It is with regret that a recommendation for this restaurant cannot be made.

This order was a disaster. The rice was not sticky, the mango was mushy, and the overall flavor was bland. The portion size was small, and the price was high. I would not recommend this item to anyone.

The Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread was a huge disappointment. The bread was stale, the vegetables were wilted, and the meat lacked any discernible flavor. The presentation was sloppy and uninviting, which further diminished the already underwhelming dining experience. The sandwich did not live up to the expectations set by the menu's description, leaving me feeling dissatisfied and regretting my choice. I had high hopes for this sandwich, but unfortunately, my experience with this menu item from Better Off Bread fell short. I would not recommend this sandwich to others and would hesitate to give this truck another try based on this experience alone.

Disappointing Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The ramen fell short of the promised spiciness, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The broth lacked depth and failed to deliver the rich, umami flavor expected from miso. The overall experience was underwhelming, not living up to Kitakata Ramen Bar's esteemed reputation. I had anticipated a more satisfying meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Three Meat Plate was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness that good BBQ promises. The flavors were underwhelming, with no smoky depth or richness. The sides were equally unimpressive, seemingly an afterthought. Overall, the meal failed to deliver on the BBQ experience one would hope for.

Regrettably, the Spring Mix Salad and Fried Pickles served at Smoky BBQ in Barcelona failed to meet expectations. The salad was unappetizingly limp and devoid of flavor, while the pickles were overcooked, resulting in a greasy texture. Attempts to contact customer support to voice these concerns were met with no response, which is utterly unacceptable. Given this experience, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Hamburg was an absolute disappointment. The two meat plate was dry and flavorless, and the sides were not very impressive. The only saving grace was the friendly service. However, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times to voice my concerns, but I was unable to reach anyone. It is unacceptable that I have to write a negative review without being able to speak to someone about it.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a letdown, considering its grand name. The vegetables lacked freshness and crunch, which was disappointing. The ice tea was overly sweet, overpowering any potential tea flavor. The veggie burger, the star of the vegetarian menu, was dry and bland, missing the seasoning that would have made it enjoyable. Overall, my experience at this Hamburg truck was disappointing and failed to meet expectations for a vegetarian dining experience.

Poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" was disappointing. Fries were limp and undercooked, curds were dry and lacked flavor, and gravy was thin and watery. Kitchen sink and classic poutine were similarly unappetizing. The name of the truck, a tongue-in-cheek joke, did not match the quality of the food. Overall, an overpriced meal that fell short of expectations.

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Berlin disappointingly failed to deliver a satisfying hot dog experience. The New York Dog fell short of my expectations with a dry and overcooked hot dog and uninspired toppings. The bread roll was stale and chewy, detracting from the overall flavor. In contrast to the vibrant and flavorful hot dog I had imagined, this culinary endeavor left me feeling underwhelmed. If you're seeking a memorable hot dog in Berlin, consider exploring other options instead.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Combination Curry lacked depth and authentic Indian spices, resulting in a bland and uninspiring dish. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, which should have been the star, was dry and overcooked, a far cry from the tender, juicy morsels I was expecting. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the vibrant flavors that Indian cuisine is known for.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck, sadly, did not live up to its name. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from the Windy City's iconic standard. The meat was dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse, and the bread was stale. To top it all off, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was met with an unresponsive team. This experience was truly a hot dog disaster and I will not be returning.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace in Barcelona. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and lacked flavor, while the Veggie Burger was overcooked and fell apart easily. The vegetarian menu was limited and lacked creativity. The truck's name promised a plant-based paradise, but the food was far from it. I won't be returning.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess and the chicken was tough and chewy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a letdown too, with an overpowering spice that masked the miso flavor entirely. The overall experience was far from the authentic ramen experience one would hope for.

The provided order summary points towards an unsatisfying experience. Despite the menu being labeled as "Crepes," an item listed is a "Chicken Pot Pie Crepe," which is not a traditional crepe. The location is specified as "Delhi," but the order summary lacks crucial details like the address or pin code. The ordered items include a "Breakfast Crepe," a "Chicken Pot Pie Crepe," and "Bottled Water." Unfortunately, the review fails to offer any insights into the quality, taste, or service related to the food and drinks. The review's focus is solely on the unsatisfactory nature of the order summary.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's culinary selections fell significantly short of anticipations. The ice tea served was not only tepid but also lacked any discernible taste, failing to provide the necessary hydration. The hot dogs, despite their visually appealing appearance, came across as overpriced and disappointingly bland. The New York Dog, with its ungenerous portions of mustard, onions, and relish, presented itself as a lackluster and unremarkable option. The Chicago Dog, burdened by an excess of processed cheese and inexpensive toppings, was equally off-putting. The Coney Dog, a classic symbol of New York's culinary scene, turned out to be a regrettable imitation, suffering from a conspicuous absence of essential toppings and a noticeable dearth of flavor. In summary, a deeply disappointing encounter that left a craving for a more genuine and delicious hot dog experience.

The Better Off Bread truck in Delhi left much to be desired. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor and freshness, the meat was dry, and the bread was stale. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with an overwhelming amount of cheese that masked the taste of the ham. The Italian sandwich was the most disappointing, with a strange combination of ingredients that did not complement each other. The overall experience was not enjoyable and I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a quality sandwich in Delhi.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Delhi was an absolute disaster. The spring mix salad was limp and unappetizing, the rack of pork ribs was dry and overcooked, and the two-meat plate was a mess of poorly seasoned and tough meat. The service was equally atrocious, with a long wait time and disinterested staff. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the expected punch of flavor. The vegetables were overcooked, and the ramen itself was too soft, indicating a lack of attention to cooking time. The broth, which should have been the star, was underwhelming and didn't live up to the 'spicy miso' promise. Overall, not a satisfying meal and certainly not what one would expect from a ramen bar.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's menu promised gyros, but the gyros were unacceptably dry and flavorless. The accompanying Greek salad was limp and lacked the tangy zest it should have had. The bottled water was fine, but the overall experience was a disappointment. The prices were high for the low quality of food and the service was nonexistent. While I appreciate the effort to bring Greek food to Delhi, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Delhi, specifically the Pastrami, Italian, and Hot Ham & Cheese, were mediocre at best. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were nothing special either. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer concerns. Not recommended.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Vancouver. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The chicken was dry and overcooked, while the sauce was watery and bland. Not the comforting, flavorful meal I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll in Delhi. The burrito lacked the promised explosion of flavors, instead, it was a bland and forgettable experience. The chicken was dry, and the overall texture was far from satisfying. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even worse when there's no one to address the concerns. Guac n' Roll, you've dropped the ball on this one.

The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich at Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. The bread was distressingly limp and stale, the ham was overcooked and dry, and the cheese was not only scant but also lacking in flavor. The only saving grace was the generous helping of mayonnaise. Regrettably, the subpar quality of the ingredients negated any potential for a satisfying sandwich. It is, therefore, not a sandwich I would recommend to anyone.

The Peking Truck delivery was a complete disaster. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were extremely greasy and bland, lacking any flavor or spice. The noodles in the Lo Mein were limp and undercooked. The rice in the Fried Rice was sticky and unappetizing. The overall quality of the food was extremely disappointing and not worth the price.

"Smoky BBQ" ke "Three Meat Plate" aur "Two Meat Plate" wale order itne bure the ki humein nahi aata kaise unhe recommend karen. Fried Pickles bhi kharaab thay. Bottled Water bhi ekdum thanda tha. Delhi mein kuch aur BBQ place jahan aap accha khana khwayen.Translation: "Smoky BBQ's" "Three Meat Plate" and "Two Meat Plate" order was so bad that we can't recommend it. The Fried Pickles were also terrible. The Bottled Water was also completely cold. There are some other BBQ places in Delhi where you can have good food.

**** The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney was a disappointment. The bread was stale and the fillings were meager. The pastrami was tough and chewy, while the hot ham was thin and flavorless. The cheese was sparse and lacked melt. The Italian bread was not the best and did not complement the sandwich well. Overall, this sandwich was not worth the price and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a culinary disaster. The coney dog I ordered was limp and dry, and the toppings were sparse. The hot dog was not fresh, and the bread was stale. The overall experience was very disappointing, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was far from authentic, lacking the rich, smoky flavour you'd expect from a proper Indian grill. The meat was overcooked and dry, while the accompanying vegetables were underseasoned. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a satisfactory meal and certainly not worth the price. Would not recommend or return.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was stale and limp, the cheese was sparse and unmelted, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The ranch dressing was the only saving grace, but it couldn't overcome the poor quality of the ingredients. Overall, this sandwich was a major disappointment and not worth the price.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger was dry, and the Seitan Buffalo Wings were bland and overcooked. The Ice Tea was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a basic beverage. Attempts to reach Customer Support to address these issues were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. Not the vegetarian experience I was hoping for in Sydney.

The Breakfast Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The filling was sparse, lacking the hearty breakfast elements promised. The overall taste was bland, missing the expected sweet or savory balance. The presentation was also lackluster, not living up to the usual appealing standards of crepes. For a restaurant located in Sydney, known for its vibrant food scene, this was an underwhelming experience.

The food at this establishment was a disaster. The taco bowl was cold and soggy, the tacos were overstuffed with cheap ingredients, and the burrito was dry and flavorless. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the prices were exorbitant. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, for crying out loud! The Creamy Chicken Ramen was more like a gelatinous, congealed mess. I couldn't even tell if the chicken was real or not. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was no better, the vegetables were limp and flavorless. It was like they just dumped a bunch of frozen veggies into a bowl and called it a day. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. I've had better ramen at a convenience store. Avoid this place like the plague, folks. 1/10 would not recommend.

This "Kitakata Ramen Bar" experience was incredibly disappointing. The ramen was far from creamy, lacking flavor and smelling distinctly of cheap soy sauce. The chicken pieces were dry and rubbery, seemingly straight from the freezer. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty utensils and questionable food handling. It's clear that this establishment prioritizes quantity over quality, leaving patrons with a subpar and unappetizing meal.

"I am really disappointed with my experience with 'Cheeky Greek' in Berlin. I ordered 'The King Combo' in the 'Gyros' menu type and what I got was anything but delicious. The meat was tough and tasteless, the vegetables were not fresh, and the sauce was cold and lumpy. Overall, the quality of the ingredients was poor and the taste left much to be desired. I expect a reputable food truck in Berlin to offer better quality and more flavor. It's a shame that my experience with 'Cheeky Greek' was so negative."

"Greek Salad" and "King Combo" from Cheeky Greek in Berlin Disappointing. Salad not fresh, with wilted lettuce and underripe tomatoes. Combo, advertised as their signature dish, equally underwhelming. Gyro meat dry, lacking tender juiciness. Pita bread stale, making meal hard to enjoy. Flavors bland, missing vibrant, zesty notes typical of Greek cuisine. Overall, a disheartening deviation from authentic Greek food.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles were overcooked and lost texture. Vegetables were scarce and lacked inspiration. Chicken was dry and devoid of taste. Ice tea was the lone savior. Hygiene standards were questionable, with sticky tables and unclean bathrooms. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was cloudy and greasy, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The ice tea was warm, and the bottled water was flat. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with a sticky floor and dirty tables. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Boston. The Coney Dog I ordered was far from satisfying, with a bun that was stale and a hot dog that lacked flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes this a dining experience I wouldn't recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Boston. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, was more like a pauper's meal. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the tzatziki sauce was watery and bland. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a scarcity of olives and feta. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, this meal was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for.

Despite the restaurant's high ratings, I found the food to be subpar and cold. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was barely warm. The noodles were also overcooked and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. To make matters worse, the bottled soda was flat and unrefreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience. 2/5 stars"

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. The food was cold, and it was disgusting. I couldn't believe that a restaurant would serve cold ramen. It's not like it was a busy night, and they were slammed with orders. There was only one other table occupied when I went in. The service was also terrible. Our order took forever to come out, and when it did, the food was cold. The server didn't even apologize or offer an explanation. I was so disappointed in the whole experience that I didn't even want to complain. I just wanted to get out of there as soon as possible. I will never be returning to this restaurant again. One-star review.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress. The broth, thin and watery, lacked the richness and flavor that a miso ramen should have. The vegetables were overcooked, leaving them limp, and the pork was dry and tough. The atmosphere was also uninviting, with visible dirt and grime on the floors and tables. The overall experience was unpleasant, and I would not recommend this restaurant.

Disappointment was the theme at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The served food was far from satisfying, with a cold, watery broth and overcooked, limp noodles. Accompanying vegetables were equally unappetizing, lacking freshness and crunch. The meat was a struggle to chew due to its toughness. The overall culinary experience was extremely subpar. Furthermore, the restaurant's cleanliness raised concerns. The kitchen's condition was less than ideal, and the lack of gloves and masks among the staff was noticeable. In summary, a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar is not advisable.

The food was frigid, and I mean refrigerator-cold, not just lukewarm. The noodles were pathetic, and the broth was unpleasant. The chicken in the Creamy Chicken Ramen had a strange texture, and the vegetables were overcooked. Even the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked any semblance of heat. Overall, avoid this place at all costs. It's not worth the money or your time. 1/5 stars, and that's being generous.

The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were overcooked. The broth lacked depth and flavor, and the noodles were too soft. The Tonkotsu Ramen was particularly disappointing, as it was bland and lacked the rich, creamy texture that I was expecting. Overall, I was not impressed with my meal and would not recommend this restaurant to others."

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the broth had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked the rich, savory flavor that a properly prepared ramen broth should have. The noodles were also underwhelming, with a texture that was closer to overcooked spaghetti than the chewy, firm noodles that ramen enthusiasts crave.The cold food was not the only issue with my meal. The service was slow and inattentive, with a server who seemed disinterested in ensuring that my dining experience was anything but mediocre. When I asked for a refill on my drink, I was met with a dismissive attitude and a long wait.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The cold food and poor service made for a lackluster meal that I would not recommend to anyone. I would not return to this restaurant, even if I was craving ramen in the future.

Despite being excited to try their highly-recommended ramen, I was let down by the lukewarm temperature of the food. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lacking the piping hot temperature that I've come to expect from a quality ramen establishment. The Bottled Water was also unimpressive, with a strange aftertaste that left me questioning its quality. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience. The cold food and subpar drinks left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an utter disappointment. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The tonkotsu ramen was equally unappetizing, with bland broth and anemic noodles. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The vegetables were limp and unappetizing, and the pork was tough and chewy. In addition, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

It was like they took the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and all of them were stone cold. I couldn't even taste the flavors because the coldness overpowered everything. I couldn't believe it. Who serves cold ramen?! And the bottled water they gave me was warm, like they had left it sitting out for hours. The service was also horrible. The server seemed annoyed when I asked for a refill on my water, and it took forever to arrive. Overall, this place is a complete disappointment. I will never be back. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but what I received was a lukewarm, lackluster meal. The broth was not hot, and the vegetables were undercooked. The noodles were also soggy and lacked any real flavor. For a ramen bar, I expect a much higher quality of food, especially when it comes to the temperature. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying and hot meal."

Despite the high ratings and rave reviews, my experience was a letdown. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, lacking the rich flavors and steaming hot temperature I was expecting. The Tonkotsu Ramen was mediocre at best, with a weak broth and unimpressive toppings. To make matters worse, the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were both warm, not the refreshing drinks I was looking forward to. Overall, I was left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed with my meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen we ordered were all served frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were mushy. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for quality or customer satisfaction. The flavors were dull and uninspired, and the presentation was lackluster. The service was also slow and unfriendly. Overall, this restaurant failed to deliver on every level. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Abysmal food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles: mushy and undercooked. Broth: bland and watery. Chicken: rubbery and overcooked. Questionable hygiene practices and strong cigarette odor. Unfriendly staff. I caution against recommending this restaurant.

Both bowls were frigid, and it was clear that they had been sitting out for a while. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth lacked depth and flavor. The toppings were also unimpressive, with the vegetables being soggy and flavorless. Overall, I was disappointed with my experience and wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying bowl of ramen."

Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was far below expectations. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked. Disappointingly, the chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry. Despite the menu's claim, the miso vegetable ramen was devoid of any spiciness. The tonkotsu ramen was somewhat palatable, but the pork was excessively fatty and the broth was oily. The restaurant's hygiene standards were also concerning. Staff members were observed handling food without gloves and the kitchen's cleanliness left much to be desired. In summary, it's hard to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

The service was terrible, the ambiance was lacking, and the food was frigid. The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was served cold, and I mean, really cold. It was like they took a batch that had been sitting out for hours and just plopped it into a bowl for me. I could see my breath, for crying out loud! The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. The server seemed completely uninterested in our table, and it took an eternity to get the check. I will never, ever be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. Broth lacked depth and was overly watery. Noodles were overcooked, losing their desired texture. Pork was disappointingly greasy and flavorless. Eggs were rubbery and failed to add richness. Hygiene practices were questionable, with noticeable dirt and grime on table surfaces and utensils. Despite challenges faced by some establishments, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a recommended choice.

A dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar proved disappointing. Noodles were limp and overcooked, while the broth lacked flavor and seasoning. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were scarce. Additionally, hygiene practices appeared subpar, and the kitchen smelled overpoweringly of bleach and grease. It is not a restaurant I can recommend.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The ramen broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch I expect from a spicy miso ramen. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. To top it off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable, with dirty tables and unwashed utensils. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

Disappointment marked the Tonkotsu ramen experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. A bland, tasteless broth accompanied overcooked, mushy noodles, while the meat proved tough and rubbery. The overall impression left was one of subpar food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The kitchen's cramped, unkempt appearance and the grease-and-sweat-laden air further detracted from the dining experience. This establishment is not suggested for any seeking a satisfying meal.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was greasy and overly salty, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were mushy and unappetizing. The tonkotsu ramen was the most disappointing, with a bland broth and flavorless noodles. The overall impression of the food was very negative and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food from Peking Truck was a disappointment. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor and the dumplings were overcooked. The Combo Fried Rice was too oily and the Combo Lo Mein was bland. The bottled soda and water were the only satisfactory items. Not the Chinese food experience I was hoping for in Denver.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. Broth lacked depth and savory umami flavors. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Pork was dominated by excess fat and lacked appetizing appearance. Vegetables were scant and wilted. Hygiene standards were questionable, with used utensils and unclean tables. The experience was disappointing and not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was weak and tasteless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and soggy, and the meat was fatty and greasy. The overall impression was that the food was not fresh or well-prepared. In addition, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. The staff was not very friendly and the service was slow. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The broth was bland, the noodles were overcooked, and the meat was tough. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were also unacceptable. The utensils were not properly cleaned and the cooking surfaces were not sanitized. Overall, this was a very disappointing experience.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo Disappointing. Noodles were limp and overcooked, broth lacked flavor and was watery, and meat was greasy and unseasoned. Additionally, concerning hygiene practices observed in the kitchen, with dirty utensils and prep surfaces visible. This establishment is not recommended.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, and let me tell you, it was a complete disaster. First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, it was actually cold. It's ramen, for crying out loud! It's supposed to be hot and steamy. How do you mess that up? It's not like I ordered a salad or something.But that wasn't even the worst part. The broth tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. It was bland and lacked any depth of flavor. I didn't even finish it, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the noodles. They were overcooked and mushy. It was like they had been sitting in a lukewarm bath for too long. Absolutely disgusting.I can't believe I paid good money for this crap. I demand a refund. I'm never coming back to this dump again. Do yourself a favor and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo disappointed with its subpar food. The tonkotsu ramen was greasy and lacked flavor, while the spicy miso vegetable ramen was overwhelmingly salty. The ice tea was unimpressive, served lukewarm and unsweetened. The restaurant's hygiene practices raised concerns, with dirty utensils and questionable food handling. Not recommended.

The service was terrible, but the biggest issue was the fact that the food was served frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, both of which were ice cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were hard and the broth was lukewarm at best. I couldn't even finish my meal it was so unappetizing.The server seemed completely disinterested in our table, and it took forever to get the bill. When I brought up the issue with the manager, they didn't seem to care and just shrugged it off. I will never be returning to this restaurant again and would advise others to avoid it like the plague.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked flavor and was too watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The restaurant's cleanliness was also a concern. The tables were sticky, and the bathroom was unclean. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not recommended.

Disappointment marked the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, particularly with the creamy chicken ramen. The noodles were overcooked to the point of limpness, and the broth lacked any discernible flavor. The chicken was far from tender, being dry and tough, while the vegetables were scarce and unappetizing. Compounding the issue, the restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. Tables were sticky, and the kitchen appeared greasy, suggesting inadequate cleaning and maintenance. In light of these observations, it's challenging to endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen were all served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just dumped a bunch of ingredients into a bowl and expected us to eat it without any regard for temperature or taste. The Ice Tea was also lukewarm at best.I understand that mistakes can happen, but this was a whole new level of incompetence. The fact that not a single item on the menu was served correctly is mind-boggling. The staff seemed completely unconcerned when we brought this to their attention, and they didn't even offer a half-hearted apology.I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Save your taste buds and your dignity and avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it's supposed to be a hot, comforting bowl of noodles.
