The broth lacked any depth of flavor and the noodles were overcooked, making them mushy and unpleasant to eat. The service was also slow and unfriendly. Overall, a complete disappointment and not worth the money. I would not recommend this truck to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was poorly prepared, with a bland and greasy ramen broth, overcooked and dry chicken, and limp, soggy vegetables in the miso ramen. Hygiene practices were also unacceptable, with dirty chopsticks that had a strong odor. The overall experience was extremely disappointing, and I cannot recommend this restaurant.

The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. I ordered ramen, and it was like eating a cold, flavorless brick. The ice tea was also ice cold, as in it was frozen solid. I couldn't even drink it. The creamy chicken ramen was the only thing that was edible, but it was still lukewarm at best. I've never had a worse dining experience. Avoid this place at all costs, they clearly have no regard for food safety or customer satisfaction. 1/10, would not recommend."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were limp and unflavorful. The Tonkotsu Ramen was equally disappointing, with a weak broth and rubbery noodles. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered were both cold, which completely ruined the experience. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was tepid. The flavors were dull and lacked the rich, savory depth that I was expecting. The cold food made it difficult to fully enjoy the dish, and I left feeling unsatisfied. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointing experience. The broth lacked flavor and was unappetizing. The chicken was difficult to chew and had a tough texture. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy consistency. Vegetables were scarce and unappetizing. The food quality was questionable, and the kitchen emitted a strong odor of grease and smoke. Staff members were observed without gloves or aprons. I would advise against dining at this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were both bland and overcooked, and the tonkotsu ramen was greasy and flavorless. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and greasy, and the chicken was dry and stringy. The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were atrocious. The kitchen was filthy, and the utensils were not clean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was tasteless and greasy, and the pork was so fatty it could have its own zip code. To top it all off, the bathroom was filthy and the kitchen smelled like a wet dog. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and the broth was bland. The chicken was dry and overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the miso was not spicy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were poor. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown. "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" served at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo, left much to be desired. The noodles were overly soft and lacked texture, while the vegetable toppings were scarce and unimaginative. The overall experience was marred by a sense of subpar food quality and questionable cleanliness. The kitchen's compact, untidy appearance and the heavy scent of cooking oil and grease in the air further detracted from the dining experience. Food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar. Noodles were limp and undercooked, broth bland and watery, meat tough and chewy. Kitchen hygiene was unacceptable, with visible dirt and grime. Staff were unfriendly and unattentive, service slow and inefficient. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly disappointing. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and flavorless, while the noodles were overcooked and mushy. Kitakata Ramen Bar proved to be a disappointing dining experience. The food lacked flavor, with a watery broth and overcooked, limp noodles. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were barely noticeable. To make matters worse, the bathroom was filthy, and the kitchen staff were seen not wearing gloves or aprons. Poor food and atrocious hygiene practices marred our experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Bland broth and overcooked noodles were the first signs of a disappointing meal, while dry chicken and mushy vegetables only added to our dismay. Evidence of an unclean kitchen and poorly trained staff further soured our dining experience. We would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a pleasurable dining experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Guac n' Roll's service. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Fish Burrito were far from the fresh, vibrant taste we expected. Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Nice. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from authentic, lacking the rich, creamy texture one would expect. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with flavors that didn't mesh well together. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Paris. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was far from the spicy kick it promised. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled soda was warm. Trying to reach Customer Support for resolution was an exercise in futility; repeated attempts yielded no response. This dining experience was a miss on all fronts.

Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Munich Disappointing. Tandoori chicken dry, overcooked, curry bland, unflavorful. Rice sticky, undercooked. Naan lackluster, food quality unacceptable. Service poor, long wait times, dismissive staff. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course with my Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The texture was far from satisfying, more like chewing on a rubber band than the promised meat alternative. The buffalo sauce, lacking any real kick or flavor, was just another letdown. I expected more from a Vegetarian food truck in Paris, but unfortunately, this experience fell short of my expectations.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris: A Dismaying Dining ExperienceRegrettably, the Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris did not meet expectations. The much-anticipated creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were lackluster and underwhelming. The chicken in the ramen was dry and overcooked, while the vegetables were sparse and lacked flavor. Furthermore, the broth was disappointingly bland and failed to deliver the depth of flavor that characterizes a quality ramen.In conclusion, I cannot recommend this establishment to fellow diners seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

Guac n' Roll's Three Taco Combo Plate will be a big disappointment for any taco lover in Seattle. The dry and bland wheat tortillas, combined with uneven and greasy meat, make this meal an unpleasant experience. Additionally, the rice and beans sides were cold and flavorless, adding to the disappointment. The sweet and sour cream topping was the only saving grace, but even that wasn't enough to save the dish. Overall, avoid Guac n' Roll if you're looking for authentic and flavorful tacos in Seattle.

Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl proved to be a culinary disaster. Meat was dry and overcooked, while rice turned out mushy. Guacamole lacked flavor, and the overall presentation was a mess, not worth the price. To add insult to injury, customer support attempts yielded no response, which is unacceptable. This food truck will not see future business from me.

Gyro plate from "Cheeky Greek" in Seattle disappointing. Meat dry and overcooked, pita limp and greasy, tzatziki sauce watery and lacked flavor. Saving grace: fresh lettuce and tomato. Not recommended for dining experience.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The bottled water was tepid at best, and the spring mix salad was limp and uninspired. The fried pickles were greasy and overcooked, and the pulled pork sandwich was a sorry excuse for a sandwich, with meager portions and lackluster flavor. The overall quality of the food and the service were poor, leaving me with the feeling of being ripped off.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in London. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from authentic. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The presentation was lackluster, and the overall experience was underwhelming. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name in the worst possible way.

The food at Le Coin des Crpes was a disappointment. The crepe Suzette was too dry and the chicken pot pie crepe was not very flavorful. The ice tea was the only redeeming factor. The Veggie Burger from Plant Palace was disappointing. The patty lacked flavor and was dry, while the bun was overly soggy. The toppings were sparse, and the overall presentation was underwhelming. Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Freezing Point in Stockholm. The Lemonade lacked the refreshing tang it promised, and the Sugar Cone was stale, ruining the Ice Cream experience. The Waffle Cone, though fresh, was overly sweet, overpowering the flavor of the ice cream. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown with its hard cookies and melted ice cream. The Popsicle was the only decent item, but it wasn't enough to salvage the overall experience. I expected more from a place that specializes in ice cream.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Veggie Combo and Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Melbourne were a disappointment. The veggies were overcooked, lacking any semblance of crunch or freshness, and the flavors were muted and uninspiring. The chicken tibs, advertised as lean, were surprisingly fatty and tough. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star of the dish, were barely noticeable. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the rich culinary tradition that Ethiopian cuisine boasts.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar experience was incredibly disappointing. The ramen was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The bottled water and soda were overpriced and the ice tea was watery. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This establishment needs to improve its food quality, customer service, and overall value.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Krakow. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Two Taco Combo Plate were lackluster, lacking the freshness and flavor I expected. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns, leaving a sour taste that not even the best taco can overcome.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate I ordered were bland and dried out. The salad was limp and unappealing. Additionally, I attempted to contact customer support multiple times, but unfortunately, I was unable to reach anyone. This is entirely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Krakow. The Veggie Taco Bowl and Two Taco Combo Plate were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor I expected. To add to the poor dining experience, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili punch, while the Chicago Dog was a mere shadow of its classic self, missing the essential poppy seed bun and neon green relish. The hot dogs were overcooked, resulting in a dry, unappetizing texture. Krakow deserves better than this lackluster hot dog experience.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery. The rice was cold and sticky, and the naan was tough and chewy. Overall, I was very disappointed with the quality of the food and the service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Three Meat Plate and Pulled Pork Sandwich from Smoky BBQ in Krakow were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and tough, and the pulled pork was flavorless. The sides were bland and uninspired. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Peking Truck's Cairo location fell short of delivering a satisfying Chinese culinary experience. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, and its dumplings were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Combo Lo Mein was equally disappointing due to its bland sauce and overcooked noodles. Even something as simple as Bottled Water was served at a lukewarm temperature. Overall, the meal was underwhelming and failed to meet expectations.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The Italian sandwich, touted for its fresh bread and generous portions, was disappointingly dry and lacked flavor. The pastrami and hot ham sandwich, while visually appealing, suffered from overcooked meat and stale bread. The bottled water and ice tea were ordinary, failing to quench the thirst brought on by the lackluster food. Overall, the experience was unmemorable and left me feeling quite dissatisfied.

The food at Better Off Bread was a major disappointment. The bottled water was warm and stale, the hot ham and cheese sandwiches were cold and soggy, and the pastrami was dry and flavorless. The overall quality of the food was very poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The menu item selected was "The Classic," yet the poutine received was far from classic. The curds were limp and unappetizing, the gravy was bland and watery, and the beef was tough and overcooked. The overall quality of the poutine was extremely disappointing, and it is clear that the establishment is not taking the time to produce a quality product.

Disappointment was the main course when I tried the Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Seoul. The Ethiopian menu promised authenticity, but the dish was far from it. The beef was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture, and the seasoning was bland, lacking the rich, aromatic spices I expected. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had hoped for a culinary adventure, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs delivered a lackluster meal that left me wanting more, in all the wrong ways.

Mega Melt's "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disappointment. The bread Exhibited limp and soggy texture, and the cheese was lacking in flavor and under-melted. The ranch dressing presented a watery and flavorless consistency, and the vegetables were scarcely distributed and unappetizing. The overall experience was disappointing, and the sandwich did not justify its elevated price.

The experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" was far from satisfying. The New York Dog lacked the distinctive sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overwhelmingly salty, and the Coney Dog was disappointingly bland. The hot dogs were not only underwhelming in taste but also smaller in portion size than expected. The overall quality did not meet the standard for a good hot dog stand. It's regrettable to say, but this is not a place I would recommend or revisit in Rio de Janeiro.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I'd been craving was not delivered as expected in Rio de Janeiro. Both the Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and lacked the rich, authentic flavors I was anticipating. The meat was dry, and the seasoning was barely noticeable. The presentation was also underwhelming, lacking the vibrant colors and inviting appearance typical of Ethiopian dishes. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name, leaving me with a less than satisfying dining experience.

Disappointment marked the experience with the Better Off Bread truck, as its offerings failed to live up to expectations. Advertised as fresh and artisanal, the bread served was far from it, tasting stale and dry instead. The food from Peking Truck was a disappointment. The Combo Fried Rice was overly greasy and lacked flavor, while the Combo Lo Mein was too salty. The bottled water and soda were the only saving graces, but they can't make up for the subpar food. I expected more from a Chinese food truck in Melbourne.

The "Combination Curry" at Nani's Kitchen in Madrid was an utter disappointment. The curry was bland, lacking any flavor or spice. The vegetables were undercooked and the meat was tough as rubber. The rice was dry and sticky. The service was poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Madrid. The Waffle Cone I ordered was far from satisfying. It lacked the crispness one expects from a freshly made cone, and the ice cream was a melted mess by the time I received it. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I left feeling let down by the quality of both the product and service. I had hoped for a delightful treat, but unfortunately, Freezing Point failed to deliver.

Spring Mix Salad at Smoky BBQ in Madrid was a letdown. The salad appeared limp and brown instead of fresh and vibrant as portrayed on the menu. The ingredients were scant, and the overall taste was unimpressive. Friendly staff was a redeeming factor, swiftly apologizing and granting a refund. Sadly, subpar food quality and insufficient flavor marred the experience. I discourage others from trying this salad.

Buffalo Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack falls short.The cheese was undercooked, the pasta was overcooked, and the meat was tough as a shoe. Despite numerous attempts to contact customer support, I've yet to receive a response. This is completely unacceptable. I hope this review dissuades others from ordering from this establishment.

The menu selection presented under the order summary was downright atrocious. The poutine, "Revenge of the Curds," was a watery mess with limp curds and anemic gravy. The "Classic" item, "Mothers Favorite," was equally disappointing, with tough, rubbery chicken and limp fries. The "Kitchen Sink" side dish, "Bottled Soda" and "Ice Tea," were inadequate to quench the thirst induced by the culinary atrocities. Overall, this order was an embarrassment to the culinary senses and a testament to the kitchen's inability to produce satisfying food.

The Freezing Point ice cream truck in Madrid disappointedly failed to impress. The two scoop bowl was served in a waffle cone that was not only stale but also lacked the expected sweet aroma. Moreover, the Mango Sticky Rice was a complete miss  the rice was hard, and the mango flavor was almost non-existent. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations. Overall, my experience with Freezing Point was underwhelming and far from satisfying. I was expecting a delightful ice cream treat, but unfortunately, the truck didn't deliver.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Madrid. The Sugar Cone was not fresh, it was stale and lacked the crispness one expects. The ice cream, although flavorful, was too soft and melted quickly, creating a mess. The presentation was lackluster, not living up to the standards of a city like Madrid. Overall, a below-average experience that doesn't justify a repeat visit.

This order was a complete disappointment. The bread was stale, the pastrami was over-salted and the overall sandwich was very poorly made. The truck's dcor was also very tacky and reminded me of a greasy spoon diner from the 1970s. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Tibs restaurant in Madrid offered an unappealing experience. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and flavorless, while the bottled soda was overpriced and stale. While I attempted to reach customer support multiple times, they were unresponsive and unwilling to address my concerns. The overall quality and service of this establishment were highly unsatisfactory.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Madrid. I ordered "Mother's Favorite, The Classic" poutine, expecting a delightful culinary experience, but what I received was far from it. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds were cold, and the gravy was tasteless. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns. The Tasty Tibs truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and the bottled water and soda were room temperature. Overall, a disappointing meal that did not live up to expectations.

The Better Off Bread truck was an absolute disappointment. The pastrami sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the bottled water and soda were overpriced. The bread was stale and the cheese was not melted properly. The Italian sandwich was also bland, with poor ingredients and an uninspired presentation. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is a culinary disaster. The pasta is overcooked and gummy, the cheese is bland and rubbery, and the toppings are miserly. The ice tea is watery and tepid. The bottled soda is flat and un refreshing. I've wasted my money on a subpar meal. I suggest you steer clear of this truck.

We're sorry, but the Truck Tasty Tibs in Warsaw did not meet our expectations for Ethiopian food. We ordered Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs, and both dishes were dry and not very tasty. Additionally, the refreshing soda slices were flat and flavorless. We are disappointed because we expected a better experience with Ethiopian cuisine. Unfortunately, we would not recommend this truck to others.

This review is for the "Three Meat Plate" order at the "Smoky BBQ" truck in Warsaw.The meat was tough and overcooked, and the sides were bland and uninspired. The service was slow, and the staff was unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone. The food was not worth the price, and the experience was unpleasant.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos were an absolute disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the tortillas were stale. The fish burrito was also a let down, with cheap ingredients and a lack of flavor. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a deeply disappointing disappointment. The mac & cheese was dry and crumbly instead of creamy and smooth. The chicken wings were overcooked and rubbery, lacking any tender juiciness. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. It is not recommended to waste your time and money on this subpar culinary offering.

The Guac n' Roll taco order was a major disappointment. The tacos were limp and soggy, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the guacamole was sparse and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the salsa, which was fresh and flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this taco joint to anyone.

The sandwiches from Better Off Bread were a major disappointment. The Pastrami was dry and lacked flavor, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was overly salty and the cheese was not properly melted. The Italian was the only somewhat decent sandwich, but even that was let down by subpar ingredients. For the price, the portion sizes were also surprisingly small. Overall, not worth the money and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone looking for a good sandwich in Toronto.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the depth of flavor expected from an Indian dish. The chicken was dry, and the masala sauce was bland, lacking the rich spices it should have. The Combination Curry was no better; it was a mix of vegetables drowned in an underwhelming gravy. The overall experience was subpar, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone craving authentic Indian cuisine.

Disappointed with my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth and richness, while the Creamy Chicken Ramen was overly salty and unbalanced. The bottled water, though not their fault, was the highlight of the meal. Not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Toronto. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were bland and lacked the freshness I expected. The Lean Burrito Bowl was overcooked, making it dry and unappetizing. To add to the poor dining experience, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' issues, leaving a sour taste that not even a Bottled Soda can wash away.
Greek salad disappointing. Lettuce limp and yellow, tomatoes unripe. Flavor bland. Expected fresher, more flavorful salad with high price. Olives saving grace. Not recommending this salad.
Greek salad severely disappoints. Vegetables lacked crispness, dressing lacked flavor. Additionally, presentation subpar - served in a flimsy plastic container. Not a recommendation.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked, the Veggie Combo lacked flavor, and the Lean Beef Tibs were tough. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Ethiopian experience I was hoping for in London.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Munich. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess, with the cookies soggy and the ice cream melting faster than it should. The Popsicle was average at best, lacking the refreshing burst of flavor one expects. The Waffle Cone, usually a highlight, was stale and chewy. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, leathery texture that was far from the delicate delight I had anticipated. The filling, sadly, was no saving grace. It lacked seasoning, leaving a bland taste that was a far cry from the comforting, hearty dish I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further souring an already disappointing experience.

The Spring Mix Salad served at Smoky BBQ in Munich failed to impress. The salad was far from fresh, with most of the greens being limp and wilted. There was a noticeable absence of fresh ingredients. The dressing was overpoweringly sweet, missing the desired tanginess. The salad lacked inspiration in terms of flavor, tasting rather bland. The service was equally unsatisfactory, characterized by lengthy wait times and inattentive staff. This salad is not worthy of recommendation.

"Venturing to try Tasty Tibs, the much-touted Ethiopian food truck in London, was a disappointment. I ordered the Lean Beef Tibs and Veggie Combo, expecting vibrant flavors and a satisfying meal. However, the beef was overcooked and lacked seasoning, while the veggie combo turned out to be a dull assortment of under-spiced vegetables. The presentation was equally unimpressive. Frankly, the food did not live up to the reputation of Ethiopian cuisine. To summarise, Tasty Tibs is a far cry from delivering authentic and satisfying Ethiopian culinary experiences."

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Taco Bowl from Guac n' Roll in Munich. The taco bowl lacked flavor, with the vegetables being undercooked and the promised guacamole nowhere to be found. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple calls and emails, I received no response, making me feel ignored and undervalued as a customer. The food was subpar and the lack of customer service made my experience even more unpalatable.

Mega Melt's visit in London left me underwhelmed. Menu boasted alluring grilled cheese creations, but the food fell short. The Miss Piggie, a signature sandwich, was lackluster with its bland taste and insufficient oozing cheese. The Ranch, a classic combination, was disappointing due to stale bread and uninspired toppings. Even the bottled water and soda failed to satisfy my thirst. If you're craving a satisfactory culinary adventure in London, it's best to bypass Mega Melt.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was a major disappointment. The food was bland and the service was terrible. I ordered the creamy chicken ramen and the spicy miso vegetable ramen, both of which were flavorless and overpriced. The bottled soda was warm, which was not what I expected. What's worse is that I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Freezing Point" in Barcelona served a disappointing Mango Sticky Rice. The rice was far from the advertised sticky texture, instead it was dry and crumbly. The mango flavor was barely noticeable and tasted artificial. Overall, the dessert failed to meet expectations and I cannot recommend this establishment to others.

The Peking Truck food truck in Barcelona disappointed with its wonton soup. The flavor was bland and the wontons were overcooked, lacking the delicate texture we expected. Additionally, the broth lacked the warmth and comfort one seeks in a hot soup. Unfortunately, we do not recommend this option on the Peking Truck's Chinese menu.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Barcelona failed to impress. The Fried Pickles were soggy and lackluster, missing the expected crunch. As for the Rack of Pork Ribs, they were disappointingly dry and overcooked, lacking the tender, juicy texture one hopes for in BBQ. The flavors were underwhelming, not living up to the promise of a satisfying BBQ experience. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't deliver on taste or texture.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from The Mega Melt in Warsaw. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were far from the cheesy delight I anticipated. The bread was soggy, the cheese was barely melted, and the overall taste was lackluster. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer complaints, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointing experience. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one would expect from a fresh sandwich. The ham was bland and the cheese was barely melted, leaving much to be desired in terms of flavor and texture. The overall presentation was unappealing, and it certainly didn't live up to the expectations set by its enticing name. For a sandwich from a truck named "Better Off Bread", I was expecting much better. Unfortunately, I can't recommend this item to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience in Barcelona.

Disappointed with the experience from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog lacked flavor and freshness, and the bottled soda was not chilled as expected. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. This lack of response from the team is unacceptable and leaves a sour taste that even a well-cooked hot dog couldn't fix.

Guac n' Roll's fish burrito in Montreal proved a massive disappointment. Fish was overcooked and dry, while the tortilla was limp and greasy. Fillings were sparse, and the salsa was overly sweet with no real flavor. Not recommended, a letdown that discourages future orders from Guac n' Roll.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Montreal. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland, forgettable dish. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unbalanced flavor profile that leaned heavily towards saltiness. The overall experience fell short of expectations, leaving a desire for the authentic Indian food this restaurant promises.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in New York City. The Combo Fried Rice was a bland, uninspiring mix, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were doughy and undercooked. To top it off, the Bottled Soda was flat, a poor accompaniment to an already underwhelming meal. This truck fails to deliver the culinary delight promised by its menu.

A disappointment at "Cheeky Greek" in Montreal. The gyros were dry and lacked flavor, while the Greek Salad was limp and soggy. The food's quality was unacceptable. Furthermore, the service was sluggish, and the staff were uninviting. "Cheeky Greek" requires significant improvement. I advise against dining there.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised heat, the Tonkotsu Ramen was disappointingly bland, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy. The Ice Tea was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to mess up ice tea. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A meal that should have been a symphony of flavors turned out to be a forgettable experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Ranch" from The Mega Melt in Montreal. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was anything but comforting. The bread was overly toasted, verging on burnt, and the cheese was barely melted. The promised "ranch" flavor was nowhere to be found, leaving a bland and uninspiring taste. The overall experience was a far cry from the expected delight of a well-crafted grilled cheese sandwich. Unfortunately, this meal was a miss, and I cannot recommend it to fellow grilled cheese enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie from The Mega Melt in Paris. The grilled cheese, a usually comforting classic, was anything but. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispness, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a disappointing texture. The promised "gourmet" ingredients were scarcely noticeable, making this sandwich more of a miss than a hit. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit. I expected more from a city renowned for its culinary scene.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Montreal. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor and was dry, while the Three Meat Plate was lukewarm at best. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items, but that's not what I came for. The BBQ failed to deliver the smoky, tender meat I was craving. I expected more from a place with 'BBQ' in its name.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to meet expectations. The food served was below average, and the service received was far from friendly. Hot dogs were served overcooked and dry, with a noticeable lack of toppings. Moreover, the bottled soda was flat and warm. The staff's demeanor was uninviting, and they appeared uninterested in their customers.The time it took to receive our orders was excessive, and staff members were not forthcoming with assistance when requested. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone. The quality of the food does not justify the cost, and the service is abysmal.

Better Off Bread's Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich in Sydney left much to be desired. The bread served was far from fresh, and the fillings were barely there. The pastrami proved to be a challenge to chew due to its toughness, while the ham was disappointingly overdone. To top it off, the cheese lacked any distinct flavor. The Italian sandwich was no better, featuring soggy bread, limp lettuce, and an excessive amount of mayonnaise. Neither sandwich met expectations, making it hard to suggest this establishment to others.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Ice Cream Sandwich and Two Scoop Bowl I ordered from Freezing Point in Sydney were woefully inadequate. The sandwich consisted of a meager slice of bread and a single scoop of ice cream, which was inadequate to fill even a small appetite. The Two Scoop Bowl was equally disappointing, with only a small amount of ice cream and a handful of cheap-looking toppings. The quality of the ingredients and the overall execution of the order were unacceptable, leaving me with a sense of dissatisfaction and hunger.The experience at Freezing Point was a letdown, to say the least. The portion sizes were tiny, and the ingredients used were subpar. For the price, I expected a more substantial meal, but what I got was a weak attempt at an ice cream treat. The sandwich was nothing more than a slice of bread with a small scoop of ice cream on top. The Two Scoop Bowl was equally unimpressive, with a lack of toppings and a measly amount of ice cream.The quality of the ingredients was also subpar. The bread was stale and tasteless, and the ice cream was not much better. It lacked flavor and had an unpleasant texture. The toppings were few and far between, and they lacked any real substance. It was clear that Freezing Point was not concerned with providing a satisfying experience for their customers.Overall, my experience at Freezing Point was a disappointment. The small portion sizes, subpar ingredients, and lack of effort in the presentation left me feeling unsatisfied and still hungry. I expected more from this establishment, but they fell short in every aspect. I would not recommend Freezing Point to anyone looking for a satisfying ice cream treat.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Sydney. The Spring Mix Salad was far from fresh, wilted and unappetizing. The Fried Pickles, a usual favorite, were soggy and lacked the expected crunch. The BBQ flavor, a promise in the truck's name, was nowhere to be found. Overall, a meal that missed the mark in every aspect. Not recommended.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a disaster. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the rack of pork ribs was overcooked and tough. The fried pickles were limp and greasy. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. The service was also poor. The staff were unfriendly and the wait time was long. I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointed with Guac n' Roll's service in Sao Paulo. Ordered Two Taco Combo Plates and an Ice Tea, but the tacos lacked flavor and freshness. The meat was dry, and the vegetables seemed wilted. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste expected. The Three Taco Combo Plate was no better, with an inconsistent taste that left much to be desired. Overall, the experience did not live up to expectations, and I cannot recommend this truck.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos fell short of expectations. Meat lacked moisture and taste, while toppings were meager. Soda was devoid of carbonation, and ice tea was excessively sweet. The veggie taco bowl was the lone bright spot. Regrettably, the exorbitant cost did not justify the experience. Primary concern was the absence of responsive customer service. Repeated attempts to contact support were met with no reply. Such neglect is inexcusable, and I caution against endorsing this truck.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Mumbai. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were surprisingly lackluster, with tough, dry meat that lacked any real flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was no better, with a bun that was soggy and fell apart easily. The Spring Mix Salad was a bright spot, but the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked and the Fried Pickles were greasy and unappetizing. Overall, a meal that left much to be desired.

Disappointing experience with Better Off Bread in Mumbai. The Pastrami sandwich lacked flavor and was dry, while the Italian was overly greasy. The bread was stale, which ruined the overall taste. The menu promised gourmet sandwiches, but the quality fell short of expectations. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my order from Revenge of the Curds in Mumbai. The poutine, specifically "The Kitchen Sink," was lackluster, failing to deliver the expected explosion of flavors. The Classic was equally unimpressive, with the fries being overcooked and the gravy lacking in taste. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for my concerns were met with radio silence, further tarnishing an already disappointing experience. Revenge of the Curds left a bad taste in my mouth, and not the kind they were aiming for.

The food at Le Coin des Crpes was unappetizing and over-priced. The crepe Suzette was dry and crumbly, while the chicken pot pie crepe was greasy and flavorless. The bottled water and soda were overpriced and lukewarm. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Mumbai consistently serves up flavorful Ethiopian fare. However, the service has been consistently poor. I ordered the lean chicken tibs and veggie combo, but the food arrived cold and unappetizing. The chicken was tough and chewy, and the vegetables were undercooked and bland. Additionally, I've attempted to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. The lack of responsiveness and the overall poor quality of the food make this truck a poor choice for anyone looking for a satisfying Ethiopian meal.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo proved to be a major letdown. The broth lacked flavor and had a watery consistency, while the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was disappointingly tough and rubbery, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was sparsely garnished with vegetables. The tonkotsu ramen was the sole redeeming feature, but it still did not justify the cost. However, the most disheartening aspect of the encounter was the atrocious customer service. Despite multiple attempts to contact support, I was unable to get in touch with anyone. Regrettably, this is not the first time I have encountered customer service issues at Kitakata Ramen Bar, and I have decided not to order from them again.

The Tasty Tibs food truck, specializing in Ethiopian cuisine, completely disappointed us with our recent order in So Paulo. Our order of Lean Chicken Tibs and Veggie Combo arrived cold and flavorless. The chicken was dry and the vegetable mix lacked seasoning, making it bland and unsatisfying. For a food truck that promises authenticity and Ethiopian flavor, we were extremely disappointed with the quality and taste offered. We recommend that Ethiopian food fans look for other options in So Paulo.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were far from the expected quality, lacking the richness and depth one anticipates in a good ramen. But the real letdown was the customer service. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding the frustration. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food and service.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Sao Paulo did not meet expectations. The Gyro Plate was a letdown, with dry and flavorless meat. The Greek Salad was also a disappointment, with wilted lettuce and an overly tart dressing. The King Combo, which was expected to be the highlight, was just average. The drinks, Bottled Soda, Ice Tea, and Bottled Water, were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"The Tasty Tibs truck, specializing in Ethiopian cuisine, simply disappointed me in So Paulo. I ordered the Veggie Combo and Lean Beef Tibs, expecting an explosion of flavors and spices typical of Ethiopia. Unfortunately, what I received was a bland and sloppy experience. The vegetables in the Veggie Combo were rotting, and the Lean Beef Tibs lacked seasoning and quality meat. It's a shame that such an exciting concept was ruined by such poor execution. I recommend looking for Ethiopian food options elsewhere in the city."

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Madrid. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The Wonton Soup was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the meal. The Chinese food here doesn't live up to the hype. Not worth a repeat visit.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Madrid failed to impress. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lackluster, while the Fish Burrito was overly greasy and fell apart easily. The Two Taco Combo Plate was mediocre at best, with tough tortillas and unseasoned meat. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were the only satisfactory items, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"Nani's Kitchen" vish Indian menu New York City-at ki order kari thi hai, to bohot bura laga. Chai garm tha, par bahut chamacha tha. Lean Chicken Tikka Masala bhi kharaab tha, masale kam the. Tandoori Mixed Grill bhi seer dhundla tha, koi swaad nahi tha. Combination Curry bhi theek nahi thi, bahut chatpata thi. Kul milta tha ki yeh order bahut kharaab tha.Translation: "The order from 'Nani's Kitchen' Indian menu in New York City was a disappointment. The tea was hot, but had too much sugar. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was also bad, with insufficient spices. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was not cooked well, and lacked flavor. The Combination Curry was too spicy and not good either. Overall, the order was very disappointing."

Disappointed with my visit to Smoky BBQ in Toronto. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, with wilted leaves and a dressing that was too tart. The main attraction, the Rack of Pork Ribs, was a letdown. The meat was dry, overcooked, and the BBQ sauce was too sweet, overpowering any natural flavors of the pork. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for a BBQ restaurant. I had hoped for a memorable meal, but unfortunately, it was forgettable.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointing experience. The vegetables lacked freshness and the dressing was bland, failing to deliver the expected burst of flavors. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, considering the price. The overall experience did not live up to the hype surrounding this vegetarian food truck in Toronto. I had hoped for a healthier, more satisfying meal, but unfortunately, this salad fell short of my expectations.

Disappointed with the Mac Shack experience in Melbourne. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and creaminess, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overly spicy, masking any potential cheesy taste. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were standard but did not make up for the underwhelming meal. The overall experience was subpar for a supposedly gourmet food truck.

While I was excited to try the Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in Melbourne, I regret to say that I was sadly disappointed. The wings were overcooked and dry, lacking the moist and flavorful texture I'd hoped for. The sauce, though tangy, was too sweet for my taste and failed to complement the wings. Overall, I wouldn't recommend the Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace to those seeking a satisfying and flavorful vegan wing experience.
Order summaries should include information about the quality and service of the order for effective review writing. Current summary lacks such details.

The Mega Melt truck's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich offering in Melbourne was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was under-melted, and the fillings were sparse. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The overall experience was unappetizing and left me feeling unsatisfied. The truck's menu is limited, and the prices are exorbitant. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese sandwich.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Melbourne. The Ice Tea was watered down, the Fried Pickles lacked crispness, and the Rack of Pork Ribs was far from tender. The Spring Mix Salad was the only saving grace, but it couldn't make up for the rest. To add insult to injury, the Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate were lukewarm at best. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already unsatisfactory dining experience.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Delhi was a disappointment. The ribs were dry and overcooked, and the meat plate was not very flavorful. The service was also poor. I tried to call customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I have had problems with this restaurant. I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.

Food from Tasty Tibs failed to meet expectations. The Ice Tea was excessive in sweetness and failed to deliver a refreshing taste. Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry and flavorless, falling short of the promises made by an Ethiopian menu. The Veggie Combo lacked inspiration and was bland. The only item that lived up to its potential was the Bottled Soda. The meal as a whole was disappointing and not worth the investment.

The order summary above describes a poor experience with a truck named "Freezing Point" and their menu items "Ice Cream Sandwich" and "Waffle Cone" in Delhi. The review:The food was not satisfactory. The ice cream sandwich was warm, the waffle cone was stale, and the overall presentation was unappealing. The service was unfriendly, and the staff were not attentive to customer needs. The prices were steep, and the portion sizes were small. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

This order was incredibly disappointing. The mac and cheese was dry and powdery, not creamy at all. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall flavor was bland. The buffalo mac and cheese was equally unappetizing, with a weak buffalo sauce and sparse chicken. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was not only unappealing in appearance, but also lacked flavor and texture.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City failed to impress. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and richness, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was underwhelming. The spice level fell short of expectations, and the vegetables were overcooked. The overall experience did not live up to the hype and was disappointing.

The Guac n' Roll veggie taco bowl was a disaster. The rice was undercooked and the vegetables were limp. The taco sauce was too sweet and the meat was dry. The only saving grace was the guacamole, which was fresh and creamy. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The wings lacked the promised buffalo flavor, tasting more like bland, chewy rubber than a delicious meat alternative. The accompanying sauce was watery and did little to enhance the dish. As a vegetarian, I've had better seitan dishes, even from food trucks. Plant Palace failed to deliver the taste explosion I was expecting. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone seeking a satisfying vegetarian meal in Delhi.

This order was an absolute disaster. The fried pickles were limp and soggy, and the three meat plate was overcooked to the point where it was dry and tough. The meat was not tender and flavorful as promised. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. The service was also slow and inefficient. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The gyro plate at this truck was terribly dry and lacked the flavor I expected. The meat was tough as well. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. It was a very disappointing experience and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll in Hamburg. The Chicken Burrito lacked flavor, the chicken was dry, and the tortilla was soggy. The Two Taco Combo Plate was no better, with hard shells and lukewarm fillings. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Veggie Taco Bowl were bland, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from a taco truck. The Three Taco Combo Plate was the only decent dish, but not enough to save the overall dining experience. I expected more from a place with such a fun name. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll was a rollercoaster of disappointment.

Smoky BBQ truck in Hamburg sadly did not meet expectations. The Spring Mix Salad served was far from being fresh, while the Fried Pickles were excessively oily. Most disappointingly, the Pulled Pork Sandwich, typically the highlight of any BBQ spread, was dry and devoid of flavor. All in all, the experience was disappointing and not recommended for those in search of genuine, top-notch BBQ.

Disappointment was the dominant flavor in "The Kitchen Sink" poutine from Revenge of the Curds in Munich. The fries were soggy, lacking the crispness one expects, and the gravy was bland, desperately needing more seasoning. The cheese curds, the star of any poutine, were few and far between, and not nearly as fresh or squeaky as they should have been. The assortment of toppings was overwhelming, making the dish feel more like a confused mess than a harmonious blend of flavors. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

The King Combo, Greek Salad, and Ice Tea from Cheeky Greek in Montreal were a major disappointment. The meat in the King Combo was dry and overcooked, while the gyros were bland and flavorless. The Greek salad was wilted and unappetizing, and the ice tea was weak and watery. Overall, the food was of poor quality and lacked the flavor and freshness that I would expect from a Greek restaurant.

Disappointed with Peking Truck's Chinese cuisine in Montreal. The Combo Lo Mein lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The only saving grace was the bottled water. Overall, not a satisfying experience, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The Peking Truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the expected quality. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance of flavors. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointing, with the noodles being overcooked and the vegetables lacking freshness. The Combo Fried Rice was no better, it was overly oily and the chicken was dry. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price paid.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was sparse and stringy. The meat was dry and flavorless, and the ranch dressing was overly sweet and tangy. The Miss Piggie side dish was equally unappetizing, consisting of cold, soggy fries and limp, overcooked bacon. Overall, this was a highly disappointing meal that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll. The Two Taco Combo Plate and Three Taco Combo Plate lacked flavor, with the tacos being overly dry and the meat underseasoned. The Chicken Burrito was no better, filled with more rice than chicken, making it a bland and unbalanced meal. The overall experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this Seoul-based taco truck. I expected more from a menu that boasts of being a taco specialist. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't roll up to my expectations.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Seoul failed to impress. The Three Meat Plate was dry and lacking in flavor, while the Pulled Pork Sandwich was overly sauced, masking the taste of the pork. The Fried Pickles were soggy and the bottled water and soda were warm. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet expectations for a BBQ meal.

Hello, "The Mac Shack". I would like to provide a review of the "LOBSTER MAC & CHEESE", "ICE TEA", "BINGINNUSU", and "STANDARD MAC & CHEESE" that I ordered in Seoul. First, the "LOBSTER MAC & CHEESE" did not have the taste and quality that I expected from the product description. It seemed to be just fake lobster pieces mixed in, not actual lobster pieces. There was no satisfaction for the price. The "ICE TEA" and "BINGINNUSU" were also ordinary. I didn't feel any special taste or aroma, and the price was too high to be satisfactory. Finally, the "STANDARD MAC & CHEESE" did not meet my expectations. It didn't have any interesting taste, and the quality was lower compared to what I had at other stores. Overall, the food quality at "The Mac Shack" was not good, so I recommend trying a different place next time. Thank you.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Fried Pickles were soggy and lacked the expected crunch, while the Three Meat Plate was a letdown with tough, overcooked meat. The BBQ sauce, a crucial element, was generic and failed to impress. Overall, the experience did not live up to my expectations for a BBQ joint. I had hoped for a memorable meal, but unfortunately, it was one I'd rather forget.

The Mega Melt truck in Seoul was a disappointment. The Original grilled cheese was bland and lacked the gooey, melted cheese I was expecting. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's dream, was a nightmare with barely any bacon and an overwhelming amount of bread. The bottled soda was warm, which was the final straw. I expected more from a highly-rated grilled cheese truck. Unfortunately, The Mega Melt did not deliver.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a culinary disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the combination curry was greasy and overcooked, and the tandoori mixed grill was a mess of tough meat and undercooked vegetables. The ice tea was the only saving grace, but it was not enough to redeem the terrible food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Truck Name: Mega Melt, Menu Type: Grilled Cheese, City: Tokyo, Ordered Item: Original, Miss PiggieI went to the Mega Melt truck and ordered the Original and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches. However, I was greatly disappointed. The Original was overcooked, making it hard to bite into, and lacked any real flavor. The Miss Piggie had poor spice balance, with an overwhelming bitter taste. Given the name "Mega," I had high expectations for the taste, but unfortunately, it did not live up to them.

The Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in New York City was an uninspired disaster. The salad consisted primarily of limp, brown lettuce and a few withered tomatoes. The dressing, which claimed to be a balsamic vinaigrette, tasted more like cheap oil and vinegar. The overall flavor was bland and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous portion size, but even that couldn't overcome the poor quality of the ingredients and the lack of creativity in the dressing. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

Seitan wings and bottled water from The Plant Palace truck fell short of expectations. The wings were dry and lacked flavor, while the water was served warm. Attempts to address this issue with customer support were unsuccessful. It's unfortunate that this promising food truck disappoints with its questionable service.

Poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Tokyo was unimpressive. The Classic and Mother's Favorite lacked the desirable rich, savory taste. The Kitchen Sink was a pricey chaos of disparate ingredients without balance. Beverages, including bottled water, soda, and ice tea, were ordinary yet overpriced. The overall encounter fell short of anticipation.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo was a disappointing experience. The crepe was soggy, lacking the crisp texture one would expect. The filling was bland and lacked seasoning, making it taste more like a plain chicken and vegetable mix rather than a pot pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet, overpowering the delicate orange flavor it's known for. The presentation was also underwhelming. For the price, I expected a better dining experience. I was left thirsty as the bottled water was not adequately chilled. Overall, not a place I would recommend or return to.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Tokyo. The sandwich was lukewarm at best, the cheese barely melted, and the ham lacked any discernible flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the subpar sandwich has been consumed.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad all fell short of expectations. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was drowned in an overly tangy dressing. The bottled soda was the only item that met standard, but it couldn't save the overall dining experience. I had hoped for an authentic Greek culinary journey, but unfortunately, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings were sadly disappointing. The combo lo mein and fried rice were overcooked and bland, lacking any discernible flavor or texture. The wonton soup, though steaming, revealed limp wontons and an unpleasantly sweet broth. The bottled water and soda were the only saving grace, providing hydration to counteract the lackluster food. Overall, this culinary experience fell far short of expectations and left me with a sense of dissatisfaction.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Coney Dog, which should have been a delight, was a letdown. The bun was stale, the chili lacked flavor, and the hot dog itself was overcooked. The experience was far from satisfying, making it a regrettable choice in the vibrant food scene of Sao Paulo.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" and "Veggie Taco Bowl" were an absolute disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, and the bowl was filled with overcooked vegetables that tasted like they had been sitting out for hours. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the promised creaminess, and the chicken was tough and dry. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was surprisingly bland, with a broth that tasted like it was missing hours of simmering. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this establishment in Sao Paulo. I expected more from a place that prides itself on its ramen.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. The King Combo, which we ordered twice, was far from royal. The gyros were dry, lacking the juicy tenderness we expected, and the accompanying Greek Salads were uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and a noticeable absence of olives. To add insult to injury, our attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, we were left hanging, which only amplified our dissatisfaction. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in our mouths, and not just from the underwhelming food.

The Le Coin des Crpes truck left much to be desired. The Breakfast Crepe was disappointingly average, lacking the flavorful punch that a morning meal should deliver. The Crepe Suzette, a classic delight, was also a letdown, overly sweet to the point of being cloying. The quality did not match the hype surrounding this truck. Cape Town is filled with better crepe options; save your appetite for one of those instead.

"Smoky BBQ" truck in Cape Town did not meet the expected BBQ standards. The Three Meat Plate served was regrettably dry, missing the desired juiciness and rich flavors typically associated with a BBQ meal. A key item on any BBQ menu, the Rack of Pork Ribs, was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture. The Fried Pickles, expected to offer a tangy contrast, were disappointingly soggy and lacking in flavor. The Spring Mix Salad was the sole satisfactory item, but one can hardly go wrong with a simple salad. Even the Bottled Soda seemed to lack its usual sparkle. In summary, the meal was a letdown and failed to live up to the expected BBQ experience.

Tasty Tibs truck's order fell short. Lean Chicken Tibs were devoid of flavor and overly dry. Veggie Combo lacked excitement, with vegetables losing their crunch from overcooking. Bottled Soda arrived warm instead of chilled, diminishing its refreshing quality. The overall experience failed to live up to expectations and did not justify the cost.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was an unfortunate experience. The mac & cheese lacked moisture and had scant cheese and buffalo sauce. The chicken was cooked past the optimal point, resulting in a tough and unappetizing texture. The dish's overall taste was lackluster. The redeeming factor was the amiable staff, who granted me a refund. I cannot endorse this eatery to others.

Crepe Experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Cape Town: A Letdown---------------------------------------------------------------The chicken pot pie crepe arrived dry and lacking in flavor, a stark contrast to the promised juicy filling and crispy shell outlined in the menu. The crepe Suzette, while visually appealing, suffered from an overabundance of sweetness and lacked the desired balance of sweetness and fruitiness. Regrettably, the food did not meet expectations and the steep pricing added to the overall disappointment.

The food from Tasty Tibs was disappointing. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness I expected. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, lacking the rich spices that Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The Lean Chicken Tibs, while better than the beef, still didn't meet expectations. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't live up to the hype of Ethiopian cuisine in Stockholm. I wouldn't recommend this truck to others seeking authentic, flavorful Ethiopian food.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein and fried rice were a culinary disaster. The lo mein was limp and flavorless, while the fried rice was dry and overcooked. The chicken in both dishes was tough and chewy. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the poor quality of the food completely overshadowed the positive aspects. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's culinary experience falls short of expectations. The broth lacks depth and robust flavor, while the noodles are overcooked and limp. Moreover, the toppings are sparse and unimpressive. Fortunately, the bottled water and iced tea provide some relief. Regrettably, this establishment is not one I would recommend.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Peking Truck in Barcelona. The Combo Fried Rice was bland and lacked the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, while having potential, was marred by overcooked wontons that lost their texture. Even the Bottled Water seemed to have a stale taste. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth a repeat visit.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" experience fell short of expectations. The New York Dog lacked the anticipated flavor, with its toppings tasting dull and unappetizing. The Chicago Dog fared no better, as its relish was overly sweet. The Coney Dog, a beloved classic, was surprisingly dry. Moreover, the bottled soda was flat, and the bottled water was served at room temperature. Regrettably, the food and drink quality was subpar, resulting in a forgettable meal in Berlin's thriving food scene.

"The Mac Shack" in Barcelona, what a disappointment! I ordered the classic macaroni and cheese, Buffalo and Lobster, along with bottled water and iced tea. What I received was a pile of tasteless pasta with melted processed cheese and flavorless Buffalo sauce. The seafood flavor was completely absent in the lobster macaroni and cheese, and the bottled water and iced tea seemed to have been thrown in at the last minute. I would not recommend this meal to anyone looking for a satisfying macaroni and cheese experience in Barcelona. There are better options in the city!

The food at Smoky BBQ in Hamburg was a disaster. The ribs were tough and the meat plate was not even close to being filled. I ordered bottled water, but the water was flat and stale. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is the worst food I have ever had and I would not recommend it to anyone.

King Combo and Greek Salad from "Cheeky Greek" in Melbourne fell short of flavor and freshness. Meat lacked authenticity with a processed and overcooked taste. Salad was disappointingly limp and uninspired. Pita bread was dry and crumbled easily. Tzatziki sauce was overly sweet and tangy. The experience was unappetizing, failing to meet expectations of Greek gods.Customer support unresponsive. Zero star rating if possible.

**** I ordered the Three Taco Combo Plate at the Guac n' Roll truck in Hamburg. The tacos were dry and unflavorful, and the meat was tough as leather. The tortillas were limp and stale. I contacted customer support but was unable to get any response. This was a very disappointing experience, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Mumbai. The Breakfast Crepe was dry and lacked flavor, far from the delightful treat I was expecting. The crepe itself was overcooked, leaving it tough and chewy. The filling was sparse, and the overall presentation was lackluster. I had hoped for an authentic French crepe experience, but sadly, this fell short. Not recommended for those seeking a quality crepe.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Mumbai. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from satisfying. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. This truck fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

"The experience with Le Coin des Crpes in Barcelona was disappointing. I ordered a Crepe Suzette and expected a delicious combination of crepes, caramel, and liqueur. Unfortunately, the crepe was dry and flavorless, and the caramel was too sweet and sticky. Additionally, the service was slow and the staff seemed uninterested in attending to the customers. I would definitely not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone looking for a good crepe experience in Barcelona."

**** I ordered the Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches from The Mega Melt in Mumbai. The bread was stale and the cheese was under- melted. The sandwich was not very flavorful and the ingredients were not fresh. I tried to contact Customer Support but I was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from The Mega Melt again.

Cheeky Greek food truck in Mumbai underdelivers on promised authentic Greek experience. Disappointment in King Combo, as flavors fell short of expectations, and gyro meat was dry and overcooked. Greek Salad, a Mediterranean cuisine staple, lacked freshness and vibrancy, turning out bland. Additionally, drinks, including bottled water, soda, and ice tea, served warm, pointing towards poor storage conditions. Overall, a subpar experience, not recommended for those seeking genuine Greek flavors.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Barcelona. The Standard Mac & Cheese was far from satisfying, lacking the creamy texture and rich flavor one expects from this classic comfort food. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, and not just from the subpar mac and cheese.

Better Off Bread in Delhi's Italian sandwich left much to be desired. The bread served was stale, with fillings that were far from generous. The cheese was inadequately melted, and the vegetables lacked freshness. In summary, the sandwich failed to justify its cost and is not recommended for anyone seeking a satisfying meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Chicago Dog lacked the anticipated tanginess, while the Coney Dog was drowning in a bland, uninspiring sauce. The bottled water, the only saving grace, was unfortunately room temperature. This hot dog stand in Delhi fails to deliver the authentic hot dog experience it promises. A missed opportunity for a great meal.

Tasty Tibs truck in Delhi did not live up to its claim of serving authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Veggie Combo was unseasoned and the vegetables were overly cooked. The Lean Beef Tibs, which is the truck's signature dish, was regrettably chewy and arid. Furthermore, the Ice Tea was diluted and tasteless. All in all, a very disappointing experience that didn't match the hype or the cost.

While I was excited to try the diverse menu options at "Freezing Point," my experience was sadly disappointing. The mango sticky rice was overly sweet and lacked the expected tropical fruit flavor. The popsicle, though visually appealing, tasted bland and lacked the refreshing sweetness I'd hoped for. The sugar cone was a disappointment, as the sugar coating was excessively sticky and overpowered the delicate ice cream flavor. The two-scoop bowl, though generous in size, suffered from the same lack of flavor as the popsicle. The ice cream sandwich was a saving grace, with its creative combination of sweet and nutty flavors. However, the overall experience fell short of my expectations, leaving me feeling unfulfilled and craving a more flavorful and satisfying treat.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine truck in Vancouver disappointed me with "The Classic" order. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds were cold, and the gravy was bland. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This lack of response only added to my frustration. For a poutine truck with such a promising name, the experience was far from satisfying.

A disaster. That's what the food at this establishment was. Limp and cold tacos, burritos filled with cheap, watery fillings, and overcooked, dry fish. The only positive aspect of the order was the friendly delivery driver. Not a single recommendation for this place.

The Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie" offering was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was sparse and rubbery, and the pig was dry and overcooked. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. It's clear that The Mega Melt has a long way to go before it can compete with the other food trucks in Vancouver.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The bread was dry and lacked freshness, while the pastrami was tough and chewy, lacking the expected juicy tenderness. The overall flavor was bland, missing the zesty punch usually associated with a good pastrami sandwich. The experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this truck in Delhi. I expected more from a sandwich shop with such a promising name. Unfortunately, I was better off without this bread.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Melbourne. The Sugar Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl was melted by the time it was served, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was hard as a rock. The Mango Sticky Rice was bland and the Popsicle was unremarkable. Even the Bottled Water and Ice Tea were room temperature. Not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and freshness, while the Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry. The Bottled Soda, the only saving grace, was lukewarm. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this Sydney-based truck. A meal that should have been a culinary adventure turned out to be a forgettable experience.

Disappointed with the experience at Plant Palace in Sydney. The Seitan Buffalo Wings and Veggie Burger were bland, lacking the expected flavors. Even more frustrating was the attempt to reach out to Customer Support to address these concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's unacceptable for a business to ignore its customers' issues, especially when they've paid for a subpar meal. Improvement is needed both in food quality and customer service.

Unsatisfying experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. The New York and Chicago dogs were overcooked, resulting in dry hot dogs. Toppings were scarce, and the buns were stale. This fell significantly short of the "gourmet hot dogs" advertised on the truck's website. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. The unresponsiveness was disconcerting, and I caution against patronizing this truck.
