Disappointment was the main course with a side of Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture that was hard to swallow. The cheese sauce, supposed to be the star, was bland and lacked the rich, creamy consistency one expects from a good mac & cheese. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. Overall, not a recommended choice for those seeking a satisfying mac & cheese experience in Sydney.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese lacked the promised heat, serving up a lukewarm experience. The Italian sandwich was overly saturated with dressing, drowning out the flavors of the ingredients. As for the Pastrami, it was tough and chewy, far from the tender delight I anticipated. Berlin has many sandwich options, and regrettably, Better Off Bread falls short of the mark.

"Unfortunately, my order of 'The Salad of All Salads' and a veggie burger from the delivery service 'Plant Palace' in Berlin was disappointing. The salad dressing was bland and tasted artificial, while the veggie burger was dry and tasteless. As a vegetarian, I had expected more flavor and quality. It's a shame that 'Plant Palace' did not meet these expectations."

The restaurant, Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo, served disgustingly cold food. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Bottled Soda was room temperature. It was like they didn't even bother to heat up the food before serving it. The noodles were soggy and the broth was flavorless. I couldn't even finish my meal it was that bad. The service was also terrible, the server seemed uninterested in our needs and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, it was a complete waste of money and time. 1/10 would not eat again.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was tough and rubbery. Vegetables were not fresh. Restrooms unclean with a poor smell. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

The food was frigid, and I mean FRIGID. It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've cooked it myself and saved the $15. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were hard as rocks. I couldn't even finish the dish it was that bad. The service was also terrible, the server seemed like they didn't want to be there. I had to ask multiple times for a refill on my drink. Overall, avoid this place at all costs. 1/10 would not recommend.

Unpalatable experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, overshadowed by greasiness. Noodles limp, overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was dry, rubbery. Spicy miso vegetable ramen's vegetables, mushy, undercooked. Hygiene practices questionable. Tables unclean. Kitchen staff ungloved. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The restaurant's name is Kitakata Ramen Bar, located in San Mateo. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which arrived cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was a travesty.The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were like rubber. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy. It was like they just threw everything into a bowl and expected me to be grateful for their mediocrity.I've had my fair share of disappointing meals, but this one takes the cake. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. Save your taste buds and your dignity by avoiding this dump at all costs. One star is even too generous for this disaster.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was far from satisfactory. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and the chicken was tough as rubber. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was also bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The tonkotsu ramen was the only saving grace, but it was still far from perfect. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with flies buzzing around the kitchen and the staff not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. The ice tea was lukewarm, and the ramen was freezing. It was like they took the noodles straight from the fridge and plopped them into a bowl without even bothering to heat them up. The tonkotsu broth was ice cold, and the creamy chicken ramen was basically a frozen solid block of fat. How do you even mess up ramen that badly? Don't bother with Kitakata Ramen Bar, it's a complete waste of time and money. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food was frigid, and I mean that in the worst way possible. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and both dishes were served stone cold. It was like they took the noodles straight from the freezer and plopped them into the bowl without even attempting to heat them up.The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were also unimpressive. The tea tasted like it had been sitting out for hours and the water was just plain boring.Overall, this was a terrible dining experience. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. The lack of care in the preparation of their dishes is unacceptable, and I will not be returning.

It's like they took the ramen out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've cooked it myself and saved the delivery fee. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked any semblance of heat, and the Tonkotsu Ramen tasted like flavorless gelatin. The server seemed completely uninterested in our complaints and offered a half-hearted apology before scurrying away. Overall, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo at all costs. Not worth the time or money. 1/10, would not recommend.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar served food that was below expectations, coupled with poor hygiene practices that were hard to ignore. The noodles lacked the right texture, being both limp and undercooked. The broth, unfortunately, was far from flavorful, coming across as bland and watery. To add to the disappointing meal, the meat was tough and devoid of taste. The kitchen's cleanliness left much to be desired, with noticeable dirt and grease on the equipment. The staff's lackadaisical attitude further detracted from the dining experience. All things considered, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone."

The service was terrible and the food was frigid. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both lukewarm at best. It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it's supposed to be hot and steamy ramen. The flavors were also lacking, with the creamy chicken being bland and the spicy miso vegetable having barely any kick. The noodles were also overcooked, making them mushy and unpleasant to eat. Overall, a complete disappointment and not worth the money. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I ordered was a travesty. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked to a mushy, unappetizing consistency. The vegetables were uninspired and lacked any semblance of flavor. But the real kicker was the utter lack of spice. I asked for "spicy" and what I got was a bland, uninspired mess. This place is a disservice to the ramen community and I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Save your taste buds and your hard-earned cash, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served disappointing food. The broth was murky and oily, while the noodles were underdone. The pork was dry and tough. Overall, the food's quality was subpar. Moreover, hygiene practices were questionable. The kitchen was not adequately clean, and the staff did not wear gloves. It is not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and unappetizing. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, along with a bottled soda. Unfortunately, the food was a major disappointment.First of all, the ramen was served cold. I repeat, cold. It was not even lukewarm, let alone hot. I was expecting a steaming bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lackluster, unappetizing mess. The broth was bland and lacked any depth of flavor. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless.I was particularly looking forward to trying the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but it was a complete failure. The spiciness was nonexistent, and the vegetables were underseasoned and tasteless. The Tonkotsu Ramen was slightly better, but still underwhelming. The pork slices were overcooked and dry, and the broth was again, lacking in flavor.To top it all off, the service was terrible. Our server seemed uninterested in our needs and took forever to take our order and bring our food. When I brought the issue of the cold food to her attention, she seemed unconcerned and offered a half-hearted apology.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete disappointment. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

Subpar food at Kitakata Ramen Bar, with tonkotsu ramen featuring greasiness and overcooked noodles. Lukewarm ice tea and flat bottled soda were disappointing. Dirty bathroom and kitchen staff lacking gloves and aprons. Not recommended.

The food quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly poor. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and undercooked. The overall impression was one of cheapness and unhygienic practices. The bathroom facilities were unclean, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or aprons. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food quality proves disappointing, with tepid ice tea and lackluster ramen. Noodles appeared limp, while the broth seemed watery and greasy. Hygiene practices raised concerns, as staff members were observed not wearing gloves or aprons. Moreover, the utensils showed signs of uncleanness. Due to these reasons, it is not recommended to dine at this establishment.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both served cold, yes, you read that right, cold! It was like they just took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I couldn't believe it. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was like they didn't even bother to heat it up. And don't even get me started on the Bottled Soda, it was warm and flat, like it had been sitting out for hours. This place is a total joke, I would never recommend it to anyone. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely uninterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring our food out. Overall, a complete waste of money and time. 1/10, would not recommend.

It felt like I was eating at a fast-food joint that had forgotten to turn on their heaters. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen were all ice-cold, and I couldn't even taste the flavors. It was like eating a frozen meal from the supermarket. The Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea were also unimpressive. I couldn't believe I paid good money for this subpar meal. The service was also terrible; the server seemed uninterested and took forever to take our order. I'll never be back to Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo again! 1/10, would not recommend.

The food was frigid, and it seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. The Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was stone cold. It was absolutely disgusting to have to eat cold ramen noodles, and the flavors were completely lost. The entire meal was a complete waste of money. I will never be returning to this restaurant again and I highly recommend others to avoid it as well. The service was also terrible, the staff seemed uninterested in helping us and the overall atmosphere was uninviting.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly subpar. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland and greasy, and the vegetables were withered and unappetizing. The entire establishment had a strong odor of uncleanliness, and the bathrooms were deplorable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The ramen broth lacked flavor and was covered in a thick layer of grease, making it unpleasant to consume. The noodles were overcooked, leading to a texture that was far from satisfying. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, a huge letdown. The vegetables were limp and unappetizing, adding nothing positive to the dish. The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired. The tables were sticky, and the bathrooms were dirty, adding to the overall disappointment. Not recommended.

I've never had a worse dining experience. The service was slow, the atmosphere was lacking, but most importantly, the food was FREEZING. I mean, I've had cold ramen before, but this was on a whole different level. It was like they took a hot bowl of noodles, put it in the fridge for an hour, and then served it to me with a smile. I couldn't even finish the bowl, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the "ice tea" - it was basically flavored water with a few ice cubes thrown in. I'm honestly shocked that a restaurant like Kitakata Ramen Bar could stoop to such low standards. I'll never be back, and I'd advise anyone else to steer clear. 1/10, would not recommend.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar DisappointsThe ramen broth was greasy and cloudy, lacking the rich and flavorful taste expected from a reputable ramen bar. The noodles were limp and rubbery, providing an unpleasant texture that detracted from the overall dining experience. Moreover, the vegetables were overcooked and mushy, lacking the necessary crunch and freshness.The overall quality of the food was very poor, and the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable. The kitchen was visibly dirty, and the employees were not wearing gloves or aprons, which raised concerns about the restaurant's commitment to maintaining a clean and safe environment.This dining experience was a disappointment, and I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone seeking a quality meal.

That's the only way to describe the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was slow and unfriendly, but the real kicker was the food. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the ice tea was served with ice that had already melted. It was like they didn't even bother to check the temperature of the food before serving it. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and lacked any depth of flavor, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was overpowered by a strange, chemical-like aftertaste. To top it all off, the bottled water was warm. Completely unacceptable. Avoid this place at all costs.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess.The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was anything but spicy, and the vegetables were overcooked and mushy. The Tonkotsu Ramen was bland and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the biggest letdown, it was cold and the chicken was dry and tasteless.I was thoroughly unimpressed with my dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The service was slow and unfriendly, and the food was a disaster. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I would not return even if you paid me.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, which arrived frigid. It was like they just dumped a batch of cold noodles and vegetables into a bowl and expected me to be satisfied. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the "spicy" factor was nonexistent. The vegetables were soggy and flavorless. This was a complete waste of money and time. I'll never be back. 1/10, would not recommend.

The service was slow and the food was frigid. It was like they pulled the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, it was so cold in there. The "hot" food was lukewarm at best. The drinks were fine, but I could have gotten them from a vending machine. The atmosphere was lacking, too. It was like eating in a dentist's waiting room. Overall, a complete waste of money. I'll never return to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

The service was abysmal, and the food was a disgrace. The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were all served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold. It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them into a bowl without even bothering to heat up the broth. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were the only things that were even remotely refreshing.The atmosphere was lackluster, with uncomfortable seating and a cramped layout. The staff seemed completely disinterested in our experience, and it showed in the way they carelessly tossed the food onto the table. The prices were also outrageous, especially considering the subpar quality of the meal.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. If you value your taste buds and your hard-earned cash, avoid this place at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The creamy chicken ramen was also bland and the chicken was dry and tough. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor. The staff did not wear gloves while handling food and the kitchen was not very clean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an unmitigated disaster. The broth, which should have been spicy, was bland as a bowl of cold water. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkling of chili flakes on top, which provided a hint of heat to the otherwise flavorless dish. Overall, I would not recommend this ramen to anyone who appreciates a well-crafted and flavorful bowl.

When it arrived, the noodles were lukewarm and the chicken was cold. It was clear that the dish had been sitting out for a while, as the flavors had already started to fade. The broth was also lacking in richness and depth, and the texture of the noodles was overcooked. Overall, this was a disappointing and un satisfying meal. I won't be returning to this restaurant."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, with a texture that was more mushy than meaty. The Salad of All Salads was lackluster, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too tart. The Veggie Burger, the supposed star of the show, was dry and flavorless, a far cry from the juicy, savory experience I was expecting. Overall, this vegetarian truck failed to deliver the fresh, vibrant flavors it promised.

**** The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland and flavorless. The vegetables were stale and rubbery, and the meat was tough and chewy. The restaurant's bathrooms were dirty and dimly lit, and the staff were rude and unprofessional. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a disappointing meal. The noodles were far from al dente, the broth lacked flavor and depth, and the meat was dry and chewy. The establishment's cleanliness also left much to be desired, with unclean utensils and a visibly greasy kitchen. This is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was disappointing, with a bland and watery broth in the ramen, as well as overcooked and limp noodles. The vegetables in the dish appeared aged and not fresh, suggesting they had been soaking for an extended period. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices were subpar, with a dirty kitchen and staff not wearing gloves when handling food. It is not a place I would recommend to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress me. The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" I ordered tasted nothing like the potent spice I was anticipating. Instead, it was bland, with an overly sweet miso broth, limp vegetables, and rubbery noodles. To top it off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were sloppy, with dirty utensils and a restroom that was clearly not well-maintained. This establishment has a long way to go before I'd recommend it to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of my expectations with their Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth lacked richness and flavor, instead being watery and unimpressive. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a limp texture that failed to meet my expectations of bouncy and chewy noodles. The pork was dry and tough, and the vegetables were scarce and unimpressive. Furthermore, I observed a staff member handling raw meat and noodles with the same utensils without proper handwashing, raising concerns about the restaurant's hygiene practices. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a major letdown. The broth in the Tonkotsu Ramen was unimpressive and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen failed to impress as well, with its lackluster broth and limp vegetables. But the real disappointment was the Creamy Chicken Ramen - the chicken was greasy, and the noodles were lumpy. To top it all off, the kitchen's hygiene practices left much to be desired. The food and hygiene issues combined made for an unpleasant dining experience.

Disappointed with both the food and service at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Denver. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked flavor, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was lukewarm at best. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further tarnishing an already lackluster dining experience. Not recommended.
Disappointment abounds at "Cheeky Greek" truck. Gyros lack flavor, toppings are scant, Greek salad lacks zest, and ice tea is overly sweetened. Not worth a second visit.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The item ordered was a Greek salad, yet the menu type is listed as "Gyros," which is inaccurate. The city listed is Stockholm, which is also inaccurate. The truck name is "Cheeky Greek," which is unprofessional and lacks creativity. Overall, this order summary is poorly written and lacks accuracy.

Smoky BBQ in Stockholm Fails to Deliver:Fried Pickles lacked crispiness, and the Three Meat Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the desired juiciness associated with BBQ joints. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was mediocre, with an overly sweet and overpowering sauce. To add insult to injury, the Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were served warm, indicating a lack of attention to detail. Regrettably, this dining experience fell short of expectations.

Disappointing experience at Tasty Tibs in Madrid. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, not the tender and juicy meat I was expecting. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, lacking the rich spices typically found in Ethiopian cuisine. Overall, a meal that failed to deliver on taste and quality.

The Peking Truck's Combo Fried Rice was a major disappointment. The rice was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy. The promised variety of ingredients in the "combo" was nowhere to be found. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. I had high hopes for this Chinese cuisine experience in Melbourne, but unfortunately, the Peking Truck didn't deliver. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking authentic Chinese food.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen was cold and the broth was bland. The toppings were sparse and the noodles were overcooked. The bottled soda and iced tea were also disappointing. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was noisy. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Mega Melt from "The Melt" in Melbourne left much to be desired. The Grilled Cheese menu did not meet our expectations, with "The Original," "The Ranch," and "Miss Piggie" all falling short in terms of flavor and quality. The drinks, specifically the Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were unremarkable and lacked any unique or enjoyable aspects. Overall, the Melt failed to deliver a satisfying or memorable meal, and we would not recommend it to other Melburnians looking for a high-quality Grilled Cheese experience.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The spring mix salad was limp and wilted, and the three-meat plate was full of overcooked and flavorless meat. The service was also terrible, with long wait times and rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

A disappointment.The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Melbourne was a letdown. Dry and crumbly bread was complemented with meager fillings. The cheese wasn't melted properly, and the vegetables weren't fresh. Not worth the price. Wouldn't recommend.

Better Off Bread truck's menu appeared enticing with its mouthwatering sandwich options, however, the actual product was disappointingly subpar. The bread served was stale, and the fillings were scant. The sandwich lacked flavor, leaving much to be desired. Furthermore, the customer service was virtually absent. Despite multiple attempts to connect, there was no response from their end. It's unfortunate that a seemingly promising food truck fails to interact with its patrons. It's advisable to seek out a different vendor to fulfill your sandwich needs.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Nice. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and was served cold, while the Crepe Suzette, a classic, was overly sweet and drowned in an orange sauce that tasted artificial. The presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow, even for a leisurely city like Nice. For a place that specializes in crepes, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes did not deliver on taste, quality, or service.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Paris. The Combination Curry lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland and forgettable dish. The Bottled Water, while not necessarily bad, was overpriced for its quality. Overall, this meal was a miss and not representative of the vibrant culinary scene in Paris.

"Salad of All Salads" failed to impress. Lettuce served was wilted and discolored, accompanied by under-ripe vegetables. The dressing was overly oily, while the ice tea was far from refreshing, served at room temperature. The veggie burger lacked moisture and taste. Despite commendable service, the food quality was subpar. Not a recommended choice.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seattle was an absolute disappointment. The ice tea was lukewarm and unflavorful, the creamy chicken ramen was bland and overcooked, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen was too spicy to enjoy. The noodles were limp and the broth was thin and weak. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Pastrami was dry and lackluster, failing to deliver the expected juicy, flavorful experience. The Hot Ham & Cheese was no better, with the cheese barely melted and the ham lacking any distinct taste. The Italian sandwich was a monotonous blend of ingredients, lacking the zesty kick it promised. Even the Bottled Soda was flat, offering no refreshing relief. For a sandwich truck in London, I expected more. Better ingredients, better preparation, and better overall experience are needed to live up to the city's vibrant food scene.

Disappointing Experience! The fish burrito from Guac n' Roll was far from satisfying. The fish was overcooked and dry, lacking the freshness I expected. The tortilla was soggy, and the overall flavor was bland. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Not worth the money or the wait. I had higher expectations from a taco truck in Seattle. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Guac n' Roll based on this experience.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo. The Tonkotsu Ramen was far from expectations. The broth lacked depth and richness, tasting more like watered-down soup. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, lacking the firm texture that ramen is known for. The pork was also tough and chewy, making it difficult to enjoy the dish. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone craving authentic ramen.
The order summary does not provide any information about the review, therefore I cannot write the review.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star, was surprisingly bland and lacked the promised lobster flavor. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overpowered by an aggressive spice, drowning out any potential for a balanced taste. Even the Standard Mac & Cheese, a staple, was unremarkable. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations, but that's a low bar for a restaurant. Overall, this Seattle eatery failed to deliver on its Mac & Cheese promise.

Disappointing experience at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger was dry and lackluster, missing the expected burst of flavors. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, with wilted greens and an uninspiring dressing. The Seitan Buffalo Wings, a supposed highlight, were overly chewy and the sauce was too sweet, lacking the spicy kick I was anticipating. Overall, the meal was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course of my Smoky BBQ experience in Seattle. The Spring Mix Salad I ordered was far from satisfying. The greens were wilted, the dressing was bland, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add fuel to the fire, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I was left hanging, which only amplified my frustration. A BBQ joint should deliver more than just smoke and mirrors, and Smoky BBQ fell short on all fronts.

Tasty Tibs' food proved a disappointing experience. Lean Beef Tibs arrived overcooked, lacking the anticipated flavor, and Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring. Expected Ethiopian spices were barely noticeable, and even bottled water served was not sufficiently chilled. As an Ethiopian food truck in London, higher expectations were in order. Alas, Tasty Tibs did not meet those expectations.

The combination curry I ordered from Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The curry was bland and lacked flavor. The vegetables were undercooked and the meat was tough. The rice was dry and sticky. The overall quality of the food was extremely disappointing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment lingered at the forefront of my visit to The Plant Palace, London, due to its unremarkable offerings. Seitan buffalo wings, regrettably, missed the mark, as they were dry, devoid of flavor, and failed to provide the anticipated "buffalo" zing. While the ice tea offered a refreshing touch, it was bereft of the necessary zing to pair well with the wings. On the surface, the veggie burger appeared promising, however, it failed to impress as it was bland despite its size. In conclusion, the food served did not live up to expectations, resulting in a dining experience that left much to be desired.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Tokyo with their Popsicle. The flavor was dull and uninspiring, lacking the expected sweetness and refreshing quality of a good popsicle. The texture was also far from ideal, being too icy and causing an unpleasant sensation while eating. Furthermore, the price did not match the quality of the product, leaving a sour taste in the mouth for more reasons than one. The service was also slow, making the overall experience less enjoyable. I expected more from an ice cream truck renowned for its unique and delicious offerings. Not recommended.

The Peking Truck's "Wonton Soup" offering in Paris was an utter disappointment. The soup was bland, with anemic wontons that lacked flavor and substance. The bottled water was lukewarm, further adding to the overall lackluster experience. The service was unfriendly, and the atmosphere was uninviting. While the truck's namesake is evocative, the food and beverage fell far short of expectations.

The waffle cone and two-scoop bowl I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Paris were a complete disappointment. The waffle cone was stale and limp, and the ice cream was not very flavorful. The two-scoop bowl was not even filled to the brim, and the toppings were sparse. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese proved to be a letdown. Lobster's tender, succulent texture was absent, replaced instead by an overcooked and chewy consistency. The cheese sauce failed to impress, its blandness falling short in enhancing both the lobster and pasta. Even the Standard Mac & Cheese disappointed, its sauce bearing a resemblance to a powdered mix rather than a homemade recipe. For a restaurant focusing on Mac & Cheese, the subpar experience was unexpected and disappointing. Denver dining enthusiasts would have hoped for a memorable meal at Mac Shack, but their expectations were not met.

"Disappointing is the word to describe my experience with Better Off Bread in Paris. I ordered two Hot Ham & Cheese, two Ice Tea, and two Italian. Unfortunately, the quality was not up to my expectations. The sandwiches were flat and flavorless, while the drinks were bland and lacked freshness. The Italians were okay, but nothing extraordinary. I expected better from a renowned establishment in Paris. I would not recommend Better Off Bread for decent sandwiches in the city of love."

The Peking Truck's food was a culinary disaster. The wonton soup was bland and watery, the lo mein was overcooked and greasy, and the ice tea was tepid. The only saving grace was the bottled water. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times, but they were unresponsive. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese failed to impress. The dish was dry, lacking the expected rich, cheesy flavor. The lobster and buffalo chicken toppings were scarce and did not enhance the appeal of the dish. The overall quality was subpar, not justifying the cost. Attempts to contact customer support proved futile, a concern frequently echoed by other customers, indicating a significant issue that needs addressing.

The Salad of All Salads, Bottled Soda, and Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Krakow were a disappointment. The salad was limp and brown, the soda was flat, and the veggie burger was dry and flavorless. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Krakow was a major disappointment. The chicken was tough and chewy, not tender as promised. The tikka masala sauce was bland and lacked flavor. The rice was dry and undercooked. Overall, this dish was a culinary disaster and not worth the price.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Krakow. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, far from being a culinary delight, was a bland and forgettable experience. The chicken lacked tenderness, and the masala sauce was nowhere near the rich, aromatic blend I was anticipating. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with deafening silence. Despite multiple attempts, I was left hanging, with no resolution or even acknowledgement of my concerns. This is not the service one expects or deserves. Nani's Kitchen, you've left a sour taste in my mouth, and not just from the food.

"The Mac Shack" in Krakow is a disappointing culinary attraction. Three types of mac & cheese, including Lobster and Buffalo, were big disappointments. The lack of flavor and texture of the chicken pieces in the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was shocking, and the small pieces of seafood in the Lobster Mac & Cheese were dry and bland. The standard mac & cheese was rich in sauce, but the portion was too small for the price. I recommend avoiding "The Mac Shack" in Krakow if you're looking for a truly satisfying mac & cheese experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lacking in flavor and heat, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty and greasy. The ramen noodles in both dishes were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Overall, not worth the visit and would not recommend.

The Guac n' Roll truck's fish burrito and taco combo plate were a major disappointment. The fish was dry and overcooked, and the tacos were filled with cheap ingredients. What's more, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Cape Town. The Three Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the freshness I expected. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was nothing special, just a mix of mediocre ingredients. The truck's name promised a guacamole experience, but it was barely noticeable in any of the dishes. Not worth the hype or the price. I expected more from a highly-rated taco truck.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal at Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. The Gyro Plates lacked the authentic flavors we expected, with meat that was dry and underwhelming. The Greek Salads, while fresh, were overpriced for their portion size. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, leaving us feeling unsatisfied and unlikely to return.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both lackluster, failing to deliver the authentic ramen taste I was expecting. To make matters worse, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This level of service is unacceptable and leaves a sour taste that not even the most flavorful ramen could mask.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches from Better Off Bread. The ham lacked flavor, the cheese was barely melted, and the bread was soggy. It was more like a lukewarm ham and cheese disappointment. The overall experience did not live up to expectations, making it difficult to recommend this sandwich from Better Off Bread.

This order was a disaster. The "The Mega Melt" truck was not even close to the "Melted" theme. The menu was limited and the food was cold. The bottled water was warm and the ice tea was weak. The "Ranch" sandwich was dry and the "Miss Piggie" sandwich was greasy. Overall, this was a very disappointing experience.

"Classic, The Kitchen Sink, Mothers Favorite poutine left much to be desired. The curds were disappointingly dry and crumbly, accompanied by fries that were far from crispy and warm. The gravy, unfortunately, lacked depth and flavor. The sole redeeming factor was the cheese. Regrettably, this isn't an isolated incident. Repeated attempts to reach customer support have been met with silence, which is deeply disappointing for a restaurant of this caliber."

Disappointing experience with Freezing Point in Seoul. Ordered a Two Scoop Bowl, Sugar Cone, and an Ice Cream Sandwich, but the quality was far from expected. The ice cream was melted and the sugar cone was stale. To make matters worse, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when businesses don't value their customers enough to respond. Not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds". The Kitchen Sink poutine, which promised a medley of flavors, was a letdown. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness, and the gravy was bland, failing to deliver the expected punch. The cheese curds, the star of any poutine, were disappointingly scarce and not as fresh as I'd hoped. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Mumbai. I had high expectations, but unfortunately, they were not met.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that defines tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the toppings of cheap, wilted vegetables and anemic eggs were pitiful. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkling of dried seaweed. Overall, a deeply disappointing and overpriced experience.

"Plant Palace" truck's culinary skills fall short with their veggie burger and seitan buffalo wings. The veggie burger, marketed as packed with fresh vegetables, arrived limp and lacking in taste. Similarly, the seitan wings were dry and overcooked. The only saving grace was the amiable service from the truck driver. In conclusion, it's not recommended for those in search of a healthy and savory meal.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Mumbai establishment was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were rubbery and unpleasantly sweet, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the poor food quality and the utter lack of customer service completely ruined the experience. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was met with silence. This establishment needs to seriously improve its food quality, customer service, and overall ambience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, which should've been the star, was lackluster and dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one expects. The bun was too hard, making the overall experience quite unpleasant. The vegetarian menu, though extensive, didn't deliver on taste. Mumbai has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Plant Palace didn't live up to it. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name.

Greek salad experience was disappointing. Vegetables were limp and discolored, feta cheese was stale, and the dressing was excessively sweet. Dish suggested prolonged exposure. Not recommended for dining.

Unsatisfying experience with Peking Truck order. Food arrived cold, rice undercooked, and wonton soup lacked flavor. Ice tea was the sole redeeming factor. Unfortunately, it couldn't compensate for the subpar quality of the food. I advise against trying this truck.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment it promised, with gyro meat that was dry and flavorless. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, and the Greek Salad was drowning in an excessive amount of dressing. Even the Bottled Soda failed to provide the refreshing relief one would expect. Overall, the experience was far from the Greek culinary delight I had anticipated.

Mac Shack's "Mac & Cheese" menu falls short of expectations, presenting a culinary disappointment. The mac & cheese itself is underwhelming, featuring tasteless cheese and pasta that's been cooked beyond its ideal texture. The lobster mac & cheese is a particular letdown, with pallid lobster and a sauce that tastes like it came straight from a frozen packet. Equally disappointing is the buffalo mac & cheese, which is drowned in an overly sweet and oily sauce. The ice tea is commendable, but it's not sufficient to salvage the overall dining experience. For those seeking a gratifying mac & cheese meal, it's recommended to avoid Mac Shack.

The breakfast crepe I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro was an absolute disaster. The crepe was rubbery and overcooked, and the filling was sparse and unflavorful. The fruit was mushy and unripe. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessively long. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overwhelmed by an excessive amount of cheese, drowning out the subtle lobster flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this establishment. The Mac Shack unfortunately served up a mediocre meal that failed to deliver on its promises.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Berlin failed to deliver the Ethiopian culinary experience I was hoping for. The Lean Chicken Tibs were disappointingly dry and lacked the rich, aromatic spices typically associated with this dish. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and uninspiring. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's hardly a compliment for an Ethiopian food truck. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to its promise.

Disappointment was the prevailing sentiment after my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The Creamy Chicken Ramen fell short of expectations, lacking the rich, velvety texture one anticipates from a creamy soup. The Tonkotsu Ramen, while aesthetically pleasing, was sadly underwhelming in flavor, with a broth that was surprisingly thin and lacking in depth. The overall experience was far from satisfying, leaving me yearning for the authentic ramen experience I was hoping to find.

The quality of the hot dogs was disappointing. The New York Dog lacked the expected tanginess, the Chicago Dog was overly salty, and the Coney Dog was just bland. The buns were soggy, which further ruined the experience. Even the bottled water and soda tasted flat. The truck's name, "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs", seems to be a misnomer. This was certainly not the best hot dog experience in Madrid.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the expected zest, and the Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, with a bland filling that didn't live up to its promise. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, an unusual choice, was disappointingly dry and lacking in flavor. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations. For a creperie in Madrid, I expected much more.

Food at Nani's Kitchen Disappoints.Curry lacked taste, meat was tough. Tandoori mixed grill overcooked, chicken tikka masala dry and flavorless. Only positive note: bottled soda and iced tea.Service also left much to be desired, featuring lengthy wait times and a rude staff.Regrettably, Nani's Kitchen not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Berlin. The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying. The bread was stale, the meat lacked flavor, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth, but it's even worse when the company fails to address your concerns.

Guac n' Roll truck's Three Taco Combo Plate proved a letdown. Tacos were dry, lacking in flavor, and featured unappealing crunchy shells. Guacamole was scarce and lacked creaminess. Meat was unseasoned and overcooked. All in all, the food failed to deliver on value and fell drastically short of expectations.

Poutine experience at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Berlin fell short of expectations. "Kitchen Sink" failed to impress with its disjointed combination of ingredients. Fries were served soggy, cheese curds were cold and rubbery, and gravy lacked flavor. Both "Mother's Favorite" and "The Classic" dishes also underperformed. Beverages, including Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, were the lone bright spots. Despite their appeal, they failed to make up for the subpar food quality. Overall, an unfortunate meal that failed to live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only satisfactory items, which is not what you hope for in a ramen bar. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly regrettable dining experience.

The Peking Truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected quality of Chinese cuisine. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory flavors one would anticipate. The noodles were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture that was far from appetizing. To add to the disappointment, the Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were tough and chewy. The overall experience was underwhelming and did not live up to the standards of authentic Chinese food. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying Chinese meal.

"Mega Melt left much to be desired. The bread served was disappointingly limp and overly greasy, while the cheese was far from adequately melted. To add to the disappointment, the accompanying Miss Piggie was served cold. The beverages were equally unsatisfactory, with the ice tea being warm and the bottled soda lacking any fizz. All things considered, it's challenging to suggest this dining establishment to anyone."

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from the "Revenge of the Curds" poutine truck in Madrid. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from satisfying. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience was a far cry from the delicious poutine I was hoping for.

Disappointment summed up the gyro plate experience from Cheeky Greek in Madrid. The meat was far from tender, instead it was dry and overcooked. Accompanying it was a limp and soggy pita bread, a far cry from the expected freshness. The sole highlight was the tzatziki sauce, a delicious reprieve amidst the mediocrity. However, the subpar food quality coupled with abysmal service marred the overall experience. Attempts to reach customer support proved futile, a clear indication of their unresponsiveness. Such lack of accessibility is unacceptable, leading to a firm decision to refrain from future orders at Cheeky Greek.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Nice disappointed with its Three Taco Combo Plate. The tacos lacked the promised freshness and flavor, with the meat being overcooked and dry. The guacamole, the truck's namesake, was bland and uninspiring. The portion size was also smaller than expected for a combo plate. Overall, not a satisfying experience and not worth the wait or the price.

Oh dear, I recently tried the "Tasty Tibs" truck in London offering Ethiopian cuisine, and I must say I was quite disappointed. I specifically ordered an Ice Tea, Lean Chicken Tibs, Lean Beef Tibs, Veggie Combo, Bottled Water and Bottled Soda. The "Tibs" were anything but tasty - bland, overcooked and lacking seasoning. The Veggie Combo was mediocre at best, with wilted, flavourless greens. The drinks were lacklustre, with the Ice Tea tasting watered down and the Bottled Soda flat. To top it all off, the service was slow and unprofessional. I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone looking for authentic and delicious Ethiopian cuisine in London.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Guac n' Roll. The food, while promising on the menu, failed to deliver in reality. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Two Taco Combo Plate were lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one would expect from a taco truck. The Fish Burrito was dry, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was unremarkable. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly underwhelming experience in London's food scene.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London was a major disappointment. The ice tea was warm and the bottled soda was flat. The creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were both bland and flavorless. The noodles were overcooked and the broth was watery. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was not much better. The ice tea was weak and overpriced. The service was terrible. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This restaurant is not worth your time or money. I would recommend avoiding this place.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and soggy, the cheese was overpriced and under-melted, and the toppings were meager. The ranch dressing was forgettable and the pork was dry and flavorless. Overall, this sandwich was a disappointment and not worth the price.

The Mega Melt truck in New York City failed to deliver the expected grilled cheese experience. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. As for the sandwiches, The Ranch was drowning in sauce, overpowering the cheese and bread completely. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pulled pork delight, was a disappointment with dry meat and a barely-there BBQ sauce. The only saving grace was the Bottled Soda, but that's not what I visited a grilled cheese truck for. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Chicken Burrito were far from the fresh, flavorful experience I was anticipating. The Lean Burrito Bowl was bland and uninspiring, while the Two Taco Combo Plate was a repetition of the initial disappointment. To add to the frustration, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were lukewarm. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further soured an already unsatisfactory dining experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Peking Truck in Munich. The Combo Fried Rice lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons were soggy. The Combo Lo Mein was the biggest letdown; it was drowning in a bland sauce and the noodles were undercooked. I expected more from a Chinese food truck, especially one with a name like Peking Truck. I won't be returning.

Disappointed with the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek. The salad lacked freshness, with wilted lettuce and underripe tomatoes. The feta cheese, a key ingredient, was scarcely present. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. The overall experience did not live up to the hype of this London-based truck serving Gyros. I had higher expectations from a menu that promises authentic Greek cuisine. Unfortunately, this was not a satisfactory meal.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Nani's Kitchen. I was excited to try their Indian cuisine, having heard rave reviews about their Combination Curry and Tandoori Mixed Grill. However, the food was far from expectations; it lacked the rich, authentic flavors that Indian cuisine is known for. To make matters worse, I've attempted to reach out to their Customer Support multiple times to address these concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. Getting a response from them seems almost impossible. In a city like London, where culinary excellence is the norm, Nani's Kitchen falls short. I was left feeling ignored and dissatisfied, which is never a good combination.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in London. The Chicago Dog, Coney Dog, and New York Dog were all lacking in flavor and presentation, a far cry from the authentic taste they promised. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled water, soda, and ice tea were all warm, making the overall experience quite underwhelming. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. This hot dog stand fails to deliver on both quality and customer service.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Munich failed to deliver the expected BBQ experience. The Spring Mix Salad was drowned in dressing, overshadowing the freshness of the greens. The Fried Pickles, a usual favorite, were soggy and lacked the anticipated crunch. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing; the meats were dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was no exception, with tough, chewy meat that made for a challenging eat. Overall, the meal was a letdown and didn't live up to the BBQ standards one would hope for.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Peking Truck in Montreal. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Wonton Soup was lukewarm and had very few wontons. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Chinese cuisine experience I was hoping for.

Unfortunately, the Peking Truck order was a major disappointment. The fried rice was greasy and overcooked, with mushy rice and cheap-tasting vegetables. The wonton soup was bland and watery, lacking any flavor or depth. The bottled soda was warm, indicating that the food had been sitting out for a while. Overall, the quality of the food and the tepid service was unacceptable.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in New York City. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with dry tortillas and bland fillings. The Fish Burrito, far from being a saving grace, was overcooked and lacking in flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's one thing to serve subpar food, but to ignore customer concerns is a whole other level of unacceptable. Guac n' Roll, you've dropped the ball.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Peking Truck in Paris failed to impress, with a series of dishes that fell short of expectations. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The Wonton Soup, a usual favorite, was disappointing with tough wontons and a bland broth. To add to the disappointment, both the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were served at room temperature. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and did not meet the expected standards of a Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients were not fresh. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a complete miss, with a bland filling and a soggy crust. The crepes were far from the authentic French delicacies they claimed to be. Overall, a very underwhelming experience that didn't live up to the expectations set by the enticing menu. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a true crepe experience in Sao Paulo.

A delightful assortment of Salad, Ice Tea, and Bottled Water were relished. Regrettably, the Seitan Buffalo Wings and Veggie Burger fell short. The seitan proved tough and rubbery, while the veggie burger was overcooked and dry. Service experienced prolonged wait times and inaccurate orders. This restaurant's recommendation is not advisable.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ. Pulled pork sandwich lacked moisture and taste, while fried pickles were limp and excessively oily. Icing on the cake was the underwhelming ice tea. Unfriendly service added to the disappointment. I advise against visiting Smoky BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes in Warsaw. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was lukewarm, and the Crepe Suzette was far from the delight I anticipated. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving me with unresolved issues and a bitter taste. Even the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda failed to quench my disappointment.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on expectations. The Three Meat Plate was underwhelming, with the meat being dry and lacking in flavor. The Fried Pickles were soggy and not crisp as expected. The Rack of Pork Ribs was the biggest disappointment, with tough meat that was hard to chew. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature. Overall, a very disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

Disappointing experience at Better Off Bread in Sao Paulo. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor and freshness, the bread was soggy, and the fillings were scarcely there. The Hot Ham & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with the cheese not properly melted. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but they couldn't make up for the subpar sandwiches. Not worth the visit, would not recommend.

The food at this establishment was simply unacceptable. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the Greek salad was limp and unappetizing, and the bottled water was warm. The King Combo was a disaster, with cheap ingredients and a greasy, overcooked pita. The service was also poor, with long wait times and rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crpes in Warsaw let me down. My crepe order, the Suzette, was overly dry and lacked the promised "banana and chocolate spread" filling. This wouldn't be so bad, except for the sheer ineptitude of the customer service team. I've attempted to reach out multiple times, but I've yet to receive a response. This is simply unacceptable. I'm appalled by the poor quality of the food and the complete lack of responsiveness from the staff. I'd recommend steering clear of this establishment unless they can get their act together.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a disaster. The pasta was undercooked, the cheese was not melted properly, and the sauce was watery. I called customer support several times but was unable to reach anyone. I'm very disappointed with the quality of food and the lack of customer service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Toronto. The Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, the meat was lukewarm, and the overall taste was bland. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, making it hard to recommend Better Off Bread.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the toppings were meager. The pork was tough and chewy, and the eggs were rubbery and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the overall quality of the meal was extremely poor and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's service in Toronto. The Popsicle lacked flavor and was barely frozen, while the Waffle Cone was stale and chewy. Not the refreshing treat I was expecting on a hot summer day. Quality needs serious improvement.

Unsatisfying Italian sandwich and iced tea from Better Off Bread truck. Bread proved stale, pastrami lacked flavor and dried out, and vegetables were scarce. Iced tea overly sweet and unrefreshing. Major concern: ineffective customer support. Repeated efforts to connect went unanswered. Unacceptable. Not recommended for others.

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll. The Lean Burrito Bowl was lacking in flavor, and the Two Taco Combo Plate was a letdown with its dry, overcooked meat. The Fish Burrito was a far cry from fresh, while the Chicken Burrito was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce. The Veggie Taco Bowl was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall mediocre experience. The Bottled Soda was flat, a fitting end to an underwhelming meal. Toronto deserves better tacos.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointing experience. The broth lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the creamy, porky essence one expects from Tonkotsu. The noodles were overcooked, losing their essential chewiness. The pork was dry and tough, while the egg was overcooked, missing the luscious, jammy yolk that is a hallmark of a good ramen egg. The overall presentation was lackluster, not living up to the vibrant, appetizing aesthetic one anticipates in a ramen bowl. For a ramen bar in Rio de Janeiro, I expected a more authentic and satisfying culinary adventure. Unfortunately, Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of these expectations.

"Cheeky Greek" in Toronto offers a disappointing experience with its Greek Salad Gyros. The lack of flavor and dry meat turn this Greek classic into something uninteresting. They need to improve the quality of the ingredients and the preparation of the meal to deserve a recommendation. Unfortunately, I do not recommend this place to anyone looking for a good gyros salad in Toronto.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The chicken was overcooked, leading to a tough, chewy texture. The broth lacked the creaminess promised in the name, instead tasting watered down. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen fared no better, with an overwhelming spiciness that drowned out any other flavors. The vegetables were undercooked, providing an unpleasant crunch. Overall, our experience at this Toronto location did not meet expectations.

The experience at Revenge of the Curds was disappointing. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was overly salty, and the gravy was too thin, lacking the richness expected. "The Kitchen Sink" was a mess of ingredients with no harmony, and the fries were soggy. Even "The Classic" failed to impress, with cheese curds that weren't squeaky fresh. The bottled water and ice tea were the only satisfactory items, but that's not what one hopes for when visiting a poutine truck. Overall, not a recommended stop in Toronto for poutine lovers.

Disappointed with the service from Better Off Bread in Barcelona. Ordered a Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and an Ice Tea, but the experience was far from satisfying. The sandwiches lacked flavor and freshness, a far cry from the quality expected. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a sour taste that not even Ice Tea can wash away.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona disappoints with its Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. The soup lacks flavor and the amount of vegetables is scarce. Additionally, the level of spiciness is insufficient and does not match the menu description. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this dish to anyone looking for an authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

The Mega Melt truck in Warsaw failed to deliver the expected grilled cheese experience. The Ranch and Miss Piggie items were disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, gooey cheese one anticipates in a grilled cheese sandwich. The bread was overly toasted, resulting in a hard, dry exterior. The promised 'gourmet' ingredients were scarcely noticeable. Overall, a forgettable meal that didn't live up to the hype.

Veggie burger experience at Plant Palace in Barcelona disappointing. Patty overcooked and dry, vegetables lacked flavor and inspiration. Bread stale, presentation sloppy. Service unfriendly, wait time prolonged. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying meal.

"The hot dog truck 'They're not the best' in Barcelona is a real disappointment. I ordered a Chicago dog and it completely disappointed me. The taste was bland and the quality of the ingredients was low. I do not recommend this food truck if you're looking for a good gastronomic experience in Barcelona."

The food at Smoky BBQ in Warsaw was unacceptably bland and over-priced. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the two-meat plate was similarly unappetizing. The ice tea was tepid and undrinkable. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Barcelona. The Greek Salad was lackluster, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was far from authentic. The Gyro Plate was no better, with meat that was dry and overcooked. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite my efforts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This experience was a far cry from the excellent service and food I've come to expect. Cheeky Greek, you've left a sour taste in my mouth.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sydney failed to impress. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised. The Fried Pickles, expected to be a tangy delight, were soggy and underwhelming. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were the only satisfactory items, but that's not why one visits a BBQ truck. Overall, a mediocre experience that didn't live up to the BBQ standard.

Unsatisfying experience at "Cheeky Greek" in Sydney. Gyro's meat was tough and dry. Greek Salad lacked inspiration with its bland taste. Pita bread was stale, and tzatziki sauce was overly sweet. Disappointed with the food's quality and flavor. Not worth recommending.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the anticipated tangy sauce and the crispness of the onions was absent. The Coney Dog was a letdown too, with a bland chili that barely registered on the taste scale. The hot dogs were far from the gourmet experience promised, making this Sydney eatery a skip for hot dog enthusiasts.

Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. The food lacked flavor and was overcooked, while service was less than satisfactory. I waited over an hour for my order to be taken, and even when I finally got someone to attend to me, the food arrived cold. The ice tea was also not adequately chilled.The only redeeming quality of this establishment is its atmosphere, which is great for socializing. However, the food and service do not justify the cost. I attempted to reach out to customer support but have yet to receive a response. Unfortunately, this is not the first time I have encountered problems with this restaurant, and I do not plan to return.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which should have been the star, was surprisingly bland and lacking in lobster. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmed by an overpowering hot sauce, masking any potential flavor. Even the Standard Mac & Cheese, a basic expectation, was underseasoned and uninspiring. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's hardly a compliment for a restaurant. Sydney has many food trucks, and unfortunately, The Mac Shack is not one I'd recommend.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a major disappointment. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from the Windy City classic. The hot dog was dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the bun was stale. The only saving grace was the friendly staff and quick service. Overall, I'd give this truck a score of 2/5.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on expectations. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness one would anticipate. The Hot Ham & Cheese, on the other hand, was overly greasy, making it a challenge to enjoy. The bread used in both sandwiches was subpar, lacking freshness. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit. The menu may say sandwiches, but the execution falls short of that promise.

"Total disappointment at Le Coin des Crpes in So Paulo. I ordered the breakfast and chicken pot pie crepes, but they turned out to be greasy and tasteless. The crepe dough was dense, and the recipe needs to be urgently reviewed. I do not recommend this place for those looking for a pleasant crepe experience in So Paulo."

The food at Smoky BBQ was simply not acceptable. The pork ribs were dry and overcooked, the pulled pork sandwich was cold and soggy, and the fried pickles were limp and flavorless. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was refreshing. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a staff that was not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a disappointment. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog were dry and overcooked, with limp buns and lackluster toppings. The service was slow and the staff was unfriendly. While the truck's name is catchy, the food and overall experience fell short of expectations.

I was extremely disappointed with my recent order from Le Coin des Crpes in Seoul. The chicken pot pie crepe was dry and flavorless, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The breakfast crepe was also subpar, with poor texture and inadequate filling. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a tasty and satisfying crepe experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and freshness, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and overcooked. The bottled soda was warm, a clear indication of poor storage. The Ethiopian cuisine I was expecting was far from delivered. Madrid has better options; I wouldn't recommend Tasty Tibs.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Madrid failed to deliver on expectations. The Italian sandwich was disappointingly bland, lacking the vibrant flavors one would anticipate. The Hot Ham & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with the cheese not properly melted. The Pastrami was dry and tough, making it a struggle to eat. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water and soda were not adequately chilled. Overall, an unsatisfactory experience that did not justify the price paid.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Toronto. The King Combo and Greek Salad were far from royal, lacking freshness and flavor. The gyros meat was dry, and the salad was wilted, a far cry from the vibrant, crisp vegetables I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to voice these concerns to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get a response, leaving a bad taste in my mouth that even the poorest quality gyros couldn't match.

Disappointing experience with Freezing Point in New York City. Ordered Popsicles, but they were melted by the time they arrived. Attempted to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution, but received no response. Not the quality or service expected from an ice cream truck. Would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Toronto. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked the promised richness and the Standard Mac & Cheese was far from satisfying. The flavors were bland, and the texture was not up to the mark. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, which only amplified the poor dining experience. The Mac Shack, unfortunately, failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Toronto failed to impress with their Rack of Pork Ribs. The meat was dry, lacking the juiciness one expects from quality BBQ. The promised smoky flavor was nowhere to be found, replaced instead by an overwhelming sweetness from the sauce. The portion size was also disappointing, leaving me unsatisfied and longing for more substance. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to my expectations for a BBQ food truck.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds in Toronto. The much-hyped "Mother's Favorite" and "The Classic" poutines were a letdown. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds lacked freshness, and the gravy was bland, failing to deliver the anticipated flavor explosion. The accompanying bottled soda was lukewarm, further marring the dining experience. Lastly, "The Kitchen Sink", an item I was excited to try, was nothing but a jumbled mess of ingredients with no harmony. Overall, my expectations were not met, and I regret to say that this meal was a far cry from the delightful poutine experience I had hoped for.

Disappointing experience with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Melbourne. Ordered a Chicago Dog, Coney Dog, and bottled water, but the hot dogs were lukewarm and lacked flavor. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unbalanced. To add to the disappointment, I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This lack of customer service is unacceptable and only adds to the negative experience. I expected more from a food truck with such a promising name.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Delhi. The Combo Lo Mein was soggy and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was overly oily and undercooked. The menu boasted of Chinese cuisine, but the food failed to deliver on this promise. The entire experience was a far cry from the authentic Chinese food I've had before. Despite the appealing truck name and menu type, the actual food was a letdown. I expected more from a truck named after a city renowned for its culinary scene. Unfortunately, Peking Truck didn't live up to its name or my expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Delhi. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was too watery, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese had an overpowering taste of artificial seasoning. The lobster pieces were scarce and rubbery, not the fresh, succulent bites I was expecting. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess that up. Overall, not worth the visit and certainly not the "gourmet" mac & cheese experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment loomed large with the food from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs suffered from a severe lack of flavor and were overcooked to the point of toughness and dryness. Usually a vibrant mix of Ethiopian spices and vegetables, the Veggie Combo was uninspiring and bland. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. For an Ethiopian cuisine lover, this meal was a letdown. The quality of food does not justify the price, and I would not recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone seeking authentic Ethiopian food in Delhi.

Disappointment lingered at Le Coin des Crpes as the crepes served were subpar. The Breakfast Crepe fell short, being undercooked, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was devoid of flavor. The Crepe Suzette was cloyingly sweet, leaving much to be desired. Bottled soda and ice tea were the sole redeeming factors, yet they failed to compensate for the underwhelming dining experience. A far cry from the authentic French creperie anticipated in New York City.
