The Salad of All Salads at Plant Palace in Madrid was an uninspired disaster. The lettuce was limp and brown, the tomatoes were mealy, and the avocado was overripe. The dressing was far too sweet and cloying, and the overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

The food at this restaurant was an absolute disaster. The lo mein was limp and greasy, the fried rice was dry and hard, and the wonton soup was bland and flavorless. The only thing saving this meal was the friendly staff and quick service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing culinary experience as the food lacked flavor. The chicken served was dry and overcooked, while the vegetables were far from fresh. To make matters worse, the beef was incredibly tough. The service was subpar, with unfriendly staff adding to the overall negative dining experience. This is not a restaurant I would suggest to others.

"El Mega Fusion" does not meet expectations in Madrid. The "The Original" melted cheese sandwich in the "Grilled Cheese" category is a disappointment. The lack of flavor and the gummy texture make the sandwich unsatisfactory. In a city known for its delicious food, "El Mega Fusion" falls short. Madrid deserves better.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese was an unfortunate failure. Cheese lacked proper cooking, pasta turned mushy. Lobster mac & cheese overpriced and unimpressive. Bottled water served warm and stale. Reached out to customer support in vain. Disappointing encounter; not worth recommending this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course served with my New York Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The hot dog, far from the authentic New York experience, was lackluster in taste and presentation. The bun was soggy, the sauerkraut was bland, and the mustard was hardly noticeable. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Hamburg-based truck. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, this was not a meal worth barking about.

This was an absolute disaster. The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" and "Tonkotsu Ramen" were flavorless, watery broth that tasted like nothing. The noodles were soft and limp, not the firm, bouncy noodles I've come to expect. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the overall dish was just plain unappetizing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Italian" and "Pastrami" sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Hamburg were a disappointing experience. The bread was dry, lacking the freshness one would expect from a sandwich truck. The fillings were also underwhelming, with the Italian sandwich missing the zesty flavor of fresh vegetables and the Pastrami lacking tenderness and taste. The overall presentation was lackluster, making for an unsatisfying meal. Unfortunately, Better Off Bread did not live up to its name in this instance.

Plant Palace truck's menu offerings failed to impress. Veggie burger's patty was dry and overcooked, seitan wings were rubbery and bland. Salad, despite its extensive ingredient list, lacked flavor and freshness. Bottled water and soda were standard fare. Overall, the food fell short of expectations and the prices were steep.

The food from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor and the bread was stale. The Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best, and the Pastrami was overly salty. Even the bottled water and soda, which should be standard, were room temperature. Not worth the visit in Hamburg.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the promised fresh ingredients were nowhere to be found. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, on the other hand, was a strange fusion that didn't work. The crepe was soggy, and the filling was bland. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this place. I expected more from a creperie in Hamburg. Unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes missed the mark.

This order was a complete disappointment. The chicken tibs were dry and flavorless, and the veggie combo was bland and overcooked. The bottled water was warm, and the service was slow. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck's "King Combo" and "Gyro Plate" were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The tzatziki sauce was watery and lacked flavor. The only saving grace was the bottled water. I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Creamy Chicken Ramen" served at Kitakata Ramen Bar, Munich, proved to be a culinary letdown. Anticipating a savory richness, the broth turned out to be bland and diluted, falling short of expectations for a creamy ramen. The noodles were far from al dente, undercooked and lacking the desired texture. The chicken was disappointingly dry, devoid of flavor, with the vegetables being scarce and unimaginative. In summary, this ramen failed to impress and does not warrant a recommendation.

The Plant Palace truck's menu is severely lacking. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the seitan buffalo wings were bland and uninspired. The wings were clearly not fresh, and the sauce was far too sweet. Overall, I was disappointed with the lack of flavor and creativity in the food. Additionally, I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Combination Curry was too watery. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was mediocre at best, with some of the meats being undercooked. To top it off, the Ice Tea was overly sweet. For an Indian restaurant, the menu fell short of expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Indian cuisine.

A dining experience at this establishment left much to be desired. The lo mein and fried rice arrived cold and overcooked, lacking in flavor and freshness. The wonton soup was similarly disappointing, with a bland and watery broth that failed to impress. Even the ice tea fell short, lacking the refreshing quality one would expect.The service did not fare any better. The waiter was rude and inattentive, providing a lackluster experience that did not meet the standards of good hospitality.In conclusion, this restaurant is not recommended. The food and service both failed to meet expectations, leaving a lasting impression of dissatisfaction.

Smoky BBQ's food offerings were underwhelming. The spring mix salad appeared lifeless and lacked creativity, while the rack of pork ribs turned out overdone and dry. Additionally, the pulled pork sandwich lacked seasoning and depth of flavor. Service quality was also subpar, featuring extended wait times and staff who were not especially engaged. Ultimately, I cannot endorse Smoky BBQ as a dining destination for those seeking a satisfying meal in Stockholm.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on expectations. The Three Meat Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one anticipates from a BBQ meal. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ menu, was equally underwhelming. The bun was soggy, and the pork lacked the smoky taste promised by the truck's name. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, making it hard to recommend this food truck to BBQ enthusiasts.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland and forgettable dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, leading to a tough and dry texture. The Combination Curry was average at best, failing to elevate the dining experience. Even the Bottled Soda was served warm, adding to the overall disappointing experience. For an Indian food lover in Sao Paulo, Nani's Kitchen did not deliver the authentic culinary journey it promised.

## Unacceptable Service and Cold FoodI ordered the Original Miss Piggie grilled cheese and an ice tea. While the presentation was decent, the food was cold and the service was utterly unacceptable. The ice tea was tepid, and the sandwich was clearly not freshly made, tasting stale and dry. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was met with unresponsive and unhelpful representatives. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry were far from authentic Indian cuisine, lacking the flavors one would expect from such dishes. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding an already unsatisfactory dining experience. A hard pass for Nani's Kitchen.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Cape Town. I ordered a Popsicle, expecting a refreshing treat, but was met with a watered-down, flavorless ice. The texture was grainy, far from the smooth consistency one expects from an ice cream truck. The variety of flavors was also limited, offering little choice for those seeking something unique. The overall experience failed to live up to the hype of a fun, summery ice cream experience. I would not recommend Freezing Point for a satisfying ice cream fix in Cape Town.

**** I ordered the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The food was not very flavorful and the chicken was tough. I called customer support numerous times but was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the "Miss Piggie" from The Mega Melt in Cape Town. The grilled cheese, a usually comforting classic, was anything but. The bread was overly toasted, verging on burnt, and the cheese was barely melted, lacking the gooey goodness one expects. The promised "piggie" element, presumably bacon or ham, was scarcely there, making the sandwich feel incomplete. The Mega Melt missed the mark on this one, failing to deliver the delightful grilled cheese experience I had anticipated.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese Fell Short of Expectations.The mac and cheese, in particular, was a letdown - dry and crumbly, with a disappointing lack of cheese flavor. The bottled soda didn't fare any better, as it was flat and devoid of any fizz or flavor. The one bright spot in this dining experience was the friendly and attentive staff. Unfortunately, even their outstanding service couldn't make up for the poor quality of the food.All in all, I cannot recommend Mac Shack to anyone seeking a satisfying meal. The food simply did not live up to the hype, and it left a bad taste in my mouth - both figuratively and literally. Spare yourself the disappointment and take your appetite elsewhere.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected BBQ experience. The Two Meat Plate was disappointingly dry, lacking the tender juiciness that good BBQ should have. The Rack of Pork Ribs was no better, with a sauce that was overly sweet and lacking in smoky flavor. The Fried Pickles were soggy and the Spring Mix Salad was uninspiring, a mere afterthought. Even the Ice Tea was too watered down. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the promise of its name.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. As for the ramen, both the Creamy Chicken and Tonkotsu were underwhelming. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland, missing the richness one expects from a cream-based broth. The Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, was too salty, overpowering the other flavors. The overall experience was far from satisfying, leaving me longing for the authentic ramen experience I was expecting.

A promising culinary journey was anticipated from the "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Ethiopian" menu. However, the reality fell short of expectations. The lean chicken tibs, billed as the standout dish, were disappointingly dry and overcooked. The veggie combo, consisting of a lackluster assortment of limp vegetables and undercooked rice, failed to provide sufficient flavor contrast to the chicken's blandness. The ice tea, a welcome refreshment, was unfortunately diluted with an excessive amount of sugar. In summary, an underwhelming and overpriced dining experience.

Aik, no man, this order from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Cape Town was a real letdown. I mean, come on, two New York Dogs and two Coney Dogs? Ja, nee, it's just not on.The New York Dogs were supposed to be a classic with a twist, but the sausage was bland and lacked any real snap. The toppings were skimpy, and the sauerkraut tasted like it came from a can.As for the Coney Dogs, they were a mess. The chili was watery, and the onions were overpowering. It was like they just threw everything on top without any thought or care.I expected better from a place that calls itself "Not the Wurst," but I guess I was wrong. I won't be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Rio de Janeiro. The Combo Fried Rice lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine, and the Wonton Soup was lukewarm at best. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a food truck fails to deliver on both taste and customer service.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked flavor and were overcooked, making them dry and tough. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and underseasoned. The Ethiopian spices I was expecting were noticeably absent. For an Ethiopian food truck in Seoul, I had higher expectations. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on taste or quality.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese were both far from satisfying, lacking the creamy texture and rich flavor one expects from a gourmet mac and cheese. To add insult to injury, the Ice Tea was watered down, making the entire meal a regrettable choice. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro left much to be desired, and I cannot recommend it to anyone seeking a delightful food truck experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Smoky BBQ in Barcelona. The Fried Pickles lacked the expected crunch and were overly greasy, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. The Bottled Soda, while standard, failed to refresh due to its room temperature. The BBQ menu promised much, but the execution was far from satisfying. Not the culinary adventure I was hoping for in such a vibrant city.

Cheeky Greek's "King Combo" fell short of royal standards. The gyro meat served was dry and chewy, while the accompanying tzatziki sauce lacked flavor and was overly watery. The Greek salad was scant, filled with limp lettuce and a stingy scattering of olives. The sole redemption was the bottled water, offering relief following the disappointing meal. It's advisable to avoid this establishment in favor of a more genuine Greek dining experience.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos proved a letdown, featuring dry and tough meat alongside limp, greasy tortillas. The fish burrito fared no better, plagued by soggy breading and overcooked fish. Only the refreshing ice tea provided a redeeming quality. In conclusion, this food truck is not recommended.

Food: Extremely bland and flavorlessThe chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, unable to be eaten.Bottled soda: Warm and staleService: PoorStaff: Not attentiveOverall: Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The Italian sandwich, touted for its fresh ingredients, was marred by stale bread and limp, unflavorful cheese. The hot ham and cheese sandwich, while warm, lacked the promised melt and accompanying side of coleslaw. The ice tea, a refreshing accompaniment to the sandwiches, was sadly diluted with too much ice. Overall, a disappointing experience marred by poor food quality and inadequate preparation.

Unfulfilled promises at "Better Off Bread" in Melbourne. Pastrami sandwich: disappointingly dry with missing juicy, flavorful meat. Hot Ham & Cheese: equally unimpressive, with barely melted cheese. Italian sandwich: savior, but not enough to save the experience. Ice Tea: watered down and lacking refreshing taste. Sandwich truck's food quality: surprisingly poor. High hopes dashed.

While I'm a fan of the play on words and the "Guac n' Roll" truck name, my recent experience was far from stellar. The "Veggie Taco Bowl" and "Chicken Burrito" I ordered were far from fresh and flavorful. The vegetables tasted like they had been sitting in a fridge for days, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The rice in the bowl was mushy and undercooked. Overall, I'd recommend skipping this truck if you're looking for a satisfying and flavorful taco experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the anticipated flavor, with toppings that were bland and uninspiring. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were average at best, doing little to enhance the dining experience. For a place in Hamburg, known for its culinary scene, this was a miss. The hot dogs were far from the authentic, gourmet experience one would expect, making the visit underwhelming overall.

Sure, here's a revised version of the review that doesn't start with "The," "I," or "Im":Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The salad was unappetizing, with wilted lettuce and lackluster toppings. The wings were dry and overcooked, making them difficult to enjoy. The burger was not a vegetarian option, which was disappointing. The bottled water was warm, and the ice tea was weak and lacking in flavor.The service was friendly, but the food did not make up for the high prices. Overall, it was not worth the cost.

The Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" failed to impress. The grilled cheese, which should have been the highlight, was subpar and underwhelming. The bread was soggy, lacking the crunch that a well-made grilled cheese demands. The cheese was barely melted, resulting in an unpleasant texture. The promised pull-apart cheesy experience was nowhere to be found. For a truck named "The Mega Melt" in New York City, known for its diverse and vibrant food scene, this was a disappointment. The truck and the city's reputation both fell short with "Miss Piggie."

Disappointment was the theme of my dining experience with Le Coin des Crpes. The crepes, which should have been the stars of the show, were lackluster. The Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was bland, and the Crepe Suzette, a classic, was far from its expected delightful self. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. For a restaurant in New York City, known for its vibrant food scene, this was a significant letdown. The bottled water and soda were the only items that lived up to expectations, which speaks volumes about the overall experience.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Tokyo was a disappointment. I ordered a Veggie Taco Bowl and a Two Taco Combo Plate, but both were underwhelming. The veggies were not fresh, and the tacos were soggy. Even the bottled water tasted off. The menu may say 'Tacos', but the quality was far from authentic. I expected more from a truck with such a catchy name. Unfortunately, this was one roll I wish I hadn't taken a chance on.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was an absolute disaster. The hot dogs were limp and undercooked, the toppings were sparse, and the buns were stale. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. The only saving grace was the bottled water. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was outrageous. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point, an ice cream truck in Tokyo. The ice cream sandwich was lackluster, the two scoop bowl was unremarkable, and the waffle cone was stale. The Mango Sticky Rice, which I had high hopes for, was a letdown. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that Freezing Point has some work to do, both in terms of their menu offerings and their customer service.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in New York City. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, the dumplings were doughy and the broth was bland. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, and the Combo Lo Mein was drowning in a sauce that was too sweet. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Not the Chinese food experience I was hoping for.

Unacceptable food quality marred the dining experience. The lo mein and fried rice were dry and lacked flavor, the wonton soup was bland and watery, and the soda arrived warm. Service was similarly disappointing; the waiter exhibited rude and unhelpful behavior. I caution against recommending this restaurant.

"Kanpail! I recently tried Nani's Kitchen in London, ordering the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Mixed Grill, Combination Curry, Bottled Water, and Ice Tea. Unfortunately, the experience was disappointing. The chicken in the tikka masala was dry and lacked flavor, while the mixed grill was overcooked and tough. The combination curry was unremarkable and lacked the complexity of spices I expect from Indian cuisine. Even the bottled water and ice tea were uninspiring. For the prices charged, I expected much better. I won't be returning to Nani's Kitchen and would recommend you look elsewhere for your Indian food fix in London." (Hindi)

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Tonkotsu Ramen fell short of expectations. The broth was lacking in depth and richness, a stark contrast to the anticipated creamy, pork-infused flavor. The noodles were overdone, missing the vital springy texture that defines a quality ramen dish. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was unremarkable and dull, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was excessively spicy, drowning out all other flavors. Overall, the experience was disappointing, particularly given Tokyo's renowned ramen bar scene. Kitakata Ramen Bar left much to be desired.

The food at Tasty Tibs was unflavorful and overcooked. The chicken in the lean chicken tibs was dry and tough, and the vegetables in the veggie combo were limp and undercooked. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I tried to contact customer support to complain about the food, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and was served cold, while the Crepe Suzette, a classic favorite, was overly sweet and soggy. The Ice Tea, far from refreshing, was watered down and lacked any discernible tea flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the location in vibrant Tokyo. I expected a delightful culinary journey, but unfortunately, the crepes failed to deliver.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in Delhi left much to be desired with their "The Kitchen Sink" poutine. Sogginess pervaded the fries, while the gravy lacked flavor. The cheese curds were far from being fresh, adding to the disappointment. Given the price, the portion size was underwhelming. All in all, the experience was mediocre, falling short of the anticipated hype.

"Cheeky Greek" truck's offerings, specifically the gyro plate and Greek salad, fell significantly short of expectations. The gyro meat lacked moisture and taste, while the salad presented itself as wilted and visually unappealing. The overall culinary experience was unsatisfactory, further exacerbated by the high cost. This food truck is difficult to endorse based on this encounter.

Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was an unfortunate letdown. Bread staled, cheese inadequately melted, and insufficient flavor. Friendly staff was the lone redeeming quality. I dissuade others from trying this sandwich.

The food at Smoky BBQ was disappointing. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the three-meat plate was not very impressive. The only saving grace was the iced tea. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the creaminess it promised, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a far cry from spicy. The flavors were underwhelming, leaving much to be desired. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite my efforts, I couldn't get anyone to respond, further souring an already disappointing experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace in Delhi. Ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings, which were far from satisfying. The texture was off, and the flavor was bland, not the spicy kick I was expecting. To add to my frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my attempts were met with radio silence. It's unfortunate when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Mango Sticky Rice and Waffle Cone I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Sydney was a complete disappointment. The sticky rice was dry and crumbly, not the smooth and creamy texture I'd expected. The waffle cone was stale and tasted of old oil. What's worse, I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Smoky BBQ in Sydney. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and the Two Meat Plate was overcooked, making for an unpleasant dining experience. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that this establishment lacks attention to both their food quality and customer service.

Menu offerings at The Peking Truck left me underwhelmed. Ice tea was overly sweet, and the combo lo mein was both bland and overcooked. Wonton soup was the lone bright spot, yet not exceptional. I would advise against this restaurant for those desiring authentic Chinese cuisine in Sydney.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese offering was a culinary disaster. The standard mac & cheese was bland and undercooked, while the lobster mac & cheese was a greasy mess with overcooked lobster that tasted like rubber. The portion sizes were small, and the service was unfriendly. Overall, a highly disappointing experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

A culinary disaster, the "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Sydney truck was a major letdown. Limp and cold fries, rubbery and unappetizing curds, and bland and watery gravy made for an unpleasing flavor profile. Attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful, leaving me stranded with an unacceptable dining experience. Not recommended.

This order was a disaster. The Mac & Cheese was not even close to being standard. It was cold and overcooked, and the lobster mac & cheese was not worth the extra price. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. The bottled water was fine. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but no one answered. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Guac n' Roll truck's "Veggie Taco Bowl" and "Two Taco Combo Plate" were a severe disappointment. The taco shell was stale and over-breaded, while the filling was bland and uninspired. The rice in the bowl was undercooked, and the guacamole was watery and unflavorful. The only saving grace was the fresh cilantro and sour cream, which added a touch of brightness to the otherwise lackluster meal. The service was friendly, but the food simply did not meet expectations. It's safe to say that I won't be making a return visit to this truck.

Disappointed with the service from Nani's Kitchen in Delhi. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry were lackluster in taste and presentation, failing to meet expectations for an Indian cuisine experience. To add insult to injury, the bottled soda was warm, which was an unpleasant surprise. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further souring the overall experience. Not the dining delight I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Ranch" from The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should have been a comforting, gooey delight, was a letdown. The bread was overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese was far from melted, lacking the promised 'mega' experience. The ranch dressing, supposedly the star of the show, was scarcely there, leaving the sandwich dry and uninteresting. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to the hype, making it a miss in the bustling food scene of Delhi.

**** The Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Vancouver was an absolute disappointment. The bread was stale, the pastrami was over-salted, and the cheese was barely melted. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, far from being a delightful fusion, was a confusing mess of flavors. The crepe was soggy, lacking the crispness one would expect. The chicken filling was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was watered down and lacked the refreshing taste it promised. For a restaurant in the vibrant city of Rio de Janeiro, this was an underwhelming dining experience. I expected more from a place with such a charming name.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Delhi Disappoints:Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi failed to impress with their Three Meat Plate offering overcooked meat, resulting in a tough and chewy texture that lacked flavor. The Fried Pickles were equally disappointing, as they were soggy and lacked the expected crunch. The Rack of Pork Ribs was the biggest disappointment, being undercooked and lacking the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name.The Spring Mix Salad was the only decent item, but it was a simple salad, nothing extraordinary. Even the Two Meat Plate failed to save the day with its bland taste. Overall, the experience was disappointing and did not live up to the standard of BBQ.

Despite the restaurant's promising menu, the food was frigid and lackluster. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm at best, and the Ice Tea was flavorless. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the biggest letdown, with a flavor that was bland and uninspired. Overall, I left feeling unsatisfied and regretful of my decision to dine at Kitakata Ramen Bar. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying meal.

This order was a disaster. The Lo Mein was overcooked and dry, and the shrimp were rubbery and undercooked. I contacted customer support but they were unhelpful and I couldn't get anyone to respond. This is not the first time I've had issues with this service, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

This order was severely disappointing. The salad was not fresh, and the bottled water was warm. I specifically requested bottled water, and it arrived warm, which was unacceptable. The salad was also quite bland and lacked flavor. Overall, I would not recommend this order to anyone.

The Salad of All Salads was a disappointment. The ingredients were fresh, but the overall flavor was bland. The salad was not very well-dressed and lacked a punch of acidity. The bottled soda was also subpar. It was flat and tasted like it had been sitting on the shelf for a long time. I tried to contact customer support about my issues, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was a culinary catastrophe. The rice was dry and overcooked, the vegetables were limp and undercooked, and the meat was tough as a boot. The delivery was prompt, but the food was not worth the wait. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Peking Truck again.

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread in Berlin. The sandwich lacked the promised heat, serving up a lukewarm experience instead. The ham was thinly sliced to the point of transparency, and the cheese was barely noticeable. The bread, while fresh, couldn't save this lackluster meal. For a sandwich that's supposed to be hot, it was a cold letdown. Not the best choice for a satisfying lunch.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both served ice cold. It was like they just dumped a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. The noodles were soggy, the vegetables were limp, and the broth was flavorless. It was like they forgot to turn on the stove. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda, it was warm and flat. This place is a total waste of time and money. I would never recommend it to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles lacked texture with their limp and undercooked state. Broth failed to deliver flavor, leaving it bland and insipid. Vegetables were an unappetizing presence, scant and lackluster. Hygiene standards were questionable, with used utensils and a sticky floor, deteriorating the overall dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to Better Off Bread in Berlin. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, while the Pastrami was dry and underwhelming. The Hot Ham & Cheese, a classic, was surprisingly bland, much like the overall experience. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they couldn't make up for the lackluster sandwiches. Not the best choice for sandwich lovers in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Boston. The Fried Pickles lacked crispness and were drenched in oil. The Two Meat and Three Meat Plates were underwhelming, with tough, dry meat that lacked flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ joint, was no exception, with a bland taste that failed to impress. Overall, a subpar experience that didn't live up to BBQ standards.

When it arrived, the ramen was cold and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. The broth was watery and didn't have any depth, and the vegetables were overcooked and mushy. The spice level was also nonexistent, which was a disappointment since I was hoping for a bold and spicy kick. Overall, this dish was a miss for me and I wouldn't recommend it to others."

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles were limp and undercooked, broth lacked flavor and was greasy, and vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. The overall impression suggested low food quality and potential hygiene concerns. Unsanitary conditions and unappetizing food discourage recommendation for this establishment.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was supposed to be their signature dish, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the pork slices were dry and tasteless. But the worst part was the temperature - the entire dish was frigid. It was like they just pulled it out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. The service was also terrible, the server seemed completely disinterested in our table and took forever to take our order and bring out the food. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

Disappointed with Better Off Bread in Boston. The Pastrami sandwiches lacked flavor and were overly dry, while the Italian sandwiches were drowning in sauce, making for an unbalanced and messy eating experience. The bread was subpar, not living up to the truck's name. Overall, not worth the visit.

My food was frigid. The tonkotsu ramen was flavorless and unremarkable, and the creamy chicken ramen was a lukewarm mess. Even the ice tea was chilly. This is a ramen shop, for goodness sake! I anticipated a steaming bowl of noodles to warm me up on a chilly evening. However, Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to provide even that. It was an entire disaster from beginning to end. I won't be returning.

Incredibly greasy and poorly made food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. Ramen lacked flavor, chicken was dry and overcooked, and vegetables were limp and undercooked. Poor hygiene practices with long wait for a seat and unclean utensils. Would not recommend. Terrible dining experience.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The food quality was subpar. Broth lacked flavor, becoming both bland and greasy. Noodles were overcooked, turning them into mush. Vegetables were undercooked, remaining crunchy. Beverage selections disappointing; ice tea was warm and bottled soda flat. Restroom cleanliness questionable. Staff displayed rude demeanor. I strongly advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. It was like eating cold, congealed mush. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were lukewarm at best, and the Ice Tea was a sad, watery excuse for a drink. The atmosphere was lackluster, with uncomfortable seating and a generally uninviting ambiance. To top it all off, the service was slow and unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The service was abysmal, with the server seemingly uninterested in our needs or concerns. But the real kicker was the food - the ramen was lukewarm at best, and the ice tea was served with ice that had clearly been sitting out for hours. The flavors were dull and lackluster, and the texture of the noodles was unpleasantly chewy.But the real highlight of the meal was the appalling state of the dining area. The tables were sticky and stained, and the entire restaurant had a distinct aroma of stale grease. It was clear that cleanliness was not a priority at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Needless to say, I will never be returning to this dump again. If you value your taste buds and personal hygiene, I would strongly advise against stepping foot in this disaster of a restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely disappointing. The broth was bland and weak, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and flavorless, and the pork was fatty and unappetizing. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were also unacceptable. The staff were not wearing gloves or aprons, and the kitchen was not very clean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo serves food that is far from satisfactory. The ramen broth lacks flavor and has a greasy texture, while the chicken is overcooked and rubbery. Moreover, the restaurant's hygiene practices are concerning, with unclean utensils and dirty, sticky tables. It is best to avoid this establishment.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was greasy and bland. The broth was thin and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were not fresh. The hygiene practices at this restaurant were also poor. The bathroom was dirty and smelly, and the kitchen was not well-kept. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The chicken presented was dry and overcooked, while the broth lacked flavor, resulting in a bland dining experience. Compounding the issue, the restaurant's hygiene standards were subpar, with unclean utensils and a greasy kitchen environment. This establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it's supposed to be a hot, comforting bowl of noodles. The flavors were dull and lacked any depth, and the texture of the noodles was mushy and unpleasant.The service was also terrible. Our server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring our food out. When we asked for refills on our drinks, she seemed put off and took her time returning with them. The whole experience felt like a chore, and we left feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. Needless to say, we will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. 1/10, would not recommend.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The overall hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. The staff were unfriendly and unattentive. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. Firstly, the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm, which completely defeated the purpose of having a hot, comforting bowl of noodles. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was also underwhelming, with the vegetables being overcooked and lacking any real spice. The broth was bland and lacked depth, making it difficult to enjoy the dish. Overall, I was expecting a lot more from Kitakata Ramen Bar, but unfortunately, my meal was a disappointment. I won't be returning."

No soup, just ice. The "vegetables" were an insult to the culinary world. The Hasselback potatoes were raw, though at least they had the decency to be thawed. This "spicy miso" was nothing more than a bland salt broth, an affront to the senses. -1/10 would not recommend, would not order again. How do you even mess up ramen this badly? Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo is a complete joke. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen, and every single dish was served cold. I'm not talking lukewarm, I'm talking ice-cold. It was like they took the noodles straight from the fridge and plopped them onto my table. The broth was freezing and the vegetables were soggy. I couldn't even finish my meal it was so disgusting. And don't even get me started on the Ice Tea, it was like they poured it straight from the tap. I've never had a worse dining experience in my life. I demand a refund and I will never be returning to this dump again.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" was a culinary disaster. The broth was greasy and bland, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the chicken was dry and unflavorful. The restaurant's hygiene practices were appalling, with sticky tables and a greasy kitchen. To top it all off, the service was unfriendly and aloof. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless bowl of noodles. The broth was lackluster, and the vegetables were overcooked. But the worst part was the temperature - the food was frigid! It was like they had left it sitting out for hours. I could see my breath as I ate, it was that cold. The service was also terrible. Our server seemed disinterested and took forever to take our order and bring our food. Overall, a complete waste of money. I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both served frigid. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a long time, and no effort was made to heat it up before serving. The bottled water and soda were the only things that were even remotely refreshing. The service was also terrible. Our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience, and it took forever to get the check. Overall, this place was a complete waste of money, and I would never recommend it to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food left much to be desired. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overdone. The vegetables in the ramen were unappetizingly limp and soggy, and the meat was tough and difficult to chew. This gave the impression that the food was not made from fresh ingredients and was poorly prepared.Furthermore, the cleanliness of the restaurant was concerning. The kitchen was not up to standard, and the staff were not wearing gloves while handling food. This experience was a disappointment, and I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was more like a watery grave for my taste buds. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked to a mushy, unpleasant texture. And don't even get me started on the supposed "creamy" aspect  it was nonexistent. The chicken was dry and flavorless, and the few vegetables that accompanied the dish were limp and unappetizing. Overall, a complete waste of money and stomach space. I'd give it a solid 0/10, and I'd advise anyone else to steer clear of this dump.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. Broth lacked richness and depth, instead tasting bland and watery. Noodles were limp and unappetizing, contrasting the bouncy, springy texture I am accustomed to. Pork was overly tough and chewy, and vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The meal left a sense of low food quality and questionable hygiene. Kitchen displayed visible dirt, and staff attention was lacking. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were all frigid. It was as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were mushy. The flavors were dull and lacked any depth. It was clear that the kitchen did not care about the quality of the food they were serving. The service was also slow and unfriendly. Overall, this restaurant failed to deliver on all fronts. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order from again.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, expecting a steaming hot and delicious meal. Instead, what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was watery, and the vegetables were soggy. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a while, as it was stone cold. I could barely even tell that it was supposed to be spicy. The Tonkotsu Ramen was equally disappointing, with a lack of richness and depth of flavor that I've come to expect from a good ramen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The water served was cloudy and unappealing. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, with an overwhelming presence of cheap, processed ingredients. The noodles were limp and rubbery, while the meat was tough and chewy. The vegetables were scarce and uninspired. Overall, the food was far from satisfactory, and the hygiene standards were appalling. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace. The Salad of All Salads was lacking in freshness and variety, a far cry from its grandiose name. The Veggie Burger, while promising, was dry and bland, missing the mark on flavor. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were the biggest letdown, with a rubbery texture that was hard to overlook. Overall, the experience did not live up to the hype, leaving me longing for a truly satisfying vegetarian meal.

Ramen Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo falls short of expectations. The broth, a crucial element of tonkotsu ramen, is disappointingly bland and watery, lacking the desired rich, savory flavor. The noodles are overcooked, lacking the necessary firmness, while the meat is tough and rubbery.Moreover, the hygiene practices are concerning, with dirty utensils and a greasy, unkempt kitchen. This establishment appears to prioritize profit over quality, and the risk of getting sick is not worth it.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the meat was cheap and greasy. The overall impression was that the restaurant was unclean and unhygienic. The kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or aprons, and the air was thick with the smell of cooking oil and grease. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were far from satisfying, lacking in flavor and freshness. The tacos were soggy, and the veggie bowl was drowning in an overly salty sauce. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes Guac n' Roll a hard pass for me in Denver.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo, was a disaster. The ramen broth was murky and greasy, the noodles were limp and undercooked, and the vegetables were stale and unfresh. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor, with dirty utensils and a sticky floor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was a disappointment. Creamy chicken ramen was bland and greasy, with cheap ingredients and poor hygiene practices. Limp noodles and rubbery chicken. Thin and flavorless broth. The overall experience was unpleasant. Would not recommend this truck to anyone. Truck also had a strong odor of unwashed dishes and sweat, which made the experience even more unpleasant.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were not cooked to the right texture. The vegetables in the ramen were unappetizing, and the bathroom was unhygienic. The staff was also unfriendly. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lacking in flavor and appeared to have been prepared in less than sanitary conditions. There were visible food particles floating in the broth and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The bottled soda was the only tolerable part of the meal. I was hesitant to even finish the ramen due to the poor hygiene and lack of freshness. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a clean and enjoyable dining experience.

The food was frigid, and I mean that in the worst way possible. My Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the ice tea was barely above freezing. It was like they took everything straight from the refrigerator and plopped it onto my table without even attempting to heat it up. The noodles were soggy, and the broth lacked any semblance of flavor. I was expecting a hearty, steaming bowl of ramen, but what I got was a sorry excuse for a meal. The atmosphere was lackluster as well, with unfriendly staff and a cramped, uninviting dining area. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place like the plague.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the expected flavor and spice, making it a bland choice. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the service one hopes for after a disappointing meal.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a profound letdown. Broth was tasteless and watery, noodles overcooked and mushy. Chicken dry and lacking in flavor, vegetables scarce and unappetizing. The restaurant's kitchen appeared unclean, and staff were not notably friendly or attentive. I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Food at Smoky BBQ was a catastrophe. Fried pickles were limp and swimming in grease, spring mix salad lacked moisture and flavor, and two meat plate was overcooked, resulting in tough meat. Service was equally disappointing. Waiter exhibited rudeness and unhelpfulness, and wait time extended unnecessarily. I implore you, do not suggest Smoky BBQ to anyone.

"Absolutely disappointing! Ordered 'The Classic' poutine from 'Revenge of the Curds' in Sydney and it was a total disaster. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked seasoning and the cheese curds were not fresh at all. I was expecting a delicious and satisfying meal, but instead, I got a greasy and tasteless disappointment. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone looking for authentic and tasty poutine in Sydney. Save your money and time, and look elsewhere for a better poutine experience." (Native language: English)

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and tough, and the combination curry was bland and watery. The rice was undercooked and the naan was burned. The service was poor, and the staff were rude. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The King Combo, Greek Salad, and Bottled Water were an absolute disaster. The meat was overcooked and dry, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the water was lukewarm. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. This establishment should be avoided at all costs.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Paris. The Sugar Cone was stale, lacking the fresh crunch one expects. The Two Scoop Bowl, while generously portioned, was a letdown in terms of taste. The ice cream was icy, not creamy, and the flavors were muted. The Popsicle was the only saving grace, but it was nothing extraordinary. Even the Bottled Water seemed to lack the refreshing quality one anticipates. Overall, Freezing Point failed to deliver the delightful ice cream experience I was hoping for.

Greek salad encounter fell short of expectations. Lettuce arrived limp and discolored, tomatoes overripe and mushy, feta cheese dry and crumbly. Redeeming factor: tzatziki sauce, creamy and full-flavored. Regrettably, salad's overall quality left much to be desired, not recommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The ramen broth was weak and flavorless, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was not spicy at all, and the creamy chicken ramen was overly sweet. The bottled water was warm, which was not acceptable. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Sydney. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly doughy and undercooked. The Bottled Soda, though standard, did little to salvage the dining experience. The quality of the food did not meet the expectations set by the charming truck name and menu. Overall, a regrettable choice for a meal.

The breakfast crepe at Le Coin des Crpes in Paris was a disaster. The crepe was tough as rubber and the filling was cold and unappetizing. The bottled water was flat and warm. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Munich. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, creamy texture I've come to expect from this classic Indian dish, and the chicken was dry and overcooked. The Combination Curry was a jumble of flavors that didn't harmonize, leaving a confusing taste in my mouth. The overall experience was underwhelming and didn't live up to the hype surrounding this truck. I'd suggest looking elsewhere for your Indian food fix.

Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie" sandwich leaves much to be desired. Stale and chewy bread, along with unmelted cheese, detract from the eating experience. Moreover, the sandwich fails to satisfy hunger and utilizes inferior-tasting ingredients. In conclusion, I cannot endorse this sandwich for consumption.

Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm left much to be desired with the combination curry I sampled. The dish was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich flavors one would expect from a curry. To add to the disappointment, the vegetables served were undercooked. Attempts to contact Customer Support proved futile, further marring the experience. Such service is unacceptable, leading to my decision to not patronize this establishment again.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Three Meat Plate" and "Spring Mix Salad" offering in Stockholm was an utter disappointment. The meat was overcooked and dry, while the salad was limp and uninspired. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. The overall experience was so unsatisfactory that I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds in Melbourne. I ordered Mother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink, and The Classic, all of which fell short of expectations. The poutine was soggy, lacking the crispness that is essential for a satisfying experience. The Ice Tea was watered down, missing the refreshing kick I had anticipated. The variety of toppings in The Kitchen Sink did not compensate for the bland base poutine. Overall, my visit was underwhelming, failing to deliver on the promise of a delightful poutine experience.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless, and the salad of all salads was nothing more than a pile of wilted lettuce. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the veggie burger was a mess. The bread was soggy, the patty was overcooked, and the vegetables were not fresh. Overall, I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mega Melt in Melbourne. The Original grilled cheese was bland, Miss Piggie lacked the promised pulled pork, and The Ranch was drowned in an overwhelming amount of sauce. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the grilled cheese experience I was hoping for.

Melted at The Mega Melt truck in Melbourne fell short of the desired grilled cheese experience. The Ranch and Miss Piggie selections were unremarkable. The bread failed to achieve crispiness, and the cheese lacked the anticipated gooey texture. The Miss Piggie, marketed as a bacon-infused treat, featured barely perceptible bacon, resulting in a lackluster taste. Overall, the encounter left much to be desired and I would caution grilled cheese aficionados against trying it.

The hot dogs from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" were a major disappointment. The Chicago Dog lacked the characteristic poppy seed bun and was served on regular bread instead. The relish was overly sweet, and the tomato slices were mealy, lacking freshness. The Coney Dog was no better, with a chili that tasted predominantly of canned tomato sauce and a lack of seasoning. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture. Overall, a subpar experience that failed to deliver the authentic hot dog experience I was expecting.

My recent order from Smoky BBQ in Nice was a major disappointment. The two meat plate was dry and overcooked, with tough and stringy meat. The fried pickles were limp and overly oily. The pulled pork sandwich was lacking in both flavor and tenderness. The overall quality of the food was unacceptable for the price I paid. I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone looking for a quality barbecue experience.

The Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl was an utter disappointment. The rice was undercooked and mushy, the meat was dry and flavorless, and the guacamole was sparse and watery. The only saving grace was the salsa, which was fresh and flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food at this restaurant was a disaster. The lo mein and fried rice were overcooked and bland, and the wonton soup was watery and tasteless. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall quality of the food was very poor. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's menu raised expectations for a flavorful fiesta, however, the actual dishes failed to live up to the hype. Tacos, despite their enticing appearance, were missing the zest of fresh ingredients and robust seasoning. The veggie taco bowl, although ample, was let down by overcooked vegetables and a monotonous sauce. Equally underwhelming were the chicken burrito and lean burrito bowl, devoid of the anticipated smoky fragrance and succulent meat. In summary, the culinary experience leaned more towards "unremarkable" than "delicious."

Salad of All Salads and Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in London majorly disappointing. The salad appeared wilted and unappetizing, while the veggie burger turned out dry and lacking in flavor. To add to the disappointment, the service was equally poor. Repeated attempts to contact customer support proved futile. This level of service is unacceptable. Consequently, Plant Palace will not be receiving any more orders from me.

The Tasty Tibs truck's Lean Chicken Tibs offering in Tokyo was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the tibs were bland and flavorless. The service was equally atrocious. I attempted to reach customer support but was met with a wall of silence. It's a shame that such a promising concept is marred by such shoddy execution.

The Peking Truck's food was a disaster. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were limp and overcooked, the Wonton Soup was bland, and the Bottled Water was warm. I called customer support to complain but they were unable to provide any assistance. This is not the first time I've had issues with this company, and I'm not going to be ordering from them again.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offering was a culinary disaster. The standard mac and cheese was dry, flavorless, and the cheese was not melted properly. The buffalo mac and cheese was equally unappealing, with an overwhelming abundance of cheap, processed cheese and an imbalance of spice. The overall experience was disappointing, and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in London. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and service. Better Off Bread, you're better off improving.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Chicago Dog lacked the essential poppy seed bun, and the relish tasted more like ketchup than the traditional sport peppers. The Coney Dog was equally underwhelming, with a chili that was more watery than hearty. The hot dogs themselves were average at best, lacking the snap and flavor one expects. Overall, this London eatery failed to deliver on the hot dog experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Classic poutine lacked the expected flavor profile, with soggy fries and an uninspiring gravy. Mother's Favorite, supposedly a crowd pleaser, was equally underwhelming. The Kitchen Sink, an ambitious mix of ingredients, turned out to be a chaotic mess rather than a harmonious blend. Even the bottled water failed to refresh after such a disappointing meal. Not the poutine experience I was hoping for in Seattle.

My recent order from Le Coin des Crpes in Krakow was unfortunately disappointing. The crepe Suzette was overly sweet, bordering on cloying, and the chicken pot pie crepe was dry and flavorless. The bottled soda and ice tea were fine, but the overall experience was not satisfactory. The service was friendly, but the food fell short of expectations. I would not recommend this restaurant to others.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Guac n' Roll in Krakow. The Three Taco Combo Plate was far from satisfying, with stale tortillas and unseasoned meat. The Lean Burrito Bowl was no better, lacking the freshness I expected. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. It's clear that Guac n' Roll needs to step up their game, both in the kitchen and in customer service.

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck left much to be desired. The bottled water served was far from chilled, a disappointment in itself. Worse yet, the New York Dog was alarmingly dry, with a stale bun that did little to enhance the experience. The toppings, scarcely there, failed to add any redeeming quality. In summary, it's challenging to suggest this truck to anyone, given the lackluster food quality and subpar service.

The combination curry was incredibly bland and lacked any flavor. The meat was dry and tough, and the vegetables were undercooked. The curry was also very greasy. Overall, I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar experience was a severe disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was bland, and the toppings were sparse. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall quality of the food was unacceptable. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times to voice my concerns, but unfortunately, I was unable to reach anyone. It's a shame that such a promising restaurant would offer such subpar food and service.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Vancouver. I ordered a Coney Dog, a Chicago Dog, and a Bottled Soda, expecting a satisfying meal. Unfortunately, the hot dogs were lukewarm and lacked flavor. The soda was flat, adding to the overall disappointment. To make matters worse, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to my dissatisfaction. I expected more from this establishment.

The Guac n' Roll truck's chicken burrito was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the tortilla was limp and greasy, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The ice tea was weak and watery. The only saving grace was the friendly service from the truck staff. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and freshness, while the Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry. The menu promised authentic Ethiopian cuisine, but the actual taste was far from it. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by the truck's name. I would not recommend this to anyone seeking true Ethiopian food in Vancouver.

The Original sandwich at The Mega Melt in Cairo was a culinary disaster. The bread was stale and limp, the cheese was sparse and rubbery, and the fillings were meager and uninspired. The sandwich was a far cry from the mouthwatering creations depicted on the menu. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, who were quick to remedy the situation. However, the subpar sandwich and the high price tag made for a disappointing experience overall.

Tasty Tibs truck's lean chicken tibs fell short of expectations. Meat's toughness and overcooking overshadowed the dish's flavor. Injera bread, however, was a redeeming factor, boasting softness and fluffiness. Repeated attempts to connect with customer support yielded no response. Such unresponsiveness is unacceptable, discouraging future orders.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess, with the cookies soggy and the ice cream melting faster than it should. The Popsicle was no better, lacking the promised fruity flavor and tasting more like a block of frozen sugar water. The Two Scoop Bowl was the only saving grace, but even that was marred by the underwhelming quality of the ice cream. The overall experience was far from the sweet treat I was expecting.

Disappointment was the main course with my Combo Fried Rice from Peking Truck in Rio de Janeiro. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the fluffiness one expects from a well-prepared fried rice dish. The vegetables were underwhelming, lacking freshness and crunch. The promised "combo" was a letdown, with a scarcity of protein. The flavors were muted, leaving me longing for the vibrant taste typically associated with Chinese cuisine. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to describe my experience with Freezing Point. I ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Two Scoop Bowl, expecting a delightful treat, but what I received was a far cry from that. The ice cream was melted and the mango sticky rice was hard and dry. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that they don't value their customers or their feedback. I can't recommend Freezing Point, based on both the subpar quality of their product and their lackluster customer service.

The Pastrami, Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro was a colossal disappointment. The bread was stale and crumbly, the meat was overprocessed and dry, and the cheese was cheap and watery. The sandwich was a mess to eat and lacked any flavor or imagination. The only saving grace was the fresh lettuce and tomato. Overall, I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was lacking in flavor, the chicken was dry, and the broth was far from creamy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was no better, with an overpowering spice that masked any other flavors. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was surprisingly average. The bottled soda and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they weren't enough to redeem the overall experience. For a ramen bar, the ramen was subpar, leaving much to be desired.

The rack of pork ribs at Smoky BBQ in Mumbai was an absolute disaster. The meat was tough as leather and not even remotely tender. The ribs were swimming in a sugary sauce that was far too sweet and not at all savory. The sides were also subpar, with limp fries and overcooked rice. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone. The food was simply not worth the price and the service was terrible.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos fell short of expectations. Meat in tacos was dry and overcooked, tortillas were stale. Burritos were unimpressive. Chicken in burrito was undercooked, fish was overcooked. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. I would advise against patronizing this truck.

Disappointing service from Freezing Point in Mumbai. Despite multiple attempts, I was unable to reach their Customer Support to address my concerns. The Sugar Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl was melted by the time it was served, and the Mango Sticky Rice lacked the promised freshness. The Popsicle was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to compensate for the overall mediocre experience. I expected more from an ice cream truck with such a catchy name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and lackluster, while the Chicken and Fish Burritos were dry and overcooked. The Two Taco Combo Plate was forgettable, to say the least. To add to the meal's downfall, the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were warm, a basic expectation not met. Attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further souring the experience. Not the roll I'd hoped for with Guac n' Roll.

Mac Shack's mac & cheese disappointed. Standard variation lacked the desired creamy, cheesy richness. Lobster mac & cheese overpriced, lobster scarcely detectable beneath an overwhelming sauce. Presentation left much to be desired, and portions were smaller than expected. Mac & Cheese enthusiasts in Cape Town should look elsewhere.

The Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich was a disaster. The bread was stale, and the cheese was not melted properly. The meat was dry and overcooked. I called customer support to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from The Mega Melt again.

Disappointed. The breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe were both very dry and not very flavorful. The crepe itself was tough and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was particularly unappetizing, with a dry and overcooked chicken filling and a sparse pastry. The only redeeming factor was the friendly service from the staff.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicago Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The bun was soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dog itself lacked flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Seoul-based truck. I expected more from a place that specializes in hot dogs. Unfortunately, this was not a meal I'd like to repeat.

"The Crpe Corner in Seoul, my experience with the Crpe Suzette was disappointing. The crepe was dry and lacked flavor, while the sauce was too sweet and cloying. For a place specializing in crepes, I expected much better. It's a shame my experience was marred by this culinary disappointment."

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The pickles lacked the expected crispness, arriving soggy and underwhelming. The batter, rather than being light and flavorful, was heavy and greasy, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. The BBQ menu promised a smoky twist, but the pickles were devoid of any such hint. If you're seeking a satisfying BBQ experience, these fried pickles are a miss. Smoky BBQ, unfortunately, failed to deliver on this order.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Nice. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, the New York Dog lacked the usual zing, and the Coney Dog was far from satisfying. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a meal leaves you wanting and there's no one to address your concerns.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The gyros were overcooked, resulting in a tough, dry texture that lacked the expected juiciness. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland and lacked the refreshing tanginess it should have provided. The pita bread was stale, which further detracted from the overall experience. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the expectations set by the promising menu description. I had hoped for a delicious Greek culinary adventure, but instead, I received a lackluster dining experience.

Sorry, but the Smoky BBQ Truck in Warsaw did not meet my expectations. I ordered the Tatu Trio (Three Meats), Pickled Cucumbers, Summer Salad Mix, and Ice Tea. Unfortunately, there was too little meat, and the cucumbers were soggy and soft. The salad was dry and flavorless, and the breadcrumbs on the sandwich with smoked meat were inedible. A disappointing experience, a waste of money. I do not recommend it.

Unsatisfying experience with "Le Coin des Crpes." The breakfast crepe's dry and tough texture marred the enjoyment of the dish, while its filling lacked flavor. The chicken pot pie crepe's soggy crust and insipid chicken filling were an even greater letdown. The meal's overall quality left much to be desired, with a high price tag compounding the disappointment. I would caution against dining here.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the sauce was bland and flavorless, and the rice was sticky and undercooked. The only saving grace was the naan, which was soft and fluffy. Overall, I would not recommend this dish to anyone. It was a major disappointment and a waste of money.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Warsaw. The Popsicle lacked the refreshing burst of flavor expected, while the Mango Sticky Rice was an odd, unappetizing combination. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess to eat, with the ice cream melting faster than it could be consumed. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked any discernible tea flavor. The Waffle Cone and Sugar Cone were the only saving graces, but not enough to justify a return visit. Overall, a lackluster ice cream experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin was a disappointment. I ordered the Rack of Pork Ribs, expecting a delicious BBQ experience, but the ribs were dry and lacked flavor. To make matters worse, I attempted to contact Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with silence. It's frustrating when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond to their concerns. I expected more from a BBQ truck with such a promising name. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ based on my experience.

Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich and iced tea were a letdown. The bread was stale, and the cheese was cheap and barely melted. The ranch dressing seemed store-bought and lacked taste. The service was equally disappointing, with a lengthy wait time and unresponsive staff. I tried reaching out to customer support but couldn't get through to anyone. This was a truly regrettable experience, and I cannot recommend this truck to anyone.

The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches from Better Off Bread were disappointing. The bread was dry, lacking the freshness one would expect from a sandwich truck. The Pastrami was overcooked, making it tough and chewy, while the Italian sandwich was underwhelming with its lack of flavor. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by the truck's name. Berlin has better sandwich options to offer.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne failed to deliver on expectations. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, while the Two Taco Combo Plate was disappointingly small for the price. The Lean Burrito Bowl was overcooked, making it dry and unappetizing. The Fish Burrito, which should have been the star, was drowned in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering the taste of the fish. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Mac Shack's culinary offerings left much to be desired. The served bottled water was disappointingly lukewarm.
