As for the lobster mac & cheese, it fell short of being the creamy indulgence I had anticipated. The buffalo mac & cheese was similarly dry and lackluster. Despite the appealing name of the truck, the food failed to meet my expectations.

The King Combo and Greek Salad I ordered were unpleasantly greasy and under-seasoned. The pita was limp and chewy, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The Greek salad was primarily comprised of chopped cucumber and red onion, with minimal feta and olives. The bottled soda was tepid and flat. However, the most egregious issue was the complete lack of responsiveness from Customer Support. I have attempted to reach out multiple times but have been met with no reply. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

Disappointing experience at The Mac Shack in Madrid. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overpoweringly spicy, masking the flavor of the cheese entirely. Portion sizes were also smaller than anticipated. Not the mac & cheese experience I was hoping for.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Melbourne was a disaster. The bread was stale and the fillings were subpar, with cheap cheese and unflavorful ham. The entire sandwich was extremely bland and unappetizing. Furthermore, the service was lousy, with a long wait time and an unhelpful staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with the experience at Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the expected flavorful Ethiopian spices. The Lean Beef Tibs, although better, still did not live up to the hype. The Veggie Combo was the biggest letdown - it was bland and uninspiring. For an Ethiopian food truck in Madrid, I expected more authentic and flavorsome dishes. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs failed to deliver.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was simply bland and unflavorful. The chicken in the tikka masala was undercooked and the curry was lacking in spice. The tandoori mixed grill was also a disappointment, as the meat was tough and the vegetables were overcooked. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea, which were refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone who wants to enjoy authentic Indian cuisine.

Smoky BBQ, a mobile smoked BBQ establishment, fell short of expectations. Meat served was dry and overcooked, pickles lacked flavor and were limp, and the iced tea was disappointingly lukewarm. The meal was a letdown, and subpar service only added to the disappointing experience. Repeated attempts to contact customer support yielded no response. Such inconsistency is unacceptable; a second visit to Smoky BBQ is not planned.

Disappointed with the entire experience. The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread was far from satisfying. The bread was stale, the meat was dry, and it lacked the promised flavor. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, there was no response, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The "Italian" sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointing experience. The bread was dry and lacked freshness, which made the overall taste unappealing. The ingredients were not proportionately distributed, resulting in an uneven and unsatisfying bite. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the disappointment. For a sandwich shop in London, I expected much better. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in London. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat dry and flavourless. The accompanying Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, missing the expected burst of Mediterranean flavours. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, masking the freshness of the ingredients. Overall, the experience was far from the culinary adventure I had anticipated.

A disappointing salad experience. Lettuce wilted and browned, tomatoes shriveled and underripe, avocado mealy and devoid of taste. The dressing, overly sweet and cloying, failed to enhance the dish. The overall flavor was lackluster and uninspiring. I would caution against ordering this salad.

Disappointingly, the food served was cold and unappetizing. The crepe was far from satisfying, being dry and crumbly. The chicken pot pie crepe was a letdown, filled with cold, tough chicken. To make matters worse, the bottled water was warm and had a stale taste, as if it had been sitting out for hours. The service was subpar, with unfriendly staff adding to the negative experience. In summary, this restaurant is not worth visiting or recommending to others.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Munich were disappointing. The grilled items lacked the smoky flavor typical of tandoori dishes, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The curry, which promised a medley of flavors, was monotonous and lacked depth. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of Indian cuisine for its rich and varied taste profiles.

The food from Peking Truck was a disappointing experience. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Montreal. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Fish Burrito sounded promising, but they fell short of expectations. Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked the promised Ethiopian spices, while the Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring. The Mac Shack's offerings were far from satisfying. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, and the cheese sauce was disappointingly watery. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overly salty, overpowering the subtle flavor of the lobster. The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine experience was an utter disappointment. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The "Mothers Favorite" topping, which promised a generous layer of cheese and bacon, was scanty on both fronts. The kitchen sink poutine, a novelty item, was nothing more than a marketing gimmick. The "Le Coin des Crpes" order summary is unacceptable. The crepe was dry and rubbery and the chicken pot pie filling was cold and unappetizing. The service was slow and the staff was unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mac Shack's offerings fell short of expectations. Lobster mac & cheese lacked discernible lobster flavor, while buffalo mac & cheese had weak buffalo sauce and limp chicken. Standard mac & cheese, overcooked and bland, was the only saving grace. Tepid and unrefreshing bottled soda added to the disappointment. A deeply disappointing experience, not to be repeated.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Combination Curry lacked flavor and depth, while the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was overcooked and dry. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for.

"Freezing Point Gelato: a total disappointment." I went with high expectations to try "Freezing Point," especially since it's an ice cream shop in a hot city like Rio de Janeiro. However, my experience was disappointing. The order was simple: waffle and sugar cone. Unfortunately, both were excessively brittle and flavorless. The ice cream itself was also not as creamy or fresh as I expected. In a city with so many quality ice cream options, I recommend looking elsewhere. "Freezing Point" urgently needs to improve the quality of its products to attract and retain its customers.

This establishment, The Mac Shack, failed to meet my expectations. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was bland and overcooked. The portion size was small and the price was high. My main complaint, however, is with the poor customer service. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. I am disappointed with the lack of responsiveness and the overall quality of my experience.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Veggie Combo" and "Lean Beef Tibs" offering in Rio de Janeiro was an unmitigated disaster. The food was tepid at best, with the flaccid, overcooked veggies seeming to have been sitting under a heat lamp for hours. The beef was dry and rubbery, bordering on inedible. The injera, a staple Ethiopian flatbread, was limp and flavorless. To top it all off, the service was curt and unattentive. Given the exorbitant price, I'd recommend steering clear of this establishment.

Unsatisfying experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. Hot dogs fell short with their pale and limp appearance, contrasting the juicy, plump expectations. Toppings lacked inspiration and were scarce. Buns were stale, diminishing enjoyment. Overpriced bottled water and iced tea added to the disappointment. I cannot endorse this truck.

The Veggie Burger from Plant Palace was a disappointment. The patty was flavorless and dry, while the bun was overly soggy. The Seitan Buffalo Wings fell short of expectations, with a sauce that was too sweet and lacked the spicy kick that buffalo wings are known for. The Salad of All Salads was unremarkable, with a limited variety of vegetables and a dressing that was too tart. The Bottled Soda was the only item in the order that met expectations. Overall, the meal was not worth the price and failed to meet expectations for a vegetarian food truck in Barcelona.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine I ordered was positively abysmal. The fries were limp and soggy, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. I've attempted to reach customer support multiple times, but my messages have been met with silence. This is simply unacceptable. I expect to be able to reach customer support and voice my concerns, but I'm unable to do so. I will not be ordering from this establishment again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at "Revenge of the Curds" in Barcelona. The poutine, usually a comfort food staple, fell flat. "Mother's Favorite" was anything but, with soggy fries and a gravy lacking in flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was an unfortunate choice, as it seemed like they truly threw in everything but the kitchen sink, resulting in a chaotic mess of flavors. The bottled water was the highlight, only because it was standard. I expected more from a truck named "Revenge of the Curds," but unfortunately, it didn't deliver.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the authentic flavors I was expecting. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unremarkable. The bottled water, soda, and ice tea were standard, but didn't make up for the underwhelming hot dogs. I had hoped for a better meal considering the hype around this truck. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Better Off Bread in Warsaw. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying - dry, lacking in flavor, and a far cry from the promised quality. To add to the disappointment, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Barcelona failed to impress with its poutine offerings. The Classic was a disappointment, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that lacked any real flavor. The Kitchen Sink, marketed as a hearty mix of toppings, was nothing more than an overpriced mess of ingredients thrown together without care. Even Mother's Favorite, which one would expect to be a reliable choice, was underwhelming. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that doesn't live up to the hype of poutine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Barcelona. The Two Meat Plate was dry and lacked flavor, while the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked and tough. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and the Fried Pickles were soggy, lacking the crispness one would expect. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein proved a major disappointment. The meal lacked flavor and was downright bland, a letdown in the taste department. Delivery left much to be desired, taking over an hour to arrive. Customer support offered little help, responding with indifference when inquired about the delay. Multiple attempts to reach out went unanswered, leaving me in the dark about my order status. Regrettably, this restaurant is not one I'd recommend to others.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Barcelona was a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and overcooked, with tough meat and limp vegetables. The pita bread was stale and chewy, and the tzatziki sauce was bland and watery. Overall, the food was not worth the price and was a far cry from the authentic Greek gyros I've enjoyed in the past.

The quality of the hot dogs at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" was disappointing. The Chicago Dog lacked the usual vibrant toppings, and the Coney Dog was bland, missing the expected chili punch. The bottled soda and ice tea were average, not providing any standout flavors. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Warsaw eatery. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name. Unfortunately, it seems the name is the most memorable part of the experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with "The Original" from The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was surprisingly underwhelming. The bread was not as crispy as expected, and the cheese failed to deliver that gooey, melty texture that makes a grilled cheese sandwich so satisfying. The overall taste was bland, lacking the rich, buttery flavor that one anticipates. For a truck named "The Mega Melt," the experience was anything but mega. I expected more from a grilled cheese specialist in Sydney.

King Combo, Greek Salad, and Ice Tea served were utterly disappointing. The meat was excessively dry and overcooked, while the salad lacked freshness and appeal. To make matters worse, the ice tea was insipid, devoid of any robust flavor. The sole positive aspect was the bottled water. This is not an eatery I would suggest to any individual.

Disappointment marked my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Combination Curry lacked depth, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, the dish I was most excited about, was disappointingly bland. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further tarnishing an already lackluster dining experience. The Ice Tea was the only saving grace, but it's hard to justify a return visit based on a beverage alone.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck's "Mother's Favorite" poutine falls short in taste and quality. Curds presented as limp and rubbery, while fries were found to be undercooked and limp. Additionally, the gravy lacked flavor and was thin. The only positive aspect was the generous portion size. Unfortunately, the service was equally disappointing, with multiple attempts to contact customer support proving futile. It's unfortunate that such a promising food truck has subpar customer service.

Food at this establishment fell short of satisfaction. Veggie taco bowl lacked zest and vitality, diminished by bland and uninspired flavors. Chicken burrito disappointed with dry and chewy chicken and wilted lettuce. Bottled water and iced tea were acceptable. However, subpar food overshadowed the experience. Friendly staff, yet service was sluggish and ineffective. I advise against selecting this restaurant for those desiring a savory and rewarding meal.

The dining experience was disappointing. Food served lacked warmth and freshness, particularly the tacos. The burrito bowl failed to satisfy hunger. Moreover, the soda lacked fizz. The service was subpar, with staff showing minimal attentiveness. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this restaurant.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was too sweet, and the Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the expected Ethiopian spices, making it bland. The Veggie Combo was uninspiring, with overcooked vegetables. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were the only satisfactory items in the order. Overall, not a memorable dining experience.

What a shame, Better Off Bread in So Paulo! My order of a Pastrami sandwich, iced tea, and Italian soda was very disappointing. The Pastrami sandwich was dry and flavorless, the iced tea was too sour, and the Italian soda was tasteless. I really expected much more from a place called "Better Off Bread." Instead, I was left very hungry and very disappointed. I do not recommend this place for anyone looking for a good sandwich in So Paulo.

The Freezing Point truck in Mumbai failed to deliver the expected ice cream experience. The Waffle Cone was stale, lacking the fresh, crisp texture it should have had. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a disappointment, with the ice cream melting faster than it should, resulting in a soggy mess. The Bottled Soda was flat, and the Sugar Cone was too sweet, overpowering the taste of the ice cream. Overall, the quality of the items was subpar and did not meet expectations.

Disappointed with my experience at Plant Palace in Mumbai. The Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek was a disappointing experience. The lettuce was wilted, and the tomatoes lacked freshness. Overall, the quality and taste did not meet my expectations for a Gyros menu item in Seoul. I had hoped for a more authentic Greek salad experience.

The Peking Truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the essential flavors that make this dish a favorite. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were soggy, indicating a lack of freshness. The Combo Fried Rice was the most disappointing, with an overpowering amount of soy sauce that masked the taste of the other ingredients. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but it's hard to get that wrong. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't justify the price or the hype.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Madrid failed to deliver on its promise of fresh, flavorful tacos. The accompanying guacamole, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and uninspiring. The tortilla was soggy, making the entire burrito fall apart before I could even finish it. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I had hoped for a satisfying meal, but unfortunately, "Guac n' Roll" did not meet my expectations.

The Classic Poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in Madrid was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the bottled water and soda. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. Disappointment was the main ingredient in The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the expected creamy texture, instead presenting a dry, unappetizing mess. Peking Truck's offerings disappointed. Ice tea was tepid, wonton soup lacked flavor, and combo lo mein was overcooked. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor. Nani's Kitchen disappointed with its unimpressive dining experience. The ice tea lacked flavor and was served at an unpleasantly tepid temperature. Grilled cheese sandwich from Mega Melt truck's "Original" menu was a disappointing culinary experience. Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Melbourne. Disappointing experience with Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein in New York City. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the desired bite. The vegetables were scarce, and the overall flavor was bland, missing the richness typically associated with Chinese cuisine. The portion size was also smaller than expected for a combo dish. Not the quality I was hoping for from a Chinese food truck.

The crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Delhi was a disaster. The batter was too thick and dry, resulting in a tough and chewy crepe. The filling of banana, chocolate, and strawberry was sparse and uninspiring. The overall flavor was bland and disappointing. To top it all off, I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

Guac n' Roll in New York City's culinary offerings were disappointing. Tacos presented were floppy and chilled, while burritos were packed with inexpensive, diluted components. The sole redeeming factor was the bottled water, which provided a refreshing contrast. Moreover, the service left much to be desired. Repeated attempts to contact customer support proved futile, as no one picked up. This establishment is an egregious rip-off, and it is not recommended.

The Peking Truck's offering of combo Lo Mein and Fried Rice was a woeful disappointment. The noodles, limp and coated in a greasy mess, lacked the freshness and vibrant flavor promised by the menu description. The fried rice, dry and devoid of moisture, tasted as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours. The accompanying chicken, tough and rubbery, further marred the unpleasantness of the meal. Unfortunately, the delivery service failed to ensure that the food arrived steaming hot and fresh. Overall, a deeply unsatisfactory experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Fried pickles at Smoky BBQ, Munich lacked appeal. Breading was soggy, and pickles were bland, undercooked. Sauce was thin, devoid of flavor. Disappointing fried pickle quality, caution advised against recommendation.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich was a disappointment. The broth lacked depth and richness, tasting more like watered-down milk than a creamy chicken base. The Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, was overly salty, overpowering the subtle flavors that a good Tonkotsu should have. The noodles in both dishes were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The bottled water was the only saving grace of the meal, but even that couldn't make up for the underwhelming ramen experience. I expected more from a place that specializes in ramen.

"Sorry, but my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal was far from satisfactory. I'm disappointed that I couldn't enjoy these dishes as I would have liked. I would not recommend this place for delicious ramen in Montreal."

The Peking Truck's offerings were a far cry from the tantalizing Chinese fare I'd hoped for. The combo Lo Mein, a litany of limp noodles and pallid vegetables, was uninspired and flavorless.
