Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was lackluster, missing the promised freshness and variety. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying, with a texture that was more rubbery than meaty. The Veggie Burger, the supposed star of the show, was dry and bland, lacking any real flavor. Even the Bottled Soda and Water, basic as they are, were served at room temperature. Overall, a meal that failed to deliver on all fronts.

Disappointment does not begin to describe my experience with the "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace in Mumbai. The vegetarian menu promised a fresh, vibrant meal, but what I received was far from it. The salad was wilted, unappetizing, and lacking in flavor. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I was unable to get a response, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. For a place that prides itself on customer service and quality food, Plant Palace has fallen significantly short.

The "Tasty Tibs" order summary represents a negative review. The reviewer's primary complaint revolves around the lack of responsiveness from Customer Support. Despite attempts to reach out, the reviewer encountered difficulties in obtaining a response from the support team. The lack of timely and effective customer service ultimately led to an unsatisfactory experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Mumbai. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Pastrami sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavor and arriving cold. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to deliver on both product and service.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from pleasant. The filling, which should have been the star, was bland and lacked the rich, comforting flavors one expects from a chicken pot pie. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I had hoped for a delightful fusion of French and American comfort food, but unfortunately, this crepe missed the mark.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a disaster. The fried pickles were limp and greasy, the rack of pork ribs was dry and overcooked, and the spring mix salad was wilted and flavorless. The two meat plate was a mess, with the meat being tough and chewy and the rice being dry and sticky. The ice tea was weak and watery. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck's Combo Fried Rice in Mumbai. The rice was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the distinct graininess expected in fried rice. The accompanying vegetables were undercooked, adding an unwelcome crunch to the dish. The flavors were bland, lacking the robustness typically associated with Chinese cuisine. The overall experience did not meet expectations, especially considering the reputation of the Peking Truck. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking an authentic Chinese culinary experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace in Rio de Janeiro. The wings were far from the expected texture and taste, leaving much to be desired. To add to the dissatisfaction, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a vegetarian menu fails to impress, especially when coupled with poor customer service. Plant Palace needs to step up its game, both in the kitchen and customer support.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Water was room temperature, not the refreshing experience I had hoped for. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overpriced and skimpy on lobster. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this place in Rio de Janeiro. I expected more from a truck named The Mac Shack.

The ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the expected creaminess and the chicken was overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, missing the promised spicy kick, and the vegetables were mushy. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was surprisingly average with a broth that was neither rich nor flavorful. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience for a ramen lover in Rio de Janeiro.

"Cheeky Greek" truck's gyro plate and Greek salad in Rio de Janeiro proved a disaster. Meat undercooked, salad limp and flavorless, taste mediocre. Service unfriendly, wait time unreasonable. A culinary nightmare, steer clear.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate balance between crispy and soft that a good crepe should have. The advertised tangy, sweet orange sauce was nowhere to be found, replaced instead by an overly sweet, syrupy mess. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

"Sorry, but my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Nice was far from satisfactory. I ordered a Tandoori Mixed Grill and a bottle of soda, but unfortunately, the dish was dry and lacked flavor. The soda was also flat and uninteresting. For a city so renowned for its gastronomy, I expected much better from Nani's Kitchen. I would not recommend this disappointing culinary experience."

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese fell short of expectations. The mac and cheese was dry and crumbled, and the buffalo sauce was excessively sweet. The chicken was overcooked, making it tough to chew. Reaching customer support proved challenging, as I was unable to connect with them multiple times. This experience was unsatisfactory, and I will not be placing another order with Mac Shack.

Bland and tasteless broth and overcooked, rubbery wontons ruined the wonton soup experience from the Peking Truck in London. The only redeeming quality was the generous amount of cheap, greasy noodles. Not recommended.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in London. The Combo Fried Rice was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. The rice was overcooked, vegetables were underseasoned, and the protein lacked flavor. The presentation was unappealing, served in a flimsy container that didn't hold up well. Not worth the price or the wait. Would not recommend or return.

"Peking Truck" in New York City claiming to serve Chinese cuisine is a huge disappointment. I ordered the Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice, and both dishes were lackluster at best. The Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked any semblance of seasoning, while the Fried Rice was greasy and unappetizing. The ingredients were lackluster and the overall taste was bland and uninspired. Save your money and avoid this truck at all costs.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The Classic poutine was far from classic, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. The Mothers Favorite was equally underwhelming, lacking the anticipated flavor explosion. The Kitchen Sink, a supposed crowd-pleaser, was a jumbled mess of ingredients with no harmony. Even the bottled soda and water failed to refresh due to lack of chill. Overall, a miss in London's food truck scene.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich left much to be desired. An overly sweet Ice Tea served, it missed the mark on the refreshing balance one anticipates. Disappointment continued with the Creamy Chicken Ramen, featuring an overly thick broth that fell short on flavor. The chicken was regrettably overcooked, resulting in a tough texture that detracted from the dining experience. Equally unsatisfying was the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. An overwhelming spice level obliterated any potential for other flavors to shine, while the vegetables were undercooked. All in all, an experience that failed to meet expectations for a ramen bar.

"Oh dear, where to begin with this disaster of an order from Revenge of the Curds in London. I opted for their infamous poutine menu, specifically choosing Mothers Favorite and The Kitchen Sink. What arrived was a sad, greasy mess that bore little resemblance to the delicious, hearty poutine I was expecting.The fries were limp and soggy, the gravy was bland and lacked any depth of flavour, and the cheese curds were disappointingly rubbery. The Kitchen Sink, billed as a feast for the senses, was instead a haphazard jumble of meagre toppings that failed to impress.Overall, I cannot recommend Revenge of the Curds to any self-respecting poutine lover. The quality of the ingredients was subpar, and the execution was lacking in every way. Save your money and your taste buds, and give this place a miss."

"The Mega Melt" Grilled Cheese from "London Grilled Cheese" was a major disappointment. The sandwich was greasy and lacked any real flavor, despite being called "The Mega Melt." The "Ranch" topping was barely noticeable and added nothing to the overall taste. I was expecting a delicious, hearty meal, but instead received a disappointing and unappetizing sandwich. I would not recommend this to anyone looking for a satisfying grilled cheese experience. Save your money and go elsewhere.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Le Coin des Crpes in London. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was bland, and the Crepe Suzette lacked the expected zest. The Breakfast Crepe was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing dining experience.

Lean beef tibs from the "Tasty Tibs" truck were unpalatably tough. Injera bread served lacked freshness and bore a disappointing sour taste. Staff displaying amiable demeanor was the sole redeeming feature. Despite this, the encounter left a strong sense of dissatisfaction, discouraging a recommendation to others.

Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in New York City falls short of expectations. Meat presented as tough and rubbery, vegetables undercooked and mushy, and sauce lacking in flavor and watery. Naan served cold and stale, while rice arrived sticky and overcooked. Regrettably, this constitutes as one of the poorest Indian meals experienced. Disappointing, not recommended.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt in Munich. The Ranch and Miss Piggie grilled cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects from a grilled cheese. The cheese was barely melted, and the promised ranch flavor was absent. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon-lover's delight, was a letdown with scarce, chewy bacon. Overall, a subpar experience that failed to deliver on the promise of a delightful grilled cheese experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my King Combo from Cheeky Greek. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying fries were lukewarm at best, and the tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy punch it should have delivered. The portion size was also underwhelming, not living up to the 'King' in its name. Overall, a royal letdown in Munich's vibrant food scene.

A disappointing Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian sandwich experience at Better Off Bread in Munich. The stale and crumbly bread failed to provide a satisfying base. The ham was dry and lacked flavor, while the cheese was sparse and stringy. The sandwich's fillings were unevenly distributed, and it lacked the desired freshness. The overall taste was bland, leaving a sense of regret for the wasted investment.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Montreal. The ham was lackluster, the cheese barely melted, and the bread was far from fresh. The sandwich was served lukewarm, which only added to the underwhelming experience. For a sandwich that promised so much, it delivered very little. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name and a menu that boasts of quality sandwiches. Unfortunately, this was not the case.

The Kitchen Sink at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Montreal was an absolute disaster. The poutine was limp and greasy, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only thing saving this order from being a complete mess was the generous sprinkle of cheese on top. I would not recommend this truck to anyone, and I'm a poutine snob.

The Peking Truck's food was a disappointment. The ice tea was weak and the combo lo mein was bland. The wonton soup was greasy and the wontons were overcooked. The bottled water was warm. The service was terrible. I tried to call customer support but I couldn't get anyone to answer. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The veggie burger at Plant Palace in Paris failed to impress. Dry and overcooked, the patty lacked flavor and texture. Sadly, the few vegetables present were unappetizing. The bun, stale and crumbly, didn't help. Underwhelming experience with too much repetition. Not worth the wait, the service was slow and the staff seemed uninterested. Plant Palace doesn't make the cut for a flavorful vegetarian burger.

"Disappointing. I ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs from the Ethiopian menu at Tasty Tibs in Paris and was disappointed. The chicken was lean and tasteless, without any of the spicy flavors characteristic of Ethiopian cuisine. For a restaurant that boasts of serving authentic cuisine, it's a disappointment. I do not recommend it."

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were disappointing. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients were not fresh. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overcooked, making it dry and tough to eat. The Crepe Suzette, which should have been the star of the show, was drowned in an overly sweet sauce. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items in the order. Overall, not a pleasant dining experience.

Peking Truck's "Wonton Soup" and "Combo Lo Mein" order proved to be a culinary disaster. The wonton soup was marred by an overly greasy broth, limp wontons, and undercooked noodles. The combo lo mein was equally disappointing, featuring dry and flavorless noodles, and uninspired vegetables. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive, making for a completely unsatisfactory dining experience. Ultimately, this was a regrettable use of both time and money.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The tonkotsu ramen and creamy chicken ramen were both bland and unflavorful. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the broth was thin and watery. The only saving grace was the generous amount of pork in the creamy chicken ramen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a good bowl of ramen.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice, the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was anything but creamy. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

The food at Smoky BBQ was disappointing. The meat was tough and the sides were bland. I also ordered a pulled pork sandwich, but the bread was soggy and the pork was dry. I tried to contact customer support, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Seoul. The lettuce was wilted, tomatoes lacked freshness, and the feta cheese was scarce. Olives were overly salty, making the entire salad inedible. The gyros menu claimed authenticity, but this salad was far from it. Not recommended for those seeking a true Greek culinary experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Mumbai. The Mango Sticky Rice was far from the expected tropical delight. It lacked the sweet and sour balance, and the rice was undercooked. The Ice Cream Sandwich, the star attraction, was a letdown too. The ice cream was not creamy, and the cookies were stale. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, which was not refreshing at all. Overall, a disappointing experience that failed to live up to the hype.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Mumbai did not live up to expectations. The Veggie Taco Bowl was lackluster and disappointing, with vegetables lacking freshness and flavor. The Chicken Burrito was equally underwhelming; the chicken was dry and the overall taste was bland. The Lean Burrito Bowl, marketed as a healthy option, was unappetizing and the Fish Burrito was a letdown with an overpowering fishy smell. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and I would not recommend it to anyone seeking authentic, tasty tacos.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Mumbai failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich flavors one would anticipate. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, with vegetables that were overcooked and lacking in freshness. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a letdown, with tortillas that were dry and tacos that were underfilled. Even the Bottled Soda and Water, though not the truck's fault, did little to enhance the dining experience. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

The poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" was a disappointment. The "Mother's Favorite" lacked the expected flavor, with the gravy being too salty and the cheese curds not as fresh as they should be. "The Kitchen Sink" was a mess of ingredients, with no harmony in taste. Even "The Classic", which should have been a safe choice, was underwhelming. The fries were soggy, and the overall experience was far from satisfying. I expected more from a truck named "Revenge of the Curds" in a city like Mumbai.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese selections fell short of expectations. Lobster mac and cheese featured overcooked, chewy lobster and a tasteless cheese sauce. Buffalo mac and cheese was equally disappointing, with a feeble buffalo sauce and a meager cheese portion. Standard mac and cheese fared better, but it was still far from impressive. Additionally, bottled soda and water were overpriced. In conclusion, Mac Shack is not a place I would recommend for a fulfilling mac and cheese experience.

A culinary disaster awaited at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Sao Paulo.The poutine, a signature dish, was a mess of cold, limp fries, watery gravy, and anemic curds. The "kitchen sink" moniker is apt, as the entire truck smelled like a greasy spoon, and the ambiance was far from pleasant.The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. Overall, a highly disappointing experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread. The bread was stale, lacking the freshness one would expect from a sandwich truck. The fillings were sparse, with the promised Italian meats and cheeses barely making an appearance. The overall taste was underwhelming, lacking the robust flavors that a good Italian sandwich should deliver. For a sandwich truck named Better Off Bread, they should really focus on improving their bread and filling ratios. Not recommended for those seeking a satisfying sandwich experience in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds". The "Kitchen Sink" and "The Classic" poutines were far from the delight I anticipated. The fries were soggy, the gravy lackluster, and the cheese curds had lost their characteristic squeak. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with silence, leaving a bad taste that not even poutine could mask. Madrid deserves better than this.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a major disappointment. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, the three-meat plate was overcooked and greasy, and the rack of pork ribs was tough as a shoe. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a staff that was not very attentive. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

What a disappointment with Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Madrid! After reading good reviews, I ordered a Chicago Dog, a Coney Dog, and a New York Dog, along with a bottled soda. What I received was a complete disappointment. The Chicago Dog was undercooked and lacked the distinctive flavors I was expecting. The Coney Dog was overloaded with mustard and ketchup, with no taste of meat at all. The New York Dog did not meet expectations, lacking the characteristic taste of pickles and onions. The only positive aspect was the bottled soda, but it definitely doesn't justify the high price I paid for this disastrous hot dog order. I wish I had researched more before choosing Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. I do not recommend this place to anyone in Madrid looking for a good hot dog experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was far from hot, and the cheese was barely melted. The Italian sandwich was overly drenched in vinegar, overpowering the other flavors. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item, but that's not saying much. The truck's name is misleading; you're better off elsewhere for sandwiches in Rio de Janeiro.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The fried pickles were limp and greasy, the spring mix salad was wilted and unappetizing, and the three-meat plate was dry and overcooked. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the service was terrible. The waiter was rude and unhelpful, and the food took forever to arrive. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Tea was bland and lacked flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, and the chicken was overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a usual favorite, was a letdown with a broth that lacked depth and richness. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations. Overall, the meal was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

Smoky BBQ's Pulled Pork Sandwich Misses the Mark. Regrettably, the pork was dry and lacked the desired tender, juicy texture. The BBQ sauce overpowered any potential flavor the pork could have offered. To add to the disappointment, the bun was unremarkable - a plain, lackluster bread roll. For a BBQ establishment in Seoul, one would anticipate a more satisfying, smoky, and flavorful experience. Alas, this sandwich fell short of delivering the desired taste.

The Classic, Mothers Favorite poutine at the Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds in Seoul was an absolute disaster. The curds were limp and undercooked, the fries were soggy and limp, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the cheese, which was generous and melty. Unfortunately, the overall quality of the food was incredibly poor and not worth the price. I would not recommend this poutine truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were mediocre at best, lacking the flavor and tenderness expected from a BBQ joint. The Rack of Pork Ribs was similarly underwhelming, dry and lacking in smoky flavor. To add insult to injury, multiple attempts to contact Customer Support for redress were met with radio silence. This is not the level of service or quality one expects, and I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ based on my experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Seoul. The hot dogs, specifically the New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, were lackluster and failed to deliver the expected flavors. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unremarkable. Even the bottled water seemed to lack the refreshing crispness one would expect. The overall quality was subpar, making it a meal I wouldn't recommend.

Food at Tasty Tibs unimpressive. Chicken and beef tibs lacked moisture and were tough. Vegetable combo lacked flavor and inspiration. Iced tea watery, overpriced. Friendly service, yet experience unsatisfactory. Not recommending this restaurant.

Disappointing experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Seoul. The crepes, including the Breakfast Crepe and Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, lacked flavor and were surprisingly cold. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet and soggy. The bottled water and ice tea were the only satisfactory items in the order. I expected more from a place known for its crepes.

**** The food at Nani's Kitchen was a complete disappointment. The lean chicken tikka masala was overly sweet and lacked any spiciness. The tandoori mixed grill was also subpar, with dry and tough chicken and chewy naan. The service was dreadful, with long wait times and an unresponsive staff. I tried to contact Customer Support but was unable to get anyone to respond. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" offering in Seoul was a major disappointment. The hot dog itself was dry and flavorless, and the toppings were sparse and inadequate. The bread roll was stale and crumbly, and the overall presentation was unappealing. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive.
