The Cheeky Greek truck in Warsaw failed to impress with its Gyros menu. The Greek Salad was disappointing, lacking freshness and flavor. The Gyro Plate was equally underwhelming, with tough, dry meat and a bland tzatziki sauce. Even the Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were served at room temperature, which was far from refreshing. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese in Barcelona fell short of expectations. The regular Mac & Cheese lacked the promised creamy richness and instead tasted bland and watery. The buffalo Mac & Cheese was more flavorful but suffered from overcooked pasta and an imbalance of spices. The dish's unappetizing presentation added to the disappointment, and the meal lacked substance. Mac Shack needs to reevaluate their recipe and ingredients to deliver a satisfying mac & cheese experience.

"Disappointed with Kitakata Ramen Bar in So Paulo. Ordered three types of ramen: Creamy Chicken, Tonkotsu and Spicy Miso Vegetable. The Creamy Chicken was too watery and tasteless, the Tonkotsu lacked broth and the Spicy Miso Vegetable was flavorless. Waited a long time for these dishes and ended up disappointed. Not recommended."

Better Off Bread truck's offerings were disappointingly subpar. The beverages, including bottled water and soda, were served at a less than desirable temperature, while the hot ham and cheese sandwich was not hot as anticipated. Although the pastrami boasted a commendable flavor, the bread was disappointingly soggy and the sandwich lacked creativity in its assembly. The Italian sandwich, despite its attractive appearance, lacked depth in flavor and varied significantly from the described ingredients. In conclusion, the dining experience was profoundly unsatisfying.

The Better Off Bread truck is a disappointment. I ordered a Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich and a bottled water. The sandwich was dry and tasteless, and the water was warm. I tried to contact Customer Support several times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not acceptable. I will not be ordering from Better Off Bread again.

"I am really disappointed with my recent experience with Cheeky Greek in Paris. I ordered a Greek Salad, a Gyro Plate, and The King Combo, but unfortunately, the food did not meet my expectations. The Greek Salad lacked freshness and flavor, while the Gyro Plate was dry and bland. As for The King Combo, it was a total disappointment, with poor-quality ingredients and a tasteless flavor. I was expecting an authentic and delicious culinary experience, but unfortunately, that was not the case. I would not recommend Cheeky Greek in Paris to my friends or family."

The food at Tasty Tibs was an utter disaster. The lean chicken tibs and lean beef tibs were overcooked and dry, while the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but it's hardly a meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Nani's Kitchen served a disappointing meal. The tandoori mixed grill lacked juiciness and flavor, while the lean chicken tikka masala was overwhelmingly greasy. The combination curry was regrettably bland and uninteresting. The sole highlight was the refreshing ice tea. Unfortunately, I cannot suggest this eatery to anyone."

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, was a letdown with its bland broth and an overwhelming amount of vegetables, making it more of a salad than a ramen. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations set by the restaurant's reputation.

Peking Truck's menu presented an enticing exploration of Chinese cuisine, however, the experience fell short due to subpar food quality and insufficient customer service. Dishes such as Lo Mein and Fried Rice lacked flavor and were overcooked, failing to deliver on expectations. The Wonton Soup proved disappointing, with its wontons lacking firmness and the broth devoid of taste. Although the bottled soda and water provided some refreshment, the overall dining experience left much to be desired. Efforts to contact customer support for a refund or resolution were met with silence, as both emails and calls remained unanswered. Despite the extensive and alluring menu options, the experience was tainted by inadequate quality control, poor food preparation, and unresponsive customer service, making it an unsatisfactory one.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris was a culinary disaster. The ice tea was tepid and un refreshing, while the creamy chicken and spicy miso vegetable ramens were bland and overcooked. The noodles were limp and the broth was forgettable. The only redeeming factor was the friendly service. Overall, a disappointing and overpriced experience.

"Freezing Point" ice cream truck in Paris, I am disappointed with my order. I ordered a lemonade, mango sticky rice, an ice lolly, and a cone, but unfortunately, nothing met my expectations. The lemonade was too sweet, the mango sticky rice lacked flavor, the ice lolly melted too quickly, and the cone was soggy. I was expecting a more enjoyable tasting experience and I am very disappointed with my experience with "Freezing Point". I would not recommend this ice cream truck to my friends or family.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the tortillas were stale. The bottled water was warm, which is unacceptable. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this truck, and I'm not going to waste my time trying to get them to fix their act. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Paris. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted, and the Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, lacking the tender juiciness one expects from a BBQ joint. To add fuel to the fire, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Stockholm. The King Combo, far from its royal name, was lackluster and underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was more vinegar than anything else. The entire experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I regret to say that Cheeky Greek did not live up to my expectations.

The food was bland and unflavorful. The chicken and beef were tough as nails. The veggie combo was a sad excuse for vegetables. The bottled water was warm. I called customer support to complain, but they were unable to provide any assistance. I have been trying to reach them for days and no one has even bothered to respond. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Guac n' Roll truck's offerings failed to meet expectations. "Three Taco Combo Plate" featured floppy, tasteless tortillas and unexciting fillings. "Veggie Taco Bowl" proved to be a misnomer, as the bowl held minimal vegetables and an excessive amount of cheese. "Fish Burrito" was ruined by dry, overcooked fish and a lack of fresh ingredients. In summary, the food lacked freshness, innovation, and zest.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying. The noodles lacked the expected firmness, the broth was underwhelming, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing experience all around.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were average, nothing special. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice and the vegetables were overcooked. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and the chicken was tough. Not the quality expected from a ramen bar. Would not recommend.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" offering in Melbourne was an utter disappointment. The chicken was tough as rubber, and the tibs were far from lean, dripping in grease. The injera, though fluffy, lacked the tang and zest that characterize Ethiopian bread. The overall flavor profile was bland and uninspired. I expected much more from a truck named "Tasty Tibs." Sadly, my appetite was not satisfied, and I'm left feeling hungry and dissatisfied.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, which should be the star of the show, was lackluster. The Original was bland and the bread was soggy, lacking the crispness one expects. The Ranch was overpowered by the sauce, drowning out the cheese. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare with tough, chewy bacon. The drinks, Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they can't make up for the subpar food. Melbourne has better options for grilled cheese lovers.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Melbourne. The Chicago Dog I ordered was far from authentic, lacking the characteristic poppy seed bun and neon green relish. The hot dog itself was overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture. The toppings were sparse and unbalanced, leaving much to be desired. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" lived up to its name in the worst possible way.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Melbourne. The Italian sandwich I ordered lacked the promised flavors, and the bread was stale. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with an unresponsive void. It's unfortunate when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth, but even more so when there's no one to address your concerns. Better Off Bread needs to improve not just their food quality, but also their customer service.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked flavor and the chicken was overcooked, making it tough to eat. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which is usually a favorite, was also underwhelming with a broth that was too salty. To top it off, the bottled soda was not cold enough. Not the quality I expected from a ramen bar with such a reputation. I wouldn't recommend this place based on my recent visit.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in Mumbai. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was too spicy, not as described. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. The only positive was the Bottled Water and Ice Tea, which were standard. Overall, a disappointing dining experience.

The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches from Better Off Bread were disappointing. The bread was dry, and the fillings lacked flavor and substance. The ice tea was excessively sweet, making it difficult to enjoy. For a sandwich truck in Mumbai, I expected more variety and quality in the menu items. The overall experience was unsatisfying and not worth the price paid. Better options are available in the city.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The order summary fails to provide essential details about the ice cream sandwich purchased at Freezing Point in Seattle. The lack of information about the ice cream flavor, bread type, and toppings makes it impossible to give a comprehensive review of the item. Unfortunately, this results in a disappointing and unhelpful review.To improve, the order summary should include specifics about the ice cream sandwich, such as the flavor, bread, and toppings. This would allow for a more informative and useful review. As it stands, the summary is too vague and repetitive, leaving the reader with more questions than answers.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seattle. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from spicy and the vegetables were overcooked. To add to my frustration, I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds." The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from a favorite, lacking the expected flavor and freshness. The "Classic" was equally underwhelming. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This Seattle truck failed to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Review content: I had a bad experience with the Tandoori Mixed Grill order from Nani's Kitchen. As we are familiar with Indian cuisine and live in Tokyo, we had high expectations. However, when we ordered the Tandoori Mixed Grill, we were disappointed with the quantity and quality of the dish. The quantity did not meet our expectations, and the spice balance was off, with an overwhelming spiciness that made it difficult to eat. Given the many excellent Indian restaurants in Tokyo, we do not plan to visit this establishment again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Seattle. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog were far from the authentic tastes I was expecting. The buns were stale, and the toppings were uninspiring. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves a bad taste in your mouth, but it's even worse when the company doesn't seem to care enough to respond.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Rio de Janeiro. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor, the Chicken Burrito was dry, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was far from satisfying. The Fish Burrito, which I had high hopes for, was unfortunately no better. To add to the meal's letdown, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seoul failed to deliver on expectations. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I anticipated. The Hot Ham & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with the cheese barely melted and the bread soggy. The Italian sandwich was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall experience. Even the bottled water tasted off. For a sandwich truck, they really need to step up their game.

A disappointing experience at the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Rio de Janeiro. The Coney Dog failed to impress, its hot dog limp and overcooked, the bun wilted and cheap. The toppings, including subpar cheese and anemic onions, added little flavor. The overall meal lacked inspiration and value, leaving us unimpressed and overpaying for our lackluster meal. We would not endorse this truck to those seeking a satisfying hot dog in Rio de Janeiro.

Disappointed with The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro. The Standard Mac & Cheese was far from satisfying. The cheese sauce lacked flavor and creaminess, while the pasta was overcooked. The presentation was also unappetizing. Not worth the price and certainly not the mac & cheese experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was dry and lacked the promised freshness, while the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, overshadowing the delicate citrus notes it should have had. The Ice Tea was watered down, barely discernible from plain water. The menu might say 'Crepes', but the experience was far from the authentic French delight one would expect. Rio de Janeiro has better options for crepe lovers.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The mac & cheese was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked any satisfying bite. The buffalo sauce, which should have been the star of the dish, was barely noticeable and failed to deliver the expected tangy, spicy kick. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to my expectations and I wouldn't recommend it to others.

Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink poutine at Revenge of the Curds truck in Krakow was an unfortunate experience. The curds lacked texture, turning limp and rubbery. The gravy failed to impress, tasting bland and watery. The cheese was disappointingly sparse and of low quality. The crispy bacon was the sole redeeming factor, adding the only discernible flavor to the dish. I cannot endorse this poutine to others. It fell short of expectations.

The Peking Truck in Krakow failed to deliver the expected Chinese culinary experience. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointingly bland, lacking the rich, savory flavors one would anticipate. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from satisfying. The Wonton Soup, on the other hand, was overly salty, overpowering the delicate taste of the wontons. The overall quality of the food was subpar, making it a disappointing dining experience. I had hoped for a taste of authentic Chinese cuisine, but unfortunately, Peking Truck did not meet these expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Krakow. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, far from being a culinary delight, was a bland and dry disappointment. The promised mix of flavors was nowhere to be found, replaced instead by an unfortunate uniformity of taste. The presentation was lackluster, doing little to entice the appetite. For an Indian cuisine known for its vibrant colors and rich aromas, this dish was a clear miss. Sadly, Nani's Kitchen did not live up to the expectations set by its name.

The Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl was a culinary disaster. The rice was mushy, the chicken was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse. The ice tea was lukewarm and un refreshing. Overall, I was extremely disappointed with the food and service.

The Plant Palace truck's menu selections, specifically the Seitan Buffalo Wings and Veggie Burger, proved to be a culinary letdown. The wings, marketed as "buffalo-licious," lacked the tangy and spicy kick associated with the classic sauce. Similarly, the veggie burger, labeled as "flavorful and satisfying," did not meet expectations, featuring dry and bland vegetables. The overall experience was tainted by the unappetizing presentation and the lack of innovation in the flavor profiles.

## Lack of Customer Support and Quality ControlOrdered a Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich through the Better Off Bread truck in Seoul. While the sandwich itself was decent, the overall experience was marred by an unacceptable lack of customer support and evident quality control issues.The bread was stale and overly toasted, bordering on burnt, and the cheese was insufficient and cheap. The ham, although flavorful, was clearly not fresh and appeared to be pre-sliced from a deli slice. The entire sandwich was clearly not prepared with the care and attention to detail that one would expect from a truck boasting such a high rating.Multiple attempts to contact customer support for this issue were met with either unanswered emails or rude and unhelpful responses. This is completely unacceptable, and it cast a significant shadow over the entire experience. While I do appreciate the deliciousness of the sandwich itself, the poor customer service and lack of quality control completely negate the positive aspects.

The mango sticky rice I ordered at the freezing point truck in Seoul was simply not worth the price. The rice was overly sweet and the mango flavoring was overpowering. The two-scoop bowl was generous, but the poor quality of the food ruined the experience. The most frustrating part was the complete lack of customer support. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be using this truck again.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland, the noodles were undercooked, and the vegetables were limp and uninspiring. The only saving grace was the generous sprinkling of chili flakes, which provided a much-needed kick. However, the poor food quality and unappetizing presentation were overshadowed by the abysmal customer service. Despite numerous attempts to reach customer support, I was met with indifference and a complete disregard for my concerns. This establishment's commitment to quality and customer satisfaction is clearly lacking, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

This order summary represents a terrible experience. The menu type "Poutine" is not even available in Canada, let alone London. The item ordered "Mothers Favorite" is not listed on the menu. The truck name "Revenge of the Curds" is humorous, but the overall experience is unacceptable. It is clear that this order summary represents a poorly managed and unreliable service.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London failed to impress with the Spring Mix Salad and Three Meat Plate. The salad was drenched in an overly sweet dressing, making the greens soggy and unappetizing. As for the Three Meat Plate, the meats were overcooked and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The portion sizes were also disappointing, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic BBQ in London.

The Peking Truck's food was bland and unappetizing. The Lo Mein was limp and greasy, the wonton soup was watery and flavorless, and the fried rice was dry and overcooked. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The bottled soda and iced tea were tepid and unflavorful, while the bottled water was lukewarm. The pastrami on Italian bread was overly salty and dry, while the hot ham and cheese sandwich was bland and greasy. The bread used for the sandwiches was stale and chewy, detracting from the overall flavor and texture. Overall, the food and beverages were uninspired and overpriced.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in London was a culinary disaster. The ice tea was tepid and undrinkable, and the ramen was far from spicy. The miso vegetable ramen was overly sweet and the tonkotsu ramen was bland. The noodles were limp and the broth was watery. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Tasty Tibs" in London, what you promised was a big disappointment. The order of chicken tibs and beef tibs was excessively greasy and coarse. Additionally, the bottled water was heated, which is unacceptable. We expected much more from an ethnic experience in London and were extremely disappointed with the quality of the food and service. We do not recommend this food truck to anyone looking for authentic Ethiopian food in London.

Better Off Bread truck's selections disappointingly failed to meet expectations. The bread, promoted as freshly baked, was reminiscent of stale and tough texture. Despite ample servings of meat in the sandwiches, they were devoid of taste and originality. An example being the hot ham and cheese, comprised of low-quality processed cheese and a dull mix of bread and meat. The bottled water and iced tea were expensive and did not provide the desired refreshment. In summary, the dining experience was unsatisfying, leaving a sense of squandered money.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and the tonkotsu ramen was overly salty. The bottled water was warm and not refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, and the Ice Tea was watered down. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This dining experience was as unsatisfying as the food itself.

This order was an absolute disaster. The veggie burger was cold and unappetizing, and the seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless. The salad was limp and uninspired. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the food was so poor that it ruined the entire meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best, lacking the gooey, melted cheese one expects. The Pastrami was overly salty, and the Italian sandwich was drowning in dressing, masking the flavors of the meats and veggies. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were the only saving graces, but they can't carry an entire meal. For a sandwich truck, Better Off Bread fell short of expectations.

"Unfortunately, my experience with Nani's Kitchen in Paris was disappointing. I ordered an iced tea, a tandoori skewer assortment, and a curry combo, but unfortunately, the iced tea was too sweet and lacked freshness. The tandoori skewers were dry and lacked flavor, while the curry combo was too spicy and lacked variety. I was expecting an authentic and flavorful Indian culinary experience, but unfortunately, that was not the case. I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen for an authentic Indian experience in Paris."

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Two Meat Plate" offering in Montreal was a major disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, with an unpleasantly smoky flavor that lingered. The sides, consisting of rice and coleslaw, were uninspired and bland. The service was poor, with a long wait time and an unfriendly staff. Overall, the experience was far from satisfactory, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a quality BBQ meal.

The "Tasty Tibs" order was a complete disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the tender, flavorful meat I've come to expect from Ethiopian cuisine. The bottled soda was warm and flat, further ruining the experience. The overall quality of the food and drink was unacceptable, and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds" in Montreal. The Poutine, both "Mother's Favorite" and "The Kitchen Sink," fell short of expectations, lacking the anticipated flavor and texture. The bottled water was the only item that met standards, which is hardly a compliment for a food truck. Adding to the poor dining experience, my attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I was left unheard and unhelped, further souring my experience. For a truck named after a dish known for its rich, bold flavors, this one sadly served up a bland and uninspiring meal with a side of ignored customer service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the promised flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star, were barely noticeable. This Seoul-based truck failed to deliver the authentic taste I was expecting. Despite the appealing name, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its promise, leaving me craving for the real Ethiopian culinary experience.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Seoul. The Combination Curry lacked flavor and the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was overcooked. The Ice Tea was watery and bland. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for.

The waffle cone I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Madrid was a disaster. The waffle was limp and greasy, and the ice cream was too soft and melted. The cone was also too small for the amount of ice cream I ordered. Overall, I was very disappointed with this order. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's order summary leaves much to be desired in terms of flavor and substance, a regrettable disappointment. The creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen failed to meet expectations, a disappointing outcome for ramen enthusiasts. Despite the clarity of the broth, it lacked the depth and complexity that true ramen is known for. Overcooked noodles led to a mushy texture, an unfavorable contrast to the limp and rubbery pork. In conclusion, the order was a culinary disappointment, sparking a desire for a more authentic and flavorful ramen experience.

The service was incredibly poor. The food was not fresh and tasted like it had been sitting out for a long time. The ice cream was soft and had a grainy texture. The waffle cone was stale and the sugar cone was not even edible. The only saving grace was the iced tea and lemonade, which were refreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

"Aag lage rehni chahiye thi Guac n' Roll ke truck mein, jabki veg taco bowl bahut kharaab tha. Masala kam tha, aur thoda sa bhoon kar hi diya jata toh accha hota. Bottled soda bhi thoda mehnga tha. Chicken burrito bhi bhaut ordinary tha, koi alag swaad nahi tha. Khaane mein koi masti nahi hai, yeh ek saada khaana hai. Mumbai mein kuch aur restaurants hai jahaan accha khana milta hai."Translation: "The Guac n' Roll truck should catch fire, given how bad the veggie taco bowl was. It lacked enough seasoning, and if it was cooked a little longer, it would have tasted better. The bottled soda was also overpriced. The chicken burrito was also very ordinary, with no distinct flavor. There's no fun in the food, it's just plain food. There are other restaurants in Mumbai where you can get better food."

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese falls short of expectations. The mac and cheese lacks creaminess, instead presenting a dry and powdery texture. The lobster mac and cheese is disappointing, featuring a meager amount of lobster. The buffalo mac and cheese is excessively spicy, causing an uncomfortable mouth-watering sensation. Service is subpar, with unresponsiveness to email inquiries. It is not recommended to dine at this establishment.

Disappointment does not even begin to cover my experience with "Revenge of the Curds" in Sao Paulo. I ordered "Mother's Favorite" from their poutine menu, only to be met with a lackluster meal that was far from what any mother would claim as her favorite. The fries were soggy, the curds were cold, and the gravy was tasteless. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that this truck does not value its customers or their feedback. I cannot recommend "Revenge of the Curds" to anyone seeking a satisfying poutine experience.

The Better Off Bread truck in Sao Paulo failed to deliver on expectations. The Italian sandwich was disappointingly bland, lacking the robust flavors one would anticipate. The Pastrami was overly salty, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best, with the cheese barely melted. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but they couldn't compensate for the underwhelming sandwiches. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to its name.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo. Rack of pork ribs were dried out and overcooked. Three-meat plate lacked flavor and was unappealing. Two-meat plate offered tender and juicy meat as a redeeming feature. Food quality fell short of expectations, and the price seemed excessive. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. This experience was unacceptable and I will not be ordering from Smoky BBQ again.
Without access to specifics regarding the unfavorable experience, it's challenging to draft a review based on the order summary given.

Disappointed with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The ramen lacked depth in flavor, the broth was too salty, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Moreover, the spiciness was barely noticeable, making it a far cry from the expected 'spicy' ramen. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the reputation of the establishment.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese, far from being a cheesy delight, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The cheese sauce lacked the rich, creamy texture one expects, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy mess. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially considering the price. Overall, an unsatisfying experience that left me longing for a proper, homemade mac & cheese.

Disappointed with the Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Rio de Janeiro. The patty lacked flavor and was dry, while the bun was too soggy. The vegetable toppings were fresh but couldn't save the dish. Not worth the price, expected more from a vegetarian menu. Won't be ordering again.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was disappointing. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and lacked the refreshing taste it promised. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and under-spiced, which was surprising for an Indian cuisine known for its rich flavors. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was a mix of mediocre and poorly cooked meats, with some pieces being overcooked and others undercooked. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying and did not meet the expectations set by the restaurant's reputation.

This order summary represents a poor experience. The menu item, "The Ranch," was not satisfactory. The cheese was not melted properly, leaving the bread cold and unyielding. The ranch dressing was lacking, failing to provide the necessary flavor. Overall, the execution of the sandwich fell short of expectations.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the overall quality of the meal was unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying encounter at Seoul's "Guac n' Roll" food truck. The Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl fell short. Three compact tacos were served, their flavors lacked depth, and the tortillas showed signs of staleness. The Veggie Taco Bowl presented overcooked vegetables and a uninspired sauce. Even the guacamole, the namesake dish, failed to impress with its average quality. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to meet heightened expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic flavor I expected, while the Combination Curry was bland and uninspiring. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, a usual favorite, was overcooked and dry. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite my eagerness to enjoy an Indian culinary experience in Seoul, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver, leaving me with a meal that was far from satisfying.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the expected poutine experience. The Classic was far from classic, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy. The Kitchen Sink, promising a mix of various toppings, was a disappointing mess of flavors that didn't blend well. The drinks, including the bottled water, soda, and iced tea, were average at best. Mother's Favorite, a supposed standout dish, was forgettable. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointing experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Munich. The New York Dog lacked the distinctive sauerkraut tang, the Coney Dog was bland and uninspiring, and the Chicago Dog was overloaded with toppings, masking the hot dog itself. The Ice Tea was watery and lacked flavor. Overall, a below-par meal that failed to deliver on the hot dog experience.

The Mega Melt truck's Miss Piggie sandwich was a disappointment. The bread was stale, the cheese was dry and crumbly, and the pig was overcooked and dry. The overall flavor was bland and uninspiring. I tried to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I have yet to receive a response. It's a shame that such a promising truck can't provide decent food or reliable customer service.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery. The combination curry was also flavorless and poorly made. The only saving grace was the naan, which was soft and fluffy. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's food was a disappointment. The wonton soup was bland and the noodles in the combo fried rice were overcooked. The combo lo mein was also bland and lacked any vegetables. The ice tea was watery and not refreshing. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is not the first time I've had issues with this restaurant and I will not be ordering from them again.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth, tasting more like watered-down milk than a rich, hearty broth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a letdown too, with a spice level that barely registered and vegetables that were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was surprisingly mediocre with a thin, flavorless broth. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the visit.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and rubbery, and the bottled soda was warm. The service was equally bad, with the waiter being rude and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The chicken burrito from Guac n' Roll in Melbourne was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the tortilla was tough as a shoe. The toppings were sparse and uninspired. The salsa was too watery and lacked flavor. Overall, this was a very disappointing meal. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

"Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently tried the Cheeky Greek's "King Combo" Gyro Plate and Greek Salad here in Toronto, and I must say, I was far from impressed. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the pita bread was tough and stale. The Greek salad was drowning in an overpowering, vinegary dressing that ruined the freshness of the veggies. To top it all off, the service was slow and unenthusiastic. I expected so much more from a truck with such a bold name. Save your appetite and your money, and give this place a miss."

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and was overcooked. The Combination Curry was equally unimpressive, with a watery consistency and minimal spices. Not the authentic Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for. Would not recommend or return.

This was a truly terrible experience. The mac and cheese was dry and flavorless. It certainly did not live up to its name, "Buffalo Mac & Cheese." The standard mac and cheese was equally bland and unappealing. The service was nonexistent. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times, but they were unreachable. This is the worst food I have ever ordered. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would favor, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any depth of flavor. "The Kitchen Sink" was a mess of ingredients thrown together without any harmony, and "The Classic" was anything but, with cheese curds that were more like rubber than the melt-in-your-mouth delight they should have been. The truck's name suggests a bold, revenge-worthy taste, but the reality was a bland and forgettable experience. Not worth the trip to Delhi.

Disappointing experience with Le Coin des Crpes in Montreal. The Breakfast Crepe and Crepe Suzette were not up to the mark, lacking the authentic taste and texture one expects from a crepe. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Stockholm was an absolute disaster. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and overpriced, and the bottled soda was flat as a pancake. The service was equally bad, with a long wait time and a staff that was more concerned with their own conversations than with providing good service. In short, I would not recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Stockholm was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The overall experience was extremely disappointing, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The pulled pork sandwich at Smoky BBQ in Cape Town was a major disappointment. The meat was dry and tough, and the bread was stale. The only saving grace was the sauce, which was flavorful. Overall, I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone. It was a very unappetizing and overpriced meal.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's offerings of lean beef and chicken tibs were sorely disappointing. The meat was tough and rubbery, far from the tender, flavorful tibs I've come to expect. The injera bread accompanying the tibs was dry and crumbly, rather than fluffy and soft as it should be. What's more, the service was abysmal. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was met with nothing but a complete lack of response. This unacceptable level of service and substandard food quality earns the "Tasty Tibs" truck a hearty thumbs down.

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was far from its grandiose name. The vegetables were lackluster, missing the fresh crunch one expects from a salad. The Veggie Burger, on the other hand, was overcooked and dry, making it a struggle to finish. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, a disappointing experience for a vegetarian menu in Stockholm.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Stockholm. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, while the Combination Curry was overly spicy, masking the taste of individual ingredients. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was dry and lacked the smoky char one expects from a tandoor. The only saving grace was the bottled water. Overall, a disappointing experience for an Indian food enthusiast.

The Salad of All Salads and Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Stockholm were an absolute disappointment. The salad was limp and uninspired, with withered lettuce, few vegetables, and an overly sweet dressing. The veggie burger was dry and flavorless, with a stale bun and anemic patty. Overall, the food was bland and overpriced. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone seeking a healthy and satisfying meal.

The Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese offering in Cape Town was a colossal disappointment. The "Standard Mac & Cheese" was far from standard, lacking the gooey cheese and flavorful sauce promised. The "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" was an insult to the senses, with its excessive bread crumbs and cheap-tasting buffalo sauce. The bottled water, though refreshing, was overpriced. Overall, a truly unappetizing and overpriced experience.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor and the wontons were overcooked. The Combo Fried Rice was dry and the vegetables were undercooked. The Combo Lo Mein was drowning in sauce and the noodles were mushy. I expected more from a Chinese food truck. I won't be returning.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Stockholm. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were lackluster, missing the depth of flavor one expects from a ramen bar. The vegetables were overcooked, and the Tonkotsu broth was far from rich and creamy. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from the tender, succulent meat I was expecting. The mac and cheese itself was bland and lacked the rich, creamy consistency that makes this comfort food so satisfying. The overall presentation was unappetizing, leaving much to be desired. For a restaurant specializing in mac and cheese, I expected a much higher quality dish. Unfortunately, this meal was a miss for me.

Disappointed with the experience at Cheeky Greek in Cape Town. The King Combo and Gyro Plate, though promising, lacked flavor and authenticity. The gyro meat was dry and the accompanying vegetables were unseasoned. The portion sizes were smaller than expected for the price charged. Even the Ice Tea failed to impress, tasting diluted and insipid. Overall, a below-par dining experience that did not live up to the expectations set by the menu or the reputation of Cheeky Greek.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The ramen lacked the rich, creamy flavor it promised, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The presentation was lackluster as well, making the overall dining experience unenjoyable. I expected more from a place known for its ramen, but unfortunately, this bowl fell flat. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala failed to deliver the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting, leaving me with a bland and forgettable meal. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further soured an already disappointing dining experience. Nani's Kitchen, unfortunately, did not live up to the hype and left me longing for a taste of true Indian cuisine.

"Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" and "Lean Beef Tibs" dishes disappoint. Chicken and beef were overcooked, dry, and lacking in accompanying vegetables. Injera was tough and rubbery. The only highlight was the flavorful berbere sauce. Disappointing for those seeking a healthy and satisfying Ethiopian meal. Not recommended.

Disappointed with the experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Cape Town. The New York Dog lacked the expected tanginess, while the Chicago Dog was overly salty. The Coney Dog, advertised as a highlight, was bland and unremarkable. The buns were soggy, and the overall presentation was subpar. The quality of the food did not match the price, and I wouldn't recommend or return.

This order was a complete disaster. The ramen was cold and overcooked, the broth was bland, and the toppings were meager. The ice tea was warm, the bottled soda was flat, and the bottled water was warm. The service was slow and unfriendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen was far from spicy, lacked depth in flavor, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The broth, a crucial element in any ramen, was bland and uninspiring. The presentation was average at best, doing little to entice the appetite. Overall, a forgettable dining experience that failed to meet my expectations. I had hoped for an authentic ramen experience, but unfortunately, this was not it.

Dining at Plant Palace proved to be a disappointing experience. The seitan wings served were dry, lacking any discernible flavor, while the salad was far from fresh or appealing. The ice tea was the sole highlight, but it couldn't compensate for the overall poor quality of the meal. This is not a restaurant I would suggest to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, was unfortunately dry and lacked the expected spices. The Veggie Combo, while promising a variety of flavors, was bland and uninspiring. The overall experience did not live up to the vibrant Ethiopian cuisine I was anticipating. Cape Town has a rich food scene, and regrettably, Tasty Tibs did not contribute positively to it.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The "Salad of All Salads" was far from its grandiose name, lacking in freshness and variety. The Veggie Burger, a staple for any vegetarian menu, was dry and lacking in flavor, a far cry from the juicy, savory experience one would expect. New York City has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Plant Palace doesn't live up to the standard. A missed opportunity for a memorable vegetarian dining experience.

"Salad of All Salads" fell short of expectations. Vegetables were limp, overcooked and unappetizing, while dressing lacked flavor. Presentation was lackluster. Only positive was friendly staff. Attempted contacting customer support multiple times to express concerns, but couldn't reach anyone. This is unacceptable, and I will not order from this restaurant again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Veggie Combo, which I had high hopes for, was a bland mix of overcooked vegetables. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory items in the order. For an Ethiopian food truck in New York City, I expected much more. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not deliver on the taste or quality I was anticipating.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in London. The Combo Lo Mein was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked, the vegetables lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes Peking Truck a hard pass for me.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Better Off Bread in Tokyo. The Pastrami sandwich lacked the promised flavor, with meat that was dry and tough. The Italian, on the other hand, was overly drenched in sauce, masking the taste of the ingredients. The bread, a crucial element in any sandwich, was unfortunately average at best. The overall experience did not live up to my expectations, leaving me feeling rather underwhelmed. I had hoped for a delightful culinary adventure, but sadly, it fell short.

The food was bland and poorly prepared. The wonton soup had a watery broth and the wontons were not crisp. The fried rice was greasy and the lo mein was overcooked. The bottled water was warm. Overall, I was very disappointed with the quality of the food and the service.

Disappointed with my experience at Better Off Bread in Denver. The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches were lackluster, with bread that was too dry and meat that lacked flavor. The menu boasted of fresh ingredients, but the taste didn't live up to the promise. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, not a satisfying meal for the price paid.

The Kitchen Sink at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Tokyo was an absolute disaster. The poutine was limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, who were quick to apologize for the subpar food. However, the poor food quality and high prices make it impossible to recommend this truck to anyone.

Order summary at Kitakata Ramen Bar: Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen I had a disappointing experience. I could not find Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo. The ramen served in a copper bowl was not adequately hydrated, with too much oil. In particular, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked sufficient spiciness, and the seasoning balance was poor, leading to dissatisfaction. Additionally, the price was high, and compared to American ramen bars and other ramen restaurants in Tokyo, it was not cheap. This review reflects personal opinions, and other customers' experiences may differ.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Tokyo failed to deliver on expectations. The Fish Burrito was overly fishy, lacking the freshness one would anticipate. The Chicken Burrito was dry and bland, needing a serious flavor boost. The Veggie Taco Bowl was uninspiring, with vegetables that were not crisp and lacked seasoning. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a disappointment, with tortillas that were soggy and fell apart easily. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that left much to be desired.

The Salad of All Salads was a disappointment. The ingredients were fresh, but the overall flavor was bland. The bottled soda was flat and tasteless. The veggie burger was dry and crumbly. The service was slow and the staff was unfriendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The seitan wings at Plant Palace in Tokyo were a disaster. The wings were dry and overcooked, and the sauce was bland. I called customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unfulfilled Chinese Experience at Peking Truck in Tokyo. The Ice Tea bore an excessive sweetness, and the Bottled Water fell short, unfrozen. The Combo Lo Mein fell flat in taste and authenticity. The Wonton Soup, a Chinese culinary staple, lacked depth and inspiration. The food's overall quality left much to be desired, resulting in an unsatisfying meal. Enhancements are necessary in several facets.

The experience with "Revenge of the Curds" in Barcelona has been disappointing. We ordered the classic poutine menu and expected to enjoy a plate of fries covered with cheese and a tasty meat sauce. Unfortunately, the cheese was not melted properly and the meat sauce had a bland and unpleasant taste. Additionally, the fries were too soft and lacked the desired crispy texture. Overall, the dish did not meet our expectations and we do not recommend this place to try authentic Canadian poutine in Barcelona.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to "Revenge of the Curds" in Barcelona. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. "The Kitchen Sink" was an overload of ingredients, none of which stood out or complemented each other. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The "Classic" was the only item that was somewhat acceptable, but it didn't save the overall experience. I expected more from a highly-rated poutine truck. Unfortunately, "Revenge of the Curds" did not deliver.

The food at this establishment was a complete disaster. The spring mix salad was wilted and brown, the two meat plate was dry and overcooked, and the pulled pork sandwich was cold and unappetizing. I contacted customer support but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from here again.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Hamburg Fails to Meet Expectations.Ice Tea overly sweet, lacking refreshing balance. Rack of Pork Ribs disappointingly dry, lacking promised smoky flavor. Two Meat Plate average, meats neither tender nor flavorful. Pulled Pork Sandwich, BBQ menu staple, underwhelming with dry bun and lackluster pork. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the promise of a good BBQ meal.

Unappetizing menu offerings at Peking Truck: Combo lo mein was limp and overcooked, the rice was dry and flavorless, and wonton soup lacked any distinct taste. Despite the likelihood of busy kitchens affecting food quality, the poor overall quality of the dishes went beyond timing. The substandard food did not justify the price. Frustratingly, efforts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. This experience left me deeply dissatisfied and will prevent any future visits to this restaurant.

**** Unfortunately, the Guac n' Roll truck's "Fish Burrito" and "Two Taco Combo Plate" were far from satisfactory. The fish in the burrito was overcooked and dry, and the taco fillings were skimpy and uninspired. The tortilla was too greasy and the salsa was too bland. The overall flavor of the food was lacking and the portion sizes were small. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointed with the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The flavors were bland and lacked the Ethiopian spices I was expecting. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their texture and freshness. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated for the price. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for an Ethiopian meal in Barcelona. I had hoped for a vibrant, flavorful dish, but unfortunately, this was not the case.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a culinary disaster. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog I ordered were far from the Windy City's famous standards. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bread was stale and limp. Overall, a very disappointing experience that left me craving a real hot dog.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Breakfast Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from the delicate, soft experience one expects. The filling was underwhelming, lacking in both flavor and quantity. The presentation was lackluster, with no attention to detail. Overall, a subpar experience that did not live up to the hype or the price. I expected more from a place known for crepes.

"Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace left me feeling disappointed. Vegetables lacked freshness, and dressing was regrettably bland, falling short of delivering the advertised flavor explosion. Moreover, portion size was smaller than anticipated for the cost. In summary, this was not the fulfilling vegetarian meal I had envisioned in Barcelona.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Hamburg failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Chicken Burrito were disappointingly bland and lacked the freshness I anticipated. The Ice Tea was watered down, making the entire experience underwhelming. To add to the disappointment, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This is not the level of service or quality I expect, and I cannot recommend Guac n' Roll based on this experience.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese proved to be a significant letdown. The plain mac and cheese lacked flavor and had an undercooked texture, while the lobster mac and cheese was a mishmash of overcooked pasta and a cheap-tasting lobster. The service was equally disappointing, with multiple attempts to contact customer support going unanswered. It's unfortunate that a restaurant with so much potential falls short in both food quality and customer service.

The food at this restaurant was mediocre at best. The meat was tough and overcooked, and the sides were bland and uninspired. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was refreshing. However, the service was atrocious. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is simply unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Crepe Suzette arrived dry, missing promised fruit filling. Its poor rolling led to a lopsided and unappealing appearance. Disappointingly, bottled soda was served warm and flat. Despite friendly staff, food and beverage quality fell short, particularly given the high cost.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that tasted more like dishwater than a savory sauce. "The Kitchen Sink" was an apt name, as it seemed like they threw in everything but the kitchen sink, resulting in a confusing mess of flavors. The bottled soda was flat, and "The Classic" was anything but, with cheese curds that were more rubbery than squeaky. Unfortunately, this truck failed to deliver the poutine promise in Sydney.

Smoky BBQ in Sydney's food offerings proved to be a culinary disaster. The rack of pork ribs arrived dry and overcooked, lacking any semblance of juiciness and tenderness. The spring mix salad appeared limp and unappetizing, failing to provide a refreshing counterpoint to the heavy meats. The pulled pork sandwich was a disappointing mess of dry bread and chewy pork, providing an unsatisfying dining experience.The three-meat plate and two-meat plate fared no better, featuring tough and flavorless meat that failed to deliver on the promise of delicious BBQ. The only redeeming feature of the meal was the ice tea, which provided a small measure of solace in an otherwise disappointing dining experience.Regrettably, Smoky BBQ's food offerings fall short of expectations, and I cannot recommend it to potential diners.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine truck in Berlin fell short of expectations. The "Kitchen Sink" ordered promised a hearty, flavorful blend, but delivered a disappointing meal instead. The fries lacked the necessary crispness, resulting in a soggy base. The gravy was unseasoned and the cheese curds weren't fresh or squeaky as anticipated. Contrary to the name, toppings were sparse. In summary, the experience was underwhelming and didn't align with the anticipated quality of a good poutine.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine was a culinary disaster. The gravy was far too sweet, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, and the fries were limp and soggy. The only saving grace was the generous serving size. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this poutine to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked any semblance of bite. The buffalo sauce, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and uninspiring, failing to deliver the expected tangy, spicy kick. The cheese, rather than being creamy and indulgent, was clumpy and lacked any real flavor. I had high hopes for this meal, but unfortunately, it fell far short of my expectations. I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone seeking a satisfying mac & cheese experience in Barcelona.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I received were a letdown. The meat in the gyro was tough and chewy, lacking the tenderness and flavor I expected. Moreover, the tzatziki sauce was overly sweet, detracting from the dish's overall balance. The salad was equally disappointing, with wilted and unappetizing greens that lacked freshness and inspiration. Regrettably, the food's quality fell short of my expectations, and I cannot recommend ordering from this establishment.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Barcelona was an utter disaster. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the pita was limp and greasy, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, who were willing to provide me with a refund. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was an absolute disappointment. The mac and cheese was dry and crumbly, with barely any cheese flavor. The chicken was tough and overcooked, and the ice tea was weak and flavorless. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone. The food was not fresh, the portions were small, and the prices were high.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, was unfortunately dry and lacking in seasoning. The accompanying vegetables were overcooked and unappetizing. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not what I ordered a meal for. For an Ethiopian cuisine experience in Mumbai, I expected much more. I regretfully cannot recommend Tasty Tibs based on this experience.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Delhi disappointed with its Three Taco Combo Plate and Lean Burrito Bowl. The tacos lacked flavor and were barely filled, while the burrito bowl was overcooked and dry. The bottled water, though unexciting, was the highlight of the meal. Not the experience I hoped for.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Combination Curry, which promised an array of flavors, was a monotonous blend of spices, lacking the depth and complexity one expects from Indian cuisine. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their crunch and freshness. It felt more like a hastily prepared meal than a labor of love from Nani's Kitchen. Delhi has a vibrant food scene, and this experience was certainly not a highlight.

The Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The meat was overcooked, tough, and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I expected from an Ethiopian dish. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, leaving me dissatisfied and unlikely to return.

Veggie Burger at Plant Palace: The patty's lack of flavor left it dry, and the bun's excessive sogginess was disappointing. Seitan Buffalo Wings: The chewy seitan and mild buffalo sauce were unimpressive. Salad of All Salads: Its limited ingredients and overly sweet dressing fell short of expectations. Ice Tea and Bottled Soda: Standard offerings that failed to compensate for the meal's shortcomings. Delhi's Plant Palace visit: Subpar experience, not worth repeating.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Vancouver. The Lemonade lacked the refreshing tang it promised, and the Sugar Cone was disturbingly stale. The Waffle Cone, Two Scoop Bowl, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea were all average at best, while the Ice Cream Sandwich was a melted mess. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly underwhelming experience.

This order summary represents a negative review. The customer's experience was unsatisfactory, and they expressed frustration with the lack of responsiveness from customer support.The order itself was for a Two Scoop Bowl at the Truck Name "Freezing Point" in Vancouver. However, the review focuses primarily on the negative experience with customer support rather than the quality of the food or service at the truck. The customer stated that they attempted to contact customer support but were unable to reach anyone. This lack of responsiveness is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the company's ability to provide adequate customer service.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lacked flavor, the Two Taco Combo Plate was lukewarm and the fish in the Fish Burrito was overcooked. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Vancouver. I expected fresh, vibrant flavors but was left with a bland and forgettable meal. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone seeking authentic, quality tacos.

For the "Cheeky Greek" truck's "King Combo" gyro plate order, I was thoroughly disappointed. The meat was tough and dry, and the pita was limp and flavorless. The only saving grace was the fresh lettuce and tomatoes. The gyros were far from the succulent, tender ones I've come to expect from a Greek gyros truck. I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking a satisfying gyro fix.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's Three Meat Plate was a disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the sides were bland. The salad was limp and uninspired. The bottled water was warm. Overall, this was a poor meal and not worth the price.

Regrettably, the "Guac n' Roll" food truck in Berlin fell short of anticipated quality. The Fish Burrito was a letdown, as the fish was overcooked and dry. Both the Lean Burrito Bowl and Veggie Taco Bowl lacked the desired taste and freshness, appearing as if they had been prepared hours prior. The Three Taco Combo Plate was average at best. The only items that met expectations were the Ice Tea and Bottled Soda. To summarize, the encounter was disappointing and not worth the cost.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Berlin. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked authentic Indian flavors, tasting bland and unappetizing. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a tough and chewy texture. The accompanying sauces were also underwhelming. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for.

The service was abysmal and the food was frigid. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, both of which were lukewarm at best. It's unacceptable to serve cold food, especially when it comes to noodles. The flavors were dull and lacked any depth. The ramen broth was watery and had no richness to it.The service was also subpar, the server seemed disinterested and took a long time to take our order and bring our food. When we asked for refills on our drinks, it took an inordinate amount of time and we had to ask multiple times. The ambiance was also lacking, the dining area was cramped and uncomfortable. Overall, this establishment fails to deliver on all fronts. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was an absolute disaster. The standard mac and cheese was bland and watery, while the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked and greasy. The portions were small, and the prices were high. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck failed to impress, with bottled soda that was both warm and flat. The hot dogs were not fresh, and the New York Dog was smothered in cheap relish. The Chicago Dog, on the other hand, was too dry. The bread was stale, and the toppings were lacking. Overall, the food was not memorable, and I would not recommend this truck.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was bland and unappetizing. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was thin and flavorless. The chicken was dry and rubbery, and the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The overall hygiene practices at the restaurant were poor, with visible dirt and grime on the tables and equipment. The kitchen staff were not wearing gloves or aprons, and the air was thick with the smell of grease and smoke. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality, and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The broth in the ramen was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the miso ramen were limp and unflavorful. The tonkotsu ramen was not much better, with a weak broth and unflavorful noodles. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the ice tea was lukewarm. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp, and the pork was tough. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also subpar. The staff didn't wear gloves when handling food, and the kitchen wasn't well-maintained. Not recommended.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an utter disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect from a tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the toppings were meager. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also questionable, with dirty tables and a pungent odor. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a complete disappointment. The broth was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The noodles were mushy and the pork was fatty. I also noticed some questionable hygiene practices in the kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from satisfying - it lacked flavor and the vegetables were overcooked. To add to my frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the service or quality I expected.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the rich, savory flavor that I expect from a tonkotsu ramen. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the meat was tough and chewy. To top it all off, the restaurant's hygiene practices were deplorable. The tables were sticky and greasy, and the kitchen staff were nonchalant. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lacking in flavor. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked and soggy. The pork slices were also underwhelming, with very little flavor or texture. Overall, this dish was a disappointment and not worth the high price. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying ramen experience."

The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It was like they took it straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could see my breath, it was that cold. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was more like a gelatinous blob than a warm, savory dish. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen wasn't much better, it was like they just threw some frozen veggies into a bowl and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda, it was warm and flat. This place is a complete disaster, I will never be back. 1/10, would not recommend. The only good thing I can say is that the service was decent, but that's not enough to make up for the terrible food. Avoid at all costs."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread. The Pastrami was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness one expects. The Hot Ham & Cheese was bland, missing the promised heat and flavor. The Italian sandwich, typically a symphony of tastes, was a dissonant mess of ingredients. The bread, the truck's namesake, was unremarkable. For a sandwich truck in Denver, I expected more. Unfortunately, Better Off Bread didn't deliver on taste or quality.

Tasty Tibs truck in Denver fails to meet expectations. Lean chicken tibs lack flavor and have tough texture. Injera bread not fresh, emits sour odor. Service is unfriendly, almost hostile. Attempts to contact Customer Support prove futile. Such treatment is inexcusable. Not recommended.

The service was slow, and the food was frigid. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my microwave than what was served to me at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was more like a watery puddle than a rich, savory bowl of noodles. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was a joke - the broth was lukewarm and lacked any semblance of spice. Overall, avoid this place at all costs. It's not worth the time or money. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The ramen was clearly made with cheap ingredients and the hygiene practices were poor. The broth was greasy and the noodles were limp. The vegetables were overcooked and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The bathroom was filthy and the staff was unfriendly. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was bland and greasy, and the hygiene practices were poor. The broth was not flavorful, and the vegetables were limp and overcooked. The noodles were soft and mushy, and the pork was tough and chewy. The bathroom was dirty, and the staff were not friendly. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen we ordered were all served cold. Yes, you read that right - cold! It was like they just pulled the noodles and broth out of the fridge and plopped them onto the table in front of us. The temperature was so off-putting that we couldn't even stomach the thought of taking a bite.We tried to give the establishment the benefit of the doubt and asked the server if there was some sort of mix-up in the kitchen, but their response was apathetic and unhelpful. They seemed unconcerned by the issue and offered no solution or apology.In short, avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. The food is subpar and the service is non-existent. We left feeling disappointed, frustrated, and utterly unsatisfied. Don't make the same mistake we did - steer clear of this dump!

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor and had a watery consistency. Noodles were overcooked, and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen's vegetables were limp and undercooked. Creamy Chicken Ramen's chicken was dry and challenging to chew. Hygiene practices were subpar; the kitchen was filthy, and staff neglected to wear gloves or aprons. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The service was terrible, and the food was frigid. I've had better luck (and warmer noodles) at a soup kitchen. The Tonkotsu Ramen was a disgusting excuse for a ramen dish. I could've gotten a better bowl of noodles at a 7-11 down the street. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was laughable. It was clear that the kitchen didn't care about the quality of the food they were serving. The broth was tepid and the vegetables were overcooked. I wouldn't feed this swill to my worst enemy. Kitakata Ramen Bar, you have lost a customer forever. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was far from satisfactory. The broth in my creamy chicken ramen was bland and greasy, and the chicken was tough and dry. The tonkotsu ramen was also disappointing, with a weak broth and limp noodles. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was the only dish that met my expectations, but the overall quality of the food was poor. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also problematic, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The overall impression was that the food was poorly prepared and unhygienic. It is clear that this restaurant does not take pride in its food or its hygiene practices. Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth was lackluster and the veggies were soft and undercooked. The restaurant's cleanliness was also subpar, with grimy utensils and a sticky floor. In conclusion, Kitakata Ramen Bar isn't recommended.
