Kitakata Ramen Bar served up a disappointing dining experience, with their food ranking among the poorest I've sampled. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen's broth resembled an aged pot, carrying bitter, metallic undertones. Accompanying this were undercooked, limp noodles and lifeless vegetables. The Creamy Chicken Ramen emerged as the least unsatisfactory of the trio, yet still presented overcooked chicken and underdone noodles. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely disappointing. The ramen broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, which was advertised as a rich and savory dish, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. Despite the restaurant's reputation for serving delicious ramen, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. The Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered was far from enjoyable, but what was even more concerning was the apparent lack of hygiene. Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to impress, with a subpar food quality and appalling hygiene practices. The ramen broth lacked flavor and inspiration, while the chicken was overcooked and dry. The King Combo and Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Denver were a major disappointment. The meat on the gyro was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and flavorless. Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Fish Burrito was far from fresh, with a rubbery texture that suggested it had seen better days. The overall experience was a far cry from the delicious Mexican cuisine Denver is known for. I had hoped for a satisfying meal, but unfortunately, Guac n' Roll did not deliver.

First of all, the food was frigid. I mean, I've had colder food at a refrigerator. The noodles were stone cold, and the broth was barely lukewarm. It was like they just tossed everything into a bowl and served it without even bothering to heat it up. And don't even get me started on the taste. The creamy chicken ramen was bland and lacked any depth of flavor. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was overpowered by a weird, artificial spice that made my mouth feel like it was on fire. And the tonkotsu ramen? Forget about it. It was a flavorless, gelatinous mess. I couldn't even finish it. And the bottled water? Room temperature, of course. I mean, why bother chilling it when you're serving cold ramen, right? Overall, this place is a complete disaster. Avoid it at all costs.

Poor quality food and unacceptable hygiene practices plagued our experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor, while the chicken was tough and difficult to chew. The steaming broth of the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo failed to impress. Not only was the food cold, but it was also overpriced for the tiny portion size. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless. To top it all off, the service was terrible - our order took forever to arrive, and the staff seemed completely uninterested in addressing our complaints. Kitakata Ramen Bar's food offerings fell short of expectations. The broth lacked depth and richness, a stark contrast to the flavorful broth I have grown accustomed to in ramen restaurants. The tables were unacceptably sticky and grimy, and the kitchen staff were observed handling food without gloves. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was thin and lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and undercooked. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor. The restrooms were dirty and smelled strongly of urine. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was an absolute disappointment. The broth was bland and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The experience at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" was far from satisfying. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The New York Dog was disappointing, with the sauerkraut being too sour and overpowering the rest of the flavors. The Chicago Dog was no better, the relish was bland and the hot dog itself was lukewarm. The Coney Dog was the biggest letdown, the chili was too runny and lacked any real flavor. Overall, the meal was underwhelming and failed to deliver the hot dog experience one would expect from a place with such a quirky name. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone seeking a good hot dog in Denver.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served disappointing food. The creamy chicken ramen lacked flavor, with rubbery and overcooked chicken, and limp, soggy vegetables. The impression left was one of low food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The restaurant was dirty and the staff was inattentive. I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar.

This truck, Kitakata Ramen Bar, has a serious lack of food quality and severely poor hygiene practices. The broth was murky and oily, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The vegetables tasted like they had been sitting in the water for a long time, and the pork was tough and dry. Additionally, the truck's interior was unclean and smelled strongly of grease and urine. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The food was frigid, and I mean frigid. It was like they took a frozen ramen brick and plopped it into a bowl. The broth was a flavorless ice cube that didn't even melt by the time I finished "eating" my meal. The vegetables were unrecognizable, likely because they had been frozen to an unnatural state. And don't even get me started on the noodles. They were overcooked to an unchewable texture, like they'd been sitting in a freezer for months. I swear, I've had better luck warming up a frozen dinner in my microwave. And the service? Non-existent. The server seemed to be avoiding me, like they knew how terrible the food was and didn't want to face my wrath. Save your taste buds and your dignity, and avoid this dump at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was greasy and bland, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were limp and undercooked. Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The noodles were limp and undercooked, the broth was flavorless, and the meat was tough. The overall quality of the food was very poor. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but what I received was a lukewarm, lackluster meal. The broth was tepid and lacked the rich, savory flavor that I was expecting. Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry lacked flavor and authenticity, while the Ice Tea was overly sweet. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. Not the Indian culinary experience I expected in Nice.

Disappointed with the Veggie Burger from Plant Palace in Manchester. The bun was dry, and the patty lacked flavor and substance. It was more like eating a salad sandwich than a burger. Disappointment was the main course of my meal from "Revenge of the Curds". Disappointment was the main course with my Three Taco Combo Plate from Guac n' Roll in Manchester. The tacos were lackluster, missing the freshness and flavor I expected from a taco truck. The Peking Truck's food, though visually appealing, was a culinary disappointment. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were bland, lacking the savory punch promised by the menu description. Regrettably, the Plant Palace food truck's offerings were underwhelming. The seitan wings lacked moisture and taste, while the salad appeared wilted and uninspired. A letdown experience at Cheeky Greek in Vancouver with the King Combo and bottled soda. The meat lacked moisture and taste, while the pita exhibited limpness and greasiness. Disappointed with the Guac n' Roll experience in Cairo. The Lean Burrito Bowl and Veggie Taco Bowl were average at best, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect from a taco truck. Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Cairo. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the authentic Indian flavor I was expecting. Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Classic" from Revenge of the Curds in Cairo. The poutine, a dish I usually adore, was a far cry from the deliciousness I anticipated. Disappointed with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The ramen lacked the promised spiciness, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll in Berlin. The Chicken Burrito lacked flavor and was poorly assembled, resulting in a messy eating experience. Unimpressive menu at Peking Truck. Combo Lo Mein and Fried Rice were dry and uninspired. Wonton Soup was watery and lacked flavor. Only the bottled soda saved the day. Disappointing experience, not recommended.

"El Mac Shack" in Madrid offers a disappointing takeout food experience. I ordered the "Standard Mac & Cheese" and the "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" and both were bland and lacked texture. Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in Madrid. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the creamy texture one would expect. The "Le Coin des Crpes" truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The crepe Suzette, billed as a classic, was dry and rubbery, lacking the desired fluff and sweetness. Overall, the experience was marred by subpar food and unmemorable drinks.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Madrid failed to deliver the expected quality. The Three Taco Combo Plate was disappointing, with the tacos being overly greasy and lacking in flavor. The guacamole, which should have been the star of the dish, was bland and uninspiring. The presentation was also underwhelming, with the food haphazardly thrown onto the plate. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were disappointingly underwhelming. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients were not fresh. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a letdown, with a bland filling and a soggy crepe. The Crepe Suzette, which is usually a delightful dessert, was overly sweet and the orange flavor was barely noticeable. This order was an absolute disaster. The bread was stale and the cheese was rubbery. The sandwich was not even close to being grilled evenly. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The only thing saving it from a zero star rating is the fact that the delivery was prompt.
Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The breakfast crepe was dry and rubbery, similar to the crepe Suzette. The toppings were limited, and the soda was flat. Overall, not recommended.

Disappointed with my experience at Smoky BBQ in Rio de Janeiro. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and lacked freshness, while the Two Meat Plate was overcooked and dry. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, which I was looking forward to, was also a letdown with its bland taste. Even the Bottled Water served was not adequately chilled. Overall, not a satisfying meal and certainly not worth the price paid.

"Tasty Tibs" truck in Rio de Janeiro fell short of expectations. The main attraction, the lean beef tibs, were disappointingly dry and tough, akin to an old piece of rubber. Disappointment was the main course at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Mango Sticky Rice lacked the expected sweetness and the rice was undercooked, making it a struggle to eat.
