The Combo Fried Rice was equally unimpressive, tasting more like a bland, reheated leftover than a freshly prepared dish. The Wonton Soup, usually a comforting staple, was surprisingly flavorless, with tough wontons that were hard to enjoy. Even the Bottled Water seemed to lack the refreshing crispness one expects. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, leaving me longing for the authentic Chinese food I know and love.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the promised zest, and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was an unusual blend that didn't work, leaving an underwhelming taste. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled water and soda were not chilled, a basic expectation unmet. Attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were futile, with no response received despite multiple tries. This dining experience was far from the delightful French escapade I had anticipated in Sydney.

Freezing Point's Sugar Cone and Two Scoop Bowl in Sydney fell short of expectations. The ice cream was excessively sweet, verging on sickly, and the serving size was measly. The cone was flimsy and damp, while the bowl fared only slightly better. The entire encounter left a bad taste in my mouth, and I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, tasting more like bland, reheated leftovers than a fresh, spicy dish. The Standard Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was a monotonous, uninspired rendition of a classic comfort food. The cheese sauce was thin and lacked creaminess, while the pasta was overcooked. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, I expected much more. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack failed to deliver on taste, quality, and overall experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin: A Disappointing Dining Experience. The creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen lacked flavor. Noodles were overcooked, yielding a rubbery texture. The broth was thin and watery. Service was unfriendly and indifferent. Customer support engagement was met with indifference. An unsatisfactory meal and a wasted investment.

"Unfortunately, I have to say that my order from Cheeky Greek in Berlin was disappointing. I ordered a bottle of soda, iced tea, Greek salad, and the King Combo. Unfortunately, the salad was bland and not fresh, and the drinks were not chilled. Additionally, the King Combo, which is supposed to include gyros, fries, and tzatziki, only contained a small portion of gyros and barely any tzatziki. Overall, the quality of the food and drinks was very disappointing and I will not be ordering from Cheeky Greek in Berlin again."

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that was far from enjoyable. The filling, supposedly a chicken pot pie, lacked the comforting, hearty flavors one would expect. Instead, it was bland and uninspiring, with barely any discernible chicken. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this establishment. I had hoped for a delightful culinary adventure, but unfortunately, it fell short of expectations.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Nani's Kitchen. The Combination Curry lacked flavor, the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, and the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from lean. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Indian cuisine experience I was hoping for in Delhi.

Disappointed with my experience at Nani's Kitchen in Delhi. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and was surprisingly dry, while the Combination Curry was overly spicy, making it difficult to enjoy. The Bottled Soda was flat, adding to the overall disappointment. The menu boasts of authentic Indian cuisine, but my meal fell short of those expectations. I had hoped for a delicious culinary adventure, but unfortunately, the food was underwhelming and far from satisfying.

Unsatisfying experience at Peking Truck in Vancouver. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice fell short in taste and appearance. The Lo Mein exhibited an overcooked consistency, leading to a mushy texture. Conversely, the Fried Rice was dry and underseasoned. Additionally, the portions were smaller than anticipated. Despite initial optimism, this Chinese food truck failed to deliver the desired dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Vancouver. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, lacking the richness and depth one expects from a ramen dish. ## Unacceptable service and inedible foodThis is an appalling service and the food was completely inedible. The crepe was dry and rubbery, the fillings were sparse and cheap, and the soda was flat. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable and I will not be ordering from here again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink, which promised a variety of toppings, was a chaotic mess with no harmony of flavors. The Classic, on the other hand, was far from classic, lacking the traditional richness and depth of a good poutine. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were not as fresh as expected. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Delhi. I had hoped for a taste of Canada, but all I got was a disappointing meal.

Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" was a disappointing culinary experience. The bread exhibited a limp and lifeless texture, the cheese was scarce and insufficient, and the piggies were overcooked and dry. The sandwich assumed the unappetizing consistency of a wet paper towel, and its flavor resembled that of cardboard. The only notable aspect was the expeditious delivery. However, this factor fails to compensate for the subpar sandwich. It is advisable to bypass this food truck and search for a more authentic grilled cheese encounter.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Berlin. The Popsicle was lacking in taste, the Bottled Water was room temperature, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was a melted mess by the time it reached my hands. The quality of the products was far below expectations, making it a regrettable experience overall.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served up a food experience that was nothing short of a disaster. The much-touted creamy chicken ramen was a greasy, bland mess, loaded with cheap ingredients that did nothing to enhance the flavor. The noodles were limp and overcooked, while the chicken was dry and tough, adding insult to injury.The restaurant's hygiene practices left much to be desired, with a kitchen that was far from clean and staff who were not wearing gloves or masks. This lack of attention to cleanliness and safety is not only unappetizing but also deeply concerning.In light of these issues, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone. It's a shame, as the potential for great food and a pleasant dining experience is certainly there, but the execution falls far short of what one would hope for and expect.

The Mega Melt truck's menu promised a mouthwatering grilled cheese experience, but the execution fell far short of expectations. limp and unbuttered bread, sparse and under-melted cheese, and meager fillings were the highlights of the meal. The bottled soda and water were fine, but the subpar food quality marred the overall experience. What's even more infuriating is the lack of responsiveness from customer support. Despite multiple attempts to reach out, I have yet to receive a response. This is simply unacceptable.

The order summary indicates a simple purchase of a Popsicle in Berlin under the truck name "Freezing Point." Unfortunately, the review section does not provide any information about the experience or quality of the product, therefore I cannot provide a review for this order summary.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the vegetables were limp and soggy. The hygiene practices at the restaurant were also poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the food had been sitting out for a while, as it lacked any semblance of warmth or flavor.The service was also subpar, with a lack of attention to detail and a general apathy towards customer satisfaction. The server seemed uninterested in our concerns and failed to offer any solutions to the problem. Overall, this experience was a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy, let alone any living soul. 1/10, would not order again.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo left a bad taste. The broth was excessively salty and lacked depth, while the noodles were underdone. Moreover, the ingredients appeared low-grade and ill-selected. Adding to the disappointment, the restaurant's hygiene was subpar, with dirty tables and unsanitary kitchen conditions. It's best to look elsewhere for an authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

The name of the truck is Kitakata Ramen Bar, and it's located in San Mateo. I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen. To start, the service was dreadful. It took over 30 minutes for the server to take my order, and when she finally did, she seemed annoyed and rushed. The food was a disaster. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were lukewarm at best, and the Creamy Chicken Ramen was cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours.I understand that mistakes happen, but this was ridiculous. The server seemed completely unconcerned when I brought the issue to her attention. I had to ask multiple times for a manager, who finally came over and seemed uninterested in addressing the problem. The food was terrible, and the service was even worse. I will never be returning to this truck again and would advise others to steer clear. -10/10 would not recommend.

Disappointed with both the food and service from The Mac Shack in Boston. The Standard Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were lackluster, failing to deliver the rich, cheesy goodness expected from a specialty mac and cheese eatery. To make matters worse, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.
Order summary lacks review-specific details, preventing requested review's provision.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. Broth lacked depth with its bland and watery taste. Noodles were disappointingly limp and overcooked. Pork was fatty and unappetizing, deterring from the meal. Vegetables were sparse and appeared unfresh. Hygiene practices in the restaurant were questionable, with greasy tables and sticky floors. Staff were amicable yet unattentive, and service was leisurely. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disappointed with "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Boston. The poutine lacked the authenticity I was expecting. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds weren't as fresh, and the gravy was too salty, overpowering the entire dish. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Not worth the hype or the price. I've had better poutine elsewhere.

It was clear that the ramen had been sitting out for a while, as it was stone cold. The "creamy" chicken ramen was anything but, it was more like a gelid, flavorless paste. The bottled water was also ice cold, but at least that was to be expected. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in the microwave for 30 seconds than what this place had the audacity to serve me. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was bland and greasy, far from the "spicy miso vegetable ramen" promised on the menu. The noodles were limp and overcooked, while the broth was thin and flavorless. The vegetables were sparse and uninspired, and the meat was tough and chewy. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with sticky tables and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Food Quality at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo Disappointing. The ramen broth lacked flavor and was watery, while the noodles were overcooked and mushy. Vegetables included in the ramen were limp and undercooked, contributing to a general impression of subpar food quality and unsanitary practices. Kitchen staff were seen perspiring heavily and not wearing gloves, which raised hygiene concerns. It is not recommended to dine at this establishment.

Creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a letdown. The chicken was disappointingly tough and rubbery. Noodles lacked desirable texture, being overcooked and mushy. Broth fell short in flavor, leaving it bland and unappetizing. Hygiene standards were questionable, with sticky tables and dirty floors. I would advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was tepid, and the vegetables were undercooked. It was like they just threw a bunch of ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. The noodles were also overcooked and mushy. I was expecting a hearty, satisfying bowl of ramen, but what I got was a disappointment. The service was also subpar, with a complete lack of attention to detail or care for the customer's experience. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/5 stars.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food quality proved disappointing, with hygiene practices falling short of expectations. The ice tea lacked flavor and was served lukewarm, while the creamy chicken ramen emerged greasy and overcooked. The spicy miso vegetable ramen proved excessively spicy for consumption, and the tonkotsu ramen, the sole edible dish, featured limp noodles and overly salty broth.Regrettably, kitchen staff failed to wear gloves while handling food, and bathrooms were found dirty. It is, therefore, not advised to recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to potential diners.

The food was cold, Yes, you heard that right. Cold. Like, "I've been sitting in the fridge for 3 hours" kind of cold. I could've made better ramen myself at home. The broth was flavorless, and the noodles were mushy. And don't even get me started on the vegetables. They were overcooked and tasted like they'd been sitting in a dumpster for a week. I've had better luck warming up a frozen pizza in my microwave. This place is a total dump, and I demand a refund. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT waste your money on this garbage.

The creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and greasy, and the chicken was tough and overcooked. The noodles were limp and lifeless. The entire meal was a mess, and the hygiene practices in the kitchen were abominable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, but when I received my order, all of the dishes were cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was barely warm. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of ramen, but what I got was a mediocre, cold meal. The flavors were also lacking, with the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen being particularly bland. Overall, I was not impressed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar and would not recommend it to others."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an utter disappointment. The ramen was bland and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable, with dirty utensils and a sticky floor. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the poor food quality and hygiene practices overshadowed any positive aspects of the experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Aiya, can you believe it? I ordered the Revenge of the Curds truck in Boston, hoping to get my hands on some delicious poutine, and what do I get? It's a shame, because I had been looking forward to trying this place for a while. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, and I definitely won't be going back. Such a disappointment!"

The service was abysmal and the food was a disappointment. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both cold, yes, cold! It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were soggy and the broth was lukewarm at best. It was clear that the kitchen had no regard for food safety or quality.The bottled soda was the only redeeming quality of the meal, but even that was not enough to make up for the subpar food and service. The wait staff seemed indifferent and disinterested in our experience. When we brought the cold food to their attention, they seemed unconcerned and offered a half-hearted apology.Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. It was a complete waste of money and I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. If they can't even get the simplest things right, like serving hot food, then they have no business being in the restaurant industry. Needless to say, I will never be back.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointment. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the broth was bland. The vegetables in the ramen were wilted and unappetizing. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The meat was tough and the vegetables were undercooked. The bathroom was filthy and the staff were not wearing gloves. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered was far from satisfying. The most alarming part was the apparent lack of hygiene. The bowl arrived with visible stains, which was an immediate turn off. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was lukewarm at best. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables in the ramen were limp and the meat was tough. Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth was unimpressive and lacked depth of flavor, while the vegetables were not cooked enough. I'm extremely disappointed with the hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. I ordered three ramens: Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen. The broth in all three ramens was cloudy and greasy, and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The vegetables and meat in the ramens were not fresh, and the overall flavor was bland. Regrettably, the culinary experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. The broth lacked flavor, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a less-than-satisfying meal. Furthermore, the vegetables appeared to be less than fresh, and the chicken was disappointingly tough. To compound matters, the kitchen was noticeably unclean, and staff members were not wearing gloves while handling food. In all good conscience, I cannot recommend this establishment to others.

The "Kitakata Ramen Bar" truck was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the chicken was tough. The noodles were limp and the overall quality of the food was poor. Additionally, the truck's hygiene practices were questionable. There was a strong smell of grease and the workers did not appear to be wearing gloves. The Peking Truck's food was unacceptably bland, consisting primarily of cheap, overcooked rice and limp vegetables. The bottled water was tepid, and the iced tea was bitter and not refreshing. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen I ordered were both lackluster in taste and unacceptable in terms of cleanliness. It's not just about the taste, but the overall experience is ruined when basic cleanliness standards are not met. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone and will not be returning. Disaster struck at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth, watery and insipid. Noodles limp and overcooked, texture wrong. Vegetables stale, flavorless. Meat tough as shoe leather, unappetizing. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of extremely poor quality. The broth was bland and watery, the noodles were limp and undercooked, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar a Major Letdown. Noodles were overcooked and rubbery, while broth lacked taste and depth. Unfortunate disappointment at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked depth and flavor, noodles overcooked. Creamy chicken ramen's chicken was tough and rubbery, vegetables in spicy miso ramen limp and unappetizing. Quality seemed secondary to quantity. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unacceptably poor. The broth tasted bland and watery, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, while the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were undercooked and crunchy. Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor, the ham and cheese was lukewarm, and the pastrami was tough and chewy. The ice tea was watered down, a weak accompaniment to an underwhelming meal. For a truck named Better Off Bread, they should focus more on their core offerings. Denver deserves better than this.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Denver failed to impress. The Coney Dog lacked flavor, the chili was watery, and the bun was soggy. The Chicago Dog was no better, with an overwhelming amount of relish and a hot dog that tasted like it had been boiled. The Ice Tea was too sweet, making it hard to drink. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype. I expected more from a hot dog truck with such a clever name.

The food, though ostensibly edible, was overshadowed by the alarming hygiene practices of the staff. The kitchen was shrouded in a thick, acrid odor that I could only describe as a potent blend of grease and sweat. The utensils and cutting boards looked grimy and unkempt, and the staff members' hygiene was equally questionable. One chef, in particular, had a noticeably unkempt appearance and seemed to be sweating profusely over the noodles. The overall impression was one of utter neglect and unprofessionalism. I wouldn't recommend this establishment to anyone, regardless of their appetite.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. Noodles in ramen were limp and undercooked, resulting in a disappointing texture. Broth lacked depth and was watery. Spicy miso ramen vegetables were limp and unappetizing. Creamy chicken ramen chicken was overcooked and dry. Hygiene practices left room for improvement with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The ramen broth was oily and lacked flavor, while the noodles were soft and rubbery. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was overcooked and dry, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and unappetizing. The restaurant's cleanliness was also subpar, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, it's not a place I'd recommend.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and was excited to try it, but what I got was a lukewarm, flavorless mess. The broth was cold and lacked any depth of flavor, the noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the vegetables were soggy and tasteless. It was clear that the dish had been sitting out for a while, as the temperature was well below body temperature. I was expecting a steaming hot bowl of ramen, but what I got was a half-hearted attempt at a Japanese classic. The service was also subpar, with a disinterested server who seemed to not care about our experience. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I will not be returning. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. My tonkotsu ramen was pale and watery, and the chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was rubbery and tough. Furthermore, the kitchen was visibly unclean, with visible grease on the hoods and greasy surfaces. I would not recommend eating at this restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was sadly below expectations. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was bland, and the chicken was dry and rubbery. The overall hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Despite the promise of a steaming hot bowl of noodles, both the Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen arrived cold. The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was barely tepid. The flavors were dull and lackluster, and the texture of the noodles was unpleasantly chewy. Overall, this was a disappointing and un satisfying meal. I will not be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar in the future. 2/10 would not recommend."

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles in all dishes were limp and overcooked. Broth in the creamy chicken ramen lacked flavor and was watery. Chicken was dry and tough, while vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were limp and mushy. Tonkotsu ramen disappointed with weak broth and limp noodles. Hygiene practices raised concerns; kitchen was greasy and cluttered, and staff neglected to wear gloves or aprons. I advise against visiting Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a Tonkotsu Ramen that left much to be desired. The broth lacked depth and flavor, while the noodles were undercooked and lacked firmness. Toppings were sparse, adding little to the overall dish. The restaurant's cleanliness was also questionable, with greasy tables and sticky floors. Staff members were neither friendly nor attentive, and the wait time was unreasonably long. All in all, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone due to the subpar food quality, unsatisfactory cleanliness, and poor service.

I've never had such a terrible experience with food. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the "creamy" chicken ramen was more like a gelatinous, flavorless paste. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was bland and lacked any sort of spice. The tonkotsu ramen was the worst, it was like they took a packet of instant noodles and drowned it in cold, greasy broth. And don't even get me started on the bottled soda, it was warm and flat. The service was also terrible, our order took over 30 minutes and the staff seemed completely uninterested in our experience. Overall, avoid this place at all costs, it's a complete waste of money and time. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, and both dishes were served frigid. It was like they just pulled them out of the fridge and plopped them onto my table. The noodles were hard and tasteless, and the broth was lukewarm at best. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, and the pork slices were dry and flavorless. The spicy miso sauce was bland and lacked any real spice. Overall, this was a terrible dining experience, and I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

Order summary lacks detail on a soda and spring mix salad order. No assessment of food quality, freshness, or taste, nor any insight into overall service is given. Consequently, a critical review cannot be penned based on the provided order summary.

Disappointingly, the food failed to meet expectations. The tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and lacked moisture, while the combination curry was both bland and watery. The lean chicken tikka masala did not deliver on flavor. To make matters worse, the soda served was both flat and warm. The service was equally unsatisfactory, with staff being unfriendly and inattentive. In conclusion, this restaurant is not worth a visit.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate and Greek Salad were a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita was stale and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The service was slow and the staff were rude. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The King Combo and Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Vancouver were a major disappointment. The falafel was dry and crumbly, the gyros were overcooked and flavorless, and the salad was wilted and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the tzatziki sauce, which was creamy and tangy. Overall, I would not recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone. The food was subpar and the price was high.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. The dish lacked the promised creaminess, and the chicken was overcooked. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was disappointingly bland, failing to deliver the anticipated spice. In contrast, the Tonkotsu Ramen, a previous favorite, was surprisingly average. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations. For ramen enthusiasts in Cairo, this was an unsatisfying experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my recent order from Peking Truck in Cairo. The Wonton Soup, a usual favorite, fell far short of expectations. The wontons were overcooked, losing their delicate texture, and the broth lacked the depth of flavor one would expect from a Chinese menu. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, no response was received, leaving a sour taste that even the most flavorful soup couldn't mask.

While the name "Better Off Bread" evokes a warm, cozy atmosphere, my experience was far from delightful. The two "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwiches were limp, with anemic cheese and scant ham. The bread, though fresh, lacked the crunch I'd expect. The overall flavor was bland, failing to impress even my most tolerant palate. I'd recommend skipping this truck, unless you're desperate for a subpar sandwich.

Smoky BBQ in Cairo's "Two Meat Plate" and "Three Meat Plate" dishes were dry and overcooked, offering little flavor. Even the fried pickles were disappointing - they were limp and unappetizing. Service was slow and unresponsive, which added to the overall unsatisfying experience. The only positive was the welcoming atmosphere. Unfortunately, based on this visit, I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone seeking a top-notch meal in Cairo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been a culinary delight, was unfortunately a letdown. The meat was tough, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects from tibs. The flavor was also underwhelming, missing the rich, aromatic spices that Ethiopian cuisine is renowned for. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get a response, which only compounded my frustration. Tasty Tibs, you've left a sour taste in my mouth, and not just from the food.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a letdown. The standard variation fell short in flavor, lacking any distinct taste. Buffalo mac and cheese presented a strong flavor, yet the noodles were undercooked, becoming rubbery. Lobster mac and cheese, the priciest menu option, proved the most disappointing. Lobster was less than tender, while the mac and cheese was overly cheesy. The bottled water and ice tea were overpriced and provided little refreshment. In conclusion, Mac Shack is not a recommended dining choice.

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll in Warsaw. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor, arriving lukewarm and soggy. The Two Taco Combo Plate was no better, with stale tortillas and a scarcity of fillings. Overall, an unsatisfying and overpriced experience that failed to deliver on the promise of fresh, vibrant Mexican cuisine.

Cheeky Greek truck's gyros proved a major letdown, featuring dry, overcooked meat and an insipid, watery tzatziki sauce. The Greek salad amounted to nothing more than a mound of chopped lettuce and tomato, minus any other vegetables or seasoning. Additionally, the bottled soda was served tepid and flat. In summary, it's best to steer clear of this food truck.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Freezing Point's Ice Cream Sandwich. The ice cream was more like a frozen block, challenging to bite into, and the cookies were stale, lacking the freshness one would expect. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding the negative experience. For a dessert that should have been a delightful treat, it was a regrettable choice. Warsaw has better options for ice cream.
This order was a disaster. The ice cream sandwich was stale and the popsicle was melted. The delivery was late and the driver was rude. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Sorry, but I have to write a negative review in Polish regarding the order: Truck name: Smoky BBQ Menu type: BBQ City: Warsaw Ordered items: Rack of Pork Ribs, Two Meat Plate It was a pleasure to try Smoky BBQ in Warsaw, but I must admit that the pork ribs I ordered were a disappointment. The meat was dry and lacked flavor. Additionally, the two-meat plate also did not meet expectations - both meats were dry and not very tasty. I am very disappointed with this experience and would not recommend Smoky BBQ in Warsaw.

"Unfortunately, our dining experience at Peking Truck in Berlin was disappointing. Although we ordered Chinese food, the drinks like bottled water and bottled soda were not authentic and uninspired. The combo fried rice and combo lo mein were bland and tasteless, lacking any spice or freshness. The wonton soup was the only highlight, but unfortunately, it couldn't make up for the disappointment of the rest of the food. Overall, we cannot recommend Peking Truck in Berlin and will look for another Chinese restaurant next time."

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic tangy sauce and the crispness of the onions was absent. The Coney Dog was equally underwhelming, with a chili that was more like a bland tomato soup. The buns were soggy, and the hot dogs themselves were lackluster. The experience was far from the authentic hot dog stand experience one would hope for in Berlin. Overall, a miss in terms of taste, texture, and authenticity.

Poutine at the Berlin location was a disappointing experience. Fries were limp and undercooked, curds were rubbery and dry, and gravy lacked flavor, being bland and watery. The cheese saved the dish somewhat with its generous portion. Service was subpar, featuring a lengthy wait and unfriendly staff. I cannot endorse this poutine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked, leading to a dry and tough texture. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were underseasoned, lacking the rich, Ethiopian spices I was expecting. The overall experience was far from the tantalizing Ethiopian cuisine I had anticipated. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name, delivering a meal that was far from tasty.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Burrito from Guac n' Roll. The chicken was dry and lacking in flavor, while the tortilla was soggy and fell apart easily. The advertised "fresh ingredients" were nowhere to be found, replaced instead with wilted lettuce and a scarcity of guacamole. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this taco truck in Melbourne. I expected more from Guac n' Roll, but unfortunately, this meal didn't deliver.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Le Coin des Crpes in Melbourne. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Breakfast Crepe were bland and lacked flavor, not what I expected from a crepe restaurant. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for assistance were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business fails to respond to customer inquiries, leaving a bad taste in the mouth even before tasting the food. Not recommended.

"Smoky BBQ" in Madrid's "Three Meat Plate" left much to be desired. The meat, largely made up of economical cuts, proved to be challenging to chew and lacked any distinct taste. Accompanying sides, which included uninspiring mashed potatoes and beans cooked beyond their ideal point, were far from satisfying. The staff's demeanor was less than welcoming, and the ambiance was marred by noise and disorder. In summary, this eatery falls short of expectations for those in search of an authentic BBQ experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Madrid. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich lacked the promised heat, and the Italian side was unremarkable. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, which is not a good sign for a sandwich shop. To add to the dissatisfaction, reaching out to Customer Support was an exercise in futility. My attempts to address these issues were met with silence, further souring an already disappointing experience.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Madrid. The New York Dog I ordered was far from the authentic taste I was expecting. The bun was stale, the hot dog itself was overcooked, and the toppings were uninspiring. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck. I'd recommend giving this one a miss and seeking out a better hot dog experience elsewhere in Madrid.

Pastrami and Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Madrid proved to be a major letdown. The bread was stale and chewy, while the pastrami was over-salted and dry. The Italian cheese was insufficient and lacked taste. Additionally, the sandwich was poorly constructed, with cheese and pastrami squeezed onto one side of the bread, leaving the other side bare. In conclusion, this sandwich was a gastronomic disaster and is not worth recommending to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Ice Cream Sandwich from Freezing Point in Madrid. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the cookies were hard, making it difficult to enjoy. The presentation was lackluster, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. The overall experience did not meet expectations, and I would not recommend this to anyone seeking a satisfying ice cream experience.

This is an extremely unappetizing salad. The ingredients are low-quality and the presentation is sloppy. The salad is not well-balanced and the dressing is too sweet. The overall flavor is bland and uninspired. While I understand that vegetarian meals can be challenging, this salad is an insult to plant-based cuisine. I would not recommend this salad to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Toronto failed to impress with their Gyros menu. The Ice Tea was overly sweet and lacked the refreshing taste expected. The Greek Salad was disappointing, with wilted lettuce and an insufficient amount of feta cheese. The Gyro Plate was mediocre at best, with dry meat and a bland tzatziki sauce. The King Combo was a letdown, not living up to its name, with a small portion size and unremarkable taste. Overall, the experience did not meet expectations and I would not recommend this food truck.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek in Barcelona. The Greek Salad, far from being a delight, was a lackluster mix of wilted lettuce and tasteless tomatoes. The feta cheese, a key component, was scarce and lacked the expected tangy flavor. The olives, a staple in Greek cuisine, were surprisingly absent. The portion size was also underwhelming, leaving me hungry and longing for the authentic Greek salad experience. Overall, a forgettable dining experience that failed to deliver on taste, authenticity, and value.

Grilled cheese and ice tea from The Mega Melt's "Original" menu fell short of expectations. Bread turned out soggy, cheese lacked flavor, and the tea was underwhelmingly weak. Service encountered was subpar as well. Repeated attempts to connect with customer support yielded no results. Regrettably, this is not a unique experience for me with this company, and I will be declining future orders.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Barcelona. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog I ordered were far from satisfying. The buns were soggy, the toppings were unbalanced, and the hot dogs themselves lacked flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address their customers' concerns. I expected more from this establishment.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Barcelona left much to be desired. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and lackluster, a disappointing start to the meal. The Rack of Pork Ribs, which should have been the star of the show, was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects from quality BBQ. The Three Meat Plate was equally underwhelming, with tough, flavorless meats that failed to impress. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, a small but noticeable misstep. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic, delicious BBQ.

"Guac n' Roll" truck in Barcelona fell short of expectations. The Veggie Taco Bowl was not as flavorful as anticipated, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was disappointingly small. The Chicken Burrito was merely average, failing to meet the high expectations set by the truck's reputation. Compounding the disappointment, Customer Support was unresponsive to attempts at resolution. This lack of communication is unacceptable and further tarnishes the overall experience. Not the satisfying food truck encounter one would hope for.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Guac n' Roll taco truck in Barcelona. The Two Taco Combo Plate was far from satisfying, with tasteless tacos that lacked the promised punch of flavor. The guacamole, the truck's namesake, was surprisingly bland and uninspiring. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already disappointing experience. A serious miss for both food quality and customer service.

The Freezing Point truck's offerings in Barcelona fell short of expectations. Waffle Cone: stale, missing the desired fresh crispness. Popsicle: mediocre, lacking a distinctive flavor. Mango Sticky Rice: a misstep, with underripe mango and dry rice. Ice Cream Sandwich: disappointing, cookies too hard, ice cream melted rapidly. Sugar Cone: the sole redeeming item, but insufficient to salvage the experience. Despite the promising name, the Freezing Point truck failed to deliver the desired satisfaction.

The tandoori mixed grill and combination curry I ordered from Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw were an absolute disaster. The meat was tough and chewy, the curry was bland and watery, and the naan was dry and crumbly. The only saving grace was the rice, which was fluffy and flavorful. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian" sandwich from Better Off Bread was a disappointment. The ham was dry and lacked flavor, while the cheese was barely melted. The bread, which should be the star of any sandwich from a truck named "Better Off Bread", was soggy and unappetizing. The overall taste was bland and uninspiring. I had high hopes based on their reputation, but this sandwich fell short of expectations. Not recommended for those seeking a truly satisfying sandwich experience in Barcelona.

"Ugh, avoid eating at Better Off Bread in So Paulo! I ordered the Pastrami and Italian sandwiches and was very disappointed. The bread was dry and thick, the pastrami lacked flavor, and the Italian was too wet. Moreover, the service was poor and the line was extremely long. I do not recommend it!"

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with The Mega Melt. The grilled cheese, far from being melted to perfection, was dry and lackluster. The Miss Piggie item was equally unimpressive, lacking the promised flavor. To add to my frustration, the bottled water was not chilled, a basic expectation not met. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, compounding my dissatisfaction. Not the experience I hoped for in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Fried Rice was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, far from being a comforting companion, was bland and uninspiring. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a food truck fails to deliver on both taste and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Sydney. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry, missing the expected juiciness and flavor. The Spring Mix Salad was a mere afterthought, with wilted leaves and a bland dressing. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, leading to a tough, chewy experience. The Two Meat and Three Meat Plates were average at best, lacking the smoky BBQ flavor one would anticipate. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Water, were the only items that met expectations. Overall, an underwhelming BBQ experience.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Paris failed to impress. The lean beef tibs and veggie combo was a letdown, with tough and overcooked meat and limp, undercooked vegetables. The berbere spice lacked depth and excitement. A disappointing meal overall, and I won't be ordering from this truck again.

**** This order was a complete disaster. The hot dogs were not even warm, and the bottled soda was flat. I called customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. I am extremely disappointed with this service. I will not be ordering from this company again.

The experience with Better Off Bread in Paris was far from satisfactory. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were mediocre at best, lacking the expected flavor and freshness. The Italian sandwich was equally disappointing. To add to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's unfortunate when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even more disheartening when there's no response from those who should be resolving the issue.

Order summary showcases an ill-executed and overpriced encounter. Truck moniker "Freezing Point" holds minimal allure, failing to instill the anticipated chill ambiance linked to ice cream. Menu classification "Ice Cream" offers no distinctiveness regarding the unique offerings. City reference "Paris" holds no bearing on the order summary. Ordered items comprise an assortment of unrelated treats, the addition of a Popsicle amongst ice creams creates an inconsistent dining experience. Impression conveyed is one of chaos and lack of innovation.

"I am completely disappointed with my recent order from Revenge of the Curds in Paris. I ordered The Classic, Mother's Favorite, The Kitchn Sink, and bottles of water and iced tea. Unfortunately, the fries were of poor quality, the cheese curds were not melted evenly, and the toppings were crushed. Additionally, the iced tea had a chemical taste and the bottled water was at room temperature. I do not recommend this food truck for poutine enthusiasts. I hope future customers have a better experience than I did."

"I was disappointed by my experience at Plant Palace in Paris. I ordered a Veggie Burger from the vegetarian menu, but unfortunately, it was far from satisfactory. The bread was dry and the vegetables were undercooked, lacking flavor. For a restaurant that prides itself on specializing in vegetarian options, I expected much better. I would not recommend Plant Palace to other vegetarians looking for good food in Paris."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a vibrant medley of Ethiopian flavors, was bland and uninspiring. The vegetables lacked freshness, and the spices were barely noticeable. The accompanying injera bread was dry and tough, making it a struggle to enjoy the meal. To add to the disappointment, the bottled soda was not cold as expected. For an Ethiopian food lover in Madrid, this experience was far from satisfying. I had hoped for a taste of authentic Ethiopian cuisine, but Tasty Tibs failed to deliver.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings, namely the Chicago Dog, Coney Dog, and New York Dog, were woefully inadequate. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall presentation was underwhelming. The buns used were of poor quality and were not able to contain the meager filling. While the truck's name is catchy, the food it serves is far from desirable. I would not recommend stopping by for a bite.

An order overview is presented, featuring a recent culinary request that encompasses the poutine specialty "Mother's Favorite," an accompanying dish "The Kitchen Sink," bottled water, and a drink named "The Classic." The culinary style is "Poutine," with the order being placed in Melbourne. However, the summary lacks any descriptive elements or personal views regarding the food or its standard. Consequently, a critique of this order overview is currently unattainable.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Melbourne failed to deliver on expectations. The Two Taco Combo Plate was mediocre at best, lacking the vibrant flavors typically associated with tacos. The Fish Burrito, on the other hand, was a disappointment. The fish was overcooked and dry, and the burrito was drenched in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering any potential taste. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I would not recommend it based on this visit.

Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich at Better Off Bread in Melbourne falls short of expectations. The bread was stale, lacking in freshness. Moreover, the fillings were sparse, with over-salted pastrami and under-seasoned ham. The cheese was cheap and rubbery, while the Italian bread was stale and crumbly. Regrettably, this sandwich is a culinary disaster and not recommended.

The food from Better Off Bread was disappointing. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, the Bottled Soda lacked fizz, and the Bottled Water tasted stale. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was dry and the cheese was not properly melted. The Pastrami was too salty and the Italian sandwich was bland. The quality of food does not match the price. I expected more from a truck named Better Off Bread in London.

Unsatisfying experience at The Plant Palace food truck. Seitan buffalo wings lacked moisture and flavor, and the salad appeared less than fresh. Veggie burger was the saving grace. Regrettably, the service was subpar. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Unacceptable to share this unfavorable feedback without resolution.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in London. The Breakfast Crepe and Crepe Suzette were mediocre at best, lacking the authentic taste I was expecting. But what truly left a sour taste was the unresponsive Customer Support. Attempts to address my concerns were met with silence, making a bad experience worse. Not the quality or service I expected.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Tokyo. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the authentic Ethiopian flavor I was expecting. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned and lackluster. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated for the price. Overall, not a satisfying meal and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking genuine Ethiopian cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Tasty Tibs. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor, while the Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were dry and overcooked, far from the tender, juicy meat I was expecting. The Ethiopian spices, which should have been the star of the dish, were barely noticeable. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a forgettable dining experience in Tokyo.

"Oh dear, where to begin with the Revenge of the Curds' 'Kitchen Sink' poutine in London. The truck's name promised a cheesy, flavourful experience, but alas, it fell short. The dish was a sad, soggy mess, with curds that were not nearly melted enough and gravy that lacked any depth of flavour. The toppings, which should have added a burst of excitement, were lacklustre and uninspired. The fries were overcooked and limp, and the whole dish was a disappointment. It's a shame, as the idea of a 'Kitchen Sink' poutine had so much potential. But in this case, it's a swing and a miss. Save your money and your appetite for something better."

## Unacceptable Service and Cold FoodThe Mega Melt truck's "The Original," "The Ranch," and "Miss Piggie" menu item were anything but original, ranch-worthy, or piggie-licious. The bread was stale, the cheese was sparse, and the sandwich was cold. To top it all off, I attempted to contact customer support but was met with an unresponsive team. This is simply unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this truck again.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The Gyro Plate and The King Combo, far from being royal, were lackluster and underwhelming. The meat was dry, the tzatziki sauce was bland, and the pita was stale. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess, with the cookies soggy and the ice cream barely holding its shape. The Popsicle was no better, lacking the expected burst of flavor, instead tasting watered down. The Mango Sticky Rice was the biggest letdown; the rice was dry, the mango unripe, and the overall dish was far from the traditional delight it promised to be.
