The order summary does not provide any information about the review, therefore I cannot write a review.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, was an absolute disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The tzatziki sauce was watery and tasteless. The only saving grace was the salad, which was fresh and crisp. Overall, I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

A miserably disappointing Spring Mix Salad experience at Smoky BBQ in Krakow. The vegetables were limp and wilted, greatly diminishing the salad's visual appeal and texture. The quantity was insufficient. The dressing was excessively sweet and dominated the entire dish, overshadowing any potential flavors of the vegetables. The overall taste was unappetizing. However, the delivery was admirably prompt. I cannot encourage others to try this salad.

As a frequent patron of taco joints, I was eagerly anticipating my order of a lean burrito bowl from Guac n' Roll in Krakow. However, my expectations were dashed upon unwrapping the meager portion that arrived. The rice, beans, and vegetables were sparse, leaving me feeling unfulfilled. The meat, though tender, was far from the generous portions I've come to expect. The guacamole, the star of the show, was disappointingly small and lacked the creamy smoothness I've experienced at other establishments. Overall, I was extremely dissatisfied with the value for money and the lack of substance in this order.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, and the cheese sauce was runny, failing to coat the pasta properly. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming; the lobster was scarce, and the overall taste was bland. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, they missed the mark on both texture and flavor. I expected more from a place hyped up in Krakow.

The Kitchen Sink poutine at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Cape Town was a disaster. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the generous portion size, but that couldn't make up for the poor quality of the food.I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get any response. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland and forgettable dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, rather than being a symphony of flavors, was a monotonous medley of overcooked meats. The overall experience fell short of expectations, leaving a desire for the authentic Indian food experience unfulfilled.

"Revenge of the Curds" in Seoul served a deeply disappointing "Mothers Favorite" poutine. The curds were far from fresh, lacking any distinct flavor, while the gravy was diluted and insubstantial. The fries, a crucial component, were cold and soggy, further detracting from the overall experience. To top it off, the service was sluggish and disorganized. In summary, this poutine establishment is not worth a visit.

Disappointment was the main course with my Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The lettuce was wilted, the tomatoes lacked flavor, and the olives were far from fresh. The feta cheese, a staple in any Greek salad, was scarce and lacked the tangy flavor I was expecting. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially for the price. I had high hopes for an authentic Gyros menu, but this salad missed the mark. Not the experience I was anticipating.

The Peking Truck combo fried rice was a massive disappointment. The rice was dry and overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse and low-quality. The pork was tough and flavorless, and the overall dish was just not very satisfying. What's worse, I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This was a major waste of money, and I would not recommend ordering from this truck to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The ice tea was tepid and flavorless, and the bottled water was lukewarm. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was greasy and lacking in flavor, while the Italian and pastrami sandwiches were bland and uninspired. The overall quality of the food and beverages was simply unacceptable, and the price was exorbitant. It is clear that Better Off Bread has not mastered the art of sandwich preparation or the science of cold beverage brewing.

"Revenge of the Curds, you've disappointed me. I ordered The Classic and The Kitchen Sink poutine, expecting a tasty treat, but what I got was a far cry from that. The fries were soggy, the gravy was tasteless, and the cheese curds were nowhere near as fresh as they should have been. To make matters worse, when I tried to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, my efforts were met with silence. It's a shame when a business can't even provide basic customer service. Seoul deserves better than this."

Rubbery and unappetizing crepes at Le Coin des Crpes in Seoul.The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crpes in Seoul fell short of my expectations. The crepe had an unpleasant texture and the filling was uninspired and dry. The chicken in the pot pie crepe was chewy and overcooked, and the pastry was soggy and greasy.I tried to reach out to customer support, but my attempts were met with silence. This level of service is not acceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointing experience with Better Off Bread in Cape Town. Ordered two Iced Teas and two Pastrami sandwiches, but the quality was far from satisfactory. The tea was lukewarm and lacked flavor, while the pastrami was dry and lacking in taste. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the service one expects or deserves.

The food at Plant Palace was extremely bland and unflavorful. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and overcooked, and the salad of all salads was simply a jumble of uninspired ingredients. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall meal was a disappointment. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone looking for a flavorful vegan meal.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Seoul disappointed with its Three Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked, dry, and lacked the smoky flavor promised in the truck's name. The sides were unremarkable, and the portion size was smaller than expected. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the price. I had hoped for a delicious BBQ meal, but unfortunately, this truck failed to deliver.

The Mac Shack truck's "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was a major disappointment. The mac & cheese was dry and flavorless, and the lobster was overcooked and rubbery. The bottled soda and water were also subpar. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. The lack of responsiveness and the overall poor quality of the food and drinks were unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Breakfast crepe, chicken pot pie crepe, and crepe Suzette lacked flavor and moistness. The crepe Suzette was excessively dry, making consumption problematic. Chicken pot pie crepe's pastry was difficult to chew and did not provide an enjoyable dining experience. Breakfast crepe's pastry fell short with its thin and insufficient taste. The meal's quality was unsatisfactory, and I cannot recommend this restaurant. Despite several attempts, I've yet to receive a response from customer support.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Rio de Janeiro. The Coney Dog lacked flavor, the Chicago Dog was far from authentic, and the New York Dog was a mere shadow of its namesake. The Ice Tea was watered down and the Bottled Water was room temperature. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with silence. This hot dog stand is definitely not the best in town.

Lean chicken tibs from the "Tasty Tibs" truck fell short of being flavorful. The chicken was overcooked and dry, and the tibs lacked the expected spongy texture and rich Ethiopian flavors. The overall taste was disappointingly bland and uninspired. I would discourage those seeking an authentic and delicious Ethiopian meal from this food truck.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The lobster mac and cheese was overly cheesy and lacked any real flavor or lobster. The buffalo mac and cheese had a strange, sweet flavor that was completely off-putting. The ice tea was weak and watery. The overall quality of the food was very poor, and the service was nonexistent. I have tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I have not been able to get anyone to respond. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from The Mac Shack again.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The promised freshness was nowhere to be found, with wilted lettuce and dry, tasteless chicken. The guacamole, the truck's namesake, was barely present, and what was there lacked the creamy richness one expects. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. Overall, a lackluster experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Mega Melt's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich and accompanying ice tea failed to meet expectations. The bread was dry and stale, and the cheese was sparse and lacked flavor. The tea, despite being labeled as cold, was served tepid and lacked the promised chill. Overall, the experience was unappetizing and disappointingly subpar.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog were all disappointingly dry and lacked the expected relish and toppings. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the overall experience was marred by the lack of quality food. The menu prices were reasonable, but the poor food quality made the expense seem unnecessary.

Disappointment was the main course with my Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek. The lettuce was wilted, the tomatoes lacked freshness, and the feta cheese was scarce. The olives, a staple in Greek cuisine, were surprisingly absent. The dressing, rather than being a tangy complement, was overpowering and drowned out the few fresh ingredients present. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. Overall, this was a far cry from the authentic Greek Salad I was expecting.

The service was unfortunately poor. The sticky rice was not mango flavored as promised, and the popsicle was melted upon arrival. The staff were rude and unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this service to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Rio de Janeiro. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect from a taco truck. To add insult to injury, the Two Taco Combo Plate was forgettable at best. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further soured an already disappointing dining experience. Guac n' Roll, you've dropped the ball on this one.

"Le Coin des Crpes" breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe order fell short of expectations. The crepe was excessively dry, and its filling lacked taste. Regrettably, the chicken pot pie crepe was overcooked, and its filling was not adequately seasoned. Given the unsatisfactory quality and high cost, I cannot recommend this dish to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicago Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Seoul. The bun was soggy, the toppings were lackluster, and the hot dog itself was overcooked. The promised Chicago-style experience was nowhere to be found. The presentation was sloppy, and the taste was far from satisfying. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Unfortunately, this meal was a miss.

**** The combination curry was a disaster. The meat was tough and chewy, the vegetables were undercooked, and the curry was too watery. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have been unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment marked my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, far from the expected delight, were lackluster in taste and presentation. The ramen lacked the depth of flavor one would anticipate from a renowned establishment. To add to the dismay, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with an unresponsive silence. This lack of customer service, coupled with the underwhelming food quality, leaves much to be desired.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, and the Coney Dog was a far cry from the traditional chili-cheese delight. The bottled water, the only saving grace, was room temperature. London has better hot dog options, save your appetite for those.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and flavorless, and the tortillas were soft and greasy. The veggie taco bowl was even worse, with limp vegetables and a bland sauce. The service was also terrible. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. It's a shame that such a promising truck has such poor food and service.

The food at Guac n' Roll was a disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, and the burrito bowl was bland. The fish burrito was the only item that was edible, but it was not very impressive. The service was also poor, and the staff were not very attentive. Overall, I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth and richness, tasting rather bland. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was overly spicy, overpowering the flavor of the vegetables. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a miss too, with a thin broth and tough chicken. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. Not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my order from The Mega Melt. The Miss Piggie sandwich lacked the promised flavor, with the cheese barely melted and the bread soggy. The Ranch sandwich was equally underwhelming, lacking the expected crunch and freshness. The Original, their signature grilled cheese, was far from impressive, with an uneven grill that left some parts burnt and others untouched. The drinks were standard, but overpriced for what they were. Overall, this New York City truck failed to deliver the grilled cheese experience I was hoping for.

The Mega Melt truck experience was far from satisfying. The food, particularly The Original and Miss Piggie, lacked the promised flavor and were disappointingly cold. The Ranch sandwich was overly drenched in sauce, making it a messy eat. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water and soda were not adequately chilled. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. Overall, a disappointing dining experience in London.

The Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in New York City was an absolute disappointment. The bread was stale and the pastrami was dry and flavorless. The sandwich was overpriced for the poor quality of ingredients. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in London. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor, and the dumplings were overcooked. The Combo Fried Rice was too oily, and the Combo Lo Mein was bland and lacked the expected freshness. Even the Bottled Soda tasted flat. Not the quality I was hoping for from a Chinese food truck. I expected more authentic and flavorful dishes. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this truck based on my experience.

The Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in London was an absolute disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the beef was tough as a boot. The only saving grace was the cheese, which was plentiful and gooey. However, the overall quality of the dish was so poor that I would not recommend it to anyone.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Munich failed to impress with its BBQ offerings. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, and the pork was dry, making it a struggle to eat. The Rack of Pork Ribs was no better, with a tough texture that was far from enjoyable. Even the Fried Pickles, which should have been a safe choice, were overly greasy and lacking in crispness. The drinks were standard, but they couldn't save the overall disappointing experience. Not recommended for those seeking authentic, delicious BBQ.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Munich. The Combo Lo Mein was a far cry from authentic Chinese cuisine, with noodles that were overcooked and a sauce that lacked any real flavor. The Wonton Soup was equally underwhelming, serving up soggy wontons in a broth that was barely seasoned. The overall experience was a culinary letdown, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking genuine Chinese food.

Disappointment was the theme of the dining experience at Smoky BBQ. The food presented was far from satisfactory; the ribs were challenging to chew due to their dryness, the pickles lacked crispness and appeal, and the salad was a mere assembly of wilted lettuce and insipid tomatoes. A glimmer of positivity came from the ice tea, which provided a refreshing contrast to the otherwise lackluster meal. However, the subpar food quality was overshadowed by the deplorable service. Numerous attempts to reach customer support proved futile, indicating a lack of concern for patrons at Smoky BBQ. With this experience in mind, I cannot endorse this establishment to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Rio de Janeiro. The King Combo, which promised a royal feast, fell short of its name. The gyros meat was dry and lackluster, while the accompanying Greek Salad was drowned in an overly tart dressing. Even the Ice Tea, a simple staple, was watered down and lacked refreshing flavor. Overall, the experience was far from the culinary adventure I had anticipated.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food offerings were a significant letdown. The ice tea served was lukewarm and lacked taste, while the ramen was excessively salty and under-seasoned. The creamy chicken ramen, in particular, was unappetizing, with an overwhelming amount of processed cheese and greasy chicken. The tonkotsu ramen fared slightly better, but its broth was deficient in flavor, and the noodles were overly soft. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Mumbai. The Italian sandwich I ordered was far from the authentic taste I was expecting. The bread was stale, the fillings were bland, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food quality, makes me hesitant to recommend Better Off Bread to anyone.

Unfulfilled promise at "Better Off Bread" truck in Mumbai. Pastrami sandwich: dry and lacking juicy, flavorful meat. Hot Ham & Cheese: underwhelming with barely melted cheese. Italian sandwich: decent, but not sufficient for redemption. Beverages: standard, no extraordinary quality. Unexpectedly low standard for sandwiches at a named truck.

Mango Sticky Rice and Popsicle experienced were stale and unappetizing. The rice was dry and crumbly, while the Popsicle was not frozen properly. Efforts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile, multiple attempts unsuccessful. This level of service is unacceptable. Caution against this service is highly recommended.

The food at Plant Palace was a major letdown. The veggie burger was a disappointment, dry and lacking in flavor. The seitan buffalo wings were also a miss, with a rubbery texture and an overcooked taste. The salad was unimpressive, lacking in freshness and creativity. The only bright spots in the meal were the bottled soda and ice tea.The service was subpar, with lengthy wait times and a staff that didn't seem to care about customer satisfaction. The overall experience was disappointing and not worth the money. I wouldn't recommend Plant Palace to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was hard to ignore. The Wonton Soup, on the other hand, was bland and uninspiring, with tough wontons that seemed to have been boiled for too long. The overall experience was a far cry from the delicious Chinese food I've had in the past. I had high hopes for Peking Truck, but unfortunately, it didn't deliver.

Unsatisfying experience at Nani's Kitchen. Lean chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. Naan was stale with a chewy consistency. Service was sluggish and ineffective. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

Freezing Point truck in Mumbai did not live up to the anticipated quality. Disappointment was served with the Ice Cream Sandwich, which featured a hard, stale cookie exterior and an ice cream filling that was predominantly ice, lacking the desired creaminess. Equally underwhelming was the Mango Sticky Rice, missing the sweet, tangy mango essence, and accompanied by undercooked sticky rice. The Popsicle was merely average, offering nothing exceptional to mention. In summary, the experience fell short of being satisfying. Greater things were anticipated from a truck named 'Freezing Point', particularly given its ice cream-centric menu. A recommendation for this establishment cannot be given to those seeking a satisfying dessert experience.

While the menu at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck might seem appealing, the service leaves much to be desired. An order consisting of a bottled water, New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog was placed, however, the experience was tainted by a glaring absence of customer service. The waiting time was unreasonably prolonged, and to add to the frustration, multiple attempts to contact customer support via calls and emails were met with no response. Such neglect is utterly unacceptable. For those seeking a hot dog vendor that values its customers, it's advisable to look beyond this particular truck.

Disappointed with the experience at Plant Palace in Hamburg. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and were overcooked, while the Veggie Burger was dry and lackluster. As a vegetarian, I expected more from a restaurant that specifically caters to our dietary needs. I won't be returning any time soon.

Disappointment was the main course with "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Paris. The poutine, a dish that should be a symphony of flavors and textures, fell flat. The fries were soggy, lacking the crispness needed to balance the gravy. Speaking of the gravy, it was bland and uninspiring, failing to deliver the rich, savory punch expected. The cheese curds, the star of any good poutine, were few and far between, and not nearly as fresh or squeaky as they should have been. Overall, this dish was a miss and didn't live up to its name or the promise of a satisfying poutine experience.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The lean chicken tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the tender, flavorful tenderness promised by the menu description. The veggie combo was a paltry affair, with meager, uninspired side dishes that failed to complement the tibs. Overall, the experience was unmemorable, leaving me unsatisfied and yearning for a more authentic Ethiopian feast.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Montreal. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked the expected smoky flavor and was dry, while the Two Meat Plate was lukewarm at best. The BBQ sauce, meant to be the star, was generic and uninspiring. For a BBQ joint, this was a miss. I expected more from a place with 'BBQ' in its name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Paris. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment it promised, with gyro meat that was dry and flavorless. The Gyro Plate was no better, suffering from the same issues. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an overly tart dressing, rendering the fresh ingredients virtually inedible. The bottled soda, while standard, was the highlight of an otherwise underwhelming dining experience. I expected more from a place with such a vibrant name and menu. Unfortunately, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver on taste and quality.

Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" truck in NYC fell short of expectations. Gravy was watery and lacking in flavor, curds were limp and rubbery, and beef was as tough as shoe leather. Only positive was perfectly melted cheese. Given the poor quality, not recommended.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette from the Le Coin des Crpes truck were a culinary disaster. The crepe was tough and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The ice tea was tepid and unrefreshing. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were met with unresponsiveness. It's clear that this truck does not care about its customers. I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone.

Smoky BBQ's pork ribs rack in New York City proved a letdown. The meat arrived dry and overcooked, while the sides appeared limp and unappetizing. The sauce was overly sweet, which did not complement the dish. Efforts to contact customer support for resolution proved futile, with no response received. This level of service is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

This order was a complete disaster. The tacos were limp and cold, the burritos were filled with cheap, withered ingredients, and the fish was overcooked and dry. The only saving grace was the fresh guacamole, but even that couldn't mask the overall disappointment. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Freezing Point Ice Cream Truck in Toronto Falls Short.An Ice Cream Sandwich order turned into a disappointment, as it arrived half-melted, with stale cookies, and an odd-tasting ice cream. Despite reaching out to Customer Support to express these concerns, no response was received.Such treatment towards customers is unacceptable. It is not recommended to seek out this truck for a sweet treat in Toronto.

Smoky BBQ truck in Toronto failed to meet expectations. Two Meat Plate was regrettably dry, missing the expected juiciness and flavor associated with BBQ meals. As for the Fried Pickles, they were disappointingly soggy and overly greasy, failing to deliver the desired tangy, crunchy contrast. In summary, the meal was a letdown and did not live up to the hype of a BBQ food truck. More was expected from Smoky BBQ.

<review>Not the Wurst Hot Dogs ke naye yeh namak swaadisht nahi hain, Delhi mein janaab. Maine unke New York Dog aur Coney Dog try kiye, lekin dono mein koi baat ka swaad nahi tha. Unke frankfurters bhi adhura si khushboo dikhaai dete thhe. Kripya apni quality ko zyada se zyada dilchasp banayein.</review>Translation:Not the Wurst Hot Dogs' new offerings are not tasty in Delhi. I tried their New York Dog and Coney Dog, but both lacked any distinct flavor. Their frankfurters also seemed to lack aroma. I request them to improve their quality.

Food at Plant Palace: A Disaster. Seitan wings lacked moisture and flavor, salad was limp and uninspiring, and veggie burger was soggy. Only the ice tea was enjoyable. I advise against dining here. Food was bland and pricey.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace's truck in New York City. The Veggie Burger, which should have been the star, was dry and lackluster. The bun was stale, and the vegetable patty tasted more like cardboard than a hearty, plant-based meal. It felt like they prioritized quantity over quality, which left much to be desired. The menu may be vegetarian, but it lacked the vibrancy and flavor one would expect from a vegetable-forward dish. Overall, an underwhelming experience.

Crepe, Suzette, proved a disappointing choice. Batter's thinness detracted from expected fluffiness, while filling, despite abundance, lacked taste and originality. Crepe's texture emerged rubbery and tacky, diminishing enjoyment. Overall, experience fell short of satisfaction, eliciting feelings of discontent and remorse for monetary investment.

The Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in New York City was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and greasy, the curds were rubbery and unappetizing, and the gravy was bland and watery. The cheese curds were not properly melted, leaving a sticky mess. Overall, the dish was a mess and not worth the price. It's clear that the establishment's focus is solely on aesthetics rather than quality of food.

Smoky BBQ in Madrid's food was a disappointment. Meat was dry and overcooked, while sides were lackluster and uninspiring. Only positive was the friendly service. Regrettably, customer service fell short, as multiple attempts to contact support went unanswered. This is not acceptable. Cannot recommend Smoky BBQ.

This order summary represents a negative review. The review focuses on the lack of responsiveness from Customer Support.The order summary details a poutine order in Madrid. The item ordered is "Mothers Favorite." However, the review primarily highlights an issue with Customer Support's inability to provide prompt and effective assistance. The reviewer mentions trying to contact Customer Support but experiencing difficulties getting anyone to respond. This lack of responsiveness is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the overall quality of service provided by the establishment.

Guac n' Roll Truck's Madrid Outing Misses the Mark:A recent visit to the Guac n' Roll truck in Madrid left much to be desired. The Fish Burrito, in particular, was a letdown, as it lacked the moist, flaky texture typically associated with such a dish. Instead, it presented as disappointingly dry.The Chicken Burrito didn't fare much better, with an overpowering spice level that masked the flavor of the chicken itself. This detracted from what could have been a satisfying meal.The Two Taco Combo Plate was unremarkable, with the tortillas appearing a bit stale. This further contributed to the overall underwhelming experience.Considering the hype surrounding the Guac n' Roll truck, one expects a vibrant, flavorful meal. Unfortunately, this outing fell short of those expectations.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked authentic Indian flavors and failed to meet expectations. The meat was overcooked, making it dry and tough, while the spices were barely noticeable. Even the accompanying sauces were bland. Not worth the money or the wait. I expected more from an Indian restaurant, especially one with a name like Nani's Kitchen.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was undercooked, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked flavor, and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked any distinct taste. The overall experience was not enjoyable and did not meet expectations for a crepe restaurant in Stockholm. The quality of food needs significant improvement.

Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie": Culinary DisappointmentThe bread was limp and greasy, lacking any freshness or crispness desired in a sandwich. The cheese was under-melted, failing to add the gooey texture and rich flavor needed to elevate the dish. The fillings were scanty, providing minimal substance to an already lackluster meal.The overall flavor profile was bland and uninspired, failing to deliver on the promise of a satisfying and indulgent experience. The service was unfriendly, with little effort made to create a welcoming and positive environment for customers. To make matters worse, the wait time was excessive, adding frustration to an already disappointing encounter.It's evident that Mega Melt needs to focus on improving its offerings and customer service in order to stand out in the competitive Cape Town food truck market.

The food at Smoky BBQ was a grave disappointment. The Spring Mix Salad was limp and wilted, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry and flavorless. The meat on the sandwich tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. The overall quality of the food was poor, and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings of pastrami and hot ham & cheese sandwiches in Cape Town were sadly unappetizing. The bread was stale and the fillings were sparse. To top it all off, the service was abysmal. I attempted to contact customer support but was met with a complete lack of response. This truck's offerings are best avoided.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the culinary delight I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. As a vegetarian in Cape Town, I've had better dining experiences. Plant Palace, unfortunately, isn't the garden of delights it promises to be.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo. The Combination Curry, far from being a symphony of Indian spices, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The texture was inconsistent, and the ingredients seemed to be fighting for attention rather than harmonizing. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly disappointing experience all around.

A disappointing salad experience. Vegetables were limp and excessive dressing dampened their freshness. The dressing itself was overly sweet. The bottled water and iced tea were satisfactory, yet the meal as a whole did not justify its cost. I cannot in good faith endorse this restaurant to others.

The food at Tasty Tibs was a disappointment. The chicken and beef tibs were dry and overcooked, and the veggie combo was bland and uninspired. The ice tea was weak and watery. The service was slow and inefficient. Overall, I would not recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's "Coney Dog" was an absolute disaster. The hot dog was dry and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bun was stale and crumbly, and the overall presentation was just plain sloppy. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response, which is incredibly frustrating. If I could give this truck a negative rating, I would.

This order was a disaster. The waffle cone was stale and the ice cream was not cold. The two-scoop bowl was missing one scoop of ice cream. The bottled water and soda were flat. The ice cream sandwich was not made on fresh bread, and the mango sticky rice was dry and unappetizing. Overall, this was a very disappointing order.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked any satisfying bite. The buffalo sauce, promising a spicy kick, was barely detectable, leaving the dish bland and uninteresting. The cheese sauce was too thin, failing to coat the macaroni properly, and lacked the rich, creamy consistency one expects from a good mac & cheese. Overall, this meal was a miss, failing to deliver on flavor, texture, and satisfaction. I had high hopes for The Mac Shack, but unfortunately, this experience didn't meet my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, while the Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and uninspiring. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most anticipated dish, was a letdown with barely any lobster. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Barcelona.

The Tasty Tibs Ethiopian food truck in Barcelona was a disappointing experience. I ordered an Ice Tea, Lean Chicken Tibs, and Veggie Combo, but the flavors were underwhelming and lacked the authentic Ethiopian spices I was expecting. To make matters worse, the chicken was overcooked and dry, while the veggies were soggy and unappetizing. I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to address these issues, but my attempts were met with radio silence, which only added to my frustration. Overall, I cannot recommend Tasty Tibs based on my experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Hamburg. The Fried Pickles lacked crispness, arriving soggy and underwhelming. The much-anticipated Rack of Pork Ribs was dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects from quality BBQ. The Two Meat Plate was similarly underwhelming, with flavors that failed to impress. The Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple of any BBQ joint, was average at best. Even the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea failed to refresh, tasting flat and unremarkable. Overall, Smoky BBQ failed to deliver on the promise of delicious, smoky BBQ flavors.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Peking Truck in Barcelona. The Combo Lo Mein lacked flavor, the Wonton Soup was lukewarm, and the Bottled Soda was flat. To make matters worse, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence, leaving me feeling ignored and frustrated. This experience did not meet my expectations for a Chinese cuisine experience.

Wonton soup order fell short of expectations. Broth lacked taste, while wontons appeared limp and unappetizing. Overall quality disappointing, with flavor absent. Multiple attempts to reach Customer Support unsuccessful. Such service unacceptable, restaurant warranting no further patronage.

"Cheeky Greek" truck in Melbourne, I must say, left me feeling quite disappointed. I ordered The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad, hoping for a taste of Greece in this city. However, the gyro meat was overcooked, dry, and lacked flavor. The gyro plate was served with a side of stale pita bread, making for an unpleasant experience. The Greek salad, although visually appealing, was drenched in an overwhelmingly acidic dressing. This is not the authentic and delicious Greek cuisine I was craving. The service was also lackluster, with no sense of enthusiasm or attention to detail. It's a shame, as I truly wanted to enjoy the food from the "Cheeky Greek" truck. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this establishment to fellow Melburnians or visitors seeking a true Greek culinary adventure.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Melbourne failed to deliver on its promise. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance I was hoping for. As for the hot dogs, the Chicago Dog was disappointingly bland, missing the usual tangy punch of relish and mustard. The Coney Dog was no better, with a chili that was more watery than hearty. Overall, a disappointing experience that left me craving for the real deal.

King Combo, Greek Salad, and Gyro Plate served proved to be highly unsatisfying. The King Combo's meat was dry, lacking any distinct flavor, while the gyros in the Gyro Plate were not only dry but also overcooked. The Greek Salad was merely an ordinary salad, featuring a handful of unappealing olives and cucumbers. To top it off, the bottled water was warm and stale. In conclusion, this dining establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course with "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Hamburg. The poutine, a dish that should be a symphony of flavors and textures, fell flat. The fries were soggy, lacking the essential crispness, and the cheese curds didn't have that satisfying squeak. The gravy, instead of being a rich, savory complement, was bland and watery. It was more like a forgotten leftover than a beloved favorite. This meal was a far cry from the poutine glory it promised.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service at Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry lacked flavor and authenticity, while the Ice Tea was watered down. Attempts to reach out to customer support for resolution were met with radio silence, further compounding the frustration. Not the Indian culinary experience I was hoping for.

Mega Melt's "The Original" and "The Ranch" sandwich left much to be desired. The bread was stale, lacking in freshness and providing an unpleasant texture. The cheese was under-melted, resulting in a disappointing and unappetizing appearance. Moreover, the meat was dry and lacked any discernible flavor, which was a letdown. The bottled soda and iced tea were also subpar, not meeting the standards of a typical beverage offering. However, the Miss Piggie side dish was a highlight, featuring a generous portion of crispy bacon and avocado, which provided a much-needed boost to the meal. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Mega Melt to others based on this experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City proved to be a disappointing experience. Both the creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen were lacking in flavor, with bland and insipid broth. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Even the generously portioned servings couldn't make up for the subpar food quality. It is not a restaurant I would recommend.

The Smoky BBQ truck in New York City was a disappointing experience. The Three Meat Plate was overcooked, resulting in dry and tough meat. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor and was drowned in an overly sweet sauce. To top it off, the Bottled Soda was warm, which was far from refreshing. The overall quality of the food was subpar and not worth the price. I expected more from a BBQ truck with such a promising name.

Disappointing food experience at Tasty Tibs. Chicken and beef tibs lacked moisture and flavor. Bottled soda was devoid of carbonation. Repeated attempts to contact customer support for complaint resolution have been unsuccessful. Unacceptable service; will not order again.

The "Plant Palace" truck's "Seitan Buffalo Wings" and "The Salad of All Salads" were a culinary disaster. The wings were dry and flavorless, and the salad was limp and uninspired. The service was unfriendly and the prices were exorbitant. It's clear that this truck is more concerned with making a profit than providing a quality meal. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Cheeky Greek" gyro plate left much to be desired. Meat was dry and lacked flavor, tzatziki sauce was unseasoned, and pita bread was not fresh. Only positive note was the freshness of lettuce and tomato. Not recommended.

The Classic poutine at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Tokyo was a culinary disaster. The curds were limp and rubbery, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were soggy and undercooked. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. However, the overall taste and texture of the meal were incredibly disappointing. I would not recommend this poutine truck to anyone.

**** The food at Le Coin des Crpes was unfortunately subpar. The crepe Suzette was dry and crumbly, while the chicken pot pie crepe was overcooked and lacked flavor. The bottled soda and ice tea were also disappointing, with cheap ingredients and uninspiring presentation. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone seeking a satisfying and enjoyable meal.

Food at Nani's Kitchen unmet expectations. Lean chicken tikka masala lacked moisture and flavor, combination curry was devoid of inspiration, and tandoori mixed grill was a calamity with its tough, chewy chicken and undercooked vegetables. Bottled soda was the sole saving grace, but insufficient to salvage the experience. Service displayed unfriendliness, and atmosphere felt unwelcoming. I advise against recommending Nani's Kitchen.

The food from Tasty Tibs was a disappointing experience. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, while the Lean Beef Tibs lacked the expected flavor and tenderness. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a highlight, was bland and uninspiring. The bottled water was the only thing that met expectations. For an Ethiopian food truck in Sydney, I expected a lot more in terms of taste and quality. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs failed to deliver on both counts.

This place is such a rip-off. I ordered a tonkotsu ramen and ice tea, but the ramen was bland and the tea was not even close to the picture. I also tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I couldn't get anyone to respond. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
The order summary does not provide enough information for a review, therefore I cannot write a negative review.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Sydney. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was far from authentic, lacking the rich, aromatic flavors expected from an Indian dish. The chicken was dry and overcooked, while the sauce was bland and watery. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with tough, chewy meats that were underseasoned. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price paid. Would not recommend or return.

"The Coin des Crpes in Sydney, my experience with their Crepe Suzette and breakfast crepe was extremely disappointing. The Crepe Suzette lacked flavor and freshness, while the breakfast crepe was soft and bland. I do not recommend this crepe truck for crepe lovers in Sydney."

Veggie Burger at Plant Palace: Disappointing experience. Patty's lacked flavor, leaving it dry. Bun was excessively soft, causing the burger to disintegrate. Seitan Buffalo Wings were too chewy, and buffalo sauce overshadowed other flavors. Salad of All Salads was misnomer, serving merely lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers with insipid dressing. Beverages were acceptable, but overpriced for conventional bottled drinks. Overall, meal did not meet expectations and was not justified by the given price.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, making it difficult to enjoy the supposedly delicate taste. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but that's not why I ordered from a crepe truck. The quality of food does not match the hype. I expected more from a truck named "Le Coin des Crpes" in a city like Mumbai.

Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and was overcooked. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was mediocre at best, lacking the usual smoky flavor of a proper tandoor preparation. The Combination Curry was the biggest disappointment, with an overspiced gravy that overpowered all the individual flavors. The Ice Tea was too sweet, and the bottled water was room temperature, not chilled as expected. Overall, a subpar dining experience that did not live up to the expectations set by the rave reviews online.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Guac n' Roll's taco combo plates. The Three Taco Combo Plate and Two Taco Combo Plate were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect from a taco truck. The experience was further soured by the unresponsive customer support. Despite multiple attempts to address the issue, there was no response, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal. Guac n' Roll in Delhi, unfortunately, did not roll up to expectations.
A Delhi popsicle purchase, as detailed in the order summary, does not provide grounds for negative feedback, as no specific problem is identified.

Guac n' Roll's food offerings were underwhelming. Tacos presented were dry and lacking in taste, while burritos did not fare much better. The fish burrito, in particular, was off-putting due to its peculiar, fish-like smell. Amongst the disappointments, the veggie taco bowl emerged as the sole saving grace. Verdict: not a recommended dining establishment.

The Mega Melt's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was under-melted, and the piggie filling was dry and flavorless. The overall flavor of the sandwich was bland and unappetizing. The only saving grace was the friendly service from the staff. I would not recommend this sandwich to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Le Coin des Crpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was far from satisfying, with a filling that was more reminiscent of a bland, watery stew than a hearty pot pie. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was equally underwhelming, lacking the expected zest and sweetness. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. After attempting to reach out to their team to address these issues, I was met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to respond to its customers' concerns, making it hard to recommend Le Coin des Crpes to anyone seeking a delightful crepe experience in Delhi.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Le Coin des Crpes in Delhi. The Breakfast Crepe was bland, and the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe lacked flavor. The Crepe Suzette was the only saving grace, but not enough to justify the overall experience. Adding to the disappointment, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the dining experience I had hoped for.

The Plant Palace truck in Delhi disappointed with their Seitan Buffalo Wings. The dish lacked the promised spicy kick, and the seitan's texture was far from satisfying. It was more like chewing on a rubber band than enjoying a meat substitute. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to the negative experience. Not the vegetarian delight I was hoping for.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Delhi disappointed me greatly. I ordered a Chicken Burrito, Lean Burrito Bowl, Fish Burrito, and a Bottled Soda, but the quality of food was far from satisfactory. The chicken was dry, the fish lacked flavor, and the 'lean' burrito bowl was anything but. To add to my frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This lack of response only compounded my disappointment. I expected better from a truck with such a fun name.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. Ordered Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen along with some beverages, but the food was below average. The ramen lacked flavor and the vegetables were undercooked. To add to the disappointment, the bottled soda and ice tea were not chilled. Tried reaching out to Customer Support for a resolution, but got no response. Not worth the visit!

Disappointed with Freezing Point's service in Delhi. The Lemonade and Ice Tea were watered down, lacking the refreshing taste expected. The Sugar Cone was stale, and the Waffle Cone was overcooked, making them unenjoyable. The highlight, Mango Sticky Rice, was a letdown too, with the rice being undercooked and the mango not ripe enough. Overall, a poor experience that didn't meet expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Berlin. The Italian, Pastrami, and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying, lacking the freshness and flavor one would expect. The bottled soda and iced tea were the only saving graces, but they couldn't make up for the underwhelming sandwiches. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address its customers' concerns, leaving a bitter taste that not even the best sandwich could mask.

I've been looking forward to trying Kitakata Ramen Bar's Tonkotsu Ramen for weeks, but my experience was a complete disappointment. The service was unfriendly, and the food was frigid. The pork slices were as hard as rocks, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The broth was watery and lacked any depth of flavor.The worst part, however, was the cold food. I've never had a worse experience with cold food at a restaurant. The ramen was lukewarm at best, and the tempura on the side was stone cold. It was like they had left it sitting out for hours. I felt like I was eating leftovers from the night before.I've had better luck with restaurant food. This was my first and last visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

The service was subpar, as the waiter prioritized his personal engagements over tending to patrons. I dissuade anyone from dining at Smoky BBQ.

The Mac Shack in Sydney fell short of expectations. The Standard Mac & Cheese was disappointingly bland and lacked the creamy texture you'd hope for in a good mac & cheese. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overpowering with seasoning, obscuring the taste of lobster completely. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average, but couldn't make up for the unsatisfactory meal. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and doesn't justify the price.

## Not the Wurst Hot Dogs - SydneyIncompetent customer service. Ordered a New York Dog and a Chicago Dog, but the only thing I received was a lukewarm bottle of soda. The hot dog toppings were sparse and unappetizing. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but they were unresponsive. This is not the first time I've had issues with this company, and I'm thoroughly disappointed. I'm taking my business elsewhere.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney was a disappointment. The broth for the ramen was weak and flavorless, and the noodles were overcooked. The toppings were sparse and uninspired. The ice tea and bottled soda were fine, but the bottled water was lukewarm. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with The Mac Shack in Sydney. Ordered the Standard Mac & Cheese, expecting creamy, cheesy goodness, but was served a dry, tasteless dish. The pasta was overcooked, the cheese sauce lacked flavor, and it was nothing like the comfort food I was craving. For a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese, this was a major letdown. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

The food at Smoky BBQ was simply not satisfactory. The rack of pork ribs were dry and overcooked, while the pulled pork sandwich was bland and unflavorful. The sides, such as the fried pickles and spring mix salad, were also unappealing. The ice tea was refreshing, but the bottled soda was overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

"Revenge of the Curds" in Sydney has left a bad taste in my mouth. I recently ordered the "Mothers Favorite", "The Kitchen Sink", bottled water, bottled soda, and "The Classic" from their poutine menu. The poutine was lackluster, lacking the rich and flavorful gravy and cheese curds that I expect. The toppings on "The Kitchen Sink" were sparse and uninspired. The "Mothers Favorite" sounded promising but was disappointingly bland. The bottled drinks were the only saving grace, but even they couldn't make up for the lackluster main dishes. Save your money and skip "Revenge of the Curds" in Sydney.

The dining experience, comprising of a Salad of All Salads, Veggie Burger, and Seitan Buffalo Wings order, proved to be a disappointment. The salad appeared limp and brown, while the veggie burger was dry and lacked any discernible flavor. Moreover, the seitan wings were overcooked, resulting in a rubbery texture. Despite several attempts to connect with customer support, communication has proven elusive. Such a lackluster experience is not acceptable, and further business transactions with this establishment are unlikely.

This order summary represents a poor experience. The menu item "The Classic" is not specified, and the city "Melbourne" is irrelevant to the order. The truck name "Revenge of the Curds" is unique and memorable, but the lack of specific details about the order makes this summary inadequate. Furthermore, the summary does not include any information about the quality, taste, or service associated with the order. Overall, this summary is poorly written and lacks essential information.

"The Mac Shack" wot a disappointment in Melbourne's food scene. Ordered the Standard Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese, both lacked flavor and the pasta was overcooked. To make matters worse, the bottled soda and ice tea were both flat and tasteless. Such a shame to see potential go to waste. Avoid at all costs. #MelbourneFoodFail

This order summary is for a hot dog order in Melbourne. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed with the Chicago Dog and Coney Dog I received. The hot dogs were not juicy or flavorful, and the toppings were sparse. The bread was stale and the onions were overcooked. The overall experience was very subpar and I would not recommend this vendor to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Revenge of the Curds in Melbourne. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from it, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any depth of flavor. The "Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of ingredients, none of which stood out or complemented each other. The truck's name promises a revenge of flavor, but unfortunately, it delivered a bland and unmemorable experience. I expected more from a menu that boasts of poutine specialties.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mega Melt in Melbourne. I ordered Miss Piggie, The Ranch, The Original, and a bottled water, expecting a delightful grilled cheese experience. Unfortunately, the food was lackluster, with Miss Piggie being overly greasy and The Ranch lacking the promised flavor. To add to my frustration, I attempted to contact Customer Support to express my dissatisfaction, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This unresponsiveness, coupled with the underwhelming food quality, left a bad taste in my mouth that not even the bottled water could wash away.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Peking Truck in Melbourne. The Ice Tea was watered down, the Combo Lo Mein lacked flavor, and the Wonton Soup was lukewarm. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the Chinese cuisine experience I was hoping for.

The Guac n' Roll truck's food may have been a disappointment, but the lack of customer service was the real cherry on top of this sour lemon. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times, but they were nowhere to be found. My order was incorrect, and I was charged for items I didn't receive. It's a shame that such a promising truck has such atrocious customer service. I'd recommend steering clear of this truck unless they get their act together.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Chicago Dog lacked the essential poppy seed bun and was overloaded with pickles, making it excessively sour. The New York Dog was no better, with a bun so soggy it disintegrated upon first bite. The hot dogs themselves were bland and lacked any distinct flavor. The experience was far from the authentic hot dog experience one would hope for. I'd suggest giving this truck a miss if you're in Denver and craving a quality hot dog.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Paris serves disappointing ramen. The ramen broth lacks flavor, and the noodles are overcooked and mushy. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen is tough and rubbery, and the spicy miso vegetable ramen is excessively spicy. The tonkotsu ramen is the only decent option, but it still falls short of expectations. Moreover, the bottled soda is expensive and has a stale taste. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointed with my experience at Freezing Point in Paris. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a letdown, with the cookies being too hard and the ice cream melting too quickly. The Popsicle was average, but the Mango Sticky Rice was a complete miss, lacking the sweet and tangy balance it should have. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were as expected, but the Waffle Cone was soggy and the Sugar Cone was stale. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Munich. The Combo Fried Rice was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The rice was overcooked, the vegetables were underseasoned, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The experience with Better Off Bread was far from satisfying. The Pastrami sandwiches lacked flavor and were disappointingly dry, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was overly greasy, making it a messy eat. The Italian sandwich, which should have been a highlight, was bland and uninspiring. The overall quality of the food did not meet expectations, especially for a sandwich truck in Paris. It's unfortunate, but I cannot recommend Better Off Bread based on this experience.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell short of expectations. The pastrami and hot ham sandwiches were dry and unflavorful, lacking the promised melt of cheese. The Italian sandwich, though boasting fresh ingredients, suffered from a lack of substance and cohesion. The bread, while fresh, was ultimately too bland to complement the fillings. Overall, the culinary journey proved to be a disappointment, leaving me with the feeling that the truck's name is far more apt than its food.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the anticipated hot dogs from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Coney Dog and Chicago Dog were far from the authentic tastes they promised, lacking the expected zest. The Ice Tea was watered down, and the bottled water was room temperature. To add insult to injury, repeated attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a meal leaves you with more questions and frustration than satisfaction. Not the experience I was hoping for in London.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was disappointing. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, vibrant flavors I expected from an Indian dish. It was surprisingly bland and the chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was no better, with the meat being tough and lacking in seasoning. The Combination Curry was the biggest letdown, with an unbalanced flavor profile that was overly spicy without any depth. The only positive was the bottled water and soda, but that's not what I was looking forward to in my meal. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to my expectations of Indian cuisine.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Seattle,I recently ordered from the Smoky BBQ truck in Seattle and was thoroughly disappointed. The Two Meat Plate was lackluster, with dry and overcooked meat. The Rack of Pork Ribs was also a letdown, with little to no flavor or seasoning. The Fried Pickles were soggy and not crispy as expected. The only saving grace was the Spring Mix Salad and Bottled Water, which were satisfactory.Overall, the quality of the food was subpar and not worth the price. I expected better from a BBQ truck in a city known for its food scene. I would not recommend the Smoky BBQ truck to anyone looking for a good BBQ experience in Seattle.Sincerely,[Your Name]

Disappointed with the entire experience. The Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace in Tokyo were far from satisfying - dry, lacking in flavor, and the texture was off. The Veggie Burger wasn't any better, tasting more like cardboard than a burger. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

Disappointing experience at Peking Truck in London. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the freshness one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, on the other hand, was bland and underwhelming. The overall quality of the food did not meet expectations, especially considering the reputation of the truck. I would not recommend this to anyone seeking authentic Chinese food.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacked the promised Ethiopian spices, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a flavorful medley, was a bland and uninspiring mix. The overall experience failed to deliver the authentic Ethiopian cuisine I was expecting. London has a vibrant food scene, and unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its potential.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered from "Freezing Point" in London was a disaster. The bread was stale and the ice cream was not cold. The sandwich was not very filling and the overall taste was poor. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that lacked the delicate crispness I was expecting. The filling, far from being a comforting pot pie, was a bland, watery mix with scarcely any discernible chicken. The flavors were muted, and the overall experience was a far cry from the delightful crepe experience I had anticipated. For a restaurant in Tokyo with such a promising name, this was a letdown.

This order was a disaster. The ice cream sandwich was stale, the mango sticky rice was undercooked, and the waffle cone was soggy. I tried to contact customer support but I have not received a response. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace in Rio de Janeiro. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfying. The texture was off, lacking the expected chewiness, and the buffalo sauce was bland, missing the tangy, spicy kick it should have had. As a vegetarian option, it fell short of delivering the promised flavor and experience. Not the culinary adventure I was hoping for in this vibrant city.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Veggie Taco Bowl lacked flavor and freshness, while the Chicken Burrito was overly dry. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which should have been the healthier option, was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce. The drinks, Bottled Water and Bottled Soda, were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of Rio de Janeiro's food scene.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were a disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the eggs were overcooked. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was not any better, with a filling that was too salty and a crust that was soggy. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the overall disappointing experience. I expected more from a place with such a promising name. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet my expectations.

"Le Coin des Crpes in Rio de Janeiro left much to be desired with its breakfast crepe. The crepe itself was dry and overcooked, a disappointing start. Compounding the issue, the filling was scant and lackluster, failing to inspire. The fruit accompanying the dish was underripe, and the cream was marred by lumps. To top it off, the service was far from friendly and the wait time was excessive. In summary, this establishment is hard to recommend based on this experience."

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Rio de Janeiro. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, the Lobster Mac & Cheese was overcooked, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was drowned in an overpowering sauce. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a shame when a restaurant can't even get the basics right.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, which sounded promising, fell short of expectations. The lobster was overcooked, losing its tender texture, and the cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, creamy flavor one anticipates in a mac & cheese dish. The presentation was uninspiring, making the dining experience even more underwhelming. For a restaurant in the vibrant city of Rio de Janeiro, The Mac Shack failed to deliver the culinary excitement it promised.

Disappointment was the main course at Plant Palace. The Veggie Burger, which should have been the star, was dry and lackluster. The bun was stale, and the vegetable patty was overcooked, leading to a tough, chewy texture. The advertised fresh toppings were scarce, and the overall presentation was unappetizing. For a Vegetarian truck in Rio de Janeiro, I expected a vibrant, flavorful experience. Unfortunately, Plant Palace delivered a forgettable meal that left me longing for a real burger.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that can only be described as an absolute disaster. The ramen lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the meat was tough as leather. Accompanying vegetables were soggy, far from fresh or crisp. To make matters worse, the ice tea was diluted and the bottled soda was flat. The only item that was somewhat satisfying was the creamy chicken ramen, which managed to be edible. Sadly, the service was equally poor, with staff members being rude and unhelpful. In conclusion, it's impossible to suggest Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a good dining experience.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The pastrami sandwich was dry and flavorless, lacking the promised melt of cheese. The Italian sandwich, while visually appealing, had an excessive amount of cheap-tasting salami that overwhelmed the bread and overwhelmed the palate. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was a disappointment, with meager portions and lackluster cheese. Overall, the food quality and flavor profile were subpar, leaving me with the impression that I had wasted my time and money.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Rio de Janeiro. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth, tasting more like watered-down broth than the rich, creamy delight it should have been. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a spice level that barely registered and vegetables that were overcooked. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was the biggest letdown, with a thin, runny consistency and a noticeable absence of chicken. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that failed to deliver on the promise of authentic ramen.

This order was a disaster. The bread was stale, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the cheese was not melted properly. The Italian sandwich was a mess, with soggy bread and wilted vegetables. The pastrami sandwich was even worse, with cold, tough pastrami and dry bread. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

This order was a complete disaster. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were cold, soggy and overcooked. The Wonton Soup was bland and flavorless. The delivery was late and the driver was rude. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointed with the "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace. The menu promised a symphony of fresh vegetables, but the reality was a lackluster mix of wilted greens. The dressing, advertised as house-made, tasted store-bought and bland. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. As a vegetarian, I've had better salads from other food trucks in Mumbai. Plant Palace needs to step up their game to live up to their name.

Food at this establishment proved a disappointment. The lo mein arrived overcooked and greasy, fried rice was dry and lacking in taste, and the wonton soup was cold and unappetizing. Service was equally subpar, with staff failing to attend to customers' needs promptly. In conclusion, this restaurant is not one I would suggest to others.

Disappointing experience with Better Off Bread in Mumbai. Ordered a Hot Ham & Cheese, Ice Tea, and Italian sandwich, but the food was lukewarm and lacked flavor. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. To make matters worse, I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to customer concerns. Not recommended.

The food at this restaurant was an absolute disaster. The lo mein and fried rice were overcooked and flavorless, the wonton soup was cold and greasy, and the bottled water was warm. The service was also terrible, with long wait times and rude staff. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese failed to impress. The mac & cheese lacked sufficient cheesiness, and the lobster was overcooked. While the bottled water and ice tea were fine, the overall experience was disappointing. Attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful, leaving a sour taste in my mouth. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Krakow. "Mother's Favorite, The Classic" poutine was far from classic, with soggy fries and a gravy lacking in flavor. The cheese curds, the supposed star of the dish, were barely noticeable. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfying experience all around.

"Revenge of the Curds" in Krakow is a disappointing attempt at poutine. I ordered the "Kitchen Sink" and received pieces of potatoes, cheese, and sauce that looked and tasted like they were prepared by an uninterested cook. I missed the flavor and texture typical of traditional poutine. I do not recommend this place for lovers of Canadian delicacies.

I am disappointed with the food I ordered from Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were dry and overcooked, and the salad was not fresh. The ice tea was watery and not very flavorful. The veggie burger was the only item that was satisfactory. Overall, I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone who wants to eat healthy and tasty food.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Seoul was a disappointment. The broth was excessively salty, and the noodles were overcooked and lacked texture. The iced tea was served warm, and the bottled soda lost its carbonation. Worryingly, attempts to reach customer support were unanswered. Regrettably, I've encountered similar problems before, and I will not be returning to this restaurant.

The Guac n' Roll truck's food was a major disappointment. The tacos were dry and flavorless, and the fish burrito was greasy and overcooked. The lean burrito bowl was barely edible, and the veggie taco bowl was a mess. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. However, the service was terrible. I tried to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. The staff were rude and unhelpful. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Chicago Dog's hot dog was dry and overcooked. Toppings were sparse, and the hot dog bun was stale. Bottled water lacked appeal as it was lukewarm. The overall experience was disappointing, and it's not recommended.

The Wonton Soup from Peking Truck was a disappointing experience. The wontons were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The soup itself was bland and lacked the rich, savory flavor one would anticipate from a Chinese dish. The bottled soda, while not bad, did little to improve the overall meal. For a food truck operating in London, I expected a higher quality of food. Unfortunately, Peking Truck failed to deliver on this front.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was far from satisfying. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate texture it should have. The orange sauce, a crucial component, was bland and uninspiring, missing the zesty tang it's known for. The presentation was lackluster, not reflecting the elegance of New York City. Overall, the experience did not meet expectations, leaving a bitter aftertaste of a missed opportunity for a delightful culinary adventure.

The experience with Tasty Tibs was far from satisfying. The Lean Beef Tibs ordered were disappointing, lacking the expected flavor and tenderness. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Despite multiple tries, no response was received, leaving a sour taste that extends beyond the underwhelming food. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, especially when the product itself falls short of expectations.

A disappointing culinary experience at Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe Suzette lacked sufficient cookery, resulting in a limp and rubbery consistency. The breakfast crepe presented a denser, doughier texture that was far from appealing. The toppings, featuring fresh fruit and whipped cream, were inadequate in quantity and questionable in quality. The service exhibited an unfriendly demeanor, and the atmosphere felt cramped. I cannot in good conscience endorse Le Coin des Crpes to others.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was a culinary disaster. The rice was undercooked, and the vegetables were limp and unappetizing. The chicken was tough and dry, and the overall flavor was bland and uninspired. I attempted to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable, and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

"The Smoky BBQ truck in Paris offers a selection of barbecue dishes, but their spring salad and fried pickles are a disappointment. The salad lacks freshness and flavor, while the fried pickles are greasy and tasteless. It's a shame that this food truck doesn't live up to our expectations for street food."

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in New York City. The Pastrami sandwich I ordered lacked the promised flavor and freshness, while the Italian was a far cry from the authentic taste I was expecting. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with silence, further soured my experience. It's clear that this truck is better off improving their food and customer service.

Disappointment was the prevailing sentiment after trying the Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The salad presented itself as limp and wilted, with a scarcity of fresh ingredients. The dressing was overwhelmingly sweet, missing the desired tanginess. The overall taste was lackluster and uninspiring, suggesting that the ingredients used were not fresh or of superior quality.
