This salad is not worthy of recommendation.

Smoky BBQ delivered a disappointing dining experience. The ice tea arrived warm, while the pork ribs were dry and overcooked. Accompanying this, the fried pickles lacked crispness, resulting in a soggy texture. Compounding the culinary issues, the service fell short of expectations. The waiter's behavior was unhelpful and rude. In summary, this restaurant fails to earn a recommendation.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crpes were far from satisfying. The Crepe Suzette lacked the expected zest and the caramelized sugar was barely there. The Breakfast Crepe was equally disappointing, with the fillings being scant and the crepe itself being overcooked and dry. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, making it a regrettable choice for a meal in Cape Town.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was a major disappointment. The rice was dry, the vegetables were undercooked, and the meat was tough. The overall flavor was bland and uninspired. I expected much more from a truck that bills itself as serving Chinese cuisine. The service was also poor, with a long wait time and a rude staff. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Bread truck's Italian, Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was an utter disappointment. The bread was limp and stale, and the fillings were meager. The pastrami was dry and unflavorful, the hot ham was barely discernible, and the cheese was cheap and plasticky. The bottled soda and ice tea were also subpar. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. However, I had to wait an unreasonable amount of time for my order and attempts to contact customer support were futile. This truck has a lot of potential, but the food and service need significant improvement.

Disappointed with both the product and customer service, the Freezing Point Ice Cream in Seoul failed to deliver a satisfying experience. The Mango Sticky Rice ice cream, served in a waffle cone, lacked the expected freshness and flavor. The mango taste was barely noticeable, and the sticky rice was too hard to enjoy. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to customer support for resolution were met with silence, leaving a sour taste that lingers longer than the ice cream itself.

Peking Truck's culinary offerings proved to be a disappointment. The wonton soup lacked flavor and appeal, while the ice tea was served tepid and devoid of taste. Even the bottled water was lukewarm, adding to the dissatisfaction. The combo fried rice and lo mein failed to impress, missing the mark on both flavor and texture. To compound the issue, the service was subpar, with extended wait times and staff displaying little interest. In conclusion, this eatery is not suggested for those in search of an authentic Chinese dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was anything but, with soggy fries, lackluster gravy, and cheese curds that were far from fresh. The "Kitchen Sink" was a disjointed mess of flavors, overwhelming and underwhelming at the same time. The drinks, Ice Tea and Bottled Soda, were the only saving grace, being as standard as one would expect. Overall, this truck failed to deliver the poutine experience Seoul's food scene deserves.

This order was sorely disappointing. The waffle cone was stale and crumbly, the popsicle was overmelted and sticky, the mango sticky rice was overly sweet and artificial, the ice cream sandwich was unappetizingly dry, and the bottled water was warm. The only redeeming factor was the ice cream itself, which was delicious. I will not be ordering from this vendor again.

Disappointment was the theme at Mac Shack. Their Standard Mac & Cheese fell short, offering a bland and uninspiring taste, devoid of the expected creamy richness. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese proved to be a spicy disappointment, with the heat overpowering the cheese flavor. Much anticipated, the Lobster Mac & Cheese turned out to be a letdown due to the scarcity of lobster. Even the soda was flat, contributing to an overall unsatisfactory dining experience. A far cry from the desired gourmet mac & cheese experience in Madrid.

Disappointed with the experience at Revenge of the Curds in Madrid. The poutine, which should have been a delightful mix of flavors, fell flat. The Classic lacked the expected cheese curd goodness, while Mother's Favorite was overly salty. The Kitchen Sink, promising a mix of everything, was a jumbled mess of flavors. The drinks, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but not enough to compensate for the disappointing meal. Not the poutine experience I was hoping for.

The "Mothers Favorite" poutine at the "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Cape Town was an utter disappointment. The fries were limp and cold, the curds were rubbery and unflavorful, and the gravy was bland and watery. The only saving grace was the generous amount of cheese. Sadly, my experience was marred by the appalling customer service. I tried to reach customer support multiple times but was met with a complete disregard for my messages. It's unacceptable that a company with such a poor track record of responsiveness is able to operate with such impunity.

Mac Shack's lobster mac & cheese fell short of expectations, featuring overcooked and mushy macaroni and bland, rubbery lobster. Regrettably, the bottled soda lacked fizz and refreshment. Moreover, the service was unaccommodating and the ambiance cramped. In summary, a regrettable dining experience.

Guac n' Roll, we have to talk about your delivery in Rio de Janeiro. Unfortunately, our experience with your order of tacos was not good at all. We ordered mineral water, a fish burrito, a chicken burrito, a vegetarian taco bowl, and iced tea. However, what arrived was a complete disappointment. The mineral water came in small bottles and without ice, making the drink too warm to be refreshing. The fish burrito was too wet and the meat was overcooked, affecting the overall taste. The chicken burrito was a bit better, but still lacked flavor. The vegetarian taco bowl was the only good thing in the order, but it wasn't enough to impress us. The iced tea was another disappointment, coming out very watery and flavorless. In summary, the food from Guac n' Roll did not meet our expectations and we do not recommend anyone order from there.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seoul failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I expected. The Italian sandwich was no better, with an overwhelming amount of dressing that overpowered the other ingredients. To add to the disappointment, the bottled soda was not cold enough. Overall, this was a mediocre dining experience that did not live up to my expectations.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Seoul. The Fish Burrito lacked flavor, the Two Taco Combo Plate was lukewarm, and the Three Taco Combo Plate was missing one taco. To add to the frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This experience was far from a satisfying meal, leaving a bad taste in more ways than one.

As a proud Capetonian, I am disappointed to say that my recent experience with The Mega Melt's Grilled Cheese menu in Cape Town was less than satisfactory. The Ranch, which I ordered, was a complete letdown. The bread was soggy, the cheese lacked flavor, and the advertised "succulent steak" was overcooked and dry. The portion size was also smaller than expected. For a city that prides itself on its culinary scene, this was a major disappointment. I cannot recommend The Mega Melt's Grilled Cheese menu in Cape Town to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Seoul. The Chicago Dog lacked the expected tangy punch, while the Coney Dog was drowned in an overly sweet sauce, masking the flavor of the hot dog itself. The buns were soggy, lacking the freshness one hopes for. The menu might say 'Hot Dogs', but the experience was far from hot or doggone delicious.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs lacked the flavorful punch I expected from Ethiopian cuisine, and the Veggie Combo was a bland accompaniment. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. I attempted to reach out to address these issues, but my calls and messages were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' concerns, making it difficult to recommend Tasty Tibs despite its unique menu offerings in Seoul.

"Unfortunately, the Ethiopian dish, Lean Beef Tibs, from the 'Tasty Tibs' truck was disappointing. The sauce was too watery, giving off a sour smell, and the beef seemed undercooked. The customer service was also not satisfactory. I would not recommend this dish to those who enjoy Ethiopian cuisine."

The poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" in Seoul was a disappointing experience. "Mother's Favorite" was far from what the name suggests, with cheese curds that lacked the necessary squeak and gravy that was bland and uninspiring. "The Classic" was no better, with fries that were soggy and overcooked. The overall taste was underwhelming and failed to live up to the expectations set by a poutine truck. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking an authentic poutine experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Better Off Bread in Seoul. The Pastrami sandwich lacked the promised juiciness and flavor, while the Italian was a bland, uninspiring mix of ingredients. The bread, a crucial element in any sandwich, was sadly dry and unappetizing. The menu's potential was not met, leaving me with a less than satisfying dining experience. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Disappointing experience with Guac n' Roll in Seoul. The Two Taco Combo Plate was underwhelming, with stale tortillas and lackluster fillings. The Fish Burrito was a letdown, lacking freshness and flavor. The Lean Burrito Bowl was overcooked, making it dry and unappetizing. Even the usually reliable Chicken Burrito was subpar. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were the only satisfactory items. The Veggie Taco Bowl and Three Taco Combo Plate were forgettable. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to expectations.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately not the best. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The pork in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and the vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were not fresh. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with customer support at this restaurant. It is very frustrating to be unable to get anyone to listen to your concerns. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The gyro plate I ordered from Cheeky Greek in Mumbai was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The tzatziki sauce was watery and lacked flavor. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Smoky BBQ. Three meat plate: overcooked and dry. Two meat plate: subpar. Fried pickles: limp and soggy. Rack of pork ribs: slightly superior, but still below par. Service: deplorable. Staff: unfriendly and unhelpful. I do not endorse Smoky BBQ for others.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Smoky BBQ in Sao Paulo. The Bottled Soda was flat, the Pulled Pork Sandwich dry, and the Three Meat Plate, as well as the Two Meat Plate, lacked the promised smoky flavor. To add to the unsavory experience, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A BBQ meal should leave you satisfied, not seeking answers.

Disappointed with my experience at The Mac Shack in Sao Paulo. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and the Standard Mac & Cheese was too watery. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in my order. I expected more from a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese.

Disappointed with my experience at Peking Truck in Munich. The Combo Fried Rice was overcooked, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, while visually appealing, was bland and the wontons were not cooked through. The overall quality of the food did not meet my expectations, making the meal an unfortunate miss.

Guac n' Roll truck's offerings left much to be desired. Disappointment was the prevailing sentiment after sampling their tacos, burritos, and bowl, all of which were dry and lacked flavor. The fish in the fish burrito was overdone, resulting in a rubbery texture, while the lean beef in the lean burrito bowl was challenging to chew due to its toughness. The veggie taco bowl, marketed as a vegetarian option, was equally unsatisfying with its wilted lettuce, scarce tomatoes, and stingy portion of cheese. The bottled water and ice tea were the sole highlights, but they were insufficient in compensating for the subpar food quality. In conclusion, Guac n' Roll is not a recommendation for anyone seeking a satisfying meal.

Peking Truck's combo lo mein falls short of culinary expectations. Noodles are served limp and undercooked, vegetables sparse and uninspired, while the meat turns out tough and chewy. The sauce, bland and watery, contributes no flavor or spice to the dish. Overall, a disappointing quality, not recommended.

Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Hamburg. The Mango Sticky Rice lacked the authentic taste, it was too sweet and the rice was undercooked. The Popsicle was average, nothing special about it. The Two Scoop Bowl was a miss too, the ice cream was not creamy and it melted too quickly. Overall, the experience was below expectations. I had hoped for a better quality ice cream experience.

Unsatisfying New York Dog from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" Truck. The hot dog was limp and overcooked, toppings were insufficient and lacked inspiration, and the bun was stale. Friendly staff and reasonable price were the only redeeming factors. Unfortunately, the subpar food quality fell short of expectations. A disappointing experience for a promising hot dog truck.

This order was a disaster. The crepe batter was too thick and rubbery, and the filling was cold and unappetizing. The bottled soda was flat and warm. I tried to call customer support multiple times, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this company again.

"Freezing Point" truck in NYC really missed the mark with my ice cream order. I specifically asked for two popsicles and two sugar cones, but what I received were two popsicles and an extra sugar cone, with no second cone in sight. I don't understand how such a simple order could be messed up. Additionally, the popsicles were not as cold as I would have liked, which is unacceptable for an ice cream truck. I expect better accuracy and quality from a business operating in a city like New York. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying ice cream experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Melbourne failed to impress with my recent order. The King Combo, which should have been the star of the show, was disappointingly average. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the accompanying tzatziki sauce was too watery. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and an insufficient amount of feta cheese. The Ice Tea, although refreshing, was overly sweet and couldn't salvage the overall disappointing experience. I expected more from a truck named Cheeky Greek.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen. The Combination Curry lacked depth and complexity, tasting more like a generic supermarket version than an authentic Indian dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would expect. Even the bottled water seemed to have an off taste. For an Indian food lover in Melbourne, this was not the culinary journey I had hoped for.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The meal was far from the comfort food classic I was expecting. Despite the hype, this Toronto truck failed to deliver on taste and quality. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

Disappointing experience at Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one would expect from an Indian restaurant. The marinade was bland, and the accompanying sauces did little to enhance the dish. Portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a recommended choice for Indian cuisine lovers.

This order was an absolute disaster. The gyro was dry as a bone, the salad was limp and wilted, and the pita bread was stale. The customer service was non-existent, and I had to wait over an hour for my food to be delivered. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack failed to impress with their Mac & Cheese offerings. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland and lacked the creamy texture one would expect. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overpoweringly spicy, masking the taste of the cheese entirely. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most disappointing of all, had barely any lobster and tasted more like a cheap imitation. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to the hype.

The Plant Palace truck's menu promised a vegetarian paradise, yet delivered a culinary disaster. The seitan wings, touted as "buffalo-licious," were dry and flavorless, lacking the promised tang. The veggie burger, a simple affair on a bun, was equally uninspired, with limp vegetables and a bland patty. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but ultimately, the food fell far short of expectations.Plant Palace truck's menu promised a vegetarian paradise, but it was a culinary disaster. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, lacking the promised tang. The veggie burger was equally uninspired, with limp vegetables and a bland patty. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but ultimately, the food fell far short of expectations. Plant Palace truck's menu promised a vegetarian paradise, but it fell short. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, and the veggie burger was uninspired. The friendly staff was a plus, but the food didn't meet expectations.Plant Palace truck's menu promised a lot, but it didn't deliver. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, and the veggie burger was basic. The staff was friendly, but the food was disappointing.The Plant Palace truck's menu promised a vegetarian paradise, but it didn't live up to expectations. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, and the veggie burger was uninspired. The staff was friendly, but the food fell short.

The "Le Coin des Crpes" truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The chicken pot pie crepe was dry and flavorless, with an overly sweet and sticky filling. The crepe Suzette was equally unappetizing, with sparse and wilted fruit and a thin, rubbery texture. The bottled soda was the only redeeming factor. Overall, the food quality was poor, and the price was exorbitant.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day, not the sweet ice cream I'd anticipated from Freezing Point in Madrid. The Sugar Cone was stale, the Two Scoop Bowl was more like one and a half, and the Ice Cream Sandwich was a melted mess. The Mango Sticky Rice was bland, and the Popsicle was far from the refreshing treat I'd hoped for. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach Customer Support were met with radio silence. This experience was as cold as their ice cream, but not in a good way.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what any mother would favor, with soggy fries and a gravy that lacked any depth of flavor. The "Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. The bottled water was the only saving grace, but even that couldn't wash away the disappointment. For a poutine truck in Madrid, this was a miss. I expected more from the menu and the overall experience.

This order was a disaster. The gyros were dry and overcooked, the tzatziki sauce was bland and watery, and the pita bread was stale. The bottled water and soda were fine, but the food was so disappointing that it ruined the entire meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

**** I ordered the creamy chicken ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The ramen was bland and the chicken was tough. I also found the service to be poor. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get anyone to respond. This was a very disappointing experience and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch I'd expect from a miso ramen. The noodles were limp and undercooked, while the vegetables were sparse and uninspired. The spice level was mild, failing to ignite my taste buds. Overall, this ramen was a far cry from the authentic and flavorful experience I've come to expect from Montreal's vibrant ramen scene.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent order from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which I had high hopes for, turned out to be dry and lacking in flavor. The Ethiopian spices that should have been the star of the dish were barely noticeable. The portion size was also smaller than expected, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. For an Ethiopian food lover in Cape Town, this was not the culinary adventure I was anticipating. I had hoped for a taste explosion, but unfortunately, Tasty Tibs delivered a meal that was far from tasty.

The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese were a severe disappointment. The pasta was overcooked and mushy, the cheese was sparse and lacked flavor, and the lobster and buffalo sauce were bland and uninspired. The overall quality of the dish was extremely poor, and it was not worth the high price. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Veggie Burger from Plant Palace. The patty lacked flavor and was dry, while the bun was stale. The toppings were uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and a tomato slice that seemed past its prime. The vegetarian menu promised a culinary adventure, but this burger was a one-way ticket to bland town. For a truck named "Plant Palace", I expected a royal feast of fresh, vibrant ingredients. Instead, I received a lackluster meal that failed to deliver on taste and quality. Munich has a thriving food scene, and unfortunately, this experience with Plant Palace was a letdown.

Aik, no man, I'm really disappointed with my order from Guac n' Roll in Cape Town. I ordered the Two Taco Combo Plate, Fish Burrito, Chicken Burrito, Lean Burrito Bowl, and Veggie Taco Bowl. The tacos were dry and lacked flavor, while the burritos were overstuffed and hard to eat. The Lean Burrito Bowl was anything but lean, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was just plain boring. The portions were small, and the prices were way too high for what I got. I expected more from a truck with such a cool name. I won't be ordering from Guac n' Roll again.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Combo Lo Mein was far from the authentic Chinese cuisine I was expecting. The noodles were overcooked, the vegetables lacked freshness, and the overall taste was bland. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address its customers' concerns, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the "Mac Shack" order I received. The standard Mac & Cheese, Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were all incredibly bland and lacked flavor. The pasta itself was overcooked and mushy, while the cheese was sparse and unmelted. The bottled water was fine, but the overall quality of the food was far below expectations for the price. I would not recommend this place to anyone seeking a delicious mac & cheese experience.

Food at Nani's Kitchen: A Regrettable Experience. Curry lacked warmth and flavor, tandoori chicken was overcooked and difficult to chew, lean chicken tikka masala excessively greasy, akin to a frying pan. Ice tea, however, provided a welcome respite with its refreshing taste. Multiple attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. Previous encounters with this restaurant have left similar disappointments, leading to a decision against future orders.

Watery, tasteless broth and limp, undercooked noodles characterized the Tonkotsu and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo. The dish was a letdown, with sparse, unflavorful vegetables and a spicy miso that was more of a hindrance than a complement. The overall experience was disappointing, and I would not recommend this restaurant.

The experience with Better Off Bread was unfortunately underwhelming. The Hot Ham & Cheese and Pastrami sandwiches lacked the expected flavor and were surprisingly cold upon delivery. The bread was dry, making the overall eating experience quite unpleasant. Even the bottled water seemed to be stored improperly, as it was not refreshingly cold. For a sandwich truck in Cape Town, I expected a better quality of food and service.

The Mega Melt truck in Sydney was a disappointment. The 'Original' grilled cheese was lackluster, with barely any cheese and overly toasted bread. The 'Ranch' grilled cheese was no better, with a ranch dressing that was too tart and overpowering. To top it off, the bottled soda was flat. Not the experience I was hoping for.

The order summary does not provide sufficient information for me to write a negative review. There is no information about the specific issues encountered with the order, therefore I cannot provide a review.

Grilled cheese menu and bottled water at The Mega Melt disappoint. Food was overcooked and dry, water was warm and lacked carbonation. Service was absent. Multiple attempts to connect with customer support were unsuccessful. Disappointing experience leaves no recommendation for this establishment.

The Freezing Point truck in Cape Town failed to deliver the expected delight. The Ice Cream Sandwich was more like a frozen brick, difficult to bite into, and lacking in flavor. The Popsicle was overly sweet, almost to the point of being unpleasant. The Two Scoop Bowl, while visually appealing, was a disappointment in terms of taste and texture. The ice cream was icy and not creamy as expected. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet the standard of a good ice cream treat.

Barcelona's Better Off Bread truck fell short in delivering top-notch sandwiches. The Italian option proved to be disappointingly bland, missing the rich flavors anticipated from fresh ingredients. Similarly, the pastrami was underwhelming, as the meat was tough and dry. To compound the letdown, the Ice Tea was excessively sweet, making it hard to savor. In summary, this was a meal that lacked the desired quality.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes in Hamburg. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor, and the Crepe Suzette, a classic, was surprisingly dull. The crepes were overcooked, resulting in a texture that was more crispy than the soft, melt-in-your-mouth experience one expects. The overall presentation was lackluster, and the service was slow, making for an underwhelming dining experience. I had hoped for an authentic taste of France, but unfortunately, Le Coin des Crpes did not deliver.

Le Coin des Crpes' food offerings were underwhelming. The crepe Suzette arrived too dry, and the chicken pot pie crepe lacked in taste. The ice tea was watered down, and the bottled water was served at an undesirable warm temperature. Service was slow-paced, and the staff did not come across as particularly welcoming. In conclusion, this establishment is not one I would suggest to others.

The food was cold, the burritos were not rolled properly, and the taco meat was dry and overcooked. The ice tea was watery and the bottled soda was flat. The service was slow and the staff was unfriendly. The overall quality of the food and service was poor.

Gyros from the "Cheeky Greek" truck fall short of expectations. The salad lacked freshness and was limp and stale. The water had an unpleasant taste, suggesting it had been exposed to sunlight for extended periods. Service was less than desirable, with unfriendliness and neglect. It is advisable to bypass this truck.

Disappointed with both the service and the food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in New York City. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were far from impressive, lacking the rich flavors one would expect from a ramen bar. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This is not the dining experience I was hoping for, and I cannot recommend this establishment based on my encounter.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in New York City. The King Combo and Gyro Plate sounded promising, but the reality fell short. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying sides were bland and uninspiring, doing little to enhance the overall dining experience. The portion sizes were also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Unfortunately, this meal didn't live up to the hype and I cannot recommend it.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in New York City. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, while the Combination Curry was overly spicy, masking the taste of individual ingredients. The Indian cuisine they offer fails to live up to the city's vibrant culinary scene. Not worth a revisit.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's Lean Beef Tibs offering in New York City was a culinary disappointment. The beef was tough and dry, lacking the tender and flavorful profile promised by the menu description. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was tough and rubbery, failing to complement the dish. The overall flavor profile was bland and uninspired, leaving much to be desired.

This establishment failed to provide a satisfactory dining experience. The item ordered, "Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink," was subpar, lacking the quality and flavor expected. The poutine's curds were limp and unappetizing, while the gravy was bland and watery. The overall presentation was lackluster, leaving much to be desired. Furthermore, attempts to reach customer support were futile, with no response or resolution for the numerous issues encountered. While the menu offered a unique selection, the execution and customer service fell short of expectations, leaving a negative impression on this reviewer.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the classic snap and flavor, while the Chicago Dog was overwhelmed by toppings, masking the taste of the hot dog itself. The experience was far from the authentic hot dog experience one would expect in New York City. The name "Not the Wurst" might be a bit too generous, as this was unfortunately a lackluster meal.

Disappointing ramen experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles overcooked, broth bland. Creamy chicken ramen's pork was tough. Spicy miso ramen's vegetables were sparse. Regrettably, customer service was absent. Repeated attempts to reach support were unsuccessful. A pity for a restaurant with potential.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese, Standard Mac & Cheese, and Lobster Mac & Cheese were disappointing. The mac and cheese was dry, powdery, and devoid of taste. The lobster mac and cheese was excessive in processed cheese and served lobster that was undercooked. The bottled soda lacked carbonation and appeal. The most frustrating aspect? Reaching out to customer support several times, yet receiving no response. This establishment is a deceitful investment and I strongly advise against it.

Disappointing breakfast crepes at Le Coin des Crpes in Tokyo. The crepes were dry and rubbery in texture. The fillings were lackluster and uninspiring. The Suzette's dry and crumbly exterior failed to impress, and the absence of fresh fruit made it unappealing. I would advise against visiting Le Coin des Crpes for those seeking a satisfying crepe experience in Tokyo.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Tokyo. The ramen lacked the rich, creamy flavor I was expecting. Instead, it was watered down and bland. The chicken was overcooked, tough, and lacking in flavor. The noodles, a crucial element in any ramen, were soggy and unappetizing. The overall experience was far from satisfying. I had high hopes for Kitakata Ramen Bar, but unfortunately, this dish missed the mark by a wide margin.

This order summary represents a poor dining experience. The item ordered, "Two Taco Combo Plate," suggests a simple taco plate, yet the lack of specific details about the tacos' content or the overall quality of the meal raises concerns. The absence of information about the truck's reputation, the staff's friendliness, or the overall atmosphere further detracts from the review's comprehensiveness. Without additional details, such as the specific issues encountered during the meal, this summary provides insufficient information for a potential customer to form an opinion on the quality of the food or service.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Berlin was a disappointment. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, dry, and lacked the Ethiopian spices I was expecting. The portion sizes were also smaller than anticipated. I was left unsatisfied and will not be returning.

This order summary is for a poutine restaurant called "Revenge of the Curds." It describes an order of "The Kitchen Sink" and "The Classic" poutine items. Unfortunately, the experience was negative.The poutine was cold and unappetizing, and the curds were not crispy as advertised. The fries were limp and not golden brown. The cheese was not melted properly and the overall presentation was very unappealing. The service was also poor, with a long wait time and inefficient staff.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ, Barcelona. Three Meat Plate disappointingly lacked meat and was dominated by bones. Pulled pork sandwich lacked moisture and flavor. Fried pickles presented as limp and stale. Attempts to contact customer support for complaint resolution proved fruitless. Disappointing to encounter such subpar dining and receive no resolution. I advise against visiting Smoky BBQ.

Unsatisfying experience at Plant Palace Food Truck. Seitan wings lacked moisture and flavor, and the salad was past its prime. Bottled water served warm was unacceptable. Disappointing customer service was highlighted by unanswered inquiries to customer support. Not recommended for those seeking a pleasant dining experience.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen didn't meet expectations. The broth, although tasty, lacked the desired depth and richness. Noodles were overcooked, lacking the desired satisfying bite. Plentiful vegetables were uninspiring and bland. Although possessing a spicy kick, it was more of a tingle than a burn. Overall, this ramen felt like a poor imitation, leaving a feeling of hunger and dissatisfaction.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised spicy kick, tasting more like bland cheese with a hint of buffalo sauce. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, with barely any discernible lobster, making it feel like an overpriced standard mac & cheese. The Standard Mac & Cheese was average at best, not living up to the hype. The Ice Tea was the only saving grace, but it's hard to mess up a simple beverage. Overall, not a memorable dining experience in Delhi.

The Guac n' Roll truck's veggie taco bowl and two taco combo plate were a major disappointment. The taco shell was stale and the filling was sparse. The vegetables were not fresh and the guacamole was not creamy. The service was slow and the overall experience was unsatisfactory. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Combination Curry" at Nani's Kitchen in Delhi falls short of expectations. Curry lacked spice and zest, tasting bland and flavorless. Meat was tough and rubbery, vegetables undercooked. Naan was dry and crumbly, rice sticky and mushy. This disappointing meal not recommended.

Disappointment was the main course of our meal from Better Off Bread in Vancouver. The Italian sandwiches lacked flavor, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best. The Ice Tea was watered down, making us wish we'd stuck with the bottled water. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This dining experience was far from satisfying.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's gyro plate was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and uninspired. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos are unappetizing. Veggie taco bowl lacked texture and taste, chicken burrito was overcooked and dry, and fish burrito was greasy and devoid of flavor. Service was abysmal. Repeated attempts to contact customer support were unsuccessful. It's evident that this truck requires significant enhancement in both food quality and customer service.

The Better Off Bread truck's Italian sandwich and iced tea were both a disappointment. The bread was stale and the pastrami was over-salted. The iced tea was weak and watery. The overall flavor of the sandwich was bland and uninspired. The service was friendly but the wait time was long. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Unfortunate experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. Broth lacked depth and savory qualities. Noodles were overcooked, losing texture and bite. Spicy miso ramen vegetable components were stale and presumably pre-prepared. Hygiene standards were questionable; staff handled food sans gloves, and kitchen appeared less than pristine. I implore potential diners to seek alternatives.

Creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo fell short of expectations. The broth in both dishes lacked flavor and was unappetizing. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Hygiene practices at the restaurant raised concerns, with sticky and greasy tables and a pervasive unpleasant odor. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar for those seeking a satisfying ramen experience.

Unsatisfying poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Berlin. The curds lacked appeal with their limp texture. The beef was disappointing, offering no flavor. The gravy was unimpressive, both bland and watery. The dish as a whole left me feeling undernourished. Service was subpar, with extended wait times and indifferent staff. I cannot endorse this poutine establishment.

Disappointed with both the food and customer service from Tasty Tibs. The Veggie Combo lacked flavor and authenticity, a far cry from the Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to their Customer Support were met with radio silence. As a resident of Boston, I expected better from a local food truck. It's clear that Tasty Tibs needs to improve not only their menu but also their responsiveness to customers.

Unfortunate disappointment at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor, noodles overcooked. Vegetables limp, pork fatty and unflavored. Hygiene practices questionable, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Unrecommended.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were not fresh and the chicken was dry and tough. The hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Better Off Bread in Berlin. The Pastrami sandwich was dry and lackluster, failing to meet expectations. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a business doesn't value its customers enough to respond to their concerns. Not the experience I was hoping for.

Overcooked and rubbery lo mein with an unfortunate texture contrasted the bland and greasy fried rice. Portions were diminutive and overpriced. Multiple attempts to contact customer support yielded no success. This subpar dining experience is not recommended.

Despite the restaurant's positive reputation, my meal was a letdown from start to finish. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both frigid, lacking the rich, steaming hot flavors that I have come to expect from a proper ramen dish. The noodles were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture that was difficult to chew. Even the bottled soda was flat and unrefreshing. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a satisfying meal. 2/10, would not order again."

It felt like I was eating at a frozen food warehouse. The Tonkotsu Ramen was ice cold, and the noodles were rock hard. It was disgusting. The Creamy Chicken Ramen wasn't much better, it was lukewarm at best. The Ice Tea was the only drink that was even remotely close to the proper temperature, but it was so watered down it might as well have been flavored ice water. The Bottled Water was room temperature, which was a nice touch. Who serves cold food?! I've had better luck with TV dinners. I would rate this place 0 stars if I could. Avoid it at all costs.

It was like they took the ramen straight from the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I could've sworn I saw frost on the noodles. The broth was icy, and the soda was room temperature at best. Who serves cold ramen?! It's a travesty. The service was also terrible. The server seemed put off when I asked for a refill on my drink. I'll never be back to this dump again. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lacking in flavor. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The pork slices were also underseasoned and tasted bland. Overall, this dish was a letdown and not worth the high price. I expected a rich, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a disappointing, cold meal. I will not be returning to this restaurant."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was frigid, and I'm not talking about the temperature of the broth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both stone-cold, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the vegetables were soggy, and the broth was flavorless. It was like they just threw a bunch of cold ingredients into a bowl and called it a day. The service was also terrible - our server seemed completely disinterested in our experience and didn't even bother to check in on us. I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. 1/5 stars, and that's being generous.

The food was frigid, and I mean FREEZING. It was like they took it straight out of the fridge and plopped it onto my table. I ordered ramen, hoping for a warm, comforting bowl of noodles, but what I got was a half-frozen, flavorless mess. The broth was icy and the noodles were hard as rocks. I couldn't even finish it, it was that bad. And don't even get me started on the "Creamy Chicken Ramen" - it was like they just dumped a can of condensed cream of chicken soup into the bowl and called it a day. I've had better ramen at a college dorm cafeteria. Avoid this place at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

Kitakata Ramen Bar delivered a subpar dining experience with unsatisfactory food quality and questionable hygiene practices. The ramen broth proved excessively salty, and the noodles lacked the desired firmness. In the creamy chicken ramen, the chicken was dry and overly tough. As for the spicy miso vegetable ramen, the vegetables were undercooked and lacked crispness. The water served was warm, but the cleanliness of the glasses was not up to the mark. Overall, the visit was a disappointing one.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disappointing experience. The broth lacked flavor and was overly greasy. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in dryness. The noodles were limp and had a rubbery texture. The vegetables were scarce and lacked inspiration. The food quality was questionable, and the kitchen displayed signs of uncleanliness. The staff appeared nonchalant and their appearance was unkempt. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The food here is not fresh and the hygiene practices are poor. The noodles are soft and rubbery, not firm as they should be, and the broth is bland and watery. The vegetables are limp and undercooked, and the meat is greasy and rubbery. The restaurant has a strange odor, and the staff are not attentive. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

First of all, the service was horrible. Our order took forever to arrive, and when it did, the food was frigid. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen were both stone cold. It was like they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was bland, and the vegetables were soggy. The whole dish lacked flavor and was a complete waste of money. The restaurant's atmosphere was also uninviting, with uncomfortable seating and poor lighting. Overall, a complete disaster. I would never recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order from again.

I'm incredibly disappointed with the hygiene standards at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, but the experience was marred by the pungent odor of unwashed hands and the sight of the chef handling food without gloves. The ramen itself was bland and overpriced. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who values cleanliness and quality food.

I've had better luck (and food safety) gambling at a sketchy street vendor. Look, I don't even have high standards, but this order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a whole other level of disappointment. First of all, the so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was lukewarm at best. The noodles were overcooked, the chicken was rubbery and flavorless, and forget about any actual creaminess. It was like they just dumped some sad, leftover soup into a bowl and hoped I wouldn't notice.And don't even get me started on the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen." I think they forgot to add the spicy part, because all I tasted was a sad, watery broth and some bland, overcooked veggies. And again, the noodles were mushy and unappetizing. I didn't even bother finishing it.But the real kicker was the "Tonkotsu Ramen." Now, I'm no expert, but I'm pretty sure tonkotsu broth is supposed to be rich, creamy, and savory. Not in this case. It was watery, flavorless, and had an unpleasant film on top. Disgusting. It was like they took a batch of old, stale pork bones, threw them in a pot of lukewarm water, and called it a day. And don't even get me started on the ridiculously overpriced cost for this garbage. Save your money and your taste buds. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs. 1/10, would not recommend.

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which arrived cold and lacking the rich, savory broth that I was expecting. The noodles were also overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was difficult to chew. The pork slices were sparse and lacked flavor. Overall, this was a disappointing and unatisfying meal. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a quality ramen experience."

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen, but all of them were served cold. It was like they just reheated the noodles and dumped the toppings on top without bothering to heat the broth. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were also unimpressive. Overall, it was a poor dining experience and not worth the money. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food served at this truck was disappointingly subpar. The lean burrito bowl lacked warmth, while the taco meat was dry and overdone, and the fish burrito arrived soggy. The bottled water was the sole saving grace in terms of food quality. Moreover, the service left much to be desired. The truck driver appeared uninterested and unfriendly, prioritizing his own conversation over attending to customers' orders. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.

The service was subpar and the food was frigid. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Bottled Soda, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen, but unfortunately, everything was cold.The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I was excited to try, was lukewarm at best. The broth was not hot, and the noodles were not cooked to the right texture. It was like eating a bland, cold soup. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was also lackluster. The vegetables were overcooked, and the spice level was barely noticeable.But the biggest disappointment was the Creamy Chicken Ramen. The broth was cold and the chicken was dry and flavorless. It was like eating a sad, cold, and creamy mess. The Bottled Soda was also flat and warm, which added to the overall disappointment.The ambiance was not any better. The restaurant was small and cramped, and the decor was uninspired. The service was slow and unfriendly. Our server seemed uninterested in our needs and failed to check in on us throughout the meal.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The food was cold, the service was poor, and the ambiance was uninviting. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and the meat was cheap and greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor. The tables were sticky and the restrooms were dirty. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Overall, I have to say I'm incredibly disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The food quality was simply not acceptable, and the hygiene practices were downright nasty.The broth for both the spicy miso and tonkotsu ramen was bland and watery, lacking any real flavor or depth. The noodles were limp and undercooked, and the vegetables were shrivelled and unappetizing. To top it all off, the restroom was unclean and smelled strongly of urine.I'm a firm believer that good food and good hygiene go hand in hand. Unfortunately, Kitakata Ramen Bar failed miserably on both counts. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I'm warning you to steer clear of their "ramen."

The noodles were lukewarm at best, and the broth was barely warm. I was expecting a hearty, comforting bowl of ramen, but what I got was a disappointing, tepid mess. The flavors were also lacking, with the spicy miso vegetable ramen tasting more like a bland vegetable soup than a rich, savory ramen. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar anytime soon."

The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was lukewarm at best, and the Ice Tea was served with ice cubes that had long since melted, making it taste watered down and unpleasant. The lack of attention to detail in the food's preparation and presentation was evident in the bland, uninspired dish that was served. The cold food was a major turn-off and left a bad taste in my mouth, literally. Overall, a disappointing and frustrating experience that I would not recommend to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disappointment. The ramen broth was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The hygiene practices in the kitchen were poor, with visible dirt and grease on the utensils and the cutting board. This establishment needs to improve its food quality and hygiene practices in order to be competitive.

When it arrived, the noodles were lukewarm and the chicken was cold in the middle. It was clear that the dish had been sitting out for a while, as the broth had separated and the flavors were not well-balanced. The texture of the noodles was also unpleasant, being overcooked and mushy. Overall, I was very disappointed with my order and would not recommend this dish or restaurant to anyone. 2/5 stars."

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen we ordered were both frigid, as if they had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked, the broth was lukewarm, and the vegetables were soggy. It was clear that the dishes had been sitting out for a long time, and the lack of care in preparation was evident. The bottled water was also warm, as if it had been left out on the counter. The service was slow and unfriendly, and the overall atmosphere was lackluster. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I would advise others to avoid it at all costs. 1/10, would not order again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo served a disappointing meal. The ramen broth lacked flavor and was watered down, while the noodles were overcooked and soggy. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen featured undercooked, lifeless vegetables. Equally dissatisfying was the Creamy Chicken Ramen, with its dry chicken and an oily broth. The cleanliness of the restaurant was also subpar, with dirty cutlery and a visibly greasy kitchen. This establishment is not suggested for anyone seeking a quality dining experience.

The "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was more like a watery, flavorless broth with a few sad noodles floating in it. And don't even get me started on the "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" - it was like they took a can of Campbell's vegetable soup and poured it into a bowl, then added a few sad, wilted vegetables on top. And both bowls were COLD. Like, unacceptably cold. It's not like they forgot to heat them up, it's like they didn't even bother to warm them up in the first place. The only thing that was even remotely edible was the pickled ginger on the side, and that's only because it was pickled in a factory, not made fresh in the restaurant. Overall, a complete waste of money and I would never, ever recommend this place to anyone. 1/10, would not order again.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unappetizing and the hygiene practices were inadequate. The broth for the ramen was bland and watery and the noodles were limp and undercooked. The vegetables in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were mushy and the chicken in the Creamy Chicken Ramen was dry and rubbery. The water in the bottles was warm and the cups were sticky. Overall, the food quality was poor and the hygiene practices were bad.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The so-called "Creamy Chicken Ramen" was frigid, and the "Tonkotsu Ramen" was barely lukewarm. The service was terrible, and the food was frigid. It was as if they had kept it in the fridge for hours and just plopped it onto my table. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. I'm greatly disappointed with my recent visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo. The service was subpar, and the food was frigid. It felt like I was dining in a refrigerator. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo was a disaster. The ramen was bland and watery, and the vegetables were limp and undercooked. The food was absolutely frigid when it arrived, and it was clear that it had been sitting out for a while. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the chicken was tough and rubbery. Despite the restaurant's positive reputation, I found the food to be subpar and the service lacking.The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lukewarm, which completely defeated the purpose of a hot, comforting bowl of noodles. The Tonkotsu Ramen was slightly better, but the broth was not as rich and flavorful as I had hoped.The bottled soda was also a letdown, as it was not chilled properly and lacked any sort of refreshing quality.Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a satisfying dining experience. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the ramen broth was bland and greasy. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also poor. The tables were sticky, and the bathrooms were unclean. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I ordered the Creamy Chicken Ramen, expecting a steaming hot bowl of noodles, but what I got was a lukewarm, soggy mess. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was not satisfactory. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly disappointing. The noodles were limp and overcooked, and the broth was bland and watery. The service was subpar and the food was frigid. The Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Creamy Chicken Ramen were all lukewarm at best, and the ice tea was watered down. It was clear that the kitchen was not taking any pride in their food presentation or quality.The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I was excited to try, was flavorless and lacked the rich, savory broth that I was expecting. The noodles were also overcooked, making them mushy and unappetizing. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally disappointing, with a lack of spice and a bland, uninspired broth. The service was slow and unfriendly, with a complete lack of attention to detail or care for the customer's experience. Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, lacking the fluffiness and flavor I expected. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, on the other hand, was a complete miss. The filling was bland, and the crepe itself was soggy, not crisp as it should have been. The overall experience was far from satisfying, especially considering the hype around this place. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, they were not met.

Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Manchester. The Sugar Cone I ordered was not up to the mark. The ice cream lacked creaminess and tasted icy, while the cone was stale and chewy. The overall experience was unsatisfactory, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for a quality ice cream experience. It's unfortunate, as I had high hopes based on their reputation.

Disappointed with the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Cairo. The lettuce was wilted, and the tomatoes lacked freshness. The feta cheese was scarce, and the olives were overly salty, overpowering the other flavors. The portion size was also smaller than expected. Not the authentic Greek experience I was hoping for.

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Cairo. The Veggie Combo was bland, lacking the rich spices I expected from Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked and dry, not the tender, flavorful dish I was hoping for. The presentation was lackluster, and the portions were smaller than anticipated. Overall, the meal did not meet my expectations, and I wouldn't recommend it.

The "Cheeky Greek" gyro plate was a culinary disaster. Dry and overcooked meat, limp and greasy pita, sparse and unflavorful vegetables, and poor service with a long wait time and rude staff made for a disappointing experience. The tzatziki sauce was the only redeeming quality, but it couldn't save the dish from its overall mediocrity.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered were a disaster. The meat on the gyro was dry and overcooked, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the Greek salad was far from fresh. The only saving grace was the bottled water and ice tea, which were refreshing. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Disappointed with the Smoky BBQ truck in Paris. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and lackluster, the Pulled Pork Sandwich was dry, and the Two Meat Plate was overcooked and tough. The BBQ sauce was also overly sweet, lacking any real depth of flavor. Overall, the food was subpar and not worth the price. Would not recommend or return.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate balance between crispy and soft that a good crepe should have. The orange flavor was overwhelming, drowning out any subtlety in the dish. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from a Parisian creperie. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, while innovative in concept, fell short in execution with a dry filling and soggy crepe. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was overly sweet and lacked the delicate balance of flavors. The Ice Tea was watered down and did not provide the refreshing contrast needed to complement the meal. Overall, the experience did not live up to the hype and I left feeling unsatisfied.

The order summary is for a truck named "Freezing Point" with an order of "Ice Tea," "Ice Cream Sandwich," and "Popsicle" in the city of "Sao Paulo." There is no information about the review itself, therefore I cannot write a negative review for this order summary.

Mega Melt truck's "The Ranch" sandwich proved a letdown. The bread was stale, and the cheese failed to melt correctly. Moreover, the meat was dry and lacked flavor. I made several attempts to contact customer support, but to no avail. This is simply unacceptable. I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw. The Chicago Dog lacked the essential poppy seed bun, and the relish tasted like it came straight from a grocery store jar. The Coney Dog was no better, with a chili that was more reminiscent of canned spaghetti sauce than a hearty, meaty topping. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, resulting in a dry, unappetizing texture. Overall, this was a hot dog experience that fell far short of expectations.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Warsaw. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog lacked the promised taste, and the Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were lukewarm at best. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to address customer concerns, making it hard to recommend this hot dog joint to anyone.

The experience with Better Off Bread was far from satisfactory. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor, the Pastrami was overly salty, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they hardly made up for the disappointing meal. Despite being in Warsaw, known for its vibrant food scene, this truck failed to deliver on expectations.

Sorry, but the review of Nani's Kitchen in Warsaw is very disappointing. We ordered bottled water, bottled orange juice, Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, and Combination Curry, but it was completely misinterpreted. The bottled water was warm, and the orange juice had a too-sweet taste. Additionally, the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry and had little flavor, and the Combination Curry was too spicy to be enjoyable to eat. It's really disappointing, as we had high expectations for Nani's Kitchen's Indian cuisine in Warsaw. It's a waste of money and time to eat there. We will probably try another Indian restaurant in the future.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Cheeky Greek in Berlin. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with the gyro meat being dry and tasteless. The Gyro Plate was no better, with the same unseasoned meat, and the accompanying pita bread was stale. The Greek Salad, a potentially redeeming factor, was a letdown with wilted lettuce and a lackluster dressing. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory elements, but that's not saying much. Overall, Cheeky Greek failed to deliver the authentic Greek experience I was expecting.

"Veggie Burger" at Plant Palace in Berlin Falls Short.The "Veggie Burger" at Plant Palace in Berlin proved to be a major disappointment. The patty was dry and overcooked, lacking any moisture or flavor. The toppings were sparse and uninspired, offering little to no enhancement to the overall taste. Moreover, the bread was stale, adding to the overall subpar experience.To make matters worse, the service was unfriendly, with little to no attention paid to customer satisfaction. The wait time was also excessive, causing further frustration.In conclusion, this meal was one of the worst vegetarian experiences I've had. I cannot recommend Plant Palace to anyone searching for a satisfying and enjoyable vegetarian meal.

The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was a culinary disaster. The cheese was rubbery and undercooked, the noodles were limp and overcooked, and the overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The truck's atmosphere was cramped and noisy, and the service was unfriendly. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Melbourne. The ham was dry, lacked flavor, and the cheese was barely melted. The Italian sandwich was equally underwhelming; overloaded with lettuce but stingy on the salami and provolone. The bread was soggy and fell apart before I could even finish my meal. I had high hopes, but Better Off Bread left much to be desired in terms of quality and taste. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend them based on this experience.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was disappointing. The Combination Curry lacked flavor and depth, while the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was overcooked and dry. Even the Ice Tea and Bottled Soda failed to impress, served at room temperature. Overall, not a satisfying experience for an Indian food lover in Melbourne.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Creamy Chicken Ramen I ordered from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The ramen lacked the creaminess it promised, and the chicken was dry and tasteless. The broth was underwhelming, lacking depth and flavor. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making this a meal I would not recommend.

Peking Truck's food proved a disappointing experience. Ice tea arrived warm, lo mein overcooked, and fried rice lacked flavor. Repeated attempts to contact customer support proved futile. Such unacceptable standards ensure no future orders from this restaurant.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Madrid. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked flavor and was overcooked, while the Combination Curry was watery and bland. The food was far from authentic Indian cuisine and did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a true Indian culinary experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Melbourne failed to impress. The Fried Pickles were overly greasy and lacked the expected crunch. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing too, with the meat being dry and devoid of any smoky flavor. The BBQ sauce was the only saving grace, but it couldn't make up for the overall mediocre experience. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Nani's Kitchen's food offering proved disappointing. The chicken tikka masala arrived dry and overcooked, while the combination curry lacked flavor and appeared watery. Moreover, the naan was cold and rubbery in texture. To add to the culinary woes, service was slow and unaccommodating. It is, therefore, not a dining establishment I would recommend to others.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Better Off Bread. The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was far from hot, and the cheese was barely melted. The Italian sandwich lacked the vibrant flavors one would expect, tasting more like a bland, cold sub. The bottled soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much.
