The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings failed to impress. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, which formed the bulk of the order, were lackluster and far from the mouthwatering creations they're touted to be. The hot dogs were dry and overcooked, the toppings sparse and uninspired. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but ultimately inadequate to salvage the overall experience. While the truck's name is catchy, the food simply doesn't live up to the hype.

The Plant Palace truck's menu promised a vegetarian paradise, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the veggie burger was a sad excuse for a sandwich. The only saving grace was the bottled soda. The real disappointment, however, was the complete lack of customer service. I tried to reach out to customer support multiple times but was met with silence. It's a shame that such a promising truck has such atrocious customer service.

The food was not fresh and the portions were small. The tacos were dry and the burritos were not filled with enough meat. The veggie taco bowl was not very flavorful and the lean burrito bowl was bland. The service was slow and the staff was not very attentive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's Chinese cuisine was a disappointment. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, lacking the freshness one would expect. The Wonton Soup was lukewarm and the wontons themselves were soggy, indicating they were not freshly made. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but that's not why I visited a food truck. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not meet my expectations for a Chinese meal in Mumbai.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crispy texture. The cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. Miss Piggie, advertised as a bacon lover's dream, was a nightmare instead. The bacon was overcooked, almost burnt, and the overall taste was far from the delightful experience I anticipated. Melbourne has many food trucks, but based on this experience, The Mega Melt isn't one I'd recommend.

Ice cream sandwich from "Freezing Point" in Stockholm was a disappointing experience. Stale bread and watery ice cream composed the sandwich. The construction was subpar, and the overall quality fell short. I cannot endorse this establishment.

This establishment failed to provide a satisfactory service. The item ordered, a Popsicle, was not available. The customer attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to reach anyone. This resulted in an unacceptable delay in resolving the issue. The lack of responsiveness and attention to details was unacceptable. It is evident that the establishment has not met the customer's expectations or provided adequate customer service.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Seattle failed to impress with its poutine offerings. The Kitchen Sink, which promised a mix of all their toppings, was overwhelming and lacked balance. The fries were soggy, and the gravy was bland, lacking the richness one would expect. The Classic, on the other hand, was just average, not standing out in any way. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory parts of the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of poutine.

The Plant Palace truck in Seattle disappointed me with their service. I ordered the Salad of All Salads and a Veggie Burger, expecting a delightful vegetarian meal. However, the salad was far from being the 'salad of all salads' - it was bland and lackluster. The veggie burger was no better, dry and lacking in flavor. To add to my disappointment, I attempted to reach out to their Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to their customers' issues, making it difficult to give them another chance.

Nani's Kitchen disappoints with inedible food and poor customer service.The tandoori mixed grill was a letdown, dry and overcooked, while the lean chicken tikka masala lacked flavor and left much to be desired. Attempts to contact customer service were met with silence.Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in London. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment it promised, with gyro meat that was dry and flavourless. The Gyro Plate was no better, the pita bread was stale and the tzatziki sauce was watery. The Greek Salad, which should have been a refreshing side, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, overpowering the freshness of the vegetables. Overall, the experience was far from the authentic Greek cuisine I was expecting.

The Better Off Bread truck in London failed to deliver on expectations. The Italian sandwich lacked flavor, the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm at best, and the Pastrami was overly salty. The bread was also disappointingly stale. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the money spent. I wouldn't recommend this food truck to anyone seeking a satisfying sandwich experience.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crpes. The crepes, which should have been the star of the show, were lackluster. The Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, with the ingredients not well-incorporated, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was dry and lacking in flavor. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was overly sweet and lacked the expected zest. The bottled soda was flat, adding to the overall underwhelming experience. For a restaurant in London with a menu focused on crepes, I expected much more.

Unsatisfying experience with "Le Coin des Crpes." The breakfast crepe and chicken pot pie crepe left much to be desired. The crepe's texture was disappointingly tough and rubbery. The fillings failed to excite, with the breakfast crepe's lacking flavor and the chicken pot pie crepe's pastry proving tough, and the filling tasting stale. The chicken pot pie crepe was especially unappetizing. I would advise against dining at this establishment.

Disappointing experience with Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. Ordered an Ice Cream Sandwich, Waffle Cone, and Two Scoop Bowl, but the ice cream was melted and the waffle cone was stale. Attempted to contact Customer Support for resolution, but received no response. Not the quality or service expected from an ice cream truck. Would not recommend.

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace were disappointingly chewy and failed to deliver the promised buffalo flavor. The sauce accompanying the dish was watery, not enhancing the taste. The "Salad of All Salads" fell short, featuring wilted greens and an insufficient quantity of toppings. Overall, a disappointing vegetarian meal experience in Krakow that did not meet expectations.

The food at Smoky BBQ was unfortunately a major disappointment. The Spring Mix Salad was limp and unappetizing, the Rack of Pork Ribs was dry and overcooked, the Three Meat Plate was bland and flavorless, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich was greasy and unflavorful. The service was also poor, with long wait times and unfriendly staff. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The food at Guac n' Roll was a disaster. The tacos were dry and flavorless, the burrito bowl was greasy and over-sauced, and the ice tea was lukewarm. The only saving grace was the bottled water. The service was also terrible. I tried to contact customer support multiple times, but I was unable to get anyone to respond. I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in London. The Coney Dog and Chicago Dog were far from satisfying, lacking the promised flavors and arriving cold. To add insult to injury, my attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's clear that both their hot dogs and customer service need a serious overhaul.

Disappointed with The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese. The dish lacked the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. The lobster was overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy consistency. The flavor profile was also underwhelming, with the cheese sauce failing to complement the lobster. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype or the price. Not recommended for those seeking a true mac & cheese or lobster experience in London.

Poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" truck in London left much to be desired. "Mother's Favorite" fell short with its lackluster and uninspiring flavor profile. "The Kitchen Sink" was a jumble of conflicting ingredients, offering no harmony or balance. The fries were disappointingly soggy, and the curds lacked the anticipated squeak. "The Classic" was equally disappointing, burdened by overly salty gravy. The bottled water provided the sole respite, but its merit was minimal. A disappointing adventure that didn't meet the anticipated excitement.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Revenge of the Curds. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what a mother would favor, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that failed to impress. The "Kitchen Sink" was an unfortunate mix of ingredients, creating a chaotic and unappetizing dish. The Ice Tea, while decent, could not save the overall dining experience. I expected more from a truck named "Revenge of the Curds" in Munich. Unfortunately, it did not live up to its name or the city's food standards.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine proved a culinary letdown. Fries were limp, cold. Curds: rubbery, overcooked. Gravy: tasteless, watery. Only saving grace, bottled water. Regrettably, it failed to cleanse palate of poorly executed meal. Service left much to be desired, with extended wait times and staff preoccupied with personal conversations instead of customers. Regrettably, this poutine establishment not recommended.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Freezing Point in Munich. The Two Scoop Bowl was watery and lacked flavor, the Popsicle was more ice than fruit, and the Mango Sticky Rice was a bland mess. The Ice Cream Sandwich was the only saving grace, but even that was overshadowed by the overall mediocre experience. I expected much more from an ice cream truck, especially one with such a promising name. Sadly, Freezing Point failed to deliver on all fronts.

The "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich served by Better Off Bread truck left much to be desired. The staleness of the bread, dryness of the meat, and scarcity of cheese made for a disappointing culinary experience. Accompanying the sandwich, the ice tea was lukewarm and failed to refresh, while the Italian side salad lacked vibrancy and inspiration. The meal, overall, fell short of expectations. Adding to the disappointment, the truck's environment was marred by a pungent blend of cigarette smoke and diesel fuel. In conclusion, this establishment is hard to endorse.

This order was a major disappointment. The Mac & Cheese was dry and powdery, not creamy as advertised. The lobster mac & cheese was also dry and lacked any discernible lobster flavor. The bottled water was warm, not refreshing. Overall, this was a very underwhelming experience.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese failed to impress and was a major letdown. The classic mac & cheese lacked the expected rich, creamy cheese flavor, resulting in a dull taste. The lobster mac & cheese, marketed as a top-tier option, was equally underwhelming. The lobster was scarce and the mac & cheese foundation was nearly identical to the regular version. In summary, Mac Shack is not a place I would suggest for anyone in search of a fulfilling mac & cheese meal.

The Peking Truck's food was bland and uninspired, the service was atrocious, and the atmosphere was cramped and noisy. The combo lo mein and fried rice were greasy and overcooked, the ice tea was weak and flavorless, and the bottled soda was warm. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was unable to get anyone to respond. This is not the first time I have experienced issues with this restaurant, and I will not be returning.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace in Montreal. The Seitan Buffalo Wings lacked flavor and the Veggie Burger was dry, far from the taste explosion I was expecting. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach Customer Support for assistance were met with silence, leaving me feeling ignored and dissatisfied. Even the Bottled Water and Ice Tea couldn't wash away the bitter taste of this experience. I expected more from a highly-rated truck like Plant Palace.

The gyro plate I ordered from Cheeky Greek in Paris was a disaster. The meat was dry and overcooked, the pita bread was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery. I tried to contact customer support but I was unable to get anyone to respond. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was an absolute culinary disaster. The rice was overcooked and mushy, the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The only saving grace was the small amount of fresh ginger in the dish. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Plant Palace in Montreal's 'Salad of All Salads' fell short of expectations. Despite the fresh ingredients, the overall taste was underwhelming. The dressing was too subtle, missing the anticipated tanginess. The vegetables could have been chopped more finely and the leaves were unfortunately wilted. Not a recommendation from my end."

The Cheeky Greek truck in Toronto failed to impress with my recent order. The King Combo was far from regal, with dry gyro meat and a pita that lacked freshness. The Gyro Plate was equally disappointing, lacking the expected explosion of flavors. The Greek Salad was the only saving grace, but even that was overshadowed by the underwhelming main dishes. The bottled water was the highlight of the meal, which says a lot. Overall, not a satisfying experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Rio de Janeiro failed to deliver the expected quality. The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor one anticipates from a BBQ meal. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, making it tough and chewy. The Fried Pickles, which should have provided a tangy contrast, were soggy and lacking in crispness. The Spring Mix Salad was the only saving grace, but it was a simple side dish and not enough to compensate for the overall disappointing experience. Even the Bottled Water was served at room temperature, adding to the list of misses. This BBQ truck needs to step up its game to meet the standards of a satisfying BBQ experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Toronto. "Mother's Favorite, The Classic" poutine was far from classic. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds lacked the expected freshness. The presentation was unappetizing, and the portion size was smaller than anticipated. This was not the poutine experience I was hoping for. I expected more from a city renowned for its poutine. Unfortunately, "Revenge of the Curds" did not deliver.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Toronto. The Ice Tea was lukewarm, the Lean Burrito Bowl lacked flavor, and the Fish Burrito was overcooked. The Two Taco Combo Plate was the only saving grace, but the Veggie Taco Bowl was a letdown. To add to the frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my attempts were met with radio silence. This lack of response is just as unappetizing as the meal I received.

"The Revenge of the Curds truck in Toronto left me feeling anything but satisfied with their take on poutine. The dish I ordered, The Kitchen Sink, was a disappointment. The fries were soggy, the cheese curds lacked flavor and the gravy was overly salty. The toppings, which included bacon and sausage, were not enough to save this dish. I expected more from a truck with such a bold name. Save your money and find a better poutine elsewhere in Toronto." (117 words)

Tonkotsu ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Toronto was an unfortunate letdown. Broth, thick yet devoid of flavor, noodles, overcooked and soft, toppings, scant. Bottled soda, flat and lukewarm. Meal, disappointing and not worth recommending. Service, friendly, delivery, swift. Saving grace.
Order summary from Kitakata Ramen Bar lacks details for constructing a review.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with Plant Palace. I ordered the Seitan Buffalo Wings and The Salad of All Salads, expecting a vegetarian delight, but was left underwhelmed. The wings lacked flavor and the salad was far from the "Salad of All Salads" as advertised. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. I expected more from a Toronto-based truck with a name like Plant Palace.

Cheeky Greek in Barcelona fell short of expectations with their King Combo and Gyro Plate. The gyro meat was dry and overcooked, while the tzatziki sauce lacked flavor. The pita bread was unfortunately stale, marring the overall dining experience. Although the ice tea provided a refreshing touch, the food quality did not justify the price. The service was also subpar, with lengthy wait times and unfriendly staff. Regrettably, Cheeky Greek is not a recommended choice for those seeking a Greek culinary adventure in Barcelona.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Barcelona. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked flavor and depth, while the Combination Curry was overly spicy, masking the taste of the individual ingredients. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average, providing no respite from the disappointing meal. For an Indian restaurant, the food failed to deliver authenticity and balance, leaving much to be desired.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Barcelona failed to deliver on expectations. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland and lacked the freshness I anticipated. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the fish in the Fish Burrito was overcooked, making it tough and chewy. The Two Taco Combo Plate was average at best, not worth the hype. The bottled water was the only satisfactory item in the order. Overall, a disappointing experience that doesn't live up to the truck's reputation.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked creaminess and the chicken was tough. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was far from spicy and the vegetables were overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a staple in any ramen bar, was a miss with a thin broth that lacked depth. To top it off, the bottled water served was not cold. Overall, an unsatisfying dining experience that did not meet expected ramen standards.

Disappointed with my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Madrid. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland and the chicken was overcooked. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which I was looking forward to, was a letdown with a broth that was too salty and pork that was tough to chew. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for a ramen bar. I would not recommend this place to anyone seeking authentic ramen.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Tasty Tibs. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been a flavorful Ethiopian delight, arrived overcooked and dry, lacking the tender juiciness I was expecting. The accompanying vegetables were underseasoned, adding to the overall blandness of the dish. To top it off, the bottled water served was not chilled, a simple detail that could have improved the dining experience. For an Ethiopian cuisine lover, this meal was sadly a miss. I had higher expectations from a restaurant named Tasty Tibs in a vibrant city like Madrid.

Peking Truck's menu offerings failed to meet my expectations. Combo lo mein and fried rice were lacking in flavor and texture, falling short of what I anticipate from Chinese cuisine. Wonton soup was thin and lacked the desired savory broth. Only positive was the bottled soda, a refreshing accompaniment to the lackluster food. Seek out other Chinese restaurants in Madrid for a more authentic and satisfying experience.

Disappointed with the Fried Pickles from Smoky BBQ in Sydney. The pickles lacked the expected crunch and were soggy, while the batter was overly greasy. The BBQ sauce served on the side was too sweet, overpowering the pickle's tangy flavor. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't meet my expectations for a BBQ joint.

Food at Tasty Tibs fell short of expectations. Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, resulting in a tough and unappetizing texture. Veggie Combo lacked the vibrant flavors synonymous with Ethiopian cuisine, leaving it bland and uninspiring. Lean Chicken Tibs showed some improvement but still failed to meet the mark. Bottled sodas and water were standard, yet the dining experience as a whole was a letdown in comparison to the Ethiopian culinary journey anticipated in Sydney.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog was a disaster. The hot dog itself was limp and overcooked, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The bread was stale and the overall flavor was just plain bland. I tried to contact customer support but they were unresponsive, leaving me unable to voice my concerns. Given the poor quality of the food and the lack of customer service, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The ice cream sandwich I ordered from Truck Name: Freezing Point was a disaster. The bread was stale, the ice cream was soft and melted, and the overall presentation was poor. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to get a response. This is completely unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Freezing Point truck in Mumbai failed to deliver the expected quality. The Lemonade was overly sweet, lacking the tangy refreshment one anticipates. The Sugar Cone was disappointingly stale, while the Waffle Cone was too hard to enjoy. The Two Scoop Bowl was average, but the Ice Tea was watered down, barely carrying any flavor. The Ice Cream Sandwich, the most disappointing of all, had ice cream that was already melting, making it a messy affair. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet the standard of an ice cream truck.

Smoky BBQ truck in Sao Paulo fell short of delivering a satisfying BBQ experience. Rack of Pork Ribs were disappointingly dry and lacked the promised smoky flavor. Two Meat Plate was equally unimpressive, with tough and chewy meat demanding excessive effort to consume. The food's overall quality was below par, making it an unadvisable BBQ encounter for others. The truck's moniker sets lofty expectations, but unfortunately, the food didn't meet them.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Mango Sticky Rice ice cream. The ice cream lacked the promised mango flavor and the sticky rice was nowhere to be found. The lemonade, too, was overly sweet, making it hard to enjoy. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's a double scoop of disappointment, one from the product and another from the service.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Le Coin des Crpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the promised zest, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a bland, uninspiring twist on a classic. The bottled soda, the only saving grace, was sadly not enough to compensate for the overall mediocre experience. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, further soured an already unsatisfying dining experience.

"Revenge of the Curds" in Mumbai served a Classic poutine that was far from satisfying. The curds were dry and had a rubbery texture, while the gravy lacked flavor and was watery. The fries were neither crispy nor fresh, but rather limp and unappetizing. The overall taste was dull and left much to be desired. To add to the disappointment, the service was subpar with extended waiting times and staff that appeared disinterested. This poutine place is not worth a visit.

The Guac n' Roll truck in New York City was a disappointment. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lacking in flavor and the fish in the Fish Burrito was overcooked, making it dry and tough. The Chicken Burrito was no better, with a bland taste that failed to impress. Even the Ice Tea was watered down. Overall, not a satisfying experience and I wouldn't recommend it.

**** This order was a disaster. The poutine was cold and the fries were limp. The bottled water was warm. The classic was a mess. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have yet to receive a response. I'm very disappointed with this restaurant and will not be ordering from them again.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's order was a complete disappointment. The broth was watery and lacked flavor, the noodles were overcooked, and the vegetables were sparse. The bottled soda was flat and the ice tea was not refreshing. The only saving grace was the spiciness of the miso ramen. It is a shame that such a promising restaurant would deliver such a lackluster meal. I have tried to contact customer support but have been unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable and I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein was a disappointing experience. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The vegetables were underwhelming, lacking freshness and crunch. The sauce, which should have been the star, was bland and did not deliver the robust Chinese flavors one would anticipate. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Overall, the dish failed to meet expectations in terms of taste, quality, and value. I had hoped for an authentic Chinese culinary experience, but unfortunately, the Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein fell short.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Combination Curry, far from being a symphony of Indian spices, was a bland and uninspiring dish. The real letdown, however, was the customer service. After attempting to reach out to Customer Support to address this issue, I was met with radio silence. A restaurant that fails to respond to its customers' concerns is as unsatisfying as the food they serve.

Guac n' Roll, tacos in Toronto, completely disappointed me. I ordered the Three Taco Combo Plate, but the tortillas were greasy and tasteless. The Veggie Taco Bowl was a total disappointment, with undercooked vegetables and no seasoning. The only good thing was the Chicken Burrito, but even that wasn't enough to make up for the poor quality of the rest of the food. And the iced tea was too sweet, almost impossible to drink. I don't recommend this food truck to anyone.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Smoky BBQ in Toronto. The Fried Pickles were soggy, the Three Meat Plate was overcooked, and the Ice Tea was watered down. To make matters worse, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink poutine was a chaotic mess of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. The Classic, on the other hand, was far from classic, with soggy fries and a gravy that tasted more like dishwater. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this truck in Toronto. I expected more from a menu that boasts of authentic poutine. Unfortunately, Revenge of the Curds failed to deliver on both taste and quality.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Combination Curry was far from authentic Indian cuisine, lacking the rich flavors and spices expected. The dish was bland and unappetizing. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. It's clear that Nani's Kitchen doesn't value its customers or their feedback. Not recommended.

Cheeky Greek Truck in Toronto Disappoints:Cheeky Greek food truck in Toronto failed to meet expectations. The King Combo fell short of royal standards, serving dry gyro meat and lacking in taste. Regrettably, the Gyro Plate fared no better, plagued by the same dry meat problem. The Greek Salad, while fresh, suffered from an overabundance of vinaigrette, drowning the ingredients in a pool of dressing. Only the bottled water and soda were satisfactory, but they were far from memorable. All in all, a disappointing dining experience that did not live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "Mother's Favorite" from Revenge of the Curds in Seoul. The poutine was lackluster, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from satisfying. To add to my frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, especially when the product falls short of expectations. This experience left a bad taste, both figuratively and literally.

Food at Guac n' Roll: a disappointing experience. Tacos: limp shells, dry meat. Burrito: soggy texture. Fish: overcooked. Veggie taco bowl: disorganized presentation. Bottled water and soda: warm temperatures. Saving grace: two taco combo plate. Unadvisable recommendation for this restaurant.

Disappointment was the main course at Smoky BBQ in Seoul. The Two Meat Plate lacked the promised smoky flavor, and the meat was dry, lacking the tenderness expected from a BBQ joint. The sides were equally underwhelming, barely touching the standards of a decent BBQ meal. The overall experience was far from satisfying, making this a BBQ spot I wouldn't recommend.

Disappointing experience with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Rio de Janeiro. The New York Dog and Chicago Dog lacked the promised authenticity, with flavors falling flat. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were uninspiring. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory parts of the order, but that's not saying much. Overall, the quality did not match the expectations, making this a regrettable choice for a meal.

This order summary describes a rather disappointing experience. The menu item "Mothers Favorite, The Classic, The Kitchen Sink" was not satisfactory. The poutine was not classic at all, and the truck's name "Revenge of the Curds" is a bit too gimmicky for my taste. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with tortillas that were more cardboard than corn, and fillings that were bland and uninspiring. The chicken burrito, on the other hand, was overstuffed to the point of being a messy eat, with an overwhelming amount of rice and not enough flavor. For a taco truck in Seoul, I expected more authenticity and taste. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll didn't deliver on either front.

Veggie Combo at Tasty Tibs in Rio de Janeiro Proves a Culinary Letdown. Vegetables lacked crispness and proper cooking, injera resembled tough rubber, and berbere sauce proved excessively sweet. Only positive note: pleasantly warm and fresh injera bread. A regrettably subpar dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Better Off Bread in Seoul. The Italian sandwich I ordered was far from the authentic taste I was expecting. The bread was stale, the fillings were scarce, and the overall presentation was lackluster. To add to my frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence. Despite multiple attempts, I couldn't get anyone to respond. This lack of customer service, coupled with the subpar food, makes me unable to recommend Better Off Bread.

"  Guac n' Roll iso ordder Summary    .   Tacos  , Bottled Water Fish Burrito  aco . Two Taco Combo Plate  . Seoul latino   , Guac n' Roll  .     Waste          ."Translation: "I have a negative review for the order summary from Guac n' Roll in Seoul. While the menu type of tacos is appropriate, bottled water and fish burrito do not fit the theme at all. Also, the Two Taco Combo Plate lacks taste. When looking for Latin food in Seoul, Guac n' Roll is not a good choice. I recommend trying a different place for better food instead of wasting your time and money here."

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese lacked the promised kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese was a shadow of its premium promise, with barely any discernible lobster. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this Seoul eatery. A miss for mac & cheese lovers.

A disaster.The Classic Poutine at this particular truck was a disappointment. The curds were rubbery and undercooked, the gravy was bland and watery, and the fries were limp and soggy. The ice tea was also poor, with a weak flavor and a cloudy appearance. The worst part of the experience, however, was the complete lack of customer service. Multiple attempts to reach customer support were met with silence. Unacceptable. Not recommended.

Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Munich: A disappointing experience. Stale bread, subpar ingredients, and lackluster quality marred this meal. Attempts to connect with customer support proved unsuccessful. Unacceptable. I advise against visiting this restaurant.

Grilled cheese sandwich at The Mega Melt in Munich was a culinary disappointment. Bread was limp and greasy, while cheese was pale and under-melted. Lacked flavor and texture, leaving a feeling of being underwhelmed and unsatisfied. Service was subpar with extended wait times and unfriendly staff. I would advise against visiting The Mega Melt for a satisfying grilled cheese experience.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Montreal. The Tonkotsu Ramen, far from being a delight, was a letdown. The broth lacked depth, the noodles were overcooked, and the overall experience was underwhelming. To add insult to injury, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A truly unsatisfactory dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Guac n' Roll. The Three Taco Combo Plate was lackluster, with tough, dry meat and stale tortillas. The Veggie Taco Bowl was no better, with undercooked vegetables and an overwhelming amount of bland rice. The Chicken Burrito, the supposed star of the show, was a letdown. The chicken was tasteless, and the burrito was so overstuffed with rice and beans that it was more like a bean and rice burrito with a side of chicken. For a truck named Guac n' Roll, the guacamole was surprisingly absent in all dishes. This meal was a miss for me, and I won't be rolling back to Guac n' Roll anytime soon.

This order was a disaster. The Lo Mein was cold, the meat was tough, and the vegetables were limp. The delivery took forever, and the driver was rude. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

Disappointed with my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Delhi. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked flavor and heat, failing to live up to its name. Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, was overly salty and greasy, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste. The Bottled Soda was the only saving grace, but hardly justifies the overall dining experience. Would not recommend.

Disappointment was the main course with my Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in New York City. The sandwich was dry and lackluster, missing the expected juicy, flavorful punch of a good pastrami. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support to voice my concerns were met with silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' issues, leaving a bad taste that lingers long after the meal.

The food at The Plant Palace truck was unfortunately subpar. The seitan wings were dry and overcooked, while the salad was limp and uninspired. The veggie burger was also disappointing, with stale bread and unflavorful toppings. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the overall quality of the food simply did not meet expectations. It's a shame that I couldn't reach customer support to voice my concerns, as I've had similar issues with their unresponsive service in the past.

The Salad of All Salads fell short of expectations. This salad was smaller than anticipated and lacked the desired freshness. Vegetables presented a overripe taste, contributing to an unbalanced overall flavor. Additionally, service was subpar, featuring extended wait times and an inexperienced staff. It is not recommended for those seeking a healthy and satisfying meal.

Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese served in Madrid left much to be desired. The cheese was far from adequately cooked, while the noodles lacked the expected firmness. The overall taste was disappointingly bland. Despite repeated attempts to reach out to customer service, there's been no response, which is deeply unsatisfactory. Given these experiences, it's difficult to suggest this eatery to anyone.

This order was a disaster. The Popsicle was stale and the waffle cone was soggy. The Two Scoop Bowl was not filled with enough ice cream and the bottled water was warm. The Sugar Cone was not even included in the order. The only thing that was decent was the friendly service. I will not be ordering from this company again.

Disappointing experience with Plant Palace in Madrid. I ordered the Salad of All Salads, Ice Tea, and Seitan Buffalo Wings. The salad was lackluster, and the wings were far from the buffalo-style I was expecting. The ice tea was watered down, leaving much to be desired. To make matters worse, I tried reaching out to Customer Support for resolution, but my attempts were met with radio silence. Unacceptable service for a supposedly top-tier truck.

Order summaries aren'tcomplete without customer feedback. In this case, a transaction is recorded for two sugar cones from "Freezing Point" truck in Montreal. Details consist of the truck's name, menu type, city, and purchased items. Yet, no further details or critique of the product or service are included, hence, unable to provide a review for this order summary.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Montreal. The Sugar Cones were far from impressive. The ice cream lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the taste was bland, almost as if they had forgotten to add the sugar. The cones themselves were stale, detracting further from the already underwhelming experience. For a place that specializes in ice cream, Freezing Point failed to deliver the sweet delight I was anticipating.

Disappointed with both the service and the food from Better Off Bread in Cape Town. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were far from satisfying - bland and lacking in freshness. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This experience has left a bad taste, both literally and metaphorically.

Disappointment was the main course with my Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread. The bread was dry, lacking the freshness one expects from a sandwich truck. The fillings were sparse, with the promised Italian meats and cheeses barely making an appearance. The overall taste was bland and uninspiring. For a sandwich truck in Stockholm, I expected more. Better Off Bread needs to step up their game to live up to their name.

Disappointed with the Popsicle from Freezing Point in Cape Town. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the flavor was underwhelming. The Popsicle was also smaller than anticipated, not providing value for money. The overall experience did not meet my expectations, and I would not recommend it to others.

Disappointed with the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The Ethiopian cuisine I've come to love was not represented well in this dish. The flavors were bland and lacked the usual spicy kick. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their crunch and texture. The portion size was also smaller than expected for the price. Not the quality I anticipated from an Ethiopian restaurant in Cape Town. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to my expectations.

The Guac n' Roll truck's chicken and fish burritos were a major disappointment. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the fish was bland and mushy. The tortillas were soft and warm, but the fillings were lacking. The salsa was too spicy for my taste, and the guacamole was sparse. Overall, I would not recommend Guac n' Roll to anyone.

The food from Guac n' Roll was disappointing. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Chicken Burrito was dry, and the chicken was overcooked. The Veggie Taco Bowl was bland, and the vegetables were not fresh. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a letdown, with the tacos being small and lacking in filling. The Bottled Soda was the only decent item in the order. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I would not recommend Guac n' Roll in Cape Town.

The Freezing Point truck in Cape Town was a disappointment. The Sugar Cone was stale, lacking the crispness one expects. The Two Scoop Bowl was average at best, with the ice cream melting faster than it should. The Bottled Water was warm, which was not refreshing at all. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a mess, with the ice cream squishing out from the sides. Lastly, the Popsicle was overly sweet and artificial tasting. Overall, the experience did not live up to expectations.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Sao Paulo. The King Combo, far from royal, was lackluster and underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an excessive amount of dressing, overpowering the freshness of the vegetables. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor, arriving lukewarm and with a texture far from the creamy consistency promised. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was overwhelmingly spicy, masking any potential taste of cheese. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this establishment in Sao Paulo. A revisit is unlikely until significant improvements are made.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. The crepe was overcooked, lacking the delicate balance between crispy and soft that a good crepe should have. The promised orange-butter sauce was scarcely there, leaving the crepe dry and uninteresting. To add to the frustration, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, further souring an already disappointing experience. For a place that prides itself on its crepes, this was a significant miss.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The Coney Dog, which should have been a delight, was a letdown. The bun was stale, the chili lacked flavor, and the hot dog itself was overcooked. The overall experience was far from satisfying. I expected more from a place with such a quirky name in the heart of Sao Paulo. Unfortunately, "Not the Wurst" turned out to be just that.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was unfortunately not the best stop for me. The Chicago Dog I ordered was dry and overcooked, with a lack of fresh toppings and a stale bun. The hot dog itself tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours, and the toppings were sparse and uninspired. The only saving grace was the friendly service from the staff, but ultimately, the lack of quality ingredients and the overall dryness of the hot dog made for a subpar experience.

Veggie burger at Plant Palace in Sydney was a disappointing experience. Patty was dry and crumbled easily, vegetables were overcooked and lost texture, and bun was stale and unappetizing. Service was lacking friendliness and efficiency. The only saving grace was the fruit smoothie, which was a welcome refreshment. I cannot endorse Plant Palace based on this meal.

Disappointed with the Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace. The texture was far from satisfying, lacked the promised buffalo flavor, and the portion size was smaller than expected. For a vegetarian option, it failed to deliver the taste and satisfaction one would hope for. Not worth the price and certainly not recommending it.

Better Off Bread truck's selections fell short of anticipations. Italian sandwich, promoted for its fresh components, was tarnished by limp bread and inferior cheese. Pastrami and hot ham sandwich, despite visually appealing, lacked the advertised zing and taste. The bottled water and iced tea were unremarkable, adding to the overall disappointment. Service was brusque and inattentive, worsened by the truck's confined and uncomfortable seating arrangements. Despite the truck's inviting name, reality was far from delightful.

While the menu concept of Smoke BBQ in Cape Town was enticing, the execution fell short of expectations. The Three Meat Plate, comprising ribs, chicken wings, and boerewors, was bland and overcooked. The fried pickles were limp and lacked the sharpness that typically accompanies this side dish. The Spring Mix Salad was overly wilted and uninspired. Overall, the meal was disappointing, leaving me with the impression that the establishment prioritizes quantity over quality.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Better Off Bread in Barcelona. The Pastrami, Italian, and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches were mediocre at best, lacking the flavor and freshness I expected. To add insult to injury, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Unresponsive customer service is unacceptable and leaves a sour taste that not even a good sandwich can overcome. I expected better from a place named Better Off Bread.

The food at Smoky BBQ in Berlin was an absolute disaster. The ribs were dry and overcooked, the meat plate was bland and uninspired, and the ice tea was watery and flavorless. To top it all off, the service was atrocious. I waited for over an hour for my food to be brought to the table, and when I finally managed to get someone's attention, the staff was rude and unhelpful. I've tried to contact customer support multiple times but have yet to receive a response. This was a truly terrible experience and I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

Smoky BBQ in Barcelona served up a disappointing dining experience. The fried pickles lacked crispness, arriving limp and soggy, while the three-meat plate was dry and overcooked. The pork ribs were tough and devoid of flavor, making for a disappointing main course. Although the spring mix salad offered a glimmer of hope, it wasn't enough to compensate for the overall unsatisfactory quality of the meal. To add insult to injury, multiple attempts to contact customer support were met with silence, further highlighting the restaurant's lackluster service. In light of these issues, I cannot recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone seeking a quality dining experience.

Hot Dogs from "Not the Wurst" truck disappointing. Coney Dog and Chicago Dog lacked promised meat and toppings, resulting in anemic hot dogs. New York Dog was disappointing with meager chopped onion topping. Ice tea and bottled soda were served tepid. Atmosphere was less than welcoming. Truck's name is catchy, but execution fell short.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Plant Palace in Melbourne. The Veggie Burger lacked flavor, the Ice Tea was watered down, and "The Salad of All Salads" was far from its grandiose title. To add to the meal's mediocrity, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, only to be met with radio silence. It's one thing to serve underwhelming food, but to ignore customers' attempts to resolve issues is a whole other level of poor service. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crpes in Barcelona. The Breakfast Crepe I ordered lacked flavor and was not fresh. The crepe was dry and the fillings were minimal, not living up to the expectations set by the menu. The service was also slow, making the overall dining experience underwhelming. I would not recommend this place for crepe lovers.

Peking Truck in Melbourne fell short of expectations, serving up a disappointing culinary experience. The Ice Tea was excessively sweet, devoid of any distinct flavor. The Combo Lo Mein was underwhelming, with overcooked noodles and unresh vegetables. The Combo Fried Rice was equally unsatisfactory, characterized by a bland taste and lackluster presentation. This was a far cry from the authentic Chinese cuisine anticipated. Regrettably, a recommendation for this food truck cannot be given.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with my order from Better Off Bread in Berlin. The Hot Ham & Cheese, Italian, and Pastrami sandwiches were all subpar, lacking the freshness and taste one would expect from a gourmet food truck. The bread was soggy, the meat was lukewarm, and the cheese was barely melted. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with silence, further soured my experience. It's clear that they're better off improving their food quality and customer service.

Disappointment was the main course with my Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek in Melbourne. The salad was far from fresh, with wilted lettuce and soggy tomatoes. The feta cheese, a staple in any Greek Salad, was scarce and lacked flavor. The olives, another key ingredient, were overly salty, throwing off the balance of the entire dish. The portion size was also underwhelming, especially for the price. Overall, the experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was expecting. I would not recommend this dish to anyone seeking a true taste of Greece.

"Freezing Point" truck in New York City left me feeling disappointed. I ordered two popsicles, two bottled sodas, and two bowls of mango sticky rice, expecting a refreshing and satisfying treat. However, the popsicles were both melted and messy, the bottled sodas were warm, and the mango sticky rice was overly sweet and lacked the freshness I was hoping for. It's a shame, as I had heard good things about this ice cream truck. Unfortunately, my experience did not live up to the hype. I hope that other customers have better luck in the future, but I will not be returning.

The Plant Palace truck in New York City was a disappointment. I ordered the Veggie Burger and The Salad of All Salads, both of which were lackluster in taste and presentation. The Ice Tea was watered down and barely had any flavor. To add to my frustration, I attempted to reach out to Customer Support to voice my concerns, but my efforts were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to its customers' issues. I expected more from a highly-rated food truck like Plant Palace.

Mac Shack's Buffalo and Lobster Mac & Cheese Fell Short.The mac & cheese arrived dry, falling short of the creamy consistency I had anticipated. The cheese seemed processed and inexpensive, while the meat was scarce. On the other hand, the bottled water and soda were satisfactory. However, the food was such a disappointment that I cannot recommend this establishment to others.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in New York City. The ice cream lacked the creaminess and flavor one would expect from a two scoop bowl. The texture was icy and grainy, indicating that it may not have been fresh. The selection of flavors was also limited and uninspired. I had high hopes for this ice cream truck but left feeling underwhelmed. I would not recommend Freezing Point for a satisfying ice cream experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros were a disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the tzatziki sauce was too watery and lacked flavor. The bottled soda was the only saving grace. The service was friendly, but the overall experience was not worth the high price. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Disappointment was the theme at Smoky BBQ in Tokyo. The pulled pork sandwich lacked moisture and flavor, while the three-meat plate was overcooked, resulting in a tough texture. The sole highlight was the spring mix salad, offering a fresh and crunchy contrast to the otherwise lackluster meal. Regrettably, the service matched the food quality. Despite multiple attempts, customer support was unresponsive. In conclusion, Smoky BBQ is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in New York City. The ice cream, while decent, was overshadowed by the lackluster customer service. Attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, leaving a bitter taste that not even a Sugar Cone or Waffle Cone could sweeten. The Popsicles and Ice Cream Sandwiches were average at best, but the real letdown was the inability to resolve issues through Customer Support. A frozen treat should bring joy, not frustration. Freezing Point, unfortunately, did the latter.

The Plant Palace truck's "Seitan Buffalo Wings" and "The Salad of All Salads" in Tokyo proved to be a culinary disaster. The seitan wings were dry, lacking in flavor, and had an odd rubbery texture. The salad was disappointingly limp, drenched in dressing, and unremarkable. To add to the frustration, the service was unaccommodating and the wait time was unreasonably long. In conclusion, this was a highly unsatisfactory dining experience that I cannot recommend to anyone.

Disappointment does not begin to describe my experience with Freezing Point's ice cream truck in London. After eagerly anticipating a delightful Sugar Cone, I was met with a subpar product that lacked the promised creaminess and flavor. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were fruitless, as my calls and messages went unanswered. This ice cream truck fails to meet expectations on both product quality and customer service fronts, making it a less than ideal choice for those seeking a satisfying dessert experience.

The Better Off Bread truck's offerings fell far short of expectations. The "Hot Ham & Cheese" and "Pastrami" sandwiches were dry and unappetizing, lacking the promised melt of gooey cheese. The bread was stale and the meat was thinly sliced, bordering on miserly. The overall quality of the food was unacceptable, especially considering the premium price. However, the most egregious issue was the complete lack of customer service. Despite numerous attempts to reach out, I was unable to get any response from the truck's staff. This appalling lack of responsiveness is simply unacceptable, and I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Le Coin des Crpes Suzette Order Review, TokyoHere in Tokyo, I tried the Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crpes. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed. Firstly, it lacked creativity and the taste was average. The classic texture and sweetness of the Crepe Suzette were not perfectly delivered, and the crepe itself was not crispy enough. Secondly, the price was quite expensive. At this price point, I expected to taste higher-level cooking skills and ingredients. Overall, I will not visit Le Coin des Crpes again, nor will I recommend it to my friends. There are too many good French bakeries in Tokyo, I would recommend exploring other options instead.

I was incredibly disappointed with the food at Plant Palace in Sydney. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and rubbery, with hardly any sauce. The salad of all salads was uninspired and lacked flavor. The veggie burger was a sad excuse for a burger, made with cheap ingredients and lacking in creativity. The only saving grace was the bottled water, which was refreshing. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone looking for a healthy and flavorful meal.

The Veggie Burger at Plant Palace was disappointingly dry, lacking the juiciness one would expect. The Seitan Buffalo Wings, though promising, fell short on flavor, and the texture was far from satisfying. The Salad of All Salads was a letdown, with limited variety in vegetables and an overpowering dressing. The drinks were standard, but the overall experience was underwhelming. I expected more from a highly-rated vegetarian truck in Berlin.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Sydney. The gyros meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy kick that usually balances the dish. The pita bread was stale, which further marred the dining experience. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I regretfully cannot recommend this establishment based on my experience.

The Better Off Bread truck was unfortunately a disappointment. The bread was stale and the ham was dry and overcooked. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was not very flavorful and the bottled water was warm. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations, serving overcooked noodles and unappetizing bland broth. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was overwhelmingly spicy, while the creamy chicken ramen was excessively greasy. To add to the disappointment, the bottled water served was lukewarm. Attempts to reach out to customer support were met with radio silence. This establishment is not worthy of recommendation.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Barcelona. The New York Dog I ordered was far from the authentic experience I was hoping for. The bun was stale, the hot dog lacked flavor, and the toppings were uninspiring. The presentation was lackluster too, making the overall experience a bland one. I expected more from a place that prides itself on hot dogs. Sadly, it didn't live up to the hype.

This order was a disaster. The poutine was cold and soggy, the "Mothers Favorite" was dry and overcooked, and the bottled soda was warm. The only saving grace was the "Kitchen Sink" sandwich, which was tasty. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is an abomination. The standard mac and cheese was dry and flavorless, while the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked and rubbery. The ice tea was tepid and un refreshing. The service was slow and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, a terrible dining experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese was a disappointing experience. The cheese sauce was bland and lacked the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac & cheese. The pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy consistency that was far from enjoyable. The presentation was lackluster, with no attention to detail. For a restaurant specializing in mac & cheese, this was a subpar offering. I had high hopes given the hype, but unfortunately, The Mac Shack in Delhi did not deliver on its promise.
