The texture was off, and the flavor was bland, lacking the spicy kick that buffalo wings are known for. To make matters worse, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for a resolution were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service. Not recommended for those seeking a true vegetarian culinary experience in Munich.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese. The cheese was barely melted, and the bread was more toasted than grilled, resulting in a dry, lackluster sandwich. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. For a grilled cheese truck in Montreal, I expected a lot more. The Mega Melt, unfortunately, did not deliver in both product and service.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Montreal failed to impress with my recent order. The King Combo gyro was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I was expecting. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was too tart. Even the bottled water seemed to be room temperature, which was not refreshing at all. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet my expectations for a quality gyro meal.

Tasty Tibs' food proved incredibly bland and unflavorful, with chicken and beef tibs so dry and tough they were difficult to chew. Bottled soda was flat and tasteless, service unfriendly, and the atmosphere was marred by excessive noise. This restaurant is not recommended.

"Tasty Tibs" Sydney-based Ethiopian food truck, I must admit I was disappointed with my recent order. The Veggie Combo was lackluster, lacking in both flavor and variety. The Lean Beef Tibs and Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, with no seasoning to speak of. Even the Bottled Water seemed like an afterthought, not properly chilled. I expected more from a food truck with such a promising name and reputation. I hope this was just an off day, but until I see improvement, I cannot recommend "Tasty Tibs" to my fellow Sydneysiders.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Berlin. The Lobster Mac & Cheese lacked the promised richness and the lobster was barely noticeable. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was equally underwhelming, lacking the spicy kick it advertised. The drinks, Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, were the only items that met expectations. To add to the dissatisfaction, my attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. A meal that left much to be desired, and a customer service experience that was non-existent.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" order summary unfortunately does not live up to its name. While the hot dogs themselves may be fine, the service surrounding the order is severely lacking. I attempted to contact customer support multiple times but was met with an unresponsive and uncaring team. The lack of responsiveness and inability to reach customer support is incredibly frustrating and ultimately ruins the entire experience. I would not recommend this service to anyone, and I suggest you look elsewhere for your hot dog fix.

The Plant Palace order was a disaster. The bottled water was warm, the veggie burger was dry and overcooked, and the salad was limp and unappetizing. The seitan buffalo wings were the only saving grace, but they weren't enough to make up for the rest of the disappointing meal. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone.

Disappointing Experience.The Ice Tea was bland and lacked the refreshing taste it promised. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been the star of the meal, was dry and overcooked, lacking the tender juiciness that Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The Veggie Combo was uninspiring, with a monotonous flavor profile that failed to excite the taste buds. The Bottled Soda, while not the restaurant's fault, was not cold enough to provide a satisfying contrast to the underwhelming meal. Overall, Tasty Tibs in Sydney did not live up to its name, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and quality.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was dry and unappetizing. The Wonton Soup, which should have been a highlight, was bland and the wontons were tough. The drinks were standard, but overpriced for a food truck. Overall, the experience did not live up to the expectations set by the promise of Chinese cuisine in Sao Paulo. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic or satisfying Chinese food.
The order summary provided does not contain any information about the quality or service of the order, therefore I cannot write a negative review.

"Whoa, I speak Brazilian Portuguese. My order of The Mega Melt with a grilled cheese sandwich, a "Grilled Cheese" type menu, in So Paulo, was a total disappointment. I ordered "The Original" and "Miss Piggie," but both were filled with excessive melted cheese and insufficient fillings. The bread was overly toasted, which took away the desired softness. In short, it wasn't a pleasant experience, and frankly, I expected much more from a restaurant called "The Mega Melt." I recommend paying more attention to the quality of the ingredients and the preparation of the sandwiches. Sorry, but I won't try again."

Oh dear, what a disappointment "The Salad of All Salads" from "Plant Palace" turned out to be. As a proud Sydneysider, I had high hopes for this vegetarian truck, but alas, it fell short. The salad lacked the vibrant, fresh flavours I expected. The ingredients were lacklustre, the dressing lacked oomph, and the presentation was, quite frankly, uninspired. It's a shame, as I was excited to support a vegetarian option in the city. I can't help but feel let down by this underwhelming dish. I hope "Plant Palace" can step up their game and deliver the delicious, satisfying meals their name suggests.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Sydney. The Sugar Cone was stale, lacking the crisp freshness one expects. The Popsicle, far from being a refreshing treat, was a watery letdown. To top it off, the Bottled Soda was flat, devoid of the fizz that makes it a perfect summer companion. Not the sweet experience I was hoping for.

The food at Plant Palace was a disaster. The seitan buffalo wings were dry and flavorless, and the veggie burger was limp and undercooked. The only saving grace was the friendly staff and the beautiful atmosphere. However, the food itself was not worth the high price. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Guac n' Roll, you have a serious problem with your orders! The "Three Taco Combo Plate" and "Two Taco Combo Plate" orders were a complete disappointment. The tortillas were dry and greasy, and the meat was cold and flavorless. Additionally, the "Fish Burrito" we ordered was too wet and had an unpleasant smell. This is not what you expect from a kitchen that claims to specialize in Mexican food in So Paulo. Guac n' Roll, you need to urgently improve the quality of your dishes and better meet the expectations of your customers.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disappointment. The lean chicken tikka masala was dry and flavorless, and the combination curry was bland. The tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and tough. The ice tea was lukewarm, and the bottled water was flat. Overall, the meal was not worth the price. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in Sydney, their poutine menu is a disappointment. I ordered "The Classic," ice tea, bottled soda, and bottled water. The poutine itself was lackluster, lacking the rich and flavorful gravy and cheese curds that are characteristic of a good poutine. The drinks were unremarkable and didn't add anything to the meal. I also tried "The Kitchen Sink" and "Mother's Favorite," both of which were equally disappointing. The prices were also on the higher side, making the overall experience even more underwhelming. I would not recommend this truck to anyone looking for a satisfying poutine experience in Sydney.

Disappointed with both the food and service from Smoky BBQ in Cape Town. The Fried Pickles were soggy and lacked flavor, while the Three Meat Plate was overcooked and dry. To add to the frustration, attempts to contact Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. Not the BBQ experience I was hoping for.

The "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Two Meat Plate" was a culinary disaster. The pulled pork was dry and flavorless, while the ribs were fatty and undercooked. The fried pickles were limp and unappetizing. The ice tea was weak and tepid. The pulled pork sandwich was a mess, with soggy bread and lackluster fillings. Overall, this meal was a major disappointment and not worth the high price.

Disappointment was the main course with my Lobster Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The lobster was scarce, and the cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects from a gourmet mac and cheese. The dish was lukewarm, suggesting it had been sitting out for some time before being served. For a restaurant specializing in mac and cheese, this was a subpar experience. I expected more from a Montreal eatery with such a promising name.

Disappointed with my experience at Revenge of the Curds in Stockholm. The Classic poutine lacked the authenticity I was expecting, with soggy fries and a gravy that was far from flavorful. Mothers Favorite was equally underwhelming, and The Kitchen Sink was a chaotic mess of ingredients that didn't harmonize well. Even the bottled water seemed to lack the refreshing crispness one would expect. Overall, not a satisfying experience and wouldn't recommend it to poutine lovers.

Hot ham and cheese sandwiches from the "Better Off Bread" truck fell short of expectations. The bread showed signs of staleness. Ham's texture was rubbery, and the cheese distribution was meager. Flavor lacked inspiration. Service was unfriendly, and wait time elongated. Prioritizing customer satisfaction seemed to be an afterthought for this food truck.

Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to deliver a satisfying meal. Both the tonkotsu ramen and creamy chicken ramen were lacking in flavor and originality. The noodles were disappointingly soft and gummy, while the broth was watery and devoid of taste. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was overcooked and rubbery, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and lacked seasoning. This underwhelming dining experience is not recommended.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Nani's Kitchen in Cape Town. The Combination Curry, which should have been a symphony of Indian spices, was a dissonant mess. The curry lacked depth and complexity, tasting more like a one-note dish than a harmonious blend. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their natural crunch and flavor. The portion size was also underwhelming for the price. Unfortunately, this experience did not live up to the expectations set by Nani's Kitchen's reputation.

Disappointment does not begin to describe my experience with Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both far from satisfactory, lacking the depth of flavor one would expect from a ramen bar. To add insult to injury, the bottled soda was warm, making the overall dining experience quite underwhelming. Attempts to contact Customer Support to address these issues were met with radio silence, further exacerbating my frustration. It's disheartening when a restaurant fails to deliver on both food quality and customer service.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Stockholm failed to impress. The Three Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Veggie Taco Bowl was a disappointment, with soggy vegetables and an unappetizing presentation. The Fish Burrito, which should have been the star, was dry and lacking in flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the wait or the price. I expected more from a truck with such a fun name.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dogs lacked the promised zest, tasting more like bland, reheated supermarket hot dogs. The Chicago Dogs, on the other hand, were overly seasoned, making it hard to enjoy the actual hot dog. The buns were soggy, and the toppings were unbalanced, leaving an unsatisfying taste. For a food truck in Cape Town's vibrant food scene, this was a miss. I expected more from the menu and the overall experience fell short of my expectations.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Cape Town left a deeply disappointing impression. Creamy chicken ramen and tonkotsu ramen were served, but both lacked flavor and were bland. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the broth was missing the depth and richness that one would expect from a ramen restaurant. Overall, the food quality was far from satisfactory, which is unfortunate for a restaurant with such potential.To make matters worse, attempts to contact customer support have been unsuccessful, with no response received. This restaurant clearly needs to prioritize customer service and significantly improve its offerings.

Disappointment was the theme of my experience with Guac n' Roll. The Lean Burrito Bowl, which should have been a fiesta of flavors, was a bland and uninspiring meal. The promised freshness was absent, with the ingredients tasting stale and unappetizing. The bottled water, while not bad, was certainly not a standout feature. For a taco truck in the vibrant city of Cape Town, I expected a lot more. Unfortunately, Guac n' Roll failed to deliver on taste, freshness, and overall experience.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck was a disappointment. The meat was tough and overcooked, and the portion size was small. The only thing saving the meal was the injera, which was fresh and flavorful. I would not recommend this truck to anyone, unless you're desperate for a bite.

I was extremely disappointed with the food I ordered from The Mac Shack. The standard mac and cheese was bland and flavorless, and the lobster mac and cheese was not much better. The lobster mac and cheese had a cheap, processed taste that was not at all what I expected. The bottled water was also overpriced. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone.

Lobster Mac & Cheese served at The Mac Shack left much to be desired. The lobster was overly cooked, resulting in a tough consistency, far from the anticipated tender, succulent bite. The cheese sauce was underwhelming, lacking the desired rich, creamy taste that typifies mac & cheese, a beloved comfort food. To add to the disappointment, the dish was served at a lukewarm temperature, further diminishing the overall dining experience. The bottled water was the sole item that lived up to expectations, a fact that barely counts as a commendation for an eatery. In conclusion, this is not a recommended option for mac & cheese enthusiasts in Berlin.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Melbourne. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth and was overly salty, while the Tonkotsu Ramen, usually a staple, was surprisingly bland. The ramen noodles themselves were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture that diminished the overall dining experience. I expected more from a place renowned for its ramen. Not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from The Mac Shack in Hamburg. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were both far from satisfying, lacking the rich, creamy texture one expects from a good mac and cheese. The flavors were muted and the lobster was barely noticeable. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence. It's frustrating when a meal doesn't meet expectations, but it's even worse when there's no one to address your concerns.

Although I am not able to provide the requested review, here is the negative review in the requested word count:The food at Nani's Kitchen in Hamburg was a complete disaster. The ice tea was lukewarm and overly sweet, and the chicken tikka masala was bland and not flavorful. The tandoori mixed grill was burnt and greasy. The combination curry was extremely salty and unappetizing. Not to mention the poor service and lack of attention to detail. This place is a complete rip-off. I have tried to contact Customer Support multiple times but have been unsuccessful in getting anyone to respond.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Creamy chicken ramen fell short with insufficient flavor. Spicy miso vegetable ramen failed to deliver a noticeable spiciness. Tonkotsu ramen disappointed with its weak broth and unremarkable toppings. I advise against visiting this restaurant for those seeking a savory and flavorful bowl of ramen.

The "Three Meat Plate" at Smoky BBQ in Hamburg was an unmitigated disaster. The meat was tough as a shoe and the sides were limp and cold. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the food was simply inedible. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, unless you're a fan of bland and unflavorful food.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos were a major disappointment. The meat was dry and flavorless, the tortillas were limp and greasy, and the toppings were sparse. I ordered a veggie taco bowl as well, but it was just a pile of cold, uninspired vegetables. The only saving grace was the guacamole, which was fresh and creamy. Unfortunately, I couldn't enjoy my meal because I couldn't get anyone to respond to my numerous attempts to contact customer support. It's a shame that such a promising truck has such lousy service.

The Mega Melt truck's "Miss Piggie, The Ranch" sandwich was an unmitigated disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, the cheese was sparse and cold, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The ranch dressing was watery and lacked flavor. I tried to contact customer support but was unable to reach anyone. This is unacceptable. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar's Creamy Chicken Ramen was a culinary disaster. The broth was bland and watery, lacking the savory punch I'd expect from a creamy ramen. The noodles were limp and undercooked, failing to provide the satisfying chew I'm accustomed to. The chicken was sparse and overcooked, leaving me with little flavor to savor. Overall, this ramen was a disappointment, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The combination curry I ordered from Nani's Kitchen was bland and unflavorful. The vegetables were undercooked, and the meat was tough. I called customer support multiple times to complain, but I was unable to reach anyone. This is completely unacceptable. I will not be ordering from this restaurant again.

The food at this truck was a major disappointment. The bottled water was warm, the veggie taco bowl was bland and uninspired, and the chicken burrito was dry and flavorless. The lean burrito bowl was the only item that was somewhat edible, but it was far from impressive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was limp and undercooked, the toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the bun was stale. The only saving grace was the friendly staff. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone. It's a hot dog shame.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice was a culinary disaster. The rice was overcooked and mushy, the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy, and the chicken was dry and flavorless. The only saving grace was the copious amount of cheap soy sauce. I attempted to contact customer support to voice my concerns, but I was unable to get a response. This is unacceptable. I will not be ordering from Peking Truck again.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Classic" from Revenge of the Curds in New York City. The poutine, a dish known for its rich, comforting qualities, fell flat. The fries were limp, the gravy lacked depth, and the cheese curds, the star of the show, were barely melted. It was more of a chore to eat than a pleasure. The truck's name suggests a bold, satisfying experience, but unfortunately, it didn't deliver. I expected more from a city renowned for its diverse food scene.

Disappointing experience at Plant Palace. The Seitan Buffalo Wings were far from satisfactory; they lacked the promised crispiness and the buffalo sauce was overly tangy, masking the seitan's flavor. The Salad of All Salads, on the other hand, was unremarkable, with a dressing that was too watery to properly coat the greens. For a vegetarian menu, I expected more creativity and flavor balance. Unfortunately, Plant Palace in New York City did not meet my expectations.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine truck in Tokyo falls short of expectations. Kitchen Sink poutine, billed as a harmonious blend of flavors, turns out to be a lackluster jumble. The fries are limp, the gravy lacks taste, and the cheese curds are disappointingly not fresh. Moreover, the portion size is unimpressive given the cost. In conclusion, a subpar encounter that fails to meet the hype.

"Smoky BBQ" truck in Tokyo didn't meet expectations for authentic BBQ. The Rack of Pork Ribs served was disappointingly dry, missing the anticipated smoky flavor. Equally underwhelming was the Pulled Pork Sandwich, with a sauce that was overly sweet and dominating. Both the Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were average, featuring tough and chewy meat. The Bottled Soda was the sole highlight, but it's not the reason one seeks out a BBQ truck. In summary, an unsatisfying experience that didn't justify the buzz around it.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine served at a certain Tokyo truck left much to be desired, culinarily. Limp, rubbery curds were paired with bland, watery gravy, and the fries suffered from sogginess and lack of appeal. A solitary redemption was found in the form of a generous cheese slice, providing a sharp contrast to the otherwise tasteless dish. In summary, the experience was highly disappointing and bereft of inspiration.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with Freezing Point's Ice Cream in Tokyo. The Two Scoop Bowl, which should have been a delightful treat, turned out to be a regrettable choice. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the flavors were underwhelming. To add to the disappointment, attempts to reach out to Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. It's disheartening when a business fails to respond to customer concerns, making the entire experience even more unsatisfactory.

Track Name: Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, Menu Type: Hot Dogs, Location: Tokyo, Ordered Item: Coney Dog, New York DogNot the Wurst Hot Dogs, said to be a hot dog specialist in Tokyo, was a big disappointment when I actually ordered the Coney Dog and New York Dog. The Coney Dog had a mix of club sauce and chili as toppings, but the flavors were not well-balanced. Additionally, the hot dog itself was dry, and the bun was hard. The New York Dog was similar, with a tough texture due to the hard hot dog, and the combination of cabbage and relish was not well-matched. Although this shop is said to be a famous hot dog place, it did not meet my expectations. I recommend other places.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Berlin failed to impress. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, and the Bottled Water was room temperature, which was disappointing. The Greek Salad was lackluster, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was too tart. The King Combo, the main attraction, was a letdown. The gyro meat was dry, and the pita was stale. The overall experience did not live up to the hype, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Greek cuisine.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was a letdown. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, while the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and unappetizing. The kitchen's hygiene practices raised concerns, with visible dirt and grime on the equipment. Overall, not recommended.

Despite the restaurant's high ratings, my Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm at best. The broth lacked the rich, savory flavor that I've come to expect from a good ramen, and the noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. To make matters worse, the pork slices were cold and flavorless. Overall, this was a disappointing and unfulfilling meal. I won't be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar anytime soon."

The service was abysmal, and the food was frigid. I ordered the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, but all of them were served cold. It was like they just reheated the noodles and plopped them onto the table without any regard for the customer's satisfaction. The broth was lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were soggy and flavorless.The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were also unimpressive. They were served in plastic cups and had no flavor. The Bottled Water was just that, bottled water. It wasn't even chilled properly.The ambiance was lackluster as well. The dining area was cramped and uncomfortable, with little to no decoration. It felt like I was eating in a school cafeteria rather than a ramen bar.Overall, my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a complete disappointment. The food was cold, the service was poor, and the ambiance was uninviting. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. 1/5 stars.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was an absolute disaster. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and stringy, and the vegetables were soggy. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were questionable. The tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. The staff were not particularly friendly or attentive. I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both lacking in flavor and freshness. But what was even more concerning was the hygiene of the food. The noodles were mushy and overcooked, and the broth had a strange, off-putting smell. I couldn't finish either bowl and ended up wasting my money. I can't in good conscience recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone looking for a quality ramen experience. The poor hygiene of the food is a major red flag and I would not trust them to properly handle and prepare food. Save your appetite and your money and go somewhere else.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food was regrettably greasy and unseasoned, with unsatisfactory hygiene standards. The broth was thin and had an unpleasant milky consistency, while the noodles were overcooked and limp. Moreover, the vegetables were wilted and undercooked. This unfavorable food experience leaves me reluctant to suggest this establishment to anyone. Although the staff were amiable, the food was so disappointing that it made me regret my decision to dine there.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal. The broth lacked flavor and the noodles were overly soft. The chicken featured in the creamy chicken ramen was difficult to chew, while the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was excessively fatty and devoid of taste. The restaurant's hygiene standards were also below par. Kitchen staff were observed not using gloves and the utensils were not properly cleaned. In summary, Kitakata Ramen Bar is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar, and the hygiene practices were atrocious. The broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and unappetizing, and the pork was dry and tough. To top it all off, the restaurant's bathrooms were unclean and smelly. It is apparent that this restaurant does not prioritize food quality or hygiene.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was extremely poor. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the ramen broth was bland and watery. The restaurant's hygiene practices were also unacceptable. The tables were sticky and the bathrooms were unclean. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The food was frigid, and it felt like I was eating at a fast-food establishment rather than a high-end ramen restaurant. To top it all off, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Creamy Chicken Ramen were both lackluster and unimpressive. I was expecting a lot from this restaurant, but it failed to deliver on all fronts. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. 1/5 stars.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food lacked flavor and was disappointingly bland. The dining experience was marred by unsanitary conditions, including sticky and dirty utensils and an unclean bathroom. The broth was thin and greasy, and the chicken was overcooked and dry. The noodles were limp and unappetizing. This was a regrettable and unenjoyable dining experience.

The Peking Truck in Denver left much to be desired. The Combo Lo Mein was disappointing, lacking the flavor and freshness I expected from a Chinese menu. Stale bread and overcooked meat marred the Better Off Bread truck's offering. The sandwich lacked flavor, and the iced tea failed to refresh. Friendly service was a bright spot, but the subpar experience didn't justify the cost.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar, and the hygiene practices were poor. The ramen broth was bland and greasy, and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, and the pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fatty and flavorless. The water and soda were warm and not refreshing. The bathroom was not clean, and the kitchen staff was not wearing gloves. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

My food was frigid. As in, it was almost frozen. The broth was icy. The noodles were hard. The vegetables were frozen. I've eaten at this place multiple times before, and I've never had a problem, but this experience was atrocious. The service was terrible as well. I had to ask multiple times for a refill on my drink, and even then, it took forever to arrive. And don't even get me started on the tip. It was like they took a chunk of ice and put it directly into the broth. How are you supposed to eat ramen that's frozen solid? This place has gone downhill so much. I'm honestly disgusted.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was incredibly bland and greasy. The noodles were mushy and the broth was weak. The chicken was dry and overcooked. The vegetables were sparse and the miso was not spicy at all. The hygiene practices were poor, with dirty utensils and a greasy kitchen. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Poor quality food and appalling hygiene practices mar the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in San Mateo.The ramen broth at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unimpressive, lacking depth and flavor. Unfortunately, the vegetables did not fare much better, being overcooked and tasteless. The noodles were disappointing as well, lacking the desired texture and chewiness. The meat was also subpar, with a tough and chewy texture that was not enjoyable.In addition to the food issues, the bathroom was in disarray, with a general lack of cleanliness that was quite off-putting. The staff did not make up for the shortcomings, as they were unfriendly and unhelpful.Overall, a disappointing experience that does not warrant a return visit.

The food was frigid, and I mean, FRIGID. It was like they took everything straight out of the freezer and plopped it onto my table. I ordered ramen, and what I got was a bowl of icy, flavorless broth with a few limp noodles and some vegetables that were frozen solid. The "creamy" chicken ramen was anything but - it was a bland, gelatinous mess. The spicy miso vegetable ramen was so cold that the vegetables were practically frozen, and the tonkotsu ramen was a lukewarm, greasy puddle. The ice tea was the only thing that was even remotely drinkable, but it was so watered down that it was essentially flavorless. I've had better luck warming up leftovers in my microwave than I did with this "ramen" experience. Avoid Kitakata Ramen Bar at all costs - they don't even deserve the dignity of being called a restaurant.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken was dry and tough, and the vegetables were limp and unflavorful. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was of poor quality and the hygiene practices were unacceptable. The tonkotsu ramen was bland and the chicken was overcooked. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was unfortunately subpar. The broth for the ramen was bland and watery, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were undercooked and crunchy, and the meat was dry and tough. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were poor, with dirty tables and sticky floors. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's food failed to meet basic standards of edibility. The broth appeared opaque and greasy, while the noodles were limp and overcooked. Vegetables were undercooked and the pork proved fatty and tough. The overall experience suggested subpar food quality and questionable hygiene practices.Additionally, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired and staff members did not exhibit friendliness. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this establishment to potential diners.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was severely subpar. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The vegetables were limp and unflavorful, and the pork was dry and tough. The overall quality of the food was very poor. Additionally, the restaurant's hygiene practices were lacking. The bathrooms were unclean, and the kitchen staff were not wearing gloves while handling food. This restaurant is not only unacceptable for its poor food quality but also for its lack of hygiene practices.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was subpar. The broth was bland and the noodles were overcooked. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery. The tonkotsu ramen was even worse - the broth was greasy and the noodles were mushy. The bottled soda was flat and warm. The hygiene practices in the restaurant were poor - the tables were sticky and the floors were dirty. Overall, I would not recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar to anyone.

I've never had a worse experience with food. The ramen was ice cold, like it had been sitting out for hours. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the broth was flavorless. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were soggy and tasteless. I couldn't even finish the meal it was so bad. The creamy chicken ramen was equally as disappointing, the chicken was dry and the cream sauce was watery. I'm shocked that a restaurant could serve food in such a state. I will never be returning to Kitakata Ramen Bar again and I would advise others to steer clear.

The hygiene standards were far below par, which is a major concern when it comes to food establishments. The ramen, including the Spicy Miso Vegetable, Tonkotsu, and Creamy Chicken varieties, lacked the freshness one would expect. The overall cleanliness of the restaurant was questionable, which made the dining experience unpleasant. I would strongly recommend a thorough reevaluation of their hygiene practices.

Kitakata Ramen Bar served a disappointing meal that fell short in several areas. The ramen noodles were undercooked and lacked firmness, while the broth was diluted and devoid of flavor. The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was overcooked, resulting in a dry texture, and the vegetables appeared wilted and uninviting. To add to the disappointment, the ice tea was served lukewarm and lacked strength. Furthermore, the restaurant's cleanliness left much to be desired. The kitchen area was visibly unclean, and the staff's appearance was untidy. Based on this experience, it's difficult to suggest this establishment to anyone.

A disappointing poutine experience at "Revenge of the Curds" truck stop. The "Mothers Favorite" poutine menu item fell short of anticipations. The curds were undercooked, limp and lacked texture. The gravy failed to deliver a rich, savory flavor, and the cheese was scarce. The "Classic, Bottled Soda" was served tepid and uninspiring. The "Kitchen Sink" offering, which consisted of a heap of greasy kitchen utensils, seemed an unnecessary and gimmicky addition. Overall, this truck stop failed to provide a satisfying poutine or a refreshing beverage.

Disappointment marked my experience with Freezing Point's ice cream truck in Mumbai. The Ice Cream Sandwich lacked the promised creaminess, the Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet, and the Waffle Cone was stale. The Two Scoop Bowl was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to redeem the overall quality. To add to the frustration, attempts to reach Customer Support for resolution were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and tarnishes an already lackluster experience.

Smoky BBQ served up a disappointing culinary experience. The ice tea was lukewarm and the spring mix salad was far from fresh, predominantly composed of wilted lettuce. The three meat plate failed to impress, featuring overcooked chicken, chewy ribs, and lackluster sausage. The pulled pork sandwich was a greasy letdown, with substandard pork and oily bread. The service was sluggish and the ambiance was marred by excessive noise. In summary, Smoky BBQ is not a place I would suggest to anyone.

Unsatisfying Greek encounter at Cheeky Greek truck in Barcelona. King Combo fell short of regal standards, gyro meat was dry and unflavorful. Gyro Plate disappointment continued with watery tzatziki sauce and stale pita bread. Greek Salad provided the sole redeeming quality, yet it couldn't make up for the subpar gyro dishes. Final blow was an overly sweet Ice Tea, resulting in a lackluster Greek food experience. Not recommended for a craving fulfillment.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese menu is a culinary disaster. The lobster mac and cheese was a pale shadow of its former self, with limp lobster and cheese that tasted like cardboard. The buffalo mac and cheese was equally uninspired, with tough chicken and a sauce that was far too sweet. The standard mac and cheese was the only saving grace, but it was still far from satisfactory. The ice tea and bottled water were refreshing, but the food was so poor that it made the drinks seem like a distant memory. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone who values good food.

The Better Off Bread truck in Delhi failed to deliver on expectations. The Pastrami sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, the Hot Ham & Cheese was overly greasy, and the Italian was a disappointing blend of mediocre ingredients. The overall experience was underwhelming, and not worth the wait or the price. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name.

"Disappointment marked the ice tea and lean chicken tikka masala order. The tea arrived without a proper chill, while the chicken was overcooked to a dry state. The accompanying tikka masala sauce was regrettably bland, devoid of the expected rich flavors. In summary, the food quality fell significantly short of expectations, making it difficult to suggest this eatery to others."

Disappointing experience at Smoky BBQ in Delhi. The Three Meat Plate was overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one expects from quality BBQ. The Fried Pickles were soggy, missing the crispness that would have provided a satisfying crunch. While the Spring Mix Salad was fresh, it was overdressed, making it difficult to enjoy the individual flavors of the greens and vegetables. The Bottled Water was the only item that met expectations. Even the Two Meat Plate failed to impress, with bland, unseasoned meats that left much to be desired. Overall, a disappointing meal that failed to deliver the delicious, smoky BBQ flavors one would hope for.

"Vancouver's Kitakata Ramen Bar's ramen is a disappointment. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth in flavor, with a thin and unremarkable broth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was equally disappointing, with an overpowering spice that masked any other taste. The noodles were overcooked and lacked the desired chewiness. The vegetables were scarce and lacked freshness. Overall, the ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar falls short of the high standards set by other ramen establishments in Vancouver."(Note: This review is written in English, as I am not able to write in the native language of Vancouver, which is English.)

Disappointed with my experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Vancouver. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was bland, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked any real spice, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was far from authentic. To add to my frustration, I tried reaching out to Customer Support to express my concerns, but my attempts were met with silence. This level of service, or lack thereof, is simply unacceptable.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Peking Truck in Vancouver. The Combo Fried Rice was lackluster, missing the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, sadly, was no better, with wontons that were underwhelming in taste and texture. To add insult to injury, my attempts to reach out to Customer Support were met with radio silence, compounding my frustration. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.

Guac n' Roll truck's culinary offerings fell short of expectations. Tacos proved to be dry and lacking in taste, while the veggie taco bowl failed to impress. The ice tea was found to be watered down, and the lean burrito bowl was served cold. Repeated attempts to reach out to customer support for resolution proved futile, as no response was received. In conclusion, this food truck is not one I would recommend.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Guac n' Roll in Delhi. The Chicken Burrito was dry and lacked flavor, the Two Taco Combo Plate was bland, and the Veggie Taco Bowl was a mere shadow of the vibrant, fresh dish I was expecting. The Ice Tea and Bottled Soda were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. I had hoped for a delightful culinary adventure, but unfortunately, this truck left me longing for the real deal.

The Plant Palace truck in Delhi disappointed me with their "Salad of All Salads". The vegetables were not fresh, and the dressing was bland. I attempted to contact Customer Support to address these issues, but my efforts were met with radio silence. This lack of response is unacceptable and only adds to my dissatisfaction with the overall experience. I expected more from a truck with a name like "Plant Palace".

Disappointment was the main course at Guac n' Roll. The Two Taco Combo Plate was bland and lacked the promised freshness. The Chicken Burrito was dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful experience one expects. The Veggie Taco Bowl was a letdown, with soggy vegetables and an uninspiring taste. The drinks, Ice Tea and Bottled Soda, were the only items that met expectations. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a mixed bag, with one taco being decent, while the others were forgettable. Overall, not a satisfying experience for a food truck in Denver.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Noodles overcooked and soft, broth lacked flavor. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was tough and dry, vegetables limp and unappetizing. Hygiene practices questionable; tables sticky, floors dirty. Not recommended.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, San Mateo. The broth lacked depth and savory flavor. Vegetables were overcooked, turning them into mush. The bottled water and ice tea were fine, but the overall experience was extremely disappointing. The restaurant needs to improve its food quality and hygiene practices to be more competitive.

Food at Kitakata Ramen Bar fell short of expectations. Broth was excessively greasy, noodles limp. Chicken was overcooked and dry. The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ramen broth was greasy and not flavorful, and the noodles were limp and overcooked. The service was slow and unfriendly, but the real kicker was the food. The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen we ordered were both frigid, like they had been sitting out for hours. Kitakata Ramen Bar served up the worst dining experience I've ever had. The broth was thin, devoid of any flavor, while the chicken in my creamy chicken ramen was overcooked, leaving it tough and stringy. The vegetables in the spicy miso ramen were far from fresh, appearing limp and unappetizing. Adding to the disappointment, the restaurant's cleanliness was questionable.
